reviews.review: At night. Nice light show every evening at 8. You will enjoy the HongKong skyline and see all the buildings even better than in the day, because it might be very misty due to the humidity and the warmth. The show lasts for about 15 mn. Don't miss it.

Great view both day and night. The Hong Kong skyline is truly spectacular both during daytime and night. Just make sure you visit on a clear day, if its foggy or cloudy it might be hard to get a good view.

Amazing. There are different ways to enjoy HK's skyline:
- Star ferry
- Ozone bar
- Helicopter ride
- Junk
- Promenade in TST or Central
I personally like the star ferry experience the most

Iconic skyline. One of the most iconic skylines in the world with so many skyscrapers. Be sure to take a walk along the promenade and view the skyline in the day and at night. Especially the light show, there are also many buildings to get go up and get another view from restaurants and the viewing deck in the ICC or take the star ferry across.

Totally unbelievable.. Most impressive in the world...and I'm from NY. Especially from Victoria Peak or the tram, it gets more impressive every year. I would love to live here if it wasn't so darn expensive. A must see on everyones bucket list.

Lots of buildings, but not particularly beautiful. In Hong Kong "more" seems to mean "better". This city has paid no attention to design or architecture and the skyline is a sad excuse for a tourist activity.

Too smoggy to see :(. For a spectacular skyline you have to be lucky to get the full effect. It was so smoggy in Hong Kong that half of it disappeared into thin air. I have been here when it isn't so smoggy and its quite impressive.
It was so amaizing. The view is so amazing. It's quite popular so it was busy but since the area is huge so it was't bad at all.

What else can you say?. It's the Hong Kong skyline. Amazing and you can't find it anywhere else.It's beautiful from all angles. We enjoyed it from the Ferris Wheel. Also from both shores. Pretty amazing!
Disappointing. This should be removed from guide books, I have seen this before and it was excellent, this time we couldn't tell if it had started or finished!!
Clear day to visit. Select a clear day to visit, you can see more far and clear, better is near evening, sun set and changing blue, night view also.

The Light Show Lives Up to Its Reputation. The light show starts about 8 pm and is really a collection of individual illuminations of various high-rise buildings on Hong Kong Island. Best viewed from Kowloon on the opposite side of the harbor.
A must!. Make it a point to go in the evening. One of the most beautiful in the world. We went there on 2 consecutive nites. Absolutely stunning.

Spectacular. Amazing skyline no matter where you view it from. Our hotel had 39 floors so we could take a lot in. But the best viewing areas are either the Victory Peak or take the ferry over and back on the harbor. So much to see all around.

Beautiful.... It is really a great view. But I felt that the Symphony of Lights show is difficult to watch because of the huge crowd in front of the waterfront. the skyline itself is amazing and so typical of HK
Nice view. Very nice view, especially during the night, when the sky is clear and the moon shines over the dark and tall buildings.
Great Lasershow. Every night at 8pm there is a great Lasershow across Victoria Harbour, Hong Kong Island with key commercial buildings up in laser lights. Worth spending time to enjoy this show.
Mind blowing view. Whether you look at the HK skyline from across the harbour in Kowloon, or from within HK itself, its an amazing view. Tightly placed, tall buildings with lots of lights.

Always Feels Brand New. I have lived in HK for 12 years and every time I see the harbour and its skyline my breath always catches. It's beautiful. One of the best and simplest ways to enjoy the view is from the Star Ferry Pier in Tsim Sha Tsui. You can just grab an ice cream from the Mobile Softee van and find yourself a place to sit and you're all set. Every night at 8pm there is a laser light show and this can be viewed from either the Kowloon or Central side of the harbour.
Perfect night stroll. Good place for a couple to stroll and take in the dynamic hustle and bustleof the star ferry and promenades. Light show every night at 8. Take the junk tour along the river.

Treat to the eyes. This sky line is not the best in the world but its a great treat to the eyes. It looks amazing at night , during the day it a maze to watch. Don't miss the early morning walk by the harbor to see the skyline.

One of the best in the world.. Nothing beats the HK Skyline during a nice sunset or clear day. I'm not a huge fan of HK, having lived here for 8 years but it's still one of the best cityscapes you'll see anywhere in the world.
Nice evening. It s must see in Hong Kong , made sure enjoy with boat in the evening shift it s great souvenir , th e skyline was very nice
Spectacular!. I never tire of looking at this skyline. I am staying in North Point, so I am mostly looking at Kowloon. Spectacular at any time of day or night!

Bright Lights . Amazing architecture and high tech lighting on tall tall skyscrapers packed into a small city. Each side of the bay offers great views of the immense concentration of man made wonders.

Brilliant, especially the laser light show. Hong Kong skyline is interesting with combination the old and new - including, for example use of bamboo scaffolding on building sites.
The laser show display, which happens each evening about 8pm is well worth seeing - the most amazing city nightscape experience we've ever had.
Beautiful. a change from the garish neon of Kowloon - an interesting selection of colours and directional lighting

Superb at night. We went to the Kowloon side of the harbour to view this iconic skyline a few times on our trip but at night it takes on a different shape with all the lights on and the smog seems to disappear.

Beautiful Skyline. The Hong Kong city skyline is beautiful, especially at night. I would definitely recommend checking it out, especially for photographers. I didn't get the opportunity to take a long exposure picture, but I'm sure that it would look great.
I love Hong Kong!. This was my first visit and I must say = I love Hong Kong! The skyline is the magnificent. My son and I took a cruise on the Aqua Luna and the experience was exceptional.

I love this city!. The Hong Kong skyline is probably up there as number one in the world - maybe on par with NYC. To see it during the day is one thing but to experience it lit up at night is incredible! The light show is decent and if you're there at the right time, it's worth sticking around for. I wouldn't go out of my way to view it but if you find yourself down there, have a look see...

Spectacular. From various points (harbour level or Victoria's Peak) by day or night the view is amazing. But it is spectacular at night when the illuminations come on, certainly something you shouldn't miss if you are in Hong Kong.

Beautiful Play of Light. It is a well known attraction of Hong Kong, but until you see it yourself, you wouldn't understand the beauty of it. Best viewed from the pier or from Hong Kong Observation Wheel.

A beautiful skyline - particularly at night. The Hong Kong Island and Kowloon skylines are very spectacular, and feature a couple of the tallest buildings in China outside Shanghai. Brightly lit at night (often with animated lighting on the walls), but also striking during the day.

Breathtaking Skyline View!!. You want to experience beautiful views, head to Victoria Peak (dont take peak tram package) on your own and view Hongkong in night lights. Its calming and serene experience.
So beautiful!. The skyline at night is impressive especially from Peak Mountain when the light shows are on. Even during the day, overlooking the harbour it is spectacular.

Twice enamored... What a view!. At 8 pm each night the symphony of lights is a spectacle that shouldn't be missed especially since this is a FREE event. At any other time you can enjoy the view from either the Kowloon side or the Hong Kong side or enjoy it from the Star Ferry and be in the middle of it!

Famous and Must Do!. Its a bit difficult at the moment due to refurbishment works, but a night time stroll along the promenade admiring the HK sky line is a must. It's evocative, romantic and beautiful. It's a must do when in HK.

Pick a open view bar and enjoy the skyline. Had drinks at Harlan's Bar in The One building which offers an awesome view of HK island. Lychee Lychee cocktail is nice, so are the Truffles fries. Stellar was served in a huge glass, good for arm exercise whilst one lifts to drink. Good experience. Worth to check it out.

Great at night. The view from the harbour across to Hong Kong island at night is really very good, we went to see the light show, but was hard pressed to notice when it had started. I recommend a trip to the harbour for the view, but don't worry if your timings don't match the 8pm light show any time after dark is fine.
Best light show. Starts at 8 every nite. Looks great from the Kowloon side of the harbour. Go to the elevated walkway next to the clock for a great view
A bit tacky, but free. Free light show, can't be beat. Tons of construction by the Avenue of Stars, but go further west on the Kowloon side toward the Star Ferry for great views.

Always impressive, but spectacular at night. The Hong kong skyline is one of the world's most impressive, but is even more spectacular at night. The vaunted 8:00 pm light show is pretty lame, though. The best views are from the Kowloon side of the harbor.

Best skyline I've ever seen in person. To see the darkness roll over HKI is just amazing. The buildings become even more distinct because of the lighting. When the light show starts the city becomes vibrant, almost alive. Loved this, only watched it for one of the nights we were there.
Really great view. The Hong Kong skyline is an amazing feature of Hong Kong. The light show at 20:00 Hrs is special feature to watch.

Fantastic light show. Come early to check out the Avenue of the Stars and get a good spot while waiting for the light show to start. The light show was fantastic, too bad we couldn't understand the voice over story because it was in Chinese. I highly recommend checking the schedule to know which language the light show will be on and plan your trip accordingly to maximize the entertainment experience.
Beautiful. The harbor view in Hong Kong is beautiful, at night it is spectacular a must see, went there every night
Better than in the pictures. Just couldn't get enough of this magnificent view! The best thing to do and enjoy the great feel the city and its palpable beat it generates!

Was busy shopping / going to the mall and was not able to see the 8pm light show. Stayed in Hong Kong for a vacation with the wife.Viewed the Hong Kong Skyline every night but was not able to catch the 8pm light show (to busy shopping or going to the mall)Visited several websites and concluded that no need to make additional effort to view the light show.The Hong Kong Skyline was extremely nice even without the light show. Comparable to Singapore Skyline but Hong Kong seems much more bigger in scale.There are several good viewing points but I enjoyed it best when we viewed it on the boat.
Has to be seen.. We stood just near Golden Bauhinia Square where there is good vision of both sides of the harbour and the music can also be heard. Weather was good which helps of course!

The light show was... ok.... Meh, the light show was in my opinion not worth the wait. It was mediocre at best. The skyline itself was beautiful, really nice to see. There are plenty of places to set up a trip pod and get a good shot.
Visit in the day, and at night for the two different views.
Wow!. Just wow!! Make sure to visit at night, as the skyline is far less impressive by daylight. Must see when you are in hong kong!

Best viewed from Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon. Wonderful views of Hong Kong's skyline are best viewed from the Kowloon side of Victoria Harbour. Nightly laser show at 8 pm is set to music. Speakers are set on poles along the walk next to the harbour. With big crowds nightly, the walkway is very crowded and sometimes the music cannot be heard. No seating on the walk, unless you are there early enough to to get a "front row" location, perhaps by 7:30 pm.Stay close to the Star Ferry pier for the music.

A Secret Spot with a Fabulous View - TST Woolamaloo Prime. Sometimes successful word of mouth can destroy the little treasures you have discovered. I can tell you I am reluctant to share knowledge about this spot for that reason. Woolamaloo Prime in The One is one of those little treasures in Tsim Sha Tsui on Nathan Road. It is a high rise restaurant with a small balcony and an absolutely fabulous view over Victoria Harbour from the Kowloon side.High rise restaurants and bars are pricey of course but this one is a special spot. I just hope no one reads my review because my experience was on a Saturday afternoon and it was quiet, peaceful and very relaxing with good service and a view to die for.Getting there involves going to the lift lobby in The One on Nathan Road - The One is visible from afar! Then taking the lift to the 27th floor.So, if you looking for a new view of the Hong Kong skyline, this one might just meet your expectations of a great place to have a drink and a meal.

Breathtaking. My partner and i have been in hong kong on our first trip for our anniversary from nz on our way to italy.We had always desired to see the hong kong city skyline and we were not disappointed!!Viewing this during the day or at night is a beautiful sight to see, my partner says in his mind its one of the best in the world!The buildings stretch as far as the eye can see and is amazing to look at. When night time falls its even more wonderful.Lit up buildings, changing colours and even pictures playing on some of them. Very beautiful. Would love to come back.

Great to see at Night. On a clear night, this is one of the most amazing views of the city Skyline in the entire world!!! The buildings are lit up with different colors and you can see all the boats on the water! Spectacular
Bright lights of Hong Kong. We viewed the bright lights from Victoria Peak, SPECTACULAR. We managed to see this on good day and it's well worth the effort.
Nice view of the city. The view of the Hongkong is very nice, especially when dragon ships are going by. If you want to go there only for the laser show, do not bother. It is very average.

Not to be missed - 8:00 pm is the light show. Our hotel in Kowloon (the Intercontinental) had a perfect view of the Hong Kong skyline. The light show is one of a kind. We watched it from both our hotel and from a harbor cruise.
great view in both the daytime and evening. Easy to get to by bus and nice area to walk around. I was there during the day and stayed until it got dark to see the lights. Worth the wait
Good view from Kowloon. The best views are from the tip of the Kowloon peninsula. There is a music and laser show every night at 2000 lasting 20 minutes

Light up. The Hong Kong Island lends itself to a beautiful array of lights from the buildings,each with there own stamp of individuality it is pleasant strolling along Kowloon foreshore absorbing the colours and atmosphere.The laser light show...don't be too disappointed the quality has downgraded from 6 yrs ago.
Hong Kong skyline from Kowloon. Very colourful, worth a trip to the waterfront to see the colours of Hong Kong reflected on the water

Beautiful Day or Night. The Hong Kong and the Kowloon skylines are beautiful. Riding the inexpensive Star Ferry back and forth will give you great views. There are evening boat tours and dinner cruises that personally I think are overpriced and not worth it. You'll see the same sights standing on either side of Victoria Harbour or riding the Star Ferry. The areas are very safe in the evening so, venture out and enjoy.
Beautiful. The view is beautiful during the day and even more fantastic at night. The Symphony of Light and Music is not to be missed really an extravaganza , especially the stunning red duk ling

Great view from Kowloon. Best viewed fro Kowloon side then take the Star ferry across to the island. The nightly light show is very disappointing though. The night skyline stands on it's own with out someone trying to improve on it

Must visit. When visiting Hong Kong visiting this area is a must! It's a nice place to take pictures and lots of food and restaurants nearby. On the weekends the area is filled with entertainment and events, at least the last 2 times I've been here. And most people importantly, lots of Pokestops and endless Pokemon's to catch
Slightly exaggerated but still a must see. Everyone talks about the light show like it is going to blow your mind. I certainly enjoyed it but think it is probably a bit overrated
Skyline stunning....Lightshow average. Hong Kong's skyline is definitely one of the best if not the best in the world. The light show however is totally overrated and not much of a show to be honest.
Hong Kong Skyline/Laser Light Show. This is one of the best experience I ever had being in Hong Kong. The laser light show is pretty cool and you don't want to miss it.

Night time cruise. Too this night time cruise last night and it was excellent.It takes about an hour and takes you round the main sights that the harbor has to offer. There was a lovely breeze making it a great to be away from the warmer air around Kowloon.The boat was reasonably full but had plenty of area to roam around and take photos.Loved the sights seeing small boats with fisherman and the layers on layers of lights adorning the hills.Worth the effort. There are expensive boats and cheaper boats. Its all the same view but the expensive ones have more drinks I suppose.

See it free during the day - Central Plaza 46th floor. The Hong Kong skyline is so breathtaking, especially when you see it from the middle of everything. 46th floor in Central Plaza is little over halfway up the skyscraper, its the sky lobby where people change lifts to go up, you can enjoy both the views over the harbour and the green views of the peak.Take MTR to Wanchai and follow the signs. You walk to the STAR FERRY terminal to take a ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui.

Not bad but thought it would be better . Took a boat out into the harbour to watch the light display. Very touristy. The city scape is definitely worth seeing but the lights show was a hit disapointing. The boat crew were all a bit bored and hust going through the motions. Not a bad way to spend 2 hours, but needs improving.
Take in the night time view from Kowloon. Great light show when viewed from the Kowloon ferry terminal area. We favour staying in Kowloon and travel to the island by the Star ferry.

Hong Kong in 2016. Compare to other Asian cities, Hong Kong is one of the most vertical one. It is very reasonable since they have limited land so they build up to the sky. Good thing is they kept open space every where as much as possible, whether it is big or small park and green. We felt comfortable enough to walk as many as we did during our last visit about 12 years ago.

Amazing show. Great experience, the effect of the show was good plus a nice sunset if you are early there.The show will start at 8pm sharp, a small tips u can plan to reach there abit earlier than 8, like 7.30 or so so that can stand a good chance of having the front full view of the show. The show will run for about 20 mins.A little flaws is that there will be a foul smell when are there.

It's what you expect!. The skyline is enormous and varied, best seen from the Star Ferry tour of the harbour. The large commemorative building is interesting but the rest is just a jumbled skyline with the impressive backdrop of the Peak.

Sight to See. With over one thousand skyscrapers in Hong Kong you wont be disappointed with the views. Check out Victoria's Peak, Cafe Grey at The Upper House, or take a helicopter ride to take in the view.
Lights at Night. Worth seeing but the light show is not as great as described. Worth the view but not worth waiting around for the lights show.
Amazing views for pictures. Hong Kong is known for its skyline so must walk along the Victoria Harbour, take in the views, maybe take pictures.
Great Views. Amazing to see the skyline of Hong Kong, especially at night. Find a spot at a bar or restaurant and soak in the ambience
Happy together in HK. Fantastic views! Impressive surroundings! Beautiful city! Nice people! Happy to be there every year for allready more than 15 years!
Just wow!. If this is your first time in Hong Kong you will be amazed. During the daytime it might be cloudy so make sure to see the skyline at nighttime in its full glory!
harbour. did the harbour trip both day and night the evening light show was something of a let down though....but the skyline impressed.
Great views of the city. A simple way to see the nightlights of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Also take thr star ferry for stunning water views.

Beautiful evening walk. You can enjoy a beautiful skyline walk/view from the Kowloon side on the waterfront. Giving you spectacular views of the Island skyline. You can also have a drink at any number of bars that offer an amazing view as well. It just cost a little more!

Skyline. I've been privileged over the years to see some amazing sights but this is something to experience. Not sure what it is! New York is a amazing, for sure, Dubai is different, London is home. Get to Hong Kong as it's something to behold.
8pm. Not much of a city person but the 8pm show is well worth a look and popular with even the locals. Very nice to see for the other side of the bay and plenty of room for pictures.

Surreal!. We've never got tired of looking at it during our stay at metropark hotel causeway bay.
It can quite often be misty but whatever the weather once night comes and the lights are on it takes on a surreal feel!
Lovely skyline. Although vivid festival has better light showcase, HK had its moment too, beautiful and relaxing although overrated.
Best by night. Get yourself on a ferry or a cruise if you can as its the best way to take in the views. Once the sun disappears the skyline alights with billions of lights.

Great evening light show. From the Kowloon side overlooking Hong Kong we enjoyed a fantastic light show called Symphony of Lights. Laser show from the top of buildings as well as building lights coordinated to music. This event ran about 10-15 minutes.
Romantic View. I love coming back to Victoria Harbour to watch its skyline, be it nighttime or daytime. Don't miss to watch the light show at 8pm!

Gorgeous Skyline is Amazing at Night !. Hong Kong has more skyscrapers than anywhere else and they show them off well. Sunset into night are the best times to really enjoy the view. Whether from the Hong Kong or Kowloon sides, the view is simply amazing.

Beautiful view but the Symphony of Lights isn't as impressive as it should be without music. We brought the kids to watch the Symphony of Lights at 8pm from the Star Ferry Terminal. It wasn't crazy packed but we realised about 2 mins into the show that we couldn't really immerse ourselves in the experience without being near the speakers with the music, which we could vaguely make out in the distance. You can tune in via radio - but in this day and age, who carries a radio around?We lasted about 10 mins before the kids' famous "Can we go nowwwww??" started up...

Simply Stunning. The skyline really is one of the wonders of the world. We saw it both by day and by night and in both instances it is stunning. If you are lucky you will be in a bar late at night watching the laser show. We caught it from the bar at the Ritz Carlton, well worth price of a cocktail
Nice. Skylines are good when viewed by the ferry. Good place for a visit. Ferry is the cheap way to get a fantastic view.

The skyline from the hotel Intercontinental is magnificent. Hard to beat the Hong Kong skyline (well, Shanghai is close). The view across the harbour from the Intercontinental Hotel is simply magnificent. The light show was a little less than we were expecting, but the overall lighting of the buildings, reflected on the water, is one of our primary memories from our trip to Asia.

One of top 10 skyline. I watched many shows , documentaries and movies that included Hong Kong skyline and I was always impressed by it . Now when I had chance to see it with my own eyes all I can say is ooooo yessss :). Amazing day or night . You can look for long time and from different places and you will never get bored of it . I recommend seeing it from the peak or from the harbour and you can see night light show with music and all the buildings shining . I highly recommend it's must see thing in Hong Kong . I will include some photos too. Thank you and have a nice travel .

Must see. No matter if you invest the money in the peak tram (pathway would be available too if you prefer), or if you just enjoy the view from Kowloon. Light show is every night at 8pm (at least in September). Not sure if you can see it from the peak. Special harbour cruise is expensive but provides great views (if you got a window seat at the right [or left?] side). I would rather recommend to come early to the Kowloon pier and enjoy the pier. The light show is very nice, but nothing really spectacular.

Not as iconic as the NYC skyline, but just as beautiful. The HKG skyline really sets it apart from other far east mega-cities like Tokyo, Seoul or Bangkok. Anytime and anywhere you look at it, night or day, ground level or mountain peak - it's beautiful and mesmerizing.
Star Ferry. HK has an amazing skyline. Get onto the water for the best shots! Catch the Star Ferry for the best view! The Star Ferry is a cheap way to do this! Highly recommended!
Lovely view. Take a walk at night and enjoy the cosmopolitan view! The Hong Kong skyline will not disappoint the most seasoned traveler

Hong Kong is spectacular. I have always been fascinated with the city of Hong Kong from a young age. Largely due to my appreciation for Bruce Lee and other Kung Fu films. I visited Hong Kong finally and took a trip to arguably the best skyline on the planet. The view of Hong Kong at night are breath taking. I stayed in Kowloon and transportation was very easy to access to Hong Kong Island. The Peak Tram will take you to the top where you can go outside and take amazing photos. The cost is around 86HKD which is around $11USD for return train. On top they also have dining and shopping options such as Bubba Gump Shrimp company. Attached is a photo taken from Hong Kong
Fantastic view. Very nice lighting performance and the view is so great. Always looking forward to watch it when visiting Hong Kong. The place is always crowded.

One of the great city views of the world. Good architecture with some spectacular buildings including the HSBC building, BOC building, IFC and others.he views have all the flavor of a modern city, but still retain a lot of character.

Very romantic. although i was there on my own i felt like young werter missing some beauty of this world hahah. It is just very nice night skyline, seeing the lights of the city place around incredible nature - awesome. Please note that there is no need of going to this super expensive terrace, you can see everything on the way down while walking.
Beautiful!. The skyline is beautiful. Great for photography. Victoria Harbour is nice. Make sure to spend a few minutes there and take some pics.
A wow skyline. Beautiful skyline in day and night, the city that never sleep. The harbour view with tall building from my room is really fantastic, you should experience it yourselves.

Picture perfect and memerizing. Hong Kong skyline seems so perfect when seen from tsim sha sui promenade. They have some magnifiecient light shows going on as per schedule. Do plan to go in the evening as that's the best time to be at the promenade and view is great. Skyline is a place not to be a missed if your in hongkong, so plan accordingly.

It was a WOW!. But with pre-booking and three hours waiting. For children under six it's worth booking a trolley and food in stand in line. On weekends it's impossibly crowded. But the visiting was definitely worth it!

Hong Kong Victoria Harbour skyline. There is no comparison to Hong Kong's Victoria Harbour skyline anywhere in the world. You could view it from a distance or closeup, sea level or from 118 floor level (ICC bldg), it's a sight beyond compare. Of course the free nightly 8 pm laser light show is best viewed from TST at Star Ferry in Kowloon due to the viewing angle and without any obstruction. Taking the Star Ferry to Hong Kong at that hour also offers a relaxed and breezy spectacle for video capture, which is one of my favorite.
Nice view . A nice view is to be had at the top of the peak overlooking the island . It was a nice ride to the top on the peak tram
Hard to describe. If you love skylines, dramatic night shots, wonderful waterfronts you simply cant beat this. A photographers dream
Endearing & enduring. Been to Hong Kong a few times in the past decade, have never got tired of looking at the Hong Kong skyline especially when night falls and the lights start coming on.
HK skyline. The best Skyline on the world, top!during the music/light show at 20.00 is something really exciteing

One of the best skyline in the world. If you happen to drop by in Hong Kong, this is the best and free sightseeing. Two of the best spot to enjoy the moment are Peak, Hong Kong Island, and around Tsim Sha Tsui Pier.They will put on a light show every evening around 8pm.
Amazing. The ligh show takes place here and it is beautiful a real sight to see. Victoria Harbour is a magnificent place to shop and sight see!

Where Else?. There is no other place on earth, really, that is so spectacular and beautiful! I agree with the other reviewers, it is best to enjoy the view on Kowloon side. If you have a harbor view hotel room consider yourself lucky to just look out the window and have this million-dollar view right in front of you.

Beautiful but crowded. If you want to take photos or want to view it clearly without blockage, be there early.The show starts at 8pm, but by 7.30pm, the surrounding is already full of people.It's pretty annoying with people talking loudly and if you are standing behind, it will be even more when people infront of you are raising their hands high with mobile to take photos

Pretty breathtaking. The Hong Kong skyline, for me, was the most impressive thing about my recent visit to Hong Kong. A visit during the day, in my opinion, is just as impressive as one made during the night. Although you won't be able to see the buildings in all their multi-colour glory, you will still get a good view, have fewer people to contend with and won't have to fight for a decent vantage point from the shoreline.That said, a visit at night is worth the time as long as you aren't situated too far away. The A Symphony of Lights show, for me, was a little underwhelming although the atmosphere and infectious music from the Tsim Sha Tsui viewpoint is pleasant enough despite the crowds.A hike to The Peak will offer a view of the skyline from a different angle altogether. Unfortunately terrible weather put paid to my planned hike but photographs shown to me by friends who stayed in Hong Kong a few days longer than me proved the journey to be worthwhile and the views suitably impressive. I was sad to have missed out!
Remarkable. Stayed in Kowloon. Got to see this amazing view every night. The light show is worth a watch at 8pm as well. Hong Kong skyline really is quite beautiful.

Best Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade. The centralised viewpoint is in the Tsim Sha Tsui, I can getting all sightseeing from the place as well as the Hong Kong skyline which is very gorgeous. Must visit place absolutely.
Nice . The Hong Kong skyline is a really Nice one to few. During daytime it can be foggy, but a night with all te lights, really good.

Amazing Buildings. Quite possibly the most amazing skyline in the world. I love arriving to big cities at night so I can be surprised in the morning. The buildings took my breath away. They go all the way up to the heavens. From older sketchy buildings to new futuristic high rises, the Hong Kong Skyline is stunning.
Excellent. One of the best in world. We saw evening and night vision from boat. Outstanding. The sky scrapers are very amazing

Incredible!. For I come from a little village from the rural side of Germany this was an extraordinary view for me! It was by far the most colorful skyline I ever witnessed. I did spend 5 evenings just sitting there, watching the skyline. I did prefer the view from Kowloon to HK Island over the view onto Kowloon tho'.The lightshow was nice as well, but not that special. It's a little overhyped. The HK Skyline is a must see for everyone visiting Hong Kong.
Excellent to view at night. Excellent to view at night from the Kowloon bay. Nice and safe to take a walk at the Bay and watch the skyline. Definitely recommend

Beautiful Skyline at night and by day. Lovely skyline during the day, go near the Intercontinental Hotel for the best views. Plenty of space and people all around. The night views are fantastic. We felt safe and didn't see any trouble in the area. Many people taking selfies and having a good time.

Great view. The Hong Kong Skyline is just stunning. It never fails to amaze me to see so many buildings, laid out in a way that displays a wonderful light show at night. From any point in the city you can appreciate this beautiful skyline.

Recommended for photographers. The beautiful Hong Kong skyline is best seen from the Kowloon area. Be aware of Masses of mainland Chinese that visit the area. Be careful with your tripod, as you may be run over by large groups, who may not be aware of surrounds or care to be aware of their surrounds. The Laser show is pretty average, but the lights of the skyline are definitely worth the visit.

a "must see" at night time. This is one of the iconic world sights and one to be witnessed at least one. The best time is at 8pm each evening, when the skyscrapers on the island all light up with fabulous demonstrations of patterns as well as laser shows
Beautiful. Be sure to take in the laser light show on the harbour at 8 pm every evening. This was so incredible to see.

All of the lights!. Awesome! went on a romantic stroll out with my partner. Beautiful watching the sympthany of lights! this is on every night at 8pm, do not miss it, is a must see. Followed with a romantic night out on a skytop bar, drinks in hand. Fun times.
nice view nothing special. see at night during the light show good for memory pictures , lack te promenade is underconstruction
Worth the visit.. Convenient for us to get to as we had a free shuttle service from our hotel, Metropark Kowloon. Great atmosphere, great for tourists.

Amazing night or day. The skyline is something that never fails to amaze us as the ferry comes into the pier at Victoria Harbour or in the evening as the buildings' lights come on and the skyline takes on a different face again at 8 pm when the Symphony of Lights starts. A sight to marvel.
So exciting. Driving in, the skyline promises so much. The skyline at night is one of the best things Hong Kong has to offer, absolutely beautiful.
amazing view. amazing view from the Ritz Carlton top floor, but the light show , which is advertised by the city government is quite disappointing. the view of the city however made well up for it!
Best in the world ?. This could easily be the best skyline view in the world. I loved it in particular at night from the peak.

Beautiful. Even with rain the skyline was a beautiful sight. It actually gave the whole experience a special feeling. I would recommend you to find a spot high up to view the skyline, like a restaurant in one of the tall buildings.
Very pretty. Is the must while visiting HKG. Great city view and place to make photos. Laser show is so-so, but otherwise is great to spend an evening
great to look st. if you can get to a high point to look at the Hk skyline during the night, its very beautiful. The great thing about HK is it is not full of pollution like China.

Hong Kong Skyline - A visual delight!. See the Hong Kong skyline by day, from the Kowloon Star Ferry terminal point. For the night view, take a ride on the iconic Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour and be amazed by the splendid views of Hong Kong, by night!!
Nice. Hong Kong is a gift for your eyes. Skyline is fantastic and by night is also romantic. The contrasts by old and new city is really great.
Our third. The show did not have the same appeal for us as it did on our previous visits. This is probably due to having seen Italy before
A must see when in Hong Kong. You need to visit the Clock Tower side both during the day and when it's dark to have a total experience. In a word - incredible!

Magical!. The nightly light show is beautiful. The buildings show off the skyline at night. It's toned down from previous years, cutting down on light pollution. Can be viewed around the harbor. Intercontinental Hotel has great views.

Just very, very cool. At this point in my trip I was yet to visit Shanghai (and I don't think it would matter if I had). I'm from a small village in England and Hong Kong is just a world away. The skyline if so impressive and beautiful (especially at night). We caught the metro across from our hostel to do the Temple Street Night Market (which is incredible) and then went to take in the view of the skyline at night with all it's neon adverts. Finally caught the Star ferry back across and got some more pictures. A must see experience.

Stunning. Got to Victoria Harbour near the Clock-Tower early so that we could find a good place to sit and watch the Symphony of Lights over the Hong Kong skyline. The lightshow was very nice and enjoyable but the skyline stands alone as being quite stunning. It really is quite something and not to be missed.
Dissappointed. The night we went to c this was quiet foggie so we didnt get to c the really affect was really dissappointed

Wonderful views. One can spend hours here - whether day or night. There is a free laser show every night. The area has lots of food options and is adjoining the Ferry terminal, mall, food joints and bus stop as well as very close to the red line metro. Excellent for free entertainment.

Beautiful skyline especially at night. I stayed at Hotel Continental at Salisbury Road. The room I got faced the harbour, the view was fantastic, it was like a postcard of the skyline, right in front of me. No wonder the Victoria harbour skyline is a famous landmark of Hong Kong.

Beautiful, but careful where you stand!. Obviously a beautiful and iconic skyline. Went to watch the light show and stood on the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade which I advise NOT to do! At least for the time being. There's a lot of construction going on and there's a tall building that blocks essentially the entire light show. Stand near the clock tower instead or near star ferry pier where you have an unobstructed view. It should be more dazzling then!

Hong Kong night skyline . The skyline of Hong Kong Island is a must see. Stay in a Hotel with a Harbour View great value for money. At night view from near the Star Ferry Terminal by the Clock Tower or at the Skytower on Hong Kong Island. If you choose the latter then go early as the Tram queue is really long at dusk!
Beautiful Skyline. The Hong Kong skyline is possibly the beautiful skylines I have ever seen, gives NYC a run for its money, certainly worth taking a look

Symphony of Lights. The Hong Kong skyline is absolutely beautiful. You must watch the daily light show: Symphony of Lights which starts at around 8 Pm. You get the best view from the Kowloon side near the Art Museum & Clock-tower.
Great light show. Watch the free light show at night where all the buildings "work together" and light up in a fun way! :)
Great to view at night. Great light show on Hong Kong side buildings at night. Worth taking Star Ferry to Kowloon side. We watched it from BLT steakhouse on the harbor

Fantastic skyline - forget about the laser show. The skyline in itself is marvelous. One of the best in the world. Don't wait around for the light show - if you have been to Qatar or Dubai it is really disappointing

Fantastic, and even better with the light and sound show. The Hong Kong skyline just goes on... and on.... and on.... magnificent. Even better, watch "A Symphony of Lights", which is the daily light and sound show. Given the skyline stretches so far, you can watch the show from a number of locations and get a different perspective each time.The show does attract a lot of people so you may need to get there a little early to get the best view.A real 'must-do' if you visit HK!

Night show. This is a Must see from Kowloon side. There is a huge two storey promenade from where to watch the nightly laser light show of all the major buildings along the Hong Kong water front .O ur show was accompanied by music and started promptly at 8 pm. Bring your cameras!

Spectacular view be it day or night.. Depending on the season, we were there in August, you should be equipped with a strong umbrella as it rained and got quite windy from the clock tower viewpoint. Nonetheless, the view is very impressive.
Pleasant way to see Hong kong. We really got a good feel for the major areas of Hong Kong harbour and it was a pleasant way to travel.
Simply stunning. Coming from a country without too many high rises and no skyscrapers, the Hong Kong Skyline is simply spectacular.
So beautiful. The Hong Kong skyline is absolutely beautiful. You can get some pretty amazing photos as long as the weather holds up.

Dazzling Night View for Selfie Addict. Since Hong Kong is distributed between 3 main lands, this harbor is actually a place you can see central from a far. Tall buildings with some unique architecture in the harbor, it will be a suitable place to take photo.I'm not a fan of selfie, but you can enjoy the scenery if you don't mind flashlights and people who takes photo. And when I came on the worst possible winter in 60 years, the only food peddler I encountered was only ice cream stall. I bought it anyway and had snot appeared in my nose.

The best harbor view in Asia!. The harbor view of Victoria harbor has sits above the rest and can compete with the best of them when it comes to harbor views. Either from the Hong Kong or Kowloon side (Kowloon side is better FYI), the views will leave you in awe. TIP: Stay for the Symphony of Lights which starts around 7pm-9pm best viewed from the Kowloon side near the Art Museum & clocktower
Hong Kong Skyline. Hong Kong Skyline looks better at night, not as good Shanghai but better than London. From either Hong Kong Island or Kowloon the views are stunning.

Harbour Cruise. We enjoyed an informative and enjoyable evening harbour cruise. Sadly it was a little overcast so we didn't get to see the sunset but it is well worth doing to get a good feel for the city.

Symphony of Lights show was amazing. At the victoria harbour , Symphony of Lights show was amazing
We went there just before 8 pm and the 15 minute lights show
was enjoyed by our family especially the kids .

More beautiful from the top. Make sure to book a table in a nice restaurant or bar at a high floor like Aqua, Hutong, Felix at the Peninunsula. Evening views are spectacular with the non-stop show of lights
Not that great. Went to cruise for skyline and laser show. It was very confusing and we could not make out what exactly was shown!

Such a dazzling and iconic view.. We booked a harbour view room at the Intercontinental Hotel so that we could enjoy the amazing view. Whilst recovering from jet lag, we lazed around the room drinking coffee and reading the newspaper and watching the various boats and assorted river traffic go past. We also spent considerable time in the Lobby Lounge dining and reading the newspaper in the daytime and enjoying the harbour views. The view at night is breathtaking and exceeds your expectations. We knew that it would be good but we were blown away by just how spectacular the harbour view is at night. Even if you don't stay at the Intercontinental, go to the Lobby lounge for a beverage during the day as a nice respite from the manic Tsim Sha Tsui and definitely go there in the evening, even if only for a drink, and experience the amazing night lights and laser show. The show starts at 8 pm.
Good View. With the harbour front (Kowloon side) closed for renovation for 2 years, we could only view Hong Kong Skyline from the Ferry Terminal which was good.

Pictures don't do it justice. We could not stop staring yes at the skyline view. Most days its cloudy with pollution but it is a tropical island wth 7 million people. When sun is out and you catch a good clear day this is NYC Manhattan on steroids!! Light show cool at 8pm ish or 815pm .Love the view from Victoria harbor at night and sky 100 and sky 460 during the day on HK side.MUST see but you can't miss it. Crazy views often with fog rolling in from mountains on high rise buildings. Check out my cell phone pics...

A great view at night. The harbour should be viewed at night with all the lights, it is something that you should not miss, there is a light show at 8pm each night and well worth seeing, if you are able to go to the top of a tall building you will get some great photos of the harbour at night and also during the day, it is a must see if you are in Hong Kong, I have seen it many times and love seeing the view each time i am in Hong Kong.

Super. Best to view from the waterfront. If raining, I'd suggest you sit inside the Intercontinental hotel and have a drink as the sun goes down. The building light up from 6:30pm and the symphony of light starts from 8pm

have your camera/phone batteries charged. this WILL take a few spots off your battery level from sunset to night show to midnight. even a rainy/foggy mid day is a sight to be seen and remembereddont forget to try the ferry :)
It was a wow sight. It was a wow sight. You should not miss this. The laser and light show is absolutely fantastic and is absolutely free. Nicely managed crouds.
Skyline. Wow, probably the best skyline I've seen. Incredible! Will definitely be coming back again sometime soon

One of the best skyline in the world. Fascinating, Romantic, Simply Beautiful. These are the only word I can say about the skyline. In every weather condition, but during the sunset, when all the lights begin to shine it is simply terrific. Great

There's a lot more to Hong Kong than the skyline. I'm surprised that the Hong Kong skyline is listed as the number one thing to do in Hong Kong. Hong Kong is an interesting city with a lot of character, surely there's more to it than this....Having said this, I think the skyline is not bad. You get a good view from Kowloon at sunset. There's an elevated promenade like area with seating next to the Star Ferry terminal near the Kowloon clock tower where people throng every evening to see the skyline and take pictures.

The night is brilliant . Hong Kong is a fantastic city. Very efficient and clean. The night lights are best from TST Kowloon most hotels on the Harbor are good. I like the Oyster Lounge at the Sheraton. It has an almost 180 degree view.

Symphony of Lights was a disappointment. The skyline was beautiful , we waited for the symphony of lights at 8pm, but it was a disappointment. I think everyone was disappointed. Nothing spectacular bout it.

Hongkong skyline. The skyline is similar to any other top mega polis. One can spend entire day here gazing at the numerous buildings, sky & ships that sail across. There are numerous ship tours which are even inclusive of drinks & snacks. One cannot visit this during rains , during summer it's highly humid.

U Just cant miss this whenu are in HK. When in HK Definitely go to the Skyline.. can be seen well light with all sorts of light in the evening.. its open to all, and best viewed from the kowloon side esplanade.. ideal place to click snaps with eh world famous skyline in the back ground... only issue is it get crowed during the laser light show.. again the light show is free to watch form the kowloon side tourist pathway...

First time visitor. We were blessed to stay at the Hong Kong Sheraton Hotel with a view overlooking this magnificent harbour and it's spectacular skyline especially at night with it light show. A great way to unwind and relax after a day of sightseeing and exploring wonderful Hong Kong.

Great views on both sides, nightly light shows. You can walk along both sides to enjoy the views but I really felt the one hour Star Ferry ride is the best way to see it all. At night go onto the Kowloon side at 8pm to see the light show from HK side

Over rated. The light and sound show which is awaited by large crowds on the waterfront is quite disappointing. The music is very low and the lights are not spectacular as one would have expected in an otherwise fantastic city. We left half-way and proceed to dinner.
Fantastic view.. Advise against travel in august as it rains a lot, travel by MTR super easy, light show was so so, when its clear great picture opportunities

Skyline great - laser show - flat batteries . The site of Hong Kong harbour is always startling and an amateur photographers dream. The laser show - a real disappointment. Very mediocre when compared to Sydney's. It is still worth seeing - but do not expect to be mesmerised by what you see. Go for the photos.

One of must Beautiful skyline. Must see and experience it both from the ground will walking on the street from Hong Kong or sitting in some restaurant like (pizza express) or from a huge ground like the peak

Breathtaking view of modern skyline. Day or night the Hong Kong skyline is a breathtaking sight. At night, the nearly 180 degree view of skyscrapers lit up creates a modern and futuristic frame. However, on a clear day, the same view provides a juxtaposition of man made structures and the imposing deep green mountains behind them.
Awsome. Hong Kong Skyline must be one of the best city skylines in the whole world AWSOME especially at night you will not forget it

More breathtaking than NYC!. Hong Kong's skyline is phenomenal. Took a less than stellar dinner cruise to see it, but the tacky cruise was well worth the view! Amazing view of the city with the mountains in the background. A tourist must-do!

Stunning views!!!!. If you are in Hong Kong, don't miss the view of skyline from the promenade. Promenade is just a walk in distance from Tsim Sha Shui on the Kowloon side.It is best recommended to walk on the promenade in the evening, when the sun is getting down. The views are fantastic from here.Then, walk a little further to take the Star Ferry to Central. It's a very economical trip and you would get stunning views from the waters. Take the return trip after it becomes completely dark. Watching the skyline from the ferry with lights on the buildings is surely special.

Wow what a skyline!!!. If you have never seen the lights of Hong Kong at night then put it on the list, every movie you have seen with Hong Kong after dark does not do it justice. We have now seen the lights from The Peak, the Harbour, Kowloon and Hopewell tower.Every occasion offered a different but equally amazing experience, the lights are a spectacle to behold and certainly something that can be looked at for hours. If you have not yet had the chance to take in this most brilliant light display put it on the list of must see things.

Both romantic and impressive. We stayed in hong kong in sep 2016 and we really enjoyed ourselves its a very impressive city with an enormous amount of shops and nice restaurants and very high level hotels, its city that has something to offer for all kinds of people, but if there is something that will remain with you forever its the skyline view from both sides and especially at night, its such a contrast with the new and the old that one hope will remain and more of the old gets restored to blend in we will keep the skyline with us for always

Stunning, dazzling all those things. Beautiful composition of light and reflections. Impressive during the day but spectacular at night. Best viewed from any of the ferries that dock and leave from central piers. Must see.
a 10 mins worth time. was there wandering. just in time before showtime started. Great amount of light but can stay longest 10 mins.
Lovely night and day. Always a gorgeous view day or night from Kowloon all the way around to Whampoa and beyond. A photographers dream!

Hong Kong Skyline. If you are in Hong Kong, don't miss this attraction. If you have seen it from the television, in real is an amazing view from Kowloon side in the night! It is a Symphony of Lights , don't miss it, every day at 8pm from Kowloon side.

One of the World's most spectacular Urban lanscapes - A must SEE. Solo for contemplation, in couple for a romantic moment, with a bunch of friends for long-lasting memories, it's all about going to Victoria Harbor (on the Kowloon Side) and enjoying a breathtaking view. Across the Harbor there is a jungle of concrete, tall skyscrapers that switch on their colorful lights upon the falling dusk, the Peak and a chain of crests that run though Hong Kong Island from East to West.Of course, you can jump on the Star Ferry between Tsim Sha Tsui and Central or Wanchai. But the best option, which will give you wide and panoramic pictures, is to take the New World First Ferry between North Point (Hong Kong Island) and Hung Hom (Kowloon Side). It runs between 0700 and 1900. Come after a storm or a typhoon when the skies are clean, and you will enjoy a limitless range of grays, blues and greens.If you like the crowd and have a massive amount of patience, come here and enjoy the fireworks that are launched for Chinese New Year! That will leave you speechless.

Beautiful and bright. The Hong Kong harbor at night, particularly from the Kowloon side, was pretty spectacular. Many of the buildings had colored lights which changed over tine. Standing in the warm weather along the harbor, we were taken by how tall the buildings appeared and how brightly they were colored. It was a fun and free activity.
Great light show. This lighting show the best to view from the harbour or even more exiting from the boat with a glass of champagne :-)
stunning laser show you cant see elsewhere. Hong kong is crowd place, but the victoria harbour is magnificent! take a boat trip at 20:00 even better! you should try it!

Shining Skyline. Best place if want to experience the night life of Hong Kong . There is great food , music and view what else do u need. I enjoyed the skyline most . There r different shows of all kind . People of all ages will definitely enjoy . The main Laskar show take place at8:00 pm . Make sure u reach early if you want a great spot
Awesome. You've seen it in the movies and on TV, but in real life it is an amazing sight. We saw it from each side, and although the view is best from Kowloon, it was a close run thing.

Glittering Skyline of Hong Kong. What a mesmerizing experience to see in the night this skyline, we have seen this from the deck of our Yacht for almost 3 hours and could not still full fill our eyes with this beauty.It is a must watch and shall not be missed in Hong Kong

Skyline. Similar to Singapore but mountains and lots of water made it different. Mist in between mountains, buildings old and new stacked on each other made it interesting. Big and lighted signboards creates a fascinating aura.

Amazing skyline marred by blinding advertising displays. After dark, the amazing skyline is marred by gaudy, blindingly bright advertising displays. To the naked eye, it's not that bad, but try taking photos and you'll see the problem. (If you expose for the building lights, the displays bloom and blow out; if you expose for the displays, the buildings are nearly black.)Tip: The best time to enjoy the skyline IMHO is just after sunset, when the color of the sky is roughly as bright as the signage.
Most Beautiful in Asia. After a bad city tour with Ann's Travel Tours LTD, the night skyline made the whole bad day better. Especially at night, the most beautiful in Asia.
Excellent Skyline from the Harbour. Exotic Views from the Victoria Harbour. The tall buildings across and light show gives and amazing view.

A Must-See Attraction if you are visiting. The Hong Kong Skyline is probably the most recognizable city from movies and television. It is iconic because architects are hired to upstage each other with each successive skyscraper. The backdrop against Victoria Peak and unlimited photo opportunities from across the Bay create excellent photo opportunities, at least on clear days. The nighttime light show is spectacular, but overall, visit only if you are in the area.
Best viewed from the Ferry at night. One of the most iconic views in the World, this is definitely best viewed from the harbor at night (preferably on a clear night.)
Beautiful...... the skyline looks beautiful particularly at night. One can watch symphony of lights show at the harbour at 8:00 pm every night in the open.

Be dazzled by the lights. Each night HK rises to a new energy level with the synchronised building light display which is fantastic.Even without the spectacular show, the lights of the city skyline are one of the world's great night time attractions.

Not a 'must'to visit. Take e peak tram up to e peak n the temperature is just like Malaysia genting Highland where u c foggy n cooling surrounding. Trickeye n wax meusum a gd visit but don't buy sky peak ticket b4 checking e crowd up there cause e view r just e same at the opposite.

Best place to see in Hongkong . It's best at night but you will also get mesmerised during day or evening. You can see it though the Victoria harbour at Tsim Tsa Tsui or take a ferry ride and enjoy the scenic beauty at close quarters. It's a must if you are lucky you can witness's 3 D light show also.
Absolutely beautiful . Its like a dream when the whole city and its shoreline lights up in the evening with sky scrappers lighting up and to add to it the laser show every evening at 8 pm

One of the best in the world. Despite the hustle & bustle of Hong Kong, viewing the harbour skyline at night is an absolute must. Exciting, sophisticated view of an international city with a sound & light show at 6pm nightly.
Where told it was good. We did enjoy the show, however it wasn't as good as we thought it was going to be. Still well worth going and don't forget to get there a bit earlier.
the nice view to see. To see a symphony of lights, u can go to Tsim Sha Tsui. The show begins on 8pm. U can see also the clock. The big Budha in Ngong Ping 360 should see also, that is in Tung Chung.
best view. You have the best view ever, i loved this place and it's amazing to see all the buildings and the crowded city . I loved it

One of the best in HK!. well its between the best spot for seeing the HK city skyline and the best spot for pokemon hunting. free atraction everynight (8pm). not so great but still a great addition to the already great place.
there is no wrong time to visit. great place to visit in day or night time.
Skyline for free. Stay around the Cultural Centre at Tsim Sha Tsui, you may experience the fantastic laser show in both sides of Victoria Harbour. Nothing to pay for.
Nice view . This view is really nice along the harbor when the weather permits as it's quite often muggy and foggy. The skyline is constantly changing with many new construction projects going on.

Nice and funny.... It is really amazing to watch all these skyscrapers getting very lovely colorful light symphony every night...
It starts every day at 19:00 but you need to be there earlier to get a good seat and start recording.
Highly recommend this

Just wow!. This really is a stunning skyline and the best places to view this from are:
- Victoria Harbour (nearest MTR is Tsim Sha Tsui)
- Victoria Peak (accessible via peak tram)
You have to see this at night as well as during the day!

For the "postcard view" tay on the Kowloon side of the bay. Quite spectacular, but that is what it was made to be. Do try to keep your hopes in line with the fact that HK is often foggy/clowdy and you may not see the top of the buildings (and the lights from there). If you are on the Kowloon side as suggested you might want to stay near the peer where they are playing the music. I missed that part, but then again I had a hotel view with nobody else fighting for space... Looks like people position themselves quite early in order to get a good view so be prepared.
One of the Best Skylines!. Make certain to catch the light show from one of the ferries running between the island. Great views of both sides.
Beautiful city. Beautiful city skyline after dark. The colours of the lights on the buildings are spectacular. Cultural Centre at Tsim Sha Tsui provides a good view
Free entertainment every evening with Skyscrapers views. Great to watch every evening. Free of charge and lights, colors and laser based. Best to observe from the one hour Hong Kong Harbour cruise.

Worth a view. The skyline here is iconic and seen numerous times of YV, especially at New Year but unfortunately when we were there is was invariably misty/foggy. We arrived at the harbour front about an hour before the light show and waited for what we thought would be spectacular. It wasn't worth the wait - it's good and worth seeing and maybe it was the weather but certainly not a must see. Better just getting the Star Ferry across at night or the or the Victoria Peak tram during the day.
Stunning view!. It is stunning no matter you view it over the top on the peak, or you view it at the sides of the Victoria Harbour.

At night is at its best. It's the symbol of Hong Kong, and a must-see during your trip - though you can hardly avoid it! Don't bother trying to wrestle the crowds to see the light show though - it's so underwhelming I actually didn't realise it had started!

Laser light show is fun and free. Something easy to do for a free evening. A bit packed with people on a hot humid sticky night but love the red chinese junk boats that was showing off its beauty with the music and laser lights!

What a view!. A lot of Asian cities have beautiful skylines, but what I liked here the most is that this one has dancing lights and lasers which move to the music. And its not the boring white and yellow, but you can see many colours together. The symphony of music that us held every night adds to it. You can also see the occasional boat also crossing it. The observatory wheel looks like a tiny toy from far away. Kudos to the planners of the city to integrate so many features into a simple skyline.

Among the finest. There's not a lot you can say in a review of a skyline, it is what it is. But the view from the Kowloon side of the harbour at night is truly stunning. I would say I am rarely left awestruck but when I turned a corner to be faced with it I was taken a little aback. I tried to take photos but didn't do it justice. Spectacular.

View from TST. I rarely get the appeal of skylines but Hong Kong is truly beautiful with the "mountains" in the background, some standout skyscrapers and the fantastic architecture of the convention center.

Best skyline in night view. Hong Kong has best skyline in night times. You can go to waterfronts, take Star Ferry cross Victoria Harbour, go to peak, and take Tramoramic tour tram look different style of skyline.
Worth the view. Amazing view in the night... Worth every minute spent there. Built with a thought in mind to attract tourist
Spectacular Night Skyline. Do visit the harbor at night. stay there and have a view at their night lighting. Avenue of Stars are just round the corner.
Interesting light show. The whole place changes as it gets darker, the buildings each light up and then every evening for a short time there is a light show at 8pm.
Can't really see the light. Maybe its because of the weather the view wasn't the best. But overall it was fine, u get to see the beauty of the hong Kong nightcity

Nothing new .... It is a nice view. Now a days you have similar view offered by many places around the world.
Dont need to specially plan for it. Just do soke shopping and see places around Tsim Sa Sui . And by evenibg when you are tired grab some snacks and sit at the open audotorium to njy show.
Stunning . This is really one of the most iconic city skylines and not to be missed at night just amazing and catch the light show too

Just pass by..... Don't think this is a real attraction, if you are in the area at night time it is a good idea to walk around the harbour and enjoy the view, however as some people said the light show is not that great (nor bad), just not a must see!

Skyline. The most beautiful skyline of the world who gives to the visitors a stunning scenario of this dynamic city. The colours, the lines of the marvellous Skycrapers of the Hong Kong Island offer a great view from the various Skybars of Kowloon. Don't miss it, at least once in your life.

2 visits day and night!. It is so beautiful and impressive that it should be a must!
Go and enjoy it. at night is even more Impressive. At 8 in the evening they do a light show but doesn't matter if you cannot manage to go at that time as the real thing is the skyline per se.
Enjoy!
Symphony of Lights. It used to be very good, but now, hardly anything interesting to watch. But still pack with tourists.

After 50 years still takes my breath away. whether it's a day time or night time view, looking out over the Hong Kong Harbour from our vantage point in Kowloon is always fantastic. Of course over the years it has changed dramatically, but it still excites one to see it.
even if you're not in a great room soemwhere, find a place with a view and enjoy it.

LIght Show?. The longest running permanent light show in the world.
In need of a serious injection of adrenaline, a real disappointment.
The sklying is pretty enough. The light show is a scam.

Pure magic. Forget the silly light show on the Kowloon side.
Look across the harbour from Tsim Sha Tsui and enjoy the wonderful view.
Why not catch StarFerry across the harbour and see the lights of TST from the island, but, best of all, enjoy the lights from the ferry as you cross.

Stunning!. The Hong Kong skyline is totally stunning,whether it is day or night, rain or sunshine it looks beautiful.There are so many great vantage points to view it from, although my favourite is from the Star Ferry after dark. It's also breathtaking to view it from Victoria Peak, the Hong Kong Observation wheel, the harbour or the top of the International Finance Centre.

Hong Kong Skyline Lightshow. The light show featured on the building are amazing. In order to get the best view, one must be there early to grab the front seat. As it is rather far from the seats to the show, the light show become 2D image rather than 3D. If you are first time in HK, it is good to at least view it at least once! :)

The best view in the world. Go and see this view during the day or at night, this is most spectacular and wonderful skyline in the world....You can also see the light show that starts at 8.00 pm and this is just amazing....This must be seen once in a life !
ICONIC. Hong Kong's skyline is amazingView is even more spectacular at nightView from Victoria Peak or on the Star Ferry
Best in the world. One could never get bored of this view, you forget how tall each individual building is, absolutely must be seen in the day and at night

Best skyline I have seen!. I have been to New York, and many other cities with beautiful skylines, but Hong Kong tops the list for me, with it's high energy and intently lit skyline! For the best views, sit as close to the waters edge as possible (beyond the railing)
Breathtaking. Day or night, the Hong Kong waterfront skyline is one of the planet's best! Walk along the waterfront, catch a ferry, go up to The Peak for a view.

No skyline like this anywhere else on earth. This is the best man made skyline you will find on the planet. It is better than New York by far. Their is the laser show in which the buildings are lite up and have images there on combined with the occasional fire works display depending on the month you go.

One in a million !! . Truly spectacular - words cannot describe how a maze of buildings can come together to dazzle your senses ! Even concrete looks beautiful !! The light show is a huge disappointment though - hardly anything compared to the skyline ! Come by around 7 and grab your place in the pavilion and just watch the transition from dusk to night and the lights come on in full flow!
With the Star ferry a very nice view. The harbor, the ferries, cruse ships, commercial ships, and at the back lights like thousand of Christmas trees
Hong Kong night view. Best night akyline I've seen so far. We were able to view the A Symphony of Lights at the Victoria Harbor
great view. This is an amazing sight best viewed from somewhere in Kowloon a good spot is from the sky 100 building

One of the most beautiful skylines in the world (with NY/Tokyo). The view are just breathtaking. A must visit is the daily light show on the TST side. To my opinion the view gets even better at night.
Just amazing. With good weather conditions, the view from Hong Kong island to Kowloon or vice versa is just breathtaking.

Quite possibly the best in the world. We've been to many of the major cities in the world and out of them all, we like Hong Kong's skyline the best. I think the best way to see it is to experience it from Victoria Peak during the day and then from a Star Ferry or the TST at night. We also viewed it from the Ozone bar at the ICC at night as well. The light show just adds to the experience.

You won't miss it. Great at night
Lovely colours
Great harbour
You have to see it ounce although not that big
Enjoy Hong Kong
Just like on the movies. A wonderful view both day and night. Wait until the red sailed boat sails passed for best photo oppurtunity

Best at Night. Most Hotels on the Harbour front have fantastic views over the harbour. During the day sometimes it is a bit foggy but normally clears during the morning Lots of Activity in the Harbour good time wasting occupation After sunset this is the best time to view the Harbour

Incredible to See In Person. We saw a Summer Light show that ran most of August. Several of the buildings on Hong Kong Island had lights/green lasers moving to music. The waterfront area on Kowloon is very lively at night. Great place to see the lights!
Beautiful by night. The harbor was delightful to experience at night with or without the laser show.The Hong Kong skyline was shown at it's best.

Not to be missed. Peak tram good method to go up, but be there early, to avoid huge queues. Fantastic view, but hard to get to the terrace, as you have to pass first 3 floors of shops and fast food outlets.

The night lights up. The skyline is awesome, with view over victoria harbour which is very beautiful. The best time to see this is at dusk when the lights are coming on it will make you jaw drop and bring a camera you will want it.
A must see. One of the most amazing sights at night. Really a must see whenever you visit Hong Kong. The play of light makes the whole area look like something from a fairy-tale.

Lit up the dark sky with an array of colours. It was a beautiful sight to behold. The dark sky was literally lit up with a wonderful array of colours. Sky lasers were shooting off in all directions toward the sky. I didn't mind the crowd, the view totally made up for it.

Beautiful skyline but light show a bit of a dud. No question HK skyline is something you will not want to miss when visiting HK ... It is impressive overall but better at night ... There is a light show which is a bit tacky to be honest but loads of people floods in to watch it each night ... Rain or shine!

It Depends. If you like tall buildings and bright lights, then the HK skyline is the best. I saw it by boat twice, once by day and once by night. I liked the daytime views best because the boat I took went into one of the typhoon shelters, a cute boat harbor with all varieties of water craft. The neon lights at night are pretty in a way but they all are ads. Even the "Symphony of Lights" is not very interesting after a few minutes. The harbor is very nice taken from the deck of one of the many tourist boats.
Quite a spectacle at night. The waterfront is spectacular at night with the buildings beautifully lit up. Some of them change colour too.

Skyline and light show . The skyline at night is quite beautiful. It's definitely worth the trip to take some pictures and enjoy the scene. However, the light show is not very exciting. There are faint laser beams that come from certain buildings but that's about it. There's a huge crowd to see it so to fight that and find a place to sit may not be so worth it. I'd suggest going as soon as the sunsets to skip the crowd and see the skyline in peace.

Hong Kong, Chicago, New York..Good competition. Have been to quite a few Skyscrapper cities in the world and this ranks up there with the likes of Chicago and New York. The weather was excellent with a pleasant breeze which helped.
A well worth place to see the tall buildings. Go from Star ferry to harbour and you will experience HK as other HK locals do. Take a camera, like I did and take as many pictures as you can.

Fantastic . And iconic view worth the trip to Hong Kong just for the view looking across from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island in the afternoon and then into the evening with us then the lights is just amazing and fantastic place to spend a few hours

Skyline lit in the night. If you take a ferry by night - you will be amazed to see the skyline - the boat takes you through the whole length of the harbor and there is pre-recorded description of all the buildings

breath-taking but best from the peak. We saw the jaw dropping skyline from both perspectives. The nightly "show" with soundtrack is cheesy at best. Probably worth stopping buy if you are in the area but personally, I'd go at another time at night when the foreshore of TTS isn't jammed packed with people. Make the extra effort & go up to the peak at dusk/night. It's still crowded but it's well worth it. You can reach the peak by the funicular railway or by bus -latter is much cheaper.

Check out for temporary closure!. I was quite excited when I first heard about the HK skyline, the Symphony of Lights and its famous people's handprints and statues. However, when I got there, I was disappointed to find out that the place was under renovation. Although they did had some temporary murals up and we could still see the skyline from a distance, I thought it was a wasted trip.
Pretty anytime of the day and night.. The harbour is great from any angle, not sure what the hype is about the laser show but you have to see it once. Star Ferry remains a favourite.

A must for those city lovers. Like many of you, cities remain marvels of cultural, societal, and visionaries initiates and Hong Kong remains hands down one of the most elegant and contemporary skylines in the world. Day and night, Central and its adjacent neighborhoods captivate any audience and the trip with the Star Ferry is simply magic to enjoy a full experience of what it means to be in the middle of Hong Kong.

One of the most beautiful harbor in the world and is tantalizing to watch.. Simply beautiful and hard to described by words. Every Christmas tens of millions of dollars were spent on light decorations on the buildings along both coast of the harbor, not to mention the firework and the laser light show. Amazing.....

It was something special. If you come to Hong Kong, you have to see it. It is especially spectacular in the evening. Once it was unique. But nowadays you can find similar views in several big cities in China.

Otherworldy. The Hong Kong skyline is something to behold...the symphony of lights at 8pm local time nightly brings the skyline to life. You simply must enjoy this from a top floor at your Kowloon hotel looking out over the Harbor or more spectacularly, from the Star Ferry or Octane bar on the 118th floor of the Ritz Carlton.

Skyline View. Great view of the skyline. Great selfie spot!!!! We were a bit late seeing the entire show but it was worth the effort. It was crowded but not overwhelming.Definetly a must see on your visit to HK
One of the best. One of the best skylines of the world. Symphony of Lights is a unique experience, but can be spoiled by clouds or rains.

Vue of Hong Kong. This is very beautiful, many lights and light show in august. both side from tsim sha tsui or from hong kong are nice to see but the best one is from tsim sha tsui where you see all the lighted buildings. It's also good to see the city from the top of veronika's peak at night and day

Worth it if your in the area, skip it if your not. We made a special trip to see several things so we were already in the area. We stuck around for the light show and it was okay. Knowing what I know now I wouldn't make the special trip for it.

Best Skyline in the World. Hong Kong has been voted the best skyline in the world, and it lives up to the hype. Great to see from TST near the 8pm start of the laser show, or from Victoria's peak around sunset. The Bank of China building is an example of how each skyscraper is architecturally different and contributes to an amazingly bright skyline across the water at night.

Beautiful!!!. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful. It was wonderful to see during the day and night but of course more special at night. We watched the lights and music show and found it underwhelming. The lasers, when they appeared, were weak and the building lights didn't match the music in any way. Seriously, they need some pointers from a major corporation with mouse ears that put on spectacular nighttime shows. Anyhow, one can happily gaze at the stunning skyline without the show.

Such Tall Buildings. We took a night tour on an open double-decker bus to see both the Hong Kong Skyline as well as riding down the main district to see the neon lights that Hong Kong is famous for. I would recommend a jacket and scarf if you're going to be outdoors at night even though it was hot during the day. The skyline was of course impressive because of all of the skyscrapers. I'm not sure I'd do it again or whether it was worth the money we spent to take the evening skyline tour, but it was something to see.

Stunning . Its a stunning view , both day and night . Didnt go over board with the show at 8pm . Its a few green lasers from some of the buildings plus music . Nothing to get excited about . But its nice to see once . Lots of people gather on kowloon side to see it by pier / prudential building

Most Fascinating Sight !. Whether one is on the Hong Kong side or Kowloon side, the skyline on both shares is quite fascinating. It becomes more spectacular in the evening with all kinds of neon lights on buildings and hoardings. And the best way to enjoy this is by crossing the Ferry across the Victoria Harbour.
Amazing sight. Took the Kowloon ferry across to get the best view. Laser show was a bit flat. The cityscape at night speaks for itself.
