Very nice view. . ... relaxing and amazing to see all these lights at night and enjoy the viewHownthe lights are arranged is great.

3-D Laser Light Show. If you can catch this light show on the Kowloon side by the Clock Tower you will appreciate it! The engineering & coordination required to put this together between all the buildings on the HK Island side is very impressive!thier viza wi be at the old passport???
Best experience as always . I love this city! The lights in night time, food, shopping etc. You must be at 8pm by Victoria harbour for the light shows. is an incredible experience and for free.

Victoria Peak. Hong Kong skyline is incredible. Ont the top of the Victoria Peak, one can see the entire Hong Kong skyline, apartments built along the hills, all the way down to the harbour, across the harbour is Kowloon, mountains behind all the lighted apartments. One must see it to understand what I am talking about !
Amazing. Really good experience to see all of the lights from the Kowloon side of the harbour. Would also recommend going to the light show at 8pm and viewing from one of the hotel roof/Sky bars.

Hong Kong Skyline - One Of THe World's Iconic Sights. Along with London's Big Ben, Sydney's Harbour Bridge, NewYork's Statue Of Liberty and Egypt's pyramids the skyline of Hong Kong is so famous and so breathtaking that it really needs no introduction. It is magnificent and, no matter how many times you see it, you will always feel impressed and inspired by the sight of it. Best seen from The Avenue Of The Stars on Kowloon side or from the Star Ferry, it never fails to impress. Another good way to see it in all its glory is to take a taxi from Causeway Bay towards Central and the vie is magnificent along parts of the journey. And don't forget the evening light show where all the buildings are lit up and synchronised by computer - the show lasts about 10 minutes and takes place daily and is free. If you see this on The Avenue Of The Stars, there is also a music accompaniment an commentary.
Amazing view. The night view is brilliant in Hong Kong!! I could have stayed there whole night, although it is a but crowd.

Still the best Light Show. We consider this to still be the best Light Show we have seen. Now offering the 3D show at intervals each night though I'm not sure for how long it will be available for.
We compare this with the Shanghai light show which is beautiful as well.
Stunning night views. Seen this view hundreds of times over three decades of travelling and still find inspiring. Just pay a few dollars for the Star Ferry and skip the expensive tours.

Best Nighttime Skyline view in the World. At 8pm Hong Kong skyline transforms into a very cool lightshow. Buildings light up with amazing effect, lasers jump between buildings, lighting up the night sky. Once in a lifetime experience for sure. I travel there every year and am still impressed by the scale .
Most amazing view!. Haven't seen anything quite like this in my whole life, so amazing to look at, can't wait to go back again in the future!

Hong Kong version of Hollywood Stars. Great promenade along the water and see the metal stars with names on the boardwalk. At night there is a fabulous light show. Be patient, it starts off slow, but then ramps up, the reflections on the water and incredible!

Amazing view!!!. We went on the aqua Luna boat and watched the light show. The view was spectacular but the lights were a little naff! The staff on the boat were lovely and you get one free drink. Well worth it for the view and boat ride.
Must see as the sun goes down. Seen from one of the rooftop bars or restaurants at sun down and as all the lights come on, it's spectacular
Sight seeing. fantastic place to visit to adsorb Hong Kong at its best. Great scenery for a day or night visit. I did both.
Very nice harbor view with light show as well. Very nice harbor view at night under clear sky with moving light and there are nightly light show as well.

Nice show. The skyline is breathtaking! Specially at night with the light and music show seen from the other shore.
It takes place around 8 p.m and it gatehrs lots of people.
Night time wonder. Nothing special in the morning but come night time reveals a breathtaking view of this marvelous city.

Well worth going. We saw the Hong Kong Skyline at night from the Kowloon side. And it was brilliant , a "must do" when visiting Hong Kong.We took the White Star ferry across the harbour, which was cheap, and a great little trip itself. Then bought some nice cold beer and joined the crowds to enjoy the light show set to music. Brilliant!

Bucket list view. Seeing the HK skyline and light show is a bucket list event, a must-do for anyone who enjoys traveling. I rate it as one of my top 5 skylines of the world. The city of lights wakes up at dust to show off its colorful lights and night brilliance. Looking at HK island from Kowloon was the best view. We sat by the harbor city side and we're lucky enough to catch the special 3D light show running during the month of August.
Beautiful views!. The view from victoria harbour is beautiful. take a snap professionally, lovely light show. The city comes alive at night...

My secret spot to watch the skyline. The Hong Kong skyline is gorgeous but seeing it from the Avenue of Stars where its crowded and theres heaps of tourists is a bit overrated.Instead, I'd recommend finding the outdoor carpark in Ocean Terminal on the 6th floor (ocean terminal is a huge shopping centre). Go out into the carpark and walk all the way to the carpark's perimeter. From there you can get equally good views of the harbour, and you can usually get it all to yourself! Either that, or I like going up to the top of buildings to see the skyline. The American Club in Hong Kong has an excellent view of the skyline, probably the best I've seen. I watched the new years fireworks from there. Without already knowing people, it's difficult to get access into a lot of the tall buildings in Central where you might be able to see the skyline, but the carpark I mentioned above is accessible to everyone and is free.Enjoy!
breathless. go by daytime, go by nighttime. Be there at 8 o clock and see the lighsymphonie. Go up the peak at evening and enjoy the great view on the litdhing city
Best in the world. Jaw droppingly awesome.The light show at 8pm every night is a must.Amazing.One for the camera!!!!
absolutely gorgeous. this is amazing to see...especially as the lights come on in the evening. (Alma Portuguese Grill at Harbour City is a wonderful vantage point).

Packed but beautiful. If you have been to Shanghai (the bund) you won't find this too impressive.The view is wonderful and every night at 20 they light the buildings (sort of a cool city light show)The good view spots are heavily crowded.

Amazing!. If you like this sort of thing...I do, it make this place stand out to the rest of the world, I know NY have this but in HK it just a amazing, by the way I haven't been to NY so I really cant comment NY.This sort of thing is a simple of wealth, a lot of things to do 24 hours a day 7 days a week.
A must see. Join the crowds down by the Star Ferry terminal for an incredible light show every night at 8pm. Although we have seen it many times we still enjoy it, if you have kids they will love it.
Skyline downtown. Really nice view.of a.small.city but with a lot of economic.power and interesting places restaurany shops for expensive watches

Stunning like no other. HK skyline is just amazing and where to find it:From HK islandfrom the famous peak of course: important is beside the viewing point; take the hiking trail around the peak to sample more various angels of HK to the harbour; to the bridges; sea; islands just wonderful any time of the day; and make sure to get 8pm lights show from IFC; go to the posh bars on the terrace or just grab a beer/ drink from 7/11 SUPER LOW budget and enjoy free seating there while enjoying the sky linefrom high rises like wooloomooloo bar from Wan Chai; Azzure in LKF and many otherFrom Kowloon Side: simply walking along star avenue; or go to the harbour city for budget travellers on 4th Floor podium near house of Jasmine; posh bars you can go to : in the one have wooloomooloo; Harlans etc; and in ICC many surely including the ozoneor go to PekingNo 1 building to Aqua BAR

Best light show on earth!. At 8.00pm each night, the Hong Kong Symphony of Lights occurs. This is a fantastic, 20 minutes spectacular and not to be missed when visiting Hong Kong. One tip - view the show from the Kowloon tip with the other, many thousands of tourists.
Remarkable view. Choose the night based on windy conditions to get the best view. Its worth the effort. Best view is from Kowloon side looking towards the HK island.
Only at night. Do not miss the boat tour at night between 20.00-20.15 hours to enjoy the spectacular laser and music show "city of lights".
Beautiful!. There was never a dull moment seeing HK Skyline whether it is night or day. Looking at the Skyline really tells me, "I'm really in Hong Kong!". Wow!
One of the best things to do while in Hong Kong. Exploring the markets, taking the boat and observing the Hong Kong Skyline are my top 3 things to do in Hong Kong.
Wow!! . Thought New York skyline was great. But this is amazing. Both day and night time. And there is more work in progress. Truly awesome!!

Best view of the Hong Kong skyline.. There are very few skylines that rival Hong Kong. I will never forget my first impression when I first visited Hong Kong. Nearly forty trips later I am still taking photos of the skyline. The best vantage point for viewing is from the Kowloon side. Go to the bar at the Kowloon Peninsula for a top down view and the Kowloon Intercontinental hotel for an in your face dramatic view. While your there sit down and relax, have a cocktail and enjoy the view.
Amazing city. All must visit Hong Kong once in life time to experience the city. MTR is well connected almost every part of HK
Dazzling. There's a sound and light show every night that is worth the effort to see - and it's free!Laser lighting & lots of colour.

Stunning, but light show is underwhelming. The Hong Kong skyline is really a sight to see. It's absolutely breathtaking, no matter the time of day. During mid-day, the bluish gray of the buildings against the light blue sky has a nice calming effect. Sunset goes without saying. During the night, the lights are also quite nice, especially as you walk along the promenade. The light show at 8pm, however, was underwhelming to say the least. The Gardens by the Bay light show is infinitely better, in my opinion.

Visually stunning!. With a skyline dominated by celebrity architects and East-West fusion design, the nighttime extravaganza that is Victoria Harbour and Hong Kong is an easy and free attraction to enjoy. Grab a quick and tasty early dinner and stake out a spot on the Kowloon side adjacent to the Star Ferry terminal. On alternate nights the laser light show delivers commentary in Cantonese, English or Mandarin for the spectators. Regardless of the language, it's a marvellous spectacle that starts promptly at 20h00.
Breathtaking!. An incredible experience for any traveller to experience! Specially at night. It is simply one of the most amazing places in the world to see.

Probably the best in the world. I have travelled widely both for business and pleasure but Victoria harbour at night beats all other city sites. A few years ago I was with two executives from the Chase Manhattan Bank whose offices are on New York's East River. Their comments were that Hong Kong's night-time skyline beat New York into a cocked hat.

Stunning skyline. There's only a handful of skyline which can captivate you. This is one of them. To see it evolve through the years has been interesting. Still as amazing to look at it some evenings.

Beautiful view. HongKong skylines is one of the most impressive ones and I believe that the best view can be had (for pictures sake) from 3 place:Free public viewing PIERsKowloon Ferry ridePeak Tram journey
Great attraction.. We actually booked our Harbour View room at Sheraton to enjoy that show once again. The light show starts at 8pm daily and is worth coming to the shore to see it.

WOW!. We were lucky enough to stay at the Intercontinental hotel that has an amazing view of this iconic skyline.I would recommend travelling on the Star Ferry during the light show that starts at 20.00 for a great view. The buildings light up and it is a very exciting visual display, every night.Also recommended go to Victoria peak and experience the view from another perspective. If it is a clear day , the photographs are spectacular.
Polluted but night view ok.. Its like any other metropolitan city with lot of high rinsing buildings but apart from few areas the lighting is not as epic as Beijing or shanghai.

So much humidity And Little foggy on august. They said laser show and i saw nothing. Because the laser show compartment was under costruction or under maintenance. But the night view in front of clock tower and space museum is magnificent

Awesome night view. Nocturnal view of the city skyline, even the locals sometimes find it awesome. Best viewed from Tsim Sha Tsui harbour front, Central harbour front, the Peak. One thing visitors to HK should not be missed.
good. good skyline went to avenue of stars and admired the scenery, very beautiful. see it from kowloon/ overall good

Meh. . First time there. Heard the light show started at 8. Got there 5 till 8 and it was extremely crowded, which was fine. However was expecting a more spectacular light show. Unsure if I was in the wrong area. (I was near the science museum district) If I was, make sure you fine where the light show was held at.
Mr RP. Went up to see the sights and was not disappointed the views were astonishing and the lift took 60 seconds Makes your ears pop

Iconic. I used to see the Hong Kong skyline on television when growing up and always had it on my to do list of locations. The wait was worth it as the view is stunning.From the Harbour and also from Victoria Peak, you'll be amazed at the view, beauty and the history of the City so make sure you see as much as you can.Wasn't overly impressed with the light show at night but that's for a separate post.
Spectacular Views. Spectacular views especially when you see in the evening either from star ferry or from the Tsim Tsha Tsui (TST)

Best Skyline in the world. I know lost of people have compared it with NY or Shanghai. Believe me, I've been to both and many times, I still think HK is the best. It tops the table for me with its nightly laser show at Victoria harbour viewing it from Kowloon side. What surprised me the most, was the discovery of a different view from the "dark side" as the HK white expats call it meaning Kowloon (less white folks?). High up from the mountain off Clear Water Bay. The view was breathtakingly beautiful, better than Victoria harbour view! Lots of people but with more space around you.It has brought a satisfying smirk on my face.
View @ Night Excellent..... Excellent @ night view with lots of sky scrapers of hong kong with harbour area. Amazing experience and picture perfect with night vision camera. Great!!!!!

love it. perfect plase
perfect people
perfect food
perfect attractions
disey land
loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee it soooooooo much
worth to go. it's really nice view, and a lot of things happen here especially during Chinese holidays, they also have laser show everyday at 8pm
Probably the Best in the World. WOW What a skyline dya time or especially night time with laser show, seeing the Hong Kong skyline and Star Ferry are memories that will last forever.

Beautiful. Colorful.. Our visit during a night in September was filled with wow's and wonders. We don't normally see the colorful reflections of building lights along the city bay--until we visited Hong Kong. The Avenue of the Stars area is where the best view is, just south, Tsim Sha Tsui. Don't miss to go here after dropping your shopping bags in your hotel. Great experience. Breath-taking night.

Colorful lights!!. A great way to enjoy your time in Hong Kong and not have to spend any money. The skyline is beautiful to see at night and they also put on a free light show at certain times. If you have time, take the star ferry across the harbor instead of the subway and see the skyline while you save some money too!!
Essential nigh viewing. There's a light show at 20:00 hours which be viewed from Kowloon (Avenue of Stars), but either side of the harbour it's great to see the lights of Hong Kong
Beautiful view. nice view in the night with all the lamps. near by mtr. peak period in 7 pm.. will be so many people
Great view. Great view to enjoy. Hong Kong is wonderful day and night, each day of the year. I recommend it!!!!!

Hong kong bright necklace!. Visual delight! If you have not visited this place, you will never understand the evolving Hong Kong culture! Panoramic view is exhilarating! The light show starts exactly at 8 pm for 14 minutes. The Pulse 3D show follows it at 8:30 pm. Its worth spending an hour or two absorbing the skyline. Inspiring that you can make the city vibrant and beautiful! The light show can be made more happening and creative. Enjoyed !!

beautiful view, must see when you travel there. always enjoy spend time at Victoria harbor, the night view is great, very pretty, last trip there are lots constructions there, hope next trip it will be better

Most beaitiful skyline in the world. I spent a year in Hong Kong and this view never stopped being breathtaking, beatiful by day or by night, although significantly different. My favourite skyline in the world and a must see in Hong Kong! The light show is worth a watch from the star ferry pier in TST!
Hong Kong Skylight how can you go wrong?. Beautiful! They have the building lights do a little show together and I have never seen a city work together on something like that before.

Breathtaking. The skyline is absolutely beautiful. One of the best places to view it is from Victoria harbour. Everyday at 8 there is also a light show which offers a unique view of the skyline. I would also recommend taking a very across the harbour to as the offers more close up images of the skyline.

Great day and night. The neon lights are fabulous at night although during typhoon Nida they were all switched off! Day and night the view is great from the Star ferry.By accident we stumbled on the IFC2 on Hong Kong island. Make sure that you have a photo of your passport because you can go up to the 55th floor for free and have a marvellous view of Hong Kong!

Wow, what a view! Specially at night. Find he right spot to see it is challenging, but it does worth it. Depicted in many movies, this is a simple but impressive view that you will remember forever. I haven't seen anything like it.Make sure you are on the HK side. Try to get a bar in a fancy hotel and have a drink or diner at night, facing the harbor. Remarkable!

The show is dated, the skyline alone is amazing. From standing in the street waiting in anticipation for the "symphony of lights" I was most disappointed. The overall performance felt stale and dated with the skyline by itself being much more impressive. The light show would be very effective if all the buildings took part but the fact that every other building in the skyline is already lit takes away any point of reference. I would recommend seeing the skyline, just not with the show.
Skyline for Soul Searching . I like the dancing lights at night. Not sure if it happens every night but it was really a breath-taking view coming from someone who comes from a provincial area.

Hong Kong skyline views are awesome!!!. The views of Hong Kong's Skyline are incredible from many places. One of the best places is along Victoria Habour near the HK cultural center. You should get there by going on the Star Ferry which you can get from Central or Wan Chai. Even while you are in the Star Ferry, take a look around and see the fabulous views. Once you are on the Kowloon side, take a walk up and down the Harbour. Also, go to Harbour City Mall which is very close to the Star Ferry pier. Walk through that mall and you'll see some nice views of the city. Be sure to go to the Kowloon side during the day and then at night to get very different views of the city. Night time is incredible looking at all of the flashing lights.
Amazing place. What a splendid view, a must visit. This place is full of life and the view is breathtaking.There is a light and sound show, dont want for it

Worth viewing but don't expect too much!. Realistically, it is a good skyline light display of the downtown buildings of Hong Kong but not the level that I have read about in some of the other reviews. In fairness, when we viewed it, it was raining heavily and we viewed it from our hotel window without the music that goes along with it. Either way, I strongly suggest, weather permitting, you view it outside from the Kowloon side of the harbor at a location that also plays the music. I would think that they play music next to the Star Ferry.

View from all angles, day and night. You can't miss the skyline. Enjoy from a boat, a bar promenade or peak. We went to hutong restaraunt on one Peking rd, 28th floor under aqua bar one night for 8 pm. Food was expensive, but the view was unreal.

Dated and stale. The light show really feels dated. Seems similar to something I experienced as a child at amusement parks: booming voiceover, synth symphonic music. Not particularly spectacular but likely would've gone over well in the 1980s. If you're really curious, no need to get there early to stake out a good spot, like I did. One of the least memorable things I experienced in HK.

Good to see but don't waste money on sight and sound cruise. Spent £40 each for a light symphony cruise...what a waste ...15 mins on a busy ferry watching the night skyline. The skyline was viewed much better from the resteraunt decks at the shopping centre Kowloon side and would advise anyone to view thus way rather than waste money on the ferry . Ferry was advertised with refreshments which were a nasty packet of biscuits and a can of pop...rip off

Excellent. We travelled from Hong Kong by ferry to kowloon just so we could see the skyline at night . The way the lights dance on the buildings really showed what makes it a must see when visiting Hong kong

Exceptional must see on a trip to the Hong Kong area. One of the worlds most iconic scenes is the Hong Kong skyline and there is not better way to see it than from Victoria Peak on Hing Kong island. Take my word for this the view is breath taking and must not be missed. Take the bus or the fenicular railway to the top and you will not be disappointed.
Amazing . This is such a cool feature. Amazing, visited with family and they loved it. Hong Kong is extra ordinary , so many things to do
Not as expected. Had read lot about this. I had very high expectation but was just few building with lights. We went there to see the light show but were very disappointed.
Cosmopolitan Skyline with some smudges. Its a really nice skyline that depends on the weather really. There is some air pollution sometimes so that can ruin the picture but that is totally alright

Skyline. Hong Kong skyline is just perfect. I absolutely love looking at it at sunset. It can also he very beautiful when on the Starferry as you can look at the the beautiful skyline on both sides of the island.

Unparalleled.. Whether viewed from one of the surrounding peaks, or from a bar in the city (I recommend Eyebar by Tsim Sha Tsui), this view is simply stunning. It's honestly reason enough to visit HK on its own.
symphony of light, every evening at 7. when you visit just hope for a clear day and they will offer you this symphony of light show, it's interesting, for a one time not everyday occasion.

The most beautiful night skyline in the world.. "Pearl of Oriental" when I seen the night skyline in Victoria harbour, I understand why the Hong Kong called "Pearl of Oriental". it was most beautiful night skyline in the World.

A must do...on your bucket list!. Had a chance to experience the amazing Hong Kong Skyline at night, aboard the Star Pisces Cruise. The twinkling lights, the sparkling waters, beautiful red sails, the setting sun...it gets permanently etched on to your mind. A must- do !

Gorgeous. The Hong Kong skyline is fantastic, especially with the Symphony of Lights. Remember that it is about a 15 minute show with lights choreographed to music - I watched it once from shore and once from a harbor tour - enjoyed it both times. Truly a must see while in HK!

Amazing Night View. This is must place for night view.... If you miss it at Night you Miss Every Thing....
Cool Breeze , leisure walk is so so relaxing.....
Friends it said , if you dont see Skyline of Hongkong , then don't come to Hongkong.
Tall buildings , lights , .... Beautiful

Symphony of Lights Show. We went there and got a nice spot on the Kowloon side just near Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. Have to say it was a bit disappointing. The lights are outdated and not powerful enough and the sound and lights aren't really syncronized. Overall a poor performance.

Just Stratosherically Unbeatable -- The Sky's The Limit. Though Hong Kong's tallest building, the I.C.C., only ranks humbly among the top ten tallest ones on a straight height standard globally, this city can boast, not only being among the top tier of global cities for skyscaper appreciation, but in fact being the city with the world's most densely packed stratospheric buildings due to its natural shortcoming of its tiny size to attain this superlative metric.It outshines New York City with its Victoria Peak in the backdrop and a bustling harbour in the midst of it all. It's already awesomely spectacular in the day, but after adding the nightly light show of Symphony of Lights at 8 pm, and the multi colour-rotating ability of some buildings' exterior lights, it's like adding fuel to the fire.It costs nothing just to walk along the harbourfront promenade near Tsim Sha Tsui in broad daylight and again after dark, hanging out timely for the cross-harbour light show at 8 pm. DON'T MISS IT !!!!

One of the wonders of the world. You have to see this. Truly stunning. The views from the harbour are amazing in the day time and even better at night. They take the breath away. Getting out on the water allows you to see both sides, so you can try one of the tour boats or just take the Star Ferry.
What a view!. The hk panorama is amazing in day but in the night - especially during light show is stunning. Significant waste of energy but worth it. Must see when in HK
Don't miss it!. I would say it's the emblem of the city. Lights during the night over the skyscrapers offer a unique experience.
Amazing view!. Such a beautiful sight! pretty impressive by day and even more so by night! Amazing view from the ferry by night too!

Lovely . Oh it's incredible!
One of the most beautiful skyline!!!!!!!!
It's lovely also from the star ferry, don't loose this skyline, a beautiful walk watching mani colors!!!
A must see. A must see in Hong Kong. A bit crowded and must find a place 15min before starting at 8 pm with a perfect view in Victoria harbor if anybody want to take photo/movie.
Always a blast. Wherever you on the promenade, whether in Kowloon or the Island, Hong Kong's victoria harbour view is always a blast !
Light show every evening depending on weather. The light show a little disappointing we were expecting a bit more. But its free so it worth a look.

Tremendous . This is one of the very best city skyline I have ever seen. Totally worth it. I would highly recommend it to anyone to see the light show from the other side of Victoria harbour overlooking the financial district. Superb experience
Best night view. Take a ferry at 6:45pm form harbour front and see the view. This 45 minute ride will show you best light show of HK. You will see the city going bright at night

Must visit at night. Hong Kong skyline is one of the attraction of the city. Series of skyscrapers adore the city sky. This is best viewed from few particular points of the city. One of the best is from Victoria peak followed by from Harbour cruise ship at night. You can also get a glimpse coming from new airport to the city.

Best city view. The HK skyline is truly breathtaking. If you head to Kowloon in the evening and sit and watch the light show that lights up the HK skyline, you'll be amazed. Also get a great view from The Peak.

Do not miss out!. Is is a must for any Hong Kong visit. Grab a beer from one of the shops near the star ferry terminal and take in the amazing HK skyline. It is one of the most impressive views i have ever seen. The lightshow is nice to see but i wiuld arrive shortly afterwards to avoid the crowds.

What a view. The lights, neons, lasers, etc on the Hong Kong island skyline all come together at the daily 8pm show. You need to view from Kowloon of course. It's free, lasts 15 mins and set to modern music. It's impressive for its scope and cooperation between all the various high rises involved. Don't miss!
Best when looking south. From Kowloon the view is so good and there are so many places to see the night sky line from. Can but just wounderfull looking for hours.

Great view and ok light-show. The skyline of Hong Kong Central is stunning at night (if the weather is good, that is). The lights of the buildings across the bay are clearly visible and make for good pictures. If you want to enjoy the light-show (starting at 8 pm) you can see it from the water-front or from one of the many bars on top of the skyscrapers.
Beautiful. Definitely a must when visiting Hong Kong! The view is beautiful and uniques take a camera as it is truly spectacular.
Breathtaking. View of Hong Kong during the night is impressive. The energy of this city is amazing. One of the most beautiful views.

A free symphony of lights every night at Victoria Harbour. Every night at 8pm the show starts (lasts less than 15 minutes). The best place to see it is from the Avenue of Stars. Don't miss it (and it is for free!!!).

Beautiful. Beautiful and something to watch from Kowloon side. Start at 8pm sharp. Fo early to get a good seat and watch the locals or take pictures of the array of boats from old to new. Ita the best entertaining for free by far!
Best to see at Night!. Must see in Hong Kong! Best time to see/visit is after dusk whilst waiting for the Symphony of Lights. Take as many pictures as you want, this is place is free.
Urban extasy. The skyline view is fantastic in HK, especially the one from Kowloon onto the island. Picturesque, diverse architectual designs and all sandwitched between the sky and harbor.

It never ceases to amaze me. One of the most iconic harbor views in the world. To see the lovely skyline, you have to look at it from Kowloon side, preferably from Tsim Sha Tsui. Another great way is to take the star ferry between Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui.

Almost surreal . I don't quite know how it happens but somehow Hong Kong manages to create the most amazing visual spectacle and all you have to do is look up to experience it. The interaction of buildings, lights, sky and moonlight combine to conjure up something that looks like it's from the mind of a Hollywood set designer. The shapes and contrasts of the various buildings fit together like a crazy jigsaw and when you add in the way that the buildings are lit and how that sits against the night sky create something that is truly unique, whether you are at street level or 118 floors up at the Ritz Carlton Hotel overlooking the harbour, the Hong Kong skyline is something that has to be seen to be believed.

Spectacular. Different reviews talk about specific locations - really, it doesnt matter where you are, if you can see the harbour near where the Star Ferry is - you will see the light & Laser show at 8pm.Hong Kong is one of the most spectacular skylines in the world, lights or not - most of the buildings have fancy lighting all day long, do not confuse this with the light show.
Great light show. It's an awesome skyline, so many buildings lit up, many make patterns, very colourful displays. Stunning and a must see if you come to HK.

Stunning show!!. While in Hongkong we checked out the night Hongkong skyline at 8pm. We were on the Kowloon side looking across to HongKong and were treated to an amazing light and laser show. It is well worth seeing if time permits.

Great view at night. We were at Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade (near the Avenue of Stars) at 8pm to witness the Symphony of Lights from tall buildings from Hong Kong Central across Kowloon Bay. I appreciate Hong Kong's skyline very much but my location at the time didn't let me see the light show happening on my side of the bay. Also, the place was full of people trying to catch Pokemon stuff.

Study carefully what will be your view point. Every night there's a light show (with some music accompanying) that is very enjoyable and shouldn't be missed. We started our "tour" in front of the Kowloon Shangri-La hotel (next to the Tsim Sha Tsui East Ferry Pier). Note that the Avenue of Stars is closed because of construction works next to it, so should pay attention if it is on your to-do list (it was closed when we visited on May 2016). The view from there is very nice and not as busy as on plaza next to the Museum of Art. There are a lot of less crowded view points from both sides, so you just have to look for them secretly ;-)
Beautiful view, pleasant spectacle. The view, especially at night is beautiful, is great! But the spectacle, in my opinion, is pleasant, and plenty of people.

Day and Night, It's a Must-See. Come during the day to see the skyline and watch all the junks, ferries, and barges as they make their way across the water. Then come back at night to see the buildings when they light up (8 PM). You'll take lots of photos and see why the Hong Kong Skyline has been called one of the most dramatic in the world.
Great view at a modern city. If you like city views, this is a must see. Especially recommended in the night. Many skyscrapers which enlighten the sky.

So stunning! . I loved walking down the Hong Kong skyline in the evening. It's full of locals, people jogging, families and people fishing. The views can be seen from many of the hotels around if you don't wish to walk along there but it's a once in a lifetime experience to capture some gorgeous photos.Both morning and night the view is extraordinary, there's also a light show to view from 8pm so make the most of your stop here. It's definitely a must do, it's the most beautiful skyline I have seen in the world so far!

Amazing view. Hong Kong Skyline is probably one of the most spectacular Skylines in the world. Light show every night is important to see. You also get a stunning view over Hong Kong Skyline from The Peak.
Breathtaking. Place to be in Evenings. All decked up in lights, the concrete jungle shimmers against the Victoria and Nanaimo.
Beautiful place. One of the tallest building in Hong Kong. If I'm right, the bar on the top floor is called as the highest bar in the world! Such a beautiful view of harbor from there.

Amazing Harbour views . It doesn't matter on the time of day or night, sunny or cloudy, the Harbour skyline is beautiful. Every day we went to the Harbour there was something different to see or do and the skyline was a lovely backdrop for photos.

Good sightseeing . Hong Kong is very good city. And if you are in Hong Kong, watch the skyline. That is not very very splendid, but that is a good memory for you. It will start 20:00 , so come here 30 minutes ago because of everywhere is people. Also in the day here is very good. Enjoy the HK ;)
A good place to take photos. There are many places to stop and take photos. There was a lot of construction going on so need to find a clear area. Good spot for a picture at night time
Places to go to see skyline. Cafe Gray Deluxe in the JW Marriott... You might want to call in advance to reserve a table next to a window. Victoria's Peak. And Felix at the Peninsula Hotel.

Still breathtaking. Despite being a former HK resident, I still find the skyline (day or night) breathtaking to behold. Star ferry and Avenue of the Stars are the well known place to get the view, however one of the aspects (in my opinion) is from Stonecutter's Bridge.

Visit . Great views but very costly to visit. The lift was incredibly fast and quiet to get to the top. It took less than half an hour to do the round. It will be more economical to go to the Peak instead as there are more shops and restaurants.

Very beautiful. Though the symphony of lights does not last long, the view from HK island is quite amazing. There is a little promenade between the ferry piers, and there are people who come here to catch fish. There are also quite a number of performers. Very pleasant to walk by or sit in one of the benches in the evening.

A must see, but don't expect too much.. It was one of those things you must do when you visit this amazing city. however i accepted a little bit more in my head. I think all buildings should be made to take part and some do a lot more than others. Its good but has so much more potential.

A disappointing light show. I went with the entire family to watch the light show of eight o'clock. We were all ready for an amazing show, but were absolutely disappointed. The show includes a few green laser beams and that's it. You can just visit the place at night for a nice view of the skyline and the harbor, but don't try to be at the show.

Probably the best skyline in the world. Take the star ferry from wanchai to mainland. be at the ferry port around 7 pm to get the best places for the symphony of lights. Do not go upstairs to the stands - too crowded. Stay below the stands and enjoy the views from there as it is less crowded.

World"s most beatiful Skyline. Whether day or night, Hong Kong has one of the most beautiful skyline in the world. Cheapest way to see it is to take a Star ferry from Central pier in Central to Tsim Sha Tsui or vice versa. One can also walk along the piers to take some great pictures.
View cane be bet. We did the duckling boat ride at sunset and the view from Victoria Harbour of HK skyline was out of this world.
Excellent view of the Hong Kong skyline in the night. We took the Big Bus night tour and enjoyed the view of the HK skyline and Kowloon. Modern buildings with hoardings were very attractive.
One of the best views in the world. There is not much to add to the title: this is simply one of the best views around and especially at night very attractive. Must see when in Hong Kong
Great view. With the right weather it is a great view. We went there when the typhoon alert was given on August 1st, but the ferries still worked and only after that it began raining.
Colorful Skyline!. One of my favorite Skylines in the world. It's very relaxing seeing the buildings with different lights during night and the view of boats passing the Victoria Harbor.

Very impressive. Took a bus to the harbor to view the nightly laser show. Very disappointing. however, the view of the harbor and surrounding buildings was very impressive. Some of the buildings presented a light show of various colors and designs along the entire building.
DON´T MISS IT. Amazing view of the Hong Kong skyline, as well as of the nearby islands and bridges. You simply can´t miss it.

Impressive. If you like urban city skype you will feel instantly connected to this wonderful place 'cause this city's skyline is up there with the best in the world . Worldclass view in a worldclass city

The night time skyline is always very impressive. Unfortunately there are high-rise buildings currently under construction that is obstructing the view of the HK bay area from the Kowloon side of the bay. It prevents you from getting to the avenue of stars and obstructs the view of the 'symphony of lights

Lights in the Nights. one of the best and most famous Skylines of the world. the best time to visit is at from 6pm on, but especially at 8 o'clock in the evening, when lots of powerful green laser lights form the top of the skyscrapers start to flash in the dark night!

Beautiful HK Skyline. Everywhere you look the beautiful Hong Kong skyline will always amaze you. Got to see the laser and lights show at 8pm (which is not worth the hype) but getting to see the skyline from Victoria Harbor is the best.

Victoria Harbor. Every time I have to do the same thing. Go before dark and watch the skyline light up. Hours later I'm still there. You need to hold on the camera. You need to enjoy it with your eyes not your camera
Excellent view. One of the most touristic places to visit. The view of Hong Kong island from Victoria harbor. Its better at night with all the light of the buildings.
Amazing skyline. Best to see at night but the light show was rather disappointing. Was so looking forward for this light show but you wont miss much as it was nothing special.
Highlight of our visit!. We viewed the skyline once from up on Victoria Peak, and then the next night from Tsim Sha Tsui. It was awesome!
Spectacular. From HKI or Kowloon, find yourself a spot to just enjoy the magnificent HK skyline. Ask when the light show will be. It is quite beautiful.

Skyscrapers and billboards. The Hong Kong skyline can be defined as huge skyscrapers and flashing billboards for different shops. In the night the skyline really lights up and with the ocean in the front it looks beautiful.

Amazing even you live here long time. I cannot get enough of the Hong Kong skyline. I live here for more than 10 years and it still looks amazing every time from every angle.Go to the Peak, the Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront on Kowloon side and pick one or more of the many rooftop bars. Drinks are expensive at the bars here but the view is worth it.

Amazing!. This is well worth stopping to see. Truly beautiful! The sound and light show packs a crowd but the city is beautiful without this, avoid the rush and get a more relaxed view of the skyline.

Skyline in the evening!. A must seen in the evening!!!! You must take a boot in the evening and have a look at the Skyline. You can buy a ticket, around 300.- Hong Kong dollar, free drinks and a great Light show, stunning!

Amazing!. Very interesting to reach the highest point of Hong kong with that old tramway.You have to wait a long time for tickets though and avoid the shops upstairs but the view is definately worth it !

Always worth seeing. I've seen the Hong Kong skyline and the 8pm light show a few times now while on business trips but this year came here for a few days with my family while we are on an extended holiday in China. I think that this skyline is an important part of each visit to Hong Kong. OK a bit hot and humid but still exciting.

Only way HKG can grow is UP UP and Above ALL. Been to various big cities in the West , and then you come across this one in the EAST . Its the Manhattan of CHINA , its Hong Kong . Between the wonderful landscapes surrounding the place , we see the tall sky scrappers wrapping the city with the Gizmo Lights . Thats hong kong for you .
Spectacular & Amazing Free Site. Day or Night the city offers spectacular views, you need to be on the Kowloon soon, short trip away from HK, I recommend you take the star ferry.
fine skyline.... but the "lightshow" is a little overrated - it's not really so impressive as everyone keeps mentioning!
Difficult to access. Whilst the view is iconic, access the the Hong Kong harbourside is difficult due to ongoing construction on the waterfront and poor sign posting.

Stunning. This is one of my favourite cities. It has an amazing skyline with all the joys of a busy city. It has a calmness to it too. It has character that amazes you. The heat is the worse thing to cope with though....please look up
Incredible. What a view! Best seen from either the Ozone bar at the Ritz Carlton or from the peak. Also a great view from the star ferry harbour

When clear, the skyline is.... When clear, the skyline is... Amazing. Honk Kong rizes out of the sea and might stun you. Take a car or cab up to the mountain and see for yourself. Be sure to bring a lot of money ; )
A must go in Hong Kong. Best view of city. You no tourist if you not see Hong Kong skyline. My favourite spot where sit and relax.

Amazing sight, both day and night. Buildings that stretch as far as the eye can see, the Hong Kong skyline is truly an amazing sight, both day and night. If you're lucky you can catch a nice breeze during the hot Hong Kong summer. A Symphony of Lights is a must see at night too

From Kowloon waterfront. We arrived just after 8 pm to see the light show on the skyscrapers across the other side of the water. it was most impressive and the large crowd enjoyed the 20 minute spectacle.
Awesome. Try the view in. Night from peak beauty... I would always hike from hku and run on lugard road to get the view before coming back all in 2 hours sweet:-)
One of the best cityscapes around. As the title - I love the HK cityscape. The lightshow is ok for a first timer - not spectacular, but I'm sure kids would enjoy it.

Skyline Gazing. HK skyline is the best icon spot for beginner tourists. It is a splendor view day or night. A perfect sight for picture taking. Victoria Harbor offers all in experience from its surrounding restaurants and food chains, hotels, garden parks, museums and cultural center.Every visit there is worth remembering.

Beautiful by day and night. Just at our harbour front hotel but a lovely place to catch the breeze and watch the ever changing activities of the ferries and boats in Victoria harbour. Beautifully lit at night from the Kowloon side but the symphony of lights is a little disappointing and very crowded at 8 pm

Must see !. This simphony of light is the best view in hongkong definitely dont miss this attraction , this show is a laser show from building to other building is kindalike in singapore but in hongkong is better

Best view in the world. What can I say, it doesn't get better than this. On a clear day after rain at night is spectacular and the best time to take pictures from TST towards Central. During Christmas season it is better to take pictures from Central towards TST with the great Christmas lightings.
Evening is the best. At 8 o clock they got a ten minute light show. Its every evening. Go half an hour earlier to get a nice spot. You out of the wind so its hot. Take water with u.
Hong Kong skyline ❤️. The Hong Kong skyline looks spectacular at the night.Every building is light up so beautifully. The symphony of lights show starts at 8:00PM.

Spectacular architecture . It's quite amazing to see this place how it evolved over the years from a back water island into world famous urban landmark. Especially worth seeing during Symphony of Lights show. Definitely must see while in Hong Kong

Amazing. We saw this by visiting the ozone bar in the ritz Carlton.
Absolutely amazing views. Great memories.
Amazing View!. I spent three years in Hong Kong and the light show every night at 8 was the perfect cap to each day. We had an amazing time as a couple and as a family. Love HK!

Night and day. It was lovely seeing the skyscrapers on the tour bus and tram during the day but it's just something else by night.
Walk along the pier front and be mesmerised by the bright lights everywhere you look and take the tram up to The Peak for unforgettable views of Hong Kong.

Spectacular.... It is a must see especially during night, we took the ferry to reach there and reached around the time of the sound and light show. The show was ok, nothing extraordinary, but the view of the sky line was amazing.The weather was also good- visited in November 2015, so overall enjoyed the visit.

One of the best night views in the world...you should not miss!. If sunny day, go to the Peak and command the best view. If cloudy, just stay at Tsim Sha Tsui or Wanchai along the coast, you can still appreciate the night views at a much closer and clearer distance.

Amazing. Treat yourself to a harbour view room .. I can recommend the higher floors of the Hotel Icon (Club suites are brilliant) and watch the lights at night as this city never sleeps The lights are capticating and we never closed the curtains

A Must See. the true "Pearl of the Orient" - not just viewing from the Victoria habour, but also the peak, or in the restaurants in TST (e.g. Tin Lung Heen, Aqua, those in The One etc.) - the different views always give you breath taking view for the night.It is a must-see if you first time visit HK, or i should say the first 5 times. Personally love to view it from The Peak the most. and make sure you pick a not cloudy night to go as sometimes when the air pollution is really bad - it can block most of the view.In general, winter will be easier to pick a good time.

Another good attraction. Hongkong is a crowded city, but this is one place that is open. The symphony of lights show is just about okay. But i would rather say go there get some pictures clicked , chill and juat enjoy the ambience.
City of Color. Its great place to relax in the specially in the night. I enjoy the color of the lights spectacular lights.

Night time harbour cruise. We were a bit disappointed in the lights spectacular - all of the vision prior to the trip showed an outstanding show but it wasn't as good as the advertising. Drinks (wine, beer and soft drinks) were included in the price and the drinks were cold. Despite our disappointment I would still recommend this excursion.

Very Expansive!. The skyline seems to go on forever! It really is impressive, especially at night when a lot of the buildings are lit up. Every night at 8pm there is a light show of the Hong Kong skyline. You need to be in Kowloon to really see it. I thought the light show was anti-climatic after the skyline itself.
Amazing!. Absolutely amazing. New York City of Asian World. Breathtaking views from Victoria Peak or Tsim Tsha Tsui promenade.
Overlooking night view from Kowloon. We were at Peninisula Hotel and overlooking to Hong Kong night view, spectacular ! Love it ! A must-do while in Hong Kong !

Symphony Of Light. Watching symphony of light from the deck where so amazing. I never watch something like that before and this is really amazing. All the light turn out one by one from each building as so many colors and design u can see a long with the music. So much fun.
from tsim sha tsui ferry. Enjoy the top 3 ranking night view skyline of Hong Kong which is free of charge. Just get off at Tsim Sha Tsui mtr and walk for 10min to ferry or cultural centre.

Excellent experience. It is a wonderful experience to be by the harbor front at Tsim Sha Tsui. Getting there is easiest with the Star Ferry or by MTR. The best time of day in the summer is just after sunset, around 7pm. At 8pm there is a mini light show at the roof tops of some buildings which adds to the fun for some brilliant photographs.

Beautiful and lively. Not much needs to be said as one will obviously check out the skyline when in Hong Kong. Definitely check it out at night from the Victoria Peak or the Victoria Harbour. A staggering number of high rises adorn both sides of the harbour, led by the glorious International Finance Centre and the International Commerce Centre.

Symphony of Lights not to be missed.... Hong Kong Skyline is a must see place. Every day between 8 to 8.15 pm the whole hong kong skyline and kowloon skyline is lit with beautiful colorful lights with the music on the back ground.The best viewing locations of this nightly spectacle are the Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront outside the Hong Kong Cultural Centre, the promenade at Golden Bauhinia Square in Wanchai, and from sightseeing ferries in the Victoria Harbour.(Note: "A Symphony of Lights" is for free public enjoyment. No admission ticket is required.)Spectators can also listen to the music and narration at the harbourfront area by tuning to FM 103.4 MHz (English), FM 106.8 MHz (Cantonese) or FM 107.9 MHz (Putonghua). They can also listen to the same soundtrack via their mobile phones by dialing 35-665-665 (English) or 35-665-668 (Putonghua). The usual service charge for phone call shall apply.
A must see!. Skyline is beautiful no matter how you view it!The night view is a must, either from the peak or the harbor. Be sure to catch the light show too.

Iconic view renowned world over. A must when visiting Hong Kong. Always featured in magazines and articles. Fantastic lights in the evening and scene of the new year's countdown and fireworks display.
Nice to do once. Came down around 6pm and walked around Victoria Harbour until the sun went down. The buildings were then lit up which made for some nice photos. Nice to see but not amazing.
Amazing. Was lucky to stay in the Metropark hotel causeway bay and had the most amazing view from room. Night time especially.

Great lightshow terrible music. Someone once told me how much the customised music for this cost, it was NOT worth it - you can tune in to it on the radio (& online I expect) or hear it from speakers along Kowloonside. Also shouts out which buildings are currently displaying.The light show itself is lovely, often watched.

Hong Kong's Skyline defines the Hong Kong's central space. The Hong Kong skyline is impressive at any time of day as not only Hong Kong island but now the Kowloon side of the harbor is rapidly reaching for the sky. To get a grasp of the space one can take the Harbour Star Ferry (cheap) or one of many harbor tour boats -- including a vintage "Chinese" sailing ship as these travel from one end of the harbour to the other. The Skyline has changed over the past decade, as the Central District on Hong Kong Island has been taken over by architecturally impressive skyscrapers that define the central harbour space -- and are lit with coloured lights and lasers in the evening, as these share in a harbour-wide light show at roughly 8:00 each evening. .

Arguably the greatest skyline in the world. An incredible vista, be it from Kowloon waterfront, the Star Ferry, the Peak, or in glimpses walking around. Always easy to see where you are thanks to iconic buildings such as Bank of China, enlivened by greenery, water and level changes. Incredible.

Absolutely amazing at night seeing the light show!. The Hong Kong Skyline is a must see. So much has changed since my first visit back in 1989, then again 4 years ago! They build and are proud of everything they do. The lights at night are magnificent. Do take time out to check it out by boat or just from a nice restaurant, you'll not regret it

Light show. Well what can I say, we arrived by cruise ship in Hong Kong harbour just in time to see the show, got a good place on deck and waited with baited breath to see this show of lights. It's safe to say if you've never seen buildings light up, well you might enjoy it, if you've been to the USA , this dosnt come close, disappointed to say the least, in fact all of our party of eight, thought it was a waste of time.
Great view from Promenade in TST. Must pass by after 7.30 pm. Great views for pictures. Not very crowded at week days, but avoid visit during Holidays...

Worth to see. Enjoy a walk whatching the Hong Kong skyline is something you cannot skip I'm your trip to there.Day and night offer different experience looking at it, but at night is specially beautiful.You can skip the light and music spectacle everyday at 20:00. Is not a big deal.

Buisness trip. Took time out from a hectic schedule for a relaxing time out in the evening..had a beautiful time watching the light show of various skyscrapers in the Hong Kong's skyline...very nice experience..kept the crowd very interested..

A Spectacular View. The day view from Kowloon corniche is spectacular on the Kowloon side but in the evening it is even more impressive.The advertised light show is poor so no need to rush the evening meal.On special occasions there can be fireworks so plan your tip carefully.Expect lots of people but it's an enjoyable experience.
非常漂亮. 非常漂亮! Very beautiful city with magnificient tall building! We went up to Victoria peak too! Very nice and grand!

Seen it multiple times and still breath taking. Hong Kong has one of the most spectacular Skyline. I love this city and you can enjoy the Skyline day or night. You must go to the bar in Aqua in TST side or the Peak in the Hong Kong island side to get different views.

Very busy, but worth it!. Negatives first:Queue for tram is very longDespite that we bought the fast track tickets for tram, we waited for almost one hour After a certain point the queue becomes a real chaosEntry and exit to / from skyline is extremely busyGetting a good position for taking photos is not easy Positives:Tram as an experience (without taking in mind the chaos) is very unique View of the skyline is really worth itAfter all, the photos you get are priceless Overall, the experience is good, but beware of the very traffic / waiting time.
One of the best. Would have to be one of the best Skylines in the world. Great to see on a ferry or at night. Lights up more on weekend evenings.

Great World Famous View. The Hong Kong Skyline is Super by Day and Totally Awesome by Night.
I believe it is best from TST at Night and it better at 8.00pm during the Light Show.

The place of lights. Harbour view is a must see for every traveller. While the famous light shows start from 8pm onwards and people start their waiting from 6pm onwards but the show has detiorated over the period of time and not worth the wait. You should enjoy the skyline and water.

A favourite thing to do again every time I visit. Whenever I am in Hong Kong I make sure that I catch a ferry at night after dark across from Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui (TST or Kowloon) and look back at the spectacular lights of all the buildings on the island. It always makes me feel like "I'm back" and is well worth the view, not to mention the ferry trip itself is a lot of fun too :-)
Great view. The bay view is amazing, the lights are beautiful while the music is playing. A lot of people stop to watch the lights show.

Fantastic 24/7. The skyline of HongKong is superb for sure, so accessible everywhere and yes no need to go to the Peak. Enjoy it from the hotel, from a rooftop bar, fron a pier. Night is best, morning is great also. From a ferry ok but not needed.
"Very beautiful". A really beautiful skyline especially at night! It is a must see in hongkong.The light and laser show on victoria harbour was a treat to watch.

Amazing skyline!!. A beautiful skyline, best viewed from Victoria Peak although we had a great view from the Kowloon side from outside our hotel (ShangriLa). This rivals the NYC skyline. Unfortunately we missed the lightshow when we were here, although we hear it is amazing. We went out to watch it but it was cancelled on the night we had time to watch!

Stunning urban landscape. Stayed on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong & whether viewing the HK skyline during the day or evening, it is a sight to behold. So many skyscrapers that dot the city it is amazing. A true vertical city.
Incomparable. I was in awe of the Hong Kong skyline, especially when it's lit up at night. Truly stunning and massive. You can't help but be amazed.
Sunset is best. We arrived early well before sunset at avenue of stars for the symphony of light, we found the transition to dark far more interesting than the final Symphonybpart which is ho hum

Victoria Harbor Especially At Night Will Take Your Breath Away!. No visit to Hong Kong is complete without a ride on the Star Ferry to Kowloon and then a walk along the sea wall looking back towards Hong Kong. It's especially breathtaking at night especially watching the light show on the ICC Tower, the city's tallest skyscraper.
best skyline. This skyline rivals New York, very impressive, especially at night. You get the best view from Victoria Peak
Impressive!. Defintely the best thing in Hongkong. The view is amazing, especially try to go to the victoria peak to see the skyline at its best

Impossible to capture just how spectacular this skyline is in a photo!. The hong kong skyline is my favourite from all of the cities I've lived and worked in. Whether you hike up the peak or if you view the skyline from the kowloon side - it's stunning day and night. You can join the crowds on the TST side waiting for the light show at 8pm everyday or you can just admire the view from the Star Ferry. The view at night is truly stunning and amazes me everytime I catch it!
Unmissable. If you are staying in Kowloon you have an advantage. If not just cross by ferry to see the amazing night-cap of Hong Kong.

Great time with HK Skyline.. Should have some drinks at Hong Kong Skyline and see the top of view.Someone said this place you can see the whole of Hong Kong.. But I never go to Victoria Point before.. So, I can't tell which one is the most beautiful view.

Amazing skyline day and night! . Hong Kong is unique for its amazing skyline, as so many skyscrapers built on hills / mountains! At daytime you can see all the buildings shining in broad daylight. In the evening the buildings have lovely night lights and even have unique light and sound shows long central and tsim sha tsui skyline at 7:45 and 9pm. Must see when you're in HK, you won't miss it

stunning and colourful skyline by the harbour.. to see the skyline of HK is a must. BUT make sure you do it in the evening when the lights are all on. AND make sure you do it from the Kowloon Island side. the nicer buildings are on the HongKong Island side, thus one must see it from across the island, which is on the Kowloon side. it is also worth taking the short ferry ride from Kowloon side to HongKong side.

So much life and energy. We absolutely love this harbor both day and night. There is always something happening on the water that's worth watching. The sea breeze is always refreshing. Plus it's impressive regardless which side of the harbor you are on. I love when at night you see the lights of the tall buildings just fading off into the distance. Cool how certian buildings have an impressive lighting display at night, and then add to that when the Symphony of Lights commence each night. Yes it gets crowded the closer you get to the Star Ferry Terminal when watching the Symphony of Lights but there is no way anyone person can block your view, especially when the view is so huge and high. Don't bother watching it from the top of the Peak, because you won't see much of the light show, plus you won't get the narratives and music you get from the Kowloon side.
Wonderful. Beautiful skyline especially on a clear day or clear night! It is still one of Asia's most exciting cities. Do look out for the laser displays.

Spectacular. I don't get to see a lot of skyscrapers, so they amazed me.
I would suggest to check it out at night.
I didn't get to see a lot of the laser show, but just watching the buildings was amazing, could stand there for hours.

Beautiful... was expecting a bit more. Worth watching and seeing the stunning lights over Hong Kong Harbour. Crowds of people gather to watch this and the harbour is alive with boats taking guests to watch the light show whilst on the water. A bit short - expected it to be a bit more exciting.
Must watch. This is the best part of the entire city. You must take a ferry ride to enjoy the skyline. You can also take the Star Ferry to Kowloon at HKD 2 to have a look at the skyline.
Spectacular. The Hong Kong skyline must surely be one of the world's great views. The light show every evening is best viewed from the harbour front or a high vantage point
Day or night it is very impressive. Go see the sound and light show at 8 to see it light up at night. Good views during the day from by the concert hall. Umpressive
Splendid & Spectacular. Spectacular sight to see from both sides. its poster on the wall scene. Go on cruise , you experience the spectacular view. tourist not seen this not visited Hong kong.
Beautiful. Pictures speak for themselves. We spent a full day exploring Kowloon and ended the day just sitting by the ferry and enjoying the view.
Sparkly lights highlight the architecture. Amazing water and city views from all over. William Banzai can show you where to get the best shots.

memorable!. The famous Hong Kong skyline is impressive by day or night (multi-media light show -- from 8:00 to 8:30 p.m. -- narration in English on Monday, Wednesday and Friday). The night-time harbor cruises run about $50 a person and there are hefty cancellation fees, so be sure before you book.
Stunning. Don't miss this. Beautiful skyline, from a peak it's the best, but other points of view offer different perspectives and points to contemplate.

Beautiful. This is one of my favorite skylines in the world! It is absolutely beautiful at night. I definitely recommend checking it out during festivals/holidays especially for Chinese New Years when it is lit up by fireworks
Real nice. From both sides it's really nice. Just take a walk in the evening. You can see the light show and most of the time there is a little breeze from the ocean.
Great view. The nightly symphony of lights show was a little disappointing but the skyline especially at night is well worth the effort to go to the waterfront to see.
My neck is acing. Even if I only spent a few (too few) days in Hong Kong my neck tend to hurt a bit. There are simply so many tall amazing buildings to up on

Sparkling, Tantalizing...breath-taking. It's almost as if you can meditate on it. We did that a few times in mornings, evenings and especially at night. Just open the window from 23rd floor and keep gazing at the harbour and the beautiful skyline. Lit up in the night, adds to the beauty even further.Some other cities that it reminded me of were NYC, Singapore, Mumbai

Amazing. Amazing lighting of the buildings haven't seen this before. It is really good. Awesome view. And when u experience this from the fairy it is more than price less. Too good. Can't express the experience in words for the view of lights triggering. And the best part was that we had this experience at the time of new year. The new year crackers in the sky was breathtaking. And when u are there with your partner to enjoy this you feel really to blessed with the amazing atmosphere and noice and the view. The whole sky is with rockets. To good.

a beautiful view!. A wonderful thing to see in HK.Try and see it from both sides if you have the time.You can get on a boat and see it from the middle, which is amazing.We also saw it from the sky lounge at the sheraton which was also fun. There are also people on the promenade also watching.  Highly recommended to see. Note: there are no fireworks, except on special occasions.
A bucket list item. We did not go to the famed promenade but got equally wonderful sights from near the Clock Tower at night . The "light show" maybe a little over-rated.

Great views and recommend an evening visit. This is worth a visit and we deliberately booked an evening visit so we could experience both daytime and nighttime views. Hong Kong comes alive at night and the scenery just has a better feel/appeal to it with all the neon signs lit up. Anyway still a must do but if you only want to do one of this or Victoria peak I'd recommend the latter
Good !!. It is good to see the beautiful lit up buildings along the side of the water. One can sit at certain recommended places for hours and watch the stars and lights..
Breathtaking. One has to go see the Hong Kong Skyline, the Victoria Peak or else, you have not seen Hong Kong at all. It is so BEAUTIFUL that you don't want to leave your spot (its crowded).

The Iconic Skyline. Take a walk along the harbour front in Hong Kong and gaze at one of the most famous skylines the world. There are not a lot of cities in the world that have a more impressive and colourful skyline.

great for pictures. Hong Kong skyline is like no other. It is very colorful and great background for pictures. I just want to say that the laser show is very disappointing. I would not make it a point to go there just to see the laser shoe.

One of the best night view in the world. Hong Kong is small and that's why all the neons and lights from commercial and household buildings, traffics on land and sea, are fully packed together. Come on a cool Autume night and enjoy the view. Both sides of harbour or on the Star ferry.

About 15 years ago, I studied at a university in East Asia..... About 15 years ago, I studied at the "school of Management" at the university "Asia Institute of Management" in Bangkok/ Thailand.I liked to travel some days to Hongkong when I flied home to Germany, I took a flight from Bangkok to Hongkong and then from Hongkong to Frankfurt/ Germany.Hongkong is definitely one of the most fascinating cities in the world. I enjoyed my stays in Hongkong, though Hongkong is very expensive, and though the climate in Hongkong can be very, very humid!I visited the university in Hongkong, and many places in the city of Hongkong.One of the most interesting things you MUST visit in Hongkong is the view over its skyline! You won't regret it! It's really overwhelming.I visited Hongkong in all seasons, I recommend you not to go there in summer, the climate be extremely humid in summer (because of the evaporization of the water in the Sea).

must see, go at dusk to see the lights come on. The skyline is amazing, especially at night. The most interesting time to go is when it is just starting to get dark so you can see all the buildings slowly switch on their respective light shows.

The tallest building in Hong Kong. From Sky 100 we can see the beautiful city of Hong Kong to the mountain area. It is a very beautiful and amazing to see office buildings and apartment buildings from there.

Beautiful view - worth even if you miss the light show. Every night at 8pm the skyline has a synchronized show - it's worth seeing! Best of all it's free. You definitely don't need to take a cruise to get a great view. Even if you miss the show, swing by after dinner to take it all in

Much Ado about of not so great.... Well I didnt really enjoyed may be because of Cloudy Sky or may be I like the Singapore Skyline better for some reason. But its good if you see at night from a level like the Madam Tussaud Museum. But shouldn't miss.
Stunning. Great by day stunning at night. Light show everyday at 8PM. Best viewed from a harbor cruise or Kowloon waterfront.

Should be a bucket list item for everyone. Find a roof deck at twilight and enjoy. However, expect to pay through the noise for the privilege ($20 US for a gin and tonic). We chose the WooLooMooLoo roof deck in CWB

Not a bad experience, worth to have a llok. It's really a great place to view Hong Kong at 360 degree! There is a cafe that you can chill out and relax a bit to enjoy the view. They also offer a ticket with 2 admission in a day so that you can see the day view and night view!

Hon Kong iconic sky line. The stunning sky line is the iconic thing for Hong Kong people. In Singapore the water dance shows create a story with lights every weekend. But in Hong Kong it is the light beams and showing everyday. It starts at 8pm and daily and showing round about 30 minutes except the cloudy day.You cannot see the light beams when it is too cloudy.
Extraordinary, never forget. Hong Kong skyline is so signature it touched my soul. Best view is from The Peak, ideally try to catch a time close to sunset ->WIN.

My Favourite City!. The Hong Kong skyline is mt favourite city view in the whole world. It is dazzling and one an evening when the buildings aren't hidden by smog or clouds, the lights are so inspiring! I love watching them evening light show.

A must visit. what is a trip to hongkong without visiting the famed famous city skyline which show up almost in all movie films ?enjoy the breeze , see the city light dancing in the brighten sky. it is amazing how man-made lights brighten up the sky with so much intensity.

A bit disappointing :-( . I read that the Symphony of lights is the largest permanent light and sound show in the world (by Guinness records) however, living in Dubai and comparing it with the Dubai Fountain, well we ended up a bit disappointed. First of all we couldn't hear any sound so, if it's synchronize with the lights it's difficult to tell... For us it was a few buildings changing colors! To reach here you take MTR East Tsim Sha Shui station exit J and follow the Avenue of the starts signals.
Dayoff passtime!!!!. Every holidays i would rather sitback and relax especially afternoon time till evenin time...watchin the amazing lighting views at night time at around 8pm...so relaxing...,
Holiday in Hongkong. The tram to reach Victoria Peak is a ride must fort all visitors.On reaching the top one can get a panaromic view of Honkong n Kawloon.Nice place to buy souvenirs for the family.

Worth a trip. i would recommend seeing it in the day and night - they have completely different feels to them.. Pretty sure there is a weekly light show in the evenings too which i missed but found out when i'd left! would recommend a bar or restaurant with a skyline view as it is impressive.

one of the best. as far as city lights go, I think HK is one of the best if not the best that I have seen when compared to the other places I have been to: Tokyo, Los Angeles, New York, Madrid, San Francisco

Maybe I'm a Little Jaded. It was an OK show. We had some decent seats at the harbor by where the buslines begin. It's just... you have the entire breath-taking skyline. And the lightshow uses three or four buildings.

Check the sky line from both sides.. Looking at the HK skyline from Kowloon Island is definitely nicer than looking at it from Hong Kong Island.
There are a lot of free places such as IFC roof top where you can have a glimpse of Kowloon Island, or East TST to see HK island!
Amazing view. Hongkong is the city with the most building I've ever visited. it's like an a sea of buildings. Light show at 8PM don't miss it

Symphony of lights - overrated. The Hong Kong Skyline is always stunning and will give you the "City Feels". But maybe I put so much expectation on the Symphony of Lights. The lights of the buildings on the Central side are just blinking in synch with the music you will hear on the Kowloon side. But I didn't get a chance to watch it on the Central Harbor. It's free anyways so I don't have much to complain. Just be there (Victoria Harbor) at 7:00PM so you could pick a seat you want. Show starts at 8:00PM.

Gorgeous skyline. Hong Kong has a lovely skyline by day but its even better by night, all lit up its spectacular. There is a light show on every night at 8pm, however I didnt find this that good as the lights were that noticeable up in the sky. The sky line alone is spectacular without the light show

Amazing. It is amazing to see the skyline from any part of hongkong but the best place I felt was to see it from Bohenia square were in the evenings there is a light and sound show where the lights are synced with music to highlight the skyline. It's a good view.

Amazing views!!. The skyline from the ferry and the harbor are totally breath taking with a beautiful range of mountains behind and the skyscrapers seen even on the hills with the sea beneath is one of very few countries can offer. The best views can be seen from Tsim Sha Sui water front and is definitely a delight to watch all the colorful buildings with a fantastic skyline. However we missed the symphony of lights.

Stunning buildings. The Symphony of Lights shown each evening highlights the Hong Kong Skyline. The laser show is not too impressive on a cloudy evening, but the view of the HK skyscrapers from the Kowloon waterfront is very impressive.

Very beautiful. Went to visit and watch the Symphony of Lights. Waited for 20 mins from 8 pm (the scheduled time) but could not get to watch much because it was cloudy. But was a beautiful site from the Victoria Harbor.

View not to be missed. In a short walking disctance from Holiday Inn Golden Mile, you can reach to the Pier are which gives a wonderful night view of the Hong Kong Skyline, one shouldnt miss if you are in that area.
Beautiful skyline at dusk. We enjoyed watching the skyline light up. However, the 8:00 pm light show was not worth the energy it took to deal with the crowds.
Beautiful views from The Harbour Grand . So relaxing to look out at the Harbour both day and night. Never got sick of these views - an amazing city, from Hong Kong Island.

Loved the skyline. The HK skyline is beautiful. But the Symphony of Lights was not worth the 45 minutes we spent -- 30 minutes waiting then the show was only 15 minutes long. We could not even hear the music very well. There was a lot of constructions going on at the HK Space museum that blocked the view.

Underwhelming. I don't get why HK skyline and its light show was so hyped about. The buildings are not arranged in an aesthetically pleasing manner, and when the Symphony of Lights started, we had difficulty figuring out what we were supposed to be watching. Being from Singapore, I would point out that this is seriously underwhelming compared to Marina Bay's skyline.

perfect!. I visited during the new year. it was crowded, of course, but there was a happy, warm, cozy atmosphere in the air.
everyone was so excited during the countdown. but for first-time visitors, your best bet going there is that you arrive at least before 10 pm at the new year as the crowds are HUGE.
Most amazing thing. The hongkong skyline is one of the most amazing things that one should look forward to. Take the 45 minutes long ferry and enjoy the scenic beauty

Light Show was meh..... Went to see the Hong Kong Skyline Lightshow. Well its nice to see the lights and all, but the show is a major disappointment. We watch for a couple of minutes and left. Really wanted to tell the late comers running to the viewing spots to chill and take their time.

What happened to the famous Symphony of Lights at Victoria Harbour?. It was disappointing indeed! As we looked forward so much to the Symphony of Lights display, we arrived there early in order not to miss it. We waited till 8pm, only to find 2 weak and miserable green laser beams on top 2 buildings. What happened to the rest of the buildings?!!!We checked with a lady who happened to be a local tour guide. She told us that the Symphony of Lights is no longer what it used to be. The owners of the skyscrapers are no longer participating in 'laser beaming'. What a pity?!!!

So Great!. The sky line is impressive both in the day and night. The buildings give quite a busy and graphic light show at night. We were in Kowloon so had a spectacular distant view of many buildings. There is a laser light show every night at dusk. All in all, just really WOW!
Fantastic views. We were lucky to be there in a clear night. Fabulous views and they have a great bar so you can have a drink and take in the view. Buy tickets online
Kowloon walk. Take the subway to Kowloon for a walk in the kowloon cultural district; Very nice views at night (see pic)
One of the most beautiful skylines in the world. The skyline is amazing. There's a laser light show every night at 8pm. The best views are from the Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront.

Disappointing Symphony of Lights Show. My friends and I made sure to catch the Symphony of Lights at the Victoria Harbor on our second night in Hong Kong. We were prepared to be dazzled. However, that moment didn't happen.
