Nowhere quite like it. In all honesty, the Hong Kong skyline is like a scene from a futuristic movie no matter where you view it from... Victoria Peak, Tsim Sha Tsui, Star Ferry... it always takes your breath away... particularly when it's illuminated at night.

Truly beautiful and Must See. Views from TST is fantastic but can also be experienced on Star Ferry ( and also the Star Ferry harbour tour).
For me, this is THE best skyline in the world

Beautiful view!. I came here today by peak tram from causeway bay. You need to change at central and then from central, you walk to the tram stop which is about 7 minutes walk from the station. At the tram station, there were about 300-500 people waiting to catch the tram and some people also waiting to buy tickets. We bought a combo ticket at the tram station which included admission into madam Tussaud, the sky tower and return tram tickets $320 HK approximately.After buying the combo tickets, you get to skip some of the queue a little bit but you still have to wait about 20 minutes before getting on the tram. The tram ride is around 5 minutes or so long. Once you get to the top, you walk through to an indoor markets which sells souvenirs and rubbish like that. There are also some food outlets, littleRestaurants and takeaway stores. arrived at the peak building at 5:30pm.I then spent about 40 minutes in madam tussauds which I thought was better than the Sydney one. Then I made my way up and had a quick meal on the 5th floor. After that I went up the escalators all the way to the top floor. By the time I got to rhe top, it was 6:40pm which was good because it was still daylight. I was able to take a professional daylight photo and also another night time photo at 7:30. From 6:30-7:30 I watched the sunset so I think this is a good time to go because you get to see both views during the day and night. It started to get quite crowded with people pushing each other trying to get photo of the view. I finally the sky tower building at around 8:30 and joined the queue to get onto the tram. The wait for the tram was 30 minutes long.The views were beautiful and spectacular. Highly recommend you go and go at 6:30pm to watch the sunset and see the view during the day and at night.

8pm Evening Light Show. Undoubtably one of the most magnificent skylines in the world, Hong Kong lights up at night. Don't miss the night show held every evening at 8pm, best viewed from Kowloon, between the Star Ferry Terminal and the HK Art Museum.

Many Great Views. Our recent trip to HK to visit family up there for work allowed us to find a couple of great spots to view the magnificent Victoria Harbour and HK Skyline. Three places I would recommend outside of the normal tourist haunts are as follows:1. Bowen Road: Used by most locals as a walking/jogging track. No cars whilst we were on this 5-6km stretch high on the hill. We got access off Kennedy Road. Great views of HK and a level and easy walk once you get up to it.2. Woolloomooloo Open Air Bar on the 32nd floor ofThe Hennessy Building around Wan Chai/Causeway Bay Area. Very little advertising, but locals know it. Great views and good cocktails. Beware the rain as not much cover available. There was s a steak house by the same name in this building also. We just went to the bar.3. Cafe Gray Deluxe in the Upper House Hotel. Floor 42. A luxurious way to take in the harbour and skyline. We just St went for drinks nos and they allowed us to book a table. Beautiful staff.Enjoy the views of HK.

Dazzling at night from the ferry. The view of Hong Kong from the Star ferry at any time of the day is quite a sight, however at night it is dazzling. Have dinner on either side of the city and take the ferry back. There is a laser light show that operates nightly after about 8.30. while this isn't spectacular it certainly adds to the atmosphere. use your train octopus card for all ferry rides as well.
Great place to view the city. Great vista point to see the light display of Hong Kong and the buildings of Hong Kong island. Great place to meet other travels too.

Hong Kong Skyline. The view of the Hong Kong Skyline is just breathtaking. On a clear night you you can see the city all lit up in its brilliant colors. A ride on the ferry is enchanting with a variety of colors lighting up the skyline. Went on both sides of the harbor to view the skyline and it was well worth it.

Very nice view. One must do in HK. One thing is to watch pictures and yet another to be on the peak and enonjoy the skyline. I loved the combination of sea and all those tall colored buildings. Just have to bear with those queues to get on the peak.

Capture it from Kowloon side and ride the Star Ferry. If you want the leveled skyline view and not form the Peak then do it from Tsim Sha Tsui harborfront or ride the Star Ferry or stay at a hotel facing the harbor. Definitely a mustsee especially at night or around Christmas and Chinese New Year when the buildings are decorated with festive lights. From Island side you can see the Ritz Carlton lit up with a light show also. Beware of overcast days when the clouds cover the peak and some of top of buildings.

Great View, carefull of your belongings. Its overall great, but this is not our first time watching the skyline. you can see from both end, and it still quite fun.Becareful of your belongings, as many people and its pack, many pickpocket here (warning from security officer)
Skyline by night. I highly recommand taking an evening boat trip in Victoria harbour to dive into hundred different types of lights showing the skyline...

visual experience. it is a amazing visual treat no matter which side of HK you are standingthe red color boats are also great fun to see and kids really enjoyed the lights and colors used to create a great tourism spot out of nothinghats off:)
Beautiful!. The Hong Kong Skyline is just amazing. Besides the night view, even the day view is wonderful. Best photo opts for tourists!

One of the most amazing skylines. It probably beats every skyline I've seen. And I've seen NYC, Dubai and many more. Nothing comes close to the dramatic effect of the mountains around the skyscrapers on Hong Kong island. Best viewed from promenade on Kowloon side. Truly amazing, day or night.
Mesmerising. Nice place to relax after a day of hectic shopping! I prefer to admire the HK skyline in the later parts of the year when temperature is a lot lower.
Avoid Symphony of lights. The symphony of lights is a bit of let down. Just go any evening and take pictures. The show is avoidable.

depends on the miserable weather. If the weather is good, thats great; after raining is PERFECT!
If the sky is grey during the day, you can hardly see the beautiful view.
Iconic. Hong Kong skyline aline us with the visit. It varies with you location, weather from the peak, the harbour or many of the high rise.

Stunning skyline. Hong Kongs skyline is beautiful in the day. But during the night when it's all lit up its truly stunning. Unless you have a very clear, dark cloudless night the light show is not worth hanging around for.

World Class Skyline. Hong Kong walks circles around any other city I have been to, when it comes to making its skyline attractive at night. Buildings seem to coordinate their lighting. It is a beautiful sight - especially during the laser shows across the harbour.
Worldclass view. Hk skyline is one of a kind. The best view is from the TST harbour side, so that you can have a full view to the HK island, just as shown in postcard

Best Skyline in the World. We all have seen pictures or traveled around the world and have experienced beautiful views of skyline, but the Hong Kong Skyline is unique and breath taken, you will feel that you are in a movie.I will recommend to you to go in the day to Victoria Harbour and take pictures of the skyline during the day with a beautiful sunny day.But at night is when is the Best. At 8:00 pm you have to be at Victoria Harbour to experience for 15 minutes the music and some laser exchange between Hong Kong Island and Kowloom . The best is to see the Skyline all the buildings with lights, some the lights will change of different colors and others will show different images.After this experience you will have a very high standard for any other city skyline.
Stunning!. Almost everyone who's visited Hong Kong has found the city's skyline absolutely stunning and why wouldn't they? It's breath taking!
Hong Kong Skyline is beautiful day and night. You can watch Symphony of Light which is very cool to see at night. Free of charge. Available every day starting 8pm. 15 mins duration.

Perfect night time view. We visited the Hong Kong Skyline at night and were not disappointed.
The magical lights and beautiful views were all worth the trek.
Make sure you visit!
Amazing view !. Must to see. The view is really amazing. Best time is after sunset. Walk along the promenade is very pleasant and romantic.
Beautiful view. The skyline is best viewed at night either from the peak or even better on a boat trip along the river.

Beautiful skyline at night. Hong Kong is one of those places you've heard about all your life and now there it is in front of you! It was overcast earlier in the day but it cleared and the skyline comes to life in the evening with all the buildings lit up. Very spectacular.

STUNNING VIEW BEST ENJOYED OVER A COCKTAIL OT TWO. the view is better from Kowloon side and two places have fantastic views: The Intercontinental Hotel Lobby Bar and the bar on the top floor ( Felix ) of the Peninsula Hotel ( make sure to visit the male toilet too ). For HK side; nothing beats the balcony of the China Club or Sevva at the Prince's Building ( top floor with open terraces )....
Amazing View. Really enjoyed the symphony light show at night ... Evening time is very pleasant and lovely crowd ...

Light Show. There was a light show at 8pm each evening but we didn't find a good place to view it from. We viewed from the front of the hotel. I think if you were over on the city side it would have been better

Nice but disappointing as it wasn't spectacular. I'd heard so much and was looking so forward to this, but it just didn't match the lead up reviews. Sure it was nice, sure lights went on and off and lasers moved around. But it was really just so-so to my family. We've seen spectacular light shows before and this one in June 2016 just didn't make the grade.It was also a little painful having to listen to the promotional talk and advertising re the show and participants. I understand they want some promotion but I wasn't expecting that.

Solely for Majnland Chinese (meaning China). Very low quality, not a performance with any class.Packed with non-civilised tourists from China, yelling, smoking, pushing, while they might be having their orange right next to you.If you wanna get a feel of Shanghai, this is a perfect place

Nice skyline. . The skyline of Hongkong is nice. Too much it was a cloudy night with period rain. There's a light show at 8pm. Personally, its a bit too long and too many buildings involved that there's a bit of difficulty following it. Its also extremely crowded esp. at the traffic lights heading towards the venue.

Best seen at night. The skyline is sensational during the day but really comes alive at night.
Do yourself a favour and take a Star Ferry ride at night. Watch the lazer light show from the Kowloon side or even take a couple of ferry rides

Spectacular. Hong Kong easily has to be the best in the world. The great thing about it is it can viewed from so many different locations. Don't must the views from Victoria Peak or Kowloon, but also try to find a roof top bar to get a different perspective. IFC2 has a decent observation floor also.
Pearl of the Orient. This serves as the perfect backdrop for our pre-wedding pictures. Which is especially gorgeous at night.

Lights of the city. We were staying on the opposite side of the harbour to the city. We walked down to the harbour at 7.30 pm to see the city lights. At 8 pm a light show was put on for about 10mins. The lights were pretty. Lasers also put lights on the buildings on the opposite side

Never fails to amaze. In my opinion, Hong Kong has one of the most beautiful waterfronts in the world. Even unlit in the daytime, the scale of the architecture is impressive and the backdrop of the Peak from the Kowloon side makes it even more stunning. The nightly light show is a terrific (and free!) diversion for travelers.

Light Entertainment . It is just a light show and landscape from the other side of the city. If you are at Kowloon then walk down to the art museum and from there you can see the view from Hong Kong Island.The light show will start at 8pm and it will last for only 10 minutes. To me, the light show is just ordinary, but atmosphere is relax with the windy. You can else enjoy the youth music band after the show. There are number of little group perform every night.
Gathering of beauty. The skyline is wonderful. The buildings all lit up with colorful lights is a beautiful sight to see.

Pretty but very crowded. I had been trying to find the time to see the laser show on the skyline from the Kowloon side for several years and I finally got the chance. The lasers were very pretty and they were closely synchronized to the music. I would suggest that if you want to have a clear photo of the skyline at night to get there early and find a spot along the railing. Once it gets close to show time the area becomes very crowded making photo taking much more difficult.

Amazing skyline views. The view from the Kowloon side facing the HK city skyline is a must see, both during the day and again at night. The actual 8pm laser show is not a big deal and don't worry if you miss it... it's just a few lasers and some music for 10+ minutes. The nearby Star Ferry port is also a great way to see the skyline.

Symphony of lights. This is one of must to see in HK, it is free and it is every evening at 8 oclock. It looks really very nice and it is very easy to find...only walking distance from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station

Eugene Chia . Modern feng shui compliant skyscraper
Magnificent view especially the Symphony of Lights every night 8pm
Best view is from Tsim Sha Tsui harbour
Amazing Spectacle. We came to see this skyline and we were not disappointed. It is so beautiful! Worth checking out despite the exorbitant prices of Hong Kong.
hongkong skyline. It's nice when you're riding a ferry during at night were you can see the beautiful light from the harbor and the sky hight building like ifc tower four season hotel and grand hyatt

Peaceful . Looking at the harbour from the Kowloon side, it is of course amazing and pretty. However if you go to HK island, then take the train/tram to Kennedy Town, there is a lovely promenade there that is usually quiet. The view is a little broader and less 'in your face'.

Tradation and Trendy. The best place to enjoy Hong Kong Skyline is either in Oriental Tower or in Ferry along the river. When you going in Ferry you can enjoy both traditional and trendy is what you can enjoy w.r.t Hong Kong Skyline.

Must view. The one thing that comes for free in a costly city like HK is the skyline, which gets lit up every night.The Sound and Light Show, called Symphony of Lights plays out every night from 8 pm. The show can be seen from both sides, i.e. at the TST promenade on Kowloon Island and on the HK Island from HK observation Wheel and various other points.The commentary for the show is available online and well as on FM radio every evening.A Very good way to enjoy the show would be through the various ferries in the harbor, which do undertake such trips to coincide with the show.

Excellent Views!. The views of all the buildings at night were amazing. We saw the light show from one of the bay cruises which was very cool. It's nice to see both sides and the different lights and buildings. Well worth seeing, even if you don't take a harbor cruise.

Like no other skyline in the world!. Definitely go for the 8:00 pm light show. I viewed it from Kowloon side looking towards Hong Kong Island. Show takes about 14 minutes , but is unmissable and must be done, even if like me you are there for a one night stopover.
Mezmerizing View. The Hong Kong Skyline should be on everyone's bucket list. Truly Mesmerizing. Get a drink or have dinner looking out over the bay at night.
amazing. the hong kong skyline is really special.always lit up..colorful and inviting.it is perfect to see especially from the sea..also from above the view is awesome.
Must to see. Night light and sound show is marvelous. Must be seen. It starts at 8PM and last ~15-20 mins. The best place to watch is from Victoria harbor.
Beautiful view. Went up to the peak to see the view of the city. Would highly recommend taking the bus as you can enjoy the view of the city as you descend down to the city from the peak.

Stunning Skyline but Symphony of Lights a little disappointing. We were told not to miss the Symphony of lights show so we got a spot near the Avenue of Stars. Unfortunately it was a little disappointing. We have since found out that in a effort to be green and cut costs many of the building are no longer taking part so there are lots of gaps in the show. Having said that it is free and not on for long so worth having a look. The Skyline is impressive at any time of day.
Dazzling. A wonderful view especially at night. Though I went there in the early afternoon, I was still mesmerized with the views of the many tall buildings Hongkong has
TST & Central. It was lovely , impressive and beautiful. Sightseeing with Star Ferry was great. The sea breeze & lovely sun made our day.
Impressive. Magnificent view. Excellent vantage points. Buildings are lit up nice and some even have informative LED displays on the buildings themselves.

Ms Chung. The best skyline in the world on a clear day. Best view is to take a ride on the Star Ferry, or take the Peak Tram to the Victoria Peak. Also can take a walk along the Tsimshatsui Promenade or along the waterfront on Hong Kong side looking across the harbour. There is a 20 minute laser light show from 8:00 pm every night across the harbour. From mid Nov to mid January the Christmas lightings on both sides of the harbour is spectacular.
An amazing view.. Go to the Peak and have a look at the City. Ideal time would be at dusk when the city lights are turned on.
Symphony of Lights. Start at 8pm sharp every day and on different days there will be different language that is being broadcastat the harbour. English, Mandarin and Cantonese.
Wow and double wow.. How many neon signs can one city have. Its special with the neon lights and friendly people. Easy to get around and time seems to be endless.

The best skyline in the world..... Go to Kowloon by ferry a see the Hong Kong skyline by night.
It is truly unbelievable.Combine taking the Star ferry and seeing the skyline.

A View you can't miss.... From Kowloon there is an impressive view you cannot miss during your visit to Hong Kong: Hong Kong Island Skyline at dusk and early night. Additionally, the busy traffic on the Victoria Harbor gives you a bonus for your walk along the seashore...
Bright lights. The city was stunning as a star! Enjoyed every sightseeings & every glimpse of the places. Worth to see!
Buildings are all lit up like a light show!. Buildings are all lit up like a light show! All across Hong Kong Island is all buildings and signages and lightings!
One of the best in the world. The skyline is so good! I can't get enough of it. There are many ways to view it. From the peak, ferry or any rooftop bar.
Colourful, lots of ships and ferries to see. Colourful,fantastic view. Viewed from West Kowloon near the Star Ferry Terminal. There is a viewing area at the public pontoons. A must see vista
Awesome light show nightly. It's something that you should do while in Hong Kong along with the Bruce lee statue. There is a Starbucks on the Kowloon side where you can sit with coffee and enjoy.

Disappointed in the light show.. We waited 1 and 1/2 hours. When the light show was over we felt that it was not that great! I said to my husband "that's it" Maybe it was where we were sitting because we only saw one side of the skyline. We have seen better Christmas lights on houses with the music and light show. I thought it was just as good to see the lights on the building after the light show with a lot less people.
Breathtaking. The skyline from the Kowloon side is much better that the other side. And it was very nice in the evening

Beautiful night skyline. Avenue of the stars is the place to be for the 8pm light show. The light show itself is a bit disappointing but just to be on the avenue at night to see the gorgeous night skyline is quite spectacular with or without the light show!
Beautiful!. The skyline of Hong Kong is absolutely beautiful- shimmering lights with a glassy bay in the back ground. I've only been home 4 days and I miss the city already.

Colourful!. One of the most colourful skylines in the world.
It is very accessible and the locals also enjoy sitting back and looking at the lights!

Symphony of lights. At 8pm the "Symphony of Lights" starts and lasts for about 15 minutes. It looks so nice, make sure you don't miss it.
We were on the Hong Kong Island side, people tell us it looks even better from the Kowloon side.
Always a beautiful view. Take a walk along the old harbour near the ferry to see the hong kong skyline (at least one of the many views).

Beautiful. My husband and I visited Hong Kong in June 2016. The skyline was beautiful. The best views were from the peak and from the promenade on the Kowloon side. The skyline was amazing at night and during the light show at 8pm.

Beautiful colourful skyline. Been to hong kong a few times and always mesmerized by the awesome landscape that the buildings create at night. The different colours light up the harbour sky line wonderfully. 8pm is the light show with music, get to the raised area by the clock tower for a great view and good selfie:)

go more than once. over the course of two weekends we saw it from 3 great spots - on the waterfront, from the lounge of the intercontinental and from the sheraton skylounge. All on the kowloon side - we did get to the island side, but the view isn't as impressive. Seeing it from a variety of spots was great, whilst the music and light show wasn't impressive, seeing it from indoors after wasn't disappointing, it just let us watch and enjoy.

Hong Kong makes advertising beautiful. Face it, you can't escape advertising. Here in Hong Kong they have embraced it and it makes for amazing view of the harbour.Much too my surprise I find it mesmerizing and beautiful. It just gives Hong Kong something special.Hong Kong might just become my favourite Asian city.

Light show. We went last night and were disappointed. We had seen the light show a few years ago and were blown away.However last night it was a fizzer,we gave up after about 20 mins.Nothing like the show we raved about a few years ago.What is going on ?
Beautiful. The skyline is beautiful, it is worth seeing. There will be light show every night so don't miss out on that.
beautiful skyline. Was able to view the skyline while on a ferry back from Macao. Weather was not cooperating but was able to see why this an attraction.
Whats not to Love?. The Hong Kong Skyline is one of my favorite, especially at night. The buildings are always lit up and very pretty.
Very colourful. We visited the Hong kong Skyline every evening whilst on holiday. It was spectacular and a place not to be missed.

Beautiful skyline of Hong Kong. Hong Kong was a very interesting experience! It was the ending of my tour so I had mixed emotions when arriving. However, we happened to be at the skyline area for the light show that happens a few days of the week in English. It was truly enjoyable. Get there early so that you have good views.

After I took the video of the lazer show I got a cold as well.... I caught a cold and was it worth it I don't know, but when it start I could see that no one was leaving the scene, and the children seemed enjoying filming as well, so I carried on filming until it finished, the zic zac white of BOC, the tricolour or even seven colours on that higher building on the left was even better, but this was the second time, as a poet I thought I need to express a bit more with a few lines, but the next morning I thought I am not bother.

Beautiful skyline, underwhelming light show. The skyline is beautiful at all times of day. We stayed at the Shangri-la Kowloon and had beautiful views all day and night. We headed to the anticipated light show at 8pm. Construction of a new building prohibited us from seeing show from our room. We walked not far behind the cultural center to see the show. Crowds were plenty. The show was less than stellar. Beams of lights to music not much to see. A number of people left mid show. Thought there would be a major light show. It was not. Left disappointed but still enjoyed the views and beautiful pictures we took. Don't rush to see the show. There's not much to see. Few beams of light in air, accompanied music and lights on buildings. Most were disappointed. Just enjoy the views at day and night. Don't break your neck to see show. If you happen to see it, great. If not, not a big miss. View from Kowloon to hear music.
Beautiful Skyline. Hong Kong is so small it would be hard to miss the skyline. But it is definitely something worth seeing. What is even better is taking a ferry in the harbor to view both sides.

Amazing views. When Visiting Hong Kong the View is amazing from any location! A good way to view is from one of the many shopping malls, a lot of them have outside areas overlooking the amazing views.

Memorable view. Everything you think of HK can be captured by this magnificent view. Its enterprise, its growth, its position as one of the great cities of the world are all apparent in this simple snapshot. In my humble opinion, it is one of the best skylines ever.

Impressive Skyline. Walked down from our hotel, the Intercontinental Grand on Modi Road to the Kowloon Waterfront from where we had a superb view of the Hong Kong Skyline. We visited at night to be greeted by a riot of colors across the bay. The sight is impressive and not to be missed if you are staying near the waterfront.

Amazing sight, skip the laser show though... Jaw dropping. I grew up in Niagara Falls and the view of Victoria Harbor skyline at night - esp. from Kowloon/TST side looking at the Island ranks right up there in terms of sheer tour de force visual experiences...Pictures worth a thousand words here - but even seeing all the photos and videos on-line did not do justice to this amazing view... one of the true sights of a lifetime..that said - the 8:00 pm laser light show was pretty much a bust IMHO...we walked down there in the rain, and the fact that even though it was raining thousands (mostly young people) turned out for the show really got my hopes up... 15 minutes into it though, we were still wating for the show to start when the music stopped and the announcement came over the PA... "Thanks for attending.."Huh? maybe this is better in other weather, but um,,, I would just go back at 8:30 when the crowd thins out and you can take pictures right at the railing..
Best in the world. Ny? Dull. Paris? Eh. Noplace beats HK. Catch the 8pm light show from Kowlook's waterfront. Or, the star ferry anytime of day

Beautiful light show!. At 8 PM the skyline lights up with a beautiful light show. I love the pictures we took from our hotel the Grand Stanford in Tsim Sha Tsui. If you stay there the harbor view is spectacular.

Free show every night at eight o'clock. The lights on the building put on a great show of computer controlled changing patterns. There is also accompanying music from near the Star Ferry terminal on Kowloon side.

Just like the pictures!. Our hotel faced the harbor so we had a free "postcard" view of the city at night every night! The light show is great fun. The skyline is amazing ... anyone can get terrific photos of the skyline at night - it DOES look like all of the photos you have seen. Lights are dynamic and endlessly fascinating! City views like no other!

Great view but cause air pollution. For view, it is a great view to see the tall building and their light during night. However, it also the cause of causing so many polluted air trapped in the city and cause maze sometimes.

Perfect picturesque of Hongkong. Attractive in the morning and dashing at night. We stayed near this area so everytime we go out or go home, we make sure that we would pass by the Skyline. It's quite crowded at night but we enjoyed everything around. There are other museums and attractions just next to Skyline.
Breathtaking. It is still my favourite skyline in the world, after travelling all over the place. Really, go all in and see for yourself!

Picturesque. It is definitely a must see especially at night. Our hotel is in Tsim Sha Tsui and its a few meters away from the Victoria Harbor. You may dine at restaurants nearby and find yourself taking selfie of the skyline.
One of the World's Great Skylines!. The Hong Kong Skyline is staggeringly beautiful. There are so many beautiful and interesting buildings. Really loved it in the daylight and especially at night.
You have to go at night!. So amazing to see the light show at night! I've never seen anything like it! Very kitschy but so much fun!

Great views. HK's skyline is just amazing. wherever you are, you can enjoy great views across the bay and, most of the buildings have some restaurants or cafe with great terraces that offer views across the town.
Great laser light show daily. Take the ferry over from Central to Kowloon in the evening and watch the laser light show along Hong Kong's own version of Hollywood walk of stars.
Excellent light show. This light show we saw from a boat on Victoria Harbour and it was just beautiful. The colours and precision were first class.
Spectacular View at Night. Weather you simply enjoy the light or a photography freak, the view is just amazing. HK has been heavily populated by skyscraper and its light is an attraction by itself.

Hong Kong Skyline at Night. We have seen a few city light shows, and this one is one of the better to see. I'd suggest finding a bar/restaurant on a higher floor of a building on the Hong Kong island side to watch this show. It was was a nice added perk for out dinner.

The view is amazing.. It's a scenic view that is worth checking out if you're in the area. Perfect view, the smell of the sea breeze is so calming. Take a walk around the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade and enjoy the view.

From my. Hotel in Kowloon I took a walk in the evening, passed the ferry terminal and ended up at Pier 13, live music, beer on tap from a small stand and a view to die for !!! Hongkong as tourist seldom see it.
Nice view. Going at night to view the skyline is a good experience. Lots of activities to watch apart from buildings as well.

Disappointed Harbour light show. We boarded our boat for the skyline light show. I'm not sure hat happened that night but only a few buildings lit up. Met several people and the consensus was that the experience wasn't up to par.

Best skyline in the world.. The view from Victoria Peak at night is awesome, spectactular, inspiring...whatever superlative you wish...beats, NYC, SFO, Tokyo or Paris. Its also more expensive than any of them, great for a short vacation and should be in everybodys bucket list.
Amazing. Just an amazing skyline. We live on the mid-levels and we have a view of this skyline and after a long day at work...just a nice sight to see from our balcony/rooms.

Travel to Victoria Harbour. The evening view was amazing and you wud get to see the HQ of many large financial institutions. All the building lit with beautiful lights is amazing to see. The laser show starts at 8 pm and is the world best and most coordinated shows of the world. The day we visited was cloudy and hence the laser lights were not clearly visible. Overall a great experience and must see

Perhaps the worlds, most impressive skyline!. As a tourist you have the feeling that this is the one skyline in the world you don't want to miss. I loved every second watching also with all the activity in Victoria Harbour!
Excellent. A nice place to spend the evening with friends or family..leisurely strolling along the pavement soaking in all the view.
Diminishing Stature. The skyline just doesn't seem as nice as before. It's OK. The laser show is a waste of time. It is best seen from the Star Ferry.

Beautiful and Scenic. The view of Hong Kong's skyline is, in our opinion, the best in the world. There is the contrast between ultra-modern skyscrapers and lighting, set in the backdrop of the green mountains which form Hong Kong Island and the Peak. Truly stunning.

Beautiful and a must see. We went there to see symphony of stars from gardden of stars and were amazed to see this beautiful skyline. Icing on the top was the beaurifully decorated and lit cruises and boats , which were adding to the view of the skyline.

Simply Stunning. Hong Kong is a true concrete jungle. The skyline has been built up over many years and does not fail to impress. It is truly stunning.Literally everywhere you are in HK you will lookup and see the beautiful Skyline. The architecture is absolutely amazing.

Looks exactly like all the photos...... It is a nice enough view from across the harbour. The harbour front is largely pedestrianised and you can sit down and enjoy the view. No real surprises because it is a well known view that looks the same in person as in photos. More of a box to tick or place to loiter for a while.Like the Star Ferry or the ding ding I would recommend seeing it if you have not already.

See it at night. Hong Kong seems to always be grey and semi overcast during the day which makes the skyline seem drab. But at night it is transformed. There is a viewing area on the Knowlton side or catch the Star Ferry.
Spectacular. Maybe the best Skyline in the world. Hong Kong is a great city with many things to do and see but you must take the tram to the top of the mountain to see this especially at night.

To be seen from the 'Dark Side' (Kowloon). Postcard view of Hong Islands famous Skyline from Kowloon is ubeatable, both day and night.......if the weather is good. Combine it with a trip on the Star Ferry and it's a good day out!
Stunning view. The skyline of Hong Kong is absolutely great. I recommend a walk through the promenqde to enjoy the skyline of the city overnight. It's really something else.
Amazing. Best skyline view we had from the sky 100 .. Breathtaking and awesome 360 degree view of hong kong. The queue management was efficient and the super speed elevators would excite everyone.

Must See at night. Went down to the ferry terminal near here one night for a wander, the city scape was amazing!
don't forget, each night a free light show takes place at 8PM... not as many buildings participate now days but defiantly worth a look after a lovely dinner :)

Amazing. I like Hong Kong and it looks really beautiful by night with all the laser lightsOne high-rise building has Bugs and other creatures climbing up and down. AmazingWe went to the Peak to have the best view at nightAround the Harbour its getting harder and harder to access the waterfront.Its a big construction side everywhere, which is a shame but I guess thats life

Absolutely gorgeous views as the sun set. Hong Kong harbour was absolutely gorgeous as the sun set and the lights came on. It was fascinating to see the skyline from so many different vantage points as we cruised around the harbour.

Don't miss Victoria Harbor at Night. The lights in Hong Kong at night from Victoria Harbor are great. You don't need to take a dinner cruise--the food isn't usually that good. Just get any boat to take you around the Harbor. This is one of the best things to see when there is a lot of smog in the daytime.

It's great and it's free. Just wander down to the area around the cultural centre as it is getting dark. It will be packed with people so if you want a seat get there early....but it is great....most enjoyable....you can also go for a sail around the harbour in a junk.

Magnificent Nighttime View. This is one of the most beautiful nighttime views that you will ever see. Stand on the TST side along the harbor and take it all in and then take the Star Ferry to get views of both the Kowloon side and the Hong Kong Island Side.

Iconic Hong Kong skyline- best viewed from Victoria Harbor. One of the most famous and photographed skyline, Hong Kong has most skyscrapers per sq km in the world. The skyline is best viewed from the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade and other places in and around the Victoria harbor. The skyline is dominated by famous and distinctive buildings like 2IFC Towers, Bank of China building, Central Plaza and likes in the Hong Kong side, while ICC Tower dominates the skyline of the Kowloon side. Lovely view of towering buildings, especially after sunset with all those eye catching decorative lighting displays. Recommended a stroll along the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade during the evening time to have both daytime and night viewing of this amazing skyline.

Bliss. The skyline is just fantastic and the nightly laser show is just brilliant.the abundant high rise hotels and businesses look beautifull with all their coloured lights and laser beams,well worth a visit at night just to see the light show from the Koloom side..

Stunning. This Skyline is second to none - never mind waiting for night to come - it is so impressive in day light. However at night with the "Laser Light Show" at 20:00 every night it takes a whole new life of it's own. A Must !!!
Very cool.. This was really neat. We went up to the top and great views. Excellent photo op and you can really see how expansive Hong Kong really is.

Some teaser for nothing. . We've waiting so many times to get good places. At the end, some lights, some songs and ... Nothing else. If you walk around, ok. But if you decide to move 1km for that : Not necessary.

Awesome skyline from anywhere!. Wether from The Peak, The Peak Tram, The Sky100, The Star Ferry, The Ocean Terminal or just on the way in from the airport at dusk... This skyline of this great city is simply awesome!
Great Laser and light show every night. The best view is from Victoria Harbour, behind the Hong Kong Museum of Art, looking across to Hong Kong Island
Amazing Views from our Hotel!. Wow! It was absolutely spectacular, especially at night! We had a bird's eye view from The Intercontinental Grand Standford and it was breathtaking!

Enchanting Skyline. Office buildings that have wonderful colours and animations that enthrall one and all! A must see. Yes the Q to get on the ferry could be long, but worth the wait. There is actually a building that shows the time!!! The light and music show which can be viewed from the convention center is amazing as well. On a weekend ensure you reach early to block your seat/place !
everyone has to view victoria harbor. Skip the overpriced ancient style boats offering rides to stupid tourists and just ride the ferry. It's only HKD$2.60 and you can use your coins or octopus card.

Amazing - day or night. I have visited Hong Kong more than a dozen times over the last 40 years - it still amazes me each time I visit - one of the most wonderful and changing skylines I have ever seen - day or night.

Beautiful. Beautiful skyline, especially at night.
The best view could be from Hong Kong Island on Victoria's Peak or Kowloon side.
Outstanding. Must see at night get the star ferry and see the music ever and light at Karloon only 2 dollars a crossing

drink , harbour cruise. Best place for romance , for business inspiration , for a beautiful scenery , for photograph . for memorable moments .best thing or only thing in HONG KONG .have something to eat at near by restaurant in boat around the sea, or have a drink in open Boat , sexy music and drinks . 45 mins, everyday 7:30pm . 285$hongkong

Good show, a must see. For whoever visiting Hong Kong, this is a must see at least once or twice. The lights painting the sky is really good, synched with the chinese music they stream through speaker all over the coasts, you can see a surprisingly good show. And for free.. of course it can improve a lot, but well, it's such a good show. I loved it

Hong Kong Skyline . Beautiful Hong Kong Skyline but Symphony of light is a disappointment. All buildings were light up but the lighting performance do not correspond with the music. A few years ago we can still see lights from numerous buildings dancing with the music but right now only one building are performing.

Best part of HK. This was the best part of my vacation in Hong Kong. The view from club room harbour view 36 from 26th floor of hotel icon was simply awesome. I could stare all evening out of my window sipping away wine witnessing the amazing view. Please get this view by paying extra as it's truly worth it . Also this amazing view is more fascinating from their roof top pool and gym on 9th floor which faces Victoria harbour!!! Definitely worth considering staying at hotel icon if you want to enjoy this fantastic once in a lifetime experience! !!

Wow, I wasn't expecting mich. I wasn't expecting too much for another skyline. I've been to some of the largest and most modern cities in the world. But Hong Kongs skyline is impressive. At 8 PM they also put on a cute light show that you can watch from the other side of the river in the promenade. I'm glad we went to watch it and it's a must if you're in Hong Kong visiting.

Take a boat tour. One of the best city skylines in the world. The best view is from mainland Kowloon looking at Hong Kong island. Day time is great, but night time is stunning. The light show starts at 7:45pm and at 9PM. It's nothing special, but the buildings look very cool. Book a boat. The view and feeling of being out on the water at night was one my favorite experiences in Hong Kong.
Hong Kong Skyline - Beautiful at Night. Find a high point at night for the great views across the Hong Kong Skyline - the buildings and lights are well worth seeing
Like any other western downtown skyline. Looks nice in the night, but is similar to down towns of various other cities doting US and Europe .

Beautiful skyline, seen from Kowloon side. One of the most talked about skylines in the world, we had to see this one. Has to be seen either from the air or from the Kowloon side. We can recommend as well from the Ozone bar in Ritz Carlton hotel. very colorful and sparkling.
Mesmerizing. Awesome experience by the bay.. Truly great place to be during the night.. One of the architectural synthesizers which tickle your mind

Beautiful, recognizable skyline. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful and very recognizable with its many different colors and two unique buildings jutting out into the sky. I don't much like Hong Kong or how it looks during the day, but I admit that at night, the skyline really brings Hong Kong to life.
It is an amazing view from Kowloon.. One of the most amazing skylines in the world, even if they didn't have a nightly laser light show that makes it beyond spectacular.

About As Good As It Gets -On A Nice Day. The skyline is about as good as it gets anywhere --if it is a nice day and sometimes the weather is a big negative particularly in the summer. Some of the waterfront hotels such as the Renaissance and Grand Hyatt have excellent views across to Kowloon. Mt Victoria is also a great spot to see the skyline.

Stunning. One of the great sights of the world. See it from Kowloon to get the staggering expanse and sheer scale of the thing. See it from the water to get yet another view. Do not go if you are a big "save the planet" activist - the waste of energy powering all the lights will give you nightmares!
Avenue of Stars. One of the best spot to hang around in Hong Kong. This place is a must visit during the evening when the area looks so colorful and illuminated. The place looks more like a dream.

Simply Amazing. Must See!!! When you visit Hong Kong you have to take a moment and sit down at the harbor/ a lot of seatings are available. There are also a lot of artists playing music or dancing. Grab a beer from the nearest 7eleven and enjoy the evening.

One of the best Skyscrapers views I have seen. It was actually my dream to go to Hong Kong, and this was realized last month when I and my wife when to Hong Kong for our honeymoon. The first thing that came into my mind was to visit Victoria Harbour at Tsim Sha Tsui. Waited for the sun to set, and voila! Colorfully-lighted skyscrapers will amaze you! I took my camera (with tripod) and took an image of this spectacular place. Hong Kong Skyline is one of the best I have seen so far.

BUCKETLIST!!!. It was my second time in HK but didnt have the chance to visit the V. Harbor the first time I visited because of a limited time. But the view is OH SO MAGNIFICENT!!! I was smiling the whole time I was watching the light show.We arrived late here and the show was a bout to start so please do come as early as possible so that you can get the best spot!\Dont forget to bring your monopods with you!
Simply breathtaking . It was mind blowing how long the skyline was... Absolutely amazing. It's a must see every time I visit Hong Kong! The view is great during the day and night.
Beautiful!. The amazing view by day or by night, one of the best skylines in the world. Fantastic atmosphere of the Hong Kong harbor. We would love to come back to see the light show at night.

Never get used to it. There are many different spots to view the Hong Kong Skyline, such as restaurants, rooftop bars or simply just the pier. The view of Hong Kong's skyline will never get old with all the amazing lights and vibrant atmosphere. It truly is the heart of Hong Kong.

A thing for one's bucket list. Stunning view you ought to see at day and night time if possible. It was one of the things I wanted to do during my trips to Asia and have finally managed to do it this year. The skyline is impressive and makes you ponder things like wealth of nations, people's lives and course of history of this part of the world.
Pretty. Nice to see but don't bother going for the 8pm laser show. Very disappointed. The lights were all on anyway and the addition of a few lasers pointing up in to the sky didn't add much.
WOW!. Everyone who visits Hong Kong MUST go see the skyline at night! It's gorgeous! Find a spot near the water and just enjoy! It's not like anything else in the world!
Beautiful skyline at night . I could sit there all night just watching the buildings at night time. I came here for the light show which wasn't all that great but the view was just spectacular!

Undisputed great skylines of the World. There are few things that are as inexpensive as seeing the HK skyline from Kowloon. Whether during the day or night, the view is breathtaking. It remains one of the wonders of the world in my book.

Undisputed great skylines of the World. There are few things that are as inexpensive as seeing the HK skyline from Kowloon. Whether during the day or night, the view is breathtaking. It remains one of the wonders of the world in my book.

Stunning. Absolutely worth a visit. It's easy to get to. It's free. And every 8PM, there is a (not to great) laser show for 10 minutes (for free). It's the HK that I know. The skyscrapers and the night life. Sitting on the river bank. let the breeze cool you down for a bit. Fend off the Chinese ladies that offer you free cruises. Relax. Enjoy the calmness. Watch the laser show. Speaking of the laser show, we were there on a cloudy day (rained earlier in the day) and it was pretty awful. It was sporadic with some green lasers and most the time there wasn't much to see. Nonetheless it did not ruin the skyline experience and I would certainly be back again.

Better view than Victoria peak!. To get a clearer view of the skyscrapers, maybe the view from TST might be better than up at the Peak as there isn't any mist to deal with. It was nice to get a panorama of this and to take in the sights. A must do while you are here!!

Some skylines never leave you. Does not matter how many times I visit HK, but the skyline always takes my breath away. The lights and shapes make it unique in the world, the silence of admiration during the light show is something memorable.

Lights, cameras and action!. The Hong Kong Skyline at night is a visual story with electric flair! Being a local or tourist, old or young, it serves to activate a sense of exploration and adventure. It floods the soul with an emotion of awesomeness, fills you up and afterwards leaves you bubbling for some time.
NIghtly Light Show. The light show of buildings is spectacular but don't waste your money on a harbor cruise. You can see everything you need to see from the shoreline.

OMG. Standing on the river front in Kowloon looking back across to Hong Kong island, the view is spectacular. The very large big wheel looks tiny against the tall skyscrapers. As dusk falls the lights come on making the view even more remarkable. We took a place on the viewing platform ready for the nightly light show. However, we were really disappointed. It's wasn't spect ulnar at all. You could hardly hear the music and the lasers were quite feeble. The night lights in Shanghai were loads more impressive. Hong Kong - you need to up the anti to compete I'm afraid
Unforgettable.. Had the most fantastic hour on the river looking at the skyline. Nothing more to be said, the views are to die for, atmosphere brilliant. Loved it.
Stunning!. If you can, book a hotel with Harbor View. We stayed at hotel Icon and views of Skyline were out of this world.
Cool wiew. This is the most breathtaking scenery of Hong Kong. Like Las Vegas, Hong Kong is truly at its best after dark.
Impressive. Just another big city skyline. We went on a harbour cruise which was definitely worth doing. Seeing it from a different angle, quite impressive

Iconic skyline! . Iconic skyline!
Great to see this skyline by:
- day from Hong Kong harbour
- night from Kowloon
- day from The Peak, Hong Kong Island (looking down onto the island is amazing - but only go when there is good visibility!)
- taxi, as you depart to see the full scale of Hong Kong Island.

The Stunning skyline. If you do nothing else in Hong Kong, you must take the tram to the Skyline 360 to experience the stunning view of the most beautiful skyline in the world. we went at around 5 so that we could see it during both the day and twilight. However be warned, it does get really busy at that hour. We went to the observation deck and the view is phenomenal. you see the buildings clearly and if taking in that scene is marvelous, wait until the sun sets and the lights start coming on. it's out of this world.

Hong Kong Night Lights. Nothing nicer than a stroll on a balmy Hong Kong night as the shoreline comes alive with a dazzling light display. The high rise buildings all contribute with a maze of flashing neon, geometric patterns, waves of changing colours on another, and still on another building, giant figures 'walking' around the outside walls. Later, laser beams shoot across the night sky adding to the display. Fun way to see the harbour.
Iconic and beautiful. The pictures you've seen of Victoria Harbour? They are exactly what it looks like in person - beautiful. Go both during the day and the night for gorgeous vistas.
Best in the world. Even on a rainy day it's stunning.Looking forward to seeing it on other viewpoints as well, and at night..The better side to see it from is Kowloon side looking back onto HK
Symphony of laughs. The HK skyline is a beaut as viewed from Kowloon at night. See "A Symphony of Lights"once. It is hilarious. See the skyline more than once.

Lovely and its free !. Worth looking and viewing, a great light show, there are certain points to have a better view, we stayed on Kowloon and this I thought was great to see the lights. You could watch it every night, gets busy so select your spot early. Happens before 20.00 and is only 15/20 miniuets.

Another City Skyline. The Hong Kong skyline is just a tad more colourful compared to Singapore's. It is not a 'wow' attraction but it's nice to be able to sit there and just stare into the sky, pretending the neon lights from the skyscrapers are fireworks lighting up the night.There are A LOT of tourist there so it can be difficult to find a quiet spot.They also have "professional" photographers cordoning off a spot with the picture-perfect view of the skyscrapers to help you with take a photo and then buying it from them. It's not that expensive. You may buy it to keep it as souvenir.

Nice but underwhelming. Don't get me wrong, it is a very nice skyline but I was underwhelmed by it. I thought it would be bigger and better more like Shanghai. Actual Hong Kong is very old, it seemed like a run down San Francisco, but better for people who like history and to see what it was like when it was under British rule. Kowloon is the newer and nicer side which is more of what I was expecting. Still very nice to see all of the buildings and to see the old and the new of Hong Kong.

Hong Kong Skyline. Night view of the skyline is really breathtaking. You can book a boat cruise from the harbour and enjoy the view of the Hong Kong island. At 8 pm there is light show from the skyscrapers which is called the symphony of lights, you can arrange your boat cruise at this time and enjoy the great view from the sea. You can also view this great sight from the Victoria peak at night.

Must visit place in Hong Kong.. Try to be there by 7.45 pm and experience the magic of lights at 8pm. Good 20 nmnts to go around. Be careful to have your ticket for the star cruse to take you around, not a friendly staff though, but ok for a 20 mnt trip . Take time to see this attraction.
Some of the reason why you come to HK. Don't waste your time waiting for the light show its pretty pathetic, however the amount of photos you will take of this skyline is crazy...
Best skyline. we stayed at the Harbour Grand and the view from the restaurant is amazing. Always changing - amazing

Good view . Good place to visit if you want to see all Hong Kong. A little bit overpriced, because you have to pay for the pictures they make separately. It would be better just to include it to a price.
Hong Kong Skyline at night. Sitting on the 15th floor of the Sheraton Towers Hotel Sky bar for after dinner drinks with your best friend over looking the harbour under lights, very special
Spectacular!!! . One of the most spectacular places in the world. Hong Kong is amazing and the view at the bay is completely spectacular! Definitely the point for your bucket list.
Night Life !!. Symphony light show is a visual treat to watch and a must do on one of the hong kong nights. However, these shows get frequently cancelled due to rains or bad weather.

One of the best skylines in the world that can be viewed from land. The Hong Kong Island skyline, when viewed from across Victoria Harbour in TST is one of the world's best! The buildings are stunning, and when they're decorated with neon lights for Christmas, New Year or Chinese New Year, they look even more beautiful. Add to it the image of a traditional Chinese Junk sailing in the waters of the harbour or the historic Star Ferry and you've got a complete picture of what to look out for.

Dramatic by day and night. As you would have seen in every picture of HK, the skyline is gorgeous. The dramatic hills rising above it and the harbor below make is so unique. A mix of nature and man made beauty. Best to view it from Tsim Sha Tsui
not impressive. we had big expectation but it was very normal. Please dont with high expectations. it is just all buildings are lit up and there is a music. nothing else
it's true when they say it is one of the best. The even have laser light show every 8pm. the only problem is that it is always crowded. For photographers, prepare your DSLR and tripod.:)

What an amazing view!. Try seeing this from a rooftop bar, on a ferry or from the opposite harbour shore - even on cloudy nights, the lights are brighter than ever! There is plenty of movement and colour, like Vivid Sydney every night!

Incredible from land or water. We couldn't get enough of this skyline! It is incredible to see any time of day but especially lit up at night. We enjoyed a great view from the iBar one evening while having drinks and appetizers and watched the Symphony of lights at 8 pm. We also took an evening harbor cruise one night and loved seeing the skyline and light show from the water. Not to be missed!
A truly Magnificent view. During the day the sight of the high rise buildings is impressive... but wait until night fall. That is when the city shines like no other.

Absolutely spectacular!. We went on the boat tour to get the best views. It was stunningly beautiful made even more spectacular by the thunder and lightening that played in the background. Made us question the UK contribution to global warming of turning off street-lamps for 5 hours a night!

Light spectacular. At 8 pm each night the light show begins ( laser spectacular shone across the skyline )It's enjoyable to watch from the harbour side. But try riding the ferry across the river. Runs ever 15 -20min one leaves just as he light show starts.

Good Show in night. Better to go in night for the cruise to see the Symphony of Lights show.However it is better that you download the app for the music - we did not - else it is difficult to follow the lights and one does not enjoy it much
Awesome skyline esp at Night. One of the most amazing city skylines I have seen with all the colourful lights at night. Must be viewed from Tsim sha Tsui

Always changing. It is a delight to look up to see the Peak of Hong Kong or, is it covered by cloud? All the new city buildings are captivating. A ride on the Peak Tram will give you a fantastic view of the Skyline opposite.Construction works give one an idea of the progress in building works and roadway construction.Best of all is the view of the light show each evening on the buildings of Hong Kong.That is when the skyline is supreme.It is a wonderful city.

Light show. Please go to the place around 15 minutes before the start of symphony of lights, so you could get a better view. Perhaps, there are better light shows in other citys, but this one could also create positive emotions and smiles

beautiful. Wow, i did not realise that this place is close to the place i stayed only found out during the last night of our stay. We enjoyed the symphony of lights at 8:00pm and this show is one of the highlights of HK and the lights of the buildings in HK island is unbelievable.
Dazzling View. Hong Kong has one of the most beautiful skyline rather its from a boat on the Harbor. the shore lines or hotel room.

Amazing Day or Night. You really have to see the skyline at 8pm from TST side and see the amazing light show. The lights and background really do keep you in awe of Hong Kong. So much so i decided to live here and have been here for 6 years now.

HK skyline at night. Best in the world.Tip 1: night view from The Peak is excellent.Tip 2: unless you are on the Peak, it is a much better experience to view the skyline at night from the Kowloon side. It is prettier to seeing HK Island from the Kowloon waterfront, than the other way around. If cost is not an issue, stay at a Kowloon TST area hotel facing the harbour. Your harbour view room is worth the extra $$ as you can have drinks in your room every night and enjoy the best harbour view at night in the World.

You never get tire to see it, specially by night!. Wonderful experience to have on a boat! There are no words to describe the views of stunning Victoria Harbour . You really have to see it and be there!

Great vista - day or night.. We enjoyed a day view and night harbour cruise, and both were spectacular. The night tour (there are a few companies that offer various options) was very good, although the light show was a little disappointing.

Awesome. We have been to Honkers many times over the years,and we still walk down to the harbour in the evening to look at the skyline.Its just awesome!On a Saturday night they have the laser light show set to music which is amazing to watch.It does get pretty crowded when this show is on,so you need to get there a little bit earlier to get the best vantage spots.Even without the laser show the sky line is amazing ,not only at night ,but in the day too.

Best skyline. Hong Kong certainly has a skyline that equals any city. These views are from Hong Kong island, from Kowloon it's just as impressive. Each night at 8 around 40 of the buildings participate in a light show, there are lasers and the buildings change colour. There are plenty of places to view the skyline if your in Hong Kong you really cannot miss it. Spend some time walking the promenades and take in the view.

beautiful skyline - overrated laser show. The view over the Hong Kong skyline is great. There is a free laser show every evening at 8 pm which was okay but not great. Getting there 10 minutes before the show starts is ok since there is enough space at the promenade. I personally think it doesn't matter if you miss it. The place wasn't very crowded

Don't miss when you are in hongkong. The hong kong sky line has different taste in night time as a light show displayed every night . many peoples wait for the show and enjoys following boats moving in the canal

Great to see in the night. This was our main reason to fly 16 hours to Hong Kong. The skyline is impressive, especially during night time. If you're not busy, you can see the light show, which is very nice.

Fantastic. Another must do just brilliant. Fabulous views but only did it in the daytime no time to return at night and would love to do have done it both ways to get different views.even though off peak there were lots of people in the gondolas.
fantastic!. One of the most beautiful skylines of the world. Starts at 8 pm with music light and lasershow. Unique of its kind.

Majestic View. Our family viewed the skyline near Star Ferry Terminal and I should say this is one of the best skyline I've seen. My 15mo baby even enjoyed running near the viewing deck. I highly recommend checking the skyline both from Island side and Kowloon side. Spend time viewing the skyline and it will relax your mind and body from the busy city.

Wonderful Views. Hong Kong is on a par with Sydney, Vancouver, Cape Town, and San Francisco for magnificent harbor cities. Each is unique but they are all beautiful. Get a Hotel with a view over Kowloon or one from Kowloon looking back to the island
Amazing Hong Kong. The amazing views at day or night. At night amazing. Excellent views from Victoria Peak, fantastic atmosphere. Visit again in Jan.2017.

AMAZING. Not only one of the most famous skylines in the world... but for city lovers, one of the best.There are really so many locations to enjoy the view of this city - by day or by night - that it defies description!

HSBC and Meat Cleaver are great. Once you are in Hong Kong, one thing you can't avoid is its towering skyline. The HSBC building in HK was made in such a way that one can remove the blocks and bring it down. Meat Cleaver building is shaped like a cleaver.

Superb!!!. One of the best skyline you get to see, haven't seen the New York one but people rate it better than that also. Need to visit it multiple time from different sides of the sea and at different time of day. You will just fall in love with it and your camera will not let you restLight and Music show is bit overrated though...
Amazing. The views were incredible and the atmosphere was amazing, this is one of the best place to see skyline of HongKong
Amazing city. We took the tram up to Victoria Peak to get a good look of the city. The view is amazing. I cannot say enough about the view of the skyline. Probably was one of my favorites of Hongkong
Hong Kong Skyline. We had a good time travelling by the streamer in the Victoria harbor area. Excellent views during day and night.

great. The best thing about Hong Kong was its skylines. I witnessed two skylines- one is on the Hong Kong Islands and the other one is on Kowloon across Victoria Harbour, but out of both Hong Kong Island skyline was more beautiful. It is amazing during the daylight and at night its beauty takes one’s breath away. The multimedia light show on the Hong Kong’s skyline in January 2004 . The name of the show is ‘A SYMPHONY OF LIGHTS’. I liked the show but it was just for about fifteen minutes. In NEWYORK, there are also plenty of skyscrapers but due to the small space Hong Kong’s skyline looks more beautiful.

Victoria harbour 8pm light and music show. Go early get a good position if you are into photography or purely just to enjoy the light and music show. It can get very crowded when the time is near. After that you can go either side for a drink to chill.

Simply stunning. Its a marvel of technology to have so many high rises in HK. Having very little land to build horizontally, the city grew vertically. A lot of the buildings are landmarks... like the HSBC bank building or the Citibank building.
Symphony of lights. All the tourist guides tell u to go see the symphony of lights as for me it's not worthing that much time... Some music will be played and some green laser pointed at the sky.
Beautiful anytime. The skyline is impressive and quite stunning anytime. Rain, sunny, and night all amazing view. Try to go up into one of the sky bars at dusk.

Lots of lights to see at night. Best place to view the laser show is down by Star Ferry....pier 1 or 2.The laser show starts at 8pm and lasts 15 minutes.Sometimes the commentary is in English and sometimes in Cantonese but it doesn't really distract from the show. Get there early....around 7.30pm latest to get a good position as it is packed with people every night. Lots of the buildings start turning on their lights from about 7pm anyway.Usually you can see lit up red junks go by and sometimes cruise ships.Show is not spectacular but is worth seeing.

Beautiful Skyline But Unimpressive Light Show. As previous reviewers mentioned, the skyline is impressive viewed from the Kowloon side. However, the much hyped symphony of lights is nothing but a few buildings shooting green laser lights into the sky. The event is a nightly one starting at 8PM and lasting 15 minutes. Good thing it was free.

Wonderful skyline. The Ozone Bar is one of my favourite hotspots in Hongkong to have wonderful view on this beautiful city. I recommend also the Starferry to enjoy the greate view. Especially for thunder lovers - it's awesome.

jennyw. The Hong Kong Skyline is really nice we watched the laser show with lots of other
people and was very disappointed. There was only a few green laser lights
I have certainly seen better

Top skyline . futuristic skyline line no other in the world
I think although I have not yet had the chance to fly around on an helicopter to really appreciate the amazing constructions lit at night
Exhilarating view. If havent seen this ... You havent seen hong kong.. The evening spent here with my wife was one of the lifetime experiences i had.. Visit in the evening ... Get the most out of it

Fascinating. Had the chance to view Hong Kong's skyline from 2 different spots- Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Center as well as the deck of Park Lane Hotel on the 27th floor. Both give you grand views not only of the skyline but of Victoria Harbour as well. And the best part of it, it's free! Fascinating to say the least!
No place like it. No skyline I the world is like that of Hong Kong. Take it all in from the Ozone bar on the 118th story of the ICC building in Kowloon.
Amazing view at night. The skyline on the harbor is amazing, with the colors, architecture and the busy water traffic. Don't miss!

4 places you shouldn't miss in Hong Kong! . The Peak. Must take the cable tram at Garden Road. Best hours are around 7pmJust before the sun sets while all the building lights are returning on.The wooden junk boat ride. This traditional junk boat with red sails lazily sailing in the busy harbor giving you a wonderful experience of the by gone time. Get all tickets information, riding schedule and location at the Hong Kong Tourist office at Star Ferry. The double decker Tram ride from the very north of Hong Kong to the very south near Kennedy Town for peanuts. You can get on any tram stops and you'll never forget this experience for the rest of your life. Remember ride on the upper deck. Good luck! Dinner or lunch at the Jumbo Dragon Boat restaurant at Aberdeen. It's sea food at its best. You can choose the live fish before they cook it for you anyway you like. The place is like a sea Palace on a dragon boat, it is a little pricy but worth every Penny. You'll find mostly the locals eating here and you can also get their famous Dim Sums. Getting there is a little tricky but you can take any bus or taxi to Aberdeen and ask the boat ride that will get you to the Kumbo FREE!
Amazing . Amazing view in the night, that's really impressed me. Even in the day is a good place to walk and chilling with the view of the big Hong Kongs buildings
Wow. Take a boat trip during the day to appreciate the sky line by day, and then head up one of the very high towers (of which there are many) to see the day become night.
The night light show is the best. The night light show, every night at 8 pm, is not to be missed. You can see it from the public piers on Kowloon free of charge.

Beautiful. I believe the skyline of Hong Kong Island is just the best in the world it is better than even New york.. you must watch the laser show from Kowloon side near star ferry to believe me.. beautiful

A spectacular sight, especially during the light show!. I enjoyed the skyline every time I got on the ferry. However it is truly best seen at night, the 15 minute light show is truly spectacular and is best enjoyed from a cruise or ferry.
Stunning view!. As I was walking towards the Harbour, I got goosebumps cos it is really beautiful. Perfect spot to view the City Skyline! View was enchanting at night with all the lights lit up!
For dreamers. Charming trip along Victoria Harbor. I felt I was living in a dream or sort of... I couldn't believe I was there, in a beautiful ship, sailing...
One of the best skyline in the world. Beautiful skyline. The best time to see this is in the evening during Christmas time looking from the Kowloon side toward Hong Kong Island.
Beautiful. A very beautiful skyline. Even though it was cloudy for most of our visit, the skyline view was enjoyable. sadly, our last s]=day there, the smog made the view extremely hazy.
Skyline. Beautiful at night. We were able to see it from ground level and what we were told was the 7th tallest building and and highest bar in the world. Awesome from anywhere.

Beautiful. Simple, you must see, it is Hong Kong!!!! Easy to go to via bus taxi or train, though you need to walk to the promenade its just a few mins walk. Outdoor walking is still good cos you get to experience Nathan road at its best already. Go down to Tsim Sha Tsui, go around 630pm and enjoy the symphony of lights too.
Like it! . Never be bored by sitting along to bay and look at this nice and amazing skyline here. During the day and night make a little bit different feeling. But still good :)

BREATHTAKING. Stay at Marco Polo hotel and you can enjoy this breathtaking view which, each time I am lucky enough to enjoy, still amazes me.
A MUST SEE
Free light show. This is a must-see activity. Happens every night. Take up vantage points at the southern tip of Kowloon (looking at Hong Kong island). And get your camera ready!
Beautiful. It is a mesmerising experience and one must do a cruise to experience the skyline of hongkong and the laser show at 8.

Disapppointing. Expected this to be a fantastic light/laser/sound show - similar to what they have in Singapore.
We were disappointed. Very few llasers/buildings/lights which went for about 10 mins. Sound was good - but it's a really poor cousin of other shows we've seen elsewhere

Spectacular . The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful. And seeing it from Kowloon during the laser show is wonderful. But a night ride on the ferry seeing the skyline from the bay, it has to be one of the most beautiful you'll ever see.

Sky line. Nothing like in the world. View from Tst light show around 8pm every night is something to behold. If you are staying on HK central, take the ferry across have dinner at Spoon / Peninsula hotel. Bring much $$$$$$.
Amazing View. My favourite part of the trip, it was at night when I went here and was able to watch the light show for free.
beautiful and free!. Went here at around 8 or 9 pm, it was really beautiful. I feel relaxed just sitting there and looking at the water, boat and colorful buildings, too bad we missed the light show.
Nice walk in the evening after dinner. With lots of other people, the walk in TST overlooking Hong Kong island is a popular passtime. Impressive views, with the little boats going to Victoria Harbour

Must see in Hong Kong. This is perhaps the best, and ost special thing about Hong Kong. One night we saw the skyline from Carlton rooftop bar (the worlds highest bar), and the other night from the other side - where you can se Carlton having a very very special light show. Would definelty sit down with a drink for these shows! Carlton one is 19:30 and the other side 20:00.

Go see the Symphony of lights!. It simply can't be missed. They alternate the "narration language" each night between english, cantonese, and mandarin, but I don't think that's super important because all they speak about are the names of the buildings. Music and light are more important.
Wow. Fantastic view that is when it's not raining or cloudy best at night when all the lights are on. We stayed at the four seasons club lounge and had a superb view

Beautiful..!! . We went on a cruise while watching the skyline. Was absolutely worth it! The view was amazing. I did not find anything great about the "Symphony of Lights" show coz it was just a few building flashing laser lights. But just going on cruise at night watching the skyline all lighten up looks amazing..!!
Lights. Nice lights at the night. A little bit cold. We saw street performers, a band for teenagers.. You can also ask a photograper to take a picture of you and they will print it ofcourse with pay
One of a kind. We never tire of the skyline by day or night, especially when the light show is on. It really is amazing.

View from Aqua Luna. The best way to view is from one of the few Junk Boats still opeating - Dukling or Aqua Luna. I reccomend Aqua Luna. It is larger and handles better in sometimes the rough water. Also if you choose a time around sunset you will have a chance to see the skyline before and after it gets dark.

Stay in Kowloon and get it for free. Great experience. Our hotel, Grand Hotel Kowleen, provided an inclusive trip on a fabulous junk around the harbour to see this spectacular sight. It wa must do in Hong Kong.as great to see it from our boat and to get the commentary but we could have seen it from our lovely hotel room.

Heaven!. The laser light show is amazing, it is on of the most beautiful scenes anyone could ever watch. Lay down on the ground with a nice camera and enjoy the lights dance and twist with the harmonizing music, just breath taking.
Dazzling skyline with a short laser show. The strips of land on both sides with close skyscrapers offering a laser show every night at 8 PM just for 15 minutes. Many photo opportunities
Breath taking !!!. This is out of the world view. Lot of sky scrappers with dancing lights makes your experience ever lasting.
Great Skyline. Awesome skyline and the laser show @8pm is a must see. Great view from all around the city specially the peak.

Beautiful. Watched the Hongkong skyline from two different places- I would say the best two places to watch the Hongkong skyline- From the peak - watched the skyline around dusk as well as at night from here. It is pretty amazing the transition when the lights come on slowly. I also watched it from the Tsim Sha Sui promenade. Both views are truly amazing, The Symphony of lights is just ok and I guess its definitely not something to be put in a "must watch" list, However the skyline is definitely a must watch while you are in HongKong

Nice light show. Attractive light show in the heart of Hong Kong. You enjoy the show and you see several street bands where you can enjoy their music along with the show.Most probably you would do as same as I did ... right after the show, I decided to take the ferry to the other side ... very nice part of the city :)

The show at 8pm doesn't worth visiting. We visited an open-air show called "Symphony of lights' (or smth like that. It takes place every day at 8pm and is visible from Tsim Sha Tsui promenade.I can assure you that it doesn't worth visiting at all. If you have seen Las Vegas street shows, Dubai dansing water, Singapore dansing water show or at least Prague dancing fountains - a Hong Kong show is far-far-far less interesting. We were surprised that so many people wer watching it and left after 10-12 minutes without any good impression.

The most interesting: the tram. The weather is very changeable in April and we rained in half, we were fortunate to have good visibility. perhaps less interesting was the journey by boat, for which I paid a lot, without being something out of the ordinary.Otherwise it was nice
Fantastic Evening Views. There's an Illumination Show at 8pm each night. Must see... For a better feel of this take the AQUA LUNA which is a 2hr junk boat circling the harbor.

Best viewed at night. Laser display a bit tame.. The best views of the skyline come from the Kowloon side at night or indeed from the Star Ferry. The promenade at Tsim Sha Tsui (next to the Star Ferry terminal) is probably the best spot. I thought the laser display was OK rather than amazing so if you miss it don't worry, the skyline alone is amazing.
Love. Hong Kong is by far my favourite city visited so far. The views from the ferries are just unreal, defiantly a must see after dark

On top of highest building ..ICC in Hong Kong. The ICC building has an observatory at 100th floor, it is called SKY100. It is a 360-degree indoor observation deck, which was designed by international architecture firm Kohn Pedersen. There is a ticket also to see the Hong Kong if you choose to go there. However, if you are a group of two or more than it is better to go to 118th floor of the building thru a restaurant named Ozone of Ritz Carlton, you can spent quality time for the same cost. The view from the 118th floor is spectacular, amazing...it is better if you go there in the evening around 5 PM and stay there till lights are on,, so u can see the whole of Hong Kong if it is not a cloudy day and also enjoying the view when all lights are on after 6 PM. It is a must visit place in HK

Perfect place for Tourist to capture Skylines & Harbour. I was in HongKong and decided to visit this place to spend our evening. I was staying in Tsim Sha Tsui and I walked from my Hotel to this place because of lovely weather and it took my 10 minute to reach there. Once on the deck, you can enjoy view of Sea, can see Ferries/Boats and also Hong Kong's famous Skylines which look beautiful after sunset.
