If you go there, spend good 3-4 hour and don't forget to carry your camera and selfie stick.
Night lights on the sea. We enjoyed the beautiful lights of the city from Kowloon. Nice way to end a day of sightseeing from the on fort of our hotel room.

Stunning Views across the bay. Absolutely stunning views across the bay with changing colored lights to add interest. The Hong Kong Skyline is something that will live in your memory for a lifetime. Try catch a laser show - it is definitely worth while. The reflection in the water is magnificent.

The best in the world. This is a city skyline, not a dessert, or a countryside, so the skyline is full or buildings with magnificent lights. Every night there is a light show and it is usually so creative. It is so relaxing and mesmerizing. Each side of the harbour had their own respective amazing view. Check out the Inter-Continental Kowloon on Salusbury Rd, lobby lounge and on King Kong Island check out he Four Seasons view or Isola. Amazing !!
Stunning . If you have to see one thing in Hong Kong then go to see the skyline at night.It is a bustling a happening spot with buskers and a spectacular view over Hong Kong island.

Can't visit without pausing to view. "Iconic" is an overused word, but the HK skyline is so well known before you see it that it's still a thrill to regard. You feel you've 'arrived' when you get a view of it.Best way is to take the Star Ferry and then you get to see it from the water, from across the bay and again upon your return.Note that every night at 8pm there's a light show (some lasers and co-ordinated coloured lights). New Year's Eve fireworks it's not, but it's free and if you're on the 1955-ish ferry they slow down and circle a little so you can see the show.
Hong Kong. I am required to use a lot of words but WOW explains it well. Skyline views on both sides of harbor are spectacular. Even on cloudy days it is great.

The Skyline is mesmerising. Get yourself to the Avenue of Stars for the best view. Get ready for the rich people in rented ferry to block your view. Don't get carried away, not all the building will have the laser show among all those with fancy lighting; there were only 5-6 buildings that really participated in the show.
Reason to go to Hong Kong. The skyline is a must see. It is beautiful at night. I can't believe how many skyscrapers there are. Take the time to walk along both sides.

World Class View. Stand at the Kowloon Star Ferry terminal about 2100 hours and bring your camera. Take lots of pictures or just watch and enjoy the lights shimmer across the Harbour. This is one of the great sights in the world. Do it with your partner.

one of the reasons to love hk!. been to hk many times and still loving it. the skyline is just amazing, whether day or not. symphony of lights is great too!!! good for just swinging by or photography. something about it just makes it uniquely HK, never get bored seeing it over and over again.
From the peak. If your on Hong Kong Island and hopefully took the star ferry and then up to the top, your view of the sky line in the New territories across the bay is spectacular
A Photographer Must. Check this out in the day and night. Night shows are daily at 8pm. Head there early to get a good view of the skyline.
Stunning. Very worthwhile....one of the loveliest in the world ;) Free show - not to be missed !! Great reflections in the beautiful bay.

The best Skyline to Visit. Possibly the best skyline to look at from the other side of the Island. Great view when seen at night with Light-works all around. Ideal for Photography and tour on Star cruises. Although bit windy throughout, but provides an enjoyable view of the buildings with lights all around.

Best Skyline and enjoyed from Duckling. River cruise offers most excellent view of the spectacular skyline of Hong Kong.
We have got ourselves settled in Duckling (River Cruise).View from cruise is stunning.We were lucky to witness "Symphony of Lights " as well from cruise.

The East of Manhattan. The closer you could get to this view is from the walking lane next to National Science Center...enjoy the view with a beer in your hand...there's an old man passes-by selling beers in trolley cart...what aview...I called it The NYC Manhattan in the east...

Wonderful Skyline. Best nighttime skyline in the world. The best view is from a boat in the harbour. Many companies offer night time cruises, which coincide with the Symphony of Lights at 8PM.
A must see if you are in Hong Kong

Magnificent. This is a must see and one must have an unobstructed view. We decided to stay at a hotel on the waterfront with a huge window to view the light show while in the comfort of our luxurious room. I would not enjoy a Victoria Harbor cruise on a crowded ferry. I prefer having a glass of wine and taking in the view in silence!
Lovely view. Best to get to the Peak just before dusk for the best view and photos. Go by bus (slow) or tram. Very busy all of the time

Looks dazzling. if u take a ferry across the victoria harbour u would see the beautiful, dazzling hong kong skyline..it would take your breath away...like a picture taken right out of the movies...cant miss this one..! for a memorable trip of the hong kong island..
Need to experience this.. While in HK this is a must see, especially during night time. Don't miss the laser show😊 and bring your camera.

Incredible!. Out of all of the cities I have been lucky enough to visit, I cannot think of any that can truly rival Hong Kong in terms of its skyline. The city is a true urban jungle, with its skyscrapers shadowed by green mountains, but it does do with immense style and class. The city is worth visiting for its architectural prowess alone, the skyline boasts buildings designed by I. M. Pei, Norman Foster and Cesar Pelli to name a few. The views are unparalleled in both the daytime and night and can be enjoyed from the promenade on the Kowloon side of the harbour, as well as from aboard Hong Kong's famous star ferry or it's even more famous Victoria peak.

Spectacular. One of the world's iconic manmade landscapes. Stunning view during the day and at night. Heard that HK skyline was voted number 2 after Manhatten but it gets my vote (having seen both) as the whole skyline is visible.
best skyline at dark in the world.. The river cruise offers the best view the spectacular skyline of hong kong. A not to be missed attractions. And the light show is amazing.

wonderful at night. If you succeed to get on a boat at night and climb to a rooftop, you 'll enjoy this world-known skyline. I recommend to do the HK free wakling tour because they explaine the story of each building and it is fun and different from what you'd expect

Amazing Lights. Great views from Kowloon and nightly 'Symphony of Lights' from either side is worth a look too. Can get crowded but even with several people in front of you it can be seen and you can hear the music all over.
Beautiful and romantic . The skyline is what makes Hong Kong, it take your breath away especially during evening ensure you got enough battery for photos.

Superb lightshow at 20:00 Local Time. The title says it all. Either side of this, you have to put up with the (boring??) lightshow on the various HK Island builds that light the night sky. It's the corporate or business equivalent of Las Vegas, with globally known brands grabbing your attention as the light the night sky.Best viewed from Kowloon Star Ferry Port and towards the Intercontinental Grand Stanford.

Beautiful views. Victoria Harbor is free to walk along and offers amazing views of the other side of Hong Kong. At night there is a laser light show against the buildings with music which is entertaining to watch. You can catch a ride on a junk boat which is a fun experience.

8pm is the light show. A sight to remember. Get to the waterside by 745pm to book ur perfect view of the symphony of lights. It's 15 min but seems short. Some buildings are not part of show.Go to both banks of the bay to enjoy views of HK and Kowloon side.

Great relaxing evenings. A great way to relax in eh evenings in Hong Kong is to go down to the harbour and watch the skyline and light show.The lighting of the buildings is excellent and widely spread across the harbour on both sides.Come rain, or dry weather it is great to go down there and spend some time just catching the scene.

Like a light show at Disney. Every night, promptly at 8pm, for 15 minutes Kowloon puts on a beautiful light show. The show takes place on both sides of the harbor but in my opinion, best viewed across from Kowloon. Standing on the shore by the ferries, you can hear the music and announcement of the sponsoring buildings. We watched the light show from a Junk Boat on the water and we picked a clear night.

Laser show at 8pm.. It was good but the haze didn't help with the experience really. Its free and unmissable from most of the waterfront areas and lasts around 5 minutes or so. We did manage some good photos despite the haze though.It is difficult to compare or rave about this show but it is undoubtedly part of the Hong Kong experience. Architecturally the actual sky line has much merit but given that it is just an over populated city which has grown and grown we found it hard to excited about it. But having said that it will not be something we forget easily either.

Spectacular! - No other word describes. . Totally agree with previous reviews about the skyline. The vertical growth of soaring concrete is breathtaking. Viewing from Tsim Sha Tsui and Wan Chai promenades should be on every visitors' agenda.

A must see for free. I lived two years there and loved the skyline (showed it to all visitors ;)). Of course next to the ferry and on the walk of fame it is pretty crowded. I preferred the park of west kowloon waterfront promenade where you can enjoy some self brought wine in a romantic atmosphere (be aware of the opening times, get there via ICC (360 is a nice shop for good wine or 7/11 for cheaper one) - MTR Kowloon Station and follow signs for west kowloon waterfront promenade). Imo the best place for skylining - not sooo many lights but enough and not crowded ;)...

What a view!. We went to the river for the fireworks display and the view was AMAZING! Having lived in Chicago, I really could not believe how huge the skyline here was. Bigger and better than I've ever seen.

The Skyline is fantastic. Must do when in Hong Kong, especially if travelling with Kids, it was lovely being there, the light show was nice and you'll see a lot of trademark buildings that you would've seen in night wallpapers.

The buildings lit up at night are a sight to behold.. The building lit up at night are a sight to behold. They are a riot of color against the black sky. During the day,one marvels are the number of building packed into such a tight space.
A must-do stop. The buffet dinner was very good, the entertainment was also good. The views and the light show were worth the price of admission!

Pleasant walk and harbour trips available. Avenue of Stars and light show every evening.. Sometimes a bit breezy so a light jacket would be beneficial. Work is being carried out at the moment (May 2016).

Perfect. This view is magnificent! The lights start shinning after 18h30/19h00.
Just stop and enjoy the view and the lights. I assure you will be delightful

Iconic. One of the worlds most photographed and iconic skylines. Staying in Kowloon gives you a great view. There's a laser/ light show each evening - don't get too excited about it- it's not epic, but it is worth experiencing. Having said that, you don't need a light show to appreciate how awesome this view is.
Amazing light show. Go across to the Kowloon side and watch the daily light show - 8pm. You can take the Star Ferry from the piers on the Island.

Laser Light Show at Hong Kong Island, along Victoria Harbour. This is a nightly happening and is well worth seeing if you are in Hong Kong. Public transport - bus or MTR - is easy to use and reasonably priced too. It doesn't last very long but is very interesting.
No wonder it's the most beautiful skyline in the world. The shows are good, the lights and laser beams are astounding. However, the sound system aren't good enough to reach all the audiences.

don't wasted your time for symphony of light ever!. nothing interesting here except for take some pictures, don't wait to see symphony of light show, it's not fun at all
ไฟแสดงไม่คุ้ม เสียเวลา 30 นาทีเปล่าๆ ถ้าจะดูไปดูพาเหรดดิสนีย์คุ้มค่าที่เสียเวลากว่า ยิ่งปีนี้เป็นปีพิเศษครบรอบดิสนีย์ฮ่องกงด้วย ถ้ามาแล้วถ่ายรูปอย่างเดียวดีกว่า เพราะกว่าจะจบ รอบๆก็เตรียมตัวปิดร้านกันแล้ว ไปหาของกิน เดินช็อปห้างดีกว่า
One of the most spectacular skyline views I have seen. There cannot be many people who fail to stop and admire the view of the skyline at night, especially looking from Kowloon towards the Island.

Watched the Hong Kong Lights show. Saw it from the Felix Restaurant at the Peninsula Hotel, felt I had a
ringside seat. Wonderful to see.

Skyline is simply fantastic . This city is a perfect mix from New York and london. Has the advantage of the ferry which gives a great sensation of a big city with the special sunsets over the ocean. The bay is simply fascinating and the port of Hong Kong has such an immense size that is unnimaginable. The view at night from Kowloon is really something. This could be top ten cities of the world.

night show. we did a ferry ride during the day to have a look at the sky line and buildings, we also went and had a look at the night light show and found it very good there were lots of poeple and hard to get photos but the light show was well worth going to
2016 Trip. Second trip to Hong Kong and first time going to see the lights - easy to get to and very pretty sight over the harbour
Beautiful at night from Kowloon. It's magical to watch the junks come by and the ever-changing lights across the bay. Only better view in Hong Kong is from Victoria Peak. Don't miss it!

Spectacular View. The Hong Kong Island skyline is one of the most spectacular cityscapes in the world. It is more compact and dramatic when viewed from from across the water in Kowloon, over Victoria Harbour.
Top Skyline. You will not find a better skyline in the world especially with the dancing lights on the ICC tower at night. Fantastic from many different vantage points.
What you'd expect. It's quite impressive. The pictures tell the story. The ferry ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong City is inexpensive and fun and provides a great way to see the view.
Must see. It really impressive how the lights of Hong Kong can be. The horizon in colours is something that everybody who goes to HK must see.
Dazzling Light Show. A magnificent light display with neon lights and music of Honk Kong Skyline. A treat you don't want to miss.
woooow!. One can make amazing photos here! Hong Kong is often cloudy, so use the opportunity when you have clear sky.
Beautiful. A stunning sight day or night. Great views from the Star Ferry. The free light show at night is pretty good and quite beautiful.

wow. This is unquestionably the highlight of any Hong Kong trip. What's more, it's free! The main drawback is that at the season of this written work, the Avenue of the Stars is shut, which makes it more swarmed toward the dock portion of the waterfront.
mesmerizing. i could sit here all day and watch the world go by. the view is spectacular, ample seats the location is great for food and shopping

Awesome! . I was on a cruise ship when in Hong Kong and the views from the Diamond Princess was awesome . The views impressive during the day but at night the skyline came alive. The lights on the buildings were so lovely to watch with lazer lights you can see in the distance. I have seen some skylines and would have to say Hong Kongs was the most impressive. Enjoy
Bright Lights. The lit up skyline is spectacular at night. The many buildings have varied cools and shapes of lights. There are many good vantage points from Kowloon.

Impressive view. Easy to get ro Kowloon by star ferry or MTR, and just watching the city skyline is a treat. Every evening, their is a light show at 8pm, this is a free show and woth seeing at least one. Hong Kong is an impressive city and when the lifhts go on its grand.

Quite spectacular. We were impressed by our view of the skyline from our hotel. We had heard that there was a light show at night but were unable to see much of it from there. Later in the week we stayed in Kowloon and managed to see it from a premium spot down by the Ferry terminal. It started at 8pm. You need to get there earlier though to get the best position as parts of it are closed off if there are too many people, which there always are. It was an incredible light show with music, and lasers shot off the buildings etc. Amazing.

Great view of the HK bay. we came last night at Kowloon just after the star ferry, we had a great view round 7:30 pm, took great pictures and then from 8:00 pm during 20 minutes or so there was a light and sound show, which was nice at the beginning but far too long
Good day and night. Impressive by day and may be even more so at night - cross the water on the ferry to get the best views but get your photographs from land (less movement).
A real light show. A show you can't miss at all in Hong Kong, I saw it so many times in Hong Kong and I always love to come and watch it.

Nice looking. Yes it´s nice to look at the colourful buildings. The skylines looks nice in the nighttime. You can see it from the Kowloon side and when we were there it started every night at 8pm ( check the time) with some laser lights from the roof tops and other blinking lights. Nice.

Skyline good music rubbish. Worth seeing at night from mainland ... get off bus at Star Ferry pier and walk to Kowloon public pierMusic show was rubbish but lights were good. Still pics were great but not worth video

Clockwork. There really isn't anything like watching a giant city tick like clockwork and look so good doing it. Go watch the light show at 8pm every day, it's free. It was just unfathomable to me how well organized it all was.

Best In The World. I visit HK about five to six times per year and this amazing skyline always takes my breath away. No matter which direction you are looking at it from, still breathtaking. Lights, energy and excitement all add up to the magic of Hong Kong

Awesome view . No doubt Hongkong can offer a special and particular skyline, because looks old and modern at same time; while in China similar growing cities fight off each other to build more modern and aggressive building providing brand new and continuously changing landscapes, Hongkong skyline looks like the placid dean, the experienced senior brother that knows how to value tradition and history along with state of art solutions. So when viewing the modern but not new buildings, you breath a bit of tension and history and proud that makes this view different and special If you then watch the light show at night, this where you really enjoy the mix of beauty and expertise of amaze people that Hongkong will always demonstrate to you during all travel.

Absolutely Beautiful! Once the Clouds Clear.. Recently traveled to Hong Kong for business but had a little bit of time to get out and see the area. Although the majority of the time we were there it was pretty foggy and cloudy and the majority of the tops of buildings were obscured. The last night we were there, perfect timing, the clouds/fog cleared and we had the ability to get a perfect view of the Hong Kong skyline at night! Absolutely stunning!
Amazing.. By day or night it is surely the most impressive urban skyline on the planet. I went to the light show which is every night at 8:15pm, although it is a little naff it is still a cool sight.

Laser Show And Lights on Hong Kong Harbour. A Highlight of our recent trip to Hong Kong would have to be the Light Show on the Harbour. The show is best viewed from the water. Splendid Tours put on a great tour with unlimited drinks for one and a half hours on an old style Ship accompanied by an in depth commentary. This trip is accessed from Pier 9 Centro or pier 3 Kowloon
Out of sight . The HK skyline is not to be missed, especially at night. One of the most cosmopolitan cities in the planet, HK is world class, as is its architecture. Best seen Kowloon.

very impressive. There is a famed laser-light and sound show here every night. We saw the laser-lights from the ship and called it quits after about 10 minutes. No sound and a descending fog took the edge off the show. The sky-line is most impressive and the water-craft keep up their crazy choreography.

Beautiful skyline but the light show has gone downhill . The skyline of HK is amazing. No doubt. I like the view from Tsim Sha Tsui the best as the island boasts some of the more interesting skyscrapers. It's also lovely to see it at different times of the day. Having said that, the light show has gone downhill in the years since I saw it last (and I've seen it a few times) and I don't think it's worth a specific trip to see.
You have to be here to feel it. It is an excellent view irrespective from wherever you look at it. I think the best view is from the ferry ride.
Northern Lights. 8pm the start of the light show, get there early and find a nice place, to enjoy the view and the sea breeze
beautiful spellbinding tour. if you are in hongkong , please watch the Hongkong Skyline cruise. its just mindblowing and spellbinding trip to all. its too beautiful.

One of the most beautiful skylines in the world. It't not only a bunch of skyscrapers. It's a rich and colorful light show that every one of them performs, and together they form the Symphony of Lights - something amazingly beautiful that every Hong Kong visitor should see (starts a little after dark, google it for the specific schedule). The best places you can view the Hong Kong skyline are The Peak (but you actually see it from the back there, even though this is one of the most breathtaking views in the world), and from "the first row", standing on the Kowloon Promenade (where also the Avenue of Stars is located).

Just like the photos. Great viewing spot from Kowloon, all along the promenade overlooking Victoria Harbour. The well publicised free light show which is held every night at 8.00pm and lasts for twenty minutes, is worth a look at. Even more impressive at night with all the lights twinkling.
Just a view but a Must do. It is just a city view but it is a must do while in Hong Kong, it is also very interesting to see how grey the city is due to pollution.
A Honest Review. The show is free and its on every night.The show last about ten minutes,some great views on a clear night.
Splendid view, colorful and vibrant. Have a good camera to soak in the myriads of colors with the reflection on the water. It gives a true sense of a city wide awake at night, but calm and peaceful
Never gets old.... My favorite city view. It is bustling and gives you a sense of hypergrowth but still keeping nature alive since you see mountains and the sea.
Amazing view . Specially at the night with the lights of the high rise buildings and a walk there , simply amazing, you would need a professional camera to grab some good shots

mesmerising. Not really something you have to 'go to'. It's just there but it is the quintessential HK experience. We saw it from a number of different vantage points (top of the Ritz Carlton hotel, from the TST ferry and from Victoria Peak. Spellbinding both day and night.
Great skyline. Must see, especially the laser show at evening time. Many many high rise buildings along two side. Not much cities have this in the world.
lovely skyline. lovely to look at from victoria harbour. nice tall buildings, well lit, beautiful view at night. shouldn't be missed

It's a must!!!!. Heaven on earth. If you in Hongkong it's a must to see. I was there nearly every night of our stay. If you want to see the symphony of lights make sure to go there at least an hour early to get a good spot for a selfie

beautful lights. The Hong Kong sky line is beautiful especially at night when all the lights are shining so brightly. apparently they have a light show at 8pm every night but we went there 2 nights and missed it both times - not sure how but could not catch it or maybe didn't know where to look - regardless of this its a lovely view to be had
Night view is superb. The HK skyline view at night is superb. The array of modern buildings all lit up along the harbour is impressive. Gr8 place to click pictures of what HK is known for.

Hong Kong - A fascinating and exciting city. Hong Kong has something for everyone. The skyline however is something that no other city has. Best place to take in this magnificent skyline is either on Victoria Peak or go to the Kowloon side and walk along the Avenue of Stars. If you like photography, both points are perfect for amazing photography. I know that some people find the light show somewhat disappointing, but it really appreciate it, book a table in the Sheraton Hotel’s 18th Floor Oyster Bar and take in this light show while classical music is played.... It will not disappoint.
Awesome. Great pictures and beautiful to view at all times of the day or night. You can get great shots from Kowloon island if you visit there.
Victoria Harbour. At our visit the harbour was a bit misty but still very impressive lovely restaurants and shops - friendly people -

Beautiful by day, spectacular by night.. The HK skyline, viewed from Kowloon side is a spectacular array of modern skyscraper buildings, with the busy harbour in the foreground, and Victoria Peak as the backdrop. After dark the buildings light up to make it a different and even more impressive spectacle.

Wonderful sight .. I had been to Hong Kong earlier but missed the sight . at night all the skyscrapers light up with colorful lights & the beautiful sky adds to the beauty with the waves playing & cool wind blowing. At 8pm they have a laser & music show which is really enthralling . perfect place for photography lovers . don't forget to carry a windcheater in case it rains .
Perfect view from Top. From the Peak Tram to the Sky 368, the view was breathtaking. Despite the heavy fog, we still managed to get magnificent photos before the thick fog covered the low lands.

A must-go place to take a photo and show you've been to Hong Kong. The Hong Kong skyline is unlike any other with the dense skyscrapers and backdrop of Victoria Peak. You can easily find a spot to take a photo around Tsim Sha Tsui, though it gets busy around 7pm - 8pm with people camping out for the 8pm lightshow. It gets dark fairly quickly so we took a daytime photo around 6:45pm and nighttime photo at 7:30pm.Speaking of which, I personally found the lightshow to be somewhat underwhelming. We ended up leaving just before it finished to avoid the exit crowds.
Beautiful free sight. You have to pop down to the see the skyline, from Kowloon side at night. It's fabulous. Don't hang around for the light show though - it's not worth it!

Skyline view !. This is by far the best thing to do in Hong Kong and it's also free! Go to Kowloon side and you get a beautiful view of the city's skyline. If you're feeling adventurous, take the nearby ferry! Come here at night, sunrise, sunset, and during the day for 30 minutes to take some gorgeous photos!
Night Scenary. Different view from Morning and Night view. Go Hong Kong confirm need to go here take photos. Super nice view..

Stunning views. The night time skyline is well worth seeing. At 8pm each night there is a light show which gets quite crowded for what it is. If you are there, go and see it, but don't make a special effort. It lasts 10 minutes these days and is rather disappointing.

Best seen from the sea.. We had a Harbour cruise in the evening as dusk fell. The profiles of the skyscrapers, many of the with dramatic lighting effects, is quite amazing. The very tallest tower in Kowloon has a light and music show, although in HK no music was heard. It's a must.

Hong Kong's Picture View. Symphony of Lights - world largest light and sound show. Starts daily at 8.00pm to 8.14pm. it is a Unique show of its own kind.You can get its best view from Tsim Tsha Shui waterfront.I rate this average because sound and narrations are negligible and are not in English on Daily basis. Hong Kong Tourist board surely needs to work on this to make it more attractive for International tourists.Rest if it's your first time in Hong Kong than you should visit it irrespective of sound issues.
its cloudy.. its cloudy and raining so i didn't that see much :'(There’s some photographers and that can "remove" that cloud in their photo but the price its kinda pricey more $200 for one photo.

Beautiful view day or night. You could spend hours just looking at it! The laser lights reflects in the waters. Try looking at it from Harbour City's Ocean Terminal or from Avenue of Stars, if you don't have a hotel room with the view.
Lovely view of the HK skyline. If you are at HK, you cannot miss to view the skyline. The best time is around 7 pm where you can witness the awarded sound and light show.

Marvelous. Butiful exciting skyline revealed at evening time.
All lented with butiful lights
Loved it emensly.
A celebration to the eyes

Nothing like Buffalo NY. This spectacular skyline backdropped by mountains and fronted by the historic harbor is amazing. One of the best skylines in the World. Even surpasses the premier skyline in the US, Buffalo NY known for its breath taking views
Amazing. Amazing to see and was one of the highlights of my shirt trip to Hong Kong. not to be missed, though you can probably skip the light show, it's over rated.
Spectacular viewing. What a way to end your hectic day - sitting at the waterfront watching the wonderful lights while sipping your favourite tipple. Bliss!

Beautiful as usually. Eastern pearl is their name ! It is very match! Especially night time you will see all the building night on it look like all difference pears BB in the sky Mountains , building boats and ferry light create a beautiful picture! Very lovely pearl!

Always Changing, Always New. The HK skyline always seems to have something more to look at and enjoy, both day and night. The laser lights, the ships, the helicopters,the illuminated buildings (especially at Christmas) always provide and endlessly changing panorama

Don't miss it. This is definitely the highlight of any Hong Kong trip. And it's free! The only downside is that at the time of this writing, the Avenue of the Stars is closed, which makes it a bit more crowded toward the pier segment of the waterfront.
Beautiful View Day and Night. If you are debating whether or not to go to Hong Kong and are looking for a reason; just go, you are sure to enjoy it. The skyline is very nice and worth the trip.
Nice to experience at least once. Not mind blowing but definitely a good experience. Such a lovely way to see HK from a ferry. My husband and I enjoyed it :)
Stunning. We saw this from the red sailed ship as an evening treat but also from the Kowloon side via the Star Ferry. Either way is stunning and great evening show for free!
Breathtaking. Walk down towards the star ferry on Kowloon for the best views. Never fails to impress. Take a panoramic picture from the nearby viewing platform.

Awesome attraction that can be enjoyed for free. Hong Kong has one of the most breathtaking skylines among the big cities I have visited. The towering skyscrapers against a backdrop of majestic mountains make a sight to behold.

Just Breathtaking. The views from Kowlon across the harbour at night is just breathtaking. Exactly how you hope it would be...and it is. If you are staying in Hong Kkng the Star Ferries drop you in Kowloon and all you have to do is turn around and look back.
A must do on your trip to Hong Kong.

Beautiful Skyline. Stunning views from the Kowloon side. We went at about 8pm to watch Symphony of Lights. It was extremely busy but we didnt have a problem finding a place to watch this great light show.

Really great view. A definite must see, especially the laser light show at night over on Kowloon. Within the ships and ferries shuttle back and forth to Kowloon and the view of the mountains surrounding Hong Kong is something everyone should take a moment to see.
Nice sky line. Any where in hongkong you can enjoy the skylines but it is most beautiful from harbour and from the little mount reached by tram ride
Gorgeous Skyline. While I can't say I fell in love with Hong Kong, the skyline is really something and if you like post modern architecture you'll love many of the building.
What a View. This view totally made it worth the trip. Sweeping views and long walks make this a very romantic destination. One of my favorite places.

One of the best skylines worldwide. Spectacular view at night.. Hong Kong Skyline is easily the most dense one in the world (perhaps except NY). There are three best places to enjoy the view.The first one is at the Victoria's Peak, where you could have a nice fine dinner while enjoying the view of this concrete city. After your visit, you could take the tram down the mountain and get to central.The second place is at the Avenue of Stars at Tsim Sha Tsui. It's gonna be a romantic walk along the shore with the spectacular light shows in Central reflected in the river. The third place is at the 360 view deck at ICC at West Kowloon. You could reserve for a afternoon tea / dinner there and enjoy the panorama with your loved one. I brought my boyfriend to dinner at this place and we had a great time. It's pretty cold inside though, just like anywhere else indoor in HK. Oh wait, the food is not that great considering the price, and you usually need to book weeks ahead to secure a place.Let's get back to the skyline... the best skyline I've ever visited is the one in Shanghai! You will know why when you visit it!
Hong Kong Skyline. I love the Hong Kong Skyline as viewed from many different venues. No doubt my favorite views are from the Star Ferries.
Great view looking from TST to the Island. If your staying in Kowloon, (TST), looking across the harbor at night to Hong Kong Island is a real trip.

Breathtaking !!!. I had the chance to travel to Hong Kong on a ferry coming from Shunde, Guangdong. So I had the opportunity to see Hong Kong' both sides of its amazing skyline simultaneously. Simply breathtaking. But don't let anyone tell you taht Hong Kong is very small and one day is enough to see most of it. It's not, believe me.

Very nice. Every time I go to Hong Kong I don't miss it at all!
8 o'clock starts the light show.you can see it from the port or from one of the restaurants in the buildings.
If you go to Hutong a beautiful and really good Chinese restaurant you can really enjoy the skyline!
Nice. HK is famous for its skyscrapers. However in my opinion dubai has better skyline than HK. But still worth a visit.

Hong Kong Skyline - Fantastic . Hong Kong Skyline is one the most beautiful sites that you can ever visit. There is an array of hotels (Ikon, InterContinental, Shangri-la, Conrad etc) provide breathtaking views of the Skyline.
It's comes with extra charge for the views but it's worth it. At night, it's looks like a dream and majestic.

Take your selfie and leave. Right now, due to construction, it is hard to navigate the waterfront. The lights are nice, but Hong Kong could do much better. Only a few of the main buildings have changing lights, Though it is a beautiful skyline. The breeze is great. So take the selfie and go to dinner
One of the best views in the world.... Take a couple of minutes from enjoying the hectic pace of Hong Kong, stand back and enjoy this view. Simply stunning...

Best when there is a clear sky with no haze. Great at all times of the day or night but obviously best without the haze.At night it is great to get the star ferry as you have amazing views. A lovely relaxing view, and on Sundays, many of the local art schools sit on the TST promenade to paint the skyline which is always interesting.The light show is best when it is not christmas time/chinese new year, as the buildings on the skyline have their own lights during these times, which detracts from the light shows, as the show does not stand out as obviously.A great skyline, only rivalled by Shanghai, the bund. Also Singapore but thats a bit different in style.
Nice walk . Just finished eating out and decided to walk along skyline. You can really good views at night. It a nice walk you can walk for ages because there is always something to see.

View it from the Intercontinental hotel. There is no way to describe the Hong Kong skyline by night other than to stand back and simply say WOW! The biggest WOW for me was sitting in the lounge in the Intercontinental Hotel with a beer and a sandwich and just soaking up the view and the sights.

Very Good View. View of the Hong Kong Skyline from Victoria Harbour is mesmerising. If you have a good camera, then you have the options to click some most memorable pictures, with amazing lights in the background.
Iconic and colourful.. This is really what I went to Hong Kong to see. It is amazing but don't bother with the Symphony of Lights as nothing much really happens to enhance the view.

Very beautiful-must see. Symphony of light is one thing you must see-everyday at 20;00 at the harbour.There is a special deck from where you can watch the show.Also from sky 100 or the peak are possible options where you can observe the light show.

gorgeous at night!. Visited July 2014. This is so worth a trip to Hong Kong. Once its dark it is amazing to see all the buildings lit up and highlighting the skyline. We fortunately got warm and dry weather to see it in so it made it all the better!

Relax and enjoy the view. Excellent place to spend your evening. There is a skylight show from 8 to 8:20 pm in the evening everyday, nothing much special about it but lot of people gather to watch it. So don't miss it.
Run, Walk or just sit back in the one of the plenty of spots available there and just enjoy the evening.

Skyline. Wow, wow what a lovely sight. Our room was overlooking the harbour, and the lights from the buildings, boats and ferries were amazing especially on Saturday evening. There were green laser beams over the river, reflections from buildings and boats cruising up and down. I bought postcards of this as my camera just wouldn't have done it justice.

Beautiful. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful. It is quite smoggy during the day, but you can see the lights at night. Watching the light show at night was quite neat. There was music playing to the movement of the lights. I really didn't like the huge crowds. It was hard to get around. We found a spot to watch the light show only to be pushed out of the way by a family. I would do it again anytime. It is a must.
impressive views at night. There are some impressive views of it at night, from both shores. You should take the ferry across after dark, it's surely worth it and doesn't cost too much.

Best view in the world!!. There is not a better skyline view in the world. See it at dusk for hues of peach dancing off the silver buildings, Enjoy it from the Star Ferry as you trundle slowly across the harbour. Have a cocktail and watch the sun go down. Any way, it's a delight!

Very pretty view across the harbour. I stayed in Kowloon and paid a little extra for a harbour view. It was totally worth the handful of extra money each night: Seeing that skyline view of Central in the evening before I went to bed, then again as the first thing I saw in the morning was super cool. I think the Shanghai Pudong skyline is a little more dynamic, but the HK skyline is one of my favorite views in the world.
Something else. It is a sight to behold. Really something out of the movies and rather captivating. There are many great spots around town to catch the views. Best to observe from the mainland side.

One of the great skylines of the World. We have seen it twice, 19 years apart! We have yet to see it in full sunlight, still it is magnificent with the wizardry and harmony of high-rises carved out of the jungle, a freeway that winds around the island built over the water. We also went over to the Kowloon Public Pier to view the Symphony of Light and Sound at 8PM. A little hokey, but still great fun, especially mingling with the crowds which manage to be friendly despite being jammed together.
Perfect palce.. Very good place to.vist with all the family the place is so beautiful that i just felt so relaxed and the sunset is so beautiful
Great views at night . Gorgeous views at night of HK skyline on clear night. Beautiful. Easy to walk around. Highly recommend on your site visits around HK
Stunning. Hk at night. ..wonderful view. The 8pm light and laser show may not seem as good as years ago. ..but still worth a watch. Stunning views of a still fabulous city
Excellent Skyline. The view if the weather is clear is amazing. I think it look better at night lit up with wonderful colours across the night sky.
See it from TST!. Go down to TST and see the skyline from the waterfront at 20.00 when they have the light and sound show! Also very good view from Star ferry - go at dusk to get good pictures.

Symphony of Lights. Definitely a must see if you are travelling to Hong Kong. You can walk to the harbour at the end of Nathan road and experience this amazing light show for free or if you want an inexpensive view ftom the water jump on board a Star Ferry for only $2AUD
amazing view. it has really amazing view if the weather is clear so we can see the city. but since its cloudy and haze when i visit, i barely cannot see anything :(

Contrasting city scapes. We sailed into Hong Kong, arriving at the Kai Tak cruise terminal at 08.00. This makes use of the former runway of the now-closed Kai Tak airport when the new Lantau facility opened. Prior to docking, the sail in enabled us to see some of Hong Kong Island's less modern areas, something usually out of the tourists' view.Because there was said to be a shortage of taxis waiting at the cruise terminal, which turned out to be the case, we had booked a private transfer to the Novotel Citygate hotel.
Very atractive wiew . If you have spend night in hongkong you need to look from kawloon to hongkong awesome feelings you will have the lights of the skyscrapers magneficiant so must see

Laser show. By day, the fog shrouded the giants nestled along the shoreline but lifted as the laser show began. Perspective is fooled by the massive array of skyscrapers following the line of Victoria harbour. Day two revealed their paler, concrete bulk. By night, it is a unique spectacle of colour, size and silence apart from the Star ferry weaving across the ever closing harbour gap, as land reclamation continues. Watch the lights and lasers from the Harbour City shopping mall - as good a view as from a harbour cruise. Look out for the remaining junks with red sails, lit up at night. The wattage is phenomenal. What must it look like from space?

One of the must see sights. This is not just a must see for Hong Kong, it is one of the world's must see sights- one of the great urban vistas. Hong Kong is so humid and smoggy that the harbour view is pretty grey by day, but these factors do not effect the night view, which is an amazing display of light and colour. The laser display each night at 8pm is worth catching if you can, but not essential.The view is best from the Kowloon side looking toward the Island. Very often the Peak is very crowded to ascend, and even in cloud, but you need not feel short changed if you at least see the Harbour at night from the Kowloon waterfront.

Twinkling Stars on the Ground. Amazing skyscrapers from the airport to the seaports! At night the view from the Peak reminds you of twinkling stars on the ground...imagine the vast number of people living in this small island adding their own glitter in their own way.
hong kong april 2016. This is a very good viewfrom the promenade at the Star ferry terminal Kowloon side.The best time is on a clear day.

Great for Photos. The view was beautiful for it shows different skyscrapers of Hong Kong. It is great for picture taking. We went there during the middle of the day and the temperature is quite high. Please wear sun block if you will visit this place the same time we did.The sky is clear the time of our visit. Year of visit is 2009 with 7 other family members. I will visit this place again but during night time

Wall of light. Hong Kong is built on free enterprise. The wall of light you see at night across the Harbour is an advertisement for the power of capitalism. Hong Kong is one of the most prosperous places on earth. It has pulled itself up from a low-level manufacturing economy in the space of 50 years. Britain may have left Hong Kong, but their ethic of non-interference and liberty is still the ethic of Hong Kong. You can take a junk (Chinese fishing boat) tour is you want, but it is not really necessary. I love the lights, and as they say, where there's light there's hope.

Quite smoggy/foggy. So far the two days I've been here, the sky has been quite smoggy and foggy. Nice skyline, but air quality is too bad to really enjoy it. Definitely can get better skyline view at other major cities around the world such as Sydney and Auckland.
UNIQUE VIEW. Great place, the only one of its kind in Southeast Asia.Skyscrapers exciting and very high in a very charming landscape ... all this is Hong Kong!The Blade Runner city ...

Beautiful Skyline view from Tsim Sha Tsui. Just go to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station and walk to the Promenade. Be there at 8 PM to see the lights show (nothing amazing but it is nice...).
Skyline itself is already worth it.
Breathtaking. A wonderful display of lights, boats, water and incredible buildings. The skyline by day or night is a major attraction.

Light and Sound Show. The skyline is dazzling anytime of the day.Every evening there is a Light and Sound Show at 8 pm/20 hours. It lasts about fifteen minutes. It is best to see it at the Harbourside in Kowloon. The lights are on the buildings on the Hong Kong side. The Harbourside in Kowloon is always busy so come early to get a good place. Even with many people it is easy to see the lights on the Hong Kong side.

Wow!!!. Wow wow wow, normally I write long reviews but this one people, just go and see it's free to view the lazers the skyline matches anything around the world best part is though crossing the ferry for 2 HK dollars and that's it!!! Honestly best time in HK go view and get the best snapshot you can..
Very nice view. It's very nice to have a picture taken from victoria harbour. Both day time and night time would give a nice photo.

World's Most Recognizable Skyline!!!. Once you have been to HK - you will never forget this skyline - specially if you are there about 8:00pm for the light show. Get there early and find a good viewing spot - the show is a site to behold.

The Best Skyline in the World.. The nightly light show and skyline just can't be beat.  Water. People. Lights. People. Architecture. People. Ships. Oh ya, there are more people too. But it is simply the best skyline show in the world.
Beautiful. One of the all time best skylines in the world. The diversity of buildings and lights make this a memorable view.

Night Light Display. We were fortunate enough to have a reasonably clear night to see the light display on the buildings along Victoria Harbour which was wonderful to watch and to see the sailing boats with their sails up was something to be seen.

Not as cool as it looks in pictures. Cool to see but the light show is not as exciting as it appears in photos. However it is a nice boat ride if the weather is nice. The water tours company has unlimited drinks for like $45 US.

Light show a fizzer. We kept hearing about how we shouldn't miss the nightly light show at the Harbour while in Hong Kong. So we settled in at a great vantage point and waited for 8pm. Some green laser lights beamed out from four buildings for a few minutes and that was it. Massive fizzer. The only upside was not taking our travel agents advice of a boat tour to witness the light show from the harbour. What a waste of money that would have been. But there is no doubt the harbour itself at night is impressive.

One of the best Skylines in the world. Hong Komg has definitely one of the best skylines in the world if you ask me.From the Tsim Tsa Tsui side you have the best view. Go to the deck next to the clock tower so that you can sit there and enjoy the view.This time I watched the light show as well. I expected a lot because a lot of buildings are part of the show. Unfortunately it was not as special as I expected. The lights were very little.But if you have 15 minutes left, you could always watch the show. The show starts at eight pm. Make sure you are there in time since it is very busy!
Cool. It's as good as it looks in the photos. There is something magical about the HK skyline. I recommend you view it both from up on Victoria Peak and via the Star Ferry.
see the light show every night. Free light show every night plus Hong Kong never sleeps so even if it is dark you are quite safe walking along Victoria Harbor or across the bay in Tsim Sha Tsui

Beautiful skyline. Great to watch the Symphony of Lights from Kowloon over the Hong Kong Island.This is a nightly thing, so don't miss it.Even though when we visited it was very foggy the lights were still very beautiful.After the light show, enjoy a nice walk along the harbour foreshore.

Spectacular views, not so amazing picture upsell. The views are amazing but if i could see them in a different manner, I'd prefer that. The long lines, minimum time allowed on the deck and bad pictures they take make this a 3-star attraction. Not a must if you can see the views from a different area.

The most beautiful city skyline in the world..... See it best from the Peak Galleria or the Bowen Road Running Trail. You can easily get a taxi up or walk from Hong Kong University if you are staying in the Central area and want to avoid the busy queues for the tram.
Great view. The best spot to watch Hong Kong skyline is at victoria harbour where you can get to see the entire stretch of skyscraper along Hong Kong island.

Best things to see in HK . Don't miss out HK skyline! The best location where to experience the skyline is on Kowloon side close to TST pier. Go there just before the sunset, you will be amazed by the colours that this city can give you. Just be sure to be there on time as this place attracts many tourists looking for the best place to sit. Stay there also when the sun is down and it gets really dark. The view is fabulous with the city lights. At 8 every evening you can enjoy the light show!
Nice view. A nice view from the cruise of the city skyline. There is a permanent show called symphony of lights which was a treat to watch.
Stunning. Iconic yes and definitely a stunning view. A very nice photo opportunity on a clear night. Don't forget to charge your phone!
Unique. Viewed from the roof top at the Grand Harbour hotel, Kowloon. Possible to see brightly lit boats in the harbour as well as the vividly lit HK island

great. The skyline is great to see the whole of the city and also the show in the evening,most of the view points get very busy at night,as everyone seems to want to take night photos.
It is a nice relaxing way to view the whole city

Must see before the lights turn off by 11 pm. Great from locations. A lot of scenic bars or restaurants at varying price points. Best view is from Tsim Sha Tsui side right by the water in front of the museum there is a scenic Boardwalk.
Wooowwww what a great city. It is unbelievable how many skyscrapers there are in hongkong and you see them all over the place. The light show is great but not really spectecular.

The skyline is particularly good at night. The famous Hong Kong skyline attracts many tourists and it is especially beautiful at night. There is a light show every evening and if there is some mist around it is lovel

Awesome View. Wherever you stand in Kowloon the view of the Hong Kong is quite awesome. Lots of different heights of buildings and different coloured lights. Every night there is a laser show - from both sides of the harbour. I first saw it 23 years ago, but it is every bot as magical now and no doubt it will be late this year when we will visit again.

Classic. Always great to view the spectacular skyline and harbor. Truly a classic nighttime skyline view. If you can afford a hotel 'harbor view' room go for it. If not there are many vantage points in HK to enjoy the views.

Must be the best Skyline in the world!. Spectacular skyline, especially at night and from Kowloon. If you are in Central get the Star Ferry to Kowloon to take pictures. Fantastic view from the ferry boat as well. A must do and ridiculously cheap on the ferry.

Just Wow. The best location to enjoy this place would be on the steps near the sea. If you are facing the skyline, it's on your right side. You get a complete unobstructed view of the skyline and also a great spot toPlace your camera for amazing pics or videos. There is a music and lights show called symphony of Lights which takes place everyday that you can completely avoid, although it's free. I have never seen a lighting show more boring than this. Just the skyline by itself is good enough to enjoy the place.

Impressive, festive and beautiful!. Every night from 8pm from the next 15 min you can enjoy Light and music show at the Victoria Harbour. Be sure come a little earlier to get a good spot. The best view is near art centre.
light show. The skyline was strategically illuminated and beautiful. Taking a walk along the harbor was also refreshing. It's nice place to visit during the day and in the evening.

Amazing in night. The avenue of Heavens, is just awesome. You should visit it on a clear night sky , with no overcast.. When you see the heavens start meet with Hong Kong skyline, its an awesome sight... Must visit

Best free entertainment ever!. Nightly at 8.00pm, the harbour lights up. View TST just next to the ferry terminal with musical accompaniment or try the Eye bar in I square. External terrace with cocktails and finger food. Reasonably priced. Or more upmarket the bars in the Peninsular or at 1 Peking Rd.
Hong Kong Skyline on New Years Eve. We stay at the Harbour Grand Hotel on New Years Eve. The view of the Fire Works on new years eve was spectacular. A must on anyone's bucket list.

Wow Experience !!!. Hong Kong Skyline is worth the experience specially if done at evening. The view is splendid. Specially the mirror effect of the lights of the building over is sea is beautiful....
Stunning!. Hong Kong skyline is stunning and we were lucky enough to get that view form our bedroom. A modern city where everything is always on the move.
Hong Skyline Laser Show. A highly overated show. Strongly recommend to be watched from the shoreline don't take the cruise to see this show it is now worth a dollar.

Seen a 100 times, amazes me every single time. I have seen the Hong Kong skyline a 100 times and it is never boring. To me the view is most picturesque when there are blankets of clouds covering the top of the higher buildingws. Mesmerizing!

One of the most beautiful Skyline. Very nice from the Avenue of Stars in Kowloon or from one of the restaurants with a view. But best from the aqua luna boat where you can take a drink while cruising in Victoria Harbour.

Spectacular skyline -- visit by day and return by night. Victoria Peak, or "The Peak," as locals call it, offers a beautiful vista of one of the world's most famous and distinctive skyline. We took a day tour which incorporated a stop and a tram ride, then returned by evening to see the sparkling lights of this high-rise, skyscraper haven. Wow! Definitely part of any Hong Kong visit. And we recommend seeing it both by day and night.
Skyline in the night. Hong Kong skyline is typical big city skyline, but small difference is between Kowloon and Hong Kong side, better view is from Kowloon side.

Great FREE Activity to do in Hong Kong. Nothing beats taking in Hong Kong than enjoying the beautiful Hong Kong skyline. HK takes pride in its skyline with beautiful decorations all along the board walk and at night around 8:30 you should be able to catch the free laser light show. Get there early to get a good spot.

stunning skyline. HK's skyscrapers are stunning especially when you look at them from kowloon. there is a light & sound show nightly at 8 pm. it is free for everyone. the show is fine if you happen to be there at the time. it can be so-so or even boring if you have to come all the way from hongkong side just to watch it. i prefer the skyline of manhattan in NY but Hk obviously has the most concentration of skyscrapers in the world. (it is unfair to compare 2 cities, there is no such light & sound show in manhattan by the way).

So vast and different. We boarded our boat with a group of families, couples and single travellers. Very safe and timely. To see the lights on the buildings was interesting but not as fascinating as seeing the scale of residential towers along the shoreline and the intensity of development.
Well worth your time to vier. Quite a view to behold in the day or at night. Get down to the harbour for the nightly light show with commentary its well worth fifteen minutes of your time.

Beautiful View. What a great setting with huge skyscrapers on the bay and mountains as the backdrop. The best view we had was on the Kowloon side looking across Victoria Harbour at Central Hong Kong. We took a ferry which was only $2.8HK one way, well worth it for the view.
8pm. Lighting and music show available at 8pm daily. Be here earlier to get a good spot for the photography session. Awesome view !
What sky?. Hong Kong Skyline good at nightfall however during the day too much smog dos not see the sun or proper cloud formations
Hong Kong Skyline Amazing view. Hong Kong Skyline is night time & noon time have different taste.. I suggest take both experience. Amazing view , amazing feelings.. Take Hong Kong 7/24 energy

Hong Kong Nights. The Hong Kong skyline by night is magnificent despite the somewhat disappointing laser light show. We were told there were fireworks every night but that was not the case the night we visited. Still, there are few skylines in the world to compare with this one and the colorful lights make it a visit well worthwhile.

Loved it. HONG KONG is one of the greatest travel surprises...I expected to like it. To find it interesting.To be intriguing...it's all that and more. Crowded,noisy,busy,exciting defines it. Spectacular skyline. A shocking amount of green space and quiet can also be found.The sights,the smells, the restaurants,the food...the people.Go!

Amazing Skyline. The Avenue of Stars is nice to walk along, even if you are not familiar with asian celebrities. And you can enjoy the Laser light show, which starts every day at 20:00 o'clock. It is worth seeing, but can not be compared with a Pink Floyd concert, for example ;-D
Stunning. Exactly as you expect - quite spectacular. I thought it was best seen from the Star Ferry or the lobby of the Intercontinental
A mega city. The skyline is an amazing site. Magnificent architectural masterpieces light up the sky. The vista is a sight to behold.

Maybe the best skyline in Asia. One of the best ways to see the metropolitan city of Hong Kong is to admire the skyline at night. Be sure to catch the lightshow at 8PM best seen from Victoria Harbour.

great by day or night. This is a spectacular harbour, if you're lucky and get a clear day the harbour is lovely. Each evening the light show runs and can be seen best from near the star ferry terminal.
Unforgettable. With no doubts one of the most impressive skylines in the world. Every evening at 8pm there is a nice show with lights and music.
Beautiful skyline . We went there at 730 pm it was little raining and very mist hard to see some lighting. Best to see the skyline near the museum in Kowloon.

Mesmerizing. They have fireworks every night at 8pm and from this view point they are spectacular!! You could come over for the show and then spend the rest of the evening eating from food cart and walking around people watching and just enjoying the atmosphere.
Lights . The skyline is amazing either day or night the building are so tall all different shapes and sizes but at night they all come alive its such a beautiful sight not to be missed

HK skyline by night is amazing, but avoid overrated light show. The HK skyline is amazing and it is worth making your way over to TST via star ferry or mtr before it starts getting dark to enjoy the view. Do it before the masses descend for the symphony of light show which happens every day at 8pm. You will be surrounded by hundreds of people. That show is overhyped and will disappoint you.

Great views. At 8pm every evening, there is a lightshow accompanied by music. Best viewed besides the STAR ferry terminal Kowloon side. Get there 5-10 minutes earlier to ensure a decent place on the viewing platform.
Had a perfect view from our hotel room. Pay extra for a hotel room overlooking the Victoria harbour, it is worth is. We were fortunate to have the full moon as well.

Best view in the world of cityscape. Can't beat the views. It makes me smile every time we see it. Love the dramatic view of the buildings and passim boats especially those beautiful red sails. Never get bored watching it.

Solid. As beautiful as metropolitan skylines can be. The only reason why it's not a 5 star rating is because it can be inconvenient getting to it from the HK Island side (especially these days while construction is occurring in Wanchai).

The best night skyline in the world. The intensity of light source, the landscape of buildings, and the reflection of colours of all these on Victoria Harbour against the dark blue sky makes the most impressive skyline in a vibrant city like Hong Kong. The best place to look at the view is to go up to The Peak, but if you are running out of time, you can stroll along Stars Avenue to enjoy a zoomed picture. Hope for good weather and get your camera ready.
Beautiful skyline . You can catch an 8pm light show at star ferry. It wasn't anything spectacular but just looking at the skyline, it was still a nice stroll along the pier.

Stunning!. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I stayed in the Panorama Hotel in Tsimshatsui with a high room and fantastic view of the Hong Kong Island skyline. It was a pleasure seeing it in the daytime, and absolutely gorgeous at night. Lots of colorful lights and interesting buildings set against the hills.2 thumbs up!
Must in hk. Bunch of buildings aligned in a shore.. But hey it's free and you'll have the picture that you need to say that you came to Hong Kong

Worth doing once, but perhaps overrated. There is a program every night that involves lighting waterfront buildings and adding sound starting around 8pm the day we were in town. They mix various kinds of LED, flood lights and green lasers.It's free and interesting, but not as exciting in my mind as a great fireworks display. One of the problems in HK is that the humidity and air pollution limit the number of days when you can actually see the other side of the harbor. When a good day finally arrives, there is a lot of pent up demand and the crowds make it hard to get a good view. In our 7 days in HK, we had only one day when the air was clear. The crowd on the Kowloon side (probably the better views are from Kowloon) were 6 to 10 deep and about every other person had a selfie stick for their camera. PLan on being at the waterfront an hour before the show.The show runs around 12 minutes. I expected a better light display, so my wife and I are probably in the minority that this is overrated.

Wrong time of year, a bit cloudy and hazy, laser light show was lost in the clouds.. April not great , cloudy and low cloud, lazer light show lost in the cloud. No rain, we went on a boat which took us around the harbour, if you like big boats there is plenty there.
Amazing show. Every night you can see spectacular light show. Very nice for making cool pictures. At night the city looks very different,so everyone who goes to Hong Kong should see it.

A future of beauty and damnation. A must see for any globetrotter the skyline of Hong Kong is both intimate and monolithic drawing its aesthetic pedigree from blade runner and matripolis this is a glimpse into our urban future. High rise and technologically ground braking not even the most fanciful futurologist could dream up such an eclectic distopic harmony of needs versus necessity

Had this view from my hotel. At night, the view was magical and my hotel room looked straight over at it across the harbour. On weekends, they have a laser light show as well which is quite magical, definitely worth looking out for
One of the worlds best night views. Victoria harbour at night is awesome with the lights and lasers on the hi rise buildings outstanding

Great evening view of Hong Kong city. Great evening view of Hong Kong city. Strolling along the water will be great. Or catch a boat ride.City lights show is okay initially, but becomes boring after a while. Overrated

one of the best in the world.... yes I am biased...but the skyline on a clear nigh is stunning with all the various tall buildings being lit up and the laser show at 8 pm...stunning, unique, beautiful
Best skyline.. Hong Kong is known for it's skyline and it doesn't disappoint. Night skyline is amazing. The light show at 8pm shows some colors.

Hong Kong Island Skyline at night. This is probably the best city skyline in the world especially at night. To admire it, you can either take a ride on the Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui which will set you back for about US$0.30 (yes, it is 30 US cents, not a typo). Alternatively, you can admire it from a walk along the promenade along Tsim Sha Tsui East, which is free. However, summer nights can be a bit hot and humid.

Wow ! Just wow !. Every time I visit HK, I always come and see the skyline, had done so for years !! It is awesome especially night time when it is lit up! If you visit HK remember to come see this - you'll be amazed for sure !
Amazing. HK skyline is something you can't miss from anywhere in the harbour. From Kowloon to HK Island, the unique buildings and lights make it extremely photogenic. Very colorful and vibrant.
the ultimate city view. its an iconic view, seen on posters across the world, the light show every night is brilliant, a must see
Taking the boat is worth it. Just take the boat from either side and get your camera ready. The skyline view is something that you just don't have in Europe

Place to buy Suits. While looking for a restaurant we were offered hand made suits, made to order, my son got a suit, shirt and two ties for $300. It was very well made and was delivered to our hotel the next day

One of the most beautiful skylines in the world. With phenomenal views of the Hong Kong Peak behind , this is one of the most beautiful skylines in the world...amazing views at sunset and at night when the lights come up in all the high rise building , dominated by Banks and financials institutions ..the evening light show is totally worth the wait ..however it would be nice to reach and take up a place before sunset so that you could enjoy stunning views of the sun setting on the extreme right hand side ...

Day or night. HK's skyline is fascinating during the day and brilliant at night.Made with bamboo scaffolding, the HK skyline is dramatic and features generations of buildings with unique character. It's a telling symbol of this fascinating 'world' city.

Great even in fog. We saw this skyline from our hotel in Kowloon, on a dinner cruise around the harbor and from the Glasshouse Restaurant on HK island. It is a great way to get a proper view and feel of both sides of the city. We have been to Tokyo but still found the city beautiful and impressive. Weather was foggy but didn't remove any of the beauty or hinder the building light display too much. A must see!

Pretty from victoria's peak. the skyline view from Victoria's peak was awesome! but make sure you go on day when it is not hazy otherwise you will not be able to see anything. it was a much nicer skyline than I thought hong kong would have especially because it looks out over water.

Beautiful and nice with music. The first night I was having dinner at a place with habour view and I could not notice it. Apparently you need to be outside then the music and lights will make a big difference :)
Evening Light Show. We watched the evening light show from a boat ride along the river.It was enjoyable but March is very cold,so beware and ensure that you are well wrapped up!

Amazing scenic view. Highly recommend you to visit at night, the lightening of the building make the scene wonderful !
Also keep moving around the promenade as the view differs from a place to another :)

We stayed in the hotel Ibis in North point. The views generally are wonderful from The Star ferry, from our hotel, from the restaurants and bars in Hong Kong station the Imc mall and from the Peak. All very good all very spectacular.
World's best night view. You can always find different views from different locations. You may see it from both side of waterfront. You may also see it from The Peak.
Beautiful Hong Kong. Hong Kong skyline is always beautiful. I have been there many times and each time I can sit and watch for hours.
This is a MUST!. If you happen to be lucky enough to be in Hong Kong like us then visit this place it will really knock your socks off!

Beautiful skyline, beautiful light show. Went around 7pm to the look-out area on the left to the star ferry pier to get a good seat. take-away some food (egg tarts, milk tea, pies) and have a picnic dinner by the skyline of Hong Kong. Watch ferries and cruise ships sail by the harbor.The Symphony of Light starts at 8pm, at around 7.45pm that is when the crowd will show up. 100 people will try to squeeze to the front to take a photo against the skyline of hong kong. I suggest arriving early or just wait for the show to be over, that is when the crowd will leave and you get all the view to yourself :) after that its time for more shopping and more food.

Skyline: impressive, light show: not so!. The skyline view is great but the light show is a bit of a damp squib. You need to be on the Kowloon side to see it. It's ok but I wouldn't cry if I missed it!

Alternatives to enjoying the skyline. I have actually lived in HK for 12 years and there are some alternative ways to experience the HK skyline which are incredible. This depends on your budget fitness and inclination. These are Hong Kong skyline tips. This depends also on the weather, but even if it is misty it can be spectacular. The key to HK skyline is to experience it through different forms of transport at different times of day with different weather conditions. The Star Ferry of course, the tram along Hennessy Road, by bus and by foot you will see it from different angles. 1. If you can afford it do take a harbour view room in your hotel. This can be in the Mandarin Oriental or the Harbour View depending on your budget. Just sit watching from your room. The Grand Hyatt has excellent Harbour Sunsets. 2. Take the double decker bus 15 to the Peak from Central (sit on the right upper deck but half way up, swap if you can) or the 6 to Stanley, the glimpses of the skyline are magnificent. 3. Walk over Violet Hill from Repulse Bay if you are fit and Jardine's Lookout (less strenuous). 4. At the Peak, if it is clear find your way up to the Governors Walk and don't just do the standard circuit. 5. There is no end of places to drink and eat and enjoy the views of city, sea and hills! If you don't have a lot of money, then bars on the tops of ferry piers can be fun. Cafe Deco on the Peak has great food and skyline views.

Unforgettable Hong Kong Skyline. Hong Kong Skyline- An ExperienceIn Hong Kong many high-rise buildings are there. The symphony of lights charmed me and my wife. Most of skyscrapers are there in the Kowloon area. The tallest among these, as was told by the guide, is the 118-storey International Commerce Centre. The skyline of Hong Kong is surrounded by mountains and the Victoria Harbour. The tour guide emphasised the ‘Symphony of Lights named by the Guinness Book of World Records’ as the largest permanent light and sound festival in the world. A tour in cruise to enjoy the Victoria Harbour is organised. We did not dare to participate as we are senior citizens. But we could interact with few who enjoyed on the previous day. So, we treat that we missed an opportunity. We visited Hong Kong for three days in March 2015 and started from there on 29th March for San Francisco.

An absolute must in hong kong . In the evening, (if you are lucky enough to get a clear night ) the light show is nice. If you're in hong kong long enough it's worth seeing from both sides. Also from the Aqua bar or ritz carlton with a cocktail makes the view extra special.

Unforgettable . After living in Hong Kong for my study abroad period, one thing I know I will never forget is the stunning skyline. Ideally enjoyed whilst on a ferry so you can enjoy both sides at once, the skyline is a symbol of the city that made me never want to leave

Great View from Icon Hotel / Above and Beyond Restaurant - It must be good from the harbour also. The laser show starts at 8 o'clock every evening. It's nice to see the lasers and lights from the different buildings. The view is always impressive across to Hong Kong and the laser show adds a little bit more.

Highlight of Hongkong . All tour operator have some services that covers the skyline of Hongkong in the night. You can watch the Skyline, light and sound show and immerse yourself in this man made wonder. All night we took this trip to maximise the time available. If you are not taking dedicated night trips make sure you see the skyline from both island in night, it's worth it.

Synchronize light and sound Victoria Habour. Symphony of light show at 20:00 everyday. The show is the awesome idea. Every buildings are lighting and laser show with the music. Duk ling boat is a part of this show. If you want to take photo, I recommend you to take photo at Harbour city car park deck.

Most impressive I have ever seen. No matter what major city you are going to, you always want to have a good look at the skyline. Singapore, Shanghai and NY City all has amazing skylines - but nothing beats or even gets close the skyline you find in Hong Kong.You have to watch it from the Avenue of the Stars - but I would suggest you enjoy this amazing view from a restaurant also. Your dining experience will only be better with the view to Hong King Island skyline
Enjoy the view . The skyline always makes your day. Just be amazed with the scene and enjoy your view. Not many cities have such a beautiful skyline.
No better. I just love the skyline day or night, I prefer to stay on Kowloon side with harbour view room - glorious. At the moment the promenade is closed for construction
Nice view. It's really nice view of HK skyscrapers. If you like light shows you can wait till 8pm to see some lasers and neons blinking and shining from these buildings.
Relaxing!!!. We enjoyed our time here and see the most beautiful skine in Asia. The atmosphere was so amazing and relaxing and we recommend to come here around late afternoon

Hyped, but still nice:). The Hong Kong Skyline has a "lightshow" every night at 8PM. I tis nice, but the way they "hype" it before it starts gives you huge expectations. Still nice to see. Even in the rain....

Great even in the fog. While you can get a view from the roof of the star wharf on the city side of the harbour you really want to catch the ferry across to view the lights from the Tsim Sha Tsui side. We did this twice and both times it was rainy or foggy but even so you could get some great views of the skyline for photographs.

Always beautiful, always changing. The Hong Kong Skyline is one of the most recognizable in the world, full of beauty and change. From this one small segment of the world you can view modern and historical sites that have shaped the footprint of the city. There are thousands of places to see and experience when you see the skyline, for any maner of visitor you can experience anything from high above (victoria's peak / skyscraper) to something on the shoreline, to even something on a ship passing through the bay. This will never get old and it will always be one of the most beautiful sights to see in the world.

Exciting. 30 years since I have been to Hong Kong and the placed has only got better since,from the new airport to excellent highways and brightly colored foreshore buildings along with duty free buying and vast array of restaurants make it one of the best destinations in the world.

The view will stay with you forever.. I have been fortunate to see many of the worlds great cities, and admire their skyline from various vantage points. And, as I live in the Chicago area, I always use my home city as a base point - because I always thought Chicago had the most spectacular view of any skyline in the world - especially when viewed from a boat on Lake Michigan.Then I went to Hong Kong.Beautiful, breathtaking, and even awe inspiring don't begin to capture the essence of that view. It will be etched in my minds eye forever.
Pretty, Pretty, Good.. It's quite nice like really nice you might not think it's nice or you might think it's nice but either way it's nice.
Gorgeous. The view from the Intercontinental hotel (harbour view room), is outstanding. HK becomes a different city at night. Take the time to look it. It is changing, but still looks great.
Beautiful view of city at night. Very pretty we stood by Victoria harbour on quayside to view but there were boat trips available.One of the highlights of the trip and would recommend.

Iconic skyline. Walking the promenade in Kowloon is a fantastic way to view the iconic skyline both during the day and at night. While the nighttime light show is basic, it's worth going to just for the atmosphere.

If you like city lights you will enjoy the views from the Victoria Harbor!. If you like city lights you will enjoy the views from the Victoria Harbor! Or take the Star Ferry across to see the lights back in Kowloon.
The sight is beautiful, the light show could be better. Seeing the skyline at night is a must, but you can skip the unimpressive light show --if you have anything else to do.
Amazing to watch. The night show is fun, I also recommend this place for fellow photographers, some great shots are taken there during the light show.

5 star view with 1 star air. By day or night from the streets,ferry,the Peak or high rise hotel the bustling skyline of Hong Kong and Kowloon was a sight to behold. Unfortunately a persistent smog dimmed the light and on occasions made the opposite shore almost invisible.

Not even in the top 5 in my opinion, but worth a view.. This skyline remindes me of how much I miss Shanghai's PuDong skyline. Sorry, Hong Kong! It's wonderful for viewing, nice atmosphere, live music at night, etc ... But the actual skyline, meh at best.
Sorry to disappoint.
Never seems to . Loose its appeal !!! Had a harbor view room and just loved the views day / night any weather it always looks differently , beautiful
