The view is stunning.. The Hong Kong skyline is a wonderful skyline and the building lights make it look really nice. A must see in Hong Kong.

Transition. What a view it is if you are not use to very high rises with beutiful colourful lighting....what a transtion it is from calm quite tall man made mountains to disco sky vibrant and shining...i wish it was a clear day and loved to see the star above and these lights below...one time watch.
Stunning!. From Kowloon side, looking at the Hong Kong skyline at night is romantic, inspiring, and thrilling. Wait for the light show!

Stunning. We took a trip around the harbour which included free drinks definitely a bonus. It was spectacular the skyline just doesn't look real it looks as though it has been put there for a film scene it really quite stunning
Amazing. We saw the skyline from the Peak during the day and at night we saw it from the Hong Kong Convention and Business Centre. The light show was good but I still prefer Shanghai.
Good View,Must have a Photo for rememberance. HK skyline is most clicked i guess.Good Lights call for good photographs.whether its in your own phone or camera.

Breathtaking Vista. We viewed the Hong Kong skyline from both the Kowloon side and the Hong Kong Island side at 2000 hrs to enjoy the nightly Light Show which is truly breathtaking with the backdrop off the towering skyscrapers. A view in a million.

Breathtaking view from ferry, promenade, Victoria peak. Excellent skyline better than even the NY or London skyline with the symphony of lights and well lit buildings and huge skyscrapers with all major brand lights all around almost 360 degree view is litup.

Night spectacle. Hong kong is superbly lit and lovely at night. With harbour reflecting multi coloured lights from bot sides... view from Hong Kong or Kowloon side. Night time strolls or drives, both are a joy.

Nice . Dropped by after dinner to take in the Hong Hong skyline from the Star Ferry and Kowloon. Weather was good and breezy, and had a good view and was not crowded as it was after the light show. Some of the buildings were probably testing, the lighting, during that time
On weekends only. View from the harbor area Kowloon side. Everyone turns out for this. Fun time festive evening. Must see

Awesome. The view from the harbour is truly amazing, you can take great pictures with the lighting building on the background. You can also see the sound and lighting show every day (I guess) at 8Pm from the harbour. As someone who has done the latter from the harbour and the cruise, I'd say the harbour is enough.
Good luck seeing this. Pollution from China has ruined it. Most people have to take a picture with the fake background of HK Skyline in Kowloon because the pollution from mainland China is so bad. =(

Best Skyline in the World. Riveted me in 1979, and still does. Panorama that easily explains Hong Kong's allure: Dynamic, bustling and alive. Asia's melting pot. No matter how hard Shanghai, Shenzhen and the rest try, they''ll never replace the magnetic appeal that is the Pearl Of The Orient

It is great if you like concrete!. I am not belittling HK. It is remarkable how the citizens changed their small fishing village to be " Pearl of the Orient." I have watched that Skyline over the past fifty years. It has, of course, changed. To start with, the Victoria Harbour is getting smaller and smaller as the city needs land and more and more "reclaimation" took place. I hope that I shall not live to see it becoming a fishing pond. It is not as neat as it used to be. Buildings are being pulled down for new ones but they don't match their predecessors. HK builders work tremendously fast. When the Prince of Wales was here opening another new building, he marvelled at the rate the building was finished. He mentioned that he was used to open new buildings started by his father and even his grandfather in Britain! I reccommend the evening, after seven. It is definitely less hot and the sea breeze is pleasant. The lightings are pretty although not not environmentally correct. For those who don't like walking for long stretches, there are evening ferries with guides telling you the buildings' names.

Foggy weather, but very atmospheric.. I think it's the prettiest of sky lines in the world I've ever seen, I went to the harbour to take night photos one evening. The weather was very foggy and changed very quickly, one minute I was looking at this beautiful skyline, the next I could have been anywhere other than Hong Kong. I couldn't see anything, not a single light, all I could hear was the boats fog horns. I managed to take some good photos though while the junk boats were out. It was a very brief visit....

Cool City!. Beautiful views abound in Hong Kong and the amazing skyline is best taken in from any of the rooftop pools, lounges and bars at the major hotels in Central and Kowloon. Don't miss the nightly light show. It's awesome!
great experience!. a must attraction to view with a great and unique of its kind. Laser show at other end of the bay was delightful experiance
Amazing!. The view is simply stunning and they do a great job in highlighting the beauty of the skyline. Every evening there is a light show that illuminates the city. Nothing like it in the world!

Arrived early for the lights. Great show if the weather is right (no low clouds) but be warned arrive early (630-715) and be ready to use your elbows to stand your ground no and save your view, found both the star ferry terminal and the side of the closed avenue of stars to be the best views, don't bother trying to get on the elevated walk way as it gets crowded very quickly. During the day is fine for a great personal picture of the skyline.

Experience only at Aqualuna. Its great to experience this, we were couple and choose Aqualuna to view hong kong skyline and night symphony of lights. it was overall great experience specially on Chinese junk boat the Aqualuna

The true view of HK. The very first day of our tripWe went to see the skyline and waited wuite a long to enjoy the light show at skylineIts one of its kindWe went during chinese new year which made it all the more specialThe tim tshah shui has activities in afternoon (may b bcz of new year)....have eateris etcEveng the lights are on in the skyline and then there are light shows at regular intervals which are not to be missed

Just a skyline. When I saw that this was the number one attraction in HK I was ready to be blown away. I wasn't. It's just a skyline, very similar to that of other major cities around the globe. I wasn't too impressed with the light show either. There was only one building that was really lit up. Not sure why this is such a big attraction!
Hong Kong Skyline. Worth looking at if the weather is not foggy or cloudy, free lightshow at 8pm every night, best place to view is from Star Ferry terminal
Amazing. If I have to choose the most beautiful skyline I've already seen, that has to be Hong Kong. Especially at night.

Very pretty 8pm lazier show disappointed. We were told a must see sight so asked and were told 8pm laser show.Few people around waiting so we joined them looking towards Hong Kong from Kowloon, Night time so pretty with buildings lit up anyway.... 8pm .... Four green laser lights playing around in the sky after 20 / 30 mins fed up so left.It was disappointing thought it was more then that.
Hong Kong Skyline rating depends on weather. It is stunning at night especially from the river- during the day it was disappointing due to the weather.

A bucket list item ticked off. The symphony of lights is really a sight to behold, however if fog is low you can forget about it as you won't see a thing. Best viewed from the star ferry pier of in front of the space centre/ clock tower
Skyline. One of the panoramic backdrops. Impressive at night. Seen better laser shows and not impressed with the music.

Absolutely Beautiful!. One of the best skylines that I've ever seen. Many buildings have their own style and their lights are absolutely beautiful together at night. It is definitely one of the most famous attractions in HK

Laser light show nightly at 8 pm. We bought tickets to go out in the Ferry so we could see the show from both sides. However, it only is active on the Victoria Peak side and we were on the wrong side of the boat. Photos

Hong Kong at night. To enjoy the Hong Kong Skyline, enjoy it from the Kowloon side. It will be the best if you stay at those high rise waterfront hotel with sea view. If you are backpack travellers or if you did not book a waterfront hotel with sea view, there are still lots of restaurant with the view or you simply go to the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade or taking the star ferry. There are many ways to enjoy it.

Colorful. Vibrant and colorful skyline.. lights up the entire harbor... Not quite sure what exact time but there is a light show that takes place.Take the star ferry at sunset for a nice view of the skyline.
8 PM light show. Take the Star Ferry around 7:30 PM to get a good view of the evening light show. Music and lights from multiple skyscrapers are coordinated. Lasts about 30 minutes and free.

The light show. Hong kong skyline is something very special, even in the daytime its amazing. The lights animation on the buildings were brilliant. We never actually got to the full light show but what we seen was brilliant.

amazing view at night!. This is a great place for an evening walk, many locals and tourists gather here to enjoy the magic view, watch the various street musicians etc. Make sure you ride the Star Ferry at night, it's an iconic attraction and costs as little as couple of Hong Kong Dollars each way :)

The lights are simply amazing. This is a place to view at night, and while there are many place to see it from, the Peak Tram will take you to one of the best. Another great way is to take an inexpensive ferry from the terminal and enjoy the view from the ferry.

Everything You Expect It to Be. By day and by night the skyline is an amazing sight (although it can be a bit misty in the daytime). If you go up to the Peak, walk up to the top floor of the Peak shopping mall for an excellent free view over the city (rather than paying for the viewing gallery) and take the circular walk around the Peak to see different parts of the skyline. Take the Star Ferry over to Kowloon to get a different view again.

Beautiful view across the bay. The walk along the esplanade facing the HK Skyline is nice and cooling on most nights. The beauty is the reflection of the building lights cast on the dark bobbing waters. Its a wonderful view to take in.

Reviews are better. We visited the show from Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront outside the Hong Kong Centre. We got a good spot, right by a speaker! Was a good show but because the reviews talked it up to be amazing, I thought it would be better. If you want a seat or a railing side, I suggest getting there a little earlier.8pm each night with different language explanations each night. Make sure you check the website to ensure you get the right night with your language :)

Illumination Hotspot. We had been looking forward to seeing the Hong Kong skyline for some time & first saw it from our hotel window (Harbour Plaza Metropolis), then from Victoria Peak and from Victoria Harbour. The vast height of the HK skyscrapers are astounding as is the number of buildings & the amazing engineers and architects who have designed & build these wonders. Certainly well worth a visit.
Nice city skyline. It is a pretty skyline, and you have plenty of photo opportunities if you walk along Ave. of the Stars on the Kowloon side.
Great view for sure. We had a view from our hotel and it was amazing to see the night lights shine as you looked out.HK is an amazing place thats for sure

Recent visit . We have been to a number of "big cities" and seen a lot of big skylines, but this is really something. The mixture of old world and new world and that large number of very tall and skinny buildings is really a site to see. If you have the time, go to Kow Loon and wait for the light show in Hong Kong to begin at 2000 hours. It could be better, but it was neat to see.

Family bisit. We walked down Nathan road to the harbour to see the lights. It was busy but well with the walk.The boats were also out with their lights on. Not many places to eat on the harbour but still great to see

Best skyline in the world. Make sure if you are going to Hong Kong to go to Victoria Harbour to see this incredible sky line that will literally take your breath away. Go at 8PM when the light show is on. HK is truly an incredible place.

Never fails to impress. From Kowloon or Island side the view over the harbour is spectacular and never fails to impress.
Views from Wooloomooloo, Penisula, Aqua Luna boat, Four Seasons and the Intercontinental are just brilliant.
Stunning city. I am always impressed whenever I go to Hong Kong. The view offers a great mix of modern buildings, mountains and harbors. However, pollution is a serious issue.
Beautiful view, worth a stop. We wnet to see the Skyline from the public pier in Kowloon. The lights were pretty even on a foggy night, so it's worth a stop.

Interesting once but see it as part of something else . Hong Kong has a great skyline and it's great viewing it from up high. However unless you are really into skylines then doing it as part of something else makes it the perfect backdrop. For instance meeting friends for a coffee or a drink and going to the sky lounge (27th floor) on the Pullman hotel is a perfect way to enjoy the experience.
Amazing surprise!. A beautiful surprise. Expect 15 minutes of music and lights around the 2 sides of the river. Do not miss this opportunity if you are in HK!

Worth seeing if it's your first time in HK. I've been to Hong Kong a few times now but for some reason, I only went to view this when I last visited in March 2016.Is a nice reason to go and view the skyline at night and see all the lights, even in fog or bad weather the view is still good. Is not mind blowing or anything, but def worth a look imho

Worth the wait to see it at night.. The Hong Kong Skyline is impressive during the day, but it really shines at night. The buildings have an array of coloured lights and patterns, which make it truly unique. The reflection on the water also adds to the sight. At 8:00 pm, there is a light show, which entails spotlights, laser lights, and the building lights all synced to music. You can enjoy this from the opposite side of the harbor (there is plenty of room to stand and sit) or you can view the lights from one of the harbor cruises. The Tsim Sha Tsui station is a short walk to the pier.
Amazing. Day or night, I don't think you can ever tire of the view. Smog and humidity don't help at times but it is simply amazing. Best seen from TST, the Star Ferry and the Peak.
Beautiful. It was beautiful.. The Symphony of lights was a mesmerising affair.. Hundreds of people turned up and watched it spell-bound.. A definite must-see in Hong Kong..

Good light show. As previous contributors have mentions there is a vast difference between the skyline in the day compared with the night. The light show was very good but you need to have bagged a space by 7.30pm ready for it to start at eight o'clock.During the day the visibility varies from one moment to the next, if your lucky the sun will burn off the smog/fog by eleven in the morning but on many occasions you can't see across the harbour. The postcards show bright blue skies and sun but it was very different the week we were in Hong Kong.
Don't miss this on your visit!. At night it was wonderful. I would have liked a clearer day but so it was! Perhaps next time? YMMV....

Impressive but has a lot of competition. The HK skyline in itself is quite impressive, unfortunately it is often overlooked by the many other (mostly of the natural environment) eye catching sights of HK. The running pictograhs ascending and descending the many skyscrapers are certainly worth finding a quiet area in the streets to stop and look around The Night scene is obviously the more impressive.Each night (weather permitting) the Harbour Sight and Sound Spectacular is presented for free. This free lazer and sound audiovisual draws many viewers for the 15-20 minute show. (if the viewer has come from an Expo or similar large scale presentation it may seem tame, but the fact that it is coordinating many independent buildings in the light show is worthy of commendation. The Skyline typifies that you can get a very good treat for your senses, just by looking around this fantastic location.

Best of the best. Unbeatable attraction and it is one of the highlight for anyone's trip to Hong Kong. The day and night contrast a lot and there are few places to see the Hong Kong skyline, be it in the top level from the tall building, in front of harbour or catch a ferry to enjoy!

Finish the day here. The light show and the harbour itself was very enjoyable to watch as you relax and unwind. Felt very safe just sitting and watching as the evening went by, even when the kids fell asleep.
Interesting architecture. The modern buildings have some very creative architecture, featuring lots of angles and curves. They go on forever. There are countless high rises for many miles.

Lights of Hong Kong. The harbour was very colourful and every nite they have a Laser Light Show--long wait and fairly average. Note take a warm coat in March as can get very cold.Probably the best view of the lights would be from the Peak on a clear night.
Iconic views. Love this view, Spectaluar light show in the evening each night, but fantastic even without the lights.
Amazing. Amazing how the skyline changed at night, it turns into a dancing lights. Is a must to see in Hongkong. Certainly a different views in daytime

Breath Taking at Night. Absolutely stunning when looking from the vicinity of the Clock Tower at Kowloon. We went down for the light show at 8pm and waited for about 20 minutes to make sure we got a good view. To be honest it was an anti-climax, the lasers were not that dramatic and the additional neon that lights up several buildings was good for about 5 mins. I would go after dark as the Sky line is stunning, but don't wait around for the light show.

Beers watching the skyline. If you want to have cheap beers and great view, must go to tsim sha tsui harbour, right next to the ferri terminal. You can buy beers at 7-11 and sit in the terrace harbour border enjoying a great view.

To watch or not..... Light show is ok ....would watch if you are by the harbour or in the vicinity ,but I wasn't that impressed and wouldn't make a special effort to see again .
Of course if it is your first time in Hong Kong it is probably something to be seen once .

Pretty but with all the smog you expect. We came, we saw, we will not be coming back. Unless I have to go there for work, I will save my lungs from having to endure it again. And not to mention the smokers all over the place. I wonder what their rate of lung cancer is. After my visit, I think my risk factors went up.

Crazy Views from the Harbour and the Peak. HK skyline is famous and I must say it is for a reason. I was visiting HK for the first time and found it breathtaking. I can understand that second time around I might not go gaga over a skyline. But for the first time it was a visual delight. Best viewed from Vixtoria Harbour and the Peak.

Amazing view. Nice Skyline, if you go to the Peak and you have nice weather you have amazing great view. Check the historical Story that you know why the Peak is not crowded with buildings. If you use the circle Walking way at the pick you see more then expected. I like it
was raining and foggy. we were not able to enjoy syphony of lights as it was raining and was foggy. The lights was hidden. Not a good place when it is raining .
Really good. It was better than I thought it was going to be we took so many pictures I would go watch it again for sure
Nice visual sight. Go to waterfront on Tsim Sha Tsui side a little before nightfall and find place to sit while listening to the music and watch the island light up. Beautiful.

Great view spoilt by bad weather conditions. I had a great potential view of the HK skyline from my hotel room, but for the duration of my stay the view was frequently obscured by clouds or fog. It was almost impossible to see the daily laser light show.
Great view. Tourists can enjoy symphony of lights which starts at 1915hrs in the evening, only thing raining should not be there at that time.

You are definitely watching the lights show!. I would suggest taking the ferry during the show times so that you can watch it while you are on your boat and drinking a cocktails. It garners a lot of attention from all tourists visiting Hong Kong during that day.
A good photo opportunity. The skyline at night is a good photo opportunity if you have the camera for it! All the building in different colors of light make the view amazing.

Nightly laser light show . Certainly the Hong Kong skyline is impressive and even more beautiful at night. However I am not sure why anyone would rave about the nightly laser light show. Of course it is free to watch from any vantage point on land that it can be viewed from. The lights boat ride on star ferry is $200 hkd. So unless you are interested in the 45 mins tour on the bay at night that follows watching the light show, then I suggest watching from the promenade.

Pretty Lights. If you are excited about skyscrapers and lights - then make sure you check out the view. The light show is extremely over-rated I felt and just a gimmick. The normal lights of the buildings are enough to keep you mesmerised for enough time.

Concrete Skyline in Kowlon Hongkong alongside Victoria Harbour. Hong Kong Skyline best in the world Surrounding mountains and Victoria Harbour .In the evening,44 skyscrapers and buildings light up in a synchronised show " A Symphony of Lights " Holds Guinness Book of World Records as the largest permanent light and sound festival in the world.
Nice show. Nice show that happens every night with music and light effect The skyline is really impressive Go to see from Bruce Lee statue

City of shopping from malls to stalls. We didn't like Hong Kong. Ladies Market, Night Market, Jade Market very commercial and full of junky souvenirs but fun. Victoria Peak would have been great if not socked in with clouds. Aberdeen fishing village quaint and ride on a junk around the harbor fun - rain dampened it.Large City Park on Nathan Street a welcomed relief and very nice.Weather in Spring cloudy, rainy. Summer very hot and humid. Fall clear and ideal

Beautiful skyline . This is worth seeing during the day and at night, we went at 8pm and there was a light show going on with music which if worth seeing. Stay 5 minuets after and the viewing platform empties so you can get some better pictures then.
Spectacular skyline. A skyline you could watch all day and all nite. We were lucky to have a harbour view which is amazing. The light show each nite starts at 8pm for around 13 minutes.

magnificent at night. highlight of my visit to hong kong was my nighty visits to the promenade. absolutely beautiful and a perfect way to end a busy day. i could spend hours just admiring the buildings all lit up
Tall and Dense!. Hongkong is one of the most dense city in the world. You can enjoy the skyscrapers by visiting Avenue of Stars.

Nice view of skyline and dazzling lights. From the ferry, the hongkong skyline looks dazzling. You never miss the neons of the highrise, creating a bright illuminated atmosphere amidst the sea mist.
Advisable if you have time or the following is in your itenary.

Skyline from top of The Peak Tower. Stunning. Have to be sure to go on a clear night though. We travelled there one day and could see nothing but fog all round. It was worth a trip back to see the Skyline when things cleared up.
Amazing views . Amazing views, had heard and seen pictures but to see it up close and personal really put things into perspective. From all angles it really does look fantastic

Tourist. What can one say sky line is truly amazing Wonder full to see. Our view from our hotel window was like nothing we have seen before. Then at night with all the neon lights it takes on a life of its own. We had seen pictures but it had the whole factor in real life.

Unreal. We have seen some skylines in our days but this one was different due to the high amount of highrisers who had a background of the high peaks surrounding Hongkong and the water and of course the daily "Symphony Of Lights" at 8 PM best seen from Tsim Sha tsui

The Celestial Hong Kong Skyline. I been to a lot of megacities, their edifices were magnificent. To name a few, some of the wonderful high architectures I have seen are the Burj Khalifa in Dubai which is the current tallest freestanding structure in the world, the Marina Bay Sands in Singapore which is one of its kind, the Petronas Twin Towers in Kuala Lumpur which is tallest twin towers in the world, the Empire State Building which is kind of old but still has its appeal. The Hong Kong skyline is as diverse as its culture and people. Some buildings are ultramodern like the One IFC, the Bank of China Tower and the International Commerce Center while some are classic and contemporary like the Hopewell Centre, the Jardine House and the Standard Chartered Bank Building. There are some good vantage view to appreciate the skyline of Hong Kong. One of it is the Tsim Sha Shui Promenade located in Kowloon across the Victoria Harbour and the Hong Kong Island where most of the the nice buildings of Hong Kong are located. Taking the Star Ferry is another way to appreciate the magnificent edifices of Hong Kong. The Star Ferry itself is one of Hong Kong's top attractions. If you want a view from top, the vista from the Victoria Peak or simply The Peak commands a panoramic sight of the totality of Hong Kong's skyline from across the Victoria Harbour, the Kowloon Peninsula to the architectural landmarks down the Victoria Peak in the Hong Kong Island. The Peak also has a peculiar transport which is the Peak Tram. The Peak Tram is also one of Hong Kong's famous things to do. Wherever you are and wherever you plan to go, marvel at the high man-made structures made to try to reach the sky. It is also serves a trophy for megacities to declare that they have the economic might and truly a global city.
one of the most recognized attraction of Hong Kong.. Always beautiful, always great to look at, regardless of day time or night time. a must see if you are ever in Hong Kong
Beautiful Skyline. Walk along the upper walkway in Tsim Sha Tsui to watch the 8 o'clock laser show. Amazing skyline, amazing lights!

See the light show. The Hong Kong Skyline is wonderful almost any time, but at 8 pm there's a show with animated lights, lasers, and music best seen from the Kowloon side by the Tsim Sha Tsui ferry terminal. Definitely a must-do.

Many lights at night. Great way to see and watch HK lights at night!
People from all over the world. Every 6pm (or closer!) there is the showtime lights. :)

Beautiful skyline. It's a nice skyline to see from the island. Do not miss the light show, happens every night so make time for it some time in ur trip. It's a small place so you should be able to make some time for it.I'm not someone that will stare at something similar and immobile for too long.. So it wasn't a big wow factor for me, prob also because of my overtired crying toddler and my super swollen gigantic tired hurting feet! There's lots of walking involved, go prepared!

For me, this IS Hong Kong!. Viewed from either Kowloon or the famous Star Ferry, views of the northern shore of Hong Kong Island are simply amazing. Day or night, views are never the same. It does not have to be a clear sunny day to enjoy the view: Low lying heavy clouds, sea mists, shards of light popping through the clouds, the illuminated buildings at night augmented by the nightly 'Symphony of Lights Show' all make this skyline unique. As you will have gathered, I love it!

Forest of Buildings. This is one of the nicest skylines I've ever seen and I live in New York City. By day you can see the many imposing buildings with the greenery of either the New Territories or that of Hong Kong Island behind them, depending on which side of the harbor you observe from. By night is when it becomes really impressive though. Consider taking a look from both the Hong Kong side and the Kowloon side, as each offers a little bit of a different perspective. From the Kowloon side, walk down to the end of Nathan Road and cross over to the area around the Hong Kong Cultural Center next to the Museum of Art. From here you get an excellent view of the island across the harbor, as well as all the lit up boats crossing in front of you. From the East Tsim Sha Tsui Waterfront Podium which now houses the iconic Bruce Lee statue, you can also get a great view, with the many colors of the buildings being reflected into the water at night. Then of course there is the view from the peak which is an awesome, all encompassing over look of the whole city before you. There are so many colors and patterns going on, and the light show is interesting. It is worth the admission and wait to get up to the peak for this view.
Great. Still one of the best skylines in the world to view. Especially as dusk falls and you get he lighting starting.

View not to miss. Great view from TST promenade. Do watch out for fog depending on the season, as the entire skyline can disappear under it. 'A symphony of lights' is not that great, you needn't spend a lot of time waiting for it to start. If you happen to be around at showtime, do watch.
WOW. The Hong Kong skyline is wonderful. Seeing it from above at the Peak and then from the harbour let's you appreciate the beauty of it.

Awesome Viewing with amazing lights. The Hong Kong and Kowloon waterfronts have amazing lights. In fact it is recorded by the Guiness Book of records as the largest Light show.See it from Hong Kong Island or get the ferry across the bay and see it from the other side or better still take a evening boat cruise.
Beautiful view from Tsim Sha Tsui. Worth going during Day or night. Even on rainy day view is good. Fresh air with blowing wind with breath taking view. Most skyscrapers are visible. Photogenic view

Stunning but the light show could be better. Hong Kong skyline is fascinating - not unlike the Shanghai Bund. Many of the buildings have holes designed in to them. The hole is to let the local dragon through - this good feng shui, apparently. Most of the skyline buildings are built on reclaimed land. The daily light show is quite good but could be much better..
What made Hong Kong special . A trip across from to Kowloon is the cheapest and best way to enjoy it. Or just walk the Kowloon side... awesome if not more abd it's free

Amazing night skyline. I guess either you hate or love it, for me it's the first one. Hongkong's skyline fascinates me, especially at night time. Best to be seen either from Victorias Peak, from Kowloon Ferry Pier or from the top of the ICC.

I expected more. It was just a few lights in the buildings and I expected much more of this I think they could of done it much much better. The reason I gave it 2 stars is because I liked the ending but the rest of it was boring.
Wondeful skyline. never got tired of the Victoria harbour view every time I was back in HK. Vibrant and relaxing watching all the lights and boats at the harbour.

Imposing by Day, Spectacular by Night. The skyline of Hong Kong must be amongst the best in the world, set on Victoria Harbour with the Peak providing an imposing backdrop. The Symphony of Lights attracts a large crowd, so plan to be there at least 30minutes before the 8pm switch-on if you want an unobstructed few. Whilst the Symphony of Lights, with it's lasers pointing in to the heavens, is spectacular, the way that the skyline is lit up beforehand is almost as good. If you are lucky you'll be staying in one of the harbour side hotels, such as the Marco Polo, with a nightly view of the spectacular lights and buildings.

Absolute stunning!!nt. HK is the city with the largest number of sky scrapers in the world, and you get a glimpse of the same from the aircraft itself! And it just get better as the plane gradually descends on the runway!
night time lazer show. This is not to be missed, when we were there in August the show started at 2000 but this may well change with the seasons. the show is set to music and if brilliant.
Must for you visit. Must for you visit in HK, specially the laser show. If you want to take pictures, must take a small tripod with you. Enjoy!
Shanghai skyline is more gorgeous. A lot of cities nowadays have this view so there is nothing special here. A walk at the avenue of the stars/ TST promenade is good though.
Beautiful city especially at night. The symphony of lights is beautiful. It really highlights hong kong. T he kids enjoyed seeing it from the hotel nightly.

Excellent, especially at night. The skyline is a must-see in Hong Kong. Nobody should miss it. At night, at 20:00, there is a light show called Symphony of Lights which is extremely spectacular.
Tip: Don't come on a foggy day.

Lights Galore. This is a free, yet, selfie-friendly thing to do. Nothing beats the variety of shapes and colors that will definitely bring a picture (selfie or not) to life. I suggest to try the views from both sides (Hong Kong and Kowloon). Plus, wait for the Symphony of Lights at 8PM nightly.

Always worth a stop if you are in the area just to admire it.. Whether you are there to take in the light show or just walking around, it is worth a quick selfie or serious reflection. One of the world's great skylines...

The Mecca for skyscraper enthusiasts. As a skyscraper enthusiast, I was looking forward to go to Hong Kong to see the skyline. And I was not disappointed. There are so many good vantage points (Victoria Peak, Kowloon Waterfront, next to the Exhibition & Convention center...). Wherever you go, the view is simply stunning. It's equally beautiful during the day and the night. What's also nice is to walk in the "forest" of buildings on Hong Kong Island between Central / Admiralty station.

Amazing Skyline At Night.. I sat for about an hour and half at the waterside just one night I was in HK watching the light show from the skyline on both sides of the water. It is definitely worth a look as I've not been to any other city like this at night.

Phenomenal, ever changing skyline. Stupendous setting with the battle between the Hong Kong Hills& man's ingenuity to dominate ones vision. The 10 minute light display at night from the buildings is pretty if a little spoiled by the twangy out of sync music . We also loved the covered elevated walkways between the Central district skyscrapers which give the area a feeling of being in Fritz Lang's Metropolis.

Probably the best in the world.. Fantastic at anytime of the day....or night. Brilliant nightime light and laser show about 8.00pm from its tall office blocks and hotels. Hong Kong has 8000 skyscrapers !!!! A very lively harbour scene with ferries, pleasure boats. cruise liners, cargo boats and private vessels criss-crossing the harbour.

Long walk for beautiful view. Due to a lot of road works it was hard to get to the skyline park, when we finally got there - it was BEAUTIFUL!We saw the skyline from sky100, from monkok then we saw the view from the park.Totally worth going to see
Night show . Very Nice and unique, to see the night lights of HKG, as all builidings take part of the show. Unfofgetable at all.

A wonder of the world. We have seen this skyline 35 years ago and a lot has changed over the years but it's still a wonder to see - if the clouds will let you see it! Throughout our 7 days there was never a crystal clear view.
Awesome!. Wherever you view it from, it is simply awe inspiring, especially at night. The best three places to see it from are The Peak, The Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade and the Sky100 Observation Deck

The HK Skyline - Tranquility Amid Chaos. We sat in the outdoor area of the Eye Bar (rooftop), Kowloon CBD, from about 5:30 pm - 8:30 pm, watching the skyline change as darkness set in. One by one, the buildings lit up and the skyline transformed into a neon vista. The light show that begins at 8 pm isn't the best neon light-show we've seen, but it was pretty cool to watch while making plans for dinner. Photos of the HK harbour by night do give a good representation of the view, it is stunning - but if you want to purchase a picture of that view, consider looking online, as they are enormously expensive in the local stores.

It was alright. We went twice to see this attraction twice the first night was obscured by fog. The second night was clearer and thus able to see he brightly lit buildings. It was an interesting view, but we have seen better.
Beautiful views. We went in rainy weather and views were still very beautiful but hopefully will be going when there are clear skies. Surely a must view

One more must-see. If you have looked at Manhattan from Brooklyn during the hours of darkness, you need to look at Hong Kong Island from Kowloon and vice-versa. The views are also good during daylight hours, but not so impressive. The skylines of Hong Kong are majestic and internationally well-known. Unfortunately, as in my recent visit, weather conditions can radically impact negatively on the views.

Dissappointing. I went in the evening of 19 March 2016. The weather was foggy, Avenue of Stars was under construction. A huge part of the deck was barricaded, hence, we only get to see a small part of the blurry skyline.
Great skyline. Smaller than New York, Hong Kong's skyline is still pretty spectacular- look out for the nightly light show at about 8pm

Nice view from The Peak.. We did get to see the skyline from The Peak during the day time visit there. We were near the shore in the Central District, but it was a bit foggy and the view wasn't really visible. But, what we saw of the skyline was impressive with many tall buildings. Not really great architecture like in some places, but many buildings.

A Symphony of Lights. With hundreds of skyscrapers on both the Kowloon and Hong Kong sides, nighttime on the harbor is lit up in a symphony of lights.Recommendation: Start on the Wan Chai Ferry Pier, take the Star Ferry across to Kowloon to the Star Ferry Pier then cross back to Hong Kong on the other Star Ferry to Central Ferry Pier #7.Time: 8:00 p.m. to 8:14 p.m. so be at Wan Chai by 7:40 p.m. and wait for the last boat to leave before 8:00 p.m.
definately a bucket list item!. unbelievably gorgeous views of colors, lasers, lights and incredibly high towers expanding for miles all along Victoria harbor

Beautiful. This harbor view is beautiful from both Kowloon and the Hong Kong island. On Kowloon there is a pedestrian walk (Promenade) along the harbor for about 2 miles from the Star Ferry at TST to Wampoa. At night all the tall buildings are lit up and there is lazier show at 8 pm every night. This is all very beautiful.
Fabulous. Although weather not great during our trip it was still fabulous and we totally enjoyed all the things that were there to see and do .

Lots of very tall buildings. I'm not really sure you can call the skyline an attraction, but it's all around you and the number of hi-rise buildings along both sides of the harbour is impressive!Best viewed from the avenue of stars on the north side of the harbour in my opinion. It's everywhere you go though, you can see it from victoria peak, the south side of the harbour, no escaping it!
Evening Light Show. Loved the laser light show at 8pm around the harbour and island buildings. Bonus was a cruise liner sailing past during the show going to its next port of call. A lovely sight.

Great city view. From all different areas you can have a great skyline view...from both sides..during day and evening....ofcourse with clear weather from victoria peak but also from the buildings and malls and above all: from the water...These months it is raining a lot but even than you will see a beautiful skykine with buildings in the clouds...and suddenly without....
Breathtaking at night!. Great view of this from our hotel room. Lights go out in the early morning for light pollution control. Multiple buildings had light shows on them.

Great view. Pity about the weather. Unfortunate to have very foggy weather and poor visibility. I can definitely see the attraction on a clear night. Not necessarily a must do. If your in the area at 8pm then it's worth the visit.
Impressive and largely clear. We had a team dinner with wonderful view the sklyline. They ofcourse an exansive viewing deck. We got the perfect view for the wonderful sound and light show.
Awesome light show nightly. It's something that you should do while in Hong Kong along with the Bruce lee statue. There is a Starbucks on the Kowloon side where you can sit with coffee and enjoy.
Stunning. Make sure that you have a clear night otherwise you'll waste your time. A good way to see it is from the star ferry.
Must visit!. You can have and excellent view of the city from the top of it. Recommended a must visit if you are in Hong Kong.

Nice view of skyline . Viewed from Kowloon. The night we went to see it in March the light show was cancelled. Nice view of skyline all the same. If in Hong Kong definitely go to Kowloon to see the view.
great skyline. best view is from the main land, get a lounge with a top floor like aqua or at the ritz. if you have to choose between those 2, go to aqua.

You have to see it. The Hong Kong Skyline at night is a must see as the city lights are amazing. The lazer show from 20.00hrs is also worth a watch but not as amazing as we expected. There are numerous vantage points for this attraction a lot of which are free don't go anywhere to pay to see it it's not necessary
Lights. Looking at Hong Kong tall buildings with its lights is breathtaking and watching the laser show at 8 PM is something you should not miss
Simply Wow!. The HK Skyline is pretty impressive and offers an impressive view of the city at night. No wonder, it is counted amongst the most amazing locations worldwide.

Bright Lights, Big City. Beauty! Best viewed from the Star Ferry or the Avennue of the Stars, the Hong Kong Skyline lights up once the sun goes down with all the majesty of a world class city. All that light pollution is totally worth it, folks. This is stunning! Once you see it, you'll be hard pressed to forget it.
Bit disappointing . I was probably expecting something more impressive but nevertheless worth a look. It was free after all. The highlight was the illuminated junk sailing back and forth.

A popular tourist attraction. This is one of the popular tourist attractions especially at night. 15 years ago when we visited HK and saw all those skyscrapers lit up in HK and Kowloon harbour; wow what a sign, they can draw you into their spell. But last December when we went back to visit, I was a bit disappointed; the night light was not that brilliant. My friend told me that reflected their finance state. If you have never been to HK, that is still a place to be. I always wonder how a tiny little HK can support that entire skyline. Ha!Ha!Happy Travelling!

Best paramount pictures taken. Great spot to take snaps. Light show from 8pm which lasts around 15 mins (5 mins is enough). An essential, must see vista if ever visiting HK. Take a stroll from TST East, have a coffee, walk through avenue of stars and finish up at the star ferry. Busy at the best of times but ridiculous at 8pm. Dont get hit by a selfie stick.
Value for money. Good views and experience-however poor weather /foggy conditions inhibited our Otherwise good experience.

Wow, wow, wow, wow. Amazing - for best views take the STAR ferry and watch the light show through the open window.
It's pretty impressive.

Its a builfing site !!!!. I was here 3 years ago and enjoyed walking on the Avenue of Stars to admire the view of the skyline. ... but now they are building a new skyscraper that will cover the entire view from the most iconic area ....We had to way all the way to the Intercontinental and the Museum if Science to get the view .... extremely crowded . The light show was a bit disappointing. I guess we are spoiled leaving in Singapore and the light show at the Marina Bay Sands that you can admire from The Fullerton hotel .
Always impressive. See the Hong Kong skyline at night when it is illuminated by the laser show. I have seen it many times and always impressive - even when it is not clear sight.

Best in the World!. I have watched this skyline grow, since 1997 and it keeps getting more and more impressive, including the Kowloon side of the harbor. Based on the historical significance of Hong Kong, and its harbor, the beautiful mountain backdrop and accessibility to view by land from Kowloon, by boat and or from 'above' at Victoria Peak, makes this skyline stand above many of the rest i've seen (my major comparisons being New York City and Chicago). Whether viewing from Kowloon or Victoria Peak, if you have an iPhone or device that allows a "Panoramic" setting, don't forget to use it. You will come away with a picture of the entire skyline and a shot that you can't get, unless you spend a lot of money on a professional shot.

Snapshot of urban Hong Kong. Three word to summarize the experience, it's all the #night, #light and #height of Hong kong. Just sit, relax and watch those ferries sailing across. Probably, the record for people taking selfies at a time goes here.
Totally beautiful!. We sailed out of Hong Kong in the evening and we were able to view the skyline at night ... truly beautiful. It's a very crowded city, however. Not sure I could live there.

Unforgettable. The view from the ferry terminal at Kowloon, across the harbour to Hong Kong island takes your breath away. On the day we witnessed it, the low cloud hanging around did nothing to detract from the view at all.

It never gets old!. I spend about30 days a year in Hong Kong on business and I never get tired of going to locations where you can gaze upon the skyline at night. One of the most amazing locations worldwide!
WOW!. Just an amazing sight to see. Lots of vantage points to enjoy the view from. The night view is my favourite.

Every time nice to see. I have seen this many times in the past 10 years since I started travelling to HK for business. It is however always nice to see, and from time to time you see it different, with clear sky it's spectacular, but also with clouds covering partially the high rise buildings is great. It's also nice during the light show, check on HK tourist board website for the up-to-date time of the show.

Amazing. The views on this skyline can be viewed from many places. The peak. Kowloon. TST. It's glowing from all the lights and if you're lucky you can see it in action during the city-wide lightshow.

Great view of Hong Kong Island. Standing on the mainland looking over at Hong Kong Island is very nice. Very close to the ferry terminal is a large viewing area, including a raised walkway with a seating area.
Spectacular view if a night line sky. Have a walk at night to marvel at the spectacular night life sky. Company buildings are lit up and we also saw a Scan pan.

Bright, vibrant, just spectacular. Anyone visiting HK must not miss its Skyline at night. You can view this either from the Victoria Harbor or from Kowloon, but I prefer the Kowloon side. It even gets better once you see this huge oriental ship traversing the bay (great if you capture it in panorama!). Make sure to pick a great spot when taking pictures. or, you can hire a photographer along the coast (there are lots of them) to take (and print) the photo for you with this magnificent backdrop.

Fantastic . The Skyline of Hong Kong is simply Amazing and is on par New York, Sydney, London and Madeira. Tourists from all over the world spend hours on end watching the spectacular Hong Kong skyline. The laser shows on at 8.00pm drawn huge crowds.
Great City View. Wonderful skyline. Many places to see this. Star Plaza (where the star walk is) has the best view. No need for a ferry or boat you can see everything from there.

View fro boat at night is amazing. Having visited HK many times over the years I am always amazes by the skyline at night. Great places to see this is the ferry port on the Kowloon side or the reliving resteraunt on Hong Kong island. The darkness comes early as HK is on the tropics.

Really good light display. Best viewed from Kowloon either in luxury in the Intercontinental's Lounge bar or for free from the pedestrian walkway behind the modern art museum near the star ferry terminal. Scene is enhanced by the river traffic.
A fantastic place to visit day or night.. Lots of great shops and fantastic restaurants. Use the MTR to get around or just walk, it is not too far.

A VERY UNIQUE EXPERIENCE!. The Lazer show is wonderful.
The whole experience is
Romantic, noizy, spectacular!
It's worth watching it...
.........

Mind-blowing . My first trip to Hong Kong and all I can say is this skyline is mindblowing especially when viewed from the vantage points of the Kowloon promenade and the Peak. Buildings, big buildings at that, as far as the eye can see.

The harbour view is spectacular in Hong Kong.. I love the Hong Kong skyline and there are always things to see on the harbour. It especially beautiful at night when all the lights are on. It makes for an amazing experience and it feels like you are in a truly magical place. I never tire of seeing it. It is even more spectacular at Christmas time when even more lights are on. They dance across the facade of the skyscrapers using every possible colour you could ever imagine.

Watch The Lighting While Sailing in the Harbor. We went to watch the "Symphony of Lights" which Hong Kong has every evening at 8 pm. We took a boat tour from Pier 9 of Ferry Piers, Central Distt. Drinks were free and unlimited. We drank in the cold weather and say the Skyline lit with lighting from all skyscrapers. It was a magical moment of our lives.
Beautiful skyline. Breath taking - best to see from the Kowloon side. During dust time, they do a light show performed by music.

Did the low cloud spoil it?. A murky evening meant that the tops of the highest building were a n cloud so we weren't sure if we were missing anything or not. Considering it's free it was worth the walk from our hotel but I wouldn't make a special effort to go back.
Lovely View. This was my view every evening from my hotel in the city, wonderful, like looking at something from a film! every evening at dusk the lights come on, wonderful, so lovely

3 days in HK. Hong Kong was very interesting. At night, when I arrived, I was reminded of Time Square in NYC. The city was well lit and there were so many people. September is definitely the wrong time to go, if you want to avoid humid hot weather. The Ladies Market, is where I unfortunately spent most of my time. I have a habit of shopping. Nonetheless, the views are amazing from the Victoria Harbor and the skyline is awesome.

Nice skyline. The skyline is nice to watch although it was cloudy and it will look better when the sun shines.However the lightshow at 8 pm was a bit disappointing, in my opinion they can do much more with that then the quiet common stuff they are showing now.

Beautiful Skyline on Sail-Away. On our Bon Voyage Sail-Away on our cruise, the Hong Kong skyline was beautifully displayed. The skyline was even more striking against the setting sun. The various types of ships also added to the whole environment of the ever active city. Not many city in the world can boast of their skyline specially from the upper deck of a cruise ship. Hong Kong passed the test with flying color.

One Of the Best In The World!. It was really a great pleasure to stay at a hotel that overlooked this famous harbor and view the nightly light show! The harbor is also very active with many marine vessels and other enormous cruise ships. A predominant large skyscraper building was situated directly across the harbor and had fantastic laser light shows that utilized the entire building.

HK Skyline Shines Bright at Night. Your visit to Hong Kong will never be complete without getting to see the Skyline from Victoria Harbour. Whether you go in the morning, in the afternoon or in the evening, the view is astounding! Sit back and relax from the viewing platform and enjoy the scenery. and make sure you bring your camera because you don't wanna miss the sight!
absolutely wondereful. cant miss this skyline,even when it was cloudy it still was fabulous. Simply a must of course in Hong Kong

Hong Kong Experience. We had the opportunity to welcome the Chinese New Year in from our son's office on the 26th floor. The fire works were right in front of our building and the skyline looks fabulous of a night.

Beautiful skyline. Tsim Sha Tsui is a good place to see the skyline, during high season it might be quite crowded, but as we went in March it was fine. It's a good place to take pictures or just to sit down and take the view in.

Daily laser show at 8pm Hong Kong. Quarter of an hour of music ,lasers and neon lights flashing on Hong Kong's skyscrapers . English commentary on Wednesday and Friday . Browse around Harbour and view cruise ships .Window shop at the luxury stores Gucci, Tiffany etc

One of the best skylines. HK has one of the best skylines in the world, especially at night. Try taking a ferry to Kowloon and back, and enjoy the scenery from the water, giving you an opportunity to view both sides from different vantage points. I like the shapes of the buildings against the sky, the lights on the building, and the buzz and energy you'll feel just watching this vibrant city.
Light Show. The skyline is impressive particularly at night with the light and laser show. It is best viewed from the waterfront the 9th floor of the Hotel Icon.
Nowhere else like this!. Though the skyline has been disrupted by IFC, the skyline as the backdrop of Victoria Harbour is still worth seeing.
Excellent place, Amazing view. The Hong Kong skyline is a Breathtaking view whether you see it in Daytime or night time.You can enjoy it from the Peak , the promenade or from the coast.

Amazing Sight............ The shore line from the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade made for excellent viewing of the skyline by night and day. Not to be missed when you are in HK. Take a stroll from the boat pier and the clock tower right to the garden of stars!!! Amazing Sight!!! The light show which starts daily at 800 pm can also be viewed from here. Recommend going here to travelers.
Best skyline in the world. The lights, the architecture, the water, the boats makes looking at the Hong Kong skyline a great experience. Best viewed at night time from TST

Amazing view. We eat in the Innercontinental hotel (down stairs sea food buffet) and looked out onto the skyline, it is magnificent! I would recommend a meal there or a drink in the upstairs bar for a full view. We also saw the junk boat going by.

Stunning. One of the best skylines in the world and constantly changing. So many iconic landmarks. My favorite is at night with the building lit up and reflecting on the water. Go to the Ozone bar to get a birds eye view of this amazing skyline
A great view at night...👍. Awesome view of the skyline and a great distance to everything, then there's a great seawalk in yhe cool of the evening.
Best view at night. This is lovely at night when all buildings are lit. It was lovely watching it the lights were played to music.

Amazing. It is an essential part of the trip. You can enjoy it from the Peak or from Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade. At day or at night is an incredible skyline. The lights show is not the best (and crowded) but you can enjoy the view, take lots and lots of photos.
Love it every time I see it. I live here but I can't get enough of it. When you come around the corner in North Point in the morning on your way to work and see the skyline you know why you're here.

Iconic!. For anyone familiar with the world and geography, there are really only a few iconic skylines, and Hong Kong is one of them.I give it five stars because of the light show, and depending on the holiday, the light displays on the buildings. The light show is on both sides of the harbour, and starts about 8pm.The view from The Promenade in Tim Sha Tsui of Central is better and more iconic than the view from Central Piers of the Kowloon skyline.I would recommend getting photos of both sides, day and night.

Can never get bored of looking at it!. Where ever you look at the Skyline whether it is from the Kowloon Promenade, the Peak or Victoria Harbour, the sight of the Skyline never gets boring. It is great to look during the day but really comes alive at night. It is a great backdrop for memorable pictures!
Breathtaking!. Definitely one of the best skylines in the world! We had to go back the next day to witness the lights show and it was entertaining!
Beautiful Skyline. Scarcity of flat land has prompted substantial vertical developments in Hong Kong, and the skyline viewed against the Victoria Harbour is absolutely beautiful on a clear sunny day.
Satisfy Your Bucket List. The Hong Kong skyline is an unforgettable adventure. I recommend viewing it from Victoria Peak, on Hong Kong Island as well as from the promenade at Tsim Sha Tsui.
Unbeatable skyline. Have been visiting some 'metropolitan' in the world but nothing can beat HK's skyline. Don't get it missed.
Great views at night.. Walk along the harbor, or get out on a ferry after dark for great views of the skyline. This is a low or no cost activity that is worth a look.

Amazing way to enjoy Hong Kong skyline.. If you want to enjoy something unique of Hong Kong, the lightshow of the skyline is really worth it. You'll get a look at all the imponent buildings of Hong Kong and watch them light on and off at the rythm of music. We watch it from Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade and enjoyed the view.

Skyline. WOW! You'd be pushed to beat this skyline. I think NYC would rate second to this. Especially when they put on a lightshow for the Chinese New Year that we watched from Kowloon that was perfectly in sync with the music DESPITE a distance of a few km!

Better by day, or night? It's a toss-up!. I've been to Hong Kong for both business and pleasure over the last 51 years and never cease to be enthralled by the vista of gleaming office towers and apartment blocks thrusting ever upwards and reflected in the now so-clean waters of Hong Kong Harbour. Views differ on what side of the harbour offers the best views but, in my opinion, it's a no-brainer. The Kowloon side looking over to the Peak, Wan Chai and Central winds hands down! Whether you take in the view from the Star Walk between the HK Museum of Art as you head toward the Star Ferry and the iconic Clock Tower, or take in the view from a bar in any of the elegant hotels facing the waterfront or actually on the waterfront, there's always something to see, The constant hustle and bustle of marine craft, tourist junks, the Star Ferries criss-crossing the harbour, tugs and the barges carrying the ever-present construction spill will keep you gazing with interest at the ever-changing spectacle. At night the office buildings cast a brilliant light on the water ('though economics and ecology dictate that they don't do so nearly so long as formerly) and a real bonus is the laser-light show beamed in to the night sky from the three tallest buildings on Hong Kong Island. The best thing? It's all free!

A Must see when Visiting Hong Kong. The Hong Kong skyline is an essential part of any trip to Hong Kong. We did it two ways on separate nights. The first time we boarded the Big Bus by the Star Ferry dock ad the big wheel and toured downtown Hong Kong seeing the buildings close up as the lights came on. The bus then crossed the bay via the tunnel and toured downtown Kowloon and then proceeded through Kowloon past things like night markets etcVery good but you miss the laser show.There is a fee for this as well.The second night we went from the foot of Nathan street to the harbour wall of Kowloon and joined the crowds to watch the skyline, see the local junk with its red sails take passengers for a sail and the watched and listened to the laser/music show of Hong kong island.The clearer the night, the better but enjoyable... and there is no cost.

HK skyline is magical. Go to the promenade in TST via STAR ferry and then sit and watch the sun set. The laser show wasn't amazing so I wouldn't bother and the avenue of stars is temporarily closed so I didn't get a chance to see it. The atmosphere is buzzing though. It's nice just looking across the water.

Nothing beats the Hong Kong Skyline.. This is an instantly recognisable sight from various parts of Hong Kong. The bus up to Stanley gives you some wonderful views. You get a panoramic view from the Peak or from across the water on the Kowloon side. Every night there is a light and laser show highlighting various buildings and The best of this is likely to be from the water.
Laser Light River Cruise. We did the laser light river cruise which was lovely, although cold, we had to buy jackets. There was free drinks (alcoholic!) to keep us warm though

Awesome! . You read about it, you see pics of it but that's nothing compared with seeing it for real. Awesome sky scrapers, some of them scarily narrow make a real impression. Prepare for a stiff neck!

Beautiful. Just beautiful! To see the HK skyline at night is always nice. The laser show is little overated. But you can be sure that when it's over, you can sit and enjoy the view from Kawloon side of HK without all the tourists flashing with thrir cameras.

Stunning 24 hours. At day or at night the Hong Kong skyline is gorgeous. Walk along the water front and take it in. In the evening you can enjoy the laser show. Sometimes there is entertainment. Lots of chances for great photos. I never tire of it. Take the Star Ferry for an even more novel way to view the skyline.

Dinner time !. A view from some of the high raises in Kowloon after wit exellent food and wine is a perfect finish to the evening, we dined at the Ninhai no 1, after some drinks in the Sheraton top floor bar, where we took pictues from. Heavy priced? Yes, but how often do You come here?
Cosmopolitian!. Hong Kong skyline shows it cosmopolitan feature that you should not miss! You can see the skyscrapers, lighting show at 8pm daily. Also fireworks displays in CNY and National Day.

Very good view of the city both at night and daytime. The Hong Kong Skyline is one of the best skylines in the world. During night time you can see some of the most well-lit buildings and skyscrapers in the world.

Great views of a great city. Straight up the tram for amazing views and we'll worth the wait. The lines were huge but it's well worth it to get up the tram. Its cash only (although no signs tell you this) so make sure you have cash prior to lining up.

Spectacular. The skyline of Hong Kong is a tribute to the capitalist new world. In Hong Kong everything is within easy reach. Public transport allows you to move around these impressive high buildings with ease.
Super good. Ita amazing experience ,fantastic views , and a must do while in Hong Kong ,better to be done in cold weather
Amazing skyline. The Hong Kong Observation wheel was unexpected since it was my first time seeing it so close. I was happy to see an amazing skyline.
Overated as one of the Wonders of the World. Its very nice indeed and being in Hong Kong you shouldn't miss it but don't count it as an highlight experience. Not more and not less

worth a visit. We got the MTR across from HK Island to Kowloon and to get the best view you simply cross the road from the Peninsula hotel at the bottom of Nathan Road and get a space on the harbour front. One thing to note is that the crowds are usually quite substantial

Who doesn't like a light show?. Every night at 8:00pm see the FREE laser light show emitted from the buildings overlooking Hong Kong harbor. Best spot outdoors for this 13 minute show is at the star ferry terminal. Best spot indoors is at the 4 th floor buffet at the YMCA where the huge glass windows face the harbor. Bring your camera and do a short video of the lights changing on the faces of the buildings and the ferries docking.

Beautiful skyline even in foggy afternoon . We went here around 5.00 p.m, so we could see the skyline between the daytime and the night time. It was very beautiful, even in foggy afternoon. The combination of tall buildings, light, and sea make the scenery look perfect. If you stay until 8.00 p.m, you can enjoy Symphony of the Lights. Be sure you get the best spot to see it.

Beauftiful. Our hotel offered a fantastic view - we watched the laser show on the buildings and had a nice time. Would be nice to take a boat out in the harbour to check it out. Star ferry likely easiest option.
Must see. A brilliant view of the pearl of the Orient. This a never to miss cityscapeIt is literally the city that never sleeps. The view is breath taking.

Beautiful and Romantic. The night view from Victoria Harbor is beautiful - the lights, chilly wind and the sounds of water, boats and music makes it romantic, too. I visited in the daytime but I find the night view and experience better. Victoria Harbor is walking distance from Tsim Tsa Tsui.
Changed a lot. New buildings contuially being built, still some of the old ones that I knew were there, managed to even see my old flat

Tall buildings and Lights.. I enjoy their skyline more with the sun compare at night. I don't know why. But maybe its because of the disappointing HK Symphony of Lights. Well I've been to Singapore which I think is more impressive than this. You can also peacefully enjoy the view unlike here in HongKong where people are everywhere.

Amazing Sight. Well if one visits Hong Kong, one has to catch the night sight of the Harbour from Tsim Tsa Tsui. It is a treat to the eye to catch the fireworks at 10pm. Also there are plenty of other things to do around during daytime. There is the museum in the vicinity and many eat outs offering many cuisines. Also the avenue of stars is just a walk by.
Unique. The Hong Kong skyline must be fairly unique with its background of majestic peaks and high rise buildings. Viewed at night it is even more spectacular!
Lights . What can you say about skylines many look the same , in Hong Kong a little different lights sound and laser show every night from star ferry terminal

Fantastic View Perpetually Ruined By Pollution. Unfortunately Hong Kong, like most of China, is permanently shrouded in pollutants that make for poor visibility and which creates breathing issues. A wonderful harbour blighted by a lack of Government-regulated pollution controls.

Inspiring, exciting and unique. The Hong Kong skyline is unique - beutiful background, those green, tall mountains and the seemingly random giant towers, a bit alien but also inspiring and exciting. Worth a few hours of ealking and almost impossible to make enough pictures
Nightly light show is beautiful. The skyline is impressive during the day, but even better at night when there's an animated light show. The reflections in the harbor are also gorgeous.

Just plain charming and beautiful. The evening skyline along Victoria Harbor is so beautiful. There is a place next to the Star Ferry at Tsim Sha Tsui we can see the skyline. I can see why they call Hong Kong " The Pearl of the Orient"
A sight to Behold. Crossing to Kowloon by Starlight Ferry at 8pm a wonderful experince will greet your eyes.A BLISTERING show of lights that left our jaws dropping. A must see when in HK
Worth a visit. a great scenery , definitely worth a visit. You get to see the light show every night at eight pm. Near the harbour

A great skyline. It is a gorgeous skyline, that is becoming more iconic.
You can experience this from any number of rooftop / sky bars in downtown Hong Kong. I do think the night lighting makes it appear prettier, but see for yourself.
I would recommend doing that, but also just experience it walking
To see it is to believe it. The Hong Kong skyline is pretty unique and is especially spectacular during the evening "light show" find an advantage point on the harbour side and enjoy

one of the best city skylines in the world. Go after sunset at "blue hour" for best shots. You won't be disappointed. at 20.00 there is a light show on the buildings - nothing extra spectacular but nice thing still to see. The way they have light up the buildings is definitely worth to see.
Great atmosphere of an evening.. The Hong Kong Skyline is so beautiful and amazingly pretty of a night. There are so many vantage points to see the night lights.

Fantastic View of the City. This is fantastic to behold, all the tall buildings and the lights attesting to the progress that Hong Kong is undergoing. I never tire seeing the skyline every time I visit Hong Kong. You can enjoy this while on the bus going to the city, and also on the MTR.

The more you pay, the better it gets. There are a variety of places that afford great views of the cities - but in my experience, the better places tend to be a little more expensive - but worth every penny. The Peak is great, but so is Bar 100!

Pretty. It is what it is, a bunch of buildings with colourful lights on. If you are in Hong Kong then you should probably see the skyline at night as it is free. If you are basing your entire trip to HK on just seeing the skyline don't... just look at photo instead. Don't bother taking a ferry to see the lights as some websites suggest, as you can clearly see the skyline from land.Arrive a little early and watch the sunset. Be proactive as mainland Chinese tourists will crowd the viewing areas and push their way in front of you to block your view if you let them.Keep an eye on the weather as clouds and fog will make the skyline difficult to see.

Stunning, especially at night!. The Hong Kong skyline,especially viewing from the Kowloon side is simply stunning, especially at night. We were staying at the Ritz Calton, which is a great vantage point. Totally free too!
One of the World's Best Skylines. The Hong Kong Skyline is one of the world's best skylines with some of the most well-lit buildings and skyscrapers in the world.

The pictures don't do it justice - you have to be there!. It's not just the lights, or the masses of tall buildings but it's also the atmosphere, the people and the bustle of the city that makes this place so amazing. Take a ferry at night and see it from the water, it is something special from there too!

Fantastic view by day & night. Our hotel had fabulous views both by day & night overlooking the skyline. It was interesting just sitting in the lounge on the 21st floor of our hotel watching the boats sail up & down. By night the office buildings looked lovely lit up.
See it from Kowloon at a Harbour front hotel. See it from Kowloon at a Harbour front hotel. The Shangri-La is perfect for this. One of the world's most iconic city views.
Great view. Great view over the city from the top of Victoria Peak from which you could see virtually the whole of the city

Stunning Night Views and Light show. One of the best experiences in Hong Kong is totally free. The views of the Hong Kong skyline from the waterfront should not be missed. Our recent visit was to Kowloon side, but excellent views can also be seen from Hong Kong island.From the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station, follow the signs for Star Ferry and with the ferry pier in front of you turn to the left and walk for a few minutes to select your spot by the water. If you arrive at about 7.45 pm you will be in time to witness the free sound and light show which takes place at 8 o'clock every night.Powerful laser lights are synchronized to music and for 15 minutes you are transfixed with amazement. Hong Kong is a dynamic city and the sheer size of the skyscrapers are awe inspiring and are shown at their best from the waterfront. Choose a clear night.
Beautiful . Hong Kong is famous for its beautiful and lovely skyline It looks gorgeous in night . And 8 pm in night with fireworks it looks more amazing .

Buildings to light up the night.. I have been to many cities but Hong Kong Victoria harbour is the best site to see. Especially at 8pm when there is a 10 minute light show. The lights on the buildings are all controlled by one computer. The lights dance up and down buildings, lasers fire across the harbour, music plays. Look carefully at the top of Central Plaza in Wan Chi and you can tell the time. The spire going to the heavens has 4 lights, one light changes every 15 minutes. So forgot you watch just look at that building.
Wow. Stunning by night, we saw it for Chinese New Year and the skyline was even more impressive than usual. Beautiful to see from a high floor in the hotel or from the Star Ferry. Iconic.

Amazing Manhattenesque skyline.. We had two meals in restaurants on the 28th and 30th floors of buildings on Kowloon overlooking this skyline and each time enjoyed the 8PM laser light show. Imagine a futuristic world and you will not go far wrong.

Great view, especially at night.. We were lucky that our hotel was right on the harbourfront, and the views from our 19th floor room was magnificient. Both the lounge and both bedrooms faced the water. Absolutely beautiful at night with all the lights, and interesting during the day with all the traffic on the harbour.

Travellers delight. One of the must see things to do when in Hong Kong this city is amazing. Whether you see the harbour from The Peak or any of the high rise buildings you must also view it from the harbour.

Mesmerizing light show at night. The skyline of this congested city full of high rises, by the waterfront at night is beautifully lit up at night. And when the light show comes on it is mesmerizing, transforming the city into a somewhat Disney World evening light show look alike!
Lights Lights Lights. Every time you look at the skyline there is a different, view, the lights keep changing different buildings light up, it is a truly amazing sight.

The skyline is a must see when in Hong Kong. We took a taxi to the top of Victoria Peak, foregoing the tram ride due to the higher cost. We saw the skyline just before sunset and then stayed to see the skyline after dark. Don't miss the skyline if you are touring through Hong Kong

The best skyline in the world!. The Hong Kong skyline in HK Island is, in my humble opinion, by far the best in the world! If day or night, good weather or bad weather, it is just breathtaking and amazing to see all the different kind of big and even bigger buildings paired with the green mountains of HK Island. There's always something new to discover. Every evening at 20:00 o'clock the world famous A SYMPHONY OF LIGHTS show can be watched there, a laser and light show which highlights the skyline for 15 minutes. It's a MUST to see and shall not be missed!
Incredible skyline. My first time in Hong Kong & what a skyline, best viewed from Kowloon. Better weather would have helped but even so, in the overcast atmosphere, it's quite a sight
Beautiful lights. Perfect for a couples to go and see. Lights every night with music. Last about 15 min. Watch the skyline of hongkong.

Amazing. Walking along Victoria Harbour is amazing and relaxing. Weather was perfect and the gentle ocean breeze was just enough to keep things comfortable. Make sure to visit the Kowloon side and take in the view of the Hong Kong Island high rises. And it costs nothing to stroll, sit, and stroll some more.

The best in the world. Hong Kong skyline in the evening is the best among the cities around the world, especially you look at it from the peak or from the Kowloon side. Try to watch the laser show at 8 every evening from Tsim Sha Tsui or Wan Chai.

Still one of the best skylines in the Far East.. Ever since the early 1970's as a young navy man, Hong Kong was always the most exotic, diverse and beautiful city I ever saw. I never got tired of looking at the skyline from the deck of our ship anchored off the old China Fleet Club. The skyline's bigger these days. The buildings are so much taller and densely packed, and I don't care for the Ferris wheel (and I miss the junks). But, it's still hypnotizing. A person could spend hours at night walking the piers and promenades of Kowloon and never stop taking pictures. Daytime is impressive in its own right, but nighttime is best. Take a night Star Ferry ride (upper deck) and have the cheapest, prettiest ride in Asia. Or, go to Victoria Peak (anytime) and see it from the backside. Still the best.

Iconic skyline that should be on everyone's bucket list. Hong Kong is a special place to visit. It offers everything you could ever want or expect from a big city. The skyline is awesome. Whether you enjoy the view from a ferry while traveling across Victoria Harbor or if you trek up to Victoria Peak, the skyline is incredible. Enjoy the views during the day and the night. They're totally different. At night, the skyscrapers are illuminated and they put on quite a show.
Amazing view. Very beautiful Skyline. Definitely worth seeing at night when the buildings are all lit up. We saw the skyline by ferry boat at loved it!!

Nice Skyline, a good view of the City. Gives you a good view of the city, you can get some very nice pictures.
The Dancing Lights show is something that you can skip, nothing special.
I'd recommend you take the Ferry across the HK island and Tsim Sha Tsui, you'll get the same view with the water feel.
Wow. What's more to say about Hong Kong skyline. It's absolutely breath taking and one does not seem to get enough!

View from Kowloon at night is unforgettable. Light show also fun.. Take in the night time view from the art museum, raised sidewalk.
Laser show a nice complement but HK skyscrapers with lights flashing in sync to music are the star of the show

Beautiful View. Stayed in a hotel with harbour views for two nights. Amazing sights to wake up/go to sleep to. We got into our room at night and were blown away by the lights and the laser show every night.
Awesome. Funny how so many skyscrapers or tower blocks are in such close proximity and they seem to work really well but when we build them here in the uk they become ghettos and sink estates!!!!
Well worth a look. We find the best views are from any Restuarant at 1 Peking Road. So much to see and even during the day it is a great watch

Beats new york. Great pictures at sunrise and sunset
And even better when lights are all on at nite keep flash on cameras off for better efect
Simply stunning. The skyline of this city is a must-see. Be it from a sky bar, from Star Ferry, or th Peak. Really shines - of course, at night.

Mind blowing. The Hong Kong skyline is absolutely spectacular. At night, both the Kowloon and Hong Kong sides are lit up with neon lights, pictures morphing on business buildings, laser lights shining around the harbour and overall beauty. It's mesmerizing.

To have a great view of HK. It was a sunny day on 3 March 2016. I purchased the Sky 100 ticket via internet at the discount price of HKD142 (walk-in price was HKD168). Sky100 is a 360-degree indoor observation deck on the 100th floor of the International Commerce Centre, in in the Gold area of Elements, West Kowloon, Hong Kong.
