I went to Elements by taking green bus No. 26 near the Jordan MTR station. I arrived the ticketing counter by 11:20 am and got my ticket. Maybe it was so early or whatever reason, people was few and I did not need to wait for taking the left. I spent about 30 minutes over there to take photos and enjoy the nice view of HK.

A sympthany of lights at night. Fantastic during the day but simply comes alive at night. Victoria Harbor has the worlds best sound and light show of an evening that brings the cityscape to life. Over 40 skyscrapers on both sides of the harbor are involved in this multimedia spectacular. Every evening at 8pm for around 15 minutes you will enjoy this spectacular synchronized laser light display that brings the visitors to a standstill. Its something you have to see at least once in a lifetime!!

An incredible view. We were really lucky to have a room in the intercontinental hotel with a view of this spectacular skyline. Once it starts to get dark the skyline seems to be constantly changing and it is just mesmerising. We sat in our room and watched the light show last night and although we couldn't see all of the show or hear the music we were still pretty impressed. I think this is the best skyline in the world that I have seen.

Must See!. The night time skyline in Hong Kong by the harbor is unlike any I have ever seen. Each building is outlined and illuminated. At 8pm you can watch the laser light show. The laser show was ok; I was more impressed with the lights on the buildings themselves. You can view both from the Starr Ferry, or from the pier, or the Ocean Terminal Mall.

Unique! . We bought some coffees and sat on a bench in tsui tsa tsui around 6 in the afternoon .. As the day was dawning the skyline started to light up. At 8 o clock the show started and it was amazing! It lasts about 10 minutes and it's totally worth it.

Excellent Views. We very much enjoyed the skyline at Hong Kong as we viewed from the harbor. We visited during the day and took pictures, then returned at night for the laser show. The show was good, but nothing compared to the show in Nanchang. I would recommend everyone checkout the skyline when in Hong Kong!
Sit by the harbor, having a quiet quality time with the loved one. Still till middle of the night by the harbor, having a sweet quiet talk with my loved one. One of the most romantic night in my life
Very nice. A nice skyline, we watched the Lunar new year fireworks here and it was good fun (nothing on London or Sydney but still good). A nice way to spend a few hours walking along the waterside.
Amazing views at night time. I caught the star ferry over from the harbour shopping centre on Kooloon Island to the Exhibition Centre at sunset and this is when the city skyline come alive.

Fantastic!. One of the best views in Hong Kong Island and it will never fail to awe you especially if you visit at night. LED light show would illuminate the skyscrapers and it is a view that is synonymous to the country and also countless of Hong Kong movies.

Breathtaking - no other skyline quite compares . Whether you view Hong Kong from Kowloon or Kowloon from Hong Kong, there is no other skyline quite like that of Hong King/Kowloon. You don't have to take a ferry to get a good look, just walk up to the platform on either side and enjoy the view! Outstanding. Only NYC and Shanghai even come close to comparing to this majestic view...

Go to the Kowloon side to see Hong Kong Island's amazing skyline!. The skyline of incredibly cool modern buildings on Hong Kong island is worth the trip to the Kowloon side. Amazing at night from one of the many rooftop bars and restaurants. Try one of the penthouse bars at the cool shopping center on Canton Road
Great light show. Night time dazzles with LED light show on the many skyscrapers. Best viewed from up high (Ritz Carlton has some great dining and bar options with amazing views).
Great place. Very nice location for picture taking, or just walking and even jog in the morning. But place not so clean
Take a walk. Beautiful night and this amazing view of colourful lights and you will feel like in another world... don't miss it an take good camera with you

The most popupal sight of the city.. This is the most popupal sight of the city. Do not miss it at night niether at daylight. There is a cheap ferry to take good pictures of it. There is a nice light show every night.

Colourful. My parents and I went to the Tamar Park by the Victoria Harbour behind the Admiralty MTR station to watch the vast 25K white Rose LED light display from South Korea. It is located right next to the new Hong Kong government administrative buildings that include the legislative hall and the chief executive officer's office. It is supposed to have the largest green space in Hong Kong. Hong Kong night skyline is much colourful if viewed from the Kowloon Harbourfront walkway. Check out the Discover Hong King website on nightly light show.
Beautiful skyline. Very nice skyline. The skyline is impressive at night and even has a laser show. Great for taking pictures from the harbor location.
BEAUTIFULL IN GOOD WEATHER. Try to look in a sky bar arround 20.00 hr for the nice laser show. The view is super in the Aqua bar, or the sky lounge at Sheraton.
Light show. The light show was amazing. The buildings were lighting up left and right so every which way you look would be lights. The skyline was amazing we ran back and forth on the walkway.

One of the worlds greatest skylines. Best seen from Victoria Harbour or the Star Ferry. You need to get out of Hong Kong proper to enjoy it. I didn't see the laser light show but the skyline is always a glow at night.
Don't miss the light show.. Light show is fun. The buildings light up brilliantly. However, the ferry isn't needed to view this show. Check the show timings.
Skyline. Feb.2016 . The Skyline is amazing . Unfortunately it was cloudy . But dont miss it . You can go for a walk here and enjoy it
Hong Kong. A must see on a clear or foggy day. The weather changes the view which was good on both visits. We were lucky as there were displays for the new year about
Beautiful night scene. Took a stroll after dinner and enjoyed the view of Victoria Harbor. The night scene is beautiful on a clear day.

Incredible views and great lightshow. When I was there, they had music on the Kowloon side of the harbour while lasers reacted to it on the Hong Kong side. There was also a great 3D light show on the Kowloon side but that was only for the month of February. Overall, it is an impressive sight to see at night as well as being around many great tourist attractions such as museums and being right next to a very large shopping and dining area.
Take the Ferry. It is fun to take the ferry and view the skyline from one side to the other. The evening Symphony of Lights is fun to see from the ferry or from the side.

Beautiful view from the Intercon. THE reason to stay here.. Ask how to tell time from the lights on the tower and enjoy the nightly light show. And make sure to stay up late to see the lights begin to go out too

Like a postcard. You get to see the Hong Kong Skyscrapers and the view is great. There is Light and sound show (Symphony of Lights - 8:00 PM local time). This is great as you can watch the skyscrapers dance with music (okay the lights do the hard work), which is quite unique.

What a view . If your looking for the perfect night view in Hong Kong. This is a must. Breathtaking view from up top especially at night! Weather you go alone or go with friends or parent this is the perfect place!

Breathtaking. First impressions,fabulous,from the height the whole ambience is fantastic,a city that never sleeps with an evening light and laser show to highlight the buildings,stunning architecture.

Hong Kong views. The Hong Kong skyline is stunning, but we had to deal with February haze. So the view could have been crisper. In the early evening the high rises put on light shows up and down their building. We watched it every night because it was so intriguing.

Metropolitan skyline. Too bad it was lightly rainy when we visited the place so we cannot really enjoy the nightly breeze. It was also difficult to take picture of the skyline background without SLR and a tripod, so we just enjoyed the dancing light (which really not that breathtaking anyway, but still fun nonetheless).

Hong Kong's Famous Skyline. More compact and dramatic when viewed from across the water in Kowloon, over Victoria Harbour. The easiest way to explore the island's most famous buildings.
The Hong Kong Island skyline is one of the most spectacular cityscapes in the world. Highly recommended!

Light Show so so. So so and I was disappointed. Not very impressive on a cool and slightly misty evening . Only a few lights flashing in time with the muzak -
I was disappointed as a first timer and my wife said it had gone downhill from her previous visit.
ONE OF THE WORLDS MUST SEES. This is my 4th time in HK and the view is always breathtaking both during the day and night-time. Get there early for the lazer show,

Boring.... The Skyline in Hong Kong is lit up and there is a laser show around 8:00pm most nights. Depending on the angle of your view it you might see something exciting or interesting. But the few times I've seen this now have been pretty unremarkable. I guess it makes sense to check it off a bucket list... But otherwise skip it.

Magnificent Skylines. In fact there are two skylines, that of Hong Kong Island, and that of Kowloon. Each is best viewed from the other. The best viewing is either at ground level, or from on high.For ground level viewing the waterfront at Hong Kong or Kowloon is good, but in my opinion the view from the Star ferry crossing between the two is excellent.For viewing from on high Victoria Peak is good, but however it was very hazy when we went up there with the tramway.My most memorable view of the Hong Kong skyline was from the Nanhai No 1 restaurant on the 30th floor of the iSquare tower in Kowloon. At night the view of Hong Kong island with all of the buildings lit up is amazing, and we were lucky enough to catch the evening laser show whilst we were there.

Astonishing view of Hong Kong Island skyline from Kowloon. The skyline of Hong Kong Island, as seen from Kowloon promenade, is amazing.Unfortunately, we missed the daily light show at 08:00 pm on Sunday, 7 Feb. because of unknown reason - there was no show!
Vertical indeed. Hong Kong is truly vertical living. The skyline is impressive and the light show in the evening gives it a different angle. Must go to Kwoloon and see the light show.
Great view. We had a great view from our room at Shangri la Kowloon. The view is breathtaking, this view is second to none in comparison with great city such as New York or Shanghai.

Unique skyline! . As all the reviews here say, this skyline is certainly exceptional and has its very own character. Regardless of weather, time & viewpoint, Hong Kong Skyline always is a stunning experience
Best skyline in the world!. HK Skyline never gets boring and beautiful at day and night! Don't miss the laser show which takes place each night at 8:00pm!

WOW. As the title says WOW, day or night the skyline is spectacular! Best viewed from the water, but when you get up close to the buildings you realise how insignificant you really are.
I have attached a few photos for reference.

Never seen this many skyscrapers. These aren´t the tallest in the world, but there are too many. US cities have their downtown clusters of high-rise buildings, London has some amazing ones as well, but Hong Kong seems like ONLY high-rise buildings. Even in the remote areas. And, the light shows at night (around Victoria harbour) is an amazing extra twist and spectacle.
Perfect for evening visits. Ideal place to spend evenings. Hong Kong skyline complimented with nice sea breeze and great views of numerous ships

The ship sailed into HK harbour in the early morning and the skyline, although slightly misty, was awesome!. We watched the sound and light show in the pouring rain and were a little disappointed. Probably the weather!
To be done: the best skyline in the world. If you go on Victoria Harbour, there is a show of light with music every evening at 20:00 (which is not that amazing but still, it's cool)

The Best Skyline in the World!. So New Yorkers may be up in arms with my claim, but having lived in both cities, I would say HK's Skyline wins hands down. Don't get me wrong, I love NYC and some of the buildings but the sheer scale, number and density of the skyline in HK is truly spectacular.

One of the best. We stayed at the Intercontinental and had a wonderful view from our room. We also walked down the street, in front of the Hong Kong Museum of Art. Great photo shots of the city. The laser show starts at 8pm I believe. The walkway "avenue of stars" I think it's called was closed, under renovation.
lovely. The Hong Kong skyline is best viewed from Kowloon and it's one of the iconic must sees while your in Hong Kong!

A holiday season. I remember there was a dragon boat. You want to have a dinner on the boat. It was a sensational one. The menu was delicious. They serve chinese food and the best thing is in Hong Kong you get to drink chinese tea. So o long or jasmine friends?

Impressive Skyline. We were absolute impressed by Hong Kong's Skyline and we realized how much this city has grown since we were last there. Amazing views certainly worthwhile viewing. Again very impressive.
Amazing. Took the ferry over from Kowloon to Hong Kong island in the day . Took it back at night . Totally different at night with all the lights . Well worth the 20p(2hkd)

I like the very attractive harbor!. There was a light show that we viewed from an al fresco restaurant at the Ocean Terminal. It is shown every 8pm for about 10 minutes. It is only in HK by far that I can see buildings with lights and animation.
Very relaxing!
Awesome view. You can have a awesome view of HK from here. Visited in night and view was great. Whenever you visit HK do go here.
amazing..... Particularly at night. Either side is great. Try to get a good vantage point for the light shows. Try one of the dinner boats that run on the river for a little treat.
Early evening to see the lights come on.. Choose a clear day if you want to take pictures of the evening lights.picture from star ferry great. Also great pics can be taken from the Peak.

Skyline. After sunset every night you can enjoy the laser show from the Avenue of the Stars. Check on the internet about the times cause I've been there last year and I forgot but I know I really liked it and would reccomend it to everybody! Make sure to go there 20min earlier to take a good place to enjoy the show, quite few people will be there

Magnificent skyline. This has to be a great viewing area, looking across the harbour to Hong Kong Island especially at night with all the advertising lights on the buildings, some have lasers which dance through the night sky.
Amazing views. If you have good luck with the weather then, seeing this Hong Kong skyline surpasses that of many other metropolitan cities of the world. A must see.

Amazing. Took in the skyline from our restaurant - atop a tall building - overlooks Vuctoria harbour.Sensational view - when you are in HK... You absolutely must take advantage of the many excellent vantage points & take in the amazing skyline. We chose Woolimoloo restaurant - Wan Chai district.Diesnt really matter where, suffice to say, you owe it to yourself to take in one of the worlds most fascinating, colourful skylines.Note: try to plan ahead so no overcast, fog/mist is about. It will detract from the view.

Sparkling Skyline. Truly one of the most beautiful skylines in the world, with a deep harbor separating the two islands of Hong Kong. The bright lights reflecting against the dark waters of the harbor makes this one of the top 3 skyline I've seen in my travels. The harbor used to be wider and further apart giving it more dimension and distance, however due to the need of property, they keep filling the land more and more, so now the skyline looks closer and closer. Nevertheless, it is a must-do while in Hong Kong, to visit the harbor at nightfall and try to get a nice photo amongst the throngs of Mainlander tourist.

Valentine's treat. Took my wife out to dinner the day before Valentine's by the harbour so we could both enjoy the view of the symphony of light, together. It was a lovely evening and even though I felt queasy after the star ferry crossing there was still a magical quality to the evenings events.We couldn't hear any music from where we were sat but we sure enjoyed the floor show. We felt it had been a little over sold but was very beautiful regardless
Hong Kong River Buffet. It was the beginning of the Lunar New Year. The evening River Cruise Buffet was wonderful. The lights from all the buildings with the decorations was spectacular.

Breath-taking. All lit up at night, there is no better sight. The Symphony of Lights display was brilliant. There are swarms of people, Chinese people too, that flock to watch this every night. This is one attraction which is always crowded. Well worth it.

Gotta see it. Few cities can provide this at all and fewer as well at Hong Kong. Wait for the 8pm. laser show which is really quite something. Shiny shiny doesn't quite describe and I am glad not to be paying their electric bills.

Beautiful Scene.. Hong Kong Skyline lights up every evening from 8 pm till 815 pm , its a scene worth treasuring , the latest architectural structures makes the view more thrilling and then the light show is just Wow.. A must viisit while in Hong Kong

Nice views of the tallest skyscrapers in HKG. We reached there just exactly before the Light and sound show which starts daily at 08 pm. And yes it was worth it ... What a magnificent view it was.... Dark night... Light playing onto sky scrapes with music in sync...... with a cool breeze along the bank.Must visit when in HKG.

Beautiful night view. The view of the Hong Kong Island skyline is extremely beautiful. It is better than the Kowloon skyline. The view at sunset or night is better than during the day because it is quite foggy or smoky during the day.

Must do night time activity. Absolutely stunning view from victoria harbour. Every evening at 20.00 there is a light show which in my view was a bit disappointing. The view however certainly isn't. If you're in Hong Kong in the evening definitely spend a few minutes here enjoying the breathtaking view. Don't forget your camera!

Beautiful, amazing lights. We saw this during daytime and at night, at night from Star Ferry and Bahinia Dinner Cruise. This is a must see. Beautiful lights, beautiful buildings, great light show at night. Try to do this at night when weather is clear, our night was hazy and foggy, so light show wasn't the best (lasers were fuzzy). But still worth it.
Iconic!. Can spend hours just looking at it! We were there whilst there was a CNY light show by the Clock Tower, to add to its attraction.
It's beautiful in both directions. If you are in HK Island, the view of Kowloon is amazing. If you are in Kowloon, the view of HK Island is spectacular. Its a great view at daytime or night time.

stunning views. Only in hong kong for the day so wanted to see the skyline. Managed to see it at night and sunrise thanks to jet lag! The night time is without the best show with the lights shinning off the water

Great free light show. A great free light show at night that is a must see for anyone travelling to Hong Kong. The variety of adverts and lights is truly amazing and makes you wonder how much power is needed to make them work. There are numerous vantage points along the harbour front to view the lights although it can get crowded.
Night landscape along Victoria Harbour. This is a good place to take in the harbour view, either side of the channel. Not for foul weather though.
light show. the light show was not as spectacular as we were lead to believe - maybe because it was the off season - get there early - we were on the kooloown side and easy 5000 there

Amazing at Night. This is a reason to Visit Hong Kong, the night time light show at 20:00 is incredible and all of the building light up. But the skyline is a sight to cause a gasp of any seasoned traveller, is subline in the fact that you are in a City owned by China, Run by Hong Kong and loved by all! If you can get to the Clock Tower for 8pm to watch the light show, is reall is a must and again its FREE!

beautiful. Really beautiful scenic place to come and visit. Really busy though and was really humid as well, you couldn't spend the whole day here but seeing the view from the harbour is a must when visiting Hong Kong.

goog nicce. hi all
this point is verry good. very nice, i thing clap ckap them. light briliant... good value, good service, wwelcome have BBF!

Bleak concrete monstrosities . If you're into high rise skylines, You're in the right place and must see the HK skylines from the peak. If not, you can still do the laser light show on the island side ocean front high rises that happens every evening at the TST pier, always busy and fun to watch the mainland tourists have a blast

Inspiring in daytime; magical at night. Some architectural gems both here and on the facing Kowloon waterfront. Even better after dark with light displays, including nightly laser light show at 8 p.m.

Jewel of the orient. The harbor is the most beautiful and must-see sight of Hong Kong. The best time to see the harbor is just before sunset and the place place is the peak of Hong Kong Island. As the sun goes down, the light start come on and gets brighter and more gorgeous with nightfall. Another place to see is the waterfront at the Kowloon side along East Trimshatsui. Rd place to see is taking the Star Ferry between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. It is much cheaper than a harbor cruise and the view is the same.
Saw the light show. We stood around to see the show, it was good and we took photos. I would go see it again- take a video camera.
Great view at night. Great view to see at night. Some of the buildings have a light show and you can find restaurants and shopping near by.

The Hong Kong skyline. . Always wanted to see what the Hong Kong skyline was like and finally got the chance after a business trip in Seoul. Made use of the calm cool clear weather. The only problem I had was that it was the lunar new year so people were plenty and the fact that many of them buildings didn't have their full lights on, but still the view was spectacular. It's always lovely to go there and I am sure the summer will make it even better. So if you are deciding to go, then go when ever you need to but try and make sure the weather is on your side otherwise it would Be a somewhat wasted Journey.
A must do. Victoria harbour is a must do when in Hong Kong . 8.00 Pm every evening is a light and lazer show and its all free
Beautiful view. The Hong Kong skyline is an impressive sight. Cool light show and a cool ambience. Must be seen when in Hong Kong.

Beautiful sight. This is the gem of Hong Kong, stunning and spectacular! It's a short walk from the TST MTR station, and if you want less crowd then come here on a weekday afternoon. After this visiting this place you can take the Star Ferry across the harbor to Central. I believe every Thursday night they have the nightshow, so don't miss out.
Spectacular light show every night at 8pm. View this free and famous light show from Kowloon facing Hong Kong Island. It is free and fun for any age. This is the view you will see in movies.
Just love this skyline. Every time I visit HK, I love to see this skyline. Whether from Kowloon, Victoria Peak or a ferry - day or night, this is amazing.

Stunning. Nothing like a view of the gleaming towers of Hong Kong anywhere in the world. It was a view unmatched by any other. Sitting at one of the benches and just staring at it was one of the best things I did during the trip. And take a ferry to Central, sit in one of the cabins and just enjoy the cruise.

Fabulous way to end the day. Stand on either the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade or the other side of the Harbour and you wont be disappointed. The light show is a treat. The skyline lights up and is a delightful 15 minutes of some excellent choreography that calls your attention to the buildings across the sea. In the midst of it you spot the famous Chinese Junk all lit up in a glowy red that is constantly sailing across the harbour. Pure delight to watch. Its free and you can stand with your popcorn or a sip a warm drink (this was December!) and watch the show.

Hong Kong Vista. Wherever you go around Hong Kong waterfront the view is ever-changing and so interesting. You can see Aberdeen and the Floating Restaurants via the Hop On Hop Off Bus, which includes a trip on a small boat around the floating restaurants and the house boats, which is most interesting.

Relaxing and peaceful location. I was very much tired of a long journey but in the evening when I reached this place, I was very much relaxed and regained my energy after watching such a beautiful location. The images of tall colourful buildings in the water was worth watching in night. I will say if you have gone to China, don't miss to see this place.
Nice Hong Kong . I enjoy very much in Hong Kong , the atmosphere the People ( always in a row ) the different places and offcourse the different and very nice foods

Amazingly Stunning. Thus is one of the major highlights for tourists at night. A#mustsee for all visitors. We were late when we got there but its alright as we still saw a few if it even though it was foggy and of course too crowded. We had fun. Lights were stunning!

Harbour tour . Definitely a beautiful harbour but this time with my friends we ended up there on the 8 Feb 2016 and the walk along the harbour in Kowloon was shut. Lots of streets around there were blocked off due to the Chinese New Year parade. As we crossed the subway to try to reach the harbour we came across the Harbour Tour. I think it's run by the same company as the ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon. Well, we got the boat at 17:55, it was such a delight! It cost approx US$20.00 per adult and they only accepted cash so we got the cash out of an adjacent ATM. We could have not done any better. We got on quickly on a lovely 2 decker boat. Tables and chairs were like in a French brassiere stuck on the floor. They gave us a new year gift and a snack and a drink included in the ticket. The cruise was approximately 1 hour and we were there exactly at sunset. We loved it. Now we don't know wether this was just one off harbour tour on that particular Lunar New Year's Day or a regular thing. Perhaps a kind traveller can let us know that. If you come across it, it's well worth a trip. We took some beautiful pictures!!!

It's treat to your eyes!!!. Victoria harbour is an must visit for person in Hong Kong. The sun goes down and skyscrapers illuminate the Victoria harbour. It among the top 3 attractions in the world for its night view. The place is beautifully lit up during the night time. If you are during the Chinese New Year, you shall see the 20 minutes non stop firework worth a watch

Bedazzled. No wonder Hong Kong is world famous for its skylight. Such a bedazzling view to behold. No matter how many times we visit this place, it always captivates us. The best view us during the Chinese New Year. Enjoy a nice stroll along the Tsim Tsa Chui Promenade and feast your eyes.

Best seen at night. The Central area skyline of Hong Kong is best seen from Kowloon, it comes alive after dark with neon and illumination on the major buildings. It is not essential to see the 8pm show as this adds little value, I was underwhelmed.

Spectacular fireworks for Chinese New Year on 9th February 2016. Wonderful fireworks lit up the fantastic Hong Kong skyline to celebrate the start of the Chinese New Year
So well organised - many many people but no problems whatsoever- very calm.

Magnificent Sky line views. Enjoy all the lights by taking the ferry from Central to Kowloon and vice versa. The day I was there the ferry was for free, but it normally doesn't cost much. It's easy to take photos in open air while enjoying being on the water at the same time.
Stunning. . My favourite bit of our visit to Hong Kong. Amazing views from the harbour. Light show slightly disappointing, I'm sure it's better on special occasions.

Mesmerizing . Hong Kong is man overwhelming nature, but it is beautiful in its own In-your-face sort of way. Building rival mountains for your attention and the lights at night combine as if to say "forget the stars; look here"

Amazing Experience... Hi guys, I visited HK during the first step of my honeymoon around the world. My expectations for the HK Skyline was really high and I had the opportunity to enjoy it in the night during an harbour cruise. The cruise had been really romantic and beautiful. Also the cost is reasonable because we paid 140 euros for two and they offered us champagne. The atmosphere was really amazing. Unfortunately the weather was a little bit misty so we could not enjoy at the best the symphony of lights...but this was one of the best thing to do in HK... ;-)

Best skyline. In my opinion hong kong has one of the most unique skylines in the world. You can just stand at the harbour and watch the colorful shiny buildings. The laser show is not worth the hussle though. It is very disappointing.

Incredible. This is a must do in the early evening around 8 pm.Go to the northern side (TsimShaTsui) of the harbour and look across to perhaps the most beautiful urban skyline in the world. The array of different buildings is startling in their varying designs and heights.At 8 pm there is a magnificent laser light show accompanied by music.Not to be missed!

A spectacular landscape of lights. This is one of the reasons I love Hong Kong so much. Such a spectacular landscape of tall buildings that light up the sky at night against the mountainous terrain as a backdrop.The neon signs look like a series of pop art in a real life setting which is quite fitting for Honk Kong and gives you the true essense of the energy that belongs there.

Just cant stop looking at it.. The lights keep on moving so it never looks the same. During Chinese New Year there are even more lights to enjoy.
Try to view if from both sides of the harbour.

A must for any trip. The light show from Kowloon side is a must for any visit. Get there early and stand by a speaker, the musical sound track is 50% 0f the show. You can also watch it in the roof top bar of the Seraton, they play the music too.
Amazing. We had only ever seen this on pictures or TV, but to see it in real life was amazing. The lights on the buildings were fascinating and every time we looked we saw something different.
The best skyline, especially during the night!. Very beautiful and modern skyline during the night. Best viewed during the night as the neon lights looks amazing

Breathtaking view and worth it. This is a view worth taking, in the sense that you take the train up the vertical incline to the top and watch the skyline from the viewing area. It will definitely take your breath away and if you happen to be there during fireworks, its even better,
Family Holiday . We only vistited once during our holiday. It was extremely busy and lasted a bit too long for 8 year old. Worth a visit to say you've seen it
Skyline. I like seeing Christmas decorations in February...kept in position for the Lunar New Year. HK skyline from across the harbour in Tsim Sha Tsui is a world class panorama

Amazing. You may have seen the famous Hong Kong skyline in movies, a magazine, or a television show. However, there is no comparison for seeing it yourself. There are so many ways to enjoy the skyline. Of course you have go to Victoria Peak and view it from the top. But don't dismiss the views from the Star Ferry or a walk along the Promenade near the Avenue of Stars. Either way, take a moment to put down the camera/phone and simply marvel at the engineering/architectural phenomenon that is Hong Kong. Remember, much of this city is reclaimed from the sea.

Great from many angles!. Three essential ways to see the amazing skyline. 1) Go to TST on the star ferry, walk along towards the intercontinental hotel and take in the views. 2) get on the water at night on a junk like Aqua Luna and 3) go up the peak and have a cocktail in cafe deco. Other great locations for views 1) Aqua bar or Hutong or the lobby bar at the intercontinental!

easy to take in day or night. you can hardly miss this special scene, day or night. easily accessed on both sides. spectacular view at night from ground level near the ferry terminals or higher at the eye bar and the peninsula.
Beautiful Views. One of the best views in the world! So easy to access right in the middle of the city, and if you love the hustle and bustle of a city HK is the place for you.

Awesome City of Lights. Even tough it was cool and drizzling when we were there the skyline is a must see. The reflections in the water from the wonderful light shows from the buildings is just awesome. Walk to the promenade viewing platform as we did or take a tour and see the wonderful lights.
Evening light show. Every evening at 8pm there is an evening light show across the harbour. We saw it 8yrs ago and then just recently. Our feeling was that it wasn't as good as previous.
Beautiful. Shopping shopping and more shopping. Disneyland ,the peak, ocean park and lots more .english speaking.

Great to view during sunset. Definitely take the Star Ferry from Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui, then sit outside in the raised viewing area on the water's edge in front of the Cultural Centre and watch the sun go down behind the skyscrapers to the west of Central. You'll be mesmerised by the sparkling lights of the waterfront towers running eastwards all the way to North Point and the coloured light-show reflections in the harbour. Watch out for the boats plying the waters, the ferries and perhaps a red-sailed traditional junk. Great photo opportunities.

Sky 100 building. it costs £16 to go up to the 100th floor but worth every penny and more, the express lift takes 66 seconds and your ears pop. Only go on a clear day and unless your super brave a very low wind day. I went on a clear calm day and the floor still moved like on a boat, its initially scary when you look out and see 50 story sky scrapers that look like toys. the 360 degree views are literally stunning. If you go to Hong Kong and don't do this your literally mad.Totally mind blowing!!

Unusual to see a city's skyline from the meddle of the city. Usually one has to view a big city's skyline from outside the city itself, but in Hong Kong you can stand on the waterfront at the Kowloon waterfront in the middle of the city and see the skyline of Hong Kong Island, while on Hong Kong island you can see the skyline of the Kowloon area: both beautiful.
it's one of the best skylines. maybe Shanghai will top HKG, but it's a great skyline nonetheless. Especially from kowloon you'll have the best view.

Must be seen. One of the things you must see when in Hong Kong. Hey its also one of the only thing that is free. Over Chinese New Year there was also a light show on many of the buildings, worth seeing

Great for selfies!. This is a must see at night! it is simply magical and understandable it is number 1 on trip advisor. In my opinion it is best seen from Kowloon side especially nathan road area. The buildings light up and if a ship sails past it is magical. I try and see this as often as i can as i live in Shenzhen. Top top attractiongreat for selfies!!
View from Victoria's Peak. Lovely view from Victoria's Peak even on a foggy or overcast day the views were excellent. You can't go wrong with checking out the skyline

Must see!. If you can be choosy about the night that you go...make sure that it is a clear night as the lights will look better (and so will your photos). The light show is fun, and goes very quickly as you are looking from one building to another. If you luck it, and a junk happens to pass by in the harbour at the same time...the contrast of old and new is terrific.
Beautiful. Viewing the Hong Kong skyline at night is beautiful. The kaleidoscope of colour is worth a leisurely stroll on the river front.
Prettiest I've ever experienced.. Blown away. Gorgeous. Breathtaking. Wonderful light shows. Simply stunning. You have to see it to truly appreciate it. I don't think it will ever get old.

Dissapointed!. It was listed as a must see in HK but during the time i visited area is still under renovation and no symphony of lights show, it was foggy that time so maybe they cancelled it. Near avenue of stars. Maybe its good to visit when renovations to the area are done but currently i wont recommend soending your time getting here.

Pretty to Look At, but the Light Show Was Underwhelming. It's nice to stroll up and down the TST promenade. At night, if it's clear, you can take pictures with an awesome background. I do recommend having one of the vendors take a photo. They take photos from different angles so you can choose one with Central, the exhibition center and other backdrops. The light show didn't do anything for us. The view is stunning enough without the light show.

Hong Kong Skyline. I've been to many parts of the world and seen a lot of pretty sight, but the Hong Kong Skyline is magnificent!! The architecture, the lighting, the harbor, the reflections on the harbor, the cool breeze. It's got it all !!!!

Awe Inspiring. This is possibly the most beautiful / breathtaking skyline in the world. Definitely take a ferry ride between the main city islands so you get to see each skyline that make up this massive city. The light show is slightly corny but well worth it. Such coordination between so many buildings.
HK night scene Best seen from the Kowloon side.. Try to get up high Kowloon side if you can.There is now a very high restaurant/bar on the west side of of Kowloon.

Ah, the sight!. This is definitely something you shouldn't miss. The Hong Kong skyline is visible from many points around the harbor. My favorite is on top of the IFC tower in Hong Kong's CBD. Besides enjoying the sight at night, you can swing by the nearby bars for a beer or two. What else can you ask for?
Fantastic. Fantastic skyline in day and WOW in the evening when at one end is music and at the other side of the water is this Amazing light show and laser show on the sky scrapers.
Wonderful. Beautiful scenery with the occasional boat sailing past, contrasting the old and new in a wonderful way! (I know the boats are probably 20 years old, but let's not ruin the illusion! ;) )

That was a view!. To top off your day in Hong Kong, go to Victoria Harbour to see the Symphonyw of Lights too. The lights show was a bit of a let down coz I was expecting a lot knowing I am in Hong Kong. It was a good experience though. What I enjoyed most is the skyline at night. Sitting there just staring at the sea and buildings with the chilly weather was a perfect ending to a day full of activities.

Great drinks and a view bar none. My fiancee and I went to Ozone around 8 PM on a Saturday end of January 2016. As we arrived quite early we had no problems getting a table.The bar menu offers a nice and wide selection of spirits and mixers. The drinks are somewhat pricy however I felt we got our value for money due to the quality of the drinks, the ambience of Ozone and not at least due to the very nice views of the bay area and the Hong Kong island. Ozone is supposedly one of the highest bars in the world, located on the 118th floor at the top of the Ritz Carlton hotel. There is a large outdoor patio which would cater for smokers.You should reserve a table if you intend to arrive later in the evening as I understand this place can get quite full.

Incomparably Magnificent Hong Kong Skyline at Night. The Hong Kong Skyline viewed from the Kowloon side during the day is spectacular. At night, it becomes a magnificently incomparable sight to behold. There are other great skylines in the world like the New York, Toronto, Sydney skylines, to name a few, but nothing can compare to the Hong Kong skyline in terms of grandeur and beauty. It is really and definitely a sight to see and experience. One can see the multi storey office towers and multinational corporation headquarters from a great panoramic view. Taking the Star Ferry across the harbour will even provide the best way to see the Skyline. Junk boats (mainly for tourists) ply the harbour and a glimpse of the past contrasted against the modern skyscrapers will never be seen anywhere else. This is absolutely a must see attraction when visiting Hong Kong. And the beauty of it all, is that it is free for everyone to see. See it from the Kowloon side near the Star Ferry pier or behind the HK Cultural Centre. Enjoy the view!!!

Simply Amazing !!!. Hong Kong Skyline should be one among the best in the world. Its simply amazing to see the Hong Kong skyline on the either side. You get some astonishing view from the Victoria Peak as well. For that matter even you get to see the Skyline from higher floor of any hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui area.

Amazing View. The view from Tsim Sha Tsui East Waterfront was amazing. Unfortunately there is a tall building being built on the waterfront blocking the best view. The Waterfront is expected to reopen in 2018.

World best skyline. The Hong Kong Skyline is in my view the most spectacular skyline globally. I could rest for hours sitting at the harbour and watching the iilluminated skyscraper's of Hong Kong Island.
hongkong is the land of smoking. hongkong is the land of smokinga lot of smokers in HK and they not care anyone i need fresh air i need fresh air i am Thai

View from mid-level Happy Valley. Just take bus 6 or 66 to Stanley and make one short stop at DaiHong/Wong Nai Chong Gap Road (also Hong Kong Adventist Hospital ) roadside is a perfect lookout. Central is on your far left, then, Happy Valley, Causeway Bay, and Parkview Apartment is on the right. Occasionally, a tour bus stops over and bunch of tourists take few shots and hop back to resume the trip to Stanley or Deepwater Bay. Picture taken is from the left side of our balcony to the right side. It was 7:30 in the morning, the sun began to shine from the right or east.

Evening Light Show is Cool. The skyline across the harbour, from either side, is really nice. However, the evening light show that spans across buildings on both sides of the harbour and is set to music is fun, cool, and worth trying to catch.
Awesome. We had a room on the 50th floor overlooking the harbor....truly one of the best in Asia. A must if in Hong Kong

night views have been amazing. We enjoyed walking on the Avenue of Stars. We did a selfie with a monument to Bruce Lee, ate ice cream sold from a street truck. But the show from the embankment, we haven't waited.
No other in the world. New York - you are a distant second. The view of the skyline from any vantage point is nothing short of spectacular.
A must see from the Kowloon side. Amazing view of the harbor at night. The light display at 8pm...it is ok. The view on its own is excellent.
Worth the long trip. The skyline is absolutely magnificent. Beautiful during the day, gets even better by night. Traveled around the world to see it and excceded my high expectations

Nice view - day and night. We came here in the afternoon. Weather was good, bright but chilly. The view was fantastic as well. We came back the next few days - this time at night to watch the lights. It was super crowded. View was good nevertheless. One tip - if you want to come and watch the lights at night, come early to book a perfect place to view the night skyline.
Stunning Light Shows. HK Harbour is the perfect backdrop to display the laser & light shows that capture the heart of Hong Kong. Always something to see & a great mix of older & new buildings.

A dream so real.... The Hong Kong skyline is truly breathtaking and is beyond words both day and night. When the skyline is lit up at night, you feel like you're taken to a zenful place where nothing can come between you and the colorful lights.

Fantastic!. The Hong Kong Skyline is just incredible! Both by day and by night the views are amazing. I think it is due to it being also set a against an incredible landscape that makes it unbeatable for a Cityscape.
Breathtaking view. The evening light show is spectacular from the Kowloon side. Combined with the ferry ride across the harbor is is a splendid and cost free way to end an evening in Hong Kong.
It's great. Get out to the harbour morning, day, evening, the view is stunning. Something you will not forget. A wonderful free show.
You never tire of this view. Haven't been now for a couple of years. So I have forgotten how spectacular it really is. Worthwhile overtime..

Beautiful skyline. Breathtaking skyline of Hong Kong from Victoria Harbour. Many events and activities take place there, as we were visiting a gigantic cruise ship was leaving the port. The traditional Junk rides leave from here. Definitely recommended.

Disappointing. It seems like only a few (only two that we could see) buildings participated. If you happen to be in the area it might be OK but not worth making any special effort. Everyone kept looking "for the action". Then many, like us, left after a few minutes.

Great view. This place is outstanding
I do love it
It's a kind of place to get some inspirations and do contemplation.
Its view is magnificent.
For those who love shopping, the harbour city mall is located nearby.
Hong Kong skyline. the lights and atmosphere is amazing there the laser show is great but it is quite windy there so bring a jacket
Nice place. It's free for visiting and u can see the lightful and the other side of HK. The weathere it's great if u come at night but dont forget to check the time !!

the best. the best skyline, it looks better from the peninsula hotel side
they have boats very typical, like old fashioned, that with the colors, lights make a nice picture
Simply Outstanding. You can spend endless time watching this immaculate skyline. It was windy and quite chilly. We were not expecting so much cold.

Best place to view the skyline from harbour city mall tsim sha sui. . It's a must place to visit when is HKG especially at night when all sky rise buildings are lit up and shining like stars
Don't miss it

Best Anywhere. I have traveled a lot through Asia and when people ask me the best place to go you have to segment into categories. When it comes to the best view, Hong Kong is the winner in my book. Go to the walk of stars on the Kowloon side and look back at Hong Kong island and you will be hard pressed to find a more awe inspiring skyline.
Stunning. Just the most breathtaking views. Wasn't busy when we went there about 8pm. An absolute must top go there at night.

An amazing skyline. When I last visited Hong Kong in 1969 the Mandarin Oriental Hotel was the highest building on the waterfront; and now it is dwarfed! The almost endless skyline on both sides of Victoria harbour includes high rise housing, corporate buildings and hotels; and the scale is almost breathtaking. At night it is even more spectacular when the Symphony of Lights features at 8pm. Highly recommended being out on the water in a Star Ferry when this is going on. A spectacular sight! The view of the skyline from the top of Victoria Peak is also breathtaking.

High rise building everywhere. Our tourist guide explained well the history of Hong Kong and why all the buildings are high rise. Hong Kong Skyline is best to visit during night as you can see the colorful lights and captive view.
Beautiful light show. Enjoyed walking alongside the harbor looking at the light show and enjoying connection with people on the streets at night.
Underwhelming . The weather may have contributed to this review. It was spitting rain. Not too bad didn't need an umbrella but visibility was poor. Wouldn't both again to be honest

Go see but don't wait around for the light show at 8. Maybe we've been spoiled having been to Shanghai where the skyline is breathtaking but we arrived arly and waited around on a cool evening for the light show (8 to 8.20) and left half way through as it was dull. Yes, go to Kowloon and view the evening skyline but we regretted hanging about for a less than astounding show. They're getting ready for Chinese New Year in a few days so maybe they are saving the best until then...
Hong Kong comes alive. Hong Kong com s alive at night and the skyline is amazing. Go to Victoria harbour at 8.00 pm to see the light show.
Quite a view. Stunning view from the peak. One can just spend a lot of time there, looking at the skyline especially at night.
Amazing View. You may need to come down on the other side of the skyline to experience the view. There is also a light and sound show everyday evening to enjoy skyline more.
Beautiful. Beautiful views lots of people. You can walk around at night feeling safe without anyone bothering you. Plenty of police and security guards on hand if you do have an issue.
Superb Skyline.. One can enjoy this sky near the Victoria Harbor or taking star ferry. The HSBC tower has a led on it.
A Lovely Skyline. It looks nice at all hours and if you go at 8pm you can see the light show. It's not as crowded as you might think.

Best skyline in the world. I've been to nearly every major city in the world, but every time I come to Hong Kong the skyline blows me away. The colours the lights and the magic of it. Go down to the where the star ferry departs from to get a nice view or go up to the Peak!
Breathtaking. The skyline of Hong Kong is really impressive. Funny light show during night time. Some buildings have nice rooftop bars from where you have a great view on the skyline.
Star Ferry. Take the Star Ferry back to Kowloon and see the awesome Central Skyline at night. It's a really cheap way to get the full on HK experience.
Stunning. Don't miss out on the laser show. We watched it a few different nights, but Saturday's show seemed better than the rest.
amazing and free. one of the great city skylines of the world. Then it gets even better, the lasers fire upat 2000hrs each and every night and really blow one out of the water
OMG AMAZING. Absolutely amazing and we missed the 8pm-8.30pm lights but I was still jumping for joy at the beauty of seeing the lit up night view

Brilliant night and day, check out the night lazer show.. A brilliant sky line and view, take the peak tram and view from the platform, an amazing view & photo shot. Having stayed at the Conrad with a view over the harbour, the whole harbour is a busy and bustling hive of activity, cruise ships in & out but the skyline is brilliant at night with the lazer light displays, the latest buildings are all having these light displays as part of their structures. To see the Hong Kong skyline day or night is an unforgettable experience.

Check Out The Laser Show. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful when viewed from the Kowloon side of the harbor. It's an even nicer view at night time with all of the city lights. If I remember correctly, it's at 8PM that they have a laser light show every night. If you find the right location, there is also music synchronized to the light show.

One of the most beautiful. ... Something you can not loose... There is a fantastic promenade called Walk of Fame and you'll get a breathless view of HK. Try to be there on Sunday night you can enjoy light and sound show on skyline. .
Christmas & HK Skyline. From Tsim Sha Tsui, you look across to Central and HK Island - the skyscrapers have christmas lights and some are involved in the light show.

One of the best skylines in the world . The Hong Kong skyline is incredible - one of my favorite cities in the world. Enjoy views day or night. Don't miss the symphony of lights, a multimedia show that involves 40 buildings on both sides of the harbor.
Wow!. Amazing view by daylight but it comes into its own at night. Awesome! Great way to see it is by travelling on the star ferry from Kowloon
You have to see this!. The skyline is amazing day or night however at 8pm there's the symphony of light. Watch from Kowloon side from free viewing platform and be impressed!

Amazing nightime views!. Combine this with a dinner at Peking Garden in TST and you've got a perfect night in the making. Stroll along the waterside looking at the lit up cityscape - simply stunning and what HK is renowned for.

Beautiful. Hong Kong SkyLine, a great place to see the sights of Hong Kong at night. We can also see the light show here. Not only that, the location of Hong Kong Skyline also become one with the Avenue Of Star.

Keep coming back to Hong Kong to see this! 😍. I haven't visited different countries around the world yet (but I am definitely aiming for that) to say Hong Kong skyline is the best. However, one well-travelled friend told me it is. Absolutely stunning skyline at Victoria Harbour I will never get tired of seeing. Been there three times now and I will definitely visit this place again when I'm in Hong Kong.
Must do before you die. One of the most remarkable skylines in the world. You should see it from both sides of the harbor too,

Fantastic. A must see - free - can see 100 times and would not get sick of it - one of best harbours in the world at night - a must see.
The laser lights was very disappointing but just looking at the harbour is great on its own.
Man made wonder. Just fabulous ... One of the best skylines.. Be it a day or a night... Need to view it from the Tim Sha Tsui promenade or ferry...

Wow. Caught the Star Ferry to Kowloon, what a treat and spectacular sight the skyline is. The photos you see and the films it is seen in are accurate. The skyline from Kowloon or HK island are equally breath-taking.

Great skyline/Poor 8pm light show. We arranged our day to be on the Kowloon harbor for the 8pm show. We did not enjoy it at all. It is not really a show. Yes there are laser lights and lit buildings and background music but calling it "the symphony of lights show" is very very misleading. It is overly over-rated but the Hong Kong Skyline itself is lovely.

One of the most interesting city skylines. Hong Kong is unique, with more buildings over 50 stories than any city. Small land area equals many tall slender buildings and interesting architecture. Take the Star Ferry to see it from the harbor. Night illumination is ok but not the amazing sound and light show they describe. Worth a look but the daytime view is better I think.

The buildings light up!. Beautiful skyline, best to get this view from the Kowloon side, on. The water front by the science museum and avenue of stars. 8pm there's a light display, it's cool to see the buildings light up to the music but I wouldn't go out of my way to see this display, it's cool if you see it but if the buildings don't "dance" the view is still amazing.
light show galore. We stayed in Kowloon on the water and watched the beautiful lights every night. The weather was not great but the skyline is still an awe

The fantastic skyline gets hazy with the polution. The ever changing skyline alters from year to year as building is a national preoccupation. In 1985 HSBC's HQ was built, designed by Norman Foster it was at the time the world's most expensive building. It was the bank's fourth built on the same site at 1 Queens Road Central. In 1988 Bank of China Tower at 1 Garden Road designed by the Chinese American architect I.M.Pei was the first building over 1,000 feet outside of America Now it is dwarfed by International Finance centre completed in 2003 and at 420 metres is the second tallest in Hong Kong's ever changing skyline.The tallest is International Commerce Centre above Kowloon station completed 2010 and at 484 metres 1,588 feet is impressive.

Mind-blowing. Though I love both of them for other several reasons, Europe and America lost the skyline battle a long time ago, and the skyline of Hong Kong is a good reminder of that fact. Admittedly, perhaps there is no skyline as iconic as New York's, but those in Asian cities are more spectacular (at least in pure quantitative terms: more and taller skyscrapers). I had the chance to watch it on a sunny day, on a cloudy day and on a cloudy and foggy day, and I was always delighted. It will stay with me for a long time.
views...food.....shopping.....history. Almost everywhere you go The View is amazing.....harbor,mountains,lights....cannot b beat...add to that shopping and great food
victoria Peak. beautiful Place, the view is spectacular, I think this is one of a kind view, a must see when visit Hong Kong

Breathtaking . Was unsure about going but I had my brother who lived there being the guide. Th e lights and hussein was amazing how it was bright but calming. Planing to do this again when I go back in October of this year was there in 2007
Awesome. If you like big cites, Hong Kong is the place. It's got all the amenities, yet is still a bit rough around the edges in certain areas
Very impressive. Well this view is breathtaking, especially if u r looking at it for the first time.Try not to miss the short daily laser show at 8.00p.m.

Must-see view in a lifetime. In my opinion, the H-K Island skyline is one of the must-see things in life, worth alone the trip to H-K.If you stay on H-K Island, take the Star Ferry from either Central Ferry Pier No.7 (located near the IFC Mall) or from New Wan Chai Ferry Pier (near the Convention Center) to Kowloon. The crossing is a great experience itself - and very cheap. The viewing deck is just 100m to the left (East) of the ferry pier.
The Skyline is what Hong Kong is. You can view it from mainland and from the ferry rides. But I like the view from the Peak, which I guess no longer counts as a skyline...

This is Hong Kong at its finest. The skyline at Manhattan is iconic and an amazing experience but so too is the skyline of Hong Kong. I was alone on my first visit to Hong Kong and it is very difficult to admire something of such magnitude and structural beauty when you are on your own. This time I had my wife with me and together we watched and filmed the variation in light changes and laser lights from the top of the buildings. You can do all this for free from the public areas of Kowloon so no need for expensive tours.This really is an outstanding feature of Hong Kong and not to be missed. Each night the lights shows starts at 8pm and whilst it does not last long it is worth every second to watch it.
Breathtaking. It is surely one of the most beautiful skyline in the world, i can't describe it so well, its just breathtaking, especially on a cool night.
Iconic. This is an iconic skyline, but don't expect much with the Festival of Lights evening laser light show. Go up to SKY100 or Victoria Peak to get a look down, a different perspective.
Beats New York1. Actually, New York is my favourite city but HK skyline easily beats any city - be it NY, Rio, Paris... Though I liked Shanghai (take notice - it is also China)

Absolutely Stunning Views. We are surrounded by water everywhere and the buildings are all work of art. At night they star the Light Show at IFC and ICC followed by all other buildings surrounding Victoria Bay. These lights reflects on the waters while the waves and tide movement generate another spectacle...
Fabulous city. Best skyscrapers in the world, all lit up in various colours after evening. fabulous skyline, makes other cities look like toys.

A view that will not be missed in a trip to Hong Kong. It is easy to observe the skyline of the modern city-state of Hong Kong from many different points and views (The Peak, Sky100, Tsim Sa Tsui Promenade etc etc). For sure it is something nice to see day or night and one of the things that will not be missed when you are in Hong Kong unless the weather conditions are not favorable. Fog, humidity etc -often phenomena- there, could spoil your view and the photos you might want to take. Moreover, in certain attractions were might be a long line of people waiting (e.g. transportation for The Peak) or expensive entrance tickets (sky100 - here you will be warned about unfavorable conditions of visibility prior issuing ticket) one should be a smart traveler and avoid time loss or unnecessary expenses if the weather conditions are not favorable.

A Romantic View. Its one of the best Skyline that I have seen. Its truly romantic and my wife loves it too. We enjoyed the nice breezy walk along the Tsim Hsa Tsui Promenade and end at Victoria Harbor to watch the Lights show at 8pm.
A must see. You can't really go to King Kong without seeing this iconic view.Night time is spectacular.Take the ferry ride across and back it only costs about $2 and it's lovely.
One of the great views in the world. The Hong Kong skyline from Kowloon is breathtaking, especially at night. Good vantage points are the Star Ferry, or the lobby bar of the Intercontinental Hotel.
victoria peak. breathtaking views and the bus ride up and down was truly exciting and wonderful. worth dong at such a low cost.
Worth spending an hour. This place has jst the view of all the well lit building in HK and we went during the Light festival (December '15) so we had the opportunity to watch laser shows.
Breathtaking. Beautiful view the symphony of lights was brilliant and was stunning to watch. I would recommend going to see it was fantastic and worth the wait.

Spectacular skyline. The Hong Kong skyline is stunning, during the day and especially at night. The backdrop of the hills and being across the harbour makes it all the more dramatic. Definitely go and make an effort to take it in, don't just glance at it walking past. The light show is OK but don't worry about making a special effort for it. If you happen to be able to catch it great but otherwise you're not missing much.
Quintessential.. It is imressive enough in the daytime, but becomes absolutely beautiful at night when the lights come on. Definitely one for the album.

Unlike Anywhere Else. I live in Manhattan but work in Queens so I view the Manhattan skyline daily and felt like a small town guy in comparison to Hong Kong as the skyline is unrivaled. Good places to view include,1) Walk of Stars2) Intercontinental Hotel Lobby Lounge3) Ritz Carlton Ozone Bar
Majestic. The Hongkong Skyline is truly one attraction you really have to see, it is second to nothing. S0, c'mmon and visit HK!

And I thought I had seen it all when I visited Manhattan for the first time. "Oh boy was I wrong!". Simply one of the most fascinating skylines in the world! The Symphony of lights shows will leave you perplexed.
Spectacular View at Nights. Spectacular view of the Hongkong sky-scrappers. Get down at East Tsim Shah Si station to this attraction. The entire stretch is good to have a walk.
Great view. Love the skyline. Great place to take a stroll after a heavy dinner. May not be a good place to be at during winter though.

Take your camera. One of my favourite things to do when I visit a city is to get out and explore. Hong Kong did not disappoint me. I was overwhelmed by the skyline. I thoroughly enjoyed the ferry from Hong Kong Island across to Kowloon. I wandered up to the Peninsula to have their famous high tea that didn't disappoint. At night the city is lit up with a million lights. Wonderful place.
One of the world's best skylines. Hong Kong Harbour provides one of the world's most impressive skylines. The light show is definitely worth a stop.
Super laser show. The skyline of HK is one of the best if not no 1. The laser show takes place every evening with buildings illuminating one after the other a delightful sight.

Bright , Colourful and worth a visit. The HongKong Skyline is a view which is very often and very often photographed. The deep Harbour dividing the Kowloon and the Harbour side makes this an interesting view. Onec can cross the Harbour on boat or take the public transport like buses, taxi or MTR which will take you to the other side in minutes. The skyline is changing and with the addition of the HongKong Observation Wheel it makes it even more interesting.

The most amazing skyline in the world!. I have heard that the Manhattan skyline in New York is amazing, but quite frankly there is nothing in the world to top the stunning view of Hong Kong island from Kowloon. If you ever get to this part of the world, it's not to be missed.

MUST SEE!!!. Don't forget to check out the light show they put on every night. I had a 3 week long vacation & Hong Kong was my finale. Ohhh that skyline is so beautiful. You can just sit there and stare at it forever. Spectacular & a must see when you are there.

Nothing else is quite like it. Amazing.. Photos will never do this justice, this is just something you have to kick back and take it. Get there early or be prepared to stand behind lots of people and wait to get up front. :)

Gorgeous!. We think everyone should view the skyline from Kowloon. If you go to the waterfront of Kowloon as the sun sets and then hang around until 8 pm, you will be able to see the light show which is enjoyable.
The number 1 reason to visit. If you're into skyscrapers, Hong Kong is where you need to go. The skyline is stacked with architectural gems.

Must see tourist attraction. You have not been to HK till you do this. Best way is to plan a trip to Kowloon on the star ferry for the afternoon. Then you can take daylight photos of the skyline as you arrive. Take in the shopping at the mall in Kowloon and check out the Apple store across the road. Then when you are all shopped out get something to eat at one of the places overlooking the harbour. At 8pm you will see the famous light show with all the buildings engaging in a magical dance of lights.
Amazing! View to kill for!. If you can't see anything else in Hong Kong, make sure to experience the skyline at night! Even better if you make it for the light show!
Wonderful views. Fantastic views from the Peak or on Kowloon side, would suggest taking the cable car to the peak, eat up there and look down on the views
Walk around at night. Great place for walking and enjoying the waterfront with stunning skyline both day and night time. Plenty of room to make move around.

One of the world's greatest city skylines. One of the world's greatest city skylines, HK whether during the day or night is just great from either Central over the harbour to Kowloon or the other way round. If you are lucky enough to get a harbour view hotel room you should.

The skyline is good - but don't go out of your way for the light show.. We sat in the intercontinental hotel, with floor to ceiling windows in the bar. This was the perfect place to enjoy the view and I would recommend enjoying the view here. When we went there was live music and a good atmosphere.We deliberately aimed to be here for 8pm as this is when the light show starts every night, but the light show was not worth making plans for - if you see it great, if you don't then you haven't missed out on much.

Beautiful day and night!. While visiting Hong Kong for a week, we rode the Star Ferry at least a dozen times. Each and every time, it was beautiful to see the Hong Kong Skyline. Worth checking out both day and night.
Interesting evening show from Kowloon. If you are in Kowloon, why not take in the show. It is interesting and doesn't cost anything. We had low clouds which made it more entertaining.
Simply awesome!. A magnificent view I must say! Looks awesome both during day and evening! You must go here and get a breathtaking view from Kowloon airport express station.

Beautiful skyline . Hong Kong having lack of land been building lots of high rise of various design and height. Viewing the skyline from Kowloon side to see Hong Kong skyline is more magnificent. There is a light show everyday at 8pm. Watch it.

The famous skyline . The view does not disappoint so much going on, and a lot of buildings with their own personalities! I like how it changes from day to night, the back drop of the mountains is amazing.I didn't get to see it at its full glory as it is winter, clouds and rain lessen the view. Make sure you also see it from the water on a junk!! Classic Hong Kong.

A long beautiful skyline. Took a stroll along this beautiful place, at night where all the lights are up, be taken away by the serenity. Watch the ships sail by, watch lovers dating, enjoy the sight is truly a enjoyment
Hong Kong Skyline. Great place to visit with wonderful view. It's located on the 100th floor and almost at 400 meter above sea level. so it was a nice new experience.
Better at night with light show. Depending on which side of the harbor you are on, it was a good place to watch the light show link with music.

Perfect. The day or night views of Hong Kong Island are a Must See when you visit. No matter how tired you are, at least one night you need to come out at 8pm and experience the light show. I have never seen it from the Hong Kong side, but have been told that is equally as spectacular. We visit often and have always made walking along the waterfront one of our must do activities.

Seasonal Lighting Adds Interest, but.... Seasonal lights placed on various landmark buildings add some interest to the Victoria harbour spectacle - usually at Christmas through to Chinese New Year.The standard is dropping though. Access is hindered now that the Avenue of the Stars is closed off for rennovations.Don't hold your breath for the nightly light show held at 8PM either. This used to be a lot better.

The Best Skyline in Asia. Best viewed from bar Felix which is on the Kowloon side of the island. Felix boasts Hong Kong's spectacular skyline and pushes culinary boundaries under the helm of Chef Yoshiharu Kaji. Located on the 28th floor of The Peninsula tower, Felix is the creation of renowned avant-garde designer Philippe Starck. Serving Modern European cuisine made with the freshest seasonal ingredients, the restaurant offers breathtaking views of Victoria Harbour, Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. Other unique venues within Felix include the Wine Bar, the Balcony, the American Bar and the Crazy Box.
Skyline. Spectacular! Always amazes me. Colourful and breathtaking during most times of the year (when the air is cleaner)
Great day or night. Catch the Victoria Peak tram and get a great view of Hong Kong from Bubba Gump's restaurant on Victoria Peak. Spectacular at night and truly impressive during the day.

Amazing but no need to rush over to Kowloon for the light show. HK Skyline is one of the most iconic and breathtaking sky lines in the world. It is almost work booking a hotel in Kowloon just so you can see it. I never get tired of it. No need to rush over to Kowloon to see the light show.. its a bit tacky... in my opinion..

Beautiful, especially from icon hotel rooms!. We had a lovely floor to ceiling windows in our 19th floor room at hotel icon. We suffered from misty weather during our stay, but when it was clear we had a fab view of this lovely hong kong island skyline.
Interesting lighting from the buildings. The Christmas lighting decoration and animation are beautiful in the night time. Nostalgic when see the old ship cruise along the straights.
wonderful view. the hongkong skyline is very wonderful and also very nice place to visit, the place is clean and many restaurants near by
Skyline. Awesome to see, we didn't get to see the light show as it was foggy the few times we were down near the harbour.

treat to any Civil Engineer's eyes. The HK skyline is vivid and magnificent.. beautiful!!
Architecture at its best.. Tall buildings everywhere!

Amazing . Very hard to beat both at nighttime and day time . Worth getting the view from the HK island and TST side. It's varied and well lit up , a memorable view to take home with you ! Take the peak tram up as another added experience !

Fantastic. Very dramatic, day or night!
You can feel the vibrancy of the city by looking at it.
Have a drink In The Intercontinental hotel in Kowloon to fully appreciate it.
You can also walk along the newly built promenade on Kowloon to see the skyline.
3 days in HK. Great to see, clean everywhere, good transport and clean toilets. Views beautiful even on rainy misty nights. Plentiful restaurants. Star ferry and trains excellent.

Well worth visiting great views. We took the trai from Kowlan then walked to get tge tram to the Peak.Very long queue for tram bug it moves fast. Once at top you take tbe escalatorto top and view is amazing even when overcast. Lots of reasonable priced placesto eat at top outside.
Wonderful wiew!. One of the worlds greatest skylines!!! Beautiful wiew with lots of lights. Nice buildings and lots of people!!!! Looks best during night time!

Stunning. The skyline is stunning and personally I think the best views are from Kowloon side
Great views from Tsin Sha Tsui promenade across from the Peninsula Hotel and by the cultural centre

Best cityscape on Earth.. I see this every evening and all my guests and friends are blown away when they see it. it does not get old, or familiar, and continues to inspire and strike awe into one's core.

Must do. No visit to HK is complete without taking a look at the Hong Kong Skyline from Kowloon. Do it at least once by daytime and once by night, its amazing and you'll engrave it your memories forever. Oh, by the way I forgot to mention that is completely free.

270 Degree view of skyline. One of the best places I viewed the Hongkong Skyline from was at Avenue of Stars, but note that it is now closed and block off for renovation. Another place I went - Ozone Bar at Ritz Carlton gives you bird's eye view of the skyscrapers as well.

skyline is great...light show is meh. Given the grandeur of the skyline and its buildings, the 8pm light show is somewhat unimpressive. Yes, it's cool that they choreograph it, but given the scale everything else is done on, this is subdued. But hey, it's free, and every night, so why not? We watched from the Kowloon side, and I think it might be better to watch from the Harbor itself on a Star Ferry (or on a harbor light cruise).
Lights at night. The first night we visited it was very cloudy so not such as good view of the light show.The second night was so much better.It was a great display.Just pick a clear night
One of the best skylines in world.. Check out viewing platform in TST for best view especially at night during light show and don't miss a star ferry ride across harbour.
Christmas in Hong kong. The skyline in Hong Kong at Christmas is beautiful. The skyscraper are decorated with a Christmas theme and there is a nightly laser show.

Awesome view.. Awesome view basically in the night. Multi color lights and leaser make all the skyline beside the harbour so beautiful. In our visiting period all the skylines near harbour has been decorated for Christmas and also for new year celebration 2016.
Awesome View. We stayed at Intercontinental Stanford in Harbor view room and this is what we see from our room.This is breathtaking and one of the best skylines I have seen so far.

Waterloo Sunset. The skyline is spectacular, whether you are in Kowloon looking back at the island or vice versa. My personal favourite view was looking west at sunset, the colours and silhouetted shaped were truly breathtaking.

A nice view. But no more than that, it is a beautiful harbour that has been ruined by commerce. It is a glittering row of offices, banks insurance building all with their names emblazoned on the front, not a single (NOT EVEN ONE) building of note or history amongst them. yes it is impressive, could be magnificent, but to me vastly disappointing
Iconic Sights. After a few dozen times of coming to HKG, I still can't tire of the amazing skyline of this city. Nighttime is the best view, especially from the Star Ferry. What a world-class city.

Amazing. The best skyline in the world. We even paid for the picture taken by the "pros". A rip off at £20 for a digital picture sent by email but the skyline was so nice. We went at 9.30pm and there was no queue. The ram up is also amazing
Well worth a look. The view from the Kowloon side of the day is spectacular at night and we'll worth the $2hkd on the star ferry to get to
When in Hong Kong.... This is a nice attraction that brings a lot of people to the same spot every night to the light show. It gets very crowded and busy. A must see when in Hong Kong.
Must see light show. Don't miss the sound and light show that is presented each evening from 8:00-8:10pm. It must be viewed from the Kowloon side. Very impressive!

Only Skyline that can Rival New York's. Being from New York I have high standards for what a "city" is. There are many things to be considered (e.g. the caliber of restaurants found there, the quality and extensiveness of the subway and mass transit systems, the history, etc.) but the sight and appearance of the city itself, it's Skyline, is certainly a prime attribute to evaluate and consider.Hong Kong's Skyline is the only skyline I've ever seen that's made me think: "that might be nicer than New York's". And it's for that and many many more reasons that I can say without any doubt whatsoever that Hong Kong is Truly a City.

Unbeatable. The photo you have to take whilst in HK! There are several paying viewpoints but with a bit of imagination you can get a great view and some great photos somewhere free. My personal favourite is next to the Burger King halfway up the shopping mall at the top of the hill. Just go through Burger King, out the back door, hop the balcony and you get a sweet view without queueing and paying for it.
Always Amazing. I have seen many skylines, but this is really one of the most amazing in the world. Especially nice from the lobby of the Intercontinental Hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui.

The place to be at night!. The view is quite impressive from the day time and I was lucky to have a local friend help me figure out how to take the ferry to enjoy the view. The evening view is much better and you can really appreciate how crowded Hong Kong is.
Stunning. Cross the river by boat at night time and you'll see this awe-inspiring sight.This is a 10-minute journey, but well worth the effort.

Stunning sight especially at night . Undoubtedly Hong Kong's skyline is awesome. Watch the nightly symphony of lights from both sides - Kowloon (TST) and island. Ensure you go to one of the venues at which you can hear the music to which the lights are choreographed. It's a must do experience that I ensure I fit in at least once on every trip to HK.

Just stunning.... We were staying on Hong Kong island in an airbnb so got the fairy over to the mainland one evening and the view as you're pulling away from the port is beautiful. Definitely worth a picture or two.

Awesome. This skyline Blows Dubai skyline out of the water! From every single angle/ viewpoint this place looks imposing and assured! The surroundings of lush green and water make this skyline all the better!

get yourself over to kowloon to watch the light show. try travelling to or from the island from kowloon on the star ferry at dusk to see the light show put on every night by the high rises of on the island.
Breathtaking. In my opinion, Hong Kong has the best skyline/nightlights. You have not been to HK if you haven't seen the skyline at least once.

Worlds TOP 5 views.
