NYC, Sydney, Rio, Shanghai and Hong Kong of course share the leading top 5 views in the world in my opinion.The HK can be admired from the sea level on Kowloon side, from Tsim Sha Tsui to the Avenue of the Stars, or from the upper point on the Victoria Peak on HK island.The first one is slightly better, especially at night when all lights are lit up. There's a free sound and light show nightly at 8 PM (arrive 15-20 min earlier).Another perfect panorama is from the iconic Star ferry while crossing the harbor.

Go to isquare and the 39th floor of the tower. I've been to HK many time but never fail to be amazed by the skyline! Got to Kowloon side and find the ibar in isquare and head for the viewing bar on the 39th floor. Will take you breath away.

Most beautiful view in the world . Hong Kong skyline must be the most beautiful view in the world and a truly gift to the eyes. Somebody said New York? , yes it is very comparable but Hong Kong is much more dramatic , probably because the hills and the mountains but I am sure that the electric bill of Hong Kong must be the triple comparable to New York City.

Great view at night. A girl I met at the hostel I was staying and I decided to see the light show in the harbour. We took the MTR over to Kowloon and boy was it packed. I can't believe how many people were taking the MTR at that time. Luckily we got there a bit early so we were able to get a good vantage point. The light show is alright and luckily it's free. The view of the skyline at night however is just beautiful. When I was there in September it was hot and humid during the day, at night it's much cooler and a welcome relief.

Spectacular. Viewing from Kowloon side of the harbour, looking across to the skyline under coloured lights is a marvel to see, aided by the reflection of the lights in the harbour waters. A visual symphony. It is grand to see the boats quietly moving across the harbour against the colourful background.
Impressive skyline. So many 30-60 story buildings; you can get some good views of the city and skyline from some of them. Mesmerizing
First thing that comes to your mind!. What would be Hong KOng without its unique magnificent bay and skyline. It's simply breathtaking when you see those lights!

Bright lights and spectacular skyline. Simply a delightful sight to see the HK skyline in the day time as well as at night. This is what I imagine this busy and cosmopolitan city to be! Did not disappoint!
A stroll along the harbor frong... Day or night, walking along the esplanade on the Kowloon side and watching the ships and the Star Ferries, it's a great way to spend a bit of time in Hong Kong!

Great views as billed, avoid rainy/fogging/smoggy days. Very crowded locations at the Peak, and along the road to the Peak, especially on weekends and around sunset so suggest getting to locations early. There are other places which might be less crowded on non-public holidays, eg along Barker road. Also high floor restaurants are also a good option on both sides of the harbour.

Best skyline ... ANYWHERE!!!. As someone who was born in NYC and has visited many cities in the U.S., Europe, and Asia, the view of Hong Kong island from Kowloon is absolutely spectacular!
As many times as I've been to Hong Kong, the view never gets old and is always stunning.
This is an absolute must do when visiting Hong Kong.
Must to see!. Don't miss this beautiful night skyline. Around 8pm you can enjoy a music & light show for about 10 minutes.

One of the view must to go in Hong Kong. This is the first place where my girlfriend and I visited in Hong Kong. The view was really nice,if you have a visit in Hong Kong ,this is a good place worth to go.
symphony of light. Each night at 8pm the city sky scrapers light up with a fantastic display that lasts around 10 minutes its a fantastic sight
Midnight countdown. Best fireworks display by far, leave it to Hong Kong to set the mood for the best New Years display ever

Are you a Skyscraper fan ?. The Hong Kong's Skyscraper Skyline is one of the world's best.
Must see from Kowloon side and should go up ICC building to view from there too if possible.

One of the most beautiful skylines in the world.. This is one of the most beautiful skylines in the world! The best place to enjoy this view is from Kowloon. I recommend taking the Star Ferry to Kowloon in the evening and then spending the night in Kowloon overlooking the skyline. Absolutely stunning!
always mesmerizing. the best view is from Tsim Tsa Tsui side, at 8 pm everyday when the synchronized lights in dancing to the music

One of the best views in the world!. I've been to quite a few cities and seen their night views from their 100+ towers but I can say this is probably one of the best you'll see. Especially if you just happen to visit Hong Kong on those good weather. Many people say its best to view it from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island, mainly because HK Island has more buildings but if you have the time, why not visit both sides?
A most 'picture'. When you think HK, you think 'Skyline'. You are able to see it pretty much from everywhere. So no reason to miss it. Impressive!
Worth seeing. Take a trip on the Star ferry pleasure boat that leaves from the pier at regular intervals great value and interesting

HK skyline are so awesome at night. We aleays take a walk along the river to see the skyline lighted up so wonderfully during. X mascand new year , we alsontook a cruise to see thevskyline along both side.

At night it's perfect!. They have a light and music show at the harbour on Kowloon side! The view of the buildings and water craft particularly the red lit sails of the junk boat is beautiful. The Show was not as grand as hoped, but it starts at 8pm every night, it's free and lasts only 10 minutes. There are lots of restaurants to select from nearby! Aldo lots of window shopping as prices in HK are expensive! It's not cheap!
Beautiful evening our on the harbour. Went on a dinner cruise to view these amazing lights on the sky scrapers of Hong Kong. It was gorgeous being on the harbour & seeing the colourful light display.
Amazing to watch. So much activity surrounding and yet so peaceful to watch in the evening from the club lounge of the Intercontinental with a gin in one hand and great snacks to enjoy in comfort
Just great! . Very beautiful. Overall many really nice buildings. I just don't understand the hope about the light show...

Breathtaking. Make sure you don't miss the light show at 8PM every evening. The best views are from the Kowloon peninsula. Also, you can hop on the boat that takes you on an our tour of the Victoria bay.

Must see if you visit Hong Kong. How can one miss this attraction visiting HK?! It's simply beautiful! I suggest taking the star ferry if you want to see it during the day. For the night view, the most comfortable way is to enjoy a drink at the Hotel InterContinental lobby lounge in Tsimshatsui, it offers the full view of Hong Kong skyline from its floor to ceiling glass window.
The Star Ferry Harbor Tour. Dazzling electronic graphics displays.This ride is must if you want to say that you have visited Hong Kong!
The best there is.. There are few skylines that can better it anywhere in the world. Best seen at night at the 8pm sound snd light show; in the daytime - from the Star Ferry.

It's better than Manhattan. You can't beat the Hong Kong skyline. I never get tired of looking at it and I have lived here in an apartment with Hong Kong skyline view for 10 years. (Yes, that means I live on "the dark side"). I still love every moment of it, at any time of the day.

One of the best skylines of the world. The title says it all. I can suggest two locations from where the skyline looks beautiful than anything or from anywhere else. 1) front of the ritz Carlton hotel,which is below the sky 100 observation deck building, or 2) the promenade or the avenue of stars. Best spots to enjoy the skyline,especially at night or make it more exciting with an evening harbour cruise or with a simple star ferry round trip ride over the sea. Memorable experience for sure.

Lovely ! . So many ways to see and experience the famous skyline ! Really a must for anyone visiting HK! See how many buildings you can name and watch it light up every night at 8 for the light show !
The best skyline views on the planet!. Go to the peak and view the incredible majesty of the Hong Kong Harbor. Take the tram to the peak and enjoy the view from the Moon Gate.

One of the most beautiful cityscapes in the world. Be sure to visit the skyline in the evening during the light show. Beautifully coordinated lights and music allow the buildings to come to life. The daytime view is breathtaking as well.
Beautiful.. It is a must see when in Hong Kong, day or night, rain or shine it offers a pleasant spectacle. Just another part of what makes Hong Kong such a fabulous city to visit.

Best in the World . Go to peak near desk to see all the changes. Isola restaurant has great outdoor patio to enjoy from Central. Renaissance Harbor View rooms are fantastic. Take cheap ferry across to experience all angles.

Loved the skyline at night more than during the day!. Hong Kong is an amazing place and is a 'must see', especially at night when all the lights come on. We were there at Christmas tine so the lights were extra specially sparkly!
did it ourselves. took a trip on the star ferry after dark,cost a whole 2 .5 dollars (HK) then ambled along the Kowloon prom .rather nice

Dramatic at night!. Looking back from Kowloon towards Hong Kong Island surely is one of the most dramatic skylines you can ever witness.My tip is to get there about 30-45 minutes before dark, and view the skyline in both light and darkness.Along the promenade from the Star Ferry terminal are the best views, and there are photographers there who will take your picture for a small fee, HKD40, (about £3.50), for one 6" x 4" print, which is presented to you within minutes. Well worth it, and looks better than any selfie you could possibly take.
Oh what a beautiful skyline. Wow! Simply mesmerizing, like fire or stars. So nice to just sit and look at, maybe listening to some street music, hopefully in beautiful weather. Best at night.

A must see for all tourists. As nite falls, walk along the promenades that line the sides of the harbor. Grab a trip on the Star Ferry that ply their trade between the Tsimshatui and Central terminals, or grab a seat at any vantage point that overlooks the harbor. The Neon lite show, It's worth it! buildings lite up, This is advertising at its best and worst!Coupled with the nitely lite show, you have a TWO FOR ONE (free?) show.( the Icon has a minimum charge)
Amazing skyline. Amazing skyline, but a pity it was so cloudy that we could not enjoy the skyline at its fullest. The one hour harbour trip was really amazing.
Awesome Experience. NICE VIEW from the top od the hills and get urself clicked and the train to return is also and good experience
one of the best. one of the best day or night. lots of lights to keep you entertained at night. star ferry is a great cheap way to see the skyline.

Pretty . We watched the light show from on the roof of a restaurant and it was ok and the view looked pretty but I think I was expecting something a little bit more synchronized and spectacular. Worth checking out if you are already out.
Hong Kong. The Hong Kong skyline at night is what make this city wonderful. If you live in Hong Kong or if you are visiting even for a few hours, this is the ONE and ONLY must see.

Nice experience. I recommend going there especially in the night time. Be prepared for waiting. If you´re in a hurry I recommend tking a cab - u can actually see even better from the cab than the tram.

Shimmering lights, floating. Very beautiful sight in a warm evening time in December. Boats floating by where you can go to have a buffet dinner for example. Didn't do that , but just seeing the skyline was beautiful.

Everything you've heard and more!. Hop onto the Kowloon side and be mesmerised with the lights, buildings, hoardings, and the overall effect which the ferry piers, combined give to any pair of eyes. There's an electric energy you feel when you see the Hong Kong skyline and it sets the tone for what the country has to offer. Ever bubbling with life, multiple options to experience city life, beach life, mountain life, Hong Kong is the buzz you need to see, to believe what all can a city limited by space but plenty in spirit and will to work can offer!! (Pics below are hazy and do not do a justification to the brilliance you see with your eyes)
Simply amazing. So many things to see in only one look ! Lights, skycrapers, animated lights, boats, the sea ... Even more beautiful at night !
TAKE A SLR CAMERA TO PROPERLY CAPTURE IT. Was a bit disappointed by the sheer number of people there when we went. Overcrowded, especially at 8pm for the daily light show.
Stunning!. By far one of the great skylines of the world. Best to enjoy this from TST promenade at night time or on Start Ferry.
Beautiful skyline . Beautiful view with a mountain backdrop. Nice during the day and at night especially during the night light show starting every night at 8:00pm

One of the best night skylines. View from Walk of Stars on the Kowloon side. At night, definitely one of my favorite night time skylines in the world; decent during the day as well. Bonus points for the laser show. Unfortunately, come prepared for disappointment as it's usually hazy in HK, either from pollution or high humidity (or both) and be happy if it happens to be clear.
great view. it is great central part of hong kong , next to business area, at night is the best to visit it. i just love it

One of the world's most famous skylines . The skyline of Hong Kong is an attraction in itself. I never really tired of looking at it while I was there. It is at its best at night. The neon lights of many of the buildings make the buildings a visual attraction and elevate them from just lit up lights but a spectacle to enjoy. Best views are from the Star Ferry or the Tsim Sha Tsui side of the harbour. There is also the skyline light show but it is hard to tell the difference between the normal neon lights of the skyline and the show itself. Enjoy the skyline, it is a visual treat.
A beautiful sight!. The best place to see the Hong Kong Skyline is from the Ritz hotel in one of the many venues, or from the waterfront along the pedestrian walk.

Amazing Views. So many buildings in such a small area of land makes for some exciting vistas.Viantage points are numerous from
Mt Victoria Kowloon ferry plus from many public and private buildings

Breathtaking.. Reached the TST promenade just in time for the light and sound show! It was an amazing experience. After the show ended and the crowd thinned, it was breathtaking just standing there and watching the skyline. Did not want to leave ever!
An impressive sight. Impressive sight during the day but particuarly when lit up at night, although the much vaunted sound and light show was a tad underwhelming.

Wondeful!!. HK skyline is one of the best skylines of the world. It surely beats the skyline of some of the biggest international cities. Though I found the musical show 'Symphony of Lights' not that great but overall Avenue of Stars is one of the best places in HK to visit especially at night. Its colourful its happening and gives you the best feel of being in Honk Kong city........

The future is now. Walking in the pedestrian corridors in the crowd above the traffic and looking at all those skyscrapers around give you the impression that you're in a futuristic movie. But no, the future is now and to really enjoy it, be sure to watch the Hong Kong skyline light show from Kowloon at 8 p.m.
Better at night!. Pretty much impossible to miss if you are in Hong Kong. Best appreciated at night from Kowloon looking toward HK island and from the Exhibition Center looking towards Kowloon.

A sight not to be missed. We saw this sight during the day and at night. The nightime visit was the most spectacular and we saw t from the Star Ferry. This really is spectacular with every crporate name that you can think of with their neon displays on all the tower blocks. Spectacular!
Great view. The view is amazing from nearly every point on the harbour! The daily light show though is a waste of time .
Stunning . The Hong Kong skyline is one of those beautiful global treats. It's a spectacle that is great to observe. It's best at night riding the star ferry from kowloon to HK.
very nice view. I am not sure what to write but it was very nice outlook for the other side of Hong Kong. We very much love Hong kong

Brilliant. Just Mesmerizing.
Can be seen if you take a ferry from hongkong to Macau also.
Not to be missed. So much to do around

A great reason to stay in Kowloon . The view over to Hong Kong Island from Kowloon is spectacular. If you're stuck for something to do, buy some treats and head down to the waterfront after dark and soak up the views. There's lots of activity on the water from ferries, harbour tours and cruise ships.
Fantastic skyline!. The nigh-time skyline is the best. I always try to find somewhere as high up as I can get to watch the daily night time light shows. There's nothing like it I've ever seen
Love the view. Lots of space to sit down for a while and enjoy the skyline. Really impressive. Nice place to relax a bit after shopping.

New Year's Eve fireworks. Had a lovely dinner at the nearby restaurant in the IFC mall, and went to watch the New Years fireworks in HK. Was wonderful. The skyline is very pretty full of skyscrapers and beautiful lights. Don't forget the symphony of lights show every night starting at 8pm. It is a show Which involves skyscrapers flashing lights. It is very pretty, must see when you are in HK.

Best view from the Star ferry at night.. There is a stunning lightshow on the skyscrapers each evening from Kowloon side. It is very difficult, neigh impossible to walk the entire promenade Hong Kong side as soooo much reclamation and building is being done.

One of the world's most stunning views . The Hong Kong skyline never disappoints - especially when the lights are twinkling on and off. Enjoy it from either side of the harbour. Great to see it from one of the many stunning roof top bars around Hong Kong.

BEAUTY FULL LOOKING FOR EVENING. The skyline of Hong Kong is really like no other.While Hong Kong Island's skyline is still the most impressive one, Kowloon's skyline is catching up fast now that the height restrictions.The show features several different kinds of lights including not only simple lighting from inside the buildings but also LEDs, lasers, searchlights, and projection lighting.

One of the best . There are a few skylines in the world that we all know. London, Sydney, New York and of course Hong Kong is one of these. The reflection of amazing buildings and lights on water, in this case one of the busiest harbors in the world, makes the Hong Kong skyline an attraction in itself. It is best by far to see it from the Kowloon side and at night. In itself an amazing and exciting place to visit. So do some shopping. Find a wonderful local place for dinner. Eat delicious food that you don't need to spend a fortune on then walk down to the harbor and just look across. This attraction is spectacular and is free. Now that's hard to beat.

Nice.... If it is going to be the first time for you in HK, you should go and enjoy their Light & Sound.I can't count how many time I have been to HK anymore, but still I get to enjoy it when I have time.But this time is a little bit disappointed, it was not so dazzlingly as last time.Anyway, as I told you earlier...enjoy every moment of your traveling life. Don't miss a thing.P.S. You should spare some mosquito or insect repellent with you when you get there.

Best place to spend your evenings. Best place to spend time in the evening, unwinding after yr sight seeing and shopping. This place is worth going to everyday. The amazing sound n light show is the highlight of the evening.
Beauty of Hong Kong. Its beautiful & its true for Hong Kong that SKY IS THE LIMIT!!! The best time to visit is after sunset.

Fantastic. No view like it in the world. If you are on Hong Kong looking back at Kowloon try and time it to see the light display on the ICC tower (around 930 PM I think, but check) . Its amazing, you can down load an app and get synced music to go with the light display, worth a go!

Full of Colors. When i was there, it was really nice seeing the different colors reflected from the buildings towards the sea. You can appreciate the beauty of Victoria Harbor during night time if you want to visit this place. I love it.
Superb view. We were on the harbour front on the 32nd floor overlooking Kowloon.The view would be superb except for the fog every day.
Beautiful views day and night. Our son's apartment overlooked the harbour but seeing Hong Kong from Kowloon was awe-inspiring as well. Were there at Christmas and lights on buildings were amazing.

Chinese new year. Hong Kong has a great skyline to observe at night and during Chinese new year when they let the fireworks go. From my hotel you can see the sea and the fishing boats and commercial ships, Tall buildings, the airport strip which looks like it's not long enough to stop a plane from falling in the ocean.
Must see. beautiful view, very nice activity for couples, families or friends, especially in the evening,easy to access
Amazing city skyline!. I've always enjoyed looking at the HK city skyline from the Victoria Harbour while enjoying the breeze of wind caressing my back. The lights are always awesome.
Amazing Scenery. Such a good skyline depicting the city's economic advancement. Lightshows are present as well. Picturesque view at it's best.

Nice view. The skyline like a postcard. All the major buildings n The Central business district area. On a clear day - picturesque. Can be windy. Be ready to walk. Good for evening n night if weather permits.
excellent view og the island hong kong. good attraction,the view is great.very leisurely activity.After viewing only one food jouint available. I wish food choice & outlets could be better.
Amazing Show. It was amazing show of 30 mins Loved every peace of it. Visited on 24 Dec what a view loved every piece of it
Nice nite view. Worth the effort to at least pay it a visit to the harbours. Nice lighting, lively mood and calm walk way with stars signatures. the breeze was gently yet delighting.

Amazing Light Show. Amazing and spectacular. Needs to be seen from the Kowloon side, I took my 5 year old little girl who also loved all the lights shone up the sides of the skyscrapers. Watching the local boats sail by with lit red sails was also very impressive. I would recommend getting the local ferry across to the other side as well just to see everything.
Hong Kong at its best in the night view. Just sitting there, relaxing, admiring the buildings with its lightings and watch the ships, ferries, boats sail by.

Fantastic!. I'm a sucker for big buildings with lots of lights and it doesn't get much better than Hong Kong.View the skyline from across the harbour near the Avenue of the Stars.Wait till 8pm at night for the light show, bring a camera, record the show, take lots of pictures.It looks great during the day but even better at night.

Unforgettable view - a must for anyone visiting Hong Kong. I'd recommend visiting the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade to experience the Music and Light show - 8 pm each day. This show is not going to leave you speechless, but it is certainly worth 10 minutes of your time. Just make sure that you arrive at least 15 minutes before it starts to insure that you have front row view...

Night time is best. I stayed in the BP hotel. At night I had wonderful views and light shows. FAB! I could just see the bay too - fireworks as well as lasers - some of the buildings have built in light displays too!

HK Island Skyline is the top!. Definitely a tippy top thing to see. I found myself just going there to chill and relax... If you're a photographer amateur or pro hit this place up as near to sunset as you can get. If it's not a humid day you can get an amazing sunset shot. Or time lapse if you're into that kind of thing. If not just like i said just chill and take a walk its super romantic if you're a couple. Even with the crowds.

Best viewed at night. The view of Hong Kong Island from the promenade on Kowloon is spectacular at any time, but it is even better at night. Lots of the sky scrapers are lit up with different coloured lights which makes a majestic scene right across the bay.We went for the 8pm Symphony of Lights show put on by the Hong Kong tourist board and arrived early in order to get a good position. Quite honestly, the actual show was a bit of a disappointment after watching all of the lights that were on anyway. OK, there were green laser lights flashing in time to the music from half a dozen sky scrapers for about fifteen minutes, but it was not really worth waiting for as the view at night is really good without any 'extras'.

One of kind in the world. Lets be honest, Nepal has Everest, Japan has got Fuji but Hong Kong has Victoria Harbor. I've been there thousands of times and I never get tired of watching the ships and boats go by. I first went there in 1966 and to this day I'm in love with Victorial Harbor.
One of its kind. Its hard to find another skyliner in world.Its just amazing and best viewed in the evening under lights.Must see while you are in HK.
The view is very inspiring. My friend was asked for engagement in this area. It reveals so much romance and amazing view of the entire City.

Highest number of skyscrappers in the world. Hong Kong skyline is distinctive with the highest number of skyscrappers in the world. It is impressive and must be seen and appreciated. There is a free 10-15 minute laser show nightly at 8PM with a nice promenade across the harbor on the Kowloon side for people to watch it. When in HK, it is a must see.
breath taking views. What a change. Last previous trip, 1966. skyscrapers everywhere with all types of designs. Something everyone should see.
Wonderful. It's Hong Kong (HK) it's going to be amazing unless there's overcast weather, rain. If you can try to get high up on one of the many towers, at nigh, for a great urban light show.

Has to be one of th top in the world. The skyline in Hong Kong is hard to match. It is lit up really well every night so plenty of opportunities for photos or to enjoy the iconic spot! I would have to say it's a place everyone should see at least once in their life.

Very spectacular.. Amazing scenary both at night and during the day. One giant skyscraper was lit up with moving images which reminded me of the film Bladrunner. Did you know Hong Kong has its own mini "Times Square" located at Causeway Bay? We were lucky enough to be there for the New Years Eve fireworks. Great views from the Convention Centre and the Star Ferries.
Excellent skyline... smog unfortunately gets in the way!. Excellent skyline... smog unfortunately gets in the way! We took the Dukling Junk at sunset and it's a great way to see the city

Amazing Skyline - Day or Night. If you are staying in Hong Kong make sure you visit the Harbour area to take in the Hong Kong Skyline at least once during the day and once at night. If you have time take a night tour to get the best views.

Amazing. This skyline has been very well executed and it is a delight to see, but it isn't as good as shanghai's skyline I think but it is still worth seeing! We saw it nearly every night when we visited Hong Kong and it never disappointed us!
Beautiful. Amazing view! Lots of colourful lights...Definitely worth looking at the skyline. Beautiful during the day and very colourful at night. Your eyes won't leave the scene

Stunning vista not particularly enhanced by the nightly light show.. During a recent trip to Hong Kong I was on the waterfront at Kowloon and Hong Kong Island on more than one occasion , the buildings are even more impressive at night particularly over the Christmas period where several of them really go to town with their decorations. I had a birds eye view of the New Year's eve fireworks which was a brilliant show and well worth the mild discomfort of being jostled by the thousands of others doing the same thing. The nightly light show over the harbour is ok if you happen to be there but I wouldn't make special arrangements to see it although a women next to me was getting very excited , her exclamations of 'amazing'etc made me and my son very puzzled we couldn't see anything that would provoke this reaction.

Probably the best in the world. It's impressive by any measure and its backdrop against Victoria peak and surrounding hills makes this not only an impressive urban landscape but also a natural spectacle. On a clear day you can easily appreciate how amazing this former British colony really is and when it is lit for special occasions (Christmas lights are the best) it is truly a marvel to behold. View it from the Kowloon waterfront or take the harbour ferry for a closer look. If you want a closeup sensation go to one of the many rooftop bars in central.
stand on the kowloon side at 20. so you can watch the light show. yes, it's a bit tacky, and touristy, but it's still nice and pretty amazing
xmas time skyline. stunning skyline views in december with xmas images and lights. worth getting a room with good views.

Excellent view of Hong Kong island, Victoria Harbour and Kowloon.. We got to the tram station by bus no.15 to purchase our tickets to the Peak. The ride up the peak is interesting as you can view Hong Kong from the tram.

Victoria Harbour. The lazer show was quite attractive Wonderful to see how all the buildings light up as well as the clock towerNot necessary to get onto a ferry to watch the lazer show as suggestedPlenty of shops nearby

Take an evening boat ride around the harbour. Hong Kong's skyline lives up to its reputation. The best way of seeing this is by taking an evening cruise around the harbour. There is a laser show at 7-45 pm and 9-00 pm and you can book onto a sailing boat ( with a drink) to make the most of this. Highly recommended

Over hyped attraction. Let me start by saying that the skyline is visible from three promenades along the Kowloon bay, so you have to be on Kowloon side and not Hong Kong island side. The site for watching the laser show is next to Star ferry pier/ behind Hong Kong cultural center / end of Salisbury road, all are same locations. There is a 5 min laser lights display which is tuned to the music being played but compared to any descent musical light show this is not even noticeable. The crowd is way too dense and most parents lift their children up on shoulders and some are just using selfie sticks to record the proceedings. A better option to see the skyline is to visit it after the 0800 pm show when crowds have thinned out. Also there was a 3D show just behind the pier location at 0820 pm, 0845 pm and even more timings were there. Again you see children on shoulders and selfie sticks only. The show is nothing to write home about. Alternatively, you can see the skyline from East Tsim Tsa Sui promenade while having dinner at any of the swanky restaurants with live music.
Good Panorama. Its worth spending some time, its one of the couple of places worth to see in HK.In the night there is a nice atmosphera.

Along the walkway from Star ferry exits to the entrance of Habour City. Great views at night to take pictures or just to relax and watch the times goes by....the best views in between the star ferry and before the cruise ship area.....

Christmas Lights. I've seen photos of the Skyline on the Intranet, but was blown away by the Christmas lights - seen both from a night junk one night and the promenade another time. Hong Kong really goes all-out! Gorgeous!
Free and it's Beautiful. You can view this anytime during your stay and its free to view. The atmosphere is also amazing with lots of people hanging out well into the evening.
Looks similar to Mumbai's Skyline but way too tall. Just stand near the Harbor in Kowloon and you get a mesmerizing view of crazy tall buildings competing in height.
Beautiful scenery. You really see Hong Kong transform at night where the skyline sees the city transform from a busy bustling smog into a glittering silhouette

Amazing View (especially on clear day). This is worth the lineup for the tram. The view is great.There's lots of photo opportunities. There is shopping, restaurants and other activities at the peak. I spent the money to go twice in the same day. (day and night)I enjoyed the view during the day and night with no favourite.There's a resident photographer but its very pricey!

Good Skyline. Best place to see Symphony of Light every night at 8pm and best photo view at night. Take starferry from Kowloon pier to Central pier only 10 to 15min and very cheap, about 2.5 hkd to 3 hkd each paid by octopus card to see the skyline at night.
Spectacular!!. One of the worlds great skylines. Good during the day but incredible at night when the lights come on. Take the ferry for the best view.

A view like nothing I'd ever seen. Great skyline with beautiful and decorated buildings. Really great views....try to take a harbor cruise. Star ferry if you are on a budget, else you can try Aquolulo boat tours.
Spectacular view overlooking the skyscrapers . The windy atmosphere adds to the thrill of enjoying the beautiful night lights surrounding the city of Hong Kong.
New years eve . Colourful bright and amazing view from the Kowloon side especially... Was there on the new Years eve and the fireworks were too good!
The best sky line ever seen. This was one of the best sky lines ever seen, certainly during the evening, take a tour of tge harbour with a sampan

Best Skyline in the World...Ahead of even Manhattan... Went to West Kowloon waterfront promenade to have a look at gorgeous and breathtaking Hong Kong Skyline which is probably the Best in the World along Victoria Harbour..Spend a nice time at promenade with extreme chill coming from sea side and many children playing in the promenade and also saw some local ad-shooting on the Promenade..Recommended at after sunset for those perfect pictures..
Beautiful . One of the best in the world. Driving into Hong Kong on the night we landed, we were gob smacked. Very beautiful skyline. Highly recommend the peak for a good view.
Beautiful skyline, look for the Avenue of the Stars. Just walk along the Avenue of the stars to take in the beautiful vieuw on the HongKong skyline. It is not necessary to book a tour.
Enjoyable night and day. One of the world's impressive skyline's that most other cities now look to copy. The light-show appears past its best though
Only on a clear day. Iconic skyline but really only appreciated on a clear day..which is becoming rarer....still at night it lights up and there are many viewing areas to take it in

Symphony of lights. Not so bad..it was raining and we need raincoat..or a hooded sweatshirt..try to walk towards tsim tsai tsu toward haiphong road and it more lively as the shop and light brighten the walking path..
Amazing city, great friendly polite people. Great city, fabulous people, very polite, very sophisticated, the city is clean and you feel very safe
Stunning. The most beautiful skyline I had ever seen, must do no.1 while travelling Hong Kong, better view in Tsim Sha Tsui than Central

An eye candy. No matter which way you choose to admire the skyline, from Star Ferry or from Kowloon Island, the view is magnificent. Make sure you coordinate your time so you can catch the light show that goes on every evening.

Probably the best skyline in the world. Regardless of how many times I see this skyline I am still blown away by it. The neon lights on the skyscrapers on the HK side stand out against the black background and make for an incredible photo background which I don't think you will find anywhere else.

The most high rises of any city. We got there early afternoon and after getting from the airport to our apartment and unpacking we went out for dinner.
We couldn't get over the skyline, it was different at every turn, and I was awe struck at the volume of buildings
Cool, amazing and awesome. The view was really cool, amazing and awesome from the Ritz Carlton hotel. Very colorful and lively. Baby you are worth it :)
Breathtaking on a clear day. Always a lovely walk along the harbour front, and the view is amazing, day or night, so long as the day is clear!

Ray of lights at night. Light shows at 8pm. Most of the buildings around the harbour participates during light shows. Just the usual LED lights. Nothing so fantastic about it. Crowds start to come at night and its freezing windy.

Stunning at night. Magnificent view at night. Impressive in day, but far more so at night as many of the buildings by day are relatively humdrum modern skyscrapers. Best hotel view from Kowloon we've come across is the Intercontinental.
This was the actual view from our room.. Amazing both day and night. Also very close to the hotel and we took one of the water taxis across to the other side. Recommend it.
Harbour cruise. It was an amazing experience, with the light and laser show and the beautiful decorations across the coast

Impressive by itself. Laser show was underwhelming.. Happened to view the skyline from the skytower100. It was a nice 360 degree view. it was a night view so lights were the key attraction. managed to catch the laser light show which lasts about 10 minutes. it was a bit underwhelming. the city line with the regular lights itself looked nice. the laser show did not seem to accentuate it. folks cruising on the harbor have given better reviews for the light show. also a lot depends on the weather as well.
Reach for the sky Tripadvisor Certificate of Excellence. The line is clear . Just has to be one of the most enchanting Skylines in the world Try to book your hotel room with a view

Great free thing to do after dinner. Had dinner in Kowloon, and then walked to the waterfront. It was quite busy, so I'd advise showing up earlier to get a good spot. Several rows of seating are available along the promenade.

very average in comparison to the other attractions!!!. the laser lights and the lighting was good but average in comparison to the other attractions in hong kong. really didn't even know when the laser lighting started and when it ended. substandard really, have seen better!!!
Good.. Wonderful view, provided weather permitting. Nice walk along the Tsim Shah Sui promenade. Crowded during the weekends.
Glitzy and beautiful. The colourful lights and the buildings with their fancy designs are treat to watch, you can sit for a long time and just admire.
Beautiful lights. The light show presented was very nice. There is a great view from both the Sheraton as well as the Intercontinental Hotel.

Awesome skyline. There are plenty of places to view the skyline. Woolomloo roof top bar is a great place. Most of the big hotels get a view. The skyline looking across to Kowloon is great from any vantage points point. Just cross your fingers the weather is ok.

Spectacular. This has got to be one of the most famous skylines in the world and rightly so. I saw it during the day and night, with night being better of course. I managed to time it with the sound and light show they have but its terrible, you can barely tell its co-ordinated! But this is a must not miss!
Pretty good . Hong kong should be famous for it's skyline, skyscrapers are as common as trees, and when the night comes most of them are decorated with lights and screens.

Skyline pretty but don't bother with the light show at 8pm. The skyline of Hong Kong all lit up at night is lovely, however the much hyped light show at 8pm nightly is poor.
By all means go for a wander and see the light up buildings which are pretty. The light show, was a real damp squib, crowds of people to see a few weak lasers!
Won't bother again!

Nothing like it anywhere else in the world!. The Hong Kong skyline holds up to the hype. Wonderful views from everywhere. For a real treat, have cocktails at the bar and then dinner at the Peninsula hotel's Felix restaurant. Be sure to request a window seat in the restaurant in advance. The host was very helpful with this. Wonderful experience.

World Class. Hong Kong has a fantastic skyline. It is definitely worth taking in the views from Hong Kong island, looking back at Kowloon and vice-versa and then from a high vantage point. We viewed the skyline from Victoria Peak via the tram (prepare for a lengthy wait to get on the tram, be packed on when you finally get on and pay quite a bit for the pleasure) and it was magnificent. We luckily managed to go up just before sunset and stayed until it was dark. The light show viewed from Kowloon side is also something not to be missed, its not world changing but its pretty cool seeing all buildings being lit up to music.
Always a treat. We have seen the Hong Kong skyline at least 5 times (for every time we have been in Hong Kong) and the view never fails to take our breath away.

Not sure why all the fuzz about it. It's a metropole, a large interesting city like many others. Sure, the skyline is impressive, with many true skyscrapers. But then, so is NY, Chicago, Beijing, Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Los Angeles, SF, London, São Paulo. Once you travel around you will see too many like it...

Too cold and Rainy to view. I'm sure we would have loved this attraction on a clear day. But there was zero visibility, and no place to take cover from the rain if you were not sitting at a restaurant on top.
Delightful 24/7. Staying at 4 Seasons we enjoyed the skyline 24/7 and regardless of weather or time of day, the skyline is always able to be enjoyed with great photos to capture the memories.

Beautiful View of a Gorgeous City. Every night at 8am there is a Light Show over the harbor. If you are on the TST side, it's very easy to watch it happened on the Hong Kong island side! While it's not necessarily an amazing laser show, the skyline itself is AMAZING!

Not to be missed!. It is still the best skyline in the world, especially at night. There is a laser show at nightly 8pm. The best view is from the harbor front by the Cultural Centre in Tsim Sha Tsui.

Spectacular View. One of our best night in our HK tour is to experience the dancing lights of HK Island from Victoria Harbour. It's a view to behold with all the buildings lighted up. You can't get wrong with your photo shots with the postcard background effect! Amazing night !

Beautiful. We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on Hong Kong Island and were able to have breakfast on the top floor overlooking the rest of Hong Kong. It is beautiful. Recommend to anyone planning on visiting Hong Kong.

Beautiful skyline at night . Try to get a nice view of the skyline from a height (Victoria Peak or a rooftop restaurant or bar) or from the harbour. At night if there is not too much smog your pictures will look amazing.

Uniquely Hong Kong. The skyline is uniquely Hong Kong - it can not be mistaken for any other city. The skyline can be enjoyed in many ways, but highly recommended is the view from a Star Ferry or from the Kowloon side boulevard. During daytime you can enjoy the outstanding (literally) architecture, and at night the buildings come alive with colorful lighting, including fully animated video on some buildings. There is a light show each evening at 8 visible from the Kowloon side, however it does not add much to the view as such.
Cold On topof the Peak. Beautiful Breathtaking Skyline, but do come with a jacket in December on top of the Peak. Worth the trip

Fabulous. Hong Kong skyline is one of the best I've seen, especially at night. It is best viewed from Tsim Sha Tsui. Avoid crowds during the 8:00 PM "Symphony of Lights" show - this show is terrible and adds nothing to the view.
Impressive harbour views. Loved the harbour at night with the Christmas lights particularly looking across from Kowloon side to HK Island

Night Light show. Great thing to do from the Kowloon shore in the evening on the way to the airport. Arrange with the hotel concierge for a taki pick up around 8:00PM and specifically ask for a stop on the way to see the light show. The laser show is not as spectacular as suggested by the building lighting is spectacular. All in all is a great compliment to a daytime skyline view from Victoria Peak

A must see in Hong Kong. Even romantic walk or just child out alone, the path walk from TST to Avenue of the stars is wonderful. To be visited daylight and at night before 22h else the light of the building will be switch off

MUST SEE. To me, this view was more spectacular than that from The Peak, and even more so at night time. Absolutely breathtaking with so many magnificent photo opportunities. A must see for Hong Kong. Don't bother with the light show though. Literally the buildings lights flashing on and off with a few strobe lights. Not worth the wait or crowds.
Outstanding. A must ! You have to see both in the day and at night from the water and the mountain. Take the Bus to Victoria Peak a great ride.

Beautiful day and night!. HK has a wonderful skyline. There are a few bars on both sides of the water that offer great views and decent happy hours. A quick search should set you up with options near you.
View from ground and Peak Tram. View the skyline both from the ground and from the Peak Tram (also rated in another review). See both at day and night.

Beautiful City at Night. There is no Doubt that Hong Kong is a beautiful City at night.
The tall lite up buildings look wonderful at night, but during the day, the city itself is an overcrowded shopping mall full of rude mainland Chinese coming down to shop in Hong Kong.

Besutiful. The skyline here is like no other, simply breathtaking and full of new surprises! You simply need to wait a year and another building has gone up. Take it in from the star ferry crossing or from the viewing deck of one of the many hotels around the bay, the Ritz Carlton has the highest bar in the world with incredible views!

Great sight. One of the must do things in the world is to see this skyline both in daylight and also at night. It all looks so magical large and impressive. Better from a distance when you don't have to trudge for miles in pushing and shoving crowds to see it from ground level.
Hong Kong Skyline. The skyline was nice, but it was quite smoggy when we were there in December so nothing to really rave about which was a bit disappointing.

Impressive. The HK skyline truly is impressive and seeing the freighter ships, ferries and aqua ferries is really interesting. Across the water there were many buildings completely lit up in a light display, one such one was a Michael Jackson themed building, incredible! The down side is the foul smelling smog which you are inhailing during the walk along the prominade.

Always dazzling. Taking time out in our busy sight-seeing & shopping & eating schedule to enjoy the visual experience that is the Hong Kong light show.A pleasant and light breeze made the experience so much more enjoyable and while we waited for the display to begin, we walked along the stars avenue to read about the various famous and not-so-famous HK actors/actresses of the present and of the era gone. A highlight was the bronze statue of HK's famous son, Bruce Lee.
very beautiful view. you can enjoy tall buildings with beautifully light up. I recommend you enjoy the view about 8pm because there may be laser beam show.

Impressive modernity best viewed from Kowloon. This is kind of an unavoidable sight and should not be missed. The sheer grandeur of it is impressive. It's also ridiculously lit up and a light show happens nightly which is one of the dumbest things I've seen. But nonetheless popular.
Symphony of Lights. The skyline is impressive (reminds Shanghai) but the evening Symphony of Lights show was a quite disappointing
visit HK waterfront. Good but it was a little misty of the day we were there. HK was not cold then. Ace of stars was under renovation

One of the most beautiful in the world. Even if the day is cloudy, you have a great scenery. Specially if you are at the Tsim Sha Tsui Pier. You can make really great pictures, with Google Photo Assistant, I got incredible panoramic views.  In the evening, you can enjoy a wonderful lights symphony; in Christmas time is just amazing.  You should take the Star Ferry, also in the evening, seat, and just enjoy the view.
Excellent walk. I came there for a walk and I really loved it. The harbour is really THE thing to visit if you come to Hong Kong. At night time, all the light s are really nice.
Visually Beautiful and worth it. I loved the HK skyline. Its simply beautiful to take a walk on the promenade and have dinner at the restaurants.
Terrific View. If you are at a rooftop restaurant you can appreciate the grandeur of the night skyline.Also view from Kowloon side across the harbour

One of the most overhyped view in today's world. When we compare it the Dubai and other countries the view of HK city skyline was a talk of old era. Today I feel Macau and Dubai have more grandness and freshness as compared to HK SKYLINE. never the less tourist must visit to atleast talk about be when asked in social groups.
Drop by at TST Promenade. This is nice to look at and have some photo op. Nice hang-out place to if you want to relax and let time pass by.

Worlds best skyline. One of the worlds best skylines. 8pm on most days (if not every day) the buildings will light up in a light show. I went during the christmas holidays and the buildings were well lit up celebrating the season!

A breath taking view of the Hong Kong Skyline. WOW!!! That is the only expression when you see this place. Such a vantage point, you get to see a beautiful view of the HK skyline. And when all the buildings are lit, its an altogether different experience. And the show @ 8pm should not be missed at all. This place leaves a lasting impression on your mind

Lights. I was amazed at all the Christmas lights and music being played. There are Christmas trees everywhere. The sky line if finominal the buildings are so tall and lite up. Wonderful place to,visit.

holiday Illumination. We were lucky enough to be there for the Christmas Holiday. The illumination show was spectacular! The best way to see everything is to take a boat ride in the evening just before the show starts.

Absolutely amazing. We went late December and the Skyline, beautiful in itself was greatly enhanced by the most beautiful lighting displays on many tall buildings. It was an amazing lighting display. I was overawed with the technology to enable this. The display on their tallest building of about 120 floors has an incredibly clear display on it of people walking across it. And the Christmas display on about 3 buildings of their art centre is WOW, incredible clarity etc.. Yes an awesome skyline!
Beautiful!. Night time view is superb and second to none. Best viewed from the Star Ferry cruise. Must do if you are in HK.

Hong Kong has really developed. We caught the Star Ferry and the views of the Hong Kong skyline are amazing both during the day and at night. It had been 10 years since I visited Hong Kong and the city has grown enormously in that time.
one of the best. on night i enjoyed the view too much, in morning i adore it, so leave your feeling to rise there, happy to see that.

Hong Kong night skyline. You can view the Hong Kong skyline from the Kowloon side or the Hong Kong island side, both look across Victoria Harbour. I prefer the view from the Kowloon side looking across at the Hong Kong island buildings that are lite up each night.At 8:00PM there is a laser light show that begins and is very impressive and can be seen form many vantage points on the Kowloon side.
Loved the views from both sides of the harbor. Viewing the skyline with friends is refreshing for a central texas resident. Ferry views or views from either side of water are nice.
Wonderful view!. Coming back by ferry from one of the islands near the mainland at night, I looked up and saw this amazing view. It was all lights and colors

Not very exciting . I don't know or i was at the wrong time of the year in HK but i took one eveing off to have a look at the show and what i found was there was nothing happening. Even on the normal days there is a better view.

Best Skyline in the world. This is the best skyline in the world. Day or night. I advise you to go all the way to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station and then just walk down to the riverside (avenue of the stars). I´ts as good as it gets. The light show is pretty amazing. If you get the chance, drop by the Intercon lounge. It has a bar with a great view of the skyline.

Colorful, exciting and refreshing. Hong Kong welcomes peeople who like to walk and explore new areas and tastes.. A fun, lively and exciting place to explore and discover. From ancient temples in side streets, to modern hi rise buildings, Hong Kong has it all. A MUST VISIT destination on any trip to Asia.
Spectacular. Absolutely stunning view. Had a clear evening and the view from the Kowloon side is amazing. The Xmas decorations on the buildings was remarkable and great to see.

Skyline is stunning, but night show is not. The Hong kong Skyline is really impressive and yes, stunning and even captivating. That said, the 15-minute nightly 8 pm Light Show at the harbor is a big nothing but a bit of music and some laser lights not creatively projected. Someone from our tour group went to Hong Kong just to see it and was incredibly disappointed.

Worth seeing. We watched the Skyline light show as we sailed away on a cruise ship. The size of each light display and the variety of colors and special effects is impressive. We were a little disappointed not to see more synchronization between the different displays. Actually we enjoyed the skyline and the sea more than the light show.

Breathe-taking view!. Hong Kong Skyline is indeed one of the breathe-taking views I've seen yet. Mainly because of the diverse building styles. I like it on mornings but it's way better in the evening as the lights from the buildings really adds spectacle to it!

Beautiful. We were there on a slightly hazy day but even with that it is a magnificent skyline whether you're looking at it from the harbour or from the peak. It's what people expect to see when the go to Hong Kong and it doesn't fail to impress. Try to view it during the day as well as at night.
A lot of lights. A good light show in 8p.m. everyday. looks great but for 1-2 times.A good optin take star ferry it costs approx. 3$ HK, and you will have a great view.
Brilliant. Easy to get to, beautiful to watch - the light show is underwhelming, but make sure you take the Star ferry for the best view

Spectacular skyline . Spectacular skyline, an iconic vision of Hong Kong. Walking along the pier with a friend or loved one is sure to put a smile on your face when you remember your travels in the city. Be sure to catch the 8.10 pm light show near St. Felix.
Iconic and beautiful. Iconic skyline, wonderful by day and brilliant by night. See it from Tsim Sha Tsui promenade or take the Stay Ferry across to the island.

You can't avoid it and you wouldn't want to. The Hong Kong Skyline is one of the main attractions and it's amazing during the day & night. We were however very disappointed with the night time light show. It was advertised to us all day long, everyone talked about it and bigged it up so we were excited to go and see it. We arrived early to get a good view of the skyline only to find that only a couple of the skyscrapers joined in with the laser display & the music wasn't loud enough to hear so all in all a flop! I'm sure it could be amazing on New Years Eve perhaps when they hopefully make a real effort but on this occasion they didn't and it really wasn't worth all the hype.

Amazing skyline at night. Took a walk from Tsim Sha Tsui to the ferry terminal and beyond as the sun begin to set and finally reached the waterfront at night. View is absolutely mind blowing, definitely should be on the top three of anyone's to do list in Hong Kong!!!
Fantastic. Christmas light show on waterfront is not to be missed. Buildings all lit up & around the star ferry terminal was the walkway to the harbour city shopping complex
Breathtaking. stunning views from both Kowloon and Hong Kong sides of the harbour. Even more Spectacular at night.

Beautiful view of the central district of Hong Kong. I was at Victoria Harbour when I waited for the sunset. I watched as the view of Hong Kong skyline changed with the addition of lightings. It was magnificent and breath-taking.
A nice presentation od waterfront but a little too static. The lights, the music combine nicely but this is too little for a good light and sound show as not much happens in front of you...

City of lights, many, many lights! . Best view is from the water. Jump onto the Star Ferry and enjoy the amazing view at night! The other place would be from the Peak, which will reveal how dense the city is. It's baffling how they built up the city to be this way.
Amazing . The view is unexplainable romantic when u get cosy with your loved once. The sound & light program there is amazing watch.

Beautiful, especially when lit up at night . Take the ferry or go to a rooftop bar at night
The view is absolutely gorgeous
The decorations for the holidays are unlike anything I've seen before
fantastic view. you can see it on the ferry. though i am not a great fan of light shows, the skyline is a nice view

Probably my favourite view in the World. This is a view I never tire of, whether it be from the Island or from Kowloon side, particularly at night, and when the Light Show takes place around 8.10 pm each evening. My favourite place to watch is from Felix Restaurant in the Peninsula Hotel, but a free alternative is from Kowloon Public Pier.

It's massive, and awesome.Don't miss the free light show each night at 8pm.. The only problem is the pollution, If the smog is bad, the skyline is not nearly as impressive.That said, it is still pretty neat. I'd recommend getting a table and a few cocktails at the intercontinental hotel. They have a great view of the skyline for the light show.
Love Hong Kong!. The city is bustling and awesome to see. This was taken in front of the Art Museum at the base of Nathan Street. In this area, there are chairs and benches to hang out.
Little overrated. We specially travelled to the peak in the evening to get the best views of the so called sight, and found it just average.

Easily the most impressive Skyline in the world. I've been dozens of times to Hong Kong and am always mesmerised by the Skyline, either view from the Kowloon side or the Star Ferry between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, or from the Peak. You have to do all three (and more)

MMMMMM. I just don't get how could this be the best attraction in HK. The bay was crowded with everyone eager to watch the show at 8pm (everyday). We thought we were the only guys dissapointed but after 10 minutes people started to leave (the show last 20 minutes). I'm not saying its not worth it to give it a try but don't go with many expectations. At least you got the mall to walk afterwards.

Very pretty view from the ferry. I liked the Hong Kong skyline from the ferry.From the other side of the city, it all looks even more amazing.Take the ferry just before sunset, I promise it's worth the travel

Busy but with it. Fascinating skyline that's comes to life after 8 o' clock. The area on the main land to the left of the Star Ferry terminal is very busy if you want to take photographs but if you want to just take in the view anywhere on the elevated deck is ideal. Arrive well before the switch on for a good seat/view.
Grey Dirty Days. There are more dirty grey days than blue sky clear days. HK air is very dirty compared to the mainland.

Great view from the peninsula hotel . The skyline is quite wonderful at night for the laser light show. We watched it from our room. Great. Next time from the walkway along the harbor. You can hear the music. But if we do it again. Would do it from one of the boat that are out for the show. Maybe the Star Ferry. You get to see both side. It is neat that most of the buildings are lit in neon. Also in the morning at 6 am the Samsung building says good morning in the neon.

Christmastime is a treat. We took the MTR to Kowloon but a different area so we took a taxi to the waterfront to watch the light show. The buildings are beautiful with all their lights. The highlight is the boat with red sails that magically appears and sails around the harbor. It is easy to catch the Star Ferry back to Hong Kong Island

Spectacular xmas light display.... Most multi story buildings on the harbour are lit up with spectacular lights during the lead up to Christmas. Free and well worth a walk around at night to see this amazing display
8pm Magic. Make sure to watch the Symphony of Lights from the Kowloon side of HK. Plays overnight at 8pm to music. Even better during the holiday season with the buildings in Central lit up.

As good as you expecyed. Hong Kong world city skyline is spectacular as expected. What was a surprise is how the walkways across central district that thread you through them above the traffic and through the endless malls. To see views from above the Peak and the Ritz Carlton are superb from below HK park.

The skyline in Hong Kong is unlike any other. The skyline in Hong Kong is unlike any other skyline I have ever seen. So many colors and lights reflecting off the water. While I was there there were a lot of building with Christmas designs and lights! Its worth looking at from all angles.
Amazing. Wonderful City and the it just need to be explored. Everything from fake polo shirts to the most high end designer shops on every street.

View in the night. The best place to view the Hong Kong skyline is from the Kowloon side near the port for the Star Ferry. It is especially great when the buildings on HK Island are decorated for the holidays.

1st and 2nd time in a year...... it was a different feeling ...when me and the whole family of 7 with 2 kid first to be here to feel the cold breeze of january.and it was a bit humid the 2nd time in August with me and my wife...we plan to come back to visit the said place again for the 3rd time...in future.
sit back and stare as it unfolds. the view "tastes" best, watched when sun goes down and all the high-rises start to light-up. it's a real show

Beautiful city lights. Really nice place to take a stroll along the the river even though it's crowded. Also a romantic place :) Went there during holiday season and they have pretty decorations around too! And it's very near to TST. Worth a visit/ walk there.
One of the best urban views in the world?. Enjoying our hotel room with a view of Hong Kong's harbour skyline. The buildings are especially resplendent with Christmas themed animations.

The weather should be clear to enjoy. we went in evening to enjoy musical show with skyline, but its was too cloudy we cud hardly see buildings. but when we went in after noon , its was clear and enjoyed more.

Great architecture, amazing imagery and uses of color. The Hong Kong skyline is one of the greatest sights in the world, amplifier\d only by personal opportunity to enjoy and react to the evening light and laser shows A "must see" in Hong Kong.
Lights up the sky. The Christmas theme lights are magnificent but the tower that tells the time on the side in different coloured bars is mesmerizing

Skyline worth the visit. Beautiful skyline with Christmas lights, best enjoyed from a highly located bar or the roof of your hotel. Best seen at night and makes a stunning setting with the boats on the water beneath.

Beautiful Views but far out of the way. Be sure to pick a clear night because once you go up if there are clouds or pollution you can't really see the lights. The buses that travel up and back can take a long time. I recommend taking a bus up and and taxi down as the bus lines are very long leaving at the end of the night and the taxi aren't the costly. But overall it's a popular place in HK that everyone should see once!

Stunning. Morning, afternoon or evening always something new to spot. Great place to wander and people watch especially on Sunday's and bank hols when the locals gather. A bit disappointed by the nighttime laser displays, not as good as I expected but worth a quick visit just to say you have seen them
beautiful view. Looks amazing at night .. beautifully lit buildings .. music show was average but from cultural center was exceptional
Watch the show!. Beautiful show! So amazing that a city can offer such a thing. The Hong Kong waterfront spectacle is definitely something not to be missed on your trip to HK!
Symphony of lights. Did disappoint to a certain extent.....as had reads excellent reviews about the show. Better from the Kowloon promenade
Laser show. Skyline is amazing to watch at night, with all buildings lit up and animated with lights moving across them .Don't miss the Symphony of Lights laser show.

Great in daylight, amazing at night. No surprise that one of the attractions of the skyline of HL is the 8 pm show which lights the buildings of HK island. If on the island then the Kowloon buildings are also lit for the light show.

Best at night. The Hong Kong skyline is average during the day but fantastic at night. It is best to view it from Kowloon over the Harbour. The lights and projections onto the building across the harbour make for fantastic photos.
awesome. amazing views of Hong Kong Island best enjoyed from Kowloon site or on board the Star Ferry. Best at night but also impressive during day time. Cool views from top of Victoria Peak.
Spectacular & Very Over the Top. The Hong Kong Skyline is mesmerizing in many ways and exceeds one's expectations one every level. The spectrum of magnificent colors will simply blow your mind.

Nothing fancy. If you have a better plan, just go. (Shopping, eating, sightseeing, clubbing, praying, etc) There's nothing to regret at this place. I felt like there's only a couples of buildings that prepare a special lighting at the showtime (8pm, please check again). The music wasn't very entertaining either.
View Anywhere. Everywhere in Hong Kong has excellent views, where ever you go, but the Hong Kong skyline takes it to the extreme. Best views are at about 8:00 PM.

Worth seeing!. The Hong Kong skyline is best viewed at night, as all the building lights are lit.
The light show is not that great especially if it is a misty evening.
the future. but all together this is one on the best skylines I have every seen. get a beer and watch the lights show at 8:00pm
Best in the World I think!. cp to Paris, London, Prague, Montreal etc. Well, I am local, so may be bias and then again, minus the locals finding local places boring factor could balance it! :>
it's a must. Everytime I travel to HK....i never miss to take a picture of the skyline...... it's romantic..colorful..attractive ...and surrounding are safe and clean....

One of the best sky.ines in the world. Hong Kong has one of the best skylines in the world. Enjoy it from the Island side to see Kowloon from the Peak or from Kowloon to see the Island form the Avenue of Stars or Ozone Bar, or take a junk (Chinese boats) over Victoria Harbour or take the Star Ferry. Stunning and free!

Fantastic effort. Where else, other than Vegas, can you get a full glitzy light show for nothing! And it's way more classy. Best spot to watch is on the platform to left of kowloon (tsim sha tsui) star ferry terminal. Nice touch having some with Xmas lights, and you can see more if you do a night harbour cruise
Best skyline by far. The best viewing points are the Victoria harbor or the Victoria peak, which is accessible using the tram. It is a must see if you're in Hong Kong.

Litte difficult to see. Unfortunatly the day we spent in Hong Kong was foggy so we could not see much of the skyline. But with all the skyscrapers it is difficult to miss and be amazed by the incredibly tall buildings. But in the end they are just skyscrapers.

Best viewed from Kowloon side. You gotta love a city that lights up its buildings every night, and puts on a show for free. Not energy efficient, but a lot of fun. Happens every evenings about 8 or 9 oclock.
Best from Kowloon. We went on an evening ferry over to Kowloon and the view of the Hong Kong Island skyline was amazing.

Nice skyline. The skyline of Hong Kong is great. But the lightshow isn't that interesting. It is crowded and a bit dull. If you want ti enjoy the skyline go a bit more to the side. Lot less people and the view is the same.

Spectaular View. Hong Kong skyline is having spectacular view whether you are there in day or night. I was there to see the laser show but I was disappointment that it was not so impressive but he lighting on the building is so adorable. Laser show start every evening at 08PM so you want to see this be there before the time.
Mesmerizing scene that makes me fell in love with HK. One of the most unforgettable scene when you visit HK. Unmissable to the very max, it's one of the reason why I fall in love with this city.

Skyyline by night, on the ferry. Go to the Skyline by night. Take a ferry (3 HK&) to the kowloon area. On the water you have amazing views. In the period (Dec, 2015) there was also a light show running (Pulse) which was nice to see!

Amusing show and great view. We went there for the 8pm show and as everyone had told us, the 15min show really does feel like 5mins. In addition to the show, generally the Hong Kong skyline is a great view. We stayed in TST specifically so we can stroll down to the promenade and enjoy the night views and it was well worth it.The only drawback was the intense volume of crowd that gathers during the 8pm show, other than that a leisurely stroll is something to remember.
A great light show. We went down to the waterfront on the Kowloon side. It was a beautiful light show. It's beautiful how the lights reflect off of the water.
One of the best views in the world. Get there around 8:00 in the evening for a spectacular daily light show! The views are brilliant day or night.
Amazing Views !. You really need to spend a night walking about the harbour just to take it all in.... light light and more lights !!

Stunning view. Took the bus up to Victoria peak as the tram lines were very long. The view of the city of Hong Kong is amazing with all the lights and neon visuals. There are many places where you can get a good view of the Hong Kong skyline and it's definitely a thing you'll want to see while in Hong Kong.
Wow!. You can get the train to Tsim Sha Tsui station and you will see the hong Kong skyline. It is amazing! You can also see the light shows!
Nice view.. . Good place to view sunset. Wasn't able to catch one as it was a cloudy day when I went there. But still able to view the day turn tonight.
Visiting for four nights. Had to see so many places in 3 days - hard to know which to see in the short time. Glad we did the Skyline. Amazing views

Probably the prettiest skyline in the world. Great architecture situated between Victoria Peak and the Hong Kong harbor: Hong Kong benefits from a stunning combination of natural beauty and spectacular skyscrapers resulting in the prettiest skyline in the world. The lightshow is also quite nice.
Breathtaking View. A nice walk after dinner to view the Hong Kong Skyline is an excellent way of relaxation. You can see this city is bustling with activities even at night.

Beautiful view, every single night. It is a very beautiful view. It doesn't matter from where and when you look at it, but it is worth to take a few minutes at 20:00 to watch it at night and enjoy the Symphony of Lights.

Very Pretty City both during the Day & Night. A very pretty city anytime day or night, Victoria Harbour is dotted with both old and new buildings. Mixed hotels and businesses, tall, very tall and short buildings! Very diverse city with old and new intermingled. Lots of cultural things to see and learn about.Very busy city! Many people jammed up in a tiny area and it is best to do things early in the mornings but shopping malls only open at 10am. This is definitely a night life city! The buildings around Victoria Harbour at night are all lit up and there is even a night light show at 8pm each evening.This time if year everything inside and out is decorated beautifully for Christmas! A magical time of year to visit Hong Kong!

What's so special?! . Give me the Singapore skyline any day! Agreed there are many more tall buildings in HK but aren't these buildings so cramped? Gives me a feeling that that people can peek out from one building to the other - they're so close! Plus the apartments are ugly looking, old. Looks like shoe boxes. Never going back to HK again!

Must See at Night. We got off the ferry back from Macau at about 9.00pm local time and walked along the concourse and viewed the skyline. It was something on my bucket list since learning about it at school and I was not disappointed. The lights were stunning and if in hong kong dont miss out this free event.

Bright lights big city. Hong Kong harbor sparkles with neons and is an impressive and probably unique vista among world cities. HK is truly hustle bustle with a cosmopolitan flavor. The infrastructure for transportation is more than outstanding and there seems nonstop construction everywhere. While China cities seem replacing Hong Kong in many aspects, Hong Kong will remain the most international of them all.

Stunning. Unfortunately our flight arrived late and we arrived just minutes before they began turning off the lights on the buildings. With that said still the most stunning skyline I have ever seen. Having seen it in so many movies it was even better in person.

The Impressive Hong Kong Skyline. Hong Kong boast of one of the most impressive city skyline whether you're viewing Tsim Tsa Chui from the island or the island from Kowloon side.Hong Kong being as mountainous island adds to the charm with impressive sky scrapers with the sea on the foreground and mountain in the background.Truly impressive display of the city skyline at night when all its skyscrapers are lighted up. It's just like a live painting captured on canvas.
best to view from star ferry or marco polo hong kong parking. most impress at night with all the lights.depending the moment of the year, various changing subjects

Impressive Skyline. I never really thought of a skyline as an attraction, but Hong Kong's skyline is truly impressive ...especially at night, or on a clear day where you get the contrast of the buildings against the greenery of the hills behind the city.

Great View Day or Night. Iconic HK Island views from Kowloon, night or day get the star ferry over using your Octopus card if you stay on HK island for a good view. Or sail around the harbour on star ferry harbour tour to see both sides..

Beautiful skyline. A great place to see the night lights is from the Kowloon West Promenade. We were there for the annual Clockenflap and it was just beautiful to spend time by the water, looking back on Hong Kong island with the beautiful skyline.You can walk over from Kowloon MTR station and there is an overhead crossing to get you there easily. But it is about a 10-15 minute leisurely walk from the station to the promenade.

Lights...... We went to see the HongKong Skyline, it was lights in the sky... not particularly to any music and after about 2 mins we actually wondered if we had missed it or maybe if we had expected a little too much.... nothing amazing and probably wouldn't recommend it to be honest.

Photos do not do justice!. Definitely worth exploring both day and night if possible. But if you are time-short the evening is great! There is a light show every night at 8pm. If your around at the time you may as well watch it however the skyline itself is amazing and the light show itself is average! How great to take such views in, and FREE of charge!
Building Light. Everyday 8pm you can come here to have free show. You will see lot of people waiting here. Better view is nearby the terminal there.

One of the biggest perks of Hong Kong. This view will always be beautiful whatever night you come (best to come a night after it rains so the pollution clears up). Whenever I'm in HK I'll always come here to absorb the view. Even more amazing during the fireworks.

Cliche Skyline. The clarity of the Hong Kong Skyline depends very much on the air quality that day. For photography enthusiasts out there, try to take photos from various vantage points to experience the skyline differently.
Not to be missed. Amazing view at night from the Kowloon Public pier (near the Star ferry). I think I prefer this view as the one from the peak. Excellent night photo opportunity of course.
hongkong skyline. Great experience of watching the skyline with lights , crowd is huge over the place. Good place to hang out in evening ! Can also go for cruise dinner there .

Great skyline for Kowloon. The Hong Kong is excellent from Kowloon and especially so when the laser show is on. I believe that this is the better side to see the show and to see the magnificent lights of Hong Kong. A extra special way to see the skyline and the laser show is to catch a ferry from either Kowloon or Hong Kong just as the laser show is starting. Make sure that you sit up top on the star Ferry. The shyline also looks great from Victoria Peak.
Night lights. Go anytime at night to see the lights, they are worth seeing alone, the light show at 8pm was a fizzer.

A fabulous view!. For the best possible view, in my opinion, go to the harbour area between the Ocean Terminal in Canton Road and the Tsim Sha Tsui Star Ferry Terminal. The light show starts at 8pm and lasts around 15 minutes. You can hear the water lapping and the view is breathtaking, whether the light show is on or at other times.
Worth sitting and admiring it. Make use of the promenade and get a seat around 730pm for the light show. While the show is nothing spectacular, it makes for a good relaxing evening!
One of the most incredible skylines in the world. Hong Kong harbor and it's skyline are worth the trip to Hong Kong! Take lots of pictures! You will cherish that view!

Fantastic. Just like one sees in the photos - and more. It would be even more perfect if there was no smog - which wasn't the case when we were there, unfortunately. Make sure you look at both sides - as from Kowloon and from HK island

Working &leisure. Hong Kong still a beautiful Cosmopolitan city Full Of changingI travel here from long time but HK AND alwAys i found something New AND amazing thinghs To doFood AND People are greats

Skyline to Capture the Imagination. Hong Kong skyline is excellent to view both by day & night there is a light show at 8pm each night which is great to view from Kowloon. Also worth viewing from the Peak with an Audio guide of all the buildings

under expectation!. We expected it to be amazing full of lights and melondy and but it was just above satisfying. The people were punshing their way to see the lights! some oragainzing could be done about it.
