Super View !!!. We went there around 7:30am, the view was fantastic. We clicked some exotic pictures from this locations. There is a walk-able stretch & park which you can enjoy. Loved this view in HongKong
Better View. The lights at night at Victoria Harbour usually provide a good background. The clarity of the skyline is not important to provide interesting images.
Always mesmerizing. The best and cheapest way to see it is on the Star Ferry - do a day passage and a night passage to see the the city in the day and night. Cost only US 40 cents per way.

Amazing. To say Hong Kong's skyline is horrible especially during the day, has not seen it light up at night, its a thing of beautiful, it left me in awe just to see how it can change, well worth getting a ferry at night and checking it out
a visit not to bb emissed. Hong Kong is full of skyskrapers and it is worthwhile to visit one of them and this is a good place to start

One of the world's iconic views!. I arrived before dusk to set up my camera on a tripod. Just along from the Star Ferry terminal is a double storey open set of viewing areas where you can watch the lights come up over the city. Amazing!

Beautiful skyline. I've been to Hong Kong a few times and I never get sick of seeing their skyline. It's best to go at night when it's lit up. They have a daily light show at 8pm and I suggest going at 730 to get a good spot.

Hong Kong from the harbour. A must see from a boat trip round the harbour. On Saturday a spectacular free light show best seen from the water. Book a trip on a boat (about 330 HK dollars per person and enjoy free drinks whilst sailing slowly round the harbour. A fantastic experience not to be missed.

Iconic postcard view. Unique. Unmissable. The Harbour view is a must for any visitor to Hong Kong. Recommend the Avenue of Stars on the Kowloon side. Take your photos with the Hong Kong Island as a backdrop.The tour buses full of loud, ill-mannered mainland Chinese are starting to get a bit tiresome these days, but otherwise a great place for a stroll.At 8 pm every evening there is a sound and light show. Worth a look if you haven't seen it yet. But it is getting a bit tame, especially on a gloomy day. Much better on a special day with added fireworks. But very crowded.Ferry trip across the Harbour is also a must - cheap and authentic experience.

Night time at the peak! . a definite must when in HK. After queuing for just over an hour to go up in the evening we arrived at the top around 9. The trip up is good. View is on your right hand side so grab a seat there if it's free.The view was great seeing the HK lights and skyline. We looked around and went away from the mall for a bait for a better view. We stayed until around 11 after looking around the mall although the ships are the same as all the other malls in HK. We had dinner at woodfire which was good as we had a window seat. I think a definite must when in HK.

Boring... dont get the hype. One of the first activities we did when we landed in HKG, but I have to say it was far behind the expectations....We were at the avenue of stars to try to catch the symphony of lights, but failed, as there were only a couple of weak lights shining...My HKG friend later told me that they have kinda slacked with this symphony of lights thing after the umbrella protest (not sure if it's true).Overall, you can go there, but dont expect much.

one of the iconic cityscapes. amazing skyline - very impressive during the day - i though it was best viewed from kowloon island - but breathtaking by night. the laser and light show was a marvel to see. during the day a live band were playing the the atmosphere was very relaxed and friendly
Beautiful at its best. A beautiful place to visit this time of the year. The buss is great. The weather was perfect. Just walking yourself tired is worth it.

What a beautiful city one of the best skylines in the world. We stayed at the Ritz Carlton on the 109th floor so we woke up every day to this spectacular sight and then got seconds in the evening with all the beautiful lights. Absolutely stunning.

Spectacular!. Wow, just take the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island (or the other way). For like a dime you get one of the finest views in the world. Or at night, stand on the shore on one of the many pretty walkways and see the light show where all the buildings flash on and off in many colors, while lasers and music play!

Avoid the nightly light show. The skyline is incredible to look at rising from the harbour in but the 8pm light show should be avoided - its nothing more than a ten minute effort of some lasers and dodgy 80's music and not impressive. If you have the time walk down there after its finished or alternatively find somewhere to eat with a view.
Nice skyline. Always love the skyline from Tsim sa tsui looking out to HK island, especially during Christmas season. Laser light show is dated and unimpressive though..

A truly stunning sight.... The skyline of Hong Kong harbour at night is truly beautiful. Whether you perch yourself at one of the many bars or restaurants or take a dinner cruise, it's just really pretty.

One of the best in the world !. It is hard to describe such a stunning sight as the HK skyline at night (or during the day) ! It represents the water (the deep harbour was the initial attraction to enable what HK is today) , the growth and success of this amazing City through its buildings and the light which gives hope and reward to those who love it and those who were either brought up here or have come to reside here through work or passion.Take the Star Ferry both ways to enjoy the atmosphere of a brilliant Skyline.
Must see. Fantastic view from the Victoria harbour. It is one of the best skyline in Asia. The visit was even more relaxing as we were there during winter when the weather was cool and pleasant.

Beautiful skyline. No doubt stunning views of an incredible skyline. Even better if you're watching the sun set over the city. Stayed for the 8pm light show, which was pretty average and a little disappointing.

Romance adventure Excitement all rolled into one. Lots of cities ,towns have lights ,light shows and fab skylines but really Hong Kong beats the lot!!!!!!to take the Star Ferry at 8 pm any evening is like experiencing a Festival !!!!!!The skyline darts into life with a multi colour,media mad show One can walk along the "Prom' or sail on the straits ,dine on a floating restaurant or just stand gazing from Street corners An amazing SHOW
try and catch the evening laser light show- Its free. every night the harbour is lit u with amazing light shows on some of the skyscrapers.One good location is at the IFC mall on Hong Kong side

See the Christmas decorations. If you are in Hong Kong at this time of the year it's a must to go TST and see the Christmas decorations along Victoria Harbor. On a clear day it's fantastic. After Christmas the Chinese New Year decorations will come.
Pretty but overrated. Was nice to watch, honestly it doesn't matter what language you see it in. Recommend walking the harbour front afterwards.

A BIRDS EYE VIEW. I have been to the Empire State building in N Y C to see a fantastic skyline but that is nothing compared to Hong Kong Skyline which is best viewed from Victoria Peak, what a view it is looking out over Hong Kong tall buildings some with roof top gardens and even Bar-B-Que areas but most of all it shows not only the density of the population but the harmony in which the live, it is true what is said about Hong Kong it is the melting pot of Asia with a skyline that depicts that diversity of the whole Island, you look from Victoria Peak and you see the influence of of the past & the direction of the future and if you study the skyline carefully you will see all this and more, take your time and watch it change as the day passes into night, you will leave Hong Kong but the view of Hong Kong's skyline will never leave you. It is a great wonder of this world
Over-rated Laser lights show. Skyline is beautiful, but was disappointed with the laser light show. Felt it was over-rated having read the reviews on here.

It looks terrific at first. Photos of Hong Kong always show masses of high rises jammed together on the Island side of the harbor, with towering buildings on the Kowloon side. Well, it's really quite a site at first, but once you look closely, few of the buildings are truly distinguished. Compare it to the significant buildings in Sao Paulo...the Copan, Hotel Unique, etc. Once you start to really see the massive apartmentdevelopments that most Hong Kong residents live out their life in, much of skyline is architecturally uninteresting, and a times drab. The vast housing estates are monotonous.A few unusual building dot the shores on both sides of harbor. Unusual, eye-catching but not always good buildings. Hong Kong has energetic land reclamation programs, which insure more undistinguished buildings will be blocking the ones presently along the water. Sorry to be the one who doesn't go along with the crowd on this. But do want to be on the level.The sum is more than the parts here. So don't look to closely.
one of the most stunning views in the world. You must go to Hong Kong - the HK skyline must be one of the best in the world :) .....Night or Day, it is equally stunning

best at night for light show at 8pm. Stroll across the bay on the Kowloon side for the best view of the light show but either side lights up the night ! More interesting if you can be 10 floors up above the walkway

One of the best night time views anywhere . Go to Kowloon on the Star Ferry and head right out of the ferry terminal exit. Walk for 2 to 3 minutes and you will be rewarded with some of the most stunning views of the city.If you time it right then you will catch the laser light show on the hour at 8 and 9pm.Pictures give a good idea as to what you can see but only going here in person will do it justice. Don't miss this when in HK, after all its free!!
Simply Beautiful. Go in the evening to view the Avenue of Stars, Bruce Lee's statue and than enjoy the skyline for a postcard view at night. The colours are a treat to the eyes!

Beautiful Skyline. One of the most beautiful skylines I have ever seen and a visit to Hong Kong would not be complete without a visit to Victoria Harbour to see the skyline. It is even better looking out from Victoria Peak.
Excellent View. One of the best views in the world. We enjoyed the skyline from our cruise ship, Starr Ferry, hotel room and hotel lounge - all slightly different all great.

Amazing!. A must visit for everyone who goes to Hong Kong and definitely a no.1 visit of Hong Kong. Amazing and Breath taking view made possible more so, by the Hong Kong Administration. Will recommend for everyone who goes to the place.Choose night time and a cloudless night.

See it, day and night. No visit to Hong Kong would be complete without a visit to Victoria Harbour to see the skyline. It truly is a sight to behold (and photograph!)If you didn't bring your camera, there are many photographers along the shoreline who will photograph you and make a print on the spot (for a fee).Make sure this is on your list!
Amazing. Is the most amazing skyline I've seen!!!! Loved it. And at this time of the year has Xmas decorations!
Hundreds of lights at the hong kong harbour. A little far way but you could still get some good pics. We also saw the famous sail boat with the red sails. Very posh area of hong kong
great. amazing skyline. one of the best in the world. great to crab a coffee or drink and walk and mesmerize
A great place. Visit the harbour area near the Golden Bauhinia square for a spectacular view of the light show held at 8 o'clock in the evening.

Almost as beautiful as the Seattle Skyline.. Enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the Cucina restaurant at the Marco Polo hotel. Sat outdoors with a gorgeous view of the water and skyline. Watched the laser show from our table. Beautiful skyline with lots of thebuilding lights themed for the Christmas season.
Amazing Skyline . I think took the Skyline in the night, morning, afternoon but also when the sun go down in the back great photos.
Stunning! . Well worth the view. It's beautiful to see the city of Hong Kong. So many buildings, so high & so spectacular. This is an amazing city which is expressed on the skyline.
Mesmerising lights. it is always a beautiful sight watching the HK skyline from Kowloon. We had kids with us and they enjoyed the light and sound show in the evening. The HSBC building is the best

Colours of the night .... The skyline looks vibrant with colourful lights. The best part is this amazing scenery is free. You can just stand at the opposite side of the new territories to enjoy the skyline or you can be on a boat.

Awesome view. We had an amazing view from our room at InterContinental Hotel! The skyline is mesmerizing at night! My husband and I got one of the many stationed professional photographers to take our picture (Cash only). There's a symphony lights show that starts at 8 and runs for 14-15 minutes. There's no music accompaniment to this. But unfortunately, the symphony lights show can be missed. The Bellagio water show in Las Vegas is definitely way better.

A lot different from not too long ago.. The Hong Kong skyline was predominately dominated by the distinctive Bank of China tower ( the one with the triangular framing ) , the first building outside of North America to top out at over 1000ft. It held its distinction as the most recognizable building of Hong Kong throughout the 90s until a spur of growth as Hong Kong became to emerge as one the top financial centers in Asia.The skyline began to give way to even taller, grander buildings in the 2000s, in timing as China's economy began develop. I'm not the biggest fan of financial and banking cartels, but they sure do build some impressive work spaces for all to gawk upon as they stare down on the 99.99% from 100 story high builds. Never the less Hong Kong's skyline has become one of the worlds most impressive, even surpassing Manhattan's in terms of density and setting behind the mountains of Hong Kong Island.The best views are from the Avenue of Stars, the Star Ferry & from Victoria Peak. There is a nightly light show called Symphony of Lights in the evening but to many failed to live up what long exposure photos depict of the event. Watch it if it fits your convenience but its not worth it to go out of your way to catch.

Excellent iconic skyline at night. I never tire at seeing the Honk Kong Syline at night dominated by the Bank of China Tower that is lit up in lines and instantly recognisable. I am sorry to say that the area has been modernised so much that much of its old charm has been lost. I have been many times but the first time 40 years ago saw many junks plying their wares in the harbour but now there is not one. Many of the old shops and shopping streets have been torn down and replaced with high rise apartments. Prices are now equal to any other high end city. RIP old colonial Honkers

Amazing sight. Recently fulfilled a life long dream and visited Hong Kong. Arrived at the YMCA Salisbury Hotel late afternoon just as it was getting dark, opened the door to our harbour view room, and there was this awesome spectacle outside the window. Spent 10 nights and every night I stood and just stared out of the window.
Magnificent. Look across the harbour to Kowloon at night, take the Star Ferry to Tsim Sha Sui and gaze at the Island skyscrapers. Incredible urban sight.
Colourful. The least that you can say it's a very colourful experience. The downside... It's like watching a never ending commercial.

One of the best skylines on the planet!. The Hong Kong skyline is one of the most amazing on the planet! The sheer magnitude of the place between HK and Kowloon on the other side, the variety and quantity of skyscrapers, the river/harbor, and the mountains all make for a venue that MUST be on your bucket list. If you don't like crowds or cities this won't be your cup of tea but it is awe inspiring and jaw dropping just see it!

face of hongkong. its the face of hongkong.any where you go its skyline is not to be missed by your eyes.worth a look especialy in the night with all the lightings and special effects adding to the spectacular view.
Truly Amazing. Hong Kong has a memorable skyline either during the day or at night. But certainly the night is clearly the most beautifully amazing.

"A view to die for". Bestie and I arrive at night at the Salisbury hotel HK. For me this is return visit one year on to the Salisbury but for bestie our return HK girls trip seems a long time ago.It was. As I approach the desk l am hoping for an upgrade to a harbour view room.(Dream on I hear you say.) Bestie is half asleep and eyeing off the lobby sofas but I don't say a word. Yes! Welcome back (a good start).Yes! Your room is ready. My hopes are raised when a discreet conversation takes place between the polite and polished staff.Bestie is oblivious but I don't say a word.Your room number ladies is eleven forty five.we will show you to your room and bring your luggage straight up.The lift door opens and our room is directly in front of us the room door is held open in we go.I don't say a word.Bestie is by now admiring the commodious surrounds.Moody quiet HK tones of cigar,black,and silver, two comfortable emaculately made beds, sleek and stylish table lamps a more than adequate bathroom Check,Check,Check! Would we like the drapes open? I feel a Wow moment coming.Yes please and with one deft swich of multiple layers of beautiful fabrics the glimmering sparkle of HongKong's magnificent harbour is directly in front of us. Bestie is gob smacked.A full harbour view room ours to enjoy for a week.Skyline views to die for where's the champagne? Yes we have some and the ice bucket and two flutes will be right up! That cite sky scape never fails to impress.Loved it.The red sails of the junk drifts past nightly,the light show the spectacular fire works (who else knew we were coming?) All were enjoyed from our eleventh floor cocoon. Spectacular is an understatement. Love Hong Kong! Loved staying at the Salisbury.
Music and light-colours!. In the evening, one can enjoy the beauty of Honk Kong skyline watching the dance of colour lights on it, while listening beautiful melodies from different countries.

the rule is: the locals will break the ferry queue. Prepare to wait a good half an hour, 45 mins, to get on the ferry that will take you to the tour. While waiting, make sure there won't be a huge chinese tourist group breaking the line right in front of you, so that you'll get on the boat on time. Otherwise you're good to wait another 45min. On the boat and if the weather is good go for the upper deck. The tour is beautiful but not impressive. I'd give it a good 7,5-8/10.
Skyline. HK Skyline seen from the north side of the harbour is beautiful. Go there in the evening, look at the people and relax with the enlighted skyscrapers in the background!
As good as any you will view... Well, it's another skyline.. If you're on the Promenade to view it, it's worth a shot but don't bother going to the Peak viewing deck for it.
Don't miss the laser show!. Sit on the Kowloon island side and watch the strong laser lights that flash across the sea with music. This happens every night! Worth a watch!

Walking up The Peak to catch the Hong Kong Skyline view on a clear day!. My experience to enjoy the Hong Kong Skyline view is from the Victoria Peak, commonly known as "The Peak". Our flight was 4pm out of HK, so after breakfast at 830am, we decided to take the nature walking trail up the Peak. Starting from MacDonnell Road and the Peak Tram Lane, we ascend the walking trail in steady pace by crossing Bowen Road onto Clovelly Path. Walk across May Road, we proceed to the nature walking trail (next to public toilet) up the Peak. The scenery of HK skyline transforms from close-up view of apartment buildings to sky scrapers and office towers crowding both shores of Victoria Harbor. Just enjoy this amazing view through the opening gaps between the tall trees along the trail. Walking along Barker Road towards the Peak, we finally reached the base of Peak's viewing tower in 45 minutes. After a short coffee break at Starbucks café, we decided to take a slow 45-minute walk around the Peak's tree-lined path and had the 360 degree panorama view of HK skyline unveil before us. After walking round the Peak, we took the 8-minute journey tram ride (fare HK28 per person) down and stop at MacDonnell. We get to experience a very pleasant walk up the Peak, enjoy the amazingly panoramic HK skyline and the tram ride all in just slightly 2 hours return!

Tough to beat the view. I've seen the HOng Kong Skyline on numerous occasions, Chinese new year, western new year, random nights, and it never fails to wow. There's no other cities in the world like Hong Kong built up to the extent that it is and literally right on the harbour front, it is quite spectacular
Star Ferry view. small amount of money to go Star Ferry to/from Korloon and Hong Kong Island the sky line views are spectacular, especially at night

Truly Iconic. The Hong Kong Skyline is like nothing else. I enjoyed it from the Marco Polo club, Cucina restaurant (which I highly recommend) and the Star Ferry on a regular basis for a week. I've seen it from the top of Victoria's Peak in the past as well - whatever you do, get a chance to relax and watch this at sunset and at night. You will not be disappointed.
Fantastic View. Great place to just hang out and watch everything go by - especially the light show that is on every night.

Losing its lights. Visited HK 15 years ago and the Victoria Harbour was a sight to behold. 15 years later, the boisterous lights have diminished significantly and the smog spoilt the view tremendously. No longer a must visit place on earth. The symphony of lights event much touted by the hk tourism board is a laughing stock. Waste of time and effort. It was supposedly a 15 minute show but you can see people started leaving 5 minutes into the show. That is an indication of how bad it is. If you do not have the time, don't bother to make time for the daily 8pm show so called.
A must see. you have to go to see the skyline . .best done in the evening in clear weather (if possible) 8 o'clock there's a light show really impressive...

Dazzling skyline in a beautiful city. It's clear why Hong Kong Skyline is one of the best things to do in Hong Kong. At night all the buildings light up and the lights reflect off the water creating a beautiful view. I would highly recommend going on Star Ferry at night to get a really great view across the water. It's super cheap.

Amazing skyline. A view like nothing I'd ever seen! By day it is hazy but all the buildings are amazing to see. At night it comes alive and I found the light show at night a little disappointing. I was expecting much more but I'm glad I've seen it.

One of the most beautiful bay in the world they say.... ... and it is probably true by day or by night, especially with these lighting show from night time... this is really nice
From Kowloon side of course, whether just walking outside or seating at one of the nice bars or restaurant overlooking the bay... just enjoy
Nice skyline!. Better than Chicago or New York! Great views....try to take a harbor cruise. Star ferry if you are on a budget, else you can try Aquolulo boat tours
Iconic. I may be biased, having spent many happy years in Hong Kong, but the skyline has to be one of the most spectacular views in the world!
Impressive skyline . As someone who comes from a very small country I did enjoy just sitting and watching the massive skyline of Hong Kong island.
Great Skyline. Great skyline with beautiful and decorated buildings. Best to be seen from Victoria Peak, Harbour Cruise and from Tsim Tsha Tsui promenade.

Spectacular view poor lighting show. We were waiting for that "spectacular" light show for more than half an hour. The street was really crowdy but when the light show started at 8pm I was just like - Thats all??
Amazing!. Take the star ferry great views day and night but so pretty in the evening. Can also get great views from Victoria Peak.
Gorgeous, don't miss it!. We saw it from various vantage points - the Ritz-Carlton's top floors offer a particularly great viewpoint!
Very impressive. It's amazing how many colorfull building you can see. During the morning you can get very good photos because is not very foggy.
So beautiful!. This view is incredible! Worth it to go to and see while in Hong Kong. I would make sure to see this for sure

An unique spot. It's very spectacular to see during night. Each evening at 8 o'clock begins The Symphony of Lights. All the skyscrapers become more colorful, with lasers and different hi-tech images. It's breathtaking.
Fantastic. This is the most amazing skyline I have seen, even more so than NY. But there is no light show worth the name visible from Kowloon, maybe it has been suspended?

World renowned. One of the most recognizable skylines on the planet. Quite the sight from the TST promenade or Central area, also fantastic from the Peak. Light show in the evening's was not what I expected but just as happy to leisurely enjoy the view.

3 dimension views. Bought ticket on site, the place is overcrowded but managed properly. The view is the best for Hong Kong! Once on the viewing deck take fotos and a few minutes of taking in the illumination of bright lights. Worth the visit for only less than an hour.
Great skyline day in or night wonderful experience. It was a wonderful experience day or night had fun on my way to macau or from observatory or causeway wonderful skyline

Simply Stunning. We were staying at the Holiday Inn Golden mile but met friends who were staying at at the Intercontinental for evening drinks where the view across Victoria Harbour to Hong Kong is just simply stunning. If you have time go to the Lobby Lounge for drinks and enjoy the view.

Amazing. No words or pictures can describe this amazing skyline..something that must be seen to believe!
Avoid going on weekends though, busy of course..went in the middle of the week too and was much easier to find a perfect spot to see the symphony of lights..

Another must do . Take the MTR or Ferry to Kowloon and look back at the Hong Kong Central skyline at night, it's amazing. Also recommend going up to Eyebar for a cocktail and enjoying the view from there outdoor patio, you will not be disappointed!
Certainly worth a look. The Hong Kong Skyline was on the bucket list to see as one of the most iconic. We saw it from a harbour cruise which is not necessarily the best way to see it I think.

Amazing!. We are so glad we had the opportunity to see this spectacular view across the harbour. The colourful lights were amazing and it looked so pretty. Its quite breathtaking. Hope to have the opportunity to see it again.

The city light and shyline is better than the laser show. Basically you go to Kowloon to view the Hong Kong city for all that is known in pictures. At night around 8 the lights come out to give you a show of its grandeur.They have closed the Walk of Stars but still save a small area for people to watch the show. The HK city light is better, IMO. I actually stayed at the Inter-continental Hotel, next to the Harbor.

Great views. Reach there early in the evening grab a place to sit it gets crowded when the symphony of lights is about to start.Spent 2 hrs there doing nothing just clicking away the skyline and gazing at the views.
Sound and light. Nice to see, its free!Dont expect too much!20:00 daily, come early so you can get a good and convenient place to sit!
Nothing much to see. Coming from an ultra urban country, Hong Kong skyline is nothing new and in fact a usually scenery. The lights for the buildings at night is the only attraction if you ask me.

Remarkable. This is the best landscape you can see in HKIt's an outstanding festival of colors and lights.Even being crowded at night, still a romantic place to finish your night after a dinner, or a drink

Lovely sight but not the best !. Reached Tsim sha Sui via ferry from Landmark . .. we came adoring the skyline right from elevated pathway from the landmark and through the ferry .. Ferry was cheap , 3 HKD per person ! Weather was just perfect in third week of November ... Ferry wheel added to the beauty of the sight... But not the best one , still Shanghai rates higher than this.
No other skyline like it. I stop by the harbour on TST side each time I visit HK. Go early or late at night to avoid the crowds of tourists and stare out at this beautiful skyline.

Immersive nighttime experience. After having dinner in Yao Ma Tei, we took the MTR to Tsim Sha Tsui station and walked (a lot) under we reached the skyline view. It was Halloween so there was noticeably a lot of people there. The view was amazing! The entire nighttime view of Hong Kong was like a glowing gem. It takes a while for the immersive experience to sink in, so I recommend that you do not rush to go and leave. You should take things slowly and admire the marvellous view and let it all sink in. Unfortunately for us, because of the Halloween festivities, we didn't stay for very long since it was very crowded and noisy. But it is definitely worth visiting and admiring the spectre of the Hong Kong skyline.
Absolutely stunning. This is my favourite skyline in the world. Absolutely stunning. A more spectacular view is hard to find!

Lovely. On a high floor of the Peninsula Hotel, facing the harbor, the view was lovely at all times of day. At night there were perhaps too many lights for my camera, but we still loved the view. In the morning haze as well. I took many photos.
Beautiful View. One of the best Skylines I ever seen. You can see this skuline far from the noisy and confused Hong Kong.... From this point Hong Kong seems to be silent and quiet

pre dinner Sunset tour was delightful. Cruising Victoria Harbour on a pre-dinner sunset tour was a great way to see the lights of Hong Kong. The 90 minute cruise provided insights into the development of the waterfront of HK. November can be a bit chilly when the sun goes down so a scarf and jacket may help.
Amazing . Have to say as beautiful as it looks in the photos! definitely worth having a little stroll to get this shot!

The view never gets old especially at night time. Been to Hong kong twice. Always enjoy the walk along the promenade and view towards Hk Island. Some old style illuminated boats on the water really add to the
fascinating scenery. Just about rivals New york Manhattan's skylines.
What a view!. We enjoyed an organised tour which helped us to see the most amazing views both during the day and early evening. We took a boat ride down the river which was delightful.

One of the best in the world. The impressive skyline comes to life each night, thanks to the intricately choreographed Symphony of Lights. The skyline is one of the most spectacular cityscapes of the world.
Symphony of Light. Go to Kowloon side and every day at 8 pm you can enjoy amazing light show to 50 HK Skyscapers. It's a must when you're in Hong Kong👍😉

Beautiful and Busy. The views are beautiful, and both locals and expatriates were there to enjoy the sights and have their photos taken against the skyline. The lights on Hong Kong Island are remarkable -- really a place to stop and enjoy when you're in Hong Kong.

Best in Asia!!. This is the first thing I did upon moving to Hong Kong and I was not disappointed. Wow!! Best to go late afternoon and spend the late day at the Peak and watch the transition to night. Spectacular. Plus you get a great view of the 8pm Laser Show!! We were lucky, as it was a very clear day. Expect lines if you are taking the tram up the hill. You can also take a taxi, but much more expensive. Plenty of restaurants at the top if you want to relax and have a drink and eat.
View of HK. Basically you go to Kowloon to view the Hong Kong city for all that is known in pictures. At night around 8 the lights come out to give you a show of its grandeur.
Surely one of the Wonders of the Modern World. Just stunning. unbelievable...words fail me ! Why did I leave it so long before seeing it? I can't think that anyone will see it and not be impressed
Breathtalking scene in HK. Went to see HK Skyline both during day time and night time. It's both beautiful in different ways. At 8 pm - 8.15 pm daily, should come to see the Symphony of Lights.

Only go if you have time. The star show was pretty lame for me. And during that time there'll be too many people watching it's crowded. But after the light show is over it still makes a good photo opportunity
One of the more impressive skylines. There is a light show every night (around 8 or 8:30 I think). Find a restaurant with a reasonable view and its great.

Impressive. I've seen many skylines throughout the world but nothing as impressive as the HK skyline. Make sure to catch the lights display every evening (around 20:00) from the Kowloon side. It's a fantastic show!

A must see in Hong Kong. Amazing view of the river and buildings, especially at night. At 8PM every night watch a cool light show with music and all. Especially recommended to see from the star ferry, many buildings shining in the moonlight with the right weather (best Oct- Dec) its a really nice and relaxing experience. At the piers you can have your photos taken (with the skyline on the background) and printed - though not so cheap - around 10-20 HK dollars a photo (depends on the size)

Beautiful views of a wonderful city. Please note: My 5 stars are for the views and the skyline itself, not the attractions to view it from!! The views of this city from several spots are beautiful. I would definitely recommend The Peak on a good, clear day. We went up around 4pm to see the daylight views, and stayed to watch the sunset and have a good view of the city lights, too. Wonderful evening trip! I'd also recommend visiting Red Bar in the IFC for another beautiful view over to Kowloon side from Central. There's also The Ritz bar in ICC which I would not recommend. It's overpriced ($HK100 a beer at the cheapest!) and, for us, the windows were so dirty you couldn't even see out. Perhaps we went on a bad day, but I can't imagine the view is any better here than from The Peak anyway. There's also a few other bars in Kowloon to view over to Central side, and a walk along the harbour will provide beautiful views, too.
Beautiful!. This was a sesnsational skyline - the best I have seen thus far! I would recommend going just before sunset to the promenade1!

One of the bucket list views in the world. I spent 4 months in Hong Kong staying at a hotel on the harbour and you never get sick of the view of the harbour. By night, or day it is always a hive of activity and beauty. At night enjoy the laser shows over the water and bouncing off the tops of buildings or watch the ever changing light show on the sides of the 100 story international commerce tower, or walk along the Avenue Of Stars and enjoy the local buskers and the view.

Gotta Check It Out. When in Hong Kong, a view of the Hong Kong Island skyline at night is worth a look. Symphony of Lights starts at 20:00 every night, though I personally wasn't overly impressed by the light show. Like any major metropolis, any view of the glimmering nighttime skyline is always going to be a popular thing to see.

One of the best sky lines. Viewed from the Kowloon side Hong Kong sky line is always a treat to see. They have a light show that goes off at 8pm but watching the buildings changed colours never gets boring for me.
Beautiful. Here's a little gem for you. Check this out from the Icon hotel's 52 floor restaurant/bar. It will be a dinner you'll never forget

Nothing more beautiful than the HK skyline. If you are visiting Hong Kong and the sky is blue and clear sight then you must see the beautiful skyline from the Peak. I recommend you to go to the peak by taxi if you have limited time but if you have enough time queue up for the peak tramway ride of 3 minutes with easily an hour waiting time to get up. But once there do visit the terrace and take the headset and device to listen and understand what you are seeing. It is really worthwhile.Have a nice lunch or dinner if you want to see the skyline by night in one of the many places to have dinner in whatever cuisine of choice
A must see but the light show is weak.. A trip up the peak in the day and a view from Kowloon at night will give you all the views that you will need.

View of civilization. Ok, So depend on the weather, and what kind of traveler are you , I can judge you will enjoy it or not! but from 0 to 10 , 9 you will like it, that's a civilization amazing view . simple like that

One of the only cities with two skylines -- both world class. This is a city with two skylines -- the Hong Kong Island skyline viewed from Kowloon, and the Kowloon skyline viewed from Hong Kong's waterfront or from Victoria Peak. The buildings are amazing, including the 88 story IFC building on Hong Kong Island and the ICC building (108 floors) in Kowloon. Other iconic buildings include HSBC's Headquarters (many people don't know that the name "HSBC" stands for Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation) and the Bank of China building, as well as the convention center, and, on the Kowloon side, the iconic Clock Tower and adjacent museums.See it both in the daytime and at night, and also from the Star Ferry or one of the tour boats available (including the Star Ferry boat tours). At 8PM every night there is a light show on both sides of the harbor with the music/narration broadcast on FM radio and on speakers near the harborfront.
Amazing. Highlight of any trip to Hong Kong has to be the skyline. Spectacular in the daylight but out of this world at night time.
Stunning at night. Best seen from The Peak in the evening. A must in any trip to HK although be prepared for the crowds queuing up for bus or trams

One of the most beautiful skylines in the world. I travelled a lot and have to state that HK skyline is breathtaking from Kowloon waterfront and as well from Victoria Peak. Spent nearly every evening at Kowloon waterfront, there is an elevated deck, ca 75 m long, sit down get your camera ready and at 20:00 they have a stunning 15 minutes laser/light show with music called "Symphony of lights", not to miss!!!

See the lights. Would recommend you get there at least 19H15 to 19h30 to be able to get a view of the short light show that starts at 8PM. Was not as good as I expected but still something you can do at least once.

Spectacular view. It had very nice view of Hong Kong. The lights in the night and the laser show are good. Good to take star ferry (HKD 2.5 on weekdays and HKD 3.4 on weekends for upper deck) to enjoy this amazing view.
Great views of HK harbour from ferries. The guidebooks are right! The best value ferry you will ever buy, in the world. Fantastic cross harbour views in all weather.

Once of the Great Wonders of the World. What a view. I have been told that the Hong Kong nightime view is regarded as one of the best in the world and I cannot deny it - it's fantastic.
Millions of lights in every colour you can think of, as far as the eye can see.

Well worth seeing but laser show not what it is cracked up to be.. We had plenty of time on our hands so we went across to Kowloon on the Star Ferry just at the onset of dusk. As it got darker, more and more commercial buildings switched their lights on and it was all very attractive.Announcements proclaimed the music and laser show at 8pm so we stayed for that but in our opinion it was not what it was cracked up to be. The music lasted for about 10 minutes and a few green lasers beamed from the top of a couple of buildings. It was not the climax we expected but the illuminated buildings were the stars of the evening.There is a large viewing area on the Kowloon side but the seats and walls are hard to sit on for any length of time. We would still recommend anybody visiting Hong Kong to see the lights in the evening but don't expect to be overwhelmed.
Beautiful Night View. Beautiful night view. Wait till 8pm for the light show and get ready to capture the photos of the show. Might get windy around the evening.

What a view!. We did a harbour trip along the skyline at night and have to say wow! I enjoyed this almost as much as I enjoyed the New York harbour boat trip. The colours are amazing the view is stunning. I would really recommend this to everyone that visits Hong Kong, it's well worth the time and effort.

The best part of Hong Kong. The Iconic Hong Kong skyline never tires me. I can watch it from every vantage point, whether it's during the day or at night. One can't help but enjoy the view from every angle.

Its Hong Kong's Skyline its timeless. Hong Kong Skyline is as timeless as the New York Skyline and Golden Gate Bridge. Its a great view on a clear day and it reminds me of all of the action HK movies that open up to it. Even hollywood movies use it so you know where the action is.
What Hong Kong is known for.... Beautiful lights and colors - esp. around the holidays. Has almost a Blade Runner feeling. It doesn't get old.
Must see. Find one of the high rise bars or restaurants and drink in the view....its a must do if you are in hong kong

Exciting and unique. By day or night it's well worth taking a few minutes at least to take a walk or sit on the Kowloon side to view the skyscraper of this very modern city. At night the lightshow is worth seeing from the viewing platform around 8 and 9 pm, but don't go because it is spectacularly set to music, because it is interesting and the music is somewhat incidental, the lasers on top of two of the towers make the greatest impression. It's the cheapest spectacle in HK.

One of the best views ever. Stant on the mainland, looking towards the island, the view is awesome, 8pm has a "light show" that is a bit underwhelming, but the view of the shoreline, day or night, is amazing.
Great view. get the star ferry across from the central pier for 2 HKD and take in what is surely one of the best cityscapes on the planet.
Lovely views. Enjoyed the beautiful views along the skyline..a must for those visiting HongKong.Gets a little windy and cool late evenings.

We went on tours of the city and enjoyed the scenery and did some shopping.The restaurant in the hotel was very good .. We took a taxi and went on the Star Ferry to Kowloon. We took a gray line tour and went to Victoria Peak on the funicular tram. The views were stunning.
Mesmerising. A view from where you dont want to take your eyes off. It is just amazing and kudos to the local authorities for making this such a spectacle
awesome. personally i love that spot. harbour city is perfect to dwell and browse through shops or dine at some of the restos, and in the evening enjoy the lightshow at 8pm
Amazing!. Incredible day or night! We had a great view from our hotel at night and great view from the Peak in the day!!!

One of the greatest Skylines of the world. A must in Hong Kong is a boat tour at night over the sea between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon after sunset. A great atmosphere specially for people in love... ;-)
Man's greatest achievement . Literally the best skyline in the world. Hands Down. Check out the Kowloon side at 7pm for the HK light show where all the buildings come alive in a synchronized show.
Beatiful view at night. We loved the view and could not get enough of walking along the harbor with the stars hand prints - the view at night was just exceptional - like no other.

Awesome views.. The day we went up, they had a private function, which meant our we got a discount on the tickets because the East side was not available.Spent about an hour up here, great to have some food and a drink while taking in the views.It was a great day HK, truly amazing views, well worth the 60 sec lift ride up. Going down was cool.The lift had some cool lights in it.Would be cool at night time.

Come at 7pm to get a seat for the 8pm light show. I happened to be in the Kowloon waterfront promenade area after taking the Star ferry over from Central (must take!). And decided to just sit down at the promenade to chill. It became more crowded as more people came to wait for the light show, so I would advise you to come a little earlier.The light show is not fantastic but I do like the atmosphere and it's worth just absorbing it and the evening wind while you contemplate life or chat with your friends (:
Awesome!. Just incredible, best view ever! You have to be there, photos cannot do it justice. Get the light show it just comes alive and the junks sail past.

Awesome !!!. Lovely view ! Especially from the Observatory Deck of the Peak. We stayed in Hotel Panorama by Rhombus (which was a tall 40 floor hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui area of Kowloon) and the view from the hotel terrace was also amazing !

The beauty of HK.. as always. The view is only getting better and nicer over time..Spectacular view! If you are views catcher, you may spend hours catching every single building and its structure.Pearl of Asia!

So pretty. If you are ever in Hong Kong, you should totally take the effort to take a picture (bring a DSLR or actual camera if possible as smartphones are useless at night) because it's just really pretty

One of the best city skyline both at day and at night.. Because of the backdrop of Victoria Peak, skyscrapers from waterfront to mid mountain and the constant traffic in the harbour, this is one of the most impressive city skyline in the world, both in the day time and at night. For the first time visitor, it is worth taking the ferries to zig-zag across, and don't forget your camera.
Amazing view. So heavenly, remember to get the right spot to take pictures, but you might need to fight for it. Haha!

One of the most spectacular I've seen . Looking at the view over Victoria Bay from the Kowloon side is just too beautiful for words. By 6pm the lights slowly starts to turn on. Almost like a Symphony. . One by one and by 7pm, most were on. Because it's the holidays, it looks like buildings were competitive in creating the most spectacular holiday messages. I loved sizing a drink in the intercontinental hotel and seeing this beautiful skyline unfold it's light display before my eyes. I will recommend this to anyone that wants to relax and dream.....
To die for. The Hong Kong skyline is to die for. You have not been to Hong Kong if you have not seen this view, especially at dusk.
Nice to Just chill. Very relaxing at night and not to mention the lights. Try to get there around half 7 for 8 light show

4 days in Hong Kong . I totally agree with those who rate it the number one attractions of Hong Kong. Beautiful and spectacular at night. Viewed from the peak, the Hong Kong observation wheel n the star ferry. A must do thing
Skyline and lights. Well worth a visit especially at 8pm as the is a light show at Victoria Harbour. Easy to get to and serviced by public transport.
One word fantastic. Awesome view of hong Kong skyline with all the lights and buildings very nice and peaceful place , one can just sit there and admire the view for hours too good !

Iconic view as long as the weather is good. You have to do this. In fact, it's hard to miss if you are in Kowloon and anywhere near the water. Walk along the Avenue of the Stars, take the Star Ferry, or just hang out near the water.
Impressive. This skyline is iconic and an impressive scene of architecture. I'm not one much for sky scrapers, but that's what we have here, so I can appreciate it for what it's worth.

Beautiful Hong Kong. We took a cruise on the harbour and then onto dinner at a seafood village as part of a package. Leaving at sunset and watching the lights come on was amazing. Also at this time of year the buildings were starting to have their Christmas light themes on the outside which reminded me that Christmas is around the corner. I don't think anyone who comes to Hong Kong wouldn't see the skyline by night.
A stunning view of,the skyline. A stunning view of the skyline by day and by night. Symphonies of light is hold everyday from 20:00 - 20:14

The reason to go. Hong Kong at night is stupendous, we were on the Kowloon side so looking at the island. One end is brash lighting but look around and see the smaller lights from thousands of high rise homes, it's not as iconic but still amazing

Light show was great to see. Catching a ferry from Wanchai to see the lights from the other side of the harbour is a great experience, the boats look as thought they have been doing the journey for 100 years, but everywhere you go in Hong Kong is immaculate so even though the boats are older they are lovely to ride.The lights are just amazing, and worth spending half an hour to watch. 8pm each evening

Spectacular skyline. We walked along the promenade on the Kowloon side of the harbor during the day and enjoyed seeing Hong Kong's extraordinary array of interesting buildings. We then took the same walk at night and it was even more spectacular. Buildings were decked in neon lights, even more stunning than Times Square.
One of the best skylines in the world. . Fantastic skyline in the evenings. Certainly one of the best in the world. Ranks right up there with Shanghai and Sydney.
Beautiful Skyline. Amazing buildings lit up in various colors. Beautiful setting among the mountains and water. Great view to unwind.

You Cannot Miss This Fantastic View Whilst In Hong Kong. The best time to view the Hong Kong skyline is in the evening;just before sunset.You will see the skyline of Hong Kong gradually change as the neon lights are turned on.
Amazing at night. Truly fab HK Skyline at evening and night time specially their live music and light show so advise not to miss it...

Panoramic view of Hong Kong Skyline from the Victoria Peak. A bird's eye over the Victoria Harbour and its surrounding skyscrapers is a must for most tourists when visiting Hong Kong. Photos were taken along the Lugard Road at the Peak.

Always worth seeing. The Hong Kong Skyline is really one of the lovely city views of the world, seen from Kowloon. And particularly at Christmas time, when they decorate all the buildings. Quite impressive, best viewed while taking the Star Ferry.

An impressive sight to behold!. I enjoyed the sky-line view every evening. It is a light show like none I had seen before. I suggest enjoying it from the bar in the Inter-Continental hotel. They have a perfect location with unobstructed views.

daytime not as spectacular. I went during the day, which is not as spectacular as I would imagine in the nighttime. The nighttime hides all the smog & pollution. During the day, it kind of reminded me of the Shanghai Skyline during the daytime, and which is also much better at night for the same reason:-/

Pretty with Christmas decorations. It's a pretty walk around the harbor. And it's free! At 8 pm, there's a light show.
There's a little fishy smell around the water, but it's bearable.
And it's quite safe with lots of people around.

What A Experience !!!. For starters - a great tram ride up the Victoria Peak, then the walk up the Sky Terrance 428 was itself a treat as it passed to levels full of souvenir shops, restaurants and to finish it - view from the top - Just Marvellous to see Hong Kong Skyline by night.
Great view... From Kowloon and the peak. The HKG Skyline is really amazing. Best view in the evening from Kowloon to see the laser show. But also from the peak the view is breath taking.

Light show. Spectacular from terrace of the Anhei Noodle restaurant and bar.
Well worth the time. Amazing overall panorama of an amazing city.
Memorable.

island of dreams. One of the best skylines in the world. Do not miss the Symphony of Lights (every evening at 8 pm). The view is awesome with excellent ambience. With Victoria harbour and Avenue of Star as an added attraction.
Light and sound show in the evening. Wlak along the promenade and then sit at a good point to watch the show. Go there a bit early and grab a good position. Very crowded always.
Amazing experience. It is like living in the future, the architecture is gorgeous, by day it is amazing, but by night with the lights show it turns spectacular!

lightshow is disapointing. I expected the whole skyline to get dark and that a show would start, allas it was just some lights flashing here and there only 3 buildings actually are interesting. The skyline is nicer to see just anytime at night

On a clear day, if ever.. It would be more than amazing other than the smog. Every where you look there are enormous buildings, signs of further construction and development. Thought New York and Sydney were awesome but this place is jaw dropping.

Only one HK. Nice walk on the side of the bay were you can admire the skyline. It is just breathtaking. I have a preference for the evening, with all the lights, but it is also very nice during the day.
City Skylines with the Night Lights! BRILLIANT.... Strolling along the promenade to view the excellent skylines of Hong Kong... It was an excellent sight! Took lots of snaps.. Cheerful atmosphere...
Best ever skyline of asia !. its lively skyline many people come around for walking and running, it has great laser light show and has music running on radio :D that's best I found.

worth a visit. At 19:30 you can find a seat, after a stroll from Tsim Sha Tsui.
Just enjoy your holiday feelings for 20 minutes, after the show you can go to a lot of different malls in the neighboorhood, or to temple street to catch up some spicy crabs.

Even if you love the Manhattan skyline, you will be moved by the Hong Kong skyline.. You can enjoy the skyline from the Star ferry. The light on the Victoria Harbor changes all the time. It's simply beautiful.

The most amazing city skyline i've ever seen.. Saw this awesome view over victoria peak, walking around the whole peak, caught to star very from central over to Tsim sha then caught the Star Very back to Whan Chai. each and every viewpoint had its own captivating angle of this stunning city. Would recommend all 3 and i will certainly come back just to lay my eyes on THAT VIEW!

Best in the world. The best skyline in the world period. Day or night. Best to go to Sky100 and get a full view of the city, not just the typical Victoria Harbour view and you will see the real HK where urban jungle is perfectly blend with the real greenery.
Amazing. i would rank this skyline among the top 3 in the world, great to watch during sunset and start seeing how it starts to light up until 8 pm when the light show starts.
City Highlight. The skyline was amazing both by day and by night. It was best seen from the Star Ferry trip across the harbor and also from across the way in Kowloon.
Spectacular. Hong Kong skyline is one of the best atteactions of Hong Kong. Sky high towers, harbour, port simply awesome.

Skyline is unbelievable. I have now come back twice and I have three main places I love to view the skyline. 1, Marco polo beer fest held late October. 2 star ferry. 3. Eating at either the dog house or the China hand. One of technologies and building masterpieces,just wait for it to get dark and enjoy.
lights. you must go on the ferry to see the skyline and thelazer light show at 8 o click in the evening. AMAZING
The lights are amazing. We did a night bus trip & although it was difficult to take photos it was pretty amazing to see the lights

Impressive unlike other major cities. I have travelled to over 190 cities /towns /villages across 32 countries. The Hong Kong skyline is definitely one of a kind. So many tall buildings in such small areas and hard to believe as you drive around, that more taller ones are going up. Spectacular to see at night with all the lights. We were lucky to be there around Xmas time with all the festive lights. I'm not one for skyscrapers but this is worth seeing

A pretty unbeatable site in Hong Kong. It never fails to amaze: whether you're watching from the TST promenade, on a ferry, on the island side. Admittedly, the lights show is a little cheesy. But you can see the skyline so many other ways.
Beautiful by day and night. We went to the promenade to look at the skyline every night. The lazer show at night is beautiful. Amazing city both near and far.
Sight to behold. An amazing sight with the builbings reflected in the w after of Victoria Harbour. At night the buildings are lit up in different colours - a truly spectacular experience

Great Views. Night is the best time to take a walk on Victoria Harbor to see the skyline, just do it after the Symphony of Lights when the crowds are gone,walk on both sides of the Harbor to catch the different views of both mainland and Hong Kong Island buildings.
Beauty. looks so beautiful during day or night.. different scenes during different times of the day. lot of options around to spend at least couple of hours.
nice view. waited for symphony of lights, only 3-4 buildings participated. could've been better. Many tourists were waiting for spectacular show but ended up disappointed.

synchronised work. You can view this from Kowloon side near Tshim Sha Shui. You can take the Central Line i.e. the red line to Tshim Sha Shui/ Tshim Sha Shui East and walk down for a great view and amazing experience. Take a ferry for the show.
At night. We were luck as most of the big hotels had there Christmas lights up which added to the view. Will say that the talked about light show was a bit lame
Colourful. Hong Kong night skyline is nice when all the skyscrapers are lighted up. However, if the weather is bad (raining or misty), then just forget about it.

Breathtaking!. Whether you are staying on the island or on Kowloon you have an amazing view of Hong Kong. Buildings are spectacular and lit up beautifully at night. We never got tired of seeing this skyline every day. It took our breath away.
Weekend in Hong Kong. Lot's of things to see Hk.. this is much better then expected.. love this city a lot and will come back when possible
A Very Soecial View and Experience. The Hong Kong Skyline at night is one of the most special views that I have ever experienced, definitely a must do activity when close to Hong Kong!
Stunning. This is the longest skyline in the world. The light show on Saturday nights is a good time - get there early to get a good spot. It's absolutely a must see!
Strolling along Star Avenue, Laser musical at 2000 hrs. I visited Marina Bay Sands in Singapore, the laser lighting shows are much better. Standing at Star Avenue could not even hear the music!
you cna't miss it. i been there many many times and never tired of the view. in the summer it can be a little hot but autumn and winter are really nice

Beautiful on a clear night. Some great light shows, lights from hotels and other attractions and the local water traffic make this a stunning and unique view. Find a hotel with a rooftop bar and take the opportunity to watch the activity around HK and the harbour one evening

Highly recommended to view at night. It is a ‘must do’ activity when you visit Hong Kong. It is the best skyline to view at night in the world in my opinion. Near in mind, what you view from the Peak Tower at the Peak is good viewing point but I strongly recommend you should take an evening view from Tsim Sha Tsui East corridor in Kowloon side. From there you can enjoy the skyline of building along the front of the Hong Kong island but also the lights from buildings along the slopes of the hills behind the coast line. It is unique from any other cities in the world.
Eye opening blaze of colour. Fantastic place to visit. Night or day. Start from the ferry harbour and walk along the boardwalk and just take time to take in the sights.
Memorable view. HK is a world city, this is the statement to prove it. The dazzling display shows the confidence of the city.
Great scenic experience. Like Shanghai on the Bund the view of Hong Kong at night is spectacular - the light show at 8 PM is good but I think Shanghai does it a bit better
Nowhere like it at night. Hong Kong skyline is mesmerising when it lights up at night with a colourful light show and something to see on both sides of the harbour.
Really Beautiful. From so many vantage points, the skyline in Hong Kong is incredible! Our favorite is from Kowloon in the evening (8pm), the light show is spectacular!

Hong Kong Harbor is Great. I highly recommend going to Hong Kong and seeing the Harbor. Day and/or night it is beautiful. The Laser Show across the harbor at night is great also. Try to get a hotel on the harbor with a room on that side as it is worth it !!
Night time is the right time. Even on an overcast evening, the HK skyline was fabulous. The view from behind the HK towers and the front of the Kowloon towers is worth the tram ride
Great light show. Tacky, wild, wonderful and free. A ride on the Star Ferry and then the light show. No trip to HK is coplete without it!

amazing views at night. Take a ferry ride across the bay to Kowloon and you can be amazed at the views of the city skylines on both sides. Buildings have LED light show for most of the night and some even tell a story in lights. Something you will not see anywhere in North America. Its a must see while in Hong Kong

Daylight visit is good, night time visit is spectacular. If you can then take the river trip option and watch the light show from the boat.
The river trip also gives you the chance to observe both sides with a grandstand view, and the lights a pretty spectacular.
Something you lever get tired. Have been living and traveling in many places, Hong Kong skyline is something you never get tried of as a metropolitan city.
View is great. View of Kowloon from Hong Kong is great at night. Any tall building is a good place for a view, as is Victoria Peak - fantastic on a clear night.
Nice to see.. Every day from 8pm till 8.20 pm there is a light show on the skyscrappers. I expected something more, but it's still nice to see it.
spectacular. There are a number of restaurants along the skyline path where you can sit outside and enjoy the skyline.
Beautiful. The skyline was beautiful, many modern buildings all lit up. Some lights were laser. the area is very clean and seemed a safe place to visit'

always a beauty to see. being summer, views are as far as the eye can see which is great.
make sure you always have a camera handy!

Must see.. Wonderful view of lights from huge area above the Star ferry terminal on the Kowloon side. We took a night cruise but didn't get to see the laser show very well so went back to the terminal the next night just to watch. Very pleasant.
Light show. Harbour lights are nice to see. The harbour cruise was a 90 minutes trip which went far too quickly. Considering all the traffic on the harbour it was a surprisingly smooth trip.

BEST VIEW. HK HARBOR has the most exquisite views in the world. With its modern skyline.
Take the time to stop and smell the roses.

great show. We saw the lights from the pool deck of the MarcoPolo hotel.
This was so amazing and beautiful at the same time. The building are so huge and different shapes what a show not to be missed.!
Nice view. It was an incredible view but waiting for 20:00 to see the light show was a bit of a disappointment. Nothing really happened and the best view was from before it started.

Skyline view from Starferry Harbour Cruise. The Harbour Cruise at Sunset was a pleasant & relaxing way to view Victoria Harbour. You can chill out on the Boat & enjoy the view accompanied with a cooling drink & some snacks. A pity missed out on the fireworks display. Took another Starferry ride back to Central Pier and managed to see the view of the Harbour at night.

Fun Activity. Each day at 8p the harbor lights most of the buildings with colored neon lights. We were expecting laser lights but there didn't seem to be many. However, we looked forward to viewing every evening.
Exciting with all the colors. Hong Kong is a fascinating city and especially in night time when all the buildings are illuminated and all the coulourfull neonadvertising.

amazing...spectacular..colourful night sight!!. Its really an amazing sight to look at when you walk around the jetty at night to view the colourful Hong Kong skyline.The whole place is full of activities and many are seen taking pics of the colourful display of lights.Weather can get a bit chilly at night and windy,it was about 25 degrees celcius few days back.make sure you dress warm and keep and umbrella just in case.
Good. Little bit overrated but very nice to see. Hong Kong is impressive and Christmas decor and lights are great.
From the Marco Polo you can see the lot. What a sight the Hong Kong skyline is especially at night. We saw it on a cloudy night as well as clear and to be honest I don't know which is best.

Very pretty but the lightshow was a waste. The HK light show (13 mintues at 8pm) is what I was told was a "must do" but honestly it was a waste of time, granted about 15 minutes of my time. Get there early if you really want a good view with all the selfie-sticks coming out it is hard to see much
Wait for the light show. The view of Hong Kong across Victoria Harbour is spectacular especially after dark when they run the light show.
Not to be missed. Try to see the skyline at night. It's really beautiful but forget the light show. You have, I'm sure seen better

What a view. Was visiting hongkong in summer season and it was very humid and hot. When came to skyline the view in the night is much better then in the day. Dont forget to take a pic when a red layer ship across or passing your camera.

Truly Asia's world city. The Hong Kong skyline awestruck me. It's nothing close to what I had ever seen. The brilliantly designed skyscrapers draped in dazzling LEDs showecase the city so beautifully. The show at the Victoria Harbour at Tsim Tsa Tsui in the evening is amazing as is viewing the skyline across to the Hong Kong island and the Kowloon side which I was fortunate to witness on a Chinese junk boat ride aboard the Aqualuna. Nothing comes close to this exciting experience of the Hong Kong skyline at night.

Not New York, but pretty impressive none the less. Great to see during the day but the skyline comes into it's own at night - stunning! View from The Peak or from the IFC Tower number 2 (during the day) - there's a monetary museum on the 55th floor which is free to visit and has great views - you'll need ID to go up though.....The Star Ferry to Kowloon is a great place to view at night....
Great view!. If you visit Hong Kong, you must try to see the skyline during the evening. Hong Kong has the most beautiful skyline!
A night time light show.. take the star ferry at night to Kowloon and view the amazing skyline. The modern architecture is fantastic day or night
Interesting place !!. Look for a light show in evening. Nice place to sit and enjoy evening and look the skyline of Hong Kong.

On the harborside walk down Kowloon. Astonishing on night, even better in Christmas time. You can also try to enjoy from a dinner place either in Intercontinental or Peninsula. Of course, crossing through the Star Ferry is mandatory. In a single word, this is the postcard you have to take back from HK

Unforgettable experience. Seeing this amazing skyline from the Star Ferry and also the Peak was really quite special. Many cities can look the same at night but the harbour offers an additional eye catching attraction as well.Use a tripod for great photos and enjoy what is a great aspect of Hong Kong.

Do it at night!. We took passage on the Aqua Luna junk boat in the evening to see the Hong Kong Skyline at night. Well worth it, the city looks incredible by night, you really get a good sense of the vibrancy of the city lit up at night from the water.
Absolutely amazing view!. This is a must see during your trip to Hong Kong. Travelled up by cable car and the views wee absolutely spectacular!

Amazing views. What a beautiful place, u basically see the whole of HK from this place! Loved it! Worth visiting😍
We took so many pics u just feel like ur floating on air, if ur in HK make a turn. Its also situated in a bery nice mall!
Stunning . Great as high as you can and check it out! Best at night obviously and in November effected by fog / pollution....

beautiful for evening walk. very romantic area, lots of artists and great pic point.
there r a lot of thinks to do around- art museum, market and shopping center

Worth a visit. We joined the throng at the edge of the harbour to watch the Symphony of Lights, which is the laser light show accompanied by music. The light show itself is average but the night time skyline of Hong Kong is quite spectacular in it's own right to see. The massive buildings all lit up, the reflections in the water and the silhouetted water craft passing by, make it worth a visit

Beautifull at night. Taking the ferry over is very picturesque. Got to act quick cause the ride is over very fast. Its amazing how many huge companies have buildings there and they all seem to be competing for your attention.

Beautiful skyline of HK. There are a few places to get skyline pictures. It is definitely a fantastic view at night. There are boat trips that you can take also. The boat trips will allow you to get better pictures of more areas.
Reaching for the Sky. Day or night the skyline is spectacular. It unbelivable how the scolding is just Bamboo which is very sensible when you are in an earth quake and hurricane zone.
wonderful at night. 8 pm for a short lasershow and music, walk the first level for better view, fun people watching, close to shopping center

On my top 10 list!. This skyline has been and will continue to be in my top 10 skylines in the world. The burst of colours at night combined with the water in the foreground and the mountains in the background are perfect together.

Good view but not for the price of a ticket. Booring. The windows gives reflections on the photos im trying to take. What am i doing up here? It's a trap. Expensive. Im hungry. Maby i should go and eat something instead. Or shopping?
Amazing. A must do when in Hong Kong. Go over to Kowloon and go to eye bar 30th floor at night and the view is amazing.

The view is indeed breathtaking. The skyline of HK is indeed great and the lighting which takes place at 7.45 pm just makes the place magical and worth being there. The skyline during nigfht is indeed enchanting to say the least. Keep the evening fre to visit the peak and see the skyline from there.
Fantastic skyline. I am a patriotic true-blooded American but New York has nothing on the Hong Kong skyline. Great view at night and there is a light show at about 8PM.
Great skyline best admired from ferry boats. Take the Octopus card and hop onto a ferry from TST to Admiralty in the evening the view is simply amazing
Nice View. The avenue of the starts offers a great view for the symphony of lights every night. The show is not very spectacular though, but it is still nice to see it.
Breathtaken View!. Wonderful experience, once you see the Hong Kong Skyline specially during the night you will be in love! They have a wonderul light show!!!

The Highlight of Hong Kong. I don't think there is anything more enjoyable in Hong Kong than viewing the skyline at night. A great spot to do so is on the Kowloon promenade or in the bar of the Intercontinental Hotel.

Excellent View of Hongkong from Shin Sha Sui waterfront.. The waterfront of shim sha sui is an excellent place to see the lighting of Hongkong island. Especially when it is 7.45 pm when the symphony of lights starts and lights move in tandem to the music being played. It is a must see sight.
Best Skyline in the world. one of the best skylines anywhere in the world is from the 100th floor of the sky 100. you must see it at least once while you are in Hong Kong.
November 2. Hong Kong is polluted. If you want to see the skyline clearly your chances are better taken at winning black jack in Macau

Must See. If you have money and resources to travel. Hongkong is must see location. The skyline is one of it's kind. If you ever travel to Hong Kong, make it a point to come out in the night and take a walk or go for a ride. The view is mind blowing. I love it

Most Spectacular Skyline in the World. The hong kong island skyline is truly breathtaking, its like NYC times ten...The beautiful architecture, the lights, the setting...it is all so overwhelming but so beautiful, something i would suggest to anyone , anywhere. I will never tire os staring out at the skyline....either walking down the promenade or taking the ferry...amazing in every way, don't miss it.

Best Free Show. The best way to view the skyline is from up high in a lounge in a waterfront hotel where you can relax in air conditioned comfort to take in the show. I don't think you get the full benefit from ground level on the waterfront and generally it is a more restricted view from down there.

Skylines of the world. It is mesmerizing, all the buildings, and all the lights, day or night. The light show is overrated, it gets way to busy, and at times, it seems like there is nothing going on. Just stand and look at all the buildings, the ships, yachts, lights. One of a kind experience that you will not find anywhere else in the world. Truly breathtaking.

Looked forward to the symphony of lights. We were expecting the show would probably be going with music, but no music. Was so disappointing. :( But the the sky scraping line was so beautiful and the light show was awesome! Enjoyed it!

Lovely, skip the crowded laser show. No need to wait in the line to see the laser show. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful to see any time of night. The laser show is just so so. Too many crowds, low-volume music. Just go and walk around and enjoy the beautiful sky

What a view in the evening.... In the evening, when the lights as 'ON' the vibrant nature of the place comes out.You will be able to see the beauty, if you walk along the pier [next to the clock tower] in the evening.

Sound and light show amazing!. If you visit Hong Kong you must go to Victoria Harbour (Kowloon). If you go to Victoria Peak, take the ferry back to Kowloon during or after the sunset and you will see the amazing views of Hong Kong Skyline. Be sure to be there at 8PM to see the symphony of lights!
Skyline worth going for. The Hong Kong Skyline is better than you could ever imagine, particularly on Hong Kong Island ( and you don't have to go to Kowloon to see it)
Great view!. It cost around 160 Hong Kong dlls each and it's a must, the locals recommend you to go during daylight instead of at night.
Amazing view. the skyline is simply amazing, the colors are very particular and the images are dynamic and in motion. Is a good chance to spend few minutes to watch the show.

Evening Cruise not to be missed!!. The light spectacular cruise lasts about 2 hours leaving at 19.30. Live music and friendly staff greet you on this lovely trip around Victoria harbour. The buffet is very good lots of choice and plenty of well presented food. The Hong Kong harbour light show starts every evening at 20.00 and is just awesome! afterwards there is dancing to a really good band until you arrive back on land. Highly recommended.
Amazing. Great view over the hong kong harbour. We viewed from the waterfront and also from the top of Victoria Peak. Both were were amazing.

Never miss skyline when you come to HK. Hong Kong Skyline is one of the best skylines in the world. No matter in daytime or at night time, sure you will like it. As a local, I like it very much too. Try taking the star ferry to see the both the Kowloon side and the HK side view!
Great Skyline. Great skyline day or night. Don't miss the sound and light show every day at 8:00 p.m. This is one of the best skylines in the world.

Stunning. Day or night, it's stunning- like more than Manhattan. Don't miss musical symphony @ 8 pm everyday. It goes for 15 mins. If want to be seated, got to be in promonade before 7. Enjoyed despite the second.
Beautiful at night. Make sure to walk along the waterfront (for example at TST) at night and take in the gorgeous skyline.

Amazing!. Today I visited the Skyline of Hong Kong and it is absolutely breathtaking. Hong Kong has one of the longest and prettiest skylines of the world. Take the star ferry so that you can enjoy the skyline from both sides.
Not to miss in Hong Kong!!. One of the best places to view Hong Kong! Not to miss!One of the best skylines in the world! Just mind the weather as the weather can really affect the skyline.

Beautiful views. The Hong Kong skyline has drawn the attention of every tourist coming to Hong Kong. One would admire the modern buildings in the day and the fascinating lights at night. One of the most popular activities is to take the Star Ferry to go across the harbour in the day or night, in order to enjoy the splendor. One could also travel to the Peak to get a more perspective view, time permitting. See some photos in Albums 065: picasaweb.google.com/yipjcs88pica

An Urban Work of Art. The Hong Kong skyline is an amazing site during the day and simply breathtaking when lit up at night. It is easy to view from the top of the peak or from a ferry going between the island and the peninsula. Even my wife who is not a fan of big cities was quite impressed.

Interesting light show but not worth a special trip to see. We went down to the waterfront at TST to view the laser light show and were rather disappointed. I think just the lights on the buildings which are the normal lighting was more interesting than the laser show. So if you are in that area then of course watch it but if you need to make a special detour to get there, then dont bother as you are not missing much at all.
Amazing light show. I have seen the light show at 2000h several times now, and it's always amazing. Good views you have close to Star ferry pier Tsim Sha Tsui
And i though New York was amazing. The skyline is incredible when viewed from Kowloon; it seems to go on forever. Nightly light show at 8 pm
Fancy. There's a lightshow of several buildings accompanied by music.its worth to see the illuminated buildings of honkong island.
the laser show. the laser show was not of the standard we seen on our last visit to Hong Kong maybe it was just that night we were there.

Can't say you've been to Hong Kong without seeing the lightshow. You can pay money for harbour cruise or get train to Tsim Shau Shui and take exit L6 and you come out near the Kowloon ferry. Get there around 6-6.30 and go to the 7 eleven and grab a few beers. Don't worry there is a public toilet nearby but be warned it is pretty grotty. Was a great spot to see and hear everything.

Beautiful view both at noon either at night. Located in TST area, this place shows outstanding view of skyscrapers which is all free. Don't miss the symphony of the light show every night at 8 o'clock, which is very worthy.
NYC - on steroids!!. Amazing, brilliantly lit skyline with a nightly laser show at 8 pm. Tons of huge skyscrapers all colorfully lit up many with seasonal messages.
NYC - on steroids!!. Amazing, brilliantly lit skyline with a nightly laser show at 8 pm. Tons of huge skyscrapers all colorfully lit up many with seasonal messages.

Possibly the World's worst City Scape. Hong Kong has successfully resolved most of its social issues inevitable when millions settle in a small space. It has also successfully developed its economy through financial institutions and a vibrant retail sector.
