The result is a juxtaposition of skyscrapers forming mass housing and skyscrapers forming corporate Head Quarters, usually with major retail outlets on the lower floor. The housing is harsh utilitarian architecture, fit for purpose, but unlikely to win any awards. The commercial buildings, on the other hand, are innovative, imaginative and often exciting.But put together and add a liberal veil of heavily polluted air (most from mainland China) and you get one of the least appealing cityscapes in the world.My advise would be to view it at night. Somehow, the utilitarian skyscrapers appear to form a supporting canvas to the brightly lit commercial buildings. Take a look at my two photos and see which you prefer.

Never gets old. My favourite pastime in Hong Kong is going on Junk trips (boat trips) and the best part is coming back into the harbour with the HK skyline stretched out in front of you. Always takes my breath away. There are several superb spots around town to fully appreciate the view - roof top bars like Wooloomooloo, Aqua Luna, Red Bar at IFC, the Star Ferry and from The Peak along Lugard Road. You can't come to Hong Kong and not spend at least an evening soaking up the view.

excellent view, good way to spend the night in Hong Kong. if you already visited Soho, and soaked into vibrant atmosphere of the city, it's a good idea to get the Star Ferry to Kowloon (in case you are not staying in that part of the town) and visit Victoria Harbour. Symphony of Lights, starting at 8.00 for 15 minutes - is not very impressive, but it's a good way to spend the time there. Skyline worth a look - nothing fancy, comparing with other typical US cities with decent skylines, but it's nice.

A must see. Great to see but very dependant on smog conditions. The first time we saw the skyine during the day it was just visible. Later during our stay in had cleared considerably but never totally.
Nice. Hong Kong is so much fun at night. The Skyline is amazing. Everyone should try a boat or even a ferry trip after the dawn to see the lights.
Stunning. Visit the light show for a real breath taking experience. It would be lovely to see London do something a bit like this!!! Well worth watching.
Stunning views!. The kind of scenery you never get fed up of, always changing, day or night. Easy to view from the harbour front & Promenade at TST.
star ferry have thorough view. took star ferry to Kowloon, have good thorough view of HK side(I set on the side facing HK) & the view is very good.
Absolute must see!!. It is an absolute must whilst in Hong Kong to view the skyline!! Viewing from the mainland side and looking back at the island for the light show is fantastic!!
Love this place.... Wether you are watching it from Victoria harbour, the peak, or are smack down in the middle of them - this is an awesome place...

Impressive. The best way to enjoy the Skyline is at harbour area where Symphony of Light show happens next to Avenue of Stars. Both of these are not that impressive but the Skyline is good to just sit with a beer and watch. Its peaceful, open, breezy against a magnificent backdrop. Nice way to spend an Hongkong after a tired day
Its OK. You could spend couple of hours here..the show starts around 8 if you want to grab a good seat you should arrive an hour early atleast.....
marvelous view! a must go!. Highly recommended. Could only imagine how the light show looks like, as we missed time our visit...but still worth the trip!

Worth a boat trip for sure !. We went on an evening dinner cruise on Victoria Harbour and found it very enjoyable. As usual with these dinner cruises the food lines were a bit of a jostle but the food was quite good with a large selection available. The night time views on the harbour were impressive, although not as good as the same experience in Shanghai a few days earlier but still worth while doing. Victoria harbour is enormous and very busy! An interesting slice of life to behold.
beautiful. The skyline at victoria harbour is beautiful, lights show is interesting but the place is just too crowded

Nothing special. I have been there at 20:00 to see the laser show. However it was nothing special. Of course crowdy and without any special effects. Maybe it would be better to choose a time with some sunset.

Nothing beats HK skyline. They say that NY has the best skyline, it's only because you have seen the one of HK!Our Skyline is best to view from any angles; from above at one of the roof top, from across the harbour, from the peak!
Pretty view of the HK skyline. The view of the HK skyline along the Victoria Harbour is one of the most endearing symbols of HK. Worth a view at least once during one's visit to HK.
Nice!. This is a nice vantage point to see the sheer amount of hi rise buildings which makes Hong Kong the busy metropolis that it is. Nice views both day and night. Don't miss it!

Simply the best in the world. You won't get many better skylines than the one you see in HK. Make sure you get yourself a good vantage point for the nightly symphony of lights show.
Even without the light show you can really appreciate the work that went into preserving this skyline; with its perfect combination of colored lights, it really is a beautiful sight.

If not the best skyline I don't know what is. The skyline is very beautiful, especially at night. If it's not the prettiest skyline I honestly don't know what is. I do suggest going out on the Avenue of the stars at 8pm to watch the laser light show. It's worth the time.

Really? That's It?. Was there on-shore early for the show; it does start on time. The soundtrack was nice--the helicopter landing a few hundred feet away made most of it inaudible. There were lots and lots of photographers; the show---meh. Had to see it, though.
Different sights. Fantastic views during day time, sunset, , and night time. You should try going there in the late afternoon so get all the different views experiences.
Beautiful view both day and night. Stunning view from either side of the harbour, especially good at night. Only problem is it can be a bit hazy with pollution
Holiday. Hong Kong is a cosmopolitan city with Beautiful skyscrapers and High Rise Building.There are stylish skyline like the HSBC BANK, ,and other Building in Kowloon and around Hong Kong Island.

Definitely on the bucket list. The HK skyline like all big city skylines is a modern architectural wonder but Hong Kong because of its history and geography is somehow unique. Add to that the typhoon blowing through whilst we were there and you can see from the photos the haunting image it portrays.Definitely worth seeing and Hong Kong is as vibrant a city as you will find anywhwere
One of the best. Hong Kong skyline is regarded by many as one of the best in the world. Always brings a smile when I visit.
Impressive!. The view is as great as you can expect! And if you're taking the star ferry, it brings another viewpoint from both Kowloon and HK island! A must seen in HK!
Just awesome . Breath taking during the day and heart stopping at night. It's one of the things that makes Hong Kong, Hong Kong. It's a must.
used to be much better. I was here in 2011 and the light show was MUCH better, now it isn't hardly worth spending the time to watch - very dissapointing
Amazing. What more can I say other than a stunning, vibrant city. Seeing is believing, will definitely visit again.
Fabulous . If you are going to visit Hong Kong you should go there to see the amazing symphony of light👍and the skyline was breathtaking😍,don't forget your camera📷
not to be forgotten. the Skyline, especially at night makes an unforgettable experience, with the building rising up in the sky, being brightly and colorfuuly lighted

Sensational. The skyline is magnificent. Best seen from the Peak or near the harbour. One of the harbour bars is a particularly nice place to see the lights. There's a premium, of course, but it's well worth paying.

Like lighting displays? This place is amazing.. Entire high rise buildings with active displays. Tons of colour. Lots of motion. Some incredible buildings. Lots of beautiful architecture. The "Illuminations" laser and light show in the evening was disappointing but the normal skyline lights were great.

Lights, camera and no real action as lasers were pretty rubbish. Love London at night. Shanghai very good and HK close to both in terms of light experience. The skyline on HK Island from Kowloon provides a very good light show, although the green lazers at 2005 offered very little really, so don’t rush to get there. Overall very pleased to see the spectacular vista, which looked even better from my seat in an Emirates A380 as I headed off to my next port of call.

Nighttime view outstanding. The view from our hotel Shangri-La Kowloon was outstanding, especially at night. A bit hazy during the day but made up for it at night. Missed the Xmas light shows but have seen these before and they are outstanding, from one side of the harbor the other.

Evening ride on an original Chinese Junk called the "Aqua Luna". Only way to enjoy the harbour and its lightsYou are given a complimentary drink on boarding ,go to the top deck,lie back on huge cushions and embrace it all ,no commentary-wonderful! just embrace it all
Amazing . Amazing experience especially by night with all that colors, buildings, really fantastic... Must visit...

Awesome. It is just an amazing sight and the lights of the amazing towers call you towards them.
Its a sight to be enjoyed once in Hong Kong

One of my favourite Skylines. Great view from roof top bars, Star Ferry and from Victoria Peak.
One of the best free things to do in Hong Kong!

Favorite Skyline View in the World. I've visited 68 countries and this skyline is still my favorite skyline in the world. The Intercontinental Hotel offers some great views across the water. The beautiful city is inspiring. Must see.

Amazing. Beautiful view especially at night. There are many ways to view the skyline one of the economic way is to take the star ferry from Central Hong Kong to Tsim Sha Shui. Every night at 8pm there is a display of symphony of light.

Beautiful. The Hong Kong Skyline is my second favorite right after Shanghai Skyline. The only reason because it has not change much in the last 20 years. But, overall a great sight to see if your in Hong Kong.
A view like no other. Visited Hong Kong so many times and could sit for ages and look at the wonderful view from our hotel window
Great view. Well, for a person who comes from the land where most high buildings do not reach 20 floors... It is definitely something worth seeing :)
Amazing view especially at night . I woul recommend the higher you go the better the view however we views from star ferry by day and night and this was a great way to experience it too. Must see
Signature of HK. You will find the skyline view mesmerizing every time you see it.. Never got bored of it. From peak to harbor all the glimpses are worth it.
Fab!. A good hang out and amazing views of all the towers! Very good at night and lots of people hang out there with a few drinks. We spent a few nights here just chilling out.
SPECTACULAR. I have stayed in the Kowloon Shangri-la and the Peninsula, both of which have great views of the harbour and skyline. It is worth the money just to gaze at this wonder.

Hong Kong Skyline at Dusk is Unforgettable. The view of downtown at dusk from the East Side Promenade is perhaps the most special view of this city. Many of the skyscrapers are uniquely lit at night and give the skyline a whole new level of personality. On some nights there is a laser light show too - as if the static illumination were not enough!

Amazing. I am come from country that doesn't have so many tall building, so hongkong skyline really amaze me. They have waterfront concept and I recommend to enjoy the skyline from one side to another. I enjoyed at day from the ferry and at night from avenue of Star. I prefer from the ferry. There's a show at night and i feel a bit disappointed.
Light show a litle passe. The skyline is impressive - the much lauded 8.00pm light show is a little naffe in this day and age of laser shows being common.

Nothing Special. We were told about a laser show in the harbor so we made a point to go outside to the waterfront to see it, but it was very unimpressive, a few lasers, and some lights on buildings, nothing special. This show of lights in and on building and lasers synchronized to music around the waterfront area sounded great in description, but in reality it was nothing special. Small and lacking in originality. Although walking along the waterfront is very pleasant.

AMAZING. I usually don't wander around foreign cities alone when I'm on vacation but I couldn't pass this up. I LOVE the HK skyline and I have a hundreds of photos of it rotating as my desktop background. LOVE LOVE LOVE and would visit again.
Lights fantastic. We went on a river cruise at night and the lights were amazing . Dinner on the cruise was good but it could have been longer as it was only 2 hours
The best!. Hong Kong and Singapore has the best skylines in the World! If you want to call you a traveller, you MUST visit and admire the skyline of Hong Kong!

Avenue of Stars. Great view of Hong Kong island from the Kowloon Pier also named the Avenue of Stars. Although pleasingly lit up once it gets dark till late night, most tourists head for the sound and laser show at about 8 pm when it gets very crowded and best avoided, check it out anytime before or after. A must do for the city trip.

Iconic. There is really nothing quite like the view of Hong Kong on a clear day (if you're lucky enough to get one). It's perhaps more impressive than Manhattan because of the mountains and the harbour. Worth the effort of visiting Kowloon just to admire the view.
Symphony o lights. Every day at 8 p.m. there is a Symphony of Lights show on the harbor skyline and commentary in English on Monday, Wednesday & Friday. The show is for 10 mins. only.
Must see. Great views from the Skyline. When In Hong Kong, it is a must see. I booked via Hop on Hop Off bus tour.
very dissapointed by HK, coming from Bangkok. not friendly people . taxi does not understand english. immigration very rude. 1 and last trip to HK for me
Majestic. I am a huge HK fan and I think that its skyline is the most impressive urban sight to be seen in this world. Fantastic laser lights ar sunset.

Spectacular view. During a brief stay in Hong Kong we were lucky enough to have front seats to the light show every evening as our hotel was directly on the harbour. It is quite an impressive sight to see all the buildings lighting up and flashing at 8:00 in the evening. This is certainly one of the world's greatest urban views!
Awesome view. Impressive and relaxing to look at, with the junk boats sailing in the foreground. It truly says that Hong Kong is one of Asia's finest cities.

Perhaps the best skyline on earth. The view this skyline from Victoria Harbor is breathtaking. Especially at night. It is best seen from the Kowloon Public pier. The are also options to see it by boat. I recommend taking the Aqua Luna. In the evening there is a laser show. At first it seems amazing since there is choreographed lights between the massive sky scrapers but after a few minutes, it seems a little dull and kinda cheesy. Overall it's a great view to get an awesome photo or just to enjoy for an hour.
Avg. The view is good but the lazer show is very dull n commonplace! Expectations were high but the show is disappointing.just the view nothing else

Probably one of the most powerful skylines. Contrasts with the high, narrow house because of extreme land prices, the water reflection, weather of intriguing character here opportunities for really good photographs.

Amazing sight.... Must see when you visit HK... we were there at the time of dusk... all round its a spectacle to see... sky going black and city lights coming to life... best is when you see it when you pass through kowloon - hk ie. victoria harbour...
Hong Kong Skyline. We went to watch the music and lights show from the waterfront. It lasted for 13 minutes and was amazing to see.

Excellent view. We went to top in Peak tram and it was awesome view from top.
Open observatory gives 360Deg view of Hong kong and it is becoming more spectacular with lights after sun set.
With view of Sea and sky scrapper buildings, we enjoyed the view from top.

Nothing special. I have to say the view its stunning though the show itself was really disappointing. . Really tought I would hear some symphony or great lighting show. But it kept me waiting and nothing.

A must see. From Kowloon side watching the sun go down and the lights go on on the island is spectacular. At 8PM a laser light show from some of the buildings on the island adds to the 'show.' A must see if you're visiting Hong kong.
Top skyline! . Amazing at night! Really great for photos across the river. Its huge. try to get a not so cloudy day though as it will affect your photos...
Commanding view of Hong Kong. In a very grounded Hong Kong, this is a great place to visit. The views are superb and it is easy to get a good picture of Hong Kong.

Neon wonderland. We sat and watched this from the top of the IFC building. It's a 5 minute wonder. Everyone stops to watch and listen. It's particularly lovely with the water in the foreground so everything is reflected. Well worth watching.

HK Skyline. We enjoyed this spectacle at the front of the Museum of Art on the Kowloon side. Had a great view. Just a suggestion though - get there early if you want a "front row" view. We got there at 7.30pm for an 8.00pm show and it was already starting to fill up.
A unique harbour. It used to look a lot better without the construction works that are now all over the island and Kowloon.

Anticipation as you wait for the darkness to come !!. The crowds grow as the dust turns to night and the skyline comes alive with the lights and neon from the buildings. The sight is amazing as all the twinkling lights shimmer across the bay.The promenade is well designed and has a long stretch along Victoria Bay with many vantage points for taking photographs. The public toilet are excellent there and free. The whole experience was worth the wait for nightfall !!
Light magic. A lovely discreet display of light which is not to be missed, although the laser display was disappointing!

Woww. Hongkong skyline is a damn great piece of work ppl u gotta know that this is one of the best in asia i wud say one building is betr than the other and the glass facades mite be having the most different colours of glass i hv ever seen being from the same trade
What can you say?. Not much to be said that hasn't been said before. It's gorgeous at night or daytime, the famous Hong Kong skyline.

its 1 of very cool places. when u go up there,u can c all hong kong from upside view & u can imagine how much sweet the view there . & its supported with malls inside where u can find anything u wanna there .
hongkong skyscrapper view. We can see amazing view of hongkong. Skyscrapper view and look so modern and metropolis. Better if we come at night.
Hong Kong Skyline. The view is spectacular but the Symphony of lights was not as great as is advertised. It is a beautiful sight from high above.

Its stunning. Best view is from Victoria Peak, plan your trip for early evening and see the city lights come on. Some of the buildings external lighting is really quite amazing, eg Bank of China tower with its bamboo like structure

Breathtakingly Amazing, the epitome of development. The Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade might be rather crowded at night, but the amazing skyline is totally worth squeezing in with the rest of the people. Especially romantic if you go with your partner on a cold autumn/winter's night, and enjoy the view with the wind gently caressing your face.

Light and Laser show 8pm every night ????. Marketing said was a great light and laser show choreographed to music every night on Victoria Harbour. Was described as amazing. Having seen a fantastic show in Singapore previously we thought we would check it out.It was certainly not worth a special trip as was rather disappointing. I could hear no music laser show was barely evident. The high rises were in the main just neon advertising . However 2x buildings were quite amazing to watch the as they changed colour. If you were in the area at 8pm or on a Harbour Cruise at the time it would be worth having a look but dont make a special trip down to the Harbour just to check it out as you may be disappointed.
Simply amazing. Take the star Ferry to get the best view, simply stunning and best to see at night. All the buildings lit up is a view you won't forget in a hurry
Fantastic!. So worth getting the tram up to the peak as the view is breath-taking! We lived in London many years but compared to HK it is sparse and not even close to this skyline!
Always Incredible. Go to the Avenue of Stars at Tsim Sha Tsui side - and watch the 8:00pm light show. A MUST DO while in HK

Amazing views and free. Fantastic to walk along the Kowloon shoreline to look at the Hong Kong skyline in the daytime and then again at night. Great to walk alongthe water's edge. Always clean; always safe anytime that I had visited. Amazing architecture to be seen.
Nice View of Hong Kong in the Night. Nice to see the Laser Shows at 8PM everyday. Can be viewed from the ferries or from the avenue of stars or clock tower area for a good view.
All of the ligjts. It was so amazing to see the light show done against the Hong Kong Skyline! The 'Pirate ships'that prowls the bay is also very cool and adds to an overall excitement and danger!

One of the most stunning skylines in Asia. The Homg Kong harbor is one of the most stunning skylines in Asia. Best viewed from the Kowloon side, there is a nightly light show at 8pm. Highly recommended if it is your first visit to Hong Kong.
Awesome. You need to find exactly where is the most suitable place to watch the skyline. It took a while since we found it.

Modern day wonder. When you look at Hong Kong from the plane on a clear night, it resembles an emerald island. When you look at the harbour from your room in the night, you wonder if you will ever live in a place with a better view at night. And when you cross over to Kowloon on Star Ferry on the night and look at Hong Kong island, you are too awestruck to say anything. And by the way, as Hong Kong renews itself every 3-4 years, go and see the sight again. It amazes you again.
The 2nd best skyline in the world (second to Shanghai bund). 'best to watch from the kowloon side, and be ready for the awesome laser show, nightly. Festive areas on both star ferry ports.
Awesome at night. Catch the view from TST, stay for the laser show, one of the worlds great skylines, catch the star ferry for a nice view as well.

Crazy at night.. Phenomenal view from either side of the island, as the buildings are both futuristic, colourful and old. With liners, ferries and junks all wrestling for space in this outlandishly busy harbour.

Skyscrapers, actually scraping the sky. The view of the Hong Kong skyline from the Victoria Harbour is excellent. Tall Buildings everywhere. And the Symphony of lights show at 2000 hrs is also decent. Do not miss to spend an evening appreciating the beauty of the HK skyline. One of the best in the world.

walk along the promenade in autumn. For residents or tourists from abroad it is always enjoyable to walk along the Victoria Harbors, at Kowloon side, on day or in the evening around diner time,. at 8 pm you could witness the laser show ignited from the sky scapers of Hong Kong. As a counterpart of Chinese Theater in Hollywood we find here The Avenue of the Stars with the statute of Bruce Lee, handprints of Jackie Chan and many other movie stars. In autumn the temperature Hong Kong quite nice

One of the best in the world. Let's face it, Hong Kong's skyline is gorgeous. You can view Kowloon from Hong Kong, Hong Kong from Kowloon and, no matter how you slice it, it's fantastic.Even better, find yourself a nice bar on a high-rise at dusk and watch the sunset over the harbor.
awesome. Its an awsome feeling to be looking at the island and its skyline what a city it has become and you can feel it

Awesome and simply breathtaking. I love the skyline in hongkong especially during the winter seasons, unfortunately, it may not be as nice when there is a thick fog.. The buildings are brightly lit and you can see Kowloon from Hong Kong island.

HK harbor crusie. as the sun dropped over Victoria Harbour the HK skyline started to shine, innovating building lights really took control making the skyline really spectacular. The laser light show was a little underwhelming although I must note we did have low cloud and the edge of a typhoon to deal with.

Stunning skyline, especially by night. This skyline is considered as one of the most impressive with great justice.There is a laser show at 8pm every day, hence it is crowded around that time. Who would like to enjoy the view more relaxed, should come around 10pm. Get off MTR station (East) Tsim Sha Tsui and walk towards the harbor front. Take a walk along the promenade and enjoy the great view. In addition it’s definitely worth to take the star ferry to central. It’s only 2.50 – 3.40HKD (don’t buy the expensive tickets at the counter. There are machines to buy the regular tickets or pay by octopus card)

Harbour views. The main attraction for a visit and well worth the effort. The views are spectacular day and night from all areas but especially from the Kowloon side. Unfortunately the light and laser show was disappointing as it is a low quality display lasting ten minutes and unless you are nearby I am not sure it is worth the effort.

Amazing Experience. The Symphony of Lights, a synchonized Sound and Light show, with lights beaming from the Hong Kong Skyline is a visual treat from TST. Its held every evening. Make sure you head early to get a seat. A such the views of Hong Kong Skyline in the morning times are great to. Make sure you visit both day time and evening time.

Pretty at night. We took the ferry for a night time harbour cruise and loved it, there is a laser show on nightly which is on the side of many of the buildings bordering the harbour, a must if you visit Hong Kong.

Awesome!. If the day time view is amazing then the night time skyline view is mesmerizing! The lights on the skyscrapers look beautiful. We missed the 8:00 PM view of the skyline which is supposedly a must 'to do' thing in HongKong

Great skyline.. It is hard to believe the number and size of the buildings adorning the Hong Kong skyline. The nightly 8PM laser show is entertaining if you are in Kowloon or on the Star Ferry. Each building seems to have its own uniqueness.

Hong Kong at night. What a fabulous sight is the Hong Kong skyline at night, especially if you have a laser light show, and perhaps fireworks. It is absolutely magical. I have been to many capital cities but this was the best so far. It's pretty good during the day time too !!

Symphony of Lights - best viewed from Avenue of Stars - TST Promenade. We were staying at Holiday Inn, TST. So, the TST promenade is a short walk away. Walk towards Middle rd, take subway to cross Salisbury rd, then towards HK Space museum and TST Promenade.There is a light & sound show daily between 8pm and 820pm. For a good view and good informal seat on TST Promenade, reach by 730pm.The HK Skyline by night is very pretty - all the famous buildings are brightly lit up. The light & sound show is a bit overrated - so its best to see on Day 1 if you want to unwind without doing any hectic sightseeing and retire early to be fresh to see the other bigger attractions from Day 2 of your tour.The narration is in Cantonese & English on alternate days - so if you are very keen to listen to English make sure you visit on the right day. However, as said earlier, it does not matter - we recommend you visit this on your day of arrival - the show is self explanatory - take some pics - walk on the promenade - enjoy it eating a softy and proceed to dinner and early bedtime - to get refreshed for some real sighseeing on Day 2.

Impressive!. The view is impressive. The city is pulsating, always on the move, and very fast. People everywhere... I would even say, that Hongkong is the only city in the world that has a special, unique smell.

An amazing view of the skyline. A beautiful view by night, some lady tried to take a photo and said it was 20 dollars then after she took several photo she increased it to 100 dollars, be careful and remember the 20 dollar photo is small one 100 dollar is for the large one,

One of the greatest still in the world :-). Every time I visit Hong Kong I am still blown away with its skyline, the view from Kowloon is a must and the Ferry service is always so easy to use.I will return again :-)

See a big world-class city, that's it. Unless you're traveling here for shopping you can't do at home, Hong Kong is about experiencing the city to broaden your international horizons. The ocean of skyscrapers is sobering, a lifestyle that must wear on you after a while. The tram up to The Peak is jammed crazy, so take the 15 bus up, and if the lines are manageable, take the tram down. On arrival buy the 3-day Octopus card with your Airport Express train fare. Add $50HK and you'll have unlimited subway plus enough bus fare plus the Star Ferry back and forth to Kowloon, with change leftover. The skyline at night shouldn't be missed, but frankly the "festival of lights" at 8 pm isn't really very dramatic. Worth seeing the crowd and charter boats. It's free, and worth the price of admission. Two days is enough unless you're going to a venue for music or entertainment.

One of its kind. The light show is, well, a light show. Music + effects are nothing special, but the settings is breathtaking. Also, the crowd that gathers to watch it has a special, optimistic, happy vibe.
Stunning Views. This is a must see, beautiful views of Hong Kong. The lit buildings, the neon wraparounds and the later light shows are great.

Habor laser light show. Great Free tourist attraction, so happy we were able to catch the Harbor light show during our short stay; view is best from Tsim Tsa Tusi side towards HK. Near the Hotel Sheraton and Peninsula

Magic. The Hong Kong skyline at night was full of glitz and glamour. To often see all that smog during the day and then the beautiful lights at night is no comparison. A very pretty and not to be missed skyline. You get a better view from the Kowloon side.

Must visit. There is nothing like the Hong Kong skyline, many of the buildings are lit and gorgeous but the whole view is exquisite during the day or night, even if you do nothing else in the city, check out the skyline....

Must see. Very nice at night from Kowloon. China in general seems to be busy and loud city but it only appear this way. Its very piecefull and beautifull place to see.
Go for the light show round 20:00 and see yourself

Vibrant light show. Get a view of the hong kong skyline from Victoria peak. When night falls, the buildings light up, some with heart motifs light show and the bank of China building with its flashing strips of light.

Visit Victoria Peak. You should be sure to visit Victoria Peak if you find yourself in Hong Kong. Take a taxi up there and follow Lugard Road around the curve of the mountainside. You'll get an amazing 180-degree view of the fantastic city skyline.

Spectacular sights. The HK skyline at night is one of the sights to see in HK. Especially the view of the HK skyline from the pier on the Kowloon side close to the Star ferry terminal. You can take a picnic and settle in the 'Avenue of Stars' for a great evening.

Awesome View. One of the best skyline I've seen. Standing opposite the beautifully-lit building while enjoying the night breeze is one of the best feeling in the world. Best enjoyed while taking the boat ride!
Psst!! I personally think this is also a very good spot for love confession or proposal. Who can say no in that kind of surroundings? ;)
The famous view in Hong kong. you can find the best view from Hong kong here. come before 8pm and save your place. dont forget to wear your jacket because its very windy.

Lovely in the morning . As I was jet lagged and couldn't sleep I decided to walk along the prom.
Got a beautiful sunrise and tranquillity of an empty prom other than the occasional jogger and tai chi enthusiast

An amazing collection of astounding buildings. Hong Kong is a city for everyone, with a skyline that defies description and bars that welcome you with a happy hour. Local food in the restaurants was superb.
Amazing. Is such a distinct and beautiful view reflecting off Victoria Harbor, cool buildings, lots of colour, just hope that theres not to much smog

Never gets boring. WE stopped off at the harbour after having our evening meal at Jimmy's Kitchen. We have seen the view on both cloudy and clear evenings and tbh it doesn't distract from the beauty. Try to get there for the light show which happens every night at around 8pm and you will not be disappointed.

HK Skyline and the light/sound show. We watched the skyline from Harbour City side, from our hotel in Kwun Tong, from Victoria Peak. Yeah you can see from many places. You will not miss this and worth watching it at night. You can also enjoy the same on a boat ride for HKD 2.5.

Beautiful. Hong Kong skyline is so distinct and beautiful. Reflecting off Victoria Harbor, cool buildings, lots of color, lots of variety and easy to see from different venues. I enjoy the views especially when highlighted with the Symphony of Lights. Worth it

Just Fabulous sight. Symphony of lights is best viewed from Tsim Tsa Tusi from opposite Hotel Sheraton.
Hong Kong skyline is so distinct and beautiful .There is lots of variety , lots of colour
huge cool buildings and easy to see from different venues .I enjoy the view from peak
and Kowloon side too.
nice view hotel. excellent service and fantastic location, overall experience was good, i recommend personally to take stay.

Most amazing skyline in the world!. The HK skyline is my favorite in the world. Looking from Kowloon over to HK island is an amazing view. Picture perfect. And even the view vice versa is stunning. At night but also during the day one of the most impressive views of any capital city in the world.
Great visit. A must see..!! Take the city buses after travelling on the ferry ...the best way to see Hong Kong....
A great photo op. Watch the light display each evening - a must if visiting Hong Kong for the first time. This skyline is one of Asia's most iconic.

Beautiful skyline. I saw this at two different times, day and night. During the day it isn't much of a sight. It's hazy, dirty looking and pretty unattractive. At night it's a whole different ball game. The haze isn't a factor and all the animated lights from the buildings, and the reflection of the skyline in the water is amazing. Maybe 3rd best skyline I've seen so far.

8pm show. HK like any other big Asian city has several skyscrapers - a problem with less land and more people. However, when HK island skyscrapers are lit up at night, they're an amazing sight to behold. What makes it even more beautiful is when the light show is on display at 8pm. The best place to observe the same is across the harbour from the Tsim Sha Tsui clock tower and viewing deck. One should take the phenomenally well-priced Star Ferry across to maximize the entertainment value.

Fabulous both during the day and especially at night!!. Hong Kong skyline is so distinct and beautiful. Reflecting off Victoria Harbor, cool buildings, lots of color, lots of variety and easy to see from different venues. I enjoy the view from the Peak, but like the view from the Kowloon side promenade the best. -- especially when highlighted with the Symphony of Lights, It just never gets old...

Love Star Ferry; Use it Day & Night. Be sure to use the Star Ferry during the day and the night. Great to see the city during the day and for the night views, its sooo Hong Kong!Very reasonable. A lot of construction work on the exit on Pier 7 on the island and a bit of a walk to Central MTR, could do with a clear taxi rank perhaps on exit. Wan Chai Pier was less hectic. We got on/off at the Star Ferry Pier both times.Just buy a little token from the small box before you board. They are very regular. Seat backs move both ways for different directions of travel.

Symphony of Lights. This is best viewed from Tsim Tsa Tsui from opposite Hotel Sheraton. Wouldn't say its a do not miss sight.. But if you are around in the area then go ahead.. But please find out if its on as i heard its been shut down for repairs/maintenance recently.
Just fantastic HK skyline. Lights are worth a watch every time we are in HK, the whole experience makes our trip every time we visit.

Got to be the Best. Its simply unforgettable, beautiful, vibrant an absolute must see. fact is - its unavoidable! We were lucky enough to be here for 1st October Independence Day celebrations - the fireworks were cream on top of cream! Stunning
Amazing light show. Night sky with light show was impressive. Also a walk along the waterfront during the day was very interesting
Beautiful at night. I love Hong Kong, but Hong Kong at night is spectacular. The view from Harbour city at the skyline is fantastic - not to be missed!

Nice. We could view the skyline from our room on the 27th floor, it was very pretty. We were not able to take the harbor tour, but I suspect that would be quite pretty as well, although it seemed very pricey at the time.
Hong Kong Skyline. The city has many tall buildings and we are lucky to stay at ICC on 117 floor and we could see all the tall buildings in mainland china and in Kowloon area.
The Star Ferry 1 hour night tour. A very good 1 hour trip but was a cloudy night and the light strobes not so bright but still enjoyable.

Simply stunning, amazing views in the evening. The view from the purpose built viewing platform is simply stunning. It's no surprise that so many people gather to stare in amazement. Quite a photo opportunity and a place to sit (if your lucky enough), and just soak up the sights.The various boats and ferries plying back and forth add to the atmosphere, especially the sightseeing junks which are all lit up in the evening.Rarely does a skyline make you sit and stare in awe.....Highly recommended, be sure to make time on your itinerary to view in the evening.
Amazing skyline. Hong Kong was fabulous...but the air pollution was a bit much! I was very surprised at how polluted it was. Incredible shopping deals

One of the worlds most iconic skylines - you MUST see it!. Day or night this is one of the classic city skylines, but night is when it really comes to life. Best viewed from the Kowloon side there are a multitude of skyscrapers each with a different pattern of lights, beautifully reflected in the harbour. Make the trip and you won't be disappointed.

Always amazing. The skyline is simply mesmerising. There is always something coming and going or lights changing colour. It may be a good idea to take a boat ride at night to get the full benefit or simply have a hotel with views over the skyline.
Hong Kong Skyline. Anything you can do to see the skyline of Hong Kong is worth doing especially from the Peak. do the walk around the Peak as well and visit the shops!

Easy to see why it's number 1. Its hard to think of any new ways to talk of the sheer beauty of this skyline, especially at night, that hasn't been said already. Words can't really do it any justice so just go and see it for yourself.Best way, for us at least, was to experience it on the Star Ferry harbour cruise or the Aqualuna tour.Breathtaking.
Worth a look at. Walk down in the evening and look at all the night lights. Weather beautiful lots of buskers and pleasant walk along the bay

See from the Star Ferry. Many reviews of this iconic harbour vista, it can however some times be obscured by cloud/smog so you take your chance, ride the Star Ferry you will not be dissapointed, go on the lower deck where you can see the propulsion engine if you like that sort of experience.

brilliant night time skyline!. the sky line is visable from many points, the ferry terminal near the star building in very good as you can get a slightly elevated view.
we also sat at one of the many restaurants Hutong and watched the laser light show. The HSBC (i think ) building is spectacular.
spectacular. HK skyline is one of the most memorable and beautiful attractions I have seen in Asia. The evening lights show is spectacular. Best views are from up high or by the harbor.

Really beautiful even without the Symphony of Lights. Went here during the day and night. Even with the smog, the view was still stunning. Some would prefer to wait for the Symphony of Lights at 8pm, but I was underwhelmed and it is not a total loss if you cannot fit the Symphony of Lights in your itinerary. The best vantage view in Tsim Sha Tsui is south of the Hong Kong Cultural Center!

Spectacular world-class night view. Hong Kong's night view is known as world-class grade. You may take of view of the Victoria Harbour. And everyday at 8pm, there is lighting performance on the signature buildings. If you visit Hong Kong, the skyline should be on the top of your checklist.

Iconic. The views of this magnificent skyline from just about anywhere, at any time of the day are just brilliant. There might be smog about, but it still only detracts a little from this icon.The lightshow at 8pm each night is pretty underwhelming I must say though.

Cant beat it. Best in the world without a doubt. Definitely worth checking out day and night from different vantage points. Take the tram to the Peak or walk up if you are fit. Be a tourist and check out the Avenue of Stars in the evening at TST for a different aspect. Finally, there is nothing better to check out the view from the Star Ferry. Go back and forward. It is the best value transport in HK.

Most famous skyline. Once you have seen it you will understand why it is so memorable. It's lovely to walk along the harbour on the island side but for the most memorable view take the HK$2.50/HK$3.40 (22p/29p) Star Ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade for the evening light show at 8pm. It's every evening but the commentary is only in English on certain days so check with the tourist office first.
Astonishing night view. It absolutely worth to see those lights shinning from commerical bulidings, you will know what a charming city it is

What is there to say. Simply beautiful. A breathtaking view for people who like urban landscape. Don't forget to take some pictures or go to the Ozon bar on the rooftop of the Ritz Carlton hotel to see the skyline much better.

Just amazing. .. This is just one of the things you should do !!
It's like nowhere else on the planet, mesmerising, magnificent and memorable !!!
Hong Kong skyline from Kowloon. Great views of the evening skyline from across the harbor in Kowloon. Great place to view the nightly light show
Amazing light show. Once it gets dark all the buildings provide a laser light show, walk the Avenue of Stars and enjoy the views.

8th wonder of the world. Everyone should visit hong kong once in a lifetime to witness the hong kong skyline, its breathtaking, very much like the newyork skyline but different,spent 4 day here and wish i could have spent double that,never realised that Hong Kong has the most skyscrapers in the world, almost twice as much as the Big apple,cant wait to return, its a Massive Gem

Hong Kong at night. One of the top 3 skylines in the world, Do the peaks and just look around. Worth three days of anyone's time, Beware though its fiercely commercial and sadly this means that everyone wants as much from you as they can in the shortest possible time.

Very beautiful in the evening. Definitely worth watching the skyline in the evening, and also remember to take the Star Ferry to watch it as well."Light Show" at 20.00 is nothing special.Walking along the pier in the evening is definitely recommmended!
Light Show is a must. don't miss going to Victoria Harbor in the evening to see the beautiful skyline. A laser light show is scheduled between 8:00 p.m. - 8:20 p.m. Very romantic.
Laser show. Laser show was not what I thought it would be. Expected bigger and better so was a little disappointed. Hotel Panorama had a viewing sky deck which was excellent.
Iconic. One of the great skylines of the world. There are many places to see the overview on the area. You do need to be lucky to have a clear day without the heat haze and pollution.
Just a must. This is one that must be seen. Even the weather was hazy on both night I was trying to see it. Its just great.

Night Cruise. Night Cruise to watch the light show with unlimited alcoholic drinks for approx £30 well worth it, booked at the Tourist Office at the Star Ferry Port really easy. I would recommend doing this was a nice way to have 4 glasses of wine and chill for an hour.
Hong Kong Skyline. The skyline is spectacular. Also enjoyed the light show, although that was a bit less of a thrill than we anticipated!

Magnificent view. I love the Hong kong skyline, the skyscrapers light up and they offer an outstanding light show.
Love to take the ferry to cross to hong kong island just to marble at the view.
Hong Kong harbor is one of my favorite harbor from around the world.
Beautiful Hong Kong. Whether you see it at night, or during the day, the Hong Kong skyline is always amazing! Take the ferry from Kowloon to Victoria and enjoy!
The HK Skyline is worth seeing. I took the Star Ferry to get an unobstructed view of the skyline - it was worth it. HK is a world class city and the skyline is beautiful.
Go at night. We stayed on Kowloon side and the view at night was stunning. Well worth the walk along the promenade.

Stunning. Best viewed from the Kowloon side, it is one of the most famous man made views in the world .
Try going at 7.00 in the 4vening and watch the amazing laser show.

Lots of interest , particularly the nightly light show. The skyline of Hong Kong has many interesting buildings. At 8pm each evening the buildings are illuminated, and if you tune to a local station you also get commentary and music to go with the light show. Some days are quite hazy and the skyline is not so clearly defined, which is a pity.

Great Sky at Night. Find a nice bar or restaurant that is on a high floor and get a great scene across the harbour and enjoy the lights and lasers ( at 8pm every night). Many of the high bars carry the music that accompanies the light show

One of the best. The views over Hong Kong Harbour never fail to amaze. One of the best in the world. There is so much to see in and around the area. Have a sail on one of the many harbour trips. The star ferry is a must.

Beautiful and somewhat relaxing. Definiately worth a look, at 8pm theres also the only retro light show, don't think its anything grand but considering it's over 10 years old and above it was impressive when it first came out.
great night views get a harbour cruise. had a great time with my wife on the duck ling we have done this on a day time & night cruise very enjoyable

From TST is great. Go to TST just for this. A great view of HK skyline. Just stay on the pier in front of Harbor City mall and the lights, perspectives and colors will take you breathe away. From 8-9pm is the best

Best Skyline in the world. Hong Kong skyline is the best in the world. I have travelled to many cities and never seen so a beautiful skyline in another city. It is suggested to try different angle like walk along the tsimshatsui harbour front, go to the peak and go up the icc tower to see this beautiful signature icon of Hong Kong. Two more important suggestions, one must see at night, two must view from Kowloon side. It just breath taking skyline.

Symphony of Lights. We did the Symphony of Lights Tour and thought it to be a big ordinary. The best time to be at the Harbour is on sundown when the lights are all coming on. I believe that is far more beautiful. Also do it on the "Duckling" old chinese fishing boat. So relaxing and a great way to sail around the harbour.

One of the best evening views. There are not many skylines that look this good of an evening. With so much happening, there is an awesome view no mater which way you look. To make the most of the view, catch a star ferry so you can see both sides of the habour,
A view for a lifetime. I really recommend finding a waterfront place to sit and view the skyline around sunset then prepare for the light show. Its spectacular and unique.
Amazing!. I have travelled to HK for a number of years now and never tire of this view. The light show is also a must see from the Kowloon side.

Unique. Dear friends, this show is a must. The panoramic view of the skyline of Hong Kong -from both sides of the city, either you're looking at it form the shore of Kowloon or the other way round- is something really impressive.I recommend the night view..

Best seen at sunset then at Symphony of Lights. The huge advantage of HK's skyline is that it can be enjoyed from multiple points. I have seen it from the Peak, from both sides, from my hotel room, etc.But if you want to enjoy the light show, best is to be at ground level at 8pm. You will enjoy the symphony of lights, which is one of the best things to see in HK

highlight of hongkong trip. the avenue of stars at tsim sha shui is the place to be watching the symphony of lights and the amazing skyline.the view and the podium to watch is really good.do spend few hours exploring the entire area,you will not be disappointed .go early evening.

Skyline printed on fire in my eyes!!. Best Hong-Kong skyline you can see, in my opinion is from Kowloon, where you can see the contrast between traditional boats called Junk and tall buildings on financial district. The Hong-Kong bay is very busy during all day and night.
Well worth seeing!. Hong Kong skyline is very nice. To be seen during the day and also at night. The lightining show is not that worth, though, since the lights are there before and after 8 PM.
Beautiful night skylines. The Hong Kong daily night light show is beautiful. However it is planning to be stopped soon. So recommend to catch it before it ends.

Hong Kong Skyline. Must see from The Peak. Take a tram to the Peak and go to the Observation deck.
The view is excellent. Loved it.
Honk Kong Skyline - Awsome. Unbelievable but true, The Hong Kong skyline, seeing is believing and it gets more awsome when you are at Victoria Peak and its Cloudy
Perfect evening walk. I loved walking around the avenue of stars by night and enjoy the magnificent view! You should definitely pass by if you are visiting HK!
Great views. Lots of great things to see. Weather plays a key factor but well worth the effort. Loved it. I'd go back for the cool views with so much to see!

A wonder of the world !!. Absolutely breathtaking view of the skyline from the harbour either by day or by night. An experience that must be undertaken once in a lifetime. I implore anyone with a chance to visit this marvellous city to do so !!

What an experience.. I could not believe my eyes when i first turned the corner onto Victoria harbour- it took my breath away. We went there primarily to see the Bruce Lee statue and the avenue of the stars but had to say the view was amazing. We took a trip on the harbour water to see the lasers which in itself was disappointing the the view from the water made up for it

Iconic. I have visited Hong Kong a few times over the past 15 years and I am always awed by the city skyline, especially of looking at it to watch the lightshow - every night 8pm. It's what a proper city skyline should look like.
Especially atmospheric at night with the boats, music, and people bustling around.

Light Show. It is one of the most interesting skylines in the world to me. As I know HKG since more than 30 years. During the day is very nice but in the evening it is fantastic with all the lights. Every evening by 8 pm the start a sound and light show. It says it is in English, mandarin or cantonese but it really doesn't matter because they normally only mention the companies who take part in it. The show last 12-15 minutes.
Stunning skyline!!!. The view is fantastic, plus it is free to see, Can be seen from anywhere in the city. All the skyscrapers are definitely a site to see.

Fantastic view. Sky line views are fantastic we saw them from hotel and on star ferry we have some great photos.Enjoyed sitting on 41st floor of our hotel with either glass of champagne or cocktail what more could you want amazing.

Good Evening Light show every Day @8. If I am in Hong Kong and if I get a free evening, I do visit this place. It's a nice place to just spend few hours, then take your dinner at some of the closest good restaurants nearby and go home/hotel. The light show @8PM everyday is very nice to watch. A must see if you are in Hong Kong for the first time.Happy Experiencing Life...!!!

one of the two most iconic skylines in the world. If smog is not too strong, you can enjoy the charming vista of the Hong Kong skyline, probably the most iconic skyline in the world, from the Kowloon embankment. As often, twilight is the best time to transform the day into the totally different colourful night skyline.
Night lights. So much to see. The daily night laser show which starts at 8pm is definitely worth and look. We loved it. The skyline of Hong Kong is very pretty at night.
De-light-ful. Skyline is stunning whether seen from a rooftop or down in the harbour or at street level. The promenade also provides a stunning view.

Iconic View.. This iconic view is just so fantastic, and amazing to see it for real at night with all the buildings illuminated. There is a special light show every evening but after finding a vantage point and waiting an hour for it to start, I was disappointed. It didn`t add much to the view, just some music and a few laser lights really. We could have given this a miss.

Beautiful but beware,-construction begins. Visited in mid August and they were scheduling construction... May be finished as it's October.Beautiful view, night and day. There was lots of standing room and bench areas to enjoy. Nice place to hang out.
Impressive view. If you are on the Kowloon side you will get a wonderful view looking over the bay towards Hong Kong Island. Don't miss it at night time as the buildings light up beautifully.
HK Night Lights are a must see!. Saw the famous HK night lights a couple of times whilst we were in HK. Definitely something that everyone should see when visiting HK.
Good and free lights show ... Need to see it at least one time, when you visit Hong Kong, everyday at 8pm, they do free show of laser ligths and music. Kowloon size.
skyline at night is amazing. A great photo opportunity, very colourful, they certainly like to light up their buildings with lots of lights.

HK view. Got to see this once in your life. The view to Kowloon is good from HK island and one can see a lot from a well place hottel, but go to Kowloon and take a look across to HK island. The lights, signs and buildings are a wonderful sight.
Hong Kong Sky Line. Along Victoria Harbour, always shown in Korean shows... it is definately a nice place to go and see the lights at the buildings.

One reason to see Hong Kong. One of the reasons to visit Hong Kong is its skyline. Tall modern buildings reaching for the sky are incredible to see not only during the day, but also at night when they light up. Go see the skyline from Victoria Peak or from Kowloon.
A must do.... It was absolutely breathtaking, most famous especially at night with the laser show, bring your best camera! You can also catch a ferry to watch…

Spectacular at night. Best thing to do is go to the bar on the top floor of the Sheraton Hotel (Kowloon side) at night. The drinks are a little expensive but the view is just amazing and well worth it especially if you are a first time visitor ( although we have been there several times and always go to the Sheraton for drinks,)
Spectacular lights and sounds. The city skyline as viewed from either side of the bay proves the busy and vibrant nightlife everywhere in town.
Always beautiful. I love the skyline. Every time I go, I take skyline pics! Go during Earth Day and you can view the entire skyline in darkness. Pretty neat!

Not to be missed. I always make it a point to marvel at this magnificent sight everytime i go to Hong Kong. Very iconic and worthy of (camera) clicks! Bring a tripod if you want to snap great photos at night.
Simply Superb. The best of Hong Kong visit. So beautiful, we will forget every thing else. Must watch in the day as well as in the night too. Nice panoramic view.

Stunning skyline. It is absolutely stunning, our first city in Asia and we were memorized. Would watch it night after night if we could.
A definite must see the daytime views are fantastic but at night the skyline blew us away .Get to Kowloon prom it ca be busy here but worth it.
V. Impressive. Certainly the most impressive skyline I've seen - worth visiting during the day and during the evening. There is a light show every evening at 8pm.

Iconic......... A sight to behold during both day and night. This is undoubtedly one of the most iconic views in the world. Viewed from the harbour side it is amazing but viewed from Victoria peak is stunning. Night time is great to see and the laser show was worth a visit.
Very disappointing ..... We were dissappointed. Everyone waiting with bated breath for the laser lights which was nothing to write home about. I expected more of a display .......

HK Skyline. The best place to enjoy the Hong Kong Skyline is at the lobby place at the Intercontinental Kowloon.
I would call it a "One Million Dollar" view.
The Best of HK. The skyline of Hong Kong is really like no other. Do not forget to watch the absolutely amazing Symphony of Lights show!

Colourful as can be!. Amazing view.......
Where ever you travel in HK, you should return in the night to the city to see the colourful skyline

Beautiful buildings by night!. missed the lights and laser show.. however, the walk down the star avenue and the view of the hongkong skyline was beautiful.. didn't know until now that concrete buildings can create a beautiful view in itself.. it was good evening walk.. definitely a tourist spot!

Stunning view. An fantastic view, specially in the evening, to see the lights and the laser show at 8:00. you can use several minutes just to look at the illuminated buildings and take photos of them.

Skyline beatiful but light show is stupid. The sky line of HK is really zmazing, breathtaking, and you feel like you are in a post card,
I could not believe how beautiful it is. The light show at 20:00 was so dissppinting that I could not stay untill the end.
Skip the show znd just enjoy the great skyline..

Beautiful sunset and Symphony of Lights. Beautiful at sunset. Watched the "Symphony of Lights" at the Avenue of the Stars, which was a free laser light show at 8pm. It was not very impressive, but free. Had I known it was about 10 minutes and not very impressive, I wouldn't have planned our day around it.
HK Skyline. The place is always clean and offers a wide panoramic view on the harbour. It's a nice spot to observe the city lights and to enjoy the sight of the sea at night.

The HK presentation place!. Hong Kong expats told me - thats why we are living here :)))of course its not a main reason, but how right they are - this view is one of the best in my life!i saw it from 3 angles and you never get enough of it))))first one is from Victoria Peak! MUST visit! the views are breathtaking from the TOPsecond is during the Victoria Bay night cruise. during the cruise you can fully enjoy the both sides of Victoria Bay, with all lights looking how traditional Chinese boats and big liners are passing slowly. your eyes are happy :)))and third from Ritz Carlton Hotel 118 floor MUST visit also

Stunning Hong Kong. Homg Kongs skyline is simply amazing and without a doubt one of the best in the world. Having Kowloon on one, and Hong Kong Island on the other side, with Victoria Harbour in between is nothing but spectacular. There are so many different viewing points and angles to enjoy the view, from both sides of the harbour. Dont miss it out to get great views from both sides. Star Ferry is ideal to commute between and enjoy great views too.
Great views and lots to see. Great views of the sky line and good photos to be taken. Worth a visit. Lots of shops near by many of which a designer shops and jewellery shops.

Incredible skyline and so many building cranes!. The buildings are so tall gives one the sense of being in a forest composed of skyscrapers. Interesting to be provided with the background of many of the buildings on the Big Bus and Peak commentaries. These are so many building cranes as every day work continues to increase the number of skyscrapers in this area. We were told that over 50% of the world's cranes are being used in China at this point.Loved seeing the old building method of using bamboo scaffolding on construction of the lower parts of some buildings. At night the skyline is even more dramatic and beautiful.
Beautiful. Its a skyline unlike any other major city. Be sure to enjoy the festival of lights from both the Hong Kong and Kawloon side,

Amazing views of Hong Kong from Kowloon. Best place to see the Hong Kong skyline, without the crowds is to head for the Royal Pacific Hotel on Canton Road through the entrance from Kowloon Park. Every night at 8pm, the sound and light show takes place when the Hong Kong skylight comes alive to the sound of music and light. Best place to see this is at the Avenue of the Stars, although it can be very crowded here.
Skyline. With the Hong Kong sky line you get special effects at night . The City is large mixed and evolving into the 3,000 s. Enjoy the life that dwells here

Good view at night time.. Kind of useless seeing this during the day time as the smog might hide any good view. But totally worth it at night. At 8 PM there is a light show with some music. It's always better to be outside of main Hong Kong island, looking toward it.

Better than Manhattan. We saw it from 2 locations: from Victoria Peak (no need to pay for the observatory - just head 25 meters to the left of the train and you get a great view for free) as well as from the Kowloon side. Both are impressive - with perhaps a better view from Kowloon. Brighter than Manhattan, and with the 8pm light show also a nice addition. There's a very impressive light effect show on the ICC building on the Kowloon side - and that specifically can be better viewed from HK Island.
great view from across the bay. A short hop across the bay on a ferry boat or metro - better to watch from the Avenue of the Stars at night - but also very impressive at day time
Stunning View. The Hong Kong skyline is absolutely beautiful! We saw it from various points in the city but no matter it was always spectacular!

Go in the night to get a good view of skyline.. Not much of a skyline as compared to that of the States. Anyway, it is always foggy and hazy in the day and slightly better at night but not the evening. Go in the night will be good.

Water - Lights and Lasers!. This show is spectacular from the top of Victoria Peak. You can take a tram or bus to the top but I recommend a taxi to avoid the long line ups. Taxis are very affordable in Hong Kong.

Beautiful View. The Hong Kong city skyline is beautiful. So many great colours and unique architectural designs. We visited on one evening when they play music to the light show. It gets very busy and so many people talk which does take away from the musical experience.
A Night Time Must. You can see the skyline best from Kowloon promenade or from a harbour cruise which can easily be organised. Which ever you choose you will not be disappointed.
Impressive. Travelled across to Kowloon on the Star Ferry and at around 8pm some of the buildings lit up, laser lights, great photo opportunity.

You can never get tired of this!. There are no other city with such an amazing skyline. The lights, the harbor, the buildings are all mesmerising. Be sure to catch the light show from IFC or the TST harborfront!

Spectacular sight. Hong Kong is quite overwhelming and the skyline is incredible. It is difficult to comprehend the sheer number of buildings, cheek by jowl, reaching skywards. The view from Kowloon towards Hong Kong Island is quite overwhelming, specially when the buildings are lit up at night. It is worth a stroll down to the waterfront - but don't go specially for the laser show; it is a bit of a disappointment.
Hong Kong light shows. View this from the Star Ferry at night It's lights are brilliant at 8 o clock in the evening. Get a different view during the day
Breath-taking view. Breath-taking view, especially on the star ferry, is probably the best way to enjoy this scenic adventure... U certainly will not regret....
A must but do not expect too much. Assemble early and enjoy the public and experience in a rather uninteresting display of lights that do not enervate

View from the Star Ferry a World Class View. There are great views from either side of Victoria Harbor of the skyline but the best way to see all of the views is from the Star Ferry in the middle of the harbor during the crossing to/from Hong Kong Island, or Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui). Get to the Kowloon side early in the evening to get a good view of the light show that Central Hong Kong displays every evening at 8:00PM.

Go for walk along Victoria Habour to enjoy the sunrise!. Lovely, if you can try to stay at one of the hotels facing the Victoria Habour that would be awesome! I personally love it during the sunrise/morning run or walk along the victoria habour! Not to be missed!

Hong Kong Skyline. Obviously I have already rated very highly the view from Victoria Peak of the Hong Kong skyline which in my humble opinion is one of the most spectacular in the world. However there is another option which to some will probably appeal even more. Just jump on the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbor to Kowloon. It's a fantastic and unique way to view the city. It's really cheap too. Great value for money.

Hong Kong by boat.. Hong Kong's harbour and skyline is just brilliant. We saw it from The Legend of the Seas leaving Hong Kong. One of the most beautiful harbours in the world. If you take the Star Ferry you can enjoy this beautiful sight.

Good but not the best. Had a good view of the Hong Kong at night going on the harbour cruise at night from Victoria peak and Kowloon. The laser show starts at 20 00hrs and is good but only lasts about 2 minutes it is best viewed from Kowloon tsim sha sui. At 21 00hrs other buildings come alive with lights amazing show. But if you really want to see a good show try the bund at Shanghai
Amazing..... The Hong Kong skyline is everything you would imagine it to be. Spectacular, we loved it and feel so very blessed to have had the privilege to experience such a wonderful view.
Best viewing from TST. Excellent for night walk in HK as you can see the best of Hong Kong. All the lights are beautifully placed around the mountain which is ideally for photo shooting
The best skylines in the world. We were amazed in how a city can look so amazing at night. Hong Kong is beautiful to look at at night with amazing colours and lights. The city is well designed.

Gorgeous, Amazing Skylines, outlining this fantastic vibrant city!. Fantastic skyline and superb view. Watch the free laser show at 8.00pm for 13 minutes each night. Wonderful! The entire city shoreline and harbour lights up. A beautiful diverse city.

Amazing, most probably the best in the world. . We have been to Hong Kong thrice in last 4 years. There are lot of things to see and do in Hong Kong but gazing the skyline from Victoria harbour / Avenue of Stars, whether in day or night is mesmerising. Though skyline in Singapore's Marina Bay and Shanghai's Bund are wonderful, Hong Kong's skyline is the best. Just stroll down the promenade and catch a glimpse of the mighty towers and not to forget to take a snap with the buildings in the background. At night, it becomes enchanting with the Light and Sound show with laser display in the sky. A must see for anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Mixed cultrues Of Hong Kong. Hong Kong is not what I expected as we were getting ready for our visit. But I enjoyed the visit and the adventure. Most of the people we met there were friendly and they tried to be helpful. THe city is beautiful and is a mix of many cultures, Western as well as Eastern. Beautiful while crowded, but it is expensive and at tiem has the feel of LA's Rodeo Drive with the really expensive shops sell the latest New York, Paris items.
Breathtaking. Best view of the Hong Kong Skyline is from the Victoria Peak at night. The Victoria Harbour is breathtaking.

Panoramic. A picture postcard view point to savor the sights of Hong Kong. Located at Tsim Tsa Shui , close to the iconic Peninsula hotel , Musuem & planetarium, the Avenue of stars promenade is the best vantage point to view the army of skyscrapers on the Hong Kong island. There is a light and laser show daily at 8 pm which transforms the place into a colorful spectacle. This can get crowded especially during the weekends and holidays. I preferred to visit it early morning around 630 am when there was hardly anyone other than those enjoying their morning walks and exercise. Suggest you walk from the Avenue of Stars end to the clock tower end where you get the heritage Star Ferry to take you back to Hong Kong island. This would enable you get a feel of the harbour, the Peak in the distance and the skyscrapers saying " welcome to HK".
A sea front with a view!. The lights sparkling from the financial institutions in the evening gives you a real NYC feel, sit across the view and sip a beer or just take a jog along it
Amazing Lighting. This is a really nice place especially at nights with all those lights that give you a nice view from both sides

Symphony of Lights. Good experience with the Symphony of Lights. Although not what i expected (was thinking it was a show with narrative) it was still very worthwhile as there are other things to see there. We were on the kowloon side.
Best View on the Planet. My most favorite city on earth. We always stay at the Kowlook Shangri La and get a Harborside room where we get a spectacular view of the HK skyline. Breathtaking.

8th Marvel of the world. There is no another one , and the skyline of HK id probably one of the most impressive ones. I would advise tu come and go by ferry to and from one of the piers - central or wan chai and of course kowloon. great experience
Simply Stunning. We never get tired of looking at the Hong Kong skyline. The Lunar New Year decorations and displays are especially beautiful.

Stunning. We went down to the waterfront for the nightly light show. You didn't need a show as the night skyline was breathtaking.
The boats going past in the harbour enhanced the scene.
An experience not to be missed.

The Best View in the World. I have visited the city well in excess of 10 times now, and stayed in numerous rooms overlooking the harbour, as well as enjoying many a beer overlooking the harbour, and nowhere else in the world comes close, city skyline, countryside, aerial views...nothing!Hong Kong is the greatest city in the world, and the skyline matches this. As much as I love Shanghai's skyline from the Bund, it doesn't come close to this!

One of the most beautiful night time skyline I have ever seen. Try to get on a night time harbour cruise (1 to 2 hours) and you will remember your unique experience. See my previous reviews where I suggest to enquire at your hotel or attend one of theHK tourist Centres or google "Discover Hong Kong" website. A little planning can help maximise your enjoyment time in this magical place. Enjoy.

Great Views from every angle. There seems to be no limit to the heights if the buildings in Hong Kong, even a regular condominium is often 50 stories in height. As you travel around the coastal areas you experience one great skyline after another and from your hotel you get more great views from a higher vantage point.
Spectacular. One of the World's greatest man made views - worth the ferry trip across the harbor. Make sure you see it at night too!
Don't miss. Symphony of lights makes the skyline ten times better than during the day. Have your mind and camera ready.
HK skyline is beautiful. Been to Hong Kong twice and I never fail to visit this place to view the spectacular lights of HK Skyline.

Lovely evening. So pretty at night time, definitely worth seeing the light show. You can get some really amazing pictures. It's a nice way to spend some time in the evening and you get a nice breeze too.

Great sight. Just being in Hong Kong is great but at night time the lights are worth a trip to the foreshore to see them. With the junks and other water craft sailing by it makes it even more interesting to see. the light show they put on is also good to see even if it does get a little crowed along the river edge. Have a look from both sides if you can.

Go at Night. Great light show at around 8 pm every night. Great view from the Hong Kong Cultural Center in TST right beside the star Ferry terminal on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. And yes it is Free
Love it!. Take the star ferry to the Kowloon side to see the Hong Kong skyline lit up and the light show along with the sampans and other traditional fishing boats.
Fantastic!. The Hong Kong Skyline is an attraction not to be missed. There are so many beautiful buildings which are especially beautiful when lit up at night.
Best Harbour in the World by night. Take an evening Harbour trip, the views are just awesome. So quite as well for such a big and bustling City. Memories will stay with you.

You've never seen a skyline like HK!. Many ways to see the glorious HK skyline: form the water of Victoria Harbor on the Star Ferry. From the top of Victoria Peak. Out your hotel room window. It's a world of its own, thousands upon thousands upon thousands of very tall, very skinny buildings housing apartments, shops, businesses. Kinda like Midtown Manhattan times about 100.
A MUST SEE. The night time harbour laser show viewed from the harbour side is a must see. This show starts every evening around 8pm.

The Walk of Stars is a great vantage point!. Kill two birds with one stone. Walk along the Avenue of the Stars which is a promenade on the water and very touristy, but in a nice way. Most of the stars will be unknown unless you are Chinese, but that's great. It's also a good place to watch the light show from in the evening. The light show was not as amazing as it was built up to be, but pleasant on a nice evening. The crowds are bigger than it deserves. A good place to enjoy the HK Skyline at night is to have a drink in the lounge of the Intercontinental.
Superb. Amazing skyline. An old city with narrow roads but with really tall towers. Looks amazing when viewed from Kow Loon Bay and equally amazing when walking amidst it in Hong Kong island.

Stay for the Symphony of Lights Show. Just a wonderful area to take an evening walk along the avenue of stars and stop to watch the symphony of lights.. it does get quite crowded so it is worth getting there early. Nice and peaceful to watch the world go by on the harbour at night

A skyline given a light lift. The HK Skyline is remarkable because the office blocks have taken a boring skyline and used it to make an advertising board. As there are so many of them it gives a bland skyline so excitement!

Mix up the view points. It must be said that it would be very difficult not to sight the HK skyline when visiting HK but what I would recommend is that you view it from as many different angles as you can. Obviously from both shores (island and Kowloon) but also try from The Peak, on the harbour and from one of the great restaurants such as Hutong or Aqua Roma. Watching HK at night is never boring.

Simply breathtaking. It's exciting and beautiful and mesmerising. I would never tire of it. Make this a highlight of your trip. It wraps around you as far as the eye can see. If you love big cities you will love this.
Hong Kong light show.. It is only for 15 minutes.If you are there it is good to see it, I wouldn't call it a must see.But I am glad I saw i,t so now I know.

A vista to behold. Victoria Harbour at night is a sight to behold. At 8pm each evening they have a light show for 15 mins. There are bars or boats you can choose to view the skyline from, or simply admire from the sides. A beautiful and worthy site.
Beautiful At Night. Definatley a must do in hong kong. its been my 5th time in hong kong and I always ensure i make a visit.

A 'Must See'. One of the world's iconic images that's a 'must see' for anyone who like travelling. Daytime views can be dramatic, particularly when the mist comes rolling in over the peak, but the stunner is the view at night when it's all lit up. Best place to view is from Kowloon promenade.

Hazy delight. The famous Hong Kong skyline is grogeous. But this time round the haze did play a spoilsport. I would not rank the laser show as a must watch. A walk along the Walk of stars is a peek into the star struck fans. That in itself is fun.
Amazing View. One of good places to come and spending very nice time at Hong Kong the place was organized with fantastic view and the weather was amazing
Lights up!. Best seen at night and on top a building or at The Peak. Best describes Hong Kong's kind of action once the sun sets.
Harbour Cruise.. It is good to visit the hongkong cruise in night...its is one of great experiences in hongkong.Must do

Quite impressive. If it was measured by volume then Hong Kong would beat most places. It is an interesting skyline with 2 or 3 of the tallest buildings in the world (or so I was told on my bus tour) and some of the newer ones are quite stylish and are likened to strange things like hugging koalas. Personally I think that although it is impressive, it lacks some of the character of cities like New York, but that is my personal view. You need to move around the island and get over to Kowloon so that you can see if from multiple angles
Nothing special. Went to Victoria Peek to have better view, but there´s nothing special. Cople towers had light show and thts all.
Amazing HK Skyline. Excellent and breathtaking view of the HK Skyline. Please do not miss the symphony of lights. Its a beautiful place to take a evening walk.
Great night skyline.... One of the world's greatest city skylines... Whether you Re looking across the harbour from Kowloon or Central, it is dramatic at night.
Must seet. Need to see in Hong Kong, night and day always special !just the atmosphere beeing in front of this world famous sight

Hong Kong Skyline. Yes this place is amazing worth looking at during the day and then later on at night take a ride on the harbour worth it we where very lucky with the weather cold but not raining Truly amazing show on New Years Eve best ever

Still the best in the world...... The skyline is spectacular in the daytime but at night it is even more spectacular with the evening light show at 8 pm. Get there in plenty of time if you want a seat - it does get really full.
