Nice views worth a visit. Went to the harbour looking near TST on the first night and the view of Hong Kong Island is simply stunning with all the tall buildings. There is a small light show at 8pm and 9pm each night.

Wonderful!. Hongkong's skyline is one of the best in the world with the surrounding mountains and Victoria Harbour with its impressive skyscrapers. Every night, most of the skyscrapers and buildings are light up - fantastic!!!

A sight to behold. Enjoy the breathtaking view of the skyline ...anytime of day but more remarkable at dusk and at night.
Take pictures of the numerous picturesque buildings which look like a piece of art on a canvass.

The JEWELS of HK. this is one of the most impressive skylines I have ever seen.
Tiny light up "jewels" of building and the dragon boats that are also in their brightest glory...adorn the skyline of HK harbour...It is majestic !!!

Magical Skyline on a Clear Night. The views at night are incredible aided by the huge amounts of illumination on hotels and offices. Take a trip along the river for the best views. Not so good on a rainy day though.

A worthwhile and free attraction. The best place to view the nightly lightshow of the Hong Kong Skyline is from the Avenue of Stars on the Kowloon side. From there you get the ideal view of the full range of Hong Kong Island's skyscrapers and the Symphony of Lights in which many of the building participate nightly. Definitely worth a watch.
Light Show. Went in the evening to see the skyline an light show. Not exceptional but not bad. Beware the Monk who comes up and offers you 'jewlery'. He wants significant money in return!
Beautiful light show. A simple way to see Hong Kong post card. Beautiful light show, easy access .... A must in this amazing island.

Worth coming just for the evening view. I suggest that you stay on Kowloon to enjoy the free skyline view of Hong Kong. The laser light show was new for me since my last visit but just sitting of an evening and taking in the view is worthwhile. If you are not in Kowloon, jump on the Star Ferry to get there!

One of my favorite places!. The view of Victoria Harbour and the Hong Kong Island skyline is one of my favorites! I first saw it in 1985, and it keeps getting better. More skyscrapers, more lights. Now even cruise ships passing through.
iconic. weather was not great when we were there but you could see that this is a spectacular skyline especially on a clear day.

A view from the bay. A great way to see the skyline is to travel on the ferry system by day or by night and if you time it right at 8pm in the evening you get to see the light show and animations coming from the ICC building in Kowloon. Not too be missed. The high rise of the city balanced by the water and the many crafts including junks is a great photo opportunity for those inclined

Not To Be Missed!. Not to be missed! This is a spectacular sight, especially when all th city lights are on. A tremendous view can be seen from Victorias Peak where it is cool and calm in the heat of the city. Never to be forgotten. The little ships with their red sails are a reminder of bygone elegance.

Spectacular!. Hong Kong has one of the world's best skyline, and the views from Victoria Peak or either Kowloon and Hong Kong island prove it. The night view along with the light show is amazing! Dreamworld!
Go to the top of the mountain. We went to the top of Victoria mountain to view the skyline. It was perfect, the smog was minimal, so we were able to see the whole city. Well worth the trek

Great. The Hong Kong skyline is great, particularlz at night. I want to share many photos I took of it but Tripadvisor keeps blocking my review with the web page link. go to my web site lc-stars(dot)com amd click on the menu travel and then Hong Kong. You will see about 8 pages on photos of Hong Kong including the skyline.

Skyline, city & light show!. You cannot stop talking about this amazing, vibrant and active city, full of life, you technically will find and see everything you could imagine. The Hong Kong light show is just an unforgettable and memorable experience, must see it!!

The most spectacular night view in the world. After tea and shopping in IFC, I would like to have a walk along the Victoria Harbour. With breeze and peace in mind, I feel how wonderful it is to relax in this way in Hong Kong, one of the most bustling cosmopolitan. The Hong Kong Skyline is irreplaceable and unbeatable. And it is free!

Breathtakingly beautiful... On a clear day, the Hong Kong Island skyline is amazing. We did the trip in the day and night, both equally as breathtaking. There is a red lit up junk which whizzes pass, get in in your photo and it is beautiful
Symphony of Lights. The view is magnificent especially during the night time, you can even watch the symphony of lights from the building where the lights are dancing together with the music.

The skyline. This is a free attraction for all, the best time to visit here is at night time where all the lights of the city are on and it is great for taking pictures and the view is amazing you can walk and see other grand views like hotels or just stare at their skyline.
Skyline best from victoria peak. GOOD VIEW FROM PEAK - Wild fire restaurant ( expensive though) & symphony of lights & avenue of stars was a let down... Only few chinese Hollywood stars.

Good during the day, spectacular at night. We visited both during the day and at night. During the day, although interesting, its mainly boats sailing back and forth. In the evening the whole place comes alive. Although there is a light show, its OK, not much more. The scenery of just the skyscrapers lit is more than enough

Great view.. The view is fantastic. More so if you are on Kowloon side looking at Hong Kong Island. Especially if you watching the light show. It takes place every night 8pm. From the Kowloon side star ferry pier turn right and go past the buses. Shortly after that you can see the perfect view of the harbour. Even better is to go up the stairs on the viewing platform if you are watching the light show. It does get busy so get there early as they close the viewing platform. I arrived just in time. I was on my own having just dropped off my girlfriend to get the train back to China. I had few hours to kill before I needed to get my flight so I decided to watch the light show. It's a good show and when the junk boat with the red sails comes past it looks like picture perfect postcard :-) To get a even better view you should use the star ferry. The journey lasts about 10 mins and is slow enough to get good pictures of both sides of the harbour.

Stunning views of the harbour . The best place to see the skyline and to take in the daily light show (daily at 8pm lasting 12/13 mins) is along the Avenue of Stars. The views are very amazing, it's well worth a visit for anyone visiting Hong Kong.
Night life. See this only at night time . So you can tack some really good photos as a light show starts about 8.00 at night as the high rise buildings do there own thing

One of the best in the world. I've lived in NYC, Seattle, Dallas, DC, Austin and currently live in Los Angeles. I have also traveled to a lot of cities in the world, and the Hong Kong skyline, especially seen from the lobby restaurant of the Intercon is spectacular!

Pretty - always best from the star ferry!. As long as I have been coming to Hong Kong I have always enjoyed an evening ride on the ferry at night, makes for a breathtaking view of the skyline. It just keeps getting prettier. And if you time it right around 745 you can catch the laser show! Don't waste you money on the overpriced harbor tours, just take the ferry!

A gret way to view the NK Skyline. With the crowds gathering each night to witness the HK Skyline, I thought of another and great way to experience it! I paid the fare for a Star Ferry ride from TST to Central but only walked to the very end of the pier at about 7:55 PM. I waited with my camera all set for the show to begin at 8 PM. Had a great view, no crowds and enjoyed the entire 12 minute show. When the show was over, I got on the next Ferry over to Hong Kong Island. (Oh yes, the pictures and video came out great)

Excellent . Visited here in April'15..Amazing experience..A skyline you would have never seen..Amazing view..Best to visit half an hour before sunset so that you can enjoy the view of day & night both..

Awesome view. There is nothing like the Hong Kong skyline wether it's from Kowloon or from Hong Kong Island, it is one of the most iconic skylines in the world, even better if you are sitting in a high rise restaurant sipping a cocktail or two.

Best relaxation spot. I never seem to get tired of the view, the atmosphere and, the vibe the harbour gives off. Apart from the immense crowd at prime time which is inevitable due to its immense popularity as a hotspot which the reasons will be explained once you experience it for yourself.

Amazing skyline especially at night!. There is a daily light show to highlight the Hong Kong skyline at 8 pm. Best view is from Tsim Sha Tsui next to the the Star Ferry building. I arrived half an hour earlier to get a seat at the promenade. The light show was short. Honestly I was expecting a bit more. But I did enjoyed the light show and the amazing skyline in a clear night.
Impressive!. Every time one comes back to Hongkong it seems like something new has been added to the skyline ... do not miss the lightshow in the evening !

Beautifully lit harbour. I wouldn't like to pay the electricity bill.. The harbour looks spectacular with the night lights and all the boats moving around. We were lucky to have stayed in a hotel with a view across the harbour and I found myself up very early in the morning looking around the harbour. As much as the 8pm light and sound show was nice, It wasnt that great.
Skyline not to be missed...light show less impressive. Gazing at the Hong Kong is a spectacular and a memorable sight.The 8 pm laser light show was not that impressive....not worth the wait.

At 8 pm there is a light show with very chinese music, involving major skyscrapers of HK island. Take the ferry (the only inexpensive thing in HK) and hop onto Kowloon to enjoy the nice view of HK skyline at dusk.

Not Worth The Plane Ticket. Hong Kong may have meant "Fragrant Bay" in days gone by, but I think Hong Pong would be more appropriate these days. I've traveled to many places in my life, but I can truly say this was the first time I actually suffered "culture shock" Dirty, hustle bustle of a city with severely unpleasant smells emanating at almost every turn. Worth a visit if you've never been to the East before, but I'd choose Bangkok over this any day. The skyline is mildly impressive, and the sound system needs a revamp. Maybe it's just me, but I don't think the skyline compares to New York or Dubai and not half as beautiful as Cape Town...
Beauty. Beautiful place to be in the evening. No places to eat close by ? Any way I think Hongkong people do not eat while walking or while on a public transport system ?

A bit disappointing. The laser and light show looking from Kowloon over to Hong Kong was pretty disappointing. We were led to believe it was really something to be seen but the laser and light show in Singapore is far better!!

Relax, You Won't Miss It!. A highlight of any trip to Hong Kong is something that doesn't require special advice or directions. You can't miss it! The skyline of Hong Kong is spectacular both during the day and especially at night. One of the easy pleasures of taking the Star Ferry between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island is opportunity to see both sides from the water. Then again, it's absolutely worthwhile (a must, really) to get up to the Peak on the HK Island to see it stretched out from above.

So many lights. A must-see when in Hong Kong - see it during the day, then go back at night to see it lit up. There's a light show called Symphony of Lights each day at 8pm which is quite fun if you're in the area at that time.
Unsurpassed.. Fascinating by day and night. Take the Star Ferry to Kowloon to appreciate the skyscraper vista and make sure to be around for the evening light show, best seen from here.

Spectacular Hong Kong Skyline. The Hong Kong Skyline is spectacular almost the whole year round. We were there in March and the weather was cool, the lights were beautiful. Lights display was on at around 8pm at night. Don't miss it. The yachts, boats and ships, including Star Virgo, added to the beautiful warm atmosphere. A sight to behold indeed!
Breathtaking. A modern wonder of the world. Take in the light show from Kowloon. Great atmosphere, and surely unique in the world.
This should be first on your list. One evening must.. Wow !!! Great City and great look. You forget every thing when in the evening you are there. Its just beautiful some thing to experience.
Good night sight seeing. you will see lot of skyscrapers, and this place gives you awesome night view. There are lot of good restaurants that you can enjoy there.
What a sight!. the light Symphony show isn't much to write home about but the skyline is incredible! a Harbour Ferry Tour at sunset is a great way to view the skyline.
Love the Hong Kong Skyline. I have been to HK a few time and I always love the views. I go on t the Star Ferry to Kowloon and to Victoria Peak to see the best views.

especially at night. spectacular at night,took the boat the star ferry and viewed from
the other side,went for food in one of the hotels which was a tad expensive

Great Skyline!. Hong Kong has a great sky line, and also has a light show every evening! the light show is good although the music is a bit cringe. Light show not as impressive as Singapore's. However the actual sky line is amazing, a great way to view it is to go on a boat!
Breathtaking view. The view was breathtaking, we got there in time for the light show. It is also possible to get the star ferry across the bay cheaply.

Lights everywhere. Hong Kong has to have one of the best city skylines in the world. The different advantage point are endless. From the top of mount Victoria to riding a boat in the harbour Honk Kong has it all. Tall skyscrapers that light the night sky. I truly think that Hong Kong is one of the most beautiful cities in the world especially at night when it is all lit up.
A unique skyline. Hong Kong obviously has a skyline unlike any other city so it was good to see it. It's a must see at least once kind of thing!

Beautiful skyline. the harbor skyline at night is fantastic. Views from Victoria Peak is especailly rewarding during clear nights. You can easily lost in a maze of huge buildings entwined in a maze of walkways.

Better by day. This is a must see iconic Skyline but for us the light show is not worth the time It is at 8 o'clock every night Better head for a nice restaurant and dine at 8 and have a lovely walk alone the waters edge after dinner

Grab a boat across the bay for stunning night views. A really impressive sight at night time. Be there at 20:00 for the light show. Grabbing a ferry across the bay is really cheap and a short fun way to get a change in angles and scenery.

Fantastic view!. Some might say Hong Kong is a populous city. However, this serves as an advantage for HK. Whenever approaching night time, the lights within every building. Therefore, stroll through the Victoria Harbour at night is a must-do .

You have to see it if you are in HK. Spend one evening there. 20:00 is a best time due to a Light show they have every night. Come a bit earlier to find a sit. And keep in mind that it is very hot there daytime at summer
Magic views. The skyline at night is a sight to see with the laser light show. Take a ferry on the harbour for the best view or victoria peak.
by night, it is amazing... almost a movie. We watched the HK skyline and all the movements of the neon lights, as we were leaving on the cruise ship deck.. fantastic show for about 20'!

HK Skyline, Had higher expectations.... I had been here specifically to see the light show. But was not that great based on what review I had heard. Lights going in line with music but not all buildings were lit. Would recommend only if you are a passer by to this place. Do not go there and spend time and efforts just to see the light show

Great skyline - best seen from the water. Try to get a boat ride around 8 PM in the harbour to see the best 'stereo' skyline in the world. The lightshow is sometimes spectaculair and in any case the skyline is so big on both sides of the harbour that it just almost too much to take in.

I never get tired of the Hong Kong skyline. Must see for any visitor. Go to TST walk of fame area by 5pm or so. Set a relaxing early dinner at one of the restaurants on the water and wait for the 8pm light show.

Nocturnal Delights. 9/Sept/2015 - the Symphony of Lights Show, as usual did not disappoint. The HK Skyline was as colourful and romantic as ever. What brings the place to life is that it is always teeming with people and moving sea vessels. The Mid-Autumn lantern display made our visit there special!

Got to see it - and that's why you are here anyhow, isn't it?. You would go to HongKong to see the skyline anyhow, so better make sure not to miss it. Once you have lived in China, you may expect it a bit bigger, but it is still a very nice view, great lightings, nice view from the peak. A definite thumbs up for a visit.
Doesn't matter what side of the harbour you are on the views remain breathtaking. Just about the best urban skyline on the planetMany try to emulate but few come close far less surpassing this
Always good. Never get bored with Hongkong skyline. Day and night you can enjoy, but as you know, night is better
Spectacular view of the harbor!. Visit Hong Kong just for the spectacular view of the wonderful harbor skyline. A cruise in the evening is also recommended (but not the dinner cruise).

Beautiful. Loved the way the buildings transformed themselves at night into a display of color and beautiful designs..this to be seen from our room as well as the lobby and all restaurants at the Intercontinental hotel ...
Beautiful!. I was struck by the beauty of the skyline at night upon arriving in Hong Kong. The population is dense, yet the city is well-organized, clean, and surrounded by natural beauty.
worth a trip. you go away feeling small and fulfilled at the same time! It is something to see and everyone should see it before they die. what a view
Amazing view at night. Go to TST and enjoy the view on the Hong Kong skyline. Beautiful at night and during the day. You can also use the ferry!

The most breathtaking view!!!. One of the many reasons I return to Hong Kong year after year after year. Being a lover of architecture and skylines, you will get NO better than the view you get of Hong Kong Island from Tsim Sha Tsui. absolutely breathtaking... and a free laser light display every night at 8pm... a definite NOT TO MISS!

Go at nighttime and you are promised to have some great memories of your night . HK skyline has its perks in the daytime but it really shines (literally) by the night time I would recommend to exit at exit p2 on the TST east MTR station get your self a little bottle of champagne from one of the 7/11 and walk westward towards the star ferry, find yourself a nice spot to seat on the dock and enjoy the sights
Awesome!. Awesome n magnificient!! Beautiful lights n ambience..something that nvr seen before..enjoy the view.

Amazing view. Worth making the effort and walking from the Star Ferry terminal towards Avenue of the stars and maybe further to take in the view. We did most night and soaked it all in. It feels really safe so it's really relaxing

Admire the beautiful view along the coast. Take your camera, take the ferry (either from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui/ Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui), it's very nice to cross the harbour in a ferry, can see the Hong Kong Skyline.

See it at night. Ifyou are with your sweetheart and you wanna say something special to her or you wanna proposed to marry her,this would be one of the best place to seek her attention coz if you can't do it in Manhatthan New York....do it right here by the bay of National Science Center facing directly towards the magnificent view of Victoria Harbor if you are on the side of Kowloon...it's almost like similar view of NYC...with all round sparkling lights-up the sky rapers.....enjoy

Just take it easy and breathe in the view.... With so many activities in Hong Kong, it's easy to lose yourself in the hustle and bustle. But whenever you find yourself by the edge of Kowloon Harbour on either side, it's just great to spend a while doing absolutely nothing other than admiring the view. It is especially incredible at night.
The best harbor skyline. No doubt the best attraction in HK, esp in a clear night.Very good views from both sides of the harbor, and different spot on the sides.

Very nice panoramic view of Hong Kong. The panoramic view of Hong Kong is very beautiful, we can see the IFC building on the Kowloon side. Every day there is a time where spot lights and laser lights shine out, which is amazing. In the Hong Kong side we can look at the highest ICC building of Hong Kong, and you must go to look at the night view if you come to Hong Kong.

Must see. Take either of Exits E or F and walk towards Salisbury road (directly towards the water!).Just an amazing skyline to see. The smoke hinders the view, but still worth visiting. The light show is played around 8pm at night. The place gets really packed during this time, especially during the weekend. I suggest visiting early if you want to get a spot to watch the light show from.

Hong Kong looks fantastic at night. Hong Kong looks fantastic at night. Even in winter it's nice to go down to the harbour and enjoy the lights. I particularly liked seeing the traditional boats with their big red sails.
Mesmerizing experience. Excellent view of the skyline. beautiful and scenic features, colourfull lights all around. Mesmerizing experience
fine skyscrapers. you can have a good view from victoria peak go through an uphill train,it is also a spectacular view over the journey itself.

Oh wow! . This sight is so amazing, we boarded a boat and watched the sun go down and the city light up. The colours and reflections were dazzling. We had labelled spirits included in the tour price too!

This is must go tourist activity. Hong Kong's skyline is very attractive in both day and night time. Tall and luxury buildings and mountains have been decorated the Victoria Harbour so well. It's best one of the kind. To truly appreciate the scenery, choose a day with clear sky and chilled weather, late Sep to Dec is the best timing IMHO.The Peak is a great spot to have a helicopter view on HK's beautiful landscape. Again u will see very different sceneries in day time vs night! A circular path at top of the Peak is a great walk during daytime, it's about 1 hour walk on a good maintained pathway, wheelchair or baby troller are both fine!
Breathtaking!!. Find a seat and sit in amazement at the beauty of the Hong Kong Skyline. The 'Light show' is the best....I viewed it from the Hong Kong island side.....truly stunning!!
On a clear night don't forget your camera!. Beautiful! Breathtaking! So colorful and bright! WE had a couple of clear nights when it wasn't foggy and our pictures turned out perfect!!

One of the best skylines in the world. Hong Kong skyline is just awesome, no matter if day or night. It's one of the sights you can't miss when you visit HK, because it's just there ;-)Tip: It's very touristy and hence crowded on Kowloon side at the harbor. There are many rooftop bars in HK both on Kowloon side and HK island, some of them having a nice view of the skyline. Only in those places you can sit in a comfy chair, sip your cocktail and enjoy the skyline without thousands of noisy and pushy (mostly Chinese mainland) tourists nearby :)

View from the Peak. We were fortunate to have a clear day so we took advantage of a visit to the Peak. What a spectacular view. No other view I have seen from other big cities, compare to the beautiful Hong Kong Skyline on a clear day!

A nice relaxing evening after dinner. It's one of the tourists must that won't disappoint. Use the star ferries for a cheap option or push the boat out and take an evening cruise..must like you see on the tele!!!

Best in the world.. The Hong Kong Island skyline is probably my favorite on the planet. A great place to see it, along with the nightly 8 pm light show, is at the lobby bar of the Intercontinental hotel in Kowloon.
Quite imposing. City with limited space has grown vertically. Skyline is imposing and quite different from Europe. HK is memorable place to visit with family.
The skyline beats the light show. Beautiful skyline on both sides of the ocean, lots of lights on impressive buildings. Like it even better than New York. Excellent view from kowloon or from a ferry.
must do attraction. we took the viaduct harbour cruise to enjoy the symphony of lights show. absolutely stunning views and a must do

Nothing like it anywhere else.. By night, the lights are dazzling and amazing! You are just held captive by the view anywhere on the harbour. From the Star Ferry or the Avenue of Stars or the Hong Kong Island side. It all amounts to the highlight of our visit to Hong Kong.

lan your layover in Hong Kong to leave time to do a night time drive by. This is an unforgettable skyline - so changed since my first visit in Nov. 1983. At night - take a taxi, and go over to the other side, and let your mind drift as you watch the skyline unfold for you - it is worth the cost - and is such a feast of color and of shapes. It would be a shame to miss this - I took the train in from the airport just to be able to do this before my next flight. Some crazy things just do make sense.

best view. This is the best place to enjoy the best view of Hong Kong. Great buildings and lights looked so splendid and amazing at night. The atmosphere was relaxing and comfortable and also great for taking photo

Asia;s greatest light show. When the Bank of China and the Hong Kong and Shanghai Bank (HSBC) began jockeying for bragging rights as owners of the most spectacular buildings in Central, it was an omen that Hong Kong was here to stay. If you have seen Shanghai from the air at night, it's pretty hot but for sheer in-your-face capitalist bravado, I'd have to go for Hong Kong every time. Hong Kong means "Fragrant Port" in Chinese and there's one smell that keeps that light show going -- it's the smell of money.

Nice place and beautiful view . I always heard of this place in pictures and movies but when I went there personally I could see everything is so beautiful and amazing . I spend my all evening walking there was very nice and peaceful
Almost unbelievable. The sheer size and amout of skyscrapers make this sight almost impossible to look away. Take the ferry from hong kong island to kowloon for great views.

Beautiful . Hong Kong skyline is one of the most interesting and beautiful in the world - and so many vantage points! To get a real picture of the scale of Hong Kong, sit on the left side of the boat when heading to Lantau Island. Endless tall buildings going right around the island. The quintessential shot of the skyline is obtainable from Kowloon waterfront, but if you're in the area, the front driveway of Ritz Carlton offers a pretty stunning view too! Finally, the peak gives great high views showing Hong Kong perched on its Island.

The best place in Hong Kong. As soon as you arrive in HK, you will realize that it's a city that does not have much to offer. Oh but this building is perfection. Do not buy the ticket to go to the observation deck, just take the elevator to the floor 118, have a drink at the Ritz Carlton. Fabulous views, best views I've seen in my life! In the same building there is a great restaurant for dinner, at the W Hotel, it's called The Kitchen. Now this is one spot that you SHOULD hit.
Evening stroll. My husband loved the aqua luna ride. Its quite expensive once its dark. Alnost double the price. The view is breathtaking. Better than singapore.

A must-see!. Very impressive, you can easily see why Hong Kong is famous for it's coastline and skyline.However, quite disappointed with the 'Symphony of Lights' as, apart from the addition of a few green lasers and a few more lights being turned on to create patterns, the coastline and buildings looked no different to how they usually do, so no need to rush for the 8pm start! Only difference is the crowd there created a bit of an atmosphere.Either way, it's a great sight to behold!
Perfect!. AMAZING!! How I wish e have this kind of Skyline soon here in Davao! You will be amazed by the HK skyline, morning or evening time.. both superb view!
Breath-taking. You can see the reflection of the skyscrapers on the harbour water, the light show is fantastic and the overall aesthetic of the Hong Kong skyline is superb. Bring your camera!

Nice background pictures. From Kowloon side and On a clear sky, the HK Skyline could be a perfect background for pictures. Light from multiple buildings dancing on the water surface make the scenery more attractive.
Iconic changing skyline. Go about 8pm to see the light and laser show. It's a bit rubbish, but a perfect way to see the Hong Kong skyline in all its glory at night.

Wonderful skyline. If you want to enjoy the typical skyline of Hing Kong you must really go to the avenue of the stars, in Kow Loon.
Every night at 8 p.m. you can enjoy the show of lights and music, starring the main buildings of the city.
A very nice view. Can be seen on tje Kaulon side, both night and day times are nice, but if you must choose one-night tine is better.

Spectacular highlight of HK. We took in the skyline on tha last night of our trip on the new Star Ferry Aqualuna boats, which look like old chinese pirate ships. The service was great with drinks and nibblies and fantastic views that change quickly. The light show at 8pm is okay, but you can view from anywhere. This was a highlight and a great way to end our trip.
Enjoy a world city. Go to Victoria Harbour at 8pm and enjoy the skyline as well as the laser show. Probably best seen from the Kowloon side. Don't miss it.

Signature of Hong Kong. Hong Kong skyline is world famous and not to be missed when here. There are plenty of places to admire this view from. East Tsim Sha Tsui promenade is a relaxing place to sit and watch the light show from and admire the skyline. Alternatively a boat trip or Sky100 building are good spots to see a slightly different view either close up or top down. Views from the Island to Kowloon side are also great and The Peak offers a nice spot to sit and soak up the sights.

Chose a spot with music. Went there all hyped with TA comments. Got a great spot as we arrived early. But when the lights started at 8 pm it was anti climax. The speakers behind us played the music very feebly and the lights did not make much sense. The lasers from across the shore are impressive tough. We were at the start of Avenue of stars.

Beautiful jewll of the east, with western plashes.. Beautiful, however there's a reason you only see night time pictures. That's because Hong Kong's smog and air pollution is so bad it looks like it has a permanent fog. Beautiful at night, but really hazy during the day and we went in late August. Days were very hot around 30c-35c and very hummid. around 60% plus. Still a beautiful city and loads to see and do.

Fascinating Views from Every Angle. Day or night, the HK skyline offers intriguing combinations of water, glass and steel. Get to higher elevations, such as The Peak for the best views, or visit one of the many hotel rooftop bars for a pleasant evening of watching the world go by.
Light show. Fantastic way of seeing Hong Kong. The light show is great and show the city on a different scale.Being on a boat is definitively a must as you are in the middle of it.

Most beautiful harbour in Asia. Been to Sydney, Shanghai, Singapore and I still rate Hong Kong Harbour the best in Asia. The laser light display and the vibrant atmosphere from Kowloon side walking along Avenue of Stars is spectacular. The skyline of Hong Kong is amazing and in the evening with a glass of wine or beer to toast such beautiful scene. lucky I have stay in the following hotels to view the skyline - The Peninsula,Sheraton,Intercontinental and Shangri La hotel.

Hong Kong Skyline. Fabulous tall building and lots of different designs.Found lots of buildings made Hong Kong very modern and spectacular to see. The skyline from a height is beautiful and a must see at night. Lots of colour and lights flashing.

Plesant place to sit and watch people's flow. Actually, I prefer to get threre at early morning, when few people over there is..Its quite, serene, fell the bay breeze e see the emerald/blue color water....Also you can see locals practicing taekwondo.But at night its nice too

awesome!. a MUST GO for everyone travelling to HK. night view is stunning and breathtaking seeing the lights on the skyscraper across the harbour. if time permits, hop onto the star ferry to go across and harbour and experience the hustle & bustle like a local!
Stunning Night View. Stunning view at night time. Take the Star Ferry or spend a bit more and get on the new Hong Kong Wheel by the harbour and enjoy

A view from a film !. A brilliant world skyline . I once took a helicopter from Macau to the island and swept in by night amazing . But the star ferry still shows the lines both sides of the river harbour !

Brings back the Romance. 25 years ago we went to hkg for our honeymoon, riding the Star Ferry & crossing the Harbor brings many pleasant memories. The Hkg Skyline the old world harbor crossing is still a great way to enjoy a slow boat in China.

Give the Symphony of Lights a miss. If in Hong Kong you cannot avoid seeing the skyline - probably best observed from Kowloon looking back over the harbour to HK island. However, I would give the nightly 'Symphony of Lights' a miss - this is just s few green lasers from some skscrapers moving to music that you cannot hear because of the crowds.
Great views. I never get bored walking along the harbour front taking in the views. The light show is worth seeing at least once. It makes for an enjoyable evening stroll.
Wonderful views and sights. This is without doubt one of the best views especially at night to experience the colours and bright lights of Hong Kong

Second best view at night. Excellent view but not nearly as stunning as being on the other side(Kowloon) looking at this side
Take the Star Ferry at about 7.30 cross to Kowloon and walk along the promenade then go gor a drink upstairs at The Sheraton

Always Impressive!. Always impressive. Vibrant city.
Good to see the skyline when arriving in HK for business. Favourite city.
Always changing Skyline. Wonderful. Unforgettable skyline. Only gets better. Have seen the changers over more than 20 visits over the past 30 years.

Unforgettable. I was excited to visit this place. This first ever i shown this type of light show that is amazing. I cant forgot those movement till now. Love this. love you hong kong. In the afternoon we have done the ferry , it was also very interesting. Boat was good and the boat persons was also very good.The Star Ferry is an efficient way to get from Kowloon to Hong Kong, but it's also a destination in and of itself

fantastic from either side of the harbour. One of the best things about enjoying the Hong Kong skyline is how accessible a great view is. Whether you have spent the money to go to the peak or sipping cocktails atop the Ritz Carlton or just hanging out on ave of the stars, the view is just amazing from any perspective! Its also amazing day or night

Supurb Christmas Skyline!. The Hong Kong Skyline is a must see at Christmas time. Each year they pull out all the stops, decorating skyscrapers from top to bottom with Christmas lights (including animation)! If you are in Asia over the holidays, be sure to include Hong Kong in your travel plans for a unique treat!

The VIEW!. There is no pleasure such as coming here and seeing with your own eyes one of the most scenic views of the world. There is a light show that begins at 20:00 with some sound at the background. The sound is terrible but nothing will bar me from giving the maximum rating to this attraction...

Beautiful and a nice getaway from the city. Walked the avenue of stars and truly enjoyed the beautiful skyline! We stayed for a few hours. Took so many great photos. Sat on the benches and relaxed. Definitely a must see. At 8pm you can see the symphony of light show. After we just walked up Nathan road and did some shopping and eating! Have fun!
Trip to Hong Kong. It was awesome! The city is clean. The Traffic was not bad. There were so many things to do but we didn't have a lot of time. Hope to come back soon.

Wow. A fantastic feast for your eyes.. Your first view of the Hong Kong skyline should be taken from Kowloon in Tsim Sha Tsui. Leave the MTR and head down towards the Star Ferry terminal. From here you will see Hong Kong across the harbour with its magnificent buildings and the pretty and iconic boats in the bay, especially the authentic Chinese Dhows with their red sails. Next take the Star Ferry across to the island for further fantastic views (ferry costs a staggering 20p UK pounds - 2.5 HK dollars.Finally visit the Peak (go via bus and avoid the long queues for the trams) and see the skyline from above - really spectacular after dark.

Once in a lifetime experience. The HK skyline has to be seen to be believed. It's iconic and breathtaking. From Mongkok side travel to the water side via convenient MTR. There is always a crowd of people by the waters edge. In the early evening there is a light and music show. Check local details for times of the light show. One of those 'once in a lifetime' experiences not to be missed if visiting HK.
One of the best skylines in the world. Better to see the skyline from Kowloon in order to see all the buildinces with all the lights! I think is one of the most amazing skylines in the world!

Amazing. The view on HK bay is a must during the day from TST or from the peak and also by night. Every day at 8 pm there is a light show. In addition to the peak and TST promenade you can have a drink at the Seeva, The Aqua Roma or The Felix Bar for example to benefit of this amazing view

Great View. The skyline is really impressive with iconic builduings. I was in NY and live in Dubai so it is nothing better or wow but it has is appeal. The light show is very basic and not impressive at all , it needs to be updated. Overall I'd say it is unique and worth if you are travelling in the Area.

Amazing Hong Kong Harbour. Everyone needs to see the Wonderful lights on Hong Kong Harbour it's beautiful a sight to see they do have a spectacular light show at night and it is well advertised for the times to go to the Harbour so this is a must see when travelling to Hong Kong although some people like to view the show from the Kowloon side it is up to you even from the Harbour on the Star Ferry

Sorry Manhattan. We have always felt that Manhattan was the best skyline that we have seen, well move over!! Hong Kong skyline be it from Kowloon's Avenue of the stars to the Peak, night or day. It has all you would wish for. A water reflection, boats, tall short or stumpy, the buildings give plenty to look at. The light show at 8pm every evening. This skyline will never be forgotten.
Beautiful View. Beautiful views either day or night. A must see while you're in Hong Kong. It's close to shopping and next to the Star Ferry Pier.

It is wonderfull scene for taking picture hongkong skyline, especially at 6.30pm when the light of Skycrapers is on.. Visit afternoon at 4pm, it not too hot again in summer, walking around at side walk from victoria harbour to avenue of star. It is wonderfull scene for taking picture hongkong skyline, especially at 6.30pm when the light of Skycrapers is on. Watch at 7pm for laser show for last visit.

Picturesque. Like a Movie Set.. The HK skyline is the best photo for your Facebook cover. I paid additional to get the harbor view at our hotel even if people discouraged me to get a more expensive room, but I made the right decision. The view was awesome. Yes it's all buildings, but there's something unique about the harbor and the view of Central HK and Wanchai. The Bank of China tower is a prominent figure. It's like watching a movie.
Amazing view. What a fabulous view. It is one of the most stunning views in the whole world. Plenty to see here- the best vantage point would have to be the peak.

No postcard does it justice. Nothing prepares you for seeing it in real life, the broad sweep of sea and the buildings arising beneath your feet. Take the bus from the ferry stop to get there for a few dollars (it is how the maids get to work) and walk down. Plus walk around at the top, on the 20-minute path for a completely different side of Hong Kong.

Harbour provides some time out from shopping. Victoria Harbour is always busy and there is lots to see. Catch the ferry or one of the many tourist boats for a cruise / dinner / lunch - all provide great views. At 8.00pm each night there is a light show. It is quite good but if you have seen the light shows in Singapore at Marina Bay then there is no comparison. It's also great to walk along the foreshore of the harbour while taking a break from shopping.
City view. A beautiful city view with the river beside it. Nice to visit during the day and nighttimes for the differing views.

Top of the list. I have been in many cities but, probably, because of the combination of green hills and sea, or the particular architecture, Hong Kong skyline ranks in the top. Another particular characteristic of the city is that HK has a double skyline, one view from the Hong Kong Island and the other one from Kowloon. When in Kowloon, there is an extraordinary walk starting in the Avenue of Stars (the local walk of fame) and going west to Harbour City. There is an interesting offer of restaurants and cafés to stay and admire the skyline enjoying a drink or a good dinner. In summertime probably the best time to visit the area is at evening, and at 8pm there is a laser light show that will blow your mind.
Breath Taking and Must See. Visited there a couple of times in the evening. Breath taking experience. Great light show. Must visit for all travellers even if you have a short stay

Man made wonder... Prime example of how something man made can create a symphony with nature. When you see the neon lights shimmering in the sea at night, the effect is simply mind blowing.You can arrive at 8 PM on the Tsim Sha Sui Promenade and see the sound and light show, or simply peep out of your hotel window ( If the hotel is in the harbour area ) to see the HKK skyline at night. But the best view you get is on a clear day from the Victoria peak...You will be spellbound.
HK Skyline. Skylines are generally not bad, so nothing special.. Just buildings lit-up. Didnt really enjoy having a huge crowd of people packing against us.

At night wonderful!. Great view especially at night. The symphony of lights is nice, but not great (20.00 until 20.13). Still it is a must see! The accompanying sound is quite bad actually; something to improve upon...
Evening trip. Lots of different ways to view the skyline at night. Whatever way you have to experience it. Great views and fantastic buildings with moving animations to enjoy.
Not to be missed !. Must attend show. Lasts for about 15-20 every evening. An experience worth having. Place yourself strategically around victoria harbour & Arts museum for a great view
Jaw dropping view. The view is truly exceptional. Be it daytime or nite time. the lights and the buildings look really awesome.

The highlight of Hong Kong!. This is a magical skyline and really is the highlight of the city. Be sure to take the old-fashioned star ferry across the harbour at 7pm just in time for the spectacular laser show - simply jaw-dropping!
Great light show. Hong has a beautiful skyline surrounding the waterfront. Be sure to take in the light show from one of many restaurants

Things you must do in Hong Kong. One of the most fascinating views in the world, especially at sunset and night. Viewing from the
Peak is a must as is a visit to Repulse Bay.
A beautiful place. This is a beautiful city. Be sure to watch the skyline at 8:00 PM each night, when they have a stunning laser light show.

Beautiful Views!. If you leave Hong Kong with only one memory, and that is almost impossible to do, it will most likely be the skyline. I have been in many parts of the world but the Hong Kong skyline always impresses me.
I am a big fan! Still. Compared to old days (10 years ago), it is fading........ No more the attraction as before, parts of soul is disappearing........

Always a highlight!. If the pollution levels allow a clear view of the skyline then there's no better place to appreciate all Hong Kong has to offer. The laser light show at 8pm each evening is worth watching!

Impressive display of highrise. The view of the skyline is amazing and very impressive of what they have been able to achieve. Its a showy display of the city and it belies a lot of the dirt of many of the highrise just behind it, but it seems they are go through a period of new construction where the older dirtier building are being replaced by new flashy ones. I thought it provides the perfect illustration to how busy the city was and the density of population. The light show was entertaining and was good to see with some drinks and a view. Marked down because of all the older dirty buildings that the waterfront masked.

Beautiful. As expected - a must see.
We also got the chance to see it disappear when a major storm came over the island - that was fascinating too.
Nightview that you can not forget. If possible you shall visit that during the night - the illumination is fascinating, esoecially if you can see it from some elevated point (i.e. the Peak).

A MUST VISIT CITY FOR EVERYONE. I am a skyscraper and skyline admirer and Hong Kong is a real highlight. Many of the individual buildings are worth straining your neck for but its the whole city views that are truly a highlight for anyone who can appreciate a skyline/cityscape. I will be back many times mainly for this reason alone. The city caters for people very well to enjoy the views with very good vantage points, great infrastructure and english signage everywhere.

Light, colors, Sea and us. Even though its a concrete jungle, its worth watching during day as well as during night. 8pm night laser show depends on weather condition, but still the skyline is stunning.Avenue of Stars is the best place to watch. Need to reach half an hour early to get a nice view else it will be very crowded.
Beautiful!. The skyline is beautiful at night. We went to Avenue of the Stars and watched as all the buildings turned on the lights. However, the light show was EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING.

Awesome and Dreamy at Night. Got a view of the famous Hong Kong Skyline by visiting Aqua Bar at One Peking Building. At night, the view is awesome and dreamy. Makes for a great night for drinks and conversation.
Wonderful/Colorful Night. One of the only reason to visit is to see Hong Kong night light from the Star of Avenue. It's really nice.

The best skyline in the world by far.. Words can’t describe how beautiful Hong Kong skyline is at night and pictures don’t do it justice. Every day at night I go to view the skyline at night my head keeps spinning with amazement of how beautiful it looks.Hong Kong is Magical.

Breath-taking skyline.. Quite simply the best skyline anywhere in the world. Breath-taking during the day and also at night. Whether you're on the Avenue of Stars or on the Star Ferry, it is simply amazing.
Hkg sky line.. Wonderful city view . Buzzing vehicles and city life.Clean and fresh air. Dazzling lights at night. Laser light show in the evenings.

Clear view in summer. You will have a clear view in the summer time. It is uique in the world to have landscape from the harbour to the hill top. Take a star ferry to cross the harbour. The 20 mins ride is a relax joyful experience.

A must see view. One of my favourite views on the planet, though perhaps better in the day now that so many of the buildings have a plain and dull appearance at night. Well worth a stop at both times of day, and quite relaxing

City of the future! . Breathtaking! We went there at night and drizzling. But the rain didn't stop us from exploring the place. Beautiful indeed. The HK skyline is worth visiting. Concrete jungle and out of this world neon lights! Yeah!! Fierce!!! We suggest you guys go there both daytime and at night to truly appreciate the magnitude of its grandeur. Cheers!

Beautiful. Stunning. We only had slight rain so we got to see it in all it's glory. The 'symphony' was a letdown. If you didn't know it was happening, it would just look like some of the lights were flashing. The music is so quiet that you can barely match the lights to the sound.Having said that, even without the show, the vista is amazing.

Concrete blocks reaching for the sky!. In the harsh light of the day (actually it was hazy all the time) you see the tall skyscrapers reaching for the sky. There is little greenery, foliage, natural vegetation to speak of. A bus tour takes you through blocks and blocks of concrete.But late evenings, by the harbour the scene loses its severity and acquires a softer hue. The lights go twinkiling and the sea waves lsp rhythmically against the shore. The Avenue of Stars is interesting but the much hyped symphony of lights is a major disappointment.
Relaxing as well as Dazzling. Grab your coffee and sip while admiring this magnificent view. Good during the day but better at night especially a clear day.
HK Skyline. Hong Kong Skyline is good to see. But the light show which takes place at 8 pm has nothing special to see

Beautiful at night. Can highly recommend sitting in a Hotel Terrace bar and enjoying the brightly lit HK Skyline at night or viewing it from a Victoria Harbour Cruise.I was there in torrential downpours with lots of thunder and lightning making it an even more impressive sight
fantasic skyline and laser show. sit anywhere on the waterfront to watch the frr firworks on a nightly basis. fantasic show , gets quite busy so go a little earlier to get a seat or bench.
Breathtaking!. On a clear summer nights, the Hong Kong skyline really comes alive! A must for any visitors to Hong Kong

A thing you once need to see. One of the world cities! This is my 5th time in HKG and one can't have enough of that view. Make sure to go to felix in the penninsula hotel, this bar has by far the best view over the skyline! Enjoy it and don't forget your cameras ;-)
Loved it!. The view is simply amazing. Dont miss it for the world! Go to Avenue of stars or the Promenade to witness it.
Skyline. The skyline of Hong Kong is quite nice and impressive. The light show which takes place every night at 8 pm is nice but nothing special (but its free :) )

A must-see in Hong Kong!. Yeah, the light show is average - there is potential for so much more. But, the skyline is just stunning. Standing along the harbour, watching this vast and vibrant city at night is something you just have to see while in Hong Kong. The kids loved seeing it too. We followed it up with a trip down Avenue of the Stars which is very closeby.
Harbor light Show is Amazing. Amazing experience. We had a great view from our room, but ventured out to see the light show at night. It is something NOT to be missed

Keep your expectations in check but still a Wow. The skyline is one of those things you have to see while in HK. During the day, it's kind of nice, but you're better off seeing it at night when the Symphony of Lights starts, 8pm.You can see it from the Avenue of Stars, or on the Harbour from a boat. Either way, you'll see the light show and hopefully get some great pics. My honest opinion of the light show is that it wasn't breathtaking, but it was still cool to experience. I watched it from a Victoria Harbour cruise boat, which itself was a hilarious experience. If you do the same cruise, head up and try to stand on the railing towards the bow of the ship, not the left or right. That way, once you start going and the show starts, you're in front, with the show ahead of you. Once the show has been going on for a bit, either of the sides will work too.

Not really as expected . We went there before the skyline show time bed got ourselves a position right by the sea and waited but when it came there was no music or enough lightsWe felt they were not excited about it
Gorgeous modern architecture. Be sure to see the HSBC building in Central. Be sure to capture the views from across the Harbor in Kowloon

Beautiful by day, better by night. Can't be beaten.. Some say it is a bit of a stereotype, but this skyline is magnificent.Get there at 8:00 pm to catch the light show, well worth it.Beautiful by day, better by night.

Can´t get Enough of it!. Out of most of the impressive skylines in the world I continue to cherish Hong Kong´s as one of the most special ones. You cannot leave Hong Kong without enjoying the sunset and the night view.
World famous HK skyline. World famous skyline, best seen from Kowloon side from Avenue of Stars. After 7 pm on a working day, this is a more happening area than downtown.

Spectacular Laser Show. Definitely get there before dark to get a good view. I arrived at Avenue of the Stars around 6pm and the crowds already started forming. It is well worth the wait to get a good view. If you get a night with less haze, it makes for spectacular photos and video!

symphony of lights. the symphony of lights tour is a waste of money - if you are intending on viewing the night lights, you can do so for free from the pier. Junk boat ride was bumpy and almost fell into the water - would not recommend. (Dukling tour)

Breathtaking!. Whether it's at night, or on a beautiful clear day, the Hong Kong skyline is spectacular! Even the slightly duller days, weather wise, gave this incredible skyline a brooding dominant feel. We stayed in HK Central for 10 night & each morning when I woke & every evening before bedtime, time was taken to drink in its splendour. It's magnificent & a view you could never tire of.
Beautiful. This city is filled with sky-high building, which makes the view at night a treat. Do bring your best camera!!!

Great light show. Went down to star ferry area to see this much mentioned laser light show. It was amazing but not many lasers. Just the buildings changing colours on the outside. Great experience all the same tho. Starts around 8am. Leave a bit of time to get there tho.

Never get tired of the view. Day or night the skyline is captivating. If you have a nice clear day visit the Bank of China building and go to their free observation floor. Make sure you have your passport.

Breathtaking..... My favourite site in the world. Truely breathtaking. If clear sky then its the best view in the world. Everytime we are in HK, we walk towards the Ocean Terminal near the pier to see the breathtaking scene of HK skyline.

Everyone must see it once!. By night or by day a spectacular sight. See it from Kowloon Side, from the harbour front highway from Quarry Bay to Causeway Bay or from the top of The Peak looking down. Most nights there is a laser and light show at about 8.00 pm.
Could have been a 5........ ....but it is so often obscured by smog! Best seen at night to see its real beauty looking towards the Island from Kowloon.

Hong Kong Skyline and Symphony of Lights. It was an amazing experience to see Hong Kong Skyline when all of the skyscrapers are lit in the evening. The fantastically orchestrated multimedia light and laser show called "Symphony of Lights", featuring many buildings on both sides of Victoria Harbor is a mind blowing one.
Visitor. Mesmerising at night with the night lights all lighted up. A fantastic show of lights which were breath-taking

Iconic views not to be missed. There are so many places to enjoy the skyline both at night and during the day. It is a sight that I can't get enough of. I wouldn't bother to watch the laser light show from Kowloon waterfront again. Very crowded and the light show was not that impressive.
Wow, Wow, Wow!!. I come to HongKong since the early 90s and the skyline still flashes me, ever time I get to the tip of Kowloon peninsula. A must see in your life.

Gorgeous!. The skyline is so lovely, usually I am not very impressed by buildings and lights as I am from London and all around me, but I was in Hong Kong on Christmas day and all the buildings and lights and looked beautiful!
Overwhelming!. Overwhelmingly breathtaking, one of the most picturesque skylines in asia. Romantic place to take a stroll or simply admire the scene with that someone special.

A sight for sore eyes - not to be missed.. This is a must see sight. We were lucky to have two very clear nights for viewing, one from the Kowloon waterfront and one from Victoria Peak which is essential when in Hong Kong. Take a Star Ferry at night and you'll also get a magical view of both sides of the Harbour.

A must see. Needs to be viewed from both sides of the harbour. The view of HK Island at night is quite stunning.
Take the Star Ferry across and back for a different and pleasant perspective - it's cheap and the views are free!

Spectacular Free lightshow. Wow what an evening out and about on the harbor.
Spectacular Free lightshow that is available every night.
Get to your chosen vantage point early....Avenue of Stars is a good place to start.

Beautiful Skyline and a lovely laser light show!. We were staying in the Kowloon area of Hong Kong and our hotel opened out to the promenade orr avenue of the Stars.. Each evening at 8 there was a laser light show. It didn't last very long but even without it; the building lights reflecting in the water were beautiful

Mesmerizing. The HK skyline never fails to mesmerize me. I come to HK often in a year but view of the skyline never fails to interest me. I never get tired looking at it. As much as possible I get a hotel room with a view of the skyline because I just love watching it at night from my bed and wake up to that view in the morning.

Awesome Views. The skyline of Victoria Harbor is amazing! Definitely recommend visit from the TST side. Walk the area dotted with Hong Kong cinema stars. Take many pictures you will be glad you did.If you're lucky it will be a clear night. The dragon boat in the back ground adds to a delightful picture.
Festival of lights. After having dinner we motored back by boat, saw the laser display from boat, it was lovely, would have been much better had the night been clear. Still we did enjoy it.

Fantastic skyline. watch the symphony of the light from avenue of the star, Hong Kong skyline is really incredible, even the skyline from the hotel also incredible, sadly i don't have enough time to go to the peak, will go there in the next trip

Most amazing on water cultural place with ancient feelings. Most amazing on water cultural place! awesome feeling once you get in to the boat fully traditional yet amazing staff environment and most amazing view at night!

Impressive mesmerized. Loved the skyline.. Good to see they have maintained the island feel and built all connecting bridges underground...do watch laser light show at the harbor front amidst avenue of star afterwards u can enjoy food at nearby eateries

Interesting and scenic view. The Hong Kong skyline can be viewed from many locations and always offers a sea view, mountains and the cityscapes themselves. Many dramatic skyscrapers and with changeable weather many dramatic skys too. Much can been seen from the "Peak" as well.

Super laser show on a clear night. Laser and music show is good on a clear night otherwise you won't see much. There's a junk boat that goes past too so a pretty and colourful reflection on the harbour. Avenue of stars is best place to see it but gets very busy often 10 people deep. Walk further along towards intercontinental hotel for a less crowded view. A bit overrated but worth a look if you've never seen it.

Beautiful!. The best way to view the Hong Kong skyline is on the Star Ferry coming back from Kowloon. I have done this a couple of times and it still hasn't gotten old. In fact, I admire it more and more. Its a simple surreal pleasure. My 2 year old son loved it as well. After all my trip to HK, this last sail on the ferry staring at HK made me realize that Victoria Harbour is probably one of if not the most beautiful harbour in the world.

best experience. in the morning it looks exactly like any downtown big city of the us but when the night comes you just can not stop staring at this amazing scene. huge building full of bright lights making the night a day
amazing skyline. amazing view from there.. it look like amazing in night.. have restaurants.. it good to go there.. don't miss that .. it will be best..

Iconic Skyline of The World. One of the most recognisable and most iconic skylines of the world. A great contrast between the traditional oriental ships in the harbour, and modern sky scrapers. Amongst the sky scrapers you'll find some fantastic traditional Architecture - a skyline unforgettable once experienced. Best to view from the Star Ferry.

Stunning Skyline from anywhere. Though it's strange to review a skyline, Hong Kong is one of the best in the world. There are various places I would recommend viewing the skyline. Of course, the Peak. Also, the light show at the Avenue of Stars. From the Star Ferry is lovely. My favorite is sitting at the West Kowloon Promenade on the rocks by the water. The skyline is beautiful in both the day and night so if you have chosen a spot, try to visit around sunset so you can catch both!
Nice ambience. Nice. It is the must go place in Hong Kong.. Go in the late evening waiting for the lights to come out..
The only way is up. Lots and lots of buildings which compete with each other to be seen, Hong Kong Island has the best, view from Kowloon or on the water
Picture place. The show is good but you have to arrive very earlie to have a good seat at the front. It is a great place to take pictures but no more than that
Spectacular skyline. The Hong Kong skyline viewed from the Kowloon side must be seen in both the daytime and the nighttime. Every night they put a light and laser show on that must be seen.

Can Feel the Energy. Worth a thousand pictures. You can easily take pics of the skyline from the Kowloon area by walking the harborwalk which runs directly opposite the skyline across the bay. Pictures are even better at night (if you have the right camera). The Star Ferry is also a great option which runs directly from the mainland side to Hong Kong Island and gives you ample opportunity to snap photos.
good to stand back and watch !. its a chance to stand back and feel less hemmed in allowing a little more space to breath and enjoy the sights,

Perfect place to be on a friday evening in HK. Visit the skyline once even if you have been to HK ten times. This place makes u feel the sheer size of this city and be in awe of how grand everything here is. Late nite long walks are a must.
SightSeeing. This was an awesome trip. The tram was almost 45 degrees on the slope. the view from up above is amazing.
Awesome skyline!. A must see is the 8pm nightly light and sound show from the viewing deck next to star ferry terminal over on the mainland side.
Love Hong Kong!. By anyone's standards, this is an absolutely superb hotel. From the extraordinary night life in H. K. to the peace and tranquility of the hotel. Go for it and enjoy!
Wonderful View of Woundfull city. Great View, Great Shopping and dinning Area ... Great experience to get Skyline Tram ... Never go on weekends ...
Wow Factor. Very impressive skyline during the day and in the night. Weather it seen from top of The Peak or by the bay, it excites and impresses you equally!

A firm favourite every trip. I always love to relax and watch the skyline across from the mainland at Tsim Sha Tsui. It gets very busy at sunset and for the 8pm light show but there is lots of space so maybe get there early to secure your spot to take photos.Easily accessible from Tsim Sha Tsui subway station and a great place to take a stroll along the water people watching, keep an eye out for the junk boats too.

lights, lights, lights. nice place from avenue of stars to appreciate the splendor of lights emanating from the buildings and reflecting from the water. the shimmering lights are a sight to behold and surely a must for any tourist to savor. immersing in the lights is sure a stress-beater. fyi, a nightly (i think) light show is performed on avenue of stars.

Beautiful view, run it in the morning, Drink beers on patio during the day and see lights at night!. Really enjoyed Victoria harbour... Ran it early each morning with a long wide pathway I was able to get about 8 miles in running from Kowloon area to the end and back..... During the day gar a seat on a patio and enjoy some cocktails or beers and Then at night when all lit up it is really cool to see although the "light show " which is on every night is really nothing much better than just seeing the lights on themselves... So if you miss the light show or the time is not convenient just blink you eyes a couple times when looking across the harbour.... Pretty much the same thing!!!!

Less than expected. Well, after reading and looking at videos, I took the free drinks cruise from Pier 9 in Central. The actual Symphony of Lights was very disappointing. The skyline is magnificent no doubt, but the actual show is nothing much different from the all night view.And the free drinks on the boat are a joke. No tonic for the much publicized G&T. And the beer is warm...And they demand, not ask, demand a tip....The sailing was fine and the complete tour is worthwhile, but not the supposed " cruise" which is a tourist trap, nothing else...

Never gets old. Even if I have been to Hongkong 3 times already, I always visit its skyline. Never gets old, and it always give me a fresh look each visit. If you frequent Hongkong my advice is to visit it in different times of the day. Dawn, Dusk, Sunset, Noon. It will give you a different feeling each time.
Must see, but once is enough. It's definitely an interesting view, especially in the evening. Every day at 8pm there is a laser show.

a must see. truly amazing harbour. Sydney is good, but this is great! catch the star ferry around harbour trip, cheap way to orientate yourself. can recommend the sheraton towers lounge for champers and the 8o'clock light show.

Sunset Cruise . The view was spectacular as you see the skyline change during sunset.
At the end of the cruise as we cruise back to the pier, the lights from the different buildings are truly magnificent. ☺

Shifu Wong. Along Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong Island, it is beautiful night scene when all the coloring lights are on especially when we have evening walk slowly to the nights at Arena Stars of Tsim Sha Tsui. Along the edge of Victoria Harbour, other than taking night view beautiful pictures, you can see quite a few Hongkong Singers appear at the streets. They are playing guitar and singing happily along the streets.

One of the best night time skylines. We took a trip to watch the show from the Avenue of Stars in Kowloon. Clearly this is a very popular trip as there were thousands of people doing the same thing. It was a lovely evening for all the family. However we walked from the Star ferry terminal hoping to find somewhere to get back to Central but in the end turned around and came back the same way we came.Well worth making the time to experience it.

Chill at night. Go at night to see the magnificience of this tiger state just off from mainland. It is highly developed and a giant economy evident by the humungous structures and in the life of inhabitants.

A vivid & exceptional sight to see!. What a spectacular experience! The light show at night is not to be missed. We were staying on the Kowloon side, and were dazzled with the scenery. The evening show is one thing, but just as impressive is the view during the day. The hustle-bustle of the port is a sight to behold. A one of a kind city & skyline!

Spectacular Skyline. We stayed at the Intercontinental in a harbor view room in July .We had a full view of the Hong Kong Skyline from our room looking across the harbor at the Island and we never got tired of looking at it . Particularly impressive at night of course when the lights on all the buildings illuminate the city and not to be missed at 8 pm each night - the symphony of lights . This is spectacular with spot and laser lights carving through the night skies over the glowing Hong Kong skyline .

Wonderful at Night!. My friends and I were at the skyline at midnight, and it was amazing. There weren't many people around where we were, and we had an excellent view. We came out the back of Harbour City, and it was just right there. There was no one around since it was so late and we were in a strange location. The skyline glowed around us, and it was very peaceful to stand my the shore.

Turn up Early !. Really an amazing place to visit. We were a little disappointed by the nightly light show ... to be honest the hour we sat there watching the buildings light up was much more entertaining. Now we are home our photos don't do the skyline justice ... Take the time to sit for an evening and see the view (and do a bit of people watching).
To see.. Nice and impressive view. Specially with the light of the skyscrapers and the music spectacle. For sure one amusing experience.

Beautiful skyline at night. Coming to Hong Kong, you have to view the HK skyline once. We came to the avenue of stars on both day and night times. When the lights come on for the daily light show, it is definitely a beautiful scene!

A unforgettable experience!. If you have time, take a cruise along the bay, better if you do so at 8pm so you can see the skyline show that some buildings offer at that time. If not enough time and money, enjoy the show from the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade just in front, at Kowloong, get early for good sits.

Night on the Town. 1st Viewed from Sky100, then moved To AquaBoth good then went watersided to see light show and finished night with Junk trip and drinks a Skyline you will not forget. Top view Ritz Bar 243Mts above Harbor!

Stunning. This should be high on the list for everyone who visits Hong Kong. It's impressive in the day but more so by night. I wasn't overwhelmed by the light show and think it's overrated but regardless the skyline is still a magnificent sight. Recommended with a beer in the evening.

Amusing. Hong Kong skyline is amusing because the mixture of modern city and nature ! You can see all together in one line : tall building, lights, mountain and sea. Victoria Harbour and Avenue of Star is one of the main point to see Hong Kong skyline. Yes, it is fantastic but sometimes when the peak season, the place is just over crowded. If you live in here, HK has so many spots where you can enjoy the skyline more than those places. Try to go to the rooftop of Ocean Terminal Harbour City to enjoy the sunset. Some people come just to get the moment , yes is crowded but mostly not tourists.

Spectacular Hong Kong Skyline . We could have given this a rating of 5 because of its spectacular skyline. As we have small children and the Harbour is not as child-friendly as other countries, it's 4 for us. It could have helped if the place is stroller friendly and there is a small park for kids to be occupied while relaxing along the harbour. Our rambunctious kids play close to the edge of the harbour to keep them occupied while waiting for the Symphony of Lights. The Symphony of Lights happens at 8pm everyday. A laser and light show of skyscrapers of Hong Kong. Everyday, the show runs with different language. Unluckily , we were not able to watch the English version so we don't know what the story is. The weather was also gloomy so we didn't appreciate the laser much. During extreme weather conditions, the show is cancelled so be sure to check the thunderstorm alert in the area before waiting. My sisters think that the skyline is better viewed from the Hong Kong Island; the kids and I think that the view from the Kowloon side is way better. Try from both sides, either ways it's both spectacular skyline! A really must do when in Hong Kong

7 pm musical show is a must for every first time visitor. Everyone said it, everyone go for it, you just had to be here too! Symphony of lights, the musical show playing chinese modern mix music accompanying the light show played at the building on those skyline across, totally a view so magnificent, so great, and so can't be seen elsewhere. Crowd is fantastic there, everyone is so immersed.After the show, you can stroll the harbour side, nearby there is huge mall, but I totally recommend you to have your picture taken by the street photographer there. It doesn't cost much and the picture turns out very spectacular along with the vibrant color of the lights in the background.After that, you can go to the Avenue of Star as well. This place is totally must visit.

Beautiful skyline. beautiful skyline from avenue of stars, there is a daily light show at 8pm, but it was not very impressive. should get on one of the ferry boat, enjoy the skyline with a drink on the boat is memorable experience

Impressive. As skylines go, it's a corker, and the nightly light show at 8pm is fun, if not mind blowing. Try watching from the Avenue of Stars, to get a good view of both sides (or watch from the water, there are several options).
nice view. very nice view from the other side of Bay. Amazing how the view is at night. It is extremely hot, so you can walk around for too long, but it is probably the best place to be in Hong Kong.
The best in the world!!!. You never can be tired admiring this incredible Harbour!!! Day and night the spectacle is different and amazing.
Special Skyline. Beautiful skyline and very famous. You see it often whenever Hong Kong is being featured. The view from Kowloon to Hong Kong is nicer than the other way around.

Time of my life. Been lucky to have visited Hong Kong twice and it's a must is to go up to the Peak to see the sky line during the day and at night. It takes your breath away and you are in your very own James Bond film!

Wow!!. We have seen some pretty spectacular skylines as we have travelled the world but Hong Kong is right up there with the best of them. It's just incredible what Hong Kong has achieved and the amount of land reclaimed from the sea and they have created a real wow of a skyline.

One of the best Skylines in the world.. Take the tram to the top of the mountain for one of the best views of HK. If your lucky to find a restaurant that you can enjoy the skyline, then do it. One place even has a patio out side and we were fairly high! I saw a Lazer show while having a cold Stella Artois.

Seriously over-rated. What a let down!. Joined the vast crowds on Saturday 01 August to see light show from the Kowloon side of the water. Aside from jostling for a position in between the multitude of ipads, iphones, camera tripods etc, the lightshow itself was a big non-event. Ues there are loads of lights (primarily advertising of hotels or electronics companies) but nothing like the photos in the travel brochures etc. There were a few random spotlights and it was all over in ten minutes. We only knew it had finished as everyone started to leave ............

Go to The Peak. The crowd is worth it.. The most beautiful urban landscape I've ever seen. When the sky is clear, the view is amazing from The Peak. It gets crowded up there at night, but definitely worth it. Hong Kong is always busy and the people are quite calm and civil. Riding a ferry and walking the Avenue of the Stars are other great ways to enjoy the night Skyline.

Night boat ride in the Hong Kong bay. Hong Kong has made special arrangements to light up the night skyline and this is visible from the boat ride on the Hong Kong Bay. The building exterior lighting is fun to watch and the beautiful show lasts for an hour. The efforts taken by Hong Kong Tourism for this beautiful show can be appreciated after the boat ride. Food is served on the decks to make it interesting for kids
Hong Kong by night. Brilliant night time display from the Kowloon promanade.lovely evening stroll. Take the Star ferry to see both sides.

Breathtaking scene one should see in their lifetime. The skyline of Hong Kong is one of modern times, yet one see s ancient history throughout this magnificent city. The city s buildings are beautiful, and with the available funding in this city, the structures are plentiful, yet useful. Wether it be a hotel, or office structure , a condo, to a apt residential structure all are tastefully done. The city has major commerce areas restaurant locals, shopping areas. Yet spread throughout are historic building so one never forgets their history, and what made China such a strong power in the world today
Beautiful but not worth the fuss. Beautiful and amazing architecture. I'm glad I saw it, but I'm not entirely sure what all the fuss is about.
Awesome photo opportunities!. Whats not to love about this beautiful skyline? ON a clear night, walk the path on the Kowloon side and watch as iconic junk boats float past.
Good photo ops. For camera trigger happy people... this is a must. For selfie lovers, it's a bliss to "show-off" to the people in your social media group that "YES, I AM IN HONG KONG"

A festival of lights. I have never seen such a beautiful nightlight city skyline in the world. Every single building is featured with an individual lightning.Some have continuos lights others have changing motives and flashing lights.It is amazing, beautiful and longlasting memory.

A not so Spectacular view of the Skyline. The skyline is best viewed from Tsim sha Tsui on the Kowloon side. It is not as spectacular a must have on your itinerary. If you are expecting a spectacular light show as one sees in Vegas, it aint so. Its a simple lighting up of the skyline. It was not the highlight of my trip.

Amazing Skyline but too crowded. The simphony of the lights is really poor, the harbour is really crowded when it starts and it's difficult to find a good spot to see the skyline and the lights. Best thing for me is to go there at 10-11pm, grab some beers ar 7-11, find somewhere to seat and look at the views. Normally, at that time there arent that much people and it's nicer to stay there.

Beautiful skyline. Hong Kong is famous for its skyline which is on either side of the waterfront i.e. on Kowloon Side and Honk Kong Island side. As the skyline is more prominent on the HK island side, it is better to view from the Kowloon side along the avenue of stars. Everyday there is famous show named symphony of lights which is treat to watch and it is much better to watch on a harbor cruise as it is visible on both sides.
Dazzling and Pretty. If you're not lucky enough to have a hotel room with a harbour view, take a boat ride around the harbour or simply walk along the promenade at 8pm.
