Hong Kong, go for the views. Whoa, what can one say, up above the charming grit of the city on the peak or watching from Kowloon or the star Ferry, few views beat Hong Kong's skyline.

A bit underwhelming. Having heard that this was the must see attraction, I was expecting great things.However, on the evening we went, we had a great spot just opposite the Cultural Centre and under the walkway, sitting on the fence along the harbour. Viewing spot was great, but the sound wasn't anywhere loud enough. It would be great to have a few more speakers set up to hear.Our night was quite cloudy, however this was good for the laser beams as we could see these well.We probably expected more than just the Central HK Island to be lit up. There were some fantastic lighting effects, but just not enough for the WOW factor!The myriad of boats on the harbour flitting back and forth does distract a bit, and when the big private ones moor just in front of you to pick up and drop off, it does alter the viewing available.

Victoria Harbour Skyline is highlight of HK visit....nothing else like it .. This to me was the highlight of HK. At night at around 8pm there is a light show where many of the building along Victoria Harbour have laser light etc , highlighting the building and the skyline in particular.The 3D type view of massive skyscrappers with nothing but a steep green mountain slope behind them is like nothing else you will see anywhere else.

Breathtaking. Amazing views from there, and I was lucky enough to visit on a clear day, the whole city can be seen from this tall building and the lift is fast but quiet, for someone who is scared of heights, I was impressed
Wonderful sight. Wonderful sight on the thousand lights of honk kong. Don' t go for the show ( at 20.00) it's a dumb show...for chinese people. It' s better admire the city later

The best thing in hong Kong. Indeed the skyline is amazing. Sadly it's the only amazing thing in Hong Kong which is so hot and humid that you wanne die. The light show every day at 20:00 is worth watching from the Victoria terrace.
Beautiful. You can watch sky line two side, Tsimsatui and Hong-kong island. Any side, the view is very pretty.

city of lights. Great views from kowloon. I took the junk boat ride and which came with a beverage of your choice. I chose a red wine and sat back while the boat did a loop of the harbour. 45mins as the day turned into night, i timed it just right
Light and Sound. Its always an impressive skyline of HKG...full of lights / sound etc...and every evening there is a light show which can be watched by the shore..Worth it
Skyline is breathtaking. Skyline is breathtaking, especially at night from the Tsim-Sha-Tsui promenade. Do not have too many expectation to the show of lights , though. Somewhat disappointing....
Relaxing time away from the rat race. Staying on Hong Kong Island so made the travel across on the ferry taking in the lights and atmosphere from a different angle. Very impressive City

Disappointing. I went to this place for more than 3 times at night (reached before 7.30pm everytime and waited until 8.30pm). However, the Symphony of Light show was really disappointing as i saw only light blink on those buildings, and no laser light was shown.Only a few shops are available along the street there and nothing special could be found here.

good but not great. i have been fortunate to witness skyline of new york, tokyo and shanghai. hong kong skyline was nothing great if compared to new york.if this is the first time you seeing the skyline, it may be eye open for you.

The best free show in the world.. You can see the lights of Hong Kong from Victoria Peak on the Island side but the better view is from the Kowloon side. Go there at dusk and from an elevated walkway, you can watch the Skyline change to its fully-lit finale. Their electricity bill must be something else.

Must see in hong kong. Stunning view though sometimes maybe affected by the smog. Best skyline at night at tsim sha Tsui star avenue, central Ferris wheel, or on the star ferry across the harbour which is around 3hkd per person. Don't take the lower deck, engine really stinks.

One of the best city skylines in the world!. When coming to Hong Kong, you cannot miss this spectacular view. Try to come at 8 pm when they put on the Harbour light show. Truly amazing! Best place to see it is from Kowloon side near the star ferry.

Classic Hong Kong skyline. The view of the skyline along the harbor is beautiful day or night. The view of HK Island from Kowloon, in particular, is beautiful, especially if you like a lot of glass architecture. But with the modern buildings and the beautiful green mountains in the background, make it particularly nice. Views at night with the light show are also amazing.

Skylines take on different character during the day and night. New buildings, unusual shapes, the lighting at night with advertising shows in certain buildings. The ultimate in optimizing commerce where there is space.

Best skyline in the world. There is no doubt that the Hong Kong skyline is the best in the world, especially at night. If you capture it on a clear night with the light show going on, you will be mesmerized. I was just there last night on the star walk in Kowloon and was thrilled to see it again!
Stunner!. Can't get enough of this view. It was a stunning experience. Not surprised that its named as No.1 best skyline in the world.

Breathtaking Night sky line. Visited the harbour in the day time, weather was extremely hot and humid. Decided to come back at night the next day.Short walk from the Tsim Tsa Tsui station. Follow signs for Avenue of stars. The walk from the main road to the harbor brings you on the avenue of stars. The initial view of the harbor once you've passed the construction sites is absolutely breathtaking. Bank of China, IFC buildings, HSBC tower soar towards the sky along with countless other buildings in a frenzy of intricate lighting. We also watched the pulse light and laser show which had many buildings on the central side change light colors with music. Would recommend the harbour view from TST. The view at central isn't as impressive. Definite must see! :)
Better than the telly. Amazing by day and brilliant by night. I recently stayed in the Intercontinental and had the view from the window. It was mesmerising.

Don´t miss it!. Well it´s pretty easy, missing the skyline of Hong Kong, is like missing the Eiffel tower in Paris or missing the colosseum in Rome,.... So don´t miss it! And watch it by day and by night if possible, both different and equally stunning.

A Vision of Beauty!. One of the most breath taking skylines in the world. No matter from the Star Ferry or a hotel on the HK or Kowloon side, Hong Kong is something special. A gem of a place that makes your heart ache when you have to leave. Enjoy the Skyline it is spectacular!

Easily identifable. The Hong Kong skyline is memorable and ever changing. Some of the buildings have been there for some time and others have appeared more recently along with the new bridges over the water between the islands. The views have to be seen during the day and again at night when it is dark. The ferry is cheap, quick and excellent and a good way to get about. If you are staying in one of the central hotels in HK get the train from the airport to the nearest station then grab a cab, much faster and cheaper.

Brilliant night view of the city.... the night view is spectacular... The laser light show at 8 PM everyday will entertain the kids and adults alike. Try and get there 30 mins before and find a nice spot to sit and get amazed.
My Hong Kong experience. This is Hong Kong for me. Read and heard a lot about the city, but the skyline is breathtaking. I could have stayed for more days, also for the shopping.

Absolutely stunning. It certainly is an amazing view, which one can't afford miss if in Hong Kong.. we went there in the day as well as night.. both the sights were spectacular.. but ya if you are short on time and deciding when to go I will say please do not miss the night view :)
A not to miss experience. London ,Paris,Rome Sydney ,New York I've seen them but this has to be the best with a wow wow factor

Beautiful as you see on internet. There is no doubt, HK is the skyscrapers city but it still amazes how they build the small-and-tall buildings on the mountains, look like the chopsticks. The view from sky bar, the laser show, and the view from the Vitoria Peak were fantastic....

World's Best Skyline. Wow! What can I say? Hong Kong's skyline is second to none. It's is hands down the best skyline in the world. New York's skyline is a distant second. It is best at night and I recommend that you watch the laser show that starts at 8 pm nightly.

Iconic Harbor View. Hong Kong skyline is one of the world's most beautiful views. Take the tram up to Victoria Peak to see this iconic harbor view, either during the day or at night. Your pictures will not disappoint!

Which side is better?. The Hong Kong skyline is very impressive, on a clear day (which we mostly had on our recent trip to Hong Kong and area) you can see so many buildings and it is fascinating to see the Hong Kong Central side or the Kowloon side. To see all in one check out the views from Victoria Peak but the Avenue of Stars in Tsim Sha Tsui is a gret place to see the Hong Kong Central side. Anywhere on the Hong Kong side around the harbour or convention and exhibition centre are great places to see the Kowloon skyline. Hong Kong skyline in general is pretty impressive and if you don't see the Chinese characters on some of the buildings it could be any metropolitan city in Europe or North America.
The Skyline. What can be said? Hong Kong is all about Skyline, so no way you can miss it. So typicall and beautiful
Best view. This is easily one of the best city views in the world. Night or day, you can spend hours just looking at it, finding new details.

A very romantic place to be. The skyline is beautiful and can be viewed from any different places. Viewing from the peak will show so much of Hong kong, viewing it from Victoria Harbour at night time and watching the sampans sail quietly Bois also relaxing. As a solo traveller I missed spending this time with my partner.
beautiful. Hong Kong is more beautiful by night than by day. It's almost magic! The light show though was disappointing so avoid the crowd at 8 pm and enjoy the night view at any other hour.
Aqua Luna. Remember that the boat called "aqua luna". You should make a reservation at night. Somehow better than Star Ferry.

Stunning view. You could enjoy Hong Kong Skyline by walking along the Avenue of Stars. For me it was a stunning view. The skyscrapers all line up beautifully along the skyline. I went here on a cloudy morning and it gave a totally different impression than in the night when all the lights are on.
Dazzling sound and light effects. That would be my lifetime experience to saw light attractions here. unforgettable visit. Worth to try!

Hong Kong Excursion!!. Took a dinner cruise in Hong Kong Harbour. Was a great evening.Was part of an excursion which included a Sampan ride on Hong Kong Harbor, followed by shopping and a wonderful dinner cruise.

Probably one of the best views of a city!. Go to the avenue of stars by TST and walk along to hung hom by the harbour, at day or night it is always a gret view however many times you visit. Night is more of a spectacle at between 8 - 11 there is a great light Show which is amazing.
Beautiful. Excellent views of city a must do for all ages. Be prepared to wait in lines if traveling in school holidays

Great views. Very cool looking skyline - impressive both in the day and at night. The light show was a little disappointing... can't say it was worth it unless you happen to be down in that area already.

Sroller-friendly. Always clean, always safe, always convenient. This subway system really puts anything we have in the states to shame. The stations are clean and full of shopping. Sometimes there are even good places to eat.
mesmerizing. it's a sight to behold. dwarfs everything else in the horizon and looms ominously. it's quite a glorious visual of this beautiful city
As beautiful as Manhattan skyline. A "must see". Vibrant city. I loved seeing the "light show" in the evening, with all the skyscrappers illuminated with synchronised lights and laser beams.

Outstanding view and people watching. Come before the crowds arrive for the nightly light show and take in the scenery along the Avenue of Stars walk on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong harbour. This way you can take pictures of Hong Kong skyline during the day and at night after the light show is over.They don't turn off the neon lights until much later in the night so this is a fun stroll even later at night but the light & sound show is not to be missed.P.S. Leave some room for a snack. There are adorable fried cuttlefish kiosks along the walk.

Simply Marvelous.... See the Skyline must the main reason of visiting Hong Kong as a tourist because its simply unique. With so many thing to offer as a city, this attraction its probably the most magnetic one with marvelous views at night of hundreds of buildings. The best place to appreciate this might be from either TST Promenade or Kowloon, and taking a boat from there to enjoy the magnificent scene.

Beautiful!. It is an absolutely stunning skyline from both the HK Island side and the Kowloon side. The skyline alone is much more impressive than the daily "light show", which is totally not worth waiting for (even if it is free to watch).
DAY DAZZLING, NIGHT OUTSTANDING. Victoria of a night, superb. Day viewing still breath taking.From any reasonable high point, views are wonderful

Amazing skyline!. Amazing Skyline. Am i seeing it for real? what i have been seeing on movies came to life! The IFC and ICC towers and the distinct China Bank Tower and Citibank tower. Its perfect to see this up there at the Victoria Peak Sky terrace. next time, i need to see what i missed this time, the video mapping every night, sounds and lights of some of its buildings, having the night as perfect backdrop.

well-preserved authenticity. Amazing view and fresh air even it was hot at the time I went there. appreciated about the way the government preserved the authenticity, all architectures and buildings were well-protected.
beautiful experience, light show starts at 8pm. beautiful to view along the kowloon peninsular near the avenue of stars.. after 8 the light show starts and it is beautiful

Spectacular night time views, give the tram a miss. No wonder this is a must visit, especially at night time. Although it was very crowded we still managed a great view, later we were told there was a short trek you could take which had better views but I'm not sure where that would be. We didn't pay the extra to go up to the better viewing area. There is a huge shopping centre up here whith good toilets/food etc.We took the No. 15 bus up and the tram down, the bus trip was great, exciting but a little scary with great views. The tram down was disappointing, huge queues, crowded inside and you travelled down backwards so hard to see. There were limited views coming down on the tram, most being obscured by trees or buildings, next time I wouldn't bother with tram.

Stunning. The HK skyline is something special. Whether seen from above e.g. The Peak or from ground level e.g. Victoria Harbour, it doesnt disappoint. I would recommend watching the sunset over HK and the city coming alive.The 8pm lightshow was somewhat of a let down but the experience overall was great

A view like no other.. Been to HK five times, the one place where you just want to meander, anywhere, you can't stop looking, love this place, would love to go back and meander again but realised that at 71 I need to visit places not visited, but for that I would go back again and again.
Great Experience. Highly recommended. The trip around the harbour and its foreshore was interesting and had many sites to see - the light show was spectular.
Ritz Carlton. Had a drink on the 102 floor of the Ritz Carlton. The view was absolutely amazing. Excellent. One of the highlights of our trip. The Peak was also worth visiting and Stanley Market.
Hong Kong always worth visiting. Skyline boring during the day better when it is dark. Other things to do other than eating somewhere is shoppiong,sightseeing.

Absolutley Stunning. You can view the skyline from many places and get a great view. The two best vantage points we found were at the top of the Peak and from the top floors of the Peninsula Hotel. Of the two the Peninsula view is even better than the Peak view. When you are at the top of the hotel you are looking over the bay to Hong Kong island whereas if you are at the Peak your view is onto Hong Kong island and out towards Kowloon.Both view are excellent but the top floor of the Peninsula Hotel at night is tough to beat!!!
wow skyline. been to HKG several time and is fantastic, if you get a chance to see do so.......its a great spot to see

Stunning. You will never get bored of looking at the skyline. At night. During the day. In the sun. In the rain. In any kind of weather!
Simply breath-taking
Amazing views from the Avenue of Stars. Always just so thrillig weather it's day or night. Until early August they also had a funny 3D show every evening with 30 min intervals.

WOW! Unforgettable!. This is one place that should be on everyone's Bucket List! One of the most famous sites of modern times. Visitors won't be disappointed with this amazing skyline. Combined with everything else Hong Kong has to offer it will be an incredibly memorable trip. Just don't forget to bring a high quality camera capable of great night shots.

A must at night. One of the most easily recognizable skylines in the world cannot be missed. Make the mission to go there at night, not for the light show which can be a bit disappointing. But for the sheer beauty of this amazing skyline at night. It is really worth while. Catch a ferry across from Tsim Sha Tsui to Central or vice versa to get the best views.
Evening/night cruise on the harbor.. We did an evening/night cruise on the harbor and was one of the best nighttime skylines we have seen.

Must plan a night here!!. Intercontinental Hotel for Champagne and dinner. Dad tells everyone that he had the best burger ever with a $$$ price tag but explains that it came with the most gorgeous evening view of the harbor and landscape.
Don't miss it!. Fabulous! If you've got a night spare , have a look along the front as its well worth the visit. The laser and lights show was great, our boys really enjoyed it.
Great skyline. The skyline at night is superb. Also very good at day time. Go down to the harbour at Kowloon to experienxe it.

See the skyline during the day and night from both sides of the harbor. The view of the skyline is breathtaking! View the skyline from the promenade in Kowloon or the promenade on Hong Kong Island. The latter has portions under construction. Also view both skylines from the one hour long harbor ferry cruise. The skyline is impressive in both the day and the night. A view from Victoria Peak is also worthwhile.

Love it or hate it, it is impressive. You'll either love it or hate, but you will look upon it with awe. While mountains have been transformed into cement, steel and glass to build this cachophony of commerce. I don't personally like what it stands for, but it does have its own beauty.

Stunning. Don't get confused this is a view from Kowloon looking at Hong Kong Island and for photographers of all types whether during the day bute specially at night when light up along it's length this is simply a stunning view to capture. Take a night trip on the Star ferry for equally stunning shots.
Light show. Watched the light show at 8pm, it was alright, nothing too spectacular, a few lasers and flashing lights, but enough to get a pretty decent photo. But no wow factor.

Night in Hong Kong. If you get to Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong at night you will love the city. Take the Star Ferry out to look at the lights and it's wonderful. You will forget the drab buildings and run down streets when you see them transformed into glorious technicolour.
Fabulous. The iconic HK skyline is something to behold. The best views are from Kowloon and the nightly 8pm laser light show is really great.
HK Skyline. The night view with flashing lights across buildings with narration given, it was a one of a kind experience one could ask for

Absolute beauty!. What more can one say about the beauty of the Hong Kong skyline? See it from boith sides of the harbor - high up in a building or at any overlook you can find. Breathtaking like diamonds glittering at night.

Star Ferries....some of the best cheap sightseeing, ever!. The Star Ferry from Central or Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui is easy and a terrific way to see Victoria Harbor day or night for about 35 cents US. Really...that cheap. You can use tokens or the Octopus cards. This summer on the Tsim Sha Tsui side is a laser light show on the half hour from 8 to 10 PM, called Pulse. The LEDs in nearby buildings are also synced.

One of the most stunning skylines in the workd. I think it's of the fabbest skylines in the world - the different size and shapes of all the skyscrapers makes it a great view - from both the Hong Kong side and Kowloon side - it's great in the daytime but absolutely stunning when it's all lot up at night. A trip on the star ferry is good so you get to see both sides.

Dramatic skyline. Well what can I say it is just fantastic to stand in Hong Kong and watch the skyline. Beautiful and well worth a trip. Hong Kong is a fabulous city and we enjoyed it a lot. Could not see enough of the skyline.

Why wouldn't you?. The Symphony of Lights just adds to the beauty of this incredible skyline. Looking across form Kowloon to Victoria is such a treat.The Star Ferry ride has to be the cheapest tour of the Hong Kong skyline.Day or Night the HK skyline is impressive. There are many viewing options from the harbour, the Peak, or even a few of the bars in the high rise hotels like the Peninsula.

Really nice place!. There is a really nice boardwalk area that you can walk up and down. It goes for longer than just the skyline of Hong Kong. There are people selling pictures, food carts, and there is even a really nice Starbucks overlooking the water!

Breathtaking Skyline. The Hongkong skyline is unique and impressive. We stayed at the Intercontinental and enjoyed the grand view of the skyscrapers from our room. The laser show from strategic skyscrapers was also lively and nice to see.It's amazing how Hong Kong has transformed in a few decades from a place with no skyscrapers to what it is now.Munir Daya

Iconic view. Walk along the Tsim Sha Tsui side (Kowloon) of Victoria Harbour and you will be amazed at the view of the Hong Kong Island skyline. Amazing mass of buildings and humanity fitting it such a small area. The laser show at 8pm each night is OK - not as good as it used to be I don't think but still worth catching.

City that never sleep. Excellent view a must see whrn you are in Hong Kong. One of the fabulous places in HK you must go. The lights and night sky glows throughout the night .Spend your time here with your love ones and friends and feel the stress releasing effect of the view.
HK skyline by night - amazing!!! . Dont miss it on kowloon side. You can seat there for hours and watch also the light laser show. Plenty of people and live music acts.
Glooming skyline in the evening. Like New York and Singapore the Skyline of Hongkong is special in the breaking down either from Hongkong or Kowloon site.

Quick and efficient. the only way to travel around Hong Kong, its inexpensive and quick to get anywhere. Buy an Oyster card at airport this will cost you $50 HK but that will be refunded when you leave and cash your card in.This card is good on most publis transport (bus Train and some smaller buses) Trains run all the time so if you miss one don't worry another will be there very soon.

Savour this stunning view!. This is a truly stunning view, whatever the time of day, whatever the angle. My advice would be to savour it slowly, taking the time the appreciate it during the day, at dusk and at night as well as from land at sea level, from the water and from a height. Simply beautiful!

A must see and do for anyones bucket list. I have always been in awe of the New York Skyline and to be honest I had never even really given Hong Kong much of a thought but that has all changed since my recent visit. If you can afford to go 'go' if you can't then save until you can, the place is amazing and the people always so welcoming. My stay was cut short by a day when my flight out was grounded for 27 hours so every minute in HK was precious and the Star Ferry and the view of the HK Skyline from it and Victoria Harbour were truly amazing. You don't even have to do anything special to view it just go from one side of the harbour to the other...Kowloon looks impressive but Hong Kong Island looks amazing. I went solo on this visit so time now to save to take my wife and see it all again.

Hong Kong skyline. Seen from either side is a must, at night with all the buildings lit up, and every night the light show, during the day just the atmosphere is lively and very friendly, a thing to just while away those hours!!
Perfect skyline . This skyline is awesome! Don't expect too much at the light show ( daily 8pm). We thought wasn't that spectacular.

Spectacular!. The best spot to see the Hong Kong skyline is from the Avenue of Stars. A 5 minutes walk from the hostel I stayed in. The nightly light show at the harbour is truly amazing and beautiful. I highly recommended to view the skyline at Eye bar which is a rooftop bar located on the top floor of isquare shopping mall in Tsim Sha Tsui.
Hong - just do it. Fab city loads to do and easy to get around. Stayed at the harbour grand hotel in a club room which was terrific with great service and staff.

Breathtaking. I lived in HK 15 years ago, and an not belie e how much the skyline has changed in that time. Constantly adding new and larger skyscrapers. It's an amazing view, excellent photo opportunity from the star ferry, and then TST.

An ever changing vista. The Hong Kong skyline is quite simply one of the most well photographed, globally known vistas in the world. It's used as the backdrop for advertising, movies, tv etc. When folks visit HK, they're encouraged to park themselves across the harbour in TST to enjoy the evening light show. For my husband and I, the idea of having this amazing place as the backdrop for our recent wedding celebrations was too good to pass up - and during the entire day's adventure, which included a 4 hour private cruise around Victoria Harbour, the HK skyline delivered to promise.

Beautiful. The relaxing charming lights make it a wonderful atmosphere to be in, the night view is always the best since you get a chance tot see the symphony of lights which looks marvelous ! A place definitely not to be missed! Brilliant place to take pictures but there will be a lot of people there.I would recommend this place to anyone any day since it is a place that every one should experience. The shining lights from the buildings and the dark sky make the place look indulgingly like heaven. A place to not miss.
Ablaze with Color and Light. The different lights and the use of neon lighting is truly imposing. In some cases it was a little overdone.
superrrrrb. skyline from the peak was amazing, from our hotel too, a must watch, fully lit up sky scrapers, best view was from victoria peak, sky terrace too

awesome. times square was awesome at night beautiful colours and advertising was amazing on shops we were in awe the sky scrapers were amazing huge and had a job to get tops in photos monsters such a vibrant and busy city loved its best to get plenty of info about sights and get very organised to fit everything in before you get there not to be missed

Wow! Fabulous Hong Kong!!. Hong Kong skyline has two dimensions. One is the set of fantastic views of the Victoria island from Kowloon shoreline. You can start your walk from the Wampoa Garden end at 8 AM, and end up at Tsim Sha Tsui Clock Tower by 10 AM, at very leisurely pace - you will see a different skyline at every 100 meteres.The other set of views are those of Kowloon from the Victoria Island along its north shoreline. Simply amazing!!

Always a pleasure to contemplate. Watching the buildings of the HK island gaining life and contrast by the sea is always a pleasure... If you have the days or nights then find the right spot for you, keep changing... :-) You can enjoy it not only from Tsim Sha Tsui but also from some places in the island itself... Of course, by night and from TST is great!
Majestic!. It's majestic. Have to see this because it really represents Hong Kong. Although I think the night show (the Smphony of Lights) is a bit overrated.
Unique and beautiful. Its really is amazing that you get to look at this every night in the city. Pop across the harbour and take the skyline in over dinner - doesnt get much nicer than that
Missinh HK. I went there for business trip but enjoyed like anything,i liked the clean city,people there,super roads,super airports,dint felt like coming back

Went there twice day and night. We went there during the day to take tons of photos. The area was clean with lots of people. We went back at night to watch the light show which started at 8 pm. It was more crowded at night. There was also a mini concert that night but the songs were in chinese.

Recently voted the best skyline in the world . Recently voted as the best skyline in the world, this can be watched from couple of places in HK well known being Victoria Peak and TST. Be there to catch the lights turn after dusk with each one of the buildings having an unique design.Must see in HK.
First time in Kowloon . A must do. Pretty much what you expect to see in HK. We then got the star ferry, costs $2.5 each so about 25p over to HK island.

Don't miss the nightly light show.. Every night, Hong Kong Island presents a light show that choreographs animated lights on skyscrapers. You can best view it from the waterfront in Kowloon, which is always a nice evening stroll anyway. The show on New Year's Eve is even better, although smoke from the fireworks sometimes obscure the details. Another must-see view is the Hong Kong skyline as viewed from The Peak on Hong Kong Island, which provides a scale and scope. The Kowloon skyline, during the day, can be viewed from the public garden at the top of the IFC (International Finance Center). And if you visit the Art Museum at the waterfront in Kowloon — as you MUST — you can get a water-level view of Hong Kong Island's skyline during the day.

Nice Skyline, day or night. My 3 favorite places to experience the Hong Kong Skyline are a) from Star Ferry, b) the Lounge and Bar (102F) at The Ritz-Carlton (ICC building), and c) the parking lot of the Harbour City Mall. c) is at its best when watching the nightly light show. It has a perfect view of Hong Kong Island in front of you and you can hear the announcement through the speakers.
The best skyline. It is the best skyline in the world . Probably even better the new York city. The light are just breathe taking

Beautiful Hong Kong Skyline, not to be missed.. The Hong Kong skyline is impressive. If you do this on the Aqua Luna it will be so much more expensive than just using a state ferry. Even on the green and white star ferry you get to see the entire Hong Kong skyline in all its glory. I just loved Hong Kong, but did not have enough time there!
Make sure you watch the night show. From where we stayed we had a great view of the night light show however it is best observed at the waterfront Kowloon where you have the audio experience as well.

Hong Kong Skyline experience.. One of the most beautiful and iconic cityscapes in the world.
Make sure you are there for the lazer show every evening. Best views are from Kowloon / Nathan rd area.
one of the best in the world. one of the best in the world .... be sure to check out the view at HK 360 which is a observation deck
Great place to take photos. The building and it's architecture and especially the top is excitingly refreshing and innovative. Don't miss it.

One of the Best in the World. I would argue that this is one of the most iconic skylines in the world. Even when it isn't lit up at night time, the fact the skyscrapers are right on the edge of the harbor on both sides makes this impressive.

Lots and lots of lights. Beautiful. Shiny. Lots of lights. What more do you want? Though, having been to Hong Kong only in the winter, I wouldn't want to go there in Summer. It'd be hot and humid and sticky. Unless you dig that of course. We stayed there from late afternoon, until it was completely dark. :) Also, go to Ozone bar! You can see the entire Skyline. Very chill out place.
most famous skyline!. The skyline of hong kong i sprobably one of the most famous in the world. Make sure you go by night to see the sypmhony of lights with music.

Go for the Ferry Ride and enjoy the view. The greatest night skyline in the world. Sunset and the whole city transform in to majestic light artwork. Go using a ferry ride and enjoy the magnificent view of the skyline
Interactive skyline. Best viewed at night with lights from the buildings interact! During the day appears clouded and gray especially with bad weather conditions. When in Hong Kong a must see!

Breathtaking, especially at night. It's quite remarkable to see the towering buildings, whether they be high rise apartments like in the mid levels or the CBD buildings which are thin and narrow but towering into the sky with the backdrop of the mountains and the blue water in front. Wonderful at night.
what's left to say ?. Everyone knows the iconic hong kong skyline... nothing left to say about it, except you must experience it for yourself.
Unique Skyline.. One of the world's most unique skylines. Take a trip to Kowloon to see the Hong Kong Island Skyline from across the water. While you are there, you can see Bruce Lee's statue.

Beautiful and must see. This is a wonderful site both day and night. Just hope that you get a clear sky so that you can see across. If there's fog, you'll be disappointed by the lack of visibility. Otherwise make sure to bring your camera and come at night for some great pictures.
beautiful!. Exceptionally beautiful! There is something always so charming about a city's skyline and the beauty that a city can also have.

Night and be aware of weather. It's really interesting and probably one of the best skylines to enjoy, only second -in my opinion- to Shanghai..and that is only because a comparatively poor illumination.
Since rain is frequent, try to choose a day -better a night- with an air clear enough to enjoy the view.
Night view in clear nights with the lazer show is super. The skyline is always changing and a beautiful site. Night light shows across the bay is worth the walk along the shoreline.

A must see !. Go there when the weather is clear and just watch the amazing skyline of hong kong , you should visit once during the day and once in the evening.
At 20:00 you can watch the light show on most of the sky scrapers.
Hong Kong Skyline. Viewing Hong Kong through the night skyline is one of the best part of visiting Hong Kong. The view is lights all over. Its excellent and each night a laser show is organised.

Ugly by day, gorgeous by night . With all the mist and air pollution, and grey buildings, it doesn't look the best in the day, but at night it's wonderful.
Go at twilight to see all the lights come on.

Mesmerising!. Don't miss the lightshow. Grab a beer and watch the sun set while you wait for it to start. Before I went to Hong Kong I wondered how can a city be beautiful? But it is, I couldn't take my eyes off of it!

Beautiful views at night!. Beautiful view at night and the best part was that its free. Bring along a cup of coffee and enjoy the seaview at night. I went there about 10pm at night and it wasn't crowded. What a sight!

thrilling time. the top of hongkong.the train goes on a very steep path,but the skyline is beautiful in the evening.You can see the whole of Hongkong and take pictures.On your way back you can buy some souvenirs,but they will be more expensive than in the shops below in the city.
Go during the day and at night!. In spite of the crowd and the smog it is a very nice place for a walk during the day and it is stunning at night. Do not miss it!
Ultra-Fabulous.. I've seen a lot of skylines in over 60 countries; this one is the best. Especially when viewed from the 41st floor Le 188 in the Harbour Grand Hotel on North Point.
Beautiful!. Perhaps the worlds best skyline, whether you view it from atop Victoria peak or through the TST promenade at avenue of stars, the skyline is mesmerising at any time of the day.
Its a must see for a night walk!. Seeing the night skyline is one of the MAIN reason's to even come to Hong Kong. Its fantastic, and each night at 8 there is even a laser light show. Its a must see!

AMAZING VIEW. Undoubtedly, being at this place is a lifetime experience.
A must visiting place while in Hong Kong.
Take the tram, and thereafter take numerous elevators to reach on top... and there you are!

Stunning at night. Hong Kong lights up at night, at 8pm the Hong Kong Tourist Board put on a light show choreographed to music. The best place to view it is from a boat in the harbour and there are lots of excursions you can book, but just watching from The Avenue of Stars on Kowloon side or the ferry harbour on The Island side is still enjoyable.Another great view of the skyline in the evening is from Aqua Bar at 1 Peking Road, The drinks are expensive, but it is worth it to enjoy a delicious cocktail and stunning view. Make it your holiday extravagance and enjoy.
Beautiful. It is so beautiful looking back from Kowloon. Take the Star Ferry to get the best view and experience.

One of the best skylines in the world. The best place to see HKs skyline is from Victoria peak or the The Ritz Carlton from both places you will get to see the famous skyline and at night you will get the best views of the light show that starts at 8pm

Panoramic view of Hong Kong's Victoria Harbour. We stayed at Hotel Panorama by Rhombus, the view of Victoria harbour from our bedroom and bathroom were just so great! We often went up to the Sky Garden of the hotel (located on the 40th floor) to enjoy the breeze and with no doubt the view!!! I think we made a real great choice selecting Hotel Panorama because it offers rooms with great harbour view when we visited HKG, we definitely made the most of our stay and most of all really enjoyed the picturesque view as well! We had lots of fun walking along The Avenue of Stars to take much closer photos of the harbour....just so memorable!!!
Interesting attraction for tourists. We were a bit disappointed by the choice of the music which was not as grand as a few years ago when I visited the same place.

Awesomely Thrilling - crossing 100 storeys in 60 sec. With a spectacular view (I tried both day and Night), the skyline is something to experience. The clear skyline during the day (hope its a clear day) and the twilight Harbour view in the night will keep you mesmerized. A must see.
Awsome. A very impresive skyline. Even more during the night.A good place to take pictures is close to the watch tower or from the star fairy.

Amazing!!!!!. No words to describe that fantastic experience, just you have to try!!If you are luky to find a clear day you can enjoy the view for the day too, but in darkness it becomes fantastic!!!!

Skylit Beauty. Hong Kong Skyline is beautiful. One of the most important aspect which gives the city its character. We could never have enough of it - from our hotel room to sky tram to the plane or the bus trip to Stanley or the ferry/Starcruise ride.... we kept feasting on this skyline from diff places... IT is Uniquely Beautiful !!
Scenic View. Situated between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon Peninsula, Victoria Bay is situated along the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade, allows for spectacular harbour views.

Nothing to dislike-. about the views you will see. No matter where you are, whether in the Hong Kong or Kowloon side, the view is awe inspiring. Make sure you see the views during the day and especially at night.
Laser lights show and walk. Beautiful skyline and does not matter you go in day and night, alaways busy. Must see laser lights show at night.
Breathtaking Views. Not many words can describe the beauty that is Hong Kong. The skyline lights up the cloudy sky. Definitely a highlight of mine!
nice night and day. very nice day and night to submerge yourself in HK atmosphere! you can go there with MRT and back with ffeery to enjoy the view

absolutely breathtaking. the view of the hongkong skyline from sky 100, from star ferry, mount faber and the hong kong wheel are all breath taking and I would rate it very highly. Another skyline of hongkong which I really enjoyed was the drive from ocean park to stanley ..... i did it on a hop on hop off bus and would strongly recommend doing it on the open top.

WOW. Wow! Amazing skyline from both sides, sit and spend time at the pier and just enjoy the view. Ferry ride across and back is a good idea to catch the view from both side. View in the day and dark is different and good.
Stunning if no pollution. Stunning if no pollution, it is a great harbour to sail in and out off. If the pollution is bad the lights are just a haze.
Amazing. The Hong Kong skyline seems to never end. It's important to view the skyline at night and during the day. It's an impressive and expansive city.
the Skyline, the Peak. Always worth a trip up to the Peak to be part of the skyline. The view from up there is wonderful. Upgraded since my last visit in 2003 the view is still the same.

Not the Bund. Awesome view, buildings seem to go on forever. The light show is nothing amazing. Don't plan your trip around the show at 8, just go whenever it's convenient. I'd rate it #2 behind the Bund in Shanghai.
Holiday. Oh my!!! Its really high.beautiful view from the top.huge shopping mall there too.my husband and i we injoy it.we have pix to show you guys.
Amazing skyline. Loved the way the skyline sort of flows in HK. The night view was amazing and the Symphony of Lights was really enjoyable.

Nice view. I liked the view from Victoria peak the best. It was hazy when I first arrived at the peak I hiked the Victoria peak trial and as I did this hike the haze did lift and the view was much clearer later day. You can see part of Hong Kong Island and a large section of Kowloon. On the hike you can also see Lantau Island and Lamma Island plus a few other smaller Islands.
On a clear day...... We could see forever. The Skyline from the peak is a must do.I have been here with all different family members of all different ages and I am still not tired of it!

We get an unobstructed view of the Hongkong skyline from our Ritz-Carlton hotel room at the 109th floor.. By night time, when the lights are on at the Harbour and Hongkong skyline viewed from our room, the horizon becomes romantic. Seems like life is at a standstill at these moments.

Can't get tired of the light show. The HK skyline and the lightshow are just beautiful. Do not miss the special lights at the HSBC main building due to their anniversary - is incredible what LED lights can do nowadays :)
Does it get any better for a city?. Hong Kong's skyline rivals any on the planet with buildings of all shapes, sizes, designs, colors and imagination. London? New York? C'mon...

Couldn't get enough of it!. A must see in a lifetime! Whether you se it from the Avenue of the Stars in Kowloon, a boat trip on Hong Kong bay or Victoria's peak, this is one of the must impressive skylines you can admire. The light show at night is not to miss.

Always Magnificent. All major cities offer us a great skyline site but Hong Kong's is truly something worth experiencing... If you can not stay for a long time then be sure to have a luxury stop over and book in close (if not on) the harbour so you can enjoy the view both day and night!

Avenue of the stars and HK Skyline. Best time would be around november to march. night time viewing is best. you can ride the starferry from central to kowloon and strong along the famous avenue of the starts which begins at the clock tower all the way to tsim sha tsui east. there are less crowds in tsim sha tsui east side of the promenade. the light shows in the evening are worth the wait and you wont be bored since the views are really nice and its fun to be with the locals enjoying the victoria harbour skyline.

Harbour front Walk. A must do is a walk along The Avenue of The Stars Kowloon late afternoon or evening.The views over to the Island are spectacular There are a number of statues with moviemaking themes and you will enjoy watching people posing and taking photos.There is the light show every night which draws many people. When finished take the overhead walkway and there are many outdoor restaurants with great views plus good food

Day or Night, a delightful city. Easy to fall in love with.. Whether it was day or night I loved looking over Hong Kong. It is a fascinating city that in some ways defies and challenges my imagination and perspective all at once. Best view was all the way during my hike on the Peak Trail and during my walk down the mountain. So many different perspectives of a great city.

Fantastic. There are a number of ways to take pictures of the Hong Kong Skyline: from Victoria Peak, on board the Ferry; or from the shores of either Kowloon or Hong Kong Island. My best was from my hotel room in the Conrad. Your friends will be envious.
Buildings galore. Very nice and busy skyline. Beautifully well lit at night, and if your lucky you can experience the laser light show.
Great view. Highly recommended if you go to hongkong, nevertheless hongkong is just too crowded it's the only thing I don't like

Take a stroll, don't rush .... One of the most beautiful and colourful in the world ... if you want to avoid the crowded tourists, and they can be noisy, go there after 11pm. Take your time, walk and talk with your love ones ...

Great view, terrible crowds. The view was fantastic from the top; we did the hike up to the peak and it was really worth it. However, there really needs to be more than 1 viewing platform up there; I could hardly see a thing for about 15-20 mins due to the amount of people up there. The 100dollars don't really give you a good view even from the paid viewing platform; I guess the free one would be even more crowded(although I didnt go there). Not really worth coming there early and shoring up a small area in the viewing platform for seeing the lights on the HK skyline (in my opinion). The lights do look beautiful, and after a while when you manage to get that little sanctuary of space in the viewing platform, it does make it worth. Beware of pushy people, or people trying to take a DSLR quality pic from their VGA camera; just ignore them. Focus on getting that little space to see the skyline, click your pics, and move on!!

Hong Kong Skyline is very famous, one of the best in the world!. As you all know, Hong Kong Skyline is very famous, one of the best in the world! you can explore the island's most famous buildings Such as HSBC and China Bank Center, Central Plaza, Hopewell Center etc...
Truely amazing. When lit up its like a Christmas tree. We loved cruising on Hong Kong harbour with the kids and recommend it even for the shortest visit

One Of The Best I've Seen!. Once upon a time I thought that New York had the best skyline in the world….move over New York and welcome Hong Kong! Simply unbelievable! The best vantage points of the skyline I had were from the Avenue of Stars and also from Victoria Peak. At night, the ICC Light and Music Show is also brilliant!

The Night views from Tsim Sha Tsui dock (right on the water) are awesome. We take the ferry from HK Island to Tsim Sha Tsui and walk along the waterline. The nightlife there is really fun. There is a lot of music as many groups walk around and play and the views of HK Island are absolutely beautiful. Even late at night we feel really safe. People are friendly and everyone seems to be having a great time. It is one of our favorite places in Hong Kong to cruise.

Pick a nice weather to visit. Hong Kong has a lovely skyline and you can experience it from many locations. Just pick-up the right time of the year for your visit. November through March is my recommendation. Avoid June - August :)
One of the best skylines ever. Captivating - I love skylines and this has to be one of the best I have ever seen. Loved Hong Kong and loved this view - not to be missed.

A must visit. The view of the skyline is magnificent with a mix of old and modern buildings. Definitely a must visit when you're in Hong Kong. I managed to experience the skyline at night as well as the display of colourful lights on the buildings. It was wonderful.

Bedazzled!. A view of Hong Kong city a night is a definite MUST DO when visiting. Whether you do a harbour crossing on the ferry or go to Victoria Peak, the lights of this amazing city will bedazzle you!

City under the Stars. Hongkong Skyline is best viewed at night , where dancing lights can be seen as it plays along with the sound. Can be viewed while inside the rooms/suites, even while near the Avenue of Star side decks.
Incredibly Beautiful. We were there on a rainy day/evening, but still the skyline across the river was incredible. Don't miss the light show each evening at 8pm!
Most important place to see when you are in HK!. Absolutely Important to visit this place! You cannot leave HK without checking gret view of HK Island from Kowloon side!
Super. Super view of the HongKong city with its all modern & old buildings, skyline structures. Specially at night from the peak or fron the Avenue, the skyline is sure the mark of a modern city.

Amazing!. The Skyline is a very good light show with lots of tall buildings taking part. It is around 10 mins long but it includes lazers, flashing white lights, rainbows and alot more. It was not the best light show it was very short and the photo we saw let us down quite a bit!i recomend this for family and Couplesit has got photo booths that people can takeof you by the riveroverall,it was very good

Colourful, providing its good weather.... The Hong Kong Skyline is incredibly beautiful ,day and night , providing it is a clear day...How lucky were we in June 2015 not to have rain until the very last day, and be able to view the Skyline from Victoria Peak , one day, Sky100 the next and The Ozone Bar on another occasion. You can view for miles and pick out points of interest. The light show at night on the Victoria Harbour buildings is wonderful.
World class view. Wow, no wonder this is a world class destination. So many buildings in a small place. Make sure you hit Kowloon. and some local shopping and eats.

Beautiful Night lights. Driving around Hong Kong at night is a wonderful experience. The lights never cease to amaze.
Its a pity we could not take more pictures.

Spectacular! Don't miss it!. Unbeleivable, you see it in films and pictures and its impressive, but its so much more in real life, feels like the original compared to the likes of Shanghai today. Really could stare at the different parts of it all day and importantly night. Don't go up the peak to see the lightshow, its on the other side of the buildings ;)
Wow!!!. The view was really amazing. .The buildings boast their different colors...the lightings are just so fantastic!!!
gorgeous. Hong Kong as a beautiful skyline. Beautiful by day and amazing at night! It can be seen from many different places but defiantly take the time to enjoy it!
High Rise High Rise. The skyline reminded me of New York City. Most of the buildings were modern architecture and each tried to outperform the other.
Normal Picturesque. It has a beautiful skyline. The best part is you can easily go up Victoria's Peak to see it all from one scenic view.
Tour Guide. Visit Victoria Harbour at Night at 8 Pm every night and view the Sound and Light Lazer show.The best Viewing place for this show is on the Kowloon Side.

an amazing night view of Hong Kong island. I like it especially during the night time view where we get to see a different lights of a spectacular buildings of the Hong Kong.But what i dislike is when more unorganized crowds gathered infront of the ticketing counter where in we have to wait for along queue and get annoyed when some people misbehave and cut the queue infront of your.
lights are shining. Hong Kong has one of the great skylines of the world. Get a taxi from Taikoo shing down the Eastern corridor as dusk descents.

Spectacular Skyline!. I come from a City and seeing the Skyline of Hong Kong is spectacular. The building are never ending with a backdrop of either the ocean or the mountains you can see from either end of Hong Kong.
Best view is while on the ferry coming from Macau to Hong Kong.

City views..... Very senic from top of hongkong. Its amazing! !!!
Elevator reached to 100 the floor in 60 sec.
You can enjoy chilled beer or hot cappuccino and try getting the perfect clicks.
Spectaclular. Make sure you catch the daytime and evening view. Star Ferry at 8 pm each evening provides a "light show". Gets busy but a good show.
Spectacular. Hong Kong skyline when viewed from TST harbour must be the finest in the world on a clear evening. One sight that cannot be missed whilst in the city
excellent. The night light show is something to see. Pick a nice bar with a view and enjoy a cocktail and the show.
Breathtaking. The views of the skyline are just amazing, great light show. Sometimes the low clouds and mist broke the view but when the sunsets and the light bounces off the towers...wow
Do Not Miss. You have to walk down to the bay and see the skyline at night. It is a must see for HK. Do it during the music show and the buildings light up. Nothing like it in the world.

Like No Other. If you visit HK, this is a must see. Try to get onto the Kowloon Ocean Terminal side, near the Star Ferry and look across in the evening. There is a light show of the buildings around 8pm, or after dark, and when the weather is good.Even on a bad evening, weather wise, it is beautiful and moody.And there are lots of museums and restaurants on the Kowloon peninsular area. Visit that Old Lady of HK, The Peninsular Hotel, maybe for high tea before shopping at the Ocean Terminal and a view of the night skyline before having a late dinner at one of the area restuarants.

The #1 Reason for a Kowloon Harbor Facing Room,. My favorite skyline in the world, so far. The lights on the water and the mountains behind the skyscrapers is beautiful. It tells a story of ages of trading, of commerce and of outlaws and elegance. Pleasing and soothing to gaze upon, whether it be day or night. Definitely the bonus of staying in a harbor view room in Kowloon.

sail away view. has we boarded our star ship gemini cruise going to Singapore was told we had to watch the sky line at night and glad we did it was a great colorful send off very good light display of hong kong well worth it and it was free as we were on the ship

Extravaganza,. I always try to be on the Kowloon side at 8pm at least once during every visit to Hong Kong. The light show is realy impressive and there is always something new to see. Extravelent yes but I like it.
beautiful skyline!. We loved seeing all the tall buildings lighted up at night with the view of the water in the surroundings. And it does NOT smell fishy at all!
Great HK Skyline. The way the skyline has developed over the years is just great. Great view from Victoria Harbour side.
The Best in Asia. Awe-inspiring and impressive, words could never truly describe it, and photos could never capture its beauty. One of the must-see's in Asia. Beautiful Hong Kong! :)

This skyline is unique to the world. Move around both the island and Kowloon to see many different views of the wonderful
assortment of buildings,boats and bridges

The perfect mix of Oriental and Asian vintage life with modernity all around...Simply glorious.. Beautiful ferry ride to Kowloon..The night skyline in the backdrop and if it happens that you chose the last ferry, the silence is beautiful. You might be able to talk to a Cantonese stranger and the fascinating story of old time Kowloon. A must visit place.
Very good. Very good place to visit at night , Lighting at the Building is marvelous , while crossing victoria harbour you can enjoy the same
A spectacular sight. One of the must see attractions of Hong Kong. Go there during the evening and get a place along the shore line and watch the light show and the boats across the harbour.

Magical. I have been to Hong Kong a few times, and I believe its skyline and the natural setting around are one of the city's highlights. See it during the day, see it at night... Go to Kowloon, go to Central, climb Victoria Peak, take a ferry ride... You will see something different from each angle. Yes, it can get crowded (especially along Avenue of the Stars) however it is still worth visiting. Miss out and you have not really seen Hong Kong!
Good experience do not miss and retain a photographic memory!. Lovely evening on a clear and dry day.Clean and safe environment to relax after a very tiring day crisscrossing the city's!

Night viewing a must. A must see for Hong Kong. To get one of the bst views, go to the Kowloon side to the museum of Chinese Arts and pop up the outside stair to an open area where a cafe ormallly operates during the day. It is usually uncrowded here and you get an excellent view of, not only the skyline but of the light show as well.

Whoa. One of the most amazing skylines! There are so many great views of this skyline - you'll find interesting vantage points from the Kowloon Promenade and Victoria Peak, among other places you wouldn't have expected.I so frequently found myself just staring out at the buildings during the middle of the day at the most random locations... It makes you feel wonder and awe inside!

a must to see the skyline come to life. the show in the evening is amazing like a big light show like jean michel jarred get there early for the best space to watch and bring your camera its a journey in its self
Best views. Hong Kong Skyline at night is always a highlight and every year it seems to get better. Be sure to bring a good camera to capture every moment.
Good view. U can get to see good view of hongkong from Kowloon observation deck , this view u can see near avenue of star kowloon

The Best Skyline in the World. The HK skyline never fails to mesmerise no matter how many times you have seen it. A kaleidescope of lights in and on and cascading the impressive built forms and complemented by the ever changing weather and the hive of harbour activity

Really distinct experience. The skyline is definitely something to see but I thought the "lightshow" was pretty underwhelming. Tons of people and selfie sticks to dodge for a little blinking and some faint music. Fortunately, it's a fairly short experience.

Vertical city. Hong Kong has the rare privilege to combine verticality and expanse. The result is an incredible skyline, it is best observed there. Like you look at manhattan from the brooklyn heights

Still lovely.. One cannot get tired of the lovely Hong Kong skyline, especially during the evening.Looking at the skyscrapers on either side of the harbour in the evening can be almost mesmerizing, despite the famous light show being a tad underwhelming.

HongKong is simply magnificent. Everyone must see Hong Kong!It is hard to believe that so many people live in such a small space. The tall buildings seem to have been there forever, they blend in with the mountains and the bay. At night they light up and glitter like stars.
Amazing views and skyline.. Amazing views and skyline during the day and also at night. Harbour is such a vibrant place and a must see when in Hong Kong.

One of the most interesting skylines you'll ever see. For any skyline or big city enthusiast Hong Kong's skyline surely ranks as a must see. The tall buildings against the harbour, with the mountains in the backdrop are magnificent.

Iconic. The skyline is best seen first in daytime, then sunset and then fully lit at night.
The light show is a bit naff and disappointing.

Overwhelming. Hong Kong is one of the largest cities I have ever visited. The skyline is beautiful, especially at night. It can be viewed from one of the ferries that travel between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon that don't charge much. If you purchase a ticket on the Big Red Bus that allows you to hop on and off at your leisure, they will also give you ferry tickets. Another way to view the harbor is by walking along the "Avenue of the Stars" (Chinese Movie Stars), along the Victoria Harbor waterfront.

Amazing Skyline, however.... The Hong Kong Skyline is absolutely amazing to see. Not yet being able to compare it to any other skylines in the world I have to admit this will be tough to beat.We sat on the Kowloon side at the end of Ave of the Stars where it meets the Hong Kong Museum of Art. We decided to stay put at about 7 p.m., one hour before the Symphony of Lights which starts at 8 p.m., and worked out because we got to enjoy the transformation of the city from sunset, twilight, to night. As the time drew nearer to 8 p.m. the crowds began to bother and got pretty busy. As for the Symphony of Lights, we were not impressed at all. We expected to see a light show with lasers, dancing lights, etc. however all we saw were a few green light beams out of a building here and there and some minor light patterns. There was music in the background to go with the light show however it was very low and hard to hear. Bottom line: skyline is a must to see but don't expect much from the symphony of lights.
Pre Cruise stop over. You have got to go here even if it is just for the views, remarkable, we have never been anywhere as exciting as this before and we have done a lot of long hall travelling!

Spectacular Views and Great Laser Show. Above our expectation as we thought to be similar to new years eve fireworks. bt its something totally different. Read about it on Guiddoo's app but was not sure to give a visit.I am happy we went.

View it on the water. We were advised to watch the Skyline show from a restaurant part way up on of the high rise buildings for an ultimate view.Whilst the view was still great, we lost the atmosphere and the music that you get on the water front. We went down there the next day and stood to watch the show and for us it was far improved.

Great photography and colours. The Hong Kong Skyline is something to see with it's vibrant colours at night. The laser show from building to building is a site not to miss. There are many vantage points to see this as well from Hong Kong Island, Victoria Peak and Kowloon.

Most recognizable skylines in the world. Hong Kong has an amazing skyline featuring notable architecture which only gets better at night. Some of the residential buildings are pedestrian and tired looking, but suppose they add to the unique charm of Hong Kong.
Manhattan vs Hong Kong. Hong Kong's skyline is gorgeous....it def beats the skyline that nyc has to offer. I recommend the bubba gump restaurant by the Hong Kong skyline.
Laser Light. The skyline of the urban jungle is fantastic the nightly laser show is not too be missed there are lots of places to get food and be out doors to see this amazing site
excellent memory. we looked at this beautiful skyline and thought WOW, this is just a lifetime experience for sure , and so nice
Stunning. What else could you say ? We sat in the Park above "The Avenue of The Stars" on the Kowloon Side, just amazed at that skyline.
Hong Kong with its beautiful Light show. Victoria Harbour is the place you can go by late afternoon to enjoy the sunset and after that there is a Light show at 7pm (19:00 hrs) onwards.
Nice skyine. If you ever travel to Hong Kong the skyline at night is a must. There is a light show between the buildings which is very nice

Beautiful . The Hong Kong skyline is definitely worth a visit especially at night, would recommend a ferry ride across and back to see both ends of the skyline..truly stunning and one of the best in the world

Over crowded :(. Good skyline but over crowded with visitors. No other activity at the observation area from which visitors can see the skyline. Tourism board should set up, telescopic points which offer a clearer view to tourists. No option to get your picture clicked/ framed by photographers, visitors wouldn't mind paying $10 - $20 for a decent size professional picture clicked with the skyline in the background.

from the ifc tower. Got a great view of the skyline and harbour, across to Kowloon. We found the exhibition about money was surprisingly interesting too, as were the gifts on sale. You need photo id to get in !

a breath taking view of the hong Kong skyline from tsim-sha-tsui. there is a breath taking view of the hong Kong skyline from tsim-sha-tsui. It is a must see when you are in Hong Kong. Although it is a nive view in the daytime. You must see it at night. From the tsim-sha-tsui side you will see all the buildings light up and flash colors and signs.

Good view. The skyline during my visit in June 2015 is as great. Laser show in the night is not really worth to see as i don't feel any sense of excitement. perhaps it might be due to the chinese ttheme.

Nice if you are in the area. The harbour is lovely and it's nice to see all of the skyscrapers lit up, but the light show itself isn't really anything special - Singapore, for example, does a much better job with its light-and-water show or its light-and-music show. If you are in the are, definitely take it in, preferably from one of the fancy hotels - cocktail in hand - but don't create a convoluted itinerary and miss out on something else just to make it happen.

Not to be missed. A sky line that you will not forget, do not miss the light show at 8pm, it is spectacular, you watch from the Kowloon side which you reach by the star ferry and find a place on the upper deck
Hong Kong wow!. Hong Kong is a do not miss city! If you have ever had the desire to visit HK do not miss the chance!

Find the right calm spot to enjoy the lights and the boats on the bay. Everything you think it should be. From the right spot its dreamy. A nice restaraunt terrace with a glass of wine and calm after a frantic day.
HONG KONG SKYLINE. You Have to see the lazer light show! The show normally starts at 8.30 or so. You can see the show from many points on the harbor.
Light up my life. You can walk along the promenade at dusk and take in a spectacular light show of the island. Its like a firework display and its free. Especially good at Xmas.
Lovely. It's a wonderful site to see..in fact you can hardly miss it but a few places and the light show together make it all the more interesting. A lovely destination esp with kids

Has to be seen.. The lights of the skyline looking back towards Hong Kong island are really worth seeing, along with those of the river traffic. Personally I would not be too concerned about getting there specifically for the 8.00 'show', as really this just provides a few extra lasers to what is well worth seeing anyway. I would highly recommend the ferry from HK to Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon. It is only a few pence each way and the lights are best viewed from there in the evening. Really nice promenade at TST, albeit a distinct lack of bars. I found one towards the end of the promenade if you turn right when coming out of the ferry terminal, at which you can sit outside with a good view of the river and lights.

HK Bank Holiday Trip -. Beautiful by night. Best viewed from avenue of the stars if on Kowloon, best from Admiralty if from the Island. Also advise trying to get a drinks date at the Aqua Bar HK - lovely view of the light show from there
Fantastic Light Show. A must see! It is best to go and see the light show which starts at 8pm every night. For the best view you should get on one of the river boats!

Lasers and light show. It's worth getting a viewing spot early. Well wort the visit. A real visual treat sitting by the water and watching the light and laser show. The music felt a bit dated but the show is worth the wait. Meh young boys really loved it. So much so that we saw it twice
Breathtaking view. Best place to see Hong Kong Skyline is at Victoria Peak. I came here by bus because the Peak Tram was under maintenance at the time.
Skyline is amazing. We had no idea what to expect and the view from our hotel was great. However, there often is smog and then it it a different story in Hong Kong.
Light Bling!. Theres something really beautiful about the skyline in Hong Kong. It reminded me what amazing things humans can achieve and made me feel amongst life. Such pretty bling.
Like Sheikh Zayed Road, Dubai. I got a crick in my neck from craning up to look at the very attractive buildings downtown. ("craning"; obviously from the crane bird with long thin bent neck)

Endless HK Skyline.. The magic of Victoria Harbor is significant enough during daylight hours but sunset is the most magnificent as the lights start coming on. At 8.00pm the Symphony of Lights commences for light show each night. All visitors should take the iconic Star Ferry for a crossover and return to get all the strategic views. Victoria Peak is also a must do visit to take in all the scenery.

Not as iconic as i thought. Even though the Hong Kong Skyline is known over most of the world, it would seem that only a very small part of it is well known. The light show in the evening was a bit of an anti-climax even though we had to watch it from our hotel window.

Awesome view at night from the water. You can't visit Hong Kong without going out on a ferry ride at night and viewing the wonderful skyline of the City. The architecture and height of the buildings cast against the mountains in the background and the water in the forefront is a rare sight among the great cities of the world.Try to go on a clear night (no rain or clouds) to really view this Skyline in all of its majesty. Truly a memory that will last forever.Highly recommended.
Top destination. This is an excellent destination. The restaurant at the top is fantastic and the views superb. Go at dusk and enjoy the transformation to night lights. Well worth the trip
Ever changing!. What to say, one of the best skylines in the world. There is a light show every evening at 8pm - best viewed from the Kowloon side.
My husband went for work, and I met him there a week later.. Make sure you take a peak of the Skyline at night when you are traveling to Hong Kong. Try to get a room with a skyline view.

Awesome. Awesome, simply awesome. Its a sight you need to see before you die. We first saw it from a junk in the channel and were gobsmacked.
Go to see it at 8pm.

Un-matchable View. The skyline is amazing from both sides of the harbor. The tall buildings of different styles and colors is amazing. A treat as far and high as the eye can see. The laser show in the night is a can't miss.
Awesome!. Hong kong night light symphony, should be in your list of places to visit in HK. Starts @ 8pm every night and it takes around 15 minutes of cool sound and light show.
Beautiful from TST.. The city with the greatest number of skyscrapers didn't let me down. Gorgeous skyline from across the Harbor!
It is nice. On a nice day, it is really beautiful. You can see all the lights of the buildings with glimpse of the Peak as well.
Fabulous view from Kowloon side. A fascinating view of Hong Kong island at night with glittering lights and fabulous atmosphere. One to tick off your bucket list.
Awe-inspiring skyline. Best part is the view can be had from different places. Either the kowloon bay or the main island or from the jetty.

the skyline is an event. the promenade in TST Hong Kong is an event to enjoy morng noon and night. Always comfortably crowded with couples, families friends wakers and a few runners. There are street musicians, artists, photographers. and occasional polite protesters.Everyone takes selfies and photos with friends. At night the lighted buildings and signs are like Times Square on Steroids. You can cap it off with a ride on the Star Ferry to Hong Kong island for about $0.25 and back. The view is fantastic and the ride on the harbour peaceful.I"ve done it many times and its always new.

Beautiful view of the skyscrappers in this modern city. Sadly we reached there around 8something and missed the symphony of lights show which starts at 8pm daily.It was a spur of the moment decision to visit this place after our dinner nearby and i'm glad for it since our time in HK was just like 2D1N and it's my 1st trip to HK (well, just in passing enroute home).This place really showcase to the visitors the glory of HK's prosperity and modern development esp. at night.However, do beware that there's some major construction beside the Avenue of Stars and our taxi was only able to drop us near the Intercontinental Hotel (just across the street to the waterfront). Best view mayhaps is from the double storey viewing deck besides Tin Sing harbour (天星码头) which is open to tourist and free. Around 15mins walk from the Intercontinental).Sadly it's very hard to take photos without passerby interuptions as the tourists there just don't care to stop and stare at us like we're blocking their path instead of showing some courtesy and hospitality.
Great view. Although manhattan sky line is best in the world but hongkong is not too less ,you can take a trip of old style cruise which show full view in around one and the half hour
one of the best skylines in the world. great views in both day time and night. i enjoyed the skyline from wan chai, avenue of stars and other locations.

Beautiful at Night. I'd recommend walking the Avenue of the Stars and looking across the bay for the Skyline. I wouldn't recommend the light show and music. It wasn't that great. But, I was expecting a lot. Maybe next time, if there are fireworks it'd be better.

Nice view... and it's free.. :). Hong Kong skyline view can be enjoyed around Avenue of the stars area or in front of Harbour city mall area near the ferry terminal. The best time to enjoy this amazing view is around 8am in the morning, and around 6pm until 8pm. On 8pm , those buildings in the other side of the island will have a Symphony of Lights, a sound and lighting show. So nice to see.
Really nice!. Views are stunning, not the best in the world, but certainly one of the best! The light show is just a tourist attraction, not that spectacular.
Simply amazing!. I visited the Skydeck in the morning, though I would highly recommend visiting it during the night. It comes alive at night with the Sky Show of laser lights and lit up skyscrapers.

Rainy but still beautiful!. We had a harbor view room at the Hong Kong Intercontinental so we saw the skyline every morning and night. The view from the top of the Ritz Carlton is also quite fabulous.

Best skyline in the world.... I ve seen the New York and Singapore skyline. But nothing compares to seeing the skyline of Hong Kong from opposite the harbour. The buildings all light up and flashing different colours. Not something you can see in other cities. A great place to get a nice pic.

Simply Stunning. Just an amazing sight - even more so from the top of Victoria Peak. It even comes alive at night with the Sky Show of laser lights and lit up skyscrapers. With the harbour as well, it a wonderful and vibrant city.
Wow. A visit ot the avenue of stars once in the morning and then after sunset would certainly elevate you
Wow. If you are in Hong Kong you can not miss the view. Go up to the peak and the view is even better. One of the great harbours of the world.
Must see in HongKong. While went into ferry to see light show of sky line, I wasn't hopping such a stunning view of it. It was so eye-catching and beautiful. One must not miss, if visiting HongKong.

HongKong Skyline. We bought tickets (USD$45/pp) for the harbor cruise at night to see Hongkong skyine - The advertisement mentioned laser and light show - The whole experience was a total disappointment and big disaster - There were a few laser light bouncing in the sky and the lighting on the buildings was terrible ! Don't waste your money on harbor cruise - You can see the whole skyline by standing along the pier, especially Pier # 3In summary, Hongkong skyline is NOTHING compared to Shanghai skyline (only USD$22/pp for harbor cruise)

Great place to relax. I travel to Hong Kong 3 times a year on business but I always make a point of allowing a few days for site seeing and chilling out. There are endless places to visit and every time I seem to find something that I had never even knew was there. April and October are the best times to visit this place. To get a great view of the Hong Kong Skyline walk around along the waters front towards the science museum end. Walk up the steps and there are a line of seats here that are perfect for relaxing and taking in the fantastic views across Victoria Harbour as the Light show begins.

one of the best views in the world. I think it is bed seen from the Kowloon side at night. A breathtaking view you will never forget. Or take the tram to the peak for a great view. Absolutely stunning

wonderfull city. Just beautiful. Especially at night when most are with lights. It has a special look to it. The river with all its different boats and than the tower buildings in all different shapes. I enjoyed being here a lot just watching the citylife go by.
Lofty Heights!. Impressive by day from the V Peak and even more impressive by night from the Ave of the Stars. Never seen so many high rises in such a small space.

Great view of the entire Hongkong and Kowloon Harbors. Wsh for a less foggy day so that you'll enjoy the exhilirating view. Going up there is free and fun, along with the Peak tram RIde, Madam Tussauds Wax Museum, a vist at Bubba Gump in addition to shopping at the side, your trip will be all worth it.

Amazing!. Amazing by night and day. Apparently there was a laser light show...we never got to experience it. The skyline is breath taking by any imagination. We went up to Victoria Peak during the day...I can only guess what it would've been like at night..amazing

Great Views. The views of the Hong Kong skyline at night are breath taking. The best place to see them is from the neighbooring area of Kowloon then you are able to get a panoramic view of the lights and the city.

Simply one of the best skyline views in the world. Great in the day with the Peak in the background, even better at night with all the neon and best of all if you can visit during a firework display (NYE, CNY, National Day etc)

Must been seen in night. Skyline must be seen in night. Some of the views will surprise you. No limit to numbers photos that one can click as the view are superb.
One suggestion would be not try evening cruise light show, That's pathetic and waste of money.
Astonishing. Hong Kong skyline is astonishing, very vibrant and colorful especially at night. We enjoyed the skyline at it is even relaxing for us.
