Wonder of the World. I have been lucky enough to experience the sumptuous skyline of Hong Kong on a number of occasions in recent months. It truly is a sight to marvel at, day and night. There is an endless array of skyscrapers cemented in between the hills and peaks along the shoreline of Victoria Harbour. By day the tantalising topography of the island is there for all to see while at night there is a dazzling show of lights that is guaranteed to delight. If you are a night owl visit in the hours after midnight, take a seat on a bench on the Avenue of Stars, bring a few beers sit back and take it all in.

On a junk, in the harbour! WOW.. Taking the traditional junk around the harbour was one of the highlights of our trip to HK. Just after a fresh rain, we boarded, ordered a glass of wine, sat up front and listened to the nice music on the tour. Truly a momentous time.

Hong Kong Skyline. Is one of the best skylines that I have ever seen. Found a bar/restaurant on the 30th Floor of a building near our hotel with an almost 360 degree view - it was amazing, both by day and night.
Victorias peak. Hong Kong is a place for any type of tourist. Moderately priced and polite. Very aggressive marketing and a place to de-stress. Caters to any type of palate.

Make it a point to see it at night!. Just a wonder to see the skyline from all different angles. I've been fortunate enough to see the skyline from TST Promenade, various restaurants in TST, from Victoria Peak, and Kowloon Park. In my opinion it's so much nicer to see it at night.

Beautiful, but get there before the crowds. An absolutely stunning skyline - what more can be said? If you are looking for photos, the avenue of stars is (as advertised) the best spot. I would recommend getting there at sunset: 1. because I think the sunset skyscape is superior to the nightscape and 2. because the viewing area gets absolutely packed after sundown.
Awesome Skyline. Travel over to Kowloon on the star ferry to watch the light show in the evening from the Avenue of the Stars.
a "must have seen". Of course the Hong Kong Skyline is a must have seen item for all HK visitors. The skyline is just breathtaking and amazing... not many places like that in the world...
Concrete Jungle. The HK skyline is breath taking. Had the pleasure of seeing it during the day and night time and it was breath taking.

My view for 3 years. Having lived in Hong Kong this was my view for 3 years, it was a smelly dirty harbour by day, so much bustling about but at night it was a total transformation. Try and get a hotel on either side of the Island or Kowloon and make sure you get harbour view. The skyline when lit u is amazing. You may be lucky and also see the traditional junks sailing in and out of the harbour.

A cold respite in hot weather. the placement of the giant wheel right at the pier made sure we have a great view of the hong kong sky scrapers and the air-conditioning was a breather in the hot and humid weather. however the building nearby were taller than the giant wheel itself
Beautiful. Like Newyork or Chicago , beautiful at night or sunset , the symphony of lights sound and music show was good too , not great but unique for sure .
Amazing !. Like nowhere else and it's a must see experience ! View by day from Victoria Peak, and by night from Kowloon to see the light show

First trip to HK - amazed by the views!. On Day 1, we traveled to the Peak to get our bearings, and I just couldn't believe the beauty of this city. Also learned that HK has more skyscrapers than any other metropolitan area - more than double its closest competitor (New York City). The skyline is gorgeous. Best viewed from the Peak and from Ozone in Kowloon!

Amazing with fireworks. We visited during the Chinese New Year and the fireworks across the skyline were breathtaking.There are some high restaurants to get a better view, the food is expensive, but just got and have a drink as the view is free

Good experience, but more the good crowd energy and shopping. Great crowd energy, everyone milling around and interacting, some roller skating, some seated.I was impressed until I visited Shanghai which of course is ten times more impressive.

Average.. Didn't look that excellent as was told.Maybe would look better on days with less mist/fog.The view from the peak wasn't that spectacular and the people on duty at the peak were less hospitable than what we expect at a touristy place.
Awesome. The charmest skyline of the world. Its a man made wonder. feels wonderful to look at the skyscrapers like matchsticks standing

Amazing!. One of the most spectacular skylines in the world. The harbour with the rugged mountain backdrop to the city skyline will leave you speechless. Worth the trip alone. Views from Kowloon side are better than Hong Kong side. If viewing from the Hong Kong side then try the esplanade in front of the Exhibition Centre. Well worth the effort.

Festival of Lights, HK. Was amazing, I got a ferry from HK Island to watch the show from the Kowloon side. It was defiantly worth the it.. the ferry took around 20 mins and was cheap, it was great to travel with commuters and get to see how the locals move about.
so so. not very impress on laser light show.. i see from tsim sha shui, laser light opposite the sea. i feel its far for the show.not all building have light dancing.crowd.my feeling is average

Awesome skyline. This is the image everyone knows of Hong Kong. You must check it out when here. The light show at night is nothing amazing but still worth checking out just so you can admire the skyline at night.

Don't miss the light Show in HK. Hong Kong is known for having the best light shows in the world at night. Shanghai has buildings lit up at night and Singapore has an awesome light show you can see from Marine Bay Sans Hotel, but Hong Kong has the best overall light show.
My favourite city in the world.. By far my favourite city in the world. There really is no place like it, Victoria Harbour, the trams, the sky bars, the skyline. Unforgettable and a must see city.

Perfect view of the city!. I wasn't sure what to expect but the experience was amazing! we did the sky100 up to the observation deck and even though one side was blocked for a private event (west side) I didn't feel like I missed out on anything! A must visit and very easy to get to. We also enjoyed shopping and dinner after in the Elements shopping center.

Spectacular. This has to be one of the greatest skylines in the world. See it from the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade, or with a drink at the Eye Bar on the 30th floor of the iSquare building on Nathan Road. The light show at 8pm nightly is not really worth making a special effort for though to be honest. The skyline is pretty enough at night as it is.

One of the best. One of the best city skylines, especially at night by the river when illuminated. The photo with my wife and the HK Skyline as the backdrop is one of the few photos we have on our wall at home.

Not such a Highlight. Somewhat underwhelming. Although very beautiful, we had heard such glowing (excuse the pun) reports that we were quite disappointed. I wouldn't make a special effort to wait to see the lazers. The skyline is lit up at all hours after dark & is very nice to see.

Best viewing spots. (1) at the top of the Peak at dusk.
(2) from the Kowloon waterfront day or night , at 8pm to see the Symphony of Lights.
Marvellous !!. Seen from the Victoria Peak , its breath taking with the laser show happening and the lights dancing.

Hong Kong Metroplis. Hong Kong Skyline can be accessed from many vantage points. One of the best views is from the Peak, especially at night. Several restaurants around Hong Kong City and Kowloon City also afford magnificent views. Down on the Esplanade at Tsim Sha Tsui also entertain Hong Kong skyline views.
Breathtaking. Whether you view it from a boat, ferry or land it is breathtakingly beautiful - day or night. I was disappointed in the "laser show" but otherwise the skyline is truly spectacular.

Amazing ligt show. At night this place packs out, you have to take a ferry depending on where your staying but it's fast.
The skyline turns into a light show and well it's defiantly a sight to see!!!
Can't beat it. Run in the morning or late at night lights. Very inspiring. Watched the sound and light show which is ok but touristy but clever, architectualy inspiring

Symphony of Lights - spectacular!. I have seen the Symphony of Lights several times, but every time I find something new to enjoy! Most people watch it from the Avenue of the Stars on the Kowloon side. But I've also seen it from Victoria Peak, which is even more spectacular. It starts at 8pm every evening. It's free, it's beautiful, and it's well worth seeing this amazing light show.

️Quick 2 Night Trip. We went to Hong Kong in the end of March 2015 and the weather was nice and cool. It was a bit chilly at night when we caught the light show but was nice and breezy throughout the day since we were near the water. The light show was only about 20-25 minutes and it was a very nice presentation and nice to see the Skyline, but personally I don't think this is a place where you spend more than an hour or two. Unless you want to shop. High end shopping everywhere and overall a good quick trip, however I don't think we would go back.
Worth the effort. Staying in Kowloon it is easy to walk to the good vantage points to see the skyline, especially the evening light show. One never tires of this city.
Wow. Traveled here way back April 2013, there was a light show when we visited, I think it'll always be there. :)

Best at Night. Enjoy the best view at night, while the city light is alive. They have a great composition of skyline, and the color is beautiful during the night. Enjoy the night mild wind while walking around, or sit in chairs provided along.
Lovely!. Went here on a 4night 5 day tour in celebration of my mom's 80th bday ! Had a lot of pixes in fron t of the HK Skyline ! lovely cosmopolitan city !
Not to be missed.. See the Skyline during the day and then again at nightfall. Two different looks! The atmosphere at night is great.

Fantastic views. One of the greatest skylines in the world. So many skyscrapers and the Light show (made by lasers) is one of the best things to see in Hong Kong at night. Try to be there for the Chinese national holiday as the fireworks display is breathtaking

Incredible!. Simply breathtaking. After having visited many of the world's greatest cities I can really say hong kong can stand its own. The mountains, the water, the light show on the buildings is really exceptional! So many tourists kind of ruin the experience but that is to be expected, a must see when in hong kong, especially around 6-7pm as the sun sets and the city cools down a bit.

Its one of the nicest skyline you will ever see. The crowded-ness of how buildings in Hong Kong are built can be seen at the Hong Kong Skyline. If you wanna see them nice buildings, go to either the Avenue of Stars of the peak tram

Great night view from the peak. It rained before we got up the peak and the view was clear and fantastic. I saw the day view before (hazy) and it was just amazing how the city shined in a clear night.
Stunning by day or by night. Gorgeous views by day and night, with a rather less than awesome nightly laser show, but got to see it all the same!

one of the most iconic skylines in the world. on the kowloon side and something you have to see at night. helpful note here, some days the show narrative + audio is in mandarin and then alternates into english.

Don't think a better view on planet earth. Don't think there is a better view on
Planet earth,it's breathtaking beautiful !
Hills nd mountains around !
The harbour,the ships,the mesmerizing water,the towering skyscrapers,the lighting at dusk!
Can look on nd on !

Simply Stunning!. The Hong Kong Skyline can be seen from many different high rise restaurants and bars across Hong Kong and is simply stunning. The best views are from Kowloon, looking south over Victoria Harbour or Kowloon Bay. Many of the best restaurants we visited were in Kowloon, high up with amazing views. Hutong, The Bar at the Peninsular, Felix at the Peninsular and the bar at the Intercontinental spring to mind.

Fabulous. A great sight by day or by night from the top of Victoria Peak or from Kowloon side. There is a sound and light each evening that plays over the major buildings but the best way to appreciate it all is from the deck of a Star ferry

Mesmerizing. We came from Macau and were leaving for a two day cruise without spending much time in Hong Kong. Our first view of the skyline came from aboard our ship just as we were about to sail out. And it took our breath away, the buildings lit up with neon against the dark background of Hong Kong night is a view I will never forget.We enjoyed this skyline again from Avenue of stars and from the Victoria peak during day time. Every time the density and the packed nature of sky scrapers just amazed me.

Fantastic Victoria Harbour. There are two sides of victoria harbour views:1. Take the peak tram to the Peak and look down to the Kowloon side2. Tsim Sha Tsui Star of Avenue, looking to the Hong Kong Island sideBoth view is fantastic, go to both place if you have time!

go to sky 100 for a all round view. you go 100 floors in under 60 seconds in the 4 lifts which you can use you can walk around the 4 sides so you can see all over the city and take photos you can get drinks and have afternoon tea if you like and when you come back down you can do more shopping as there are lot and lots of shops
Wow. The nightly light show is stunning. Neon lights to the max, with much of the shore front being on reclaimed land. At night, HK is one of the most beautiful cities in the world.
Unbelieveable!!. Best way to see it is the $4.00 Star ferry to Kowloon in the evening when the lights and illuminations make this a wonder of the modern world.
Peak Tram. Just brilliant, helpful staff, easy access and well organized. All staff very informative. Food and dining venues varied and welcoming... friendly and helpful staff.
Beautiful. We took an evening cruise on the Aqua Luna, which was fantastic. The concierge desk recommended it and made our reservations. The pier is only 3 min taxi ride away.

great at night. you can enjoy a great light show and lasers all over
it is free from land
tour operaters do offer packages but not cheap

Hong Kong skyline. Hong Kong skyline is best viewed from Kowloon's Avenue of the Stars.Night time is the best where you can see colourful lights emitted from the commercial buildings.It's so amazing and it really made you feel like in paradise which your eyes is being showered with the magnificient array of light.Day time view is also splendid but you need to view HK skyline from Kowloon where you can get the best of it.HK skyline never fail to amaze me and i will surely come back again but not during summer which is very hot in HK.
Modern marvel. It's a must see for any world traveler. Great view from Kowloon and the music goes perfect with the lights. The topper is the awesome Bruce lee statue.

It sparkles like diamond!. No matter you take a tram to the Peak, take a ferry floating in the Victoria Harbour or just walking along the coastal area of Tsim Sha Tsui to see the skyline of Hong Kong, I do think it is the best in the world. I find it really looks like the diamond. It sparkles so brilliant. Of course, to see in a sunny day is a MUST when you visit Hong Kong. An unforgetable experience.

Very lovely. I thought that this was a very beautiful and enjoyable part of my trip to Hong Kong. Not only does it embody the big city feel of HK, it is also a very stunning place to visit. It was my first time going to the HK skyline, so it was quite a shock for me to see all those skyscrapers light up. The lightnings are beautiful, and the atmosphere is very romantic as well. Plus there's the cool Avenue of Stars, do try to see this place both during the day and at night, because it looks and feels very different.

Beautiful Skyline. Whether you are looking from the Hong Kong side or the Kowloon side, the Skyline is beautiful, both in day time and at night. Regret that we did not take the "Junk" harbor cruise, else it would have been quite an experience. Not enough time to do everything.

Nice. Nice, very nice, interesting even though this is not an "old" monument.Quite a few stairs to climb, but worth itThe cable car is very picturesque, well worth the tripTip- get the cable car tickets in advance, if it's crowded the wait is long to get on the cable car.Another tip - the glass bottom cable car is not worth the extra money
Enjoy skyline light shows. Hong Kong being the biggest international city enjoys the most impressive skylines at night. I am truly delighted with the amazing experience especially at night.
Looks like a Postcard!. Absolutely need to see this! Its picture perfect...It looks like they used this exact picture for POSTCARDS of Hong kong.
The best. Nothing beats the skyline of Hong Kong, it is always changing, and on clear days the view of all the building can take your breath away.
Nice. It's just as expected. , soo beautiful. I really liked the lights show at 8 p (every night) which I saw from Kowloon's pier.

Stunning views!. Seeing the Hong Kong Skyline is an amazing experience! Especially at night. The light show is also on in the evening which is a bonus to see. The best view of the skyline is from a bar/restaurant called AQUA. I would recommend booking a table, although quite pricey. The food is exceptional and the view is just breathtaking. A night time seating is truly special. Another great angle is along the water of TST near the avenue of stars attraction. From the island side I would recommend the stunning views from Victoria Peak and Sheung Wan ferry port, the view from along the waterfront there is also nice but not as breathtaking as the above! Note - GO ON A CLEAR DAY! The smog/fog is restricting!

Fantastic view, and different in certain months,. I have seen up to the Peak to look at the skyline,,I have found it beautifully clear in October and less clear in May,, so it depends on the month to get a clear view,,but so well worth it,,and more so at night,,
post card views of Hong Kong island. brilliant, just like the post cards, Ships passing by, Junks under sail,New buildings under construction. Always busy and something to see.

Fantastic view. One of the most iconic skylines in the world. Maybe the best as HK is build on the slopes of the hills and most skylines are build on flat surfaces. One of the reasons why people come to HK is the jaw-dropping skyline

Light show. This is a wide skyline and quite a view. At night there is a light show to music worth watching too. The waterfront area is a nice area to walk and there are plenty of restaurants and museums to visit.

Worth the effort. At 8 o clock every evening there isa very good sound and light show on Hong Kong Island - best seen from the Star Ferry area on the Kowloon side. The only problem at times is the weather which can spoil things
great. A well organized place in far east.. but you will find multi-culture and citizen of various countries are leaving. I wish if this if China give free to Hong Kong.

Wow . Up there with the best and have see New York skyline, Rio etc and its truely awesomeWe had a harbour view room at intercontinental hotel so woke up and fell asleep to this truely wonderful harbour A must see
Amazing View At The Victoria Harbour. This is a must see if you visit Hong Kong. The night view was truly beautiful. The light show was not impressive though.

Jaw dropping view. The first time I saw this view was upon entering the old Regent hotel which is now the Intercontinental, not the Stanford Court. The view from the floor to ceiling windows was spectacular.
Each time I visit Hong Kong I go to see the view again as well as the 20:15 light show and each time me it is amazing.
Victoria Harbour view. The view from Tsim Sha Tsui area overlooking the skyline of skyscrapers at Hong Kong island is breathtaking, especially during the "Symphony of Lights" show!
Must see.... Make sure you see the skyline from BOTH sides of the water. Stunning views especially at night. We wouldn't bother with the light show again, but the views were fantastic.
asia trip. laser show is stunning. Skyscrapers magnificent as well as the mountains with Victoria Peak in the backdrop
Amazing Skyline. Best enjoyed in the evening and during the Lighting show held at 8 pm daily. Must see for all visiting the city of HK

A must at night. One of the better free entries!
It is definitely worth taking the ferry to the northern side.
I went another night to the southern recommended look-out, but it was not nearly as impressive.
There is a light show every evening at 8:00 that lasts 20 minutes, but it is impressive to see the skyline even without the light show

Amazing 'Symphony of Sound and Light'. Watched from Tsim Sha Tsui, and it happens at 8pm each night. Not every building joins in the fun, but the ones that do make it 15 minutes well spent. I'd highly recommend seeing this once on any trip to Hong Kong.
A must see. What ever you do when you visit Hong Kong this is a must at night time. The view we amaze you and you will not be disappointed you made the effort to go.
It Completes Hong Kong. It is one of the tourist attractions. To see how strong is Hong kong's economy, you got to have a look at its skyline. Looks beautiful day or night.
Great visit. When you go to HK you have to take a boat and you have to see the skyline. And you will enjoy both a great view and then a great walk in the neighborhood.

Mesmerizing . The most stunning skyline in Asia. It beats Shanghai and Singapore. And is only second to New York globally. Best view from the Kowloon side. The peak gives you a panoramic view as well.

Photo-worthy skyline!. A totally must do activity if u're in hong kong.There are basically 2 ways to enjoy the view, and it wont cost u a bomb.1. go up to the peak2. take a ferry from central pier to tsim tsa tsui.from the peak u can look at the whole skyline surrounding the victoria harbour. there is a place at the peak with free viewing deck and a photo of the skyline with buildings labels. however i was unfortunate as the day i went up the place is covered with thick fog/mist due to the rainy days.The view from the ferry crossing the harbour itself definitely makes up for my loss on top of the peak. Highly recommended.

Just too good. There're not many cities in the world that has a skyline like this. The best to view would be to go up to the Peak. Best time to go would be evening, just before sunset and stay after it turns dark. You'll see both the day and the night view. The scene of the harbour and all the lights shining from the skyscrappers are just fantastic. If the weather it's not good they day you go - too foggy or raining - worth to go again when the sky is clear. Just something not to be missed if you ever visit Hong Kong.

The best of the world skyline.. Yes, indeed, it is the best of the world. Given land price is so high in Hong Kong, skyscrappers kept renewing (one can not see much pre WW2 old housing) the HK landscape. Given the super high density of population, & also household lightings at night, around the Victoria Peak (Hong Kong Island basically is a big piece of rock) creates a spectacular picture. Best views are from either 1) the Peak & 2) Star Ferry crossing the Victoria Harbour. See both day and night times. It's breathtaking and nowhere else can beat it.
Unbelievable . This city extends forever; so does its skyline! It's beautiful and it's pretty cheap to get across the harbor to HK island, about .10 American.
Best viewed at night. Try the Sheraton Sky bar at night have a few drinks or light snackTake your camera/phoneEasy to get to on the harbour facing Hong Kong Island
Amazing. It's worth going to Hong Kong just to see this view!!!. One of the world's most amazing skylines. Not to be missed. Should be on everyone's "to see" list!!!

The best in the world. I have been to Manhattan, Paris, London, Tokyo etc. no skyline is as dramatic as the HK one where you have the high rise buildings laid out against the peak on the back and reflection on the water in front. The best and cheapest way is to ride in the Star Ferry with a cold beer in hand. Cost you only HK$3:)

Great views. It really is something quite amazing! You can get skylines similar but HKs has a light show every evening and a certain charm, look out for the red sailed junk that goes up and down Victoria harbour, and for great views go to the bar at the ritz Carlton in ICC or grab a public table by one of the bars on the roof of the ICC

Hong kong Lights. What a skyline ive been to a lot of places in the world and i still class this as the best skyline ive seen,its such an impressive veiw especially early nightime when youre standing on the tip of the kowloon penninsular whatching the lightshow (which is the biggest lightshow in the world) which if you are in any way technically minded it is just WOW how do they do that its just a brilliant show. ive been there when it was nearly christmas once and when it comes to decorations they do it big here ,youll have a 40 storey building with a santa claus being 250 foot high and loads of things like that and not just on the odd building its on most of the buildings. in the daytime its still a very impressive skyline but its at night it really shines at its best.. whenever i go back to hong kong (which has been lots and will be soon again) i always love the veiws across the harbour and go out in the evenings to have a look iys just such a good veiw.

Must see. This is one of the major "must see" things in the whole world ... and it's free! Take the MTR and Star Ferry from wherever you're staying and then walk along the streets on both the island and Kowloon sides.

Electrifying!. The Hong Kong skyline was like nothing I've ever seen. The laser and light shows in the evening were absolutely electrifying! The Hong Kong skyline ranks as one of the top I've ever seen along with Dubai, Abu Dhabi and Shanghai.

Relaxed place for the week end. I spend a week end in Hong Kong with friends at the end of a business trip. In fact HK has this busy part of town where you do business intensively. But there are places where people can gather and drink a beer (red bar). And rapidly you can be outside the town. There are then some very pleasant locations with nice beaches. It was great

Too good a skyline. This one is one of the best skylines that you can observe. It is best seen from a boat ride which takes you to Kawloon to Hong Kong and backBe there at 7: 00 pm in the boat roaming around and you will see a a fabulous Light show on both sides of street.The skyline is best utilised for projecting glamorous lights adding to unmatched skyline .....MUST seeRahul Ligade101027592

The "light concert" is a bit eighties but apart from that it's nice. A spot where couples meet at night or families with kids to watch the light show which isn't that impressive as we expected it after what we heard from locals before. It's that you can miss it.

Trip the light fantastic and for free.. The Hong Kong Harbor Light show is very popular and worth taking a look at and you can do it for free.Don't pay outrageous prices for boat and dinner tours where you have to fight crowds for space at the rail of a boat.Walk to the Star Ferry Terminal and look for the Clock Tower. Just beside the tower is a set of steps to a large platform over a pier where you can sit/stand for nothing and enjoy both the music and the sights of the 13 minute long show.
Awesome. Amazing skyline like no other. You must see this on your trip to HK well worth it. I can see why it is listed as a number one tour to do.

Beautiful lights. The way to really appreciate the Hong Kong skyline is to watch it from the Kowloon side at night. It is really a great sight as one sees the various skyscrapers fighting to see who is the higher.Some locals say the Bank of China building with its two so called horns is symbolic of the Mainland China gradual gouging of the island as the 50 years of controlled self rule is expiring.
Harbour is specular. Loved the harbour. The high rise houses are not nice but it gives you an insight of how people live in HK
Skylights. The light show is well worth hanging around for. Go early and wait around with a coffee to make sure you get a good place to see the lights.

It has to be captured when the sky is dark... Hong Kong's skyline is well known worldwide. When you come to view it during the day, it is usually not very clear. Even though it is clear, it is just like any other scene. Nothing interesting.However, when the sky gets dark, this is the best time to view.. as long as possible. That is when the lights are lighted up... beautiful

Asian Light Show. I loved the vibrant city lights and their reflections on the water. Travel by shuttle bus to the Kowloon Harbor for Spectacular views from the Avenue of the Stars. You could also see the cruise port from our hotel too.
An ever changing view. Just magnificent x go and experience the amazing site that is the hong kong skyline. I think the laser show starts at 8pm most nights.

Each building vying for aerial space. Hong Kong is as metropolitan as it gets. The land gets dearer and dearer as the building gets taller. The skyline as seen from victoria harbour at night with the lights tells you how much this city loves buildings. There is construction work going on day in and day out with one building trying to outdo another. No wonder real estate is prime here. Another good place to watch the skyline is the Victoria peak. During a clear day, you can see the buildings crisp and clear. Rain or fog,you won't even be able to see few meters ahead of you. When the lights are on at night, it lends a festive look to the whole city. You will enjoy the skyline only if you are thorough city-bred.
Promenande. Not as beautiful as Miami or Singapore. It's overrated the Hong Kong skyline and its getting uglier by the day and too much smog. Not worth its rating....
Dazzling skyline!. Must see skyline it's so beautiful, people are running at all hours and the lights on the building are dazzling!!!

Stunning skyline. The best vantage point to see Hong Kong Island skyline is from the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade. We saw the skyline both in the day time and at night. At night they do a festival of lights where some of the most famous buildings on Hong Kong Island are all lit up with a light show. A really good experience if the weather is good and sky is clear.

Disappointed. Waited for laser light show, but it was underwhelming, maybe as many people had talked it up. Skyline always colourful in HK, not sure the 8 pm show is worth the crowds, wait etc. Sydney's vivid much more entertaining.

wowed in 81 till now.. Our first time to HK was in 1981 we have seen the city skyline blossom the ferry ride is the best way to see the ground floor of the buildings but there is so many vantage points to see from Victoria peak 100 lookout there is the HSBC free lookout on the 40th floor on causeway road. They have since knocked out the old star ferry terminal building which had its own character about with the rickshaws and the older buildings with HK its there one day gone the next real sad to see it go as quick as it did.Cheap sights get on the tram and ride from end to end countless vantage points you just have to find them.
skyline. I took photos from the Star Ferry. We were disappointed in the light show that was supposed to coordinate lights from the entire skyline on Hong Kong Island as seen from across the harbor.

Slightly over-rated. Upmteem number of pics that you may have seen of HK skyline would make you think that its very breadth-taking. Actually its v standard. The photos that you see are really the best. So dotn have too much expectations. Its good, but a bit over-rated.

Wonderful city skyline.. Best view is from the ferry. When waiting for the ferry as a tourist try to weave yourself towards the front. As soon as they begin to load the locals will be on the ferry before you have a chance to get on. BE READY- ON THE MARK , GET SET ,GO!

My Favourite View in the World (So Far). I find it astonishingly pretty. I reckon you will too.TIP: I still think the light show is tremendously overrated. It's little more than them turning a few lights on/off and playing horrible, cheesy, Gameboy music. In fact, the light show only spoils the experience. If a show is coming on, I'd recommend grabbing a bite to eat and the crowds will be gone when you get back.
Beautiful views of Hong Kong. We went on top of the skyline and the views were excellent. It could have been even better if was not fogy but we still were able to enjoy the views. Its a must visit

The imposing Hong Kong Skyline. I had the good fortune of viewing the HK skyline from 3 different angles. These were:1. From my Hotel room over looking the Harbour at Kowloon.2. From the Victoria Peak3. From the sea as part of the Cruise.All three sum it up as - Impressive and awesome - a clear reminder of the capability of mankind despite the limitations of being islands.Worthy of a visit, irrespective of your age, gender or nationality.

Great view particularly at night. Hong Kong is one of those places that should be on your bucket list. The harbour and the views are amazing and the light shows on the buildings at night are something that you just have to see. Worth the time.
simply awesome. must see, esp at night! The sound and light show is pretty boring, but such a fabulous sight. If living in central, take the cool star ferry across! awesome..

8.00pm on Kowloon Side. Fantastic light show on/from the buildings on HK Island. If staying on HK Island, take Star Ferry across to Tsim Sha Tsui and watch the light show from the Avenue of the Stars. The whole experience will cost around 50p!

Take it at Night. Hong Kongs Skyline is famous, with the boats, the peak behind, the Christmas illumination (which got less impressive in past years), take a look, take a tripod and your camera.Let the wind blow in your hair, smell the sea water and just enjoy.
The Hong Kong Skyline. Hong Kong harbour is very pretty. The nightly light show should not be missed from either side of the harbour. The walkway on Kawloon is a must.
Spectacular night lights in the harbor. It's always great to see the lights in the harbor when night falls, but only if there's no smog. The light show is nothing to recommend, with the canned music.
ORIORDANT. Good views from here if the weather is favourable, however it takes time to go and return from there. It is worth the effort
Symphony of Lights-Hongkong Skyline. The best way to view the Hongkong Skyline is to take a Star Ferry and go to Kowloon to watch the Hongkong skyline in the night along with Symphony of Lights.
love HK. Loved everything about HK, the city, the parks and gardens, the nightlife & the shopping, would love to return one day.

Skyline. Panorama of lights in the night was awesome. Gives a picture of a highly developed city to the whole world aspiring to compete in the international scene in world trade, commerce, finance, etc.
Best skyline. It was a great time visiting Hong Kong skyline at night. The atmosphere was amazing and fresh. I am sure this is the best skyline in Asia.
Skyline.. The skyline in Hong Kong is spectacular whether you see it by day or by night although night time is better. Just can't get enough of looking at it.

Skyline from above. Hike or run one of the trails at night and take a camera with you. The skyline is just breathtaking and I prefer different perspectives rather than one single point. Check the weather forecast.

Impressive and diverse with many styles and colors. Styles and angles of all sorts, colorful, with a crazy diversity everywhere you turn.
The old blends with the new in sometimes crazy and funny ways.
Chaotic and bold at the same time inviting for photography whether professional or amateur.
SEVEN DAYS WENT TO QUICK. The time we spent in Hong Kong was great but with the different things we did the time went very quickly.
Wooloomooloo bar @ The One to watch nightly light show. Gorgeous and good drinks, fairly expensive. The light show is out of this world. Out of doors if you are early on 20 or 30th floor. I forget.

Stunning -and free!. Beautiful by day there is a laser and light show at night. Best viewed from the Kowloon ferry terminal but the area can get a bit crowded. From the Hong Kong Island side you can view the animated light show on the Sky100 building all evening.
Great morning walk. Beautiful walk in Tsim Tsa Tsui during early morning hours - however humidity is really tough - pretty empty roads make it even more pleasant

Impressive view of the Hong Kong Skyline. Need to see this from the Kowloon side. TST East is the nearedt MRT. You can go in the evening and watch the light show at 8pm (Symphony of Light)
Just as impressive in the day as well as you can see just how long the skyscrapers go on for.

Just fantastic from either side of the water. Any time of day or night, either side of the harbour, the skyline can just be stared at and photographed for as long as you're happy to keep looking at it

Amazing. Very spectacular, especially at night, compares with the Manhattan skyline.
We did a harbour cruise at sunset and a trip to Victoria's Peak - stunning views!
Where will they build next!. The Hong Kong Skyline just gets higher, well worth a visit to Victoria Peak to look down on it or sit on the Avenue of the Stars and crane your neck!
Disappointing. Hong Kong advertises an 8pn light and laser show - very dull - hard to see and generally the poorest one of its type
Incredible views. Well lit up and skyline conquering the sky. You can't miss Hong Kong Skyline even if you visit the city for few hours. Amazing views indeed.
Awesome. There is simply no more spectacular skyline at night a must see from the Kowloon side,or take the Ferry for a view from the sea.

Amazing Skyline with Music Scenario. Was the first time we went there. Heard many time about it, but always back to Mainland the same day. It's every night at 8pm by the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade (the best spot) you can overlook Hong Kong Island with their skyscrapers lighted and proud of their high and lights. Music could be a little bit louder. Was a great experience and strongly recommend.
A must seen place. Come to Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade in the night,enjoy the whole place and at 8.00 PM watch the laser show for about 13 minutes.

Don't miss the light show. What a great idea, to make an entire city scape the setting for a sound and light show. Fun, and a spectacular setting. You also get a great view from the Korean BBQ restaurant in the iSquare building (cheap and delicious). Just one complaint, why isn't the huge IFC building lit? There should be a campaign...
The peak. Excellent view of hong kong whilst dining, it really is the city of life and lights, organized tours in busy periods are the best way to enjoy this tour attraction.

Spectacular views. A short walk from the Kimberley Hotel brought us to the waterfront and skyline view. It was an amazing view. It was a bit crowded but that is expected. You cannot go to HK and not take in the view, you will regret it.

Spectacular!. The views were awesome, the history of the island and it's famous residents was interesting and Stanley Market offer some of the best local fare. The tour also allowed us to see more of the city.
Best city skyline, day or night. View of HK from Kowloon Avenue of the Stars is awesome, as well as from Victoria peak and Lion Rock trail.

Gorgeous! Breathtaking even with the Smog!. There was quite a lot of smog from the factories in China but it was still breathtaking to take in the sights on both sides of the harbourfront!Worth a walk along both promenades!

Skyscraper Sexy. the Hong Kong Skyline from land, sea, air or The Peak is beautiful in that glass and metal way. i love skyscrapers so i always enjoy seeing the skyline here and never get tired of it. The Star Ferry is a great way to enjoy it day and night. Same goes for Victoria Peak. if you have the chance to experience the skyline from a balcony on the 69th floor of a condo you will get butterflies. obviously if you are on the Kowloon side or the HK Island side you kind of get one view so take the opportunity to see it from the ferry and from on high from The Peak. the laser, light and music show at night i would say forget it, nothing really pops out about it.

The skyline you never see in Hong Kong. The post cards are full of fantastic photos of the view, shot on the one day clear enough a year to see it.The reality is, in Hong Kong itself, you almost never actually see this view. Or any view at all, apart from the horrendously ugly tall buildings that enclose you on all four sides.There is almost no waterfront area where you could sit in say a nice restaurant or cafe and enjoy the view. There is nothing like a walking or running track (like the Thames path) along all the city coast that could have been so nice. Being in Hong Kong makes me appreciate how Europe manages to mix life and living in with work and working. Go down to the waterfront in Kowloon and what do you get? A horrible patch of concrete, a StarBucks and a McDonalds. And a horrible old shopping centre that doesn't even have any windows looking out to "the view".Hong Kong is a city of barriers. Every where you try and cross the street, you can't. Concrete barriers, metal barriers, horrendous construction. You can never just go from A to B, even when it's across the street.In the winter months the air pollution is so bad you just want to stay in you tiny room.Don't bother going. Just look at the post cards.

Always Breathtaking. No matter how many times I travel to Hong Kong I always return with photos of the skyline - taken from a high up hotel room or a ship or atop Hong Kong Park or wherever I find myself looking at the skyline. It's magnificent....especially but not only at night.

WOW WOW WOW. This were just about the only words coming out of my mouth. :-)The view from the peak is spectacular....You can see tons of cement buildings from every angle....but the quietness and the surroundings green make this somewhere you really want to spend time in. One hardly hears the hustle and bustle way down below...Didn't purchase any tickets to the top deck as the view around the entrance to the Peak is just as fine...Also walked the path around the peak to take in all possible angles of this incredible view. Its well worth it...no matter the heat and humidity.
Calms down the senses. Stunning views from Kowloon side. One could just stare at the Skyline all night and it would still continue to amaze.

Is for sure worth a visit.. HongKong is a great place and there is a few places you must go when you are here. This is one of them. Go there and enjoy the fantastic light show at 8PM in the evening. Spectacular show with lights and stroboscopes on the high buildings on the opposite side. Why not walk the "walk of stars" which is just beside this spot. For sure a recommended place to go and especially in the evening.
amazing views. a must do either by train or with the stairs and escalator if you have more time. the view all around gives you a good idea how HK was build.

Simply Amazing.... This is something you will never been tired, is something you enjoy for all your life without boring. I personally love it and is like breathing for me, nothing can give you the same feeling, you can watch it from every position from every location, is always beautiful, don't miss it!

HK views. HK is a dynamic city with hustle and bussle shops etc but the skyline is spectacular, we took first time travellers there and all we got was WOW. All the time. The light show at 8pm each night is good but not specky. On a lot of occasions the smog was bad but you do get some good clear days.

One of the best city skyline in the world. No matter you are on the Peak or Stars Avenue in TST or a star ferry across the Victoria Harbour, the skyline would never disappoint. Tip: star ferry is definitely my favorite!
the Spot you have to visit in Hong Kong. hard to find a place with so many lights, water front, and energy in the world. A unique combinations of everything, must see spot in Hong Kong

Why I return as often as possible. Hong Kong skyline viewed from a Star Ferry puttering across Victoria Harbour is just sensational. Every visit to Hong Kong requires at least 2 ferry trips to soak in the views, especially from Kowloon side looking towards Hong Kong Island. With a multitude of very tall buildings against a back drop of The Peak, I never tire of the view and capture each trip on camera. It is simply an awesome scene for me.

One of the worlds great wonders. You should visit Hong Kong. I could give so many reasons but mostly because it is a crazy place that should not work but does. One of the particularly pleasures is to be on Kowloon side and look across the water to Hong Kong Island and see the sky line the lights which change and glow. I could stand for hours and watch. It really is wonder the wonders of the modern world

View will blow you away!. Absolutely amazing sight day or night, a view you never tire of! Stayed in Kowloon and each evening you can see the laser light show from the illuminated sky scrapers of Hong Kong Island.It gets very busy on the promenade, tourists jostling to take selfie photos but the atmosphere is a happy excited one. Best place to see is the Avenue of The Stars which is part the way along the promenade. There are two shows - one at around 8pm and I think the other is at 9pm although we didn't see the later one when we were on the star ferry.It's great to see the illuminated cruise liners come into the harbour with the skyscraper back drop, it's worth going just for the view which to me is jaw dropping on every occasion I have been.
Nights. Much more entertaining walking around of a night, city lights up and plenty of people enjoying them selves

Cruising the Far East. Mind boggling history and culture. So much to experience and learn. The native foods were wonderful and the eating experience was terrific. A "must do" for those who want to explore differences in people's and cultures. You won't be disappointed!
Breathtaking!. One of my favourite places in HK and the world to just stand and watch from! It's absolutely amazing to just take it all in from TST waterfront - I can't recommend it enough.
nice walking path on the Kowloon waterside. Have a cup of coffee our something else to drink at the patio looking at the skyline, the water and the boats.

Vertical City. Hong Kong skyline can be viewed either from the Hong Kong island side or from the Kowloon on the opposite side. On the HK Island side the most popular point to view the skyline is the Victoria harbor and on the kowloon side its the Avenue of Stars also known as TST Promenade. its just a matter of choice from where you want to view it.I personally prefer viewing from Kowloon side from Avenue of Stars since opposite to it the HK skyline is much better on the island side. How to Reach- Victoria harbour is walking distance from Central MTR Station and Hong Kong MTR station. TST Promenade is walking from Tshim sha Tsui (TST) MTR station. You may also choose to take a ferry and in that case the ferry drops you right near clock tower of the TST promenade on kowloon side. OR it drops you to central ferry pier which is walking from victoria harbour should you choose to view from HK sideThe light and sound show starts at 8:10 PM and it is said that it is tallest Light and sound show in the world. All the major skyscrapers on either side participate in this spectacle which goes on for about 50 mins. The total time to spent there would be about 2 hours. The place starts to get crowded as the time for light shown draws nearer, so its better to reach by about 6 to 6:30 PM get a good viewing point and enjoy the view as sun sets down and the lights on the skyscrapers come up gradually. It is one of the most picturesque points of HK and one of the most photographed one in HK.If you choose to view it from TST Promenade then you have a clock tower/ferry pier at one end of promenade and Avenue of Stars on other end. Near the clock tower you have eateries, washrooms and other point of convenience. Even on the Victoria Harbour on HK side there are all the public facilities and eateries available.
Lovely Views. Hongkong skyline is probably almost as good as the Manhattan skyline. I think i liked this one better because of all the light shows and the way it has been conceptualized.
Beautiful Skyline of the World. Most hotels at Harbor front offer a chance to view the skyline of the city. Try Sky Terrac428 at the Peak, awesome experience of the city states skyline

Astounding from anywhere!. Hong Kong is hard pressed for land and so it keeps rising. And the view of this up and about skyline is astounding from anywhere. We saw it from top of Victoria's peak, from the harbour and even from Sky100. Nothing beats this view - be it day or night. IMO night views are way better...
A must see when you visit Hong Kong. Hong Kong's skyline is always very vibrant and full of energy. I have been there a few times and it never fails to let me down. I feel so energetic every time.

Hong Kong Skyline. A beautiful skyline in both the day and in particular the night time as the lights of the various towers, homes and buildings really come to life against the back / fore front of the harbor.

Love the lights. We stayed at the hotel Icon on the Kowloon side. The view was great, then again we were in the lounge before we came to our room to see the lights.Of all the larger cities we have been to, this skyline was grand, it was one of the sights we wanted to see, and it was not a disappointment. Get in the right mood, sit and enjoy the skyline that makes up Hong Kong.We were there there for four night , the show was not as great as the first night, but it still brought a smile every night.
Breath taking skyline. The Hong Kong skyline is world famous for good reason. It's many skyscrapers with a hilly backdrop make it unique and beautiful.

Unbelievable. Definitely up there in the top skylines I've seen. Until I visited HK, New York was the best view - I'm now undecided as to which I like the most - I love them both. Maybe I'll have to keep visiting both places until I make a decision!! :)
The best i have seen so far. The daily light show is worth it. The music Sounds a little outdated though.Nice experience....lots of effort from hong kong right there
It's free and a spectacular light show. Lights lasers and sounds . This is the first thing you should do if staying in Hong Kong . Viewed from either Kowloon or Hong Kong the scenery is spectacular.
Absolutely stunning to see at night. The Hong Kong skyline is a.must to see, especially at night and also from a boat in the harbour. It never ceased to amaze!
Smashing. Come and see the free lightshow at 8pm from the Avenue of the Stars, and watch this magnificent skyline and the harbour from the Peak!
You've seen the pictures. It's just like that, only better. Gorgeous, and all sorts of lights in the early evening in addition to the nightly light show.

Wonderful. Impressing, fantastic, incredible, unbelievable.
If you like skyscrapers, here you got it!!!!
Don't miss it!

One of my favourites across the globe. The Hong Kong skyline is a sight to behold, especially when it's holiday season. Both Hong kong-side and Kowloon side's buildings are lit to show a spectacular show. Sometimes, there are giant ducks swimming across the harbour! That was a great touch a few years back.I always look forward to spending my Christmas in Hong Kong, and one of the reasons I look forward to it is seeing what the skyline has in store for me this time.

Very impressive!. Hong Kong is just beautiful! Take the Star Ferry over to Kowloon so you get the view of the island. Shun the extortionately priced bars on high floors and just take a walk along the concourse. Just as good and won't blow your entire budget on a tiny glass of wine!

Brilliant Skyline!. I've seen multiple skylines across some of the major cities across the world & this one stands in one of the top 5, most certainly! Grab a good DSLR before you see this for real, you'd get some awesome & unforgetful shots!
Beautiful. The best skyline, it has many views. Make sure you go 8 to the Av. of the Stars to see the Symphony of the Lights.
Can't miss this. HK is a beutiful city and the skyline is spectacular. I would suggest viewing from the walk of stars on kownloon side.
Great View from The Peak. Loved it all. Go at night! Other photographers were quite polite, people made sure they did not block my shots.

Super at Night. HK is a busy place and downtown by day is like any big city. But by night it's very scenic and special. Take the Star Ferry for a better view from the water. Kowloon, right across the river from HK is part of the light show. Don't miss it.
SIMPLY THE BEST. Probably the best skyline in the world and the nightly light show is amazing. something TO BE LOOKED AT AND IN TURN GO TO THE TOP.

Amazing. This is always breathtaking ...from dusk til dawn. Ever changing. great place to visit just as the sun is setting for the colours and the skyline lighting up.The city is amazing and certainly one of my favourites, even though I am a little biased. It's somewhere you don't tire of. Return visits essential and to see Hk in different seasons too.

Best Skyline Around. If it's your first visit to Hong Kong, then this is a must as it's what all the travel photos of HK is about. An impressive skyline, busy trade activity, impressive museum etc. The light show in the evening is especially cool and best of all it costs nothing but your time. A lot happening in this area and if nothing else you can do as much people watching as you like.

Just simply breathtaking!. Enjoy this view every time we are in Hong Kong. So many tall buildings with neon lights plus waterfront. We stayed in a room overlooking Victoria harbor.We also walk al.ng harbourfront near harbor city area...

Beautiful evening by the sea. Take one evening out to visit the HK skyline and the Avenue of Stars near Tsim Sha Tsui. The best way to see the skyline is probably aboard the Star Ferry tour, but we chose to take the ferry from Central to Kowloon and then walk along the avenue. It was cloudy and misty but as the sun descended and the lights came on, the glamour of the city was on full view. The classic old Chinese sail boat with red sails is a real beauty and you must take a ride aboard it. We walked along the entire stretch and enjoyed the various fun-time activities that people do by the side of the avenue. While all the names of the stars on the avenue were not familiar to us, we recognized a few international stars like Chow Yun Fat, Jackie Chan and Raymond Chow. The bronze statue of Bruce Lee in his famous "Enter the Dragon" fight-pose was a remarkable sight. He must have walked the streets when Hong Kong was a fishing port and the glittering skyline in the background seemed a great and fitting tribute to his contribution in getting the West to embrace it as one of Asia's shining cities.

Hong Kong - Travel Photography. On arrival in Hong Kong I was first troubled by the humidity and heat, and then the sight of so many people walking around wearing face masks. It seamed to me at first it was a mass protest at some one being anti social with bad flatulence. I meandered my way through the maze and confusion of airport immigration and baggage collection. Later on my first day I hit Soho camera free eating street food and what a jolly nice experience it was too. I woke up the next day not knowing what time zone I was in. I was tired but felt like a child at Christmas with an overwhelming urge to bugger off outdoors and explore was was going on. Mrs W made it clear she was staying in bed so I grabbed the 5D Mark3 and took the 70-300 f/4-5.6 L IS USM out to play. I headed out into Victoria Park which is just off the big shopping district that is Causeway Bay. Victoria Park, named after none other than Victoria Regina is a very busy but peaceful oasis of calm found within a blanket of skyscrapers just off where I was staying on Hong Kong Island. I was taken aback by very old people playing basket ball with teams of youths at 0700am where the temperature was already hitting 30 degrees. As I strolled around I saw mainly elderly people also practicing Tia Chi, meditating as well as having sword fights with invisible people. Very nice I thought to myself, and could not imagine the typical 60 year old Londoner doing the same. I played around with the video function on my camera and managed to get some good footage too.A nightly spectacle in Hong Kong is the Symphony of Lights show and it is a fantastic event that is a must see attraction.A ride up Victoria Peak on a 170 odd year old tram system is I must if you visit Hong Kong. The queuing system for this contraption was an experience to note too. It felt as though half the island decided to do the same about 15 minutes before me. I was wearing my Google Glass, and at first thought everyone was staring at me because I am irresistibly good looking; though the intrigue proved to be 'because' it was the Google Glass. I went to the top of Victoria Peak and to look out over the stunning skyline of Hong Kong. The views were stunning. I headed back into town and went into a camera shop and saw for sale a Canon 300mm 2/1f IS USM L and quickly did the maths with UK prices. It was half price and I was salivating..... The shop I went to quoted HK$30,800 for the lens. I calculated this was £2500 so this needed careful consideration. Too see my pictures click the link to my blog

Nice view but the sound and light show sucks. The view of the skyline of Hong Long is nice but the evening sound and light show is highly overrated again one of those things which you would not mind missing. The Avenue of the Stars is worth it only if you are a fan of Asian cinema. Better to spend time elsewhere.
Beautiful. Lovely view from the Kowloon side and the light show is worth seeing. A lovely city to look at, especially at night.Great vantage points available.
CEO. Great panoramic view Worth getting on hop on hop off to make life easy as all people can't speak English hence this is easy way out on short trips

The number one attraction of Hong Kong. The views of the skyline are best seen from the Kowloon side. Overall I preferred the view of Hong Kong's skyline to Manhattan's. You can see more from a single vantage point than you can in New York.

Gorgeous at night. The view at night is really good and the Symphony of Lights makes it a worthwhile visit. Symphony of Lights happens at about 8 pm.One of the places which comes on a must visit list in HK
Light show. Light show not that special although it is on every night. Great watching the harbour both at night and day

Amazing skyline - light show just OK. This skyline certainly does wow. Must see it from up high (Victoria Peak is great) and down low (the Kowloon waterfront is a perfect spot). I was sadly disappointed by the light show. Did not find it anything special. But the skyline is so big, I couldn't fit it all in a 3-photo panorama. Simply amazing.

What a sight. I took a boat trip to Lamma island for business. I was returning at night time. I was tired but seeing the beautiful skyline of Hong Kong from the sea side was a rewarding experience. I was lucky.

Impressive . This is definitely worth watching once, I found it a little over hyped but the view from avenue of stars is great and worth a HongKong selfie...watch out a selfie stick doesn't take an eye out.

a city with a lot of shopping. quiet at night, if you love the night life you have to go to certain area, away from the hotel, the goods are real not fake, but they can very pricey especially i was look to purchase Jade brace lace for my daughter the real ones are over $1000us
Sky line. Symphony of Light and Music excellent This wretched system seems to think you need 100 words to convey something, you do not.
Impressive. Impressive skyline where you can see a lot of tall buildings, big and little ships afloat in the water.
The future is Asia. The amazing Hong Skyline is filled with new buildings, great architecture and many construction cranes where new buildings are being built.
Lights at Night!. Incredible to see the fantastic architectural display from both sides on the Star Ferry or walking along the promenade on the Kowloon side. The only place similar is Shanghai.

Probably the best skyline in the world. Hong Kong skyline is iconic and always delivers a wow factor, whether day or night. I had read a bit about the light show occurring at 8.00pm each night. I may have been in Hong Kong during an 'off' night but I thought it was a bit under whelming. Yes there were some laser lighting going on but not a lot.
Impressive. Whatever it represents to you, the skyline is iconic and impressive. My favourite time to enjoy it is after dark, when the lights illuminate each unique building.

Skyline stunning from many vantage points. Victoria Peak was a perfect view day and night, Hennesy Bar on top was terrific, and the Aqua Bar in Kowloon was the most amazing view from top. So many places to see this! Great day and night.
Breath-taking. Gutted on arrival at the peak as a thick fog had set in on our ascent. We went to grab a drink to sit it out and moments later all the cloud cover peeled away and the view was insane!

Beautiful during the day or at night!. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful from any angle, day or night. See it from Victoria Peak, from Kowloon, or on the water from the Star Ferry. Day or night it's always impressive!

panoramic view of HK. Glass reflection for photo snap shot. Choose a sunny day to go up to sky100 for photographing.
Astounding view

Lights on Steroids. We spent our first afternoon in HK going to Victoria's Peak and catching the beauty of the harbor at sunset, then took the ferry back. The way they light-up the building at night is wonderful.
Wow. No other city in the world offers as good a skyline as HK, especially at night. This is the first vertical city and remains the best for high density urban design.

HK has the best skyline in the world. I have been to numerous cities around the world but none matches up to HK's skyline. If you are landing in HK during the day, enjoy the beautiful landscape. If you're taking off at night over HK island, the skyline will look like an HD picture from above in clear sky. This in addition to watching the skyline from the peak or TST promenade.

Excellent View of Skyline. we took a ferry from the terminal to view the skyline. It is a 60 min ride which takes you around the harbour and you can witness the laser lights between the towers very clearly from there. Overall time well spent. This ferry starts at 7:30pm. The laser show is at 8pm and last for 10 to 15 mins. A must see.
No more no less than I expected. Amazing. Real an amazing skyline. Better in the night hours. Try one of the bars on the highest floors and enjoy your experience

Tsim Sha Tsui Light Show. The harbour at night is beautiful and although the light show wasn't super spectacular it is still a breathe taking sight at night time. During the day enjoy a walk along the Avenue of Stars.

Totally Towered. The skyline and the shoreline are totally impressive. During the daytime it is overwhelming and then at nighttime it is a different story altogether. The lights on all the buildings are spectacular. Could not get over the number of high rise buildings in Kowloon and on Hong Kong island. We wondered, where do the people living in all these apartments work? We then found out that most of the buildings on Hong Kong island are offices and a lot of the people working in these offices live in Kowloon. All the above is best viewed from a harbour cruise. In our humble opinion.

Watch the Hongkong skyline at night, you wont miss Manhatten. Hong Kong's already impressive skyline comes to life each night thanks to the intricately choreographed Symphony of Lights. Hong Kong's skyline is impressive during the daylight hours but will really startle you when all the skyscrapers are lit in the evening. Be sure to carry your camera along. Adding to the beauty of Hong Kong's skyline is a fantastic multimedia light show that began in January 2004. Dubbed "A Symphony of Lights", this orchestrated light and laser show currently features 44 buildings on both sides of Victoria Harbor, View on Hong Kong Island from the Peak though it began on the Kowloon side only. The show features several different kinds of lights including not only simple lighting from inside the buildings but also LEDs, lasers, searchlights, and projection lighting. On special occasions or to mark a particular event, A Symphony of Lights adds fireworks to its nightly presentation.Taking place each night during good weather, the show starts at 8 pm and ends about fifteen minutes later. There are several good places from which to watch A Symphony of Lights, but the best by far is from aboard one of the Victoria Harbor ferries which have special rates and packages available specially for this cruise.
skyline & water line. The victoria peak and the avenue of star was a amazing combination. the back drop of the tall bulidings and the stars were amazing
Get your camera ready!. The view after dark is beautiful but there is nothing like the view from the Peak. Be sure to make the time (taxi is easy and inexpensive) to take a "peek".
A city of growth. Wonderful views. Much has changed since we were here in 1984 not all for the good. I think it's too big now and very expensive.

Impressive, Day or Night. One of the most impressive urbanscapes in the world, especially from Victoria Peak during the day; but more so from Tsim Tsa Tsui on the Kowloon side during Christmas or Chinese New Year at dusk into night during the light show. Wonderful experience.
JA JA IN HONG KONG. I travelled 20 hours in a plane just to see the skyline. I love skyscrapers. Incredible day or night. This is the real Gotham City.

Great Ways to Experience the Hong Kong Skyline!. The Hong Kong Skyline is one most memorable parts of a visitor to our city. It can be enjoyed day and night, and if viewing conditions are favourable, it has the ability to leave lasting impressions that you will long look back to when thinking about your time in Hong Kong. One of our favourite ways to enjoy the Hong Kong Skyline is by taking harbour cruises or simply hopping on the Star Ferry to cross over between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. In addition to spending time on the water, it is always impressive to approach the Hong Kong Skyline, watching the skyscrapers quickly begin to tower above you as you near the ferry pier on the HK side. While the Star Ferry crossing is a rather quick ride, you can also consider taking a longer, one hour cruise of Victoria Harbour. Again, we prefer the Star Ferry Harbour Cruise as it is probably the lowest cost option and allows you time on these vessels which are an important part of Hong Kong's heritage and history. Another popular choice is the Aqua Luna junk vessel, which also takes guests around the harbour for a similar experience. One of the best land based positions to enjoy the Hong Kong Skyline is the Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) Promenade, where you have unobstructed views with the harbour directly in front of you. You can also take in excellent views from sky bars and a few restaurants found in the upper levels of buildings in TST. The Sky101 Observation Deck is another popular way to view the Hong Kong Skyline, just be mindful of the viewing conditions before committing to a visit here. From the Hong Kong Island side, you can view the skyline from Victoria Peak. This popular location provides a much different perspective, seeing it in the foreground just in front of Victoria Harbour and the Kowloon Skyline just beyond. Like the position on the TST Promenade, this is a classic spot for making that postcard perfect picture of Hong Kong, one you will long remember after leaving the city.

AMAZING CITY SKYLINE. I have been to many cities around the world but the HK skyline is one of the most amazing ones period. take a ferry ride at night and you will be amazed, or do a night boat tour which is even better views.

How do you turn a Cityscape into a light show?. Hong Kong is truly a world city as they claim it to be, and to turn the night cityscape into a free stunning light show is a fantastic example of the energy and imagination that Hong Kong seems to have in abundance.One of the bst places to see the lights is on the Harbour, and there are numerous tours that offer this service, or you can just stroll along the avenue of stars and watch...
What a view!. The view from the Kowloon promenade across to the Hong Kong skyline can only be describes as breath-taking. The photos and TV don't do it justice.
Fantastic Views.. The skyline is fab both day and night and is best seen from the Peak but beware of low cloud. Take a boat trip or ferry to see it all from the bay.
amazing. what can i say about this , dancing lights ,beautiful place , skyscrapers , what a view !!! simply amazing !
Amazing and free !. Longest running light show in the world since 2004, I believe. Some of the effects are spectacular with sky scrapers having pac man and heart displays running riot.
Light Show. There is a fantastic daily light show at 8 p.m. which must be enjoyed from the Kowloon side. Meanwhile the skyline view from the Central side has become very attractive.

Breathtaking. Get the Star Ferry to Kowloon and watch the 8pm Hong kong Island light show, bonkers and brilliant.Go for a wander around Central and look at the unbelievable buildings, go up the mid level escalators, half a mile long and 450ft high.Then walk back down through the tropical park.
amazing!. Wonderful sykline, especially at night, the lights were amazing - could have sat for hours just looking at it.
Nowhere else like it. Visiting Hong Kong is an experience in itself. The skyline is unlike anywhere else in the world. It's breath taking. Day time, night time it's truly amazing.

Starry skyline. The HK skyline can be appreciated from multiple angles...across the bay from Tsim Sha Tsui...the Peak or even from various spots within the city. Familiarising yourself with the iconic buildings and heir history adds to the charm.

Hong Kong skyline is unique. There is nowhere else in the world you can find so many skyscrapers layering from sea front all the way up to the mountain side. However, you really need a clear day to get the most out of it.
nice view. The best place for see the Hong Kong view and light show in the night time at 20h is the peer in clock tower in Kowloon.
Not to be missed!. Definitely a must see if you come to HK. Go at night. No need to wait for the light show as it isn't that fabulous. Just go anytime at night for a nice view.
The skyline at night is a must see. best viewed form Victoria Peak. Had a meal which was in one of the restaurants in The Victoria Peak complex, Quite inexpensive considering the 5 star view
Hong Kong Skyline. Travelling from the Regal Airport Hotel into HK via subway was a pleasant experience and fast to get around to see the harbor to enjoy the nightlights and street vendors.

Lovely night views. We visited at the end of Chinese New Year with many of the decorations still in place. The Skyline was amazing with many light shows and all the building lights against the dark sky.
amazing a must see experience. the views from both sides of the harbour are truly epic. Even better in the night as the lights are truly awesome

Dancing Buildings. As you stand with many people around you in front of the skyline buildings begin to light up and all of a sudden they begin to dance.
Its a good idea to allow room for you to see, so stand in the back.
You can take your music with you as the music they play is a bit strange.

Wonderful lights. Caught a taxi to the pier 3 at Kowloon side approx 7.30pm. Lots of people around, we enjoyed the skyline on a beautiful balmy night. To highlight the evening a Chinese junk looking beautiful with lit up red sails. Also took a small 1.5 hour cruise to enjoy the evening & would recommend the sight to any visitor to Hong Kong.
Skyline at Harbour. Just excellent.. The laser show at evening is brilliant.It matches all international standards.Kids will enjoyThe negative was that it was too crowded

Amazing SKYLINE!!!. The skyline of Hongkong is amazing and beautiful!! It is best to go there at night as it really shows the bustling skyline of Hong Kong along with the river! The lights shows are interesting as well! Definitely the best skyline I've seen in Asia! :D

Hong Kong Skyline can be seen from many vantage points.. The Hong Kong Harbour/Skyline is a iconic part of Hong Kong during the day or night.
If looking from Kowloon side of the peninsula you can see the EYE (wheel) in its glory right by the waters edge.

Loved it!. Loved the Symphony of Lights....Had a great experience watching it from Macau...but the place was really crowded and trouble finding a place to sit ....finally we found a fence which was really uncomfortable....other than that it was a good experience.
a skyline for the ages. hong kong is an amazing place - this is a city you need to visit, its skyline is breathtaking. see it from atop the hill (take the tram) and at the top of the ICC, awesome

view. Well I am not sure that anywhere in the world can you see such a spectacular combination of view, downtown and mountains juxtaposed. The cleanliness of the city in general is apparent, even in the shiny city views!!

At night the buildings have light shows. We enjoyed the Hong Kong skyline during the day, and marvelled at the size of the buildings. At night many of the buildings are lit up with light shows featuring changing scenes. It was fascinating to watch. At 8 pm there is a laser light show over the harbour, which is very popular.

Spectacular at night. Skyline is iconic part of Hong Kong. It is best visible from Kowloon peninsula as you get a good view over the island. It can be nice during the day too, but is impressive at night. It is also a lovely stroll down the Avenue of stars. The laser show, that starts at 8.00 pm is a way overrated.

Spectacular, must see view. The city view from Victoria peak - complete with the tram ride up the hill - is worth experiencing at least once. The Symphony of Lights which is a free visual attraction by the govt is best viewed from above the sky deck at Victoria peak. Alternatively, you can also get a full panoramic view from near the museum down.
Fantastic. Hong Kong is a truly major city with a lot of energy and vibrancy. There is a real bizz here. Views of this unique city are stunning.I highly recommend a visit.

laser show. beautiful display. a must-see simply because its unique. we watched from Avenue of Stars and although there were a lot of people there was plenty of room for everyone to get a good view of the show.

Awesome!. One time visit. I went there on a foggy day and found it boring.
The symphony of lights may be a nice show in the nineties but it is quite boring these days..
The Promenade facing the skyline is good for an evening stroll and see the ferries helping people cross the channel....

Always a sight to behold for me. HK Skyline is one of my favourites.. I enjoy a nice brisk walk soaking in the wonderful skyline, while watching the bustling tourists and alike on the walk with the star stretch
Nice time Pass. Nice for time pass and peaceful walks and photo sessions has many eateries and ferries and good place to see the light show

Hong Kongs Heart. Hong Kong means Fantastic, Awesome, Really Really Beautiful and amazing.
Wants to visit again and again and again
Especially at night. The best view is from Victoria peek. Light show also nice from near the clock tower. Very modern - especially on Hong Kong island.

Not a bad seat in the house. Not a bad seat around town, but certainly some are better than others. My favorite? A view from The Peak. Take the walk around and also go to the observation deck. Worth the trip. Here's a tip - the observation deck costs a few dollars, but if you have a certain type of tram ticket, it is free. Not sure what the distinction is, but I got in with my tram tix.

Very nice skyline view, laser show is overrated. I wouldn't bother going for the laser show. Cheesy music, kind of boring, but a very nice skyline all in all. One of the best I've seen, and even better at night. Definitely worth a trip to Kowloon for some night market shopping, dim sum and a view of the skyline, before the Star Ferry back to Hong Kong Island!

A must ... on a nice day or night !. Got my Octopus card, jumped on the no1 bus on Prince Edward road just outside the Royal Plaza at Mongkok where I am staying from the top deck, enjoy the sights of Nathan road, get off at Tsim sa tsui...from there you can either go towards the Ocean terminal, or go to the Tsim sa Tsui prominade or take a star ferry ride to see the HK Skyline.Better yet take the 19h55 Star ferry night harbour cruise to see the light show and skyline of HK and Kowloon !Bring your Gopro!
Great view. A lovely building and a great view. It was very quiet when we visited so we had plenty of time and space to admire the views. All staff very friendly and helpful.

Best to checkout from the tallest building. The hong kong skyline especially around the wanchai causeway pier waterfront is amazing. It is possible to take a night cruise with music and food otherwise visit the neighbouring islands and have a fantastic day out.
Smogg. The skyline was lovely at night but a lot of smogg. The people are very ignorant. I seen a lot of nice things but not in a hurry to go back there, because of the people.

Wow, very impressive!!. Wherever you stand you are surrounded by modern architecture that would rival the best of those in most other cities. The cruise ships usually stay two days, so you can enjoy the color at night, which really shows off a proud city. We are still telling people back home about the mere size of this city, even comparing it with New York and that is no comparison. That is hard to believe if you haven't seen it, but it is true. Hope you get the opportunity because it is fabulous!

The skyline is great! Take your camera!. Love the skyline in Hong Kong, both sides are great. Get over to Kowloon and look across the harbour for the best view. Checkout Symphony of Lights each evening at 8pm for 13minutes, this is great, and a must see!

Stunning sight at night!. Cruising out of Hong Kong is really amazing. These massive, unique, structures towering into the sky. Seemingly endless blocks of apartments blocks stretch the waterfront, many over 60 stories. Building like the Lippo Centre, the International Commerce Building or the Bank of China building are in the clouds! A great experience seeing these structures one after another. Great photo opportunity on a clear evening.

Big and beautiful. I traveled to Hong Kong on a cruise ship and was delighted to find that we had a spectacular view of the Hong Kong skyline from the ship.
