It is a big city and the skyline at night was beautiful. Add to that numerous boats and barges gliding down the river and it made for a beautiful scene.
Really Nice!. Hong Kong is a wonderful city, full of really exciting places. The skyline is definitely worth seeing! Make sure to bring your camera to take some memories home!

INTERESTING TRIP UP ON THE RAILWAY !. Excellent views and commentary. The funicular rail ride to the top was exciting for those of a nervous disposition. It clanks, rattles and shakes, but the ride down is even more hair raising as one wonders if there are any safety features on board.Food and drink at the summit quite expensive.Normally there is a charge for the access and electronic guide to the view from the top deck but we presented our rail tickets and this was supplied at no extra charge.Do check at the bottom (preferably before travelling) that the viewing deck is open as sometimes there is maintenance or events in progress and parts may be closed from time to time.Remember seniors to present your passport for discounts on travel to this great destination !

Ok a smoggy day. We want there in the afternoon and was a bit hazy came back at night to see the music lazer light show bit disappointed and still smog and thought it would be a lot better with all the reviews saying how good it was yes it is a spectacular harbour if you can see it

Spectacular View at Night. The best time to view the Hong Kong Skyline is at night and you don't have to board one of the tour boats to appreciate the view! The light show in the evening is an added bonus.
Amazing. Saw the show from the Avenue of Stars and also saw the skyline from a boat cruise, nothing short of amazing......

Most beautiful!. This is one of the most beautiful sights in the world. The buildings are amazing. Walking along in the evening is a treat. Between the lights, people watching and exploring it cant be beat!
Awesome architecture. Architecture buffs will marvel at the skyline in HK. Huge skyscrapers packed in very densely. Great views from either side of harbour.

New York on Steroids. Stayed almost 9 days in Hong Kong and never got tired of looking at the skyline. The 8 PM laser show was fantastic but anytime at night it really show off. So much to see from anywhere in the harbor. Amazing to witness in person - have to see it to believe it.

Always beautiful. We went up to the Peak to see the skyline, great evening out and lots of places to eat. The walk to the train is exhausting on a humid day so do take lots of water with you, or take a taxi to the top.

Trip to the 'peak'. We got the Star ferry from mainland to HK island. The crossing only takes about 10 minutes. Then a bus minute walk from ferry - the front of bus was marked as The Peak can't recall number. We got off at the stop for The Peak tram. Then got a return fare from the tram terminal to the peak. I think this was the equivalent of £15 or so for the two of us. Fery was 20 p each way and bus 40 p each way. It was worth trip to the top for great views of HK. We went at night in clear weather.

Beautiful view of city. Wonderful buildings everywhere!!!It was nice experience walking along with waterfront .The view is very nice It is also great to see Guinness book world record light showAmazing amazing This is best experience yourself .its clean safe and simple breathaking The avenue of star was great fun especially taking pictures Great harbour view
Magnificent. A must to view the rows of skyscrapers from kowloon. A pity that we viewed the lights on sunday where not all the lights were on.

Amazing. HK is known for its high rise buildings. It looks completely different during Day and Night. For the best view, goto Victoria harbour (TST promenade) or to The Peak. They have some not-so-great light show every night @ 8pm that you can see from Victoria Harbour.

extraordinary view, especially at night. I stayed a few days at the Intercontinental hotel in a room facing the harbor. The view is extraordinary. I go to Hong Kong regularly, and I never get tired of this view.

A skyline that challenges the best of SF or NYC. Ultra modern, towering buildings both residential and commercial have sprung up all over the erstwhile British territory. Kowloon is awash with some fantastic architectural and structural marvels. The tallest building in the area,the Sky100 offers spectacular 360 degree views of the city.Then again the views from the Peak give an idea of the still green Hong Kong with its thrust skywards!

Interesting if you are seeing it for the first time . The postcard sight is not to be missed but do be prepared for the crowd when you are there. Selfie sticks everywhere and it difficult to get a good view of you are there late. After 5-10 mins of the light show I left the place.

+ & - of HK these days; a fabulous skyline and show but a pity about the Chinese pollution _. Practically all of the major corporates have joined force to sponsor a truly fabulous colour bonanza at night. The images generated by the coordinated light show are fantastic whether they are viewed from either the island or Kowloon. However the best viewing by far is from a boat/ship sailing the harbour. Definitely better than other harbours I have visited.

Wow!. Spent a couple of days in Hong Kong as part of a cruise. Our cabins veranda looked out towards the Hong Kong skyline, so it was bliss to sit out (with glass in hand) at any time of the day just for the view. Can't wait to go back

Stunning vistas. The view from Kowloon of the HK skyline is simply stunning no matter the time of day or weather. At night it is mesmerising and it is worth being there for the sound and light show at 8pm - though very crowded - that enhances the experience.
excellent view. it has been recorded in the Guinness book.Lighting and music together make the scenario fantabulous. Must go place!
Take pictures everywhere. This is a city the architects built. Wonderful buildings everywhere! See the city from the harbor-it is amazing!

Beautiful!. It was a very nice experience walking along the waterfront along the sidewalk of the Stars. The early spring cool breeze was very refreshing and the view is very nice, it is also great to see it from the ferry although it is a very short trip, less than 10 minutes.
Amazing Skyline view of Hong Kong Island. Absolutely beautiful view. Stunning. Rated as the second most highrise skyline view in the worlrd after New York City.
Breathtaking . Best viewed from TST promenade or Victoria Peak. Set up before sunset on TST promenade and soak it up as the sun sets and the skyline lights up

Vistas were impressive. the light show at night was lovely to see . The crowds of people were hard to get through.one is in awe of the skyscrapers everywhere. Should take a ferry over to Hong Kong Island walk around and take a tram ride.

What a great view!. You could spend a whole night walking around Victoria Harbour and looking at this beautiful view! It is definitely among the top skylines of the world, and the Symphony of Lights is an absolute must-see when visiting Hong Kong.

Amazing. The view of the skyline is amazing. Some of the buildings look like they belong in space as their architecture is so modern and sleek. It really shows the city's development and investment growth. A must when in Hong Kong.
better than the nyc one. this skyline is just breath taking and growing by the minute. Watching it from the Lobby Bar at the Intercontinental is just awesome

Something to see. Just flew form Shanghai and thought I would not see something competitive to that view, but Hong Kong has fixed that problem. Absolutely stunning. This place is great and nothing compares to it around the world.
Amazing. Great thing to see in Hong Kong- a must see! We spend some great moments there! Luckily there were not too many people when we went!

One of the best. This skyline is surely among the top city sights in the world. Rewards slow comprehension and it is easy to spend an inordinate amount of time gazing, particularly if you are wandering around at dusk.
Amazing. One of the definitive views in the World. Nip over to Ozone on the 118th floor on Kowloon side for a great view.

As good as it gets..... Prefer this one to many others. It is impressive day or night.
It can be viewed from anywhere and still impress you.

The beauty of the HongKong Skyline. I am very amazed at gazing at the HongKong skyline. Its buildings are very modern and eyecatching. These were designed by foreign architects and blends very well into the harbor. A very impressive sight, and would realize that this is the Asian hub of many major banks in the world and truly a financial capital in this part of the world. It gives you the feeling of so much wealth in the island.
Wow!. The skyline is amazing. HK has more skyscrapers than any other city in the world. And it shows. Worth a watch

Hong Kong Victoria Harbour Skyline. Amazing, amazing amazing. #%^! Words cannot describe the beauty. This is best experienced yourself. It is clean, safe, and simply breathtaking. One could sit there for hours. The Avenue of stars was fun especially to take pictures.
Far East Power. Incredible infrastructure in a vibrant and fun city. Views from the peak and the harbour are just brilliant.

The best view you can get .... Is from the Star ferry, while crossing the bay.I did it at 8 p.m., waiting to see the light show, with the green laser lights being "shot" from the buildings on one side to those on the opposite side, just to find out that it had been discontinued or maybe suspended. Nevertheless all buildings are illuminated and beautiful to be watched.Pity that the Star Ferry takes so little to cross ...
Beautiful. Especially by night.. Really beautiful..enjoy the light show in harbour,check it out from Peak view and just walk around and admire the lights and forms.

Longest Permanent Laser Night Show. Gueness World Book of Records has Hong Kong Skyline at night as the longest, Permanent running laser night show. It is a hoot. It is more spectacular than Disneyland. You can see it from some high (rate) hotel rooms (like I did) or in the harbor, or outside mall near the harbor. This is no only free but history.
best view in the world. visited this place with friends last month.was mesmerized and dazzled by the view.sure to visit again soon

Spectacular it is!. Hong Kong skyline is one of the best skylines in the world. The view of skyline from TST promenade/Avenue of stars, star ferry or peak is awesome and definitely worth visiting Hong Kong for. Both in the daylight and evening the skyline looks great and symphony of lights with the music adds to the beauty of it.

Amazing skyline. We saw the skyline by taking the star ferry to kowloon, very cheap. At night the skyline looks amazing. I wasn't too impressed with the lazer lights show which starts at 8pm every night. We waited around for an hour to see the show. Although young kids would probably enjoy it.

Get a night view. The skyline is wonderful, especially if you line up the red-sailed junk against glittering modernity for a photo. However, the Symphony of Lights was a disappointment. Repetitive and somewhat boring. The tech-heads should take themselves down to Singapore to see how good a laser light show can be!
Cheapest way to see. Get on the MTR at dusk, get off at Tsim Sha Tsui. The ferry is within a 200m walk and costs very little... takes you across the river to very near the big wheel...
great skyline. A bit bland and gray but awesome in night. The view from avenue of stars is indeed really great. Some of the skyscrappers gets missed in the clouds

Stunning skyline. Although it was mainly hazy every day when you do get a clear day the views are amazing!!! We also went up The Peak (on Hong Kong island) and you overlook the whole of Hong Kong so this is a must!!
Always Spectacular. Never get tired of visitng Victoria Peak... A must do for all travellers to Hong Kong .. Take a jacket cause it gets cold up there

Aqua lunar view. you need to view the skyline with a cultural tourguide in the morning and buy a ticket from aqua lunar in the different. very different sides of HOng Kong. i am extremely pleased with both experiences.

Simply amazing. Definitely one of the most spectacular skyline I have ever seen in the world! The symphony of night at 8.30 is the main attraction every night where they's introduce you to different building by different light effects on the building. Surely you'll be amazed by how beautiful hong kong is!

Anniversary trip. Saw the Synphony of liights from Kowloon.
Took the Star ferry, very cheap.
Went to night market,very busy.
The best skyline. Enjoyed our time by visiting this place and admired the best skyline in the world. It is more beautiful and splendid at night and make sure do not miss this place when u come to H K
nice to see hong kong. Hong Kong is very scenery from any view point. 1 hour visit is compulsory to complete your Hong Kong visit
the peak. the peak is a great place to view the skyline. the sky100 observation deck is great. we went there at night the elevator takes 60 seconds to go 100 floors

Breath-taking at night. Best at night when all the buildings light up. Be sure to catch the lights how around 8pm every night. Get there early and get a good vantage point to enjoy the show. Be sure to take the Star Ferry to either get there or to leave as it's a nice journey too.

The skyline is nice from many views, but especially from Victoria Harbour.. I enjoy taking photo of the Hong kong skyline over the water. it is a very organized city and a clean city...you are safe in the daytime in most areas. I always enjoy the food and scenery in Hong Kong. I usually enter from the Lu Yo district in Shenzhen.

Excellent Place. The Hk's Skyline is a wonderful place. It's presence is mesmerizing. The buildings look great and in the evenings it gets better with the Laser show (Lights and Sound Show) and all the Ferries that go around on the Waters. Best place to get some great pictures

One of the classic skylines of the world. The combination of highrise buildings, dramatic hilltops and the harbor makes this my favorite skyline of the world (in close competition with New York and Shanghai). It can be enjoyed from both sides of the harbor even if the better view is from Kowloon towards Hong Kong island.

Great view, annoying crowds.... Went to The Peak after sundown and paid the additional fee to get onto the viewing deck. It was ridiculously busy and if you are serious photographer then be prepared to take several deep breaths and chill as you will have to wait a long time to get a decent spot and even then it is very hard to get the shot you want. Still, the view is stunning (preferred the view from Rockafella in New York) but you will need the patience of a saint...
not on my list to return. very small and only 2 nice rides. not worth the price.not on my list to return; more shopt than attractions
Not to be missed!. The skyline of Hong Kong is spectacular during the day and unbelievable at night. Take the Star Ferry to TST and enjoy the incredible view.
Spectacular Skyline view at the Night !. The skyline of Honk Kong is the biggest in the world and it is a spectacle at Night. Definitely A must visit.
Truly amazing. Hong Kong really has one of the most amazing skylines in the worldyou have to see it for yourself - looks great during the day and splendid during the evening/night

Great at night or from the peak. Try to see the skyline before sunset and stay till it's dark you'll get the best of both worlds! if you visit victoria peak for the view only pay for the viewing platform if its a good day/night, don't waste your money if its cloudy or dull.

Sailing on a Junk to classical music, watching HK light up.........goosebumps!. Actually went about 4 years ago, but a friend is going and asked me about it...she loved the email and said I should post on TA.It was our second night in HK over the Xmas period, before travelling on to Bang Kok and Phuket. As usual we had read up on the "must do's" one of which was a sail across Victoria Harbour. We went down to the harbour and there seemed to be lots of ways & types of boats & ferries to choose from, we were so glad we chose a traditional junk, not the cheapest way to do it, but well worth the extra.For those that do not know a "junk" is an ancient Chinese sailing ship design that is still in use today ours had a magnificent red sailOn board we were directed to several daybeds and served either beer or cocktails and then set sail across the harbour, halfway across we were treated to the Symphony of Lights; which is at 8pm nightly and is a multimedia show and involves more than 40 buildings on both sides of the harbour.We decided to get off the junk across the harbour but believe you can go "full circle"You can also stand and watch from either side of the harbour, or on top of one of the tall buildings but for a total experience take a junk!
A good sight. Worth a view on a clear night. Light show was average. Not sure it is worth paying for rather watch it if you can from your hotel or a bar.

Impressive. Hong Kong Skyline is quite impressive. If you want to see it there are many ways.The promenade and avenue of starts, victoria peak... many ways.At night is usually more impressive, so I would try to get to a sky bar and get a view :)My pictures are from a Skybar called Aqua, very gorgeous view, VERY PRICEY ;)The promenade will be crowded.
Spectacular. Look at this from a ferry!It's cheap, practical, local and above all amazingGo to Pier 7 and take ferry to T S T!

Fascinating during day and night. Hong Kong has grown vertically and the high rise buildings have been built against the backdrop of the Ocean and mountains. The skyline has its attractiveness both during the day and the night when the lights come on adding charm to the atmosphere. On a clear day/night and from an altitude one can enjoy the skyline thoroughly.
Hong Kong skyline never ceases to amaze me. Victoria Harbor is certainly one of the most scenic spots in the world, even if the weather is not friendly

A Beautiful Skyline. OK, I travel a lot. I've seen my fair share of skylines. Chicago. New York City. Tokyo. Philadelphia. My mate told me Hong Kong Skyline beats them all. I thought she was exaggerating. But no. It's amazing. I don't know if it's the water. The buildings. or the fact that they light up the buildings at night and have a laser show. It's amazing to see day and night. Night is much better. You get the breeze from the harbor and the laser show at 8pm.
Hah!. I'm not saying that the Hong Kong skyline would not be impressive but the every night light show...I would not use my time to watch it again. Poor music and few lasers won't impress me.

Amazing view. Hong Kong Skyline is awesome both at daytime and at night. Watch out for morning fogs. At night time the show A symphony of lights takes place at 8 PM (9PM in summer) and it's best from Kowloon's seaside promenade.

Victoria Peak and Sky 100 is a must!. During high season you can take a taxi all the way to the top of Victoria Peak. Also the view from Sky 100, ICC building is on a clear day marvelous. The Ozon bar on the top is very crowded in the evening and you need a table reservation for the seating inside. Still a night view from a 118 floor is just amasing.

Breathtaking Skyline. Hong Kong harbor skyline is one of the most spectacular skylines in the world. The natural geography of the region and the islands and convoluted shoreline makes for the most spectacular view in the entire world. The skyline is on par with Shanghai, Seattle, San Francisco and Sydney Harbor in my opinion. The view from Victoria Peak gives one the true perspective of this beautiful city build around several islands and those are connected by some of the most beautiful suspension bridges you will ever see. I think taking in the views and the amazing architecture and mind boggling structures is a must see experience in Hong Kong. What should never be missed is the 8:00 PM laser light show each evening. That is quite an experience and one that you will never forget.

Must see in Hong Kong. Hong Kong Skyline is something one should not miss. It can be seen from many places. You can see it from the Victoria Peak, from the Harbour on bot sides (HK Iskland side and Kowloon side) and from a ferry. If possible you should experience from all these places. The laser show which starts at 7.45 pm is also a great experience. Some times it may not be visible if it is foggy. On a clear day/night it is awesome.

Absolutely mindblowing. Its like the NYC skyline but on steroids. The light shown was pretty average to be honest and other than the lasers the buildings lit up just as much as they do normally and the music is very cheesy. Worth a watch though as its only 15 mins long and at least you got to see it. Don't worry about crowds either, everyone is very polite and it didn't get more than (very loosely) three deep.If you're short on time however just miss the light show, just go anytime during or after sunset, get a seat and take the view in. Completely unbelievable. I was blown away!
Nice but not very special. It is nice to be close to the water and to oversea the skyline, but it is not so impressive since most skycrapers are not very special in their design

Impressive skyline, altho highly polluted with light. The skyline is quite magnificent albeit the light pollution from so many hoardings on the buildings. Looks like a giant billboard up in the sky. However, the ICC light show is quite unique to Hong Kong. The show timings are at 8, 9 and a few in between. Do check their site before you plan to watch the light show on the skyline itself. Take a very good camera to capture the skyline. The amount of light makes phone cameras and point and shoot camera photos look like photos taken at a discotheque. Late nights provide a good respite from the general crowds taking snaps of the skyline.
Great at night. Looking at the Hong Kong skyline during the day and at night are two completely different experiences. It was a lot better at night when it's all lighted up.

A Unique Skyline for a Unique "City". I am not sure the Hong Kong Skyline is the Number 1 attraction in Hong Kong but it is worth seeing. Certainly, it is hard to miss. The juxtaposition of old and new across the two sides along with the Star Ferry does create a unique contrast of views.
The light show is great. The show starts at 8PM and you should arrive by 7:30PM if you want to stand down by the rail on the edge of the platform.

Inpressive. Got to see the skyline at nightfall from the ferry back from the island and it is the same magical feeling as seeing the Bund in Shanghai for the first time. Nice light show and something to see everywhere.

Quite spectacular. Certainly worth going and looking at. We waited half an hour for the light show which was ok. The lighting in the buildings and the junks in the foreground provide a good show already and although the lasar lights from the light show were good , we wouldn't wait any longer than a half hour.
As nice as the photos. Go to the peak at afternoon on clear day . But take in consideration the tram there can be a long cue
It is a really one of Great Human Works.. It is really amazing. You should go and experience it!

One of the great harbors to sail into. Huge skyscrapers on top of each other around this fabulous harbor. Even in the mist, the buildings were impressive. The ferris wheel looks kind of silly because even on top of it, you are so low compared to the buildings. But a must have these days in Asian cities. The light show at 8PM is fun to watch.

Tightly Packed but most organised City. Hongkong is a very modern city in which the buildings are the closest to each other that I have seen anywhere. Yet, because it is so well organised,one does not feel that it is polluted or over crowded . Public transport is excellent so most people do not own cars and hence less pollution. One can buy a common ticket that entitles one to use both the bus service and the train. Taxis are plentiful. They even encourage walking. For example, from the Midlevels where we stayed, to down town One can walk down stairs and return uphill by a chain of 15 escalators. Along the way is a small vending machine in which you can insert your weekly bus ticket and the Machine says "thank you for walking" and adds 2 HK dollars to your bus pass ! Bars and small wayside eating joints a plenty. And of course there is plenty to do for all age groups. A visit to Hongkong is highly recommended.
night view. better at night than during the day, with a lot of fog and misty weather, at least now in April. From the East Victoria Promenade or the International expo bldg
Just like the photos.. If you have seen photos of the HK skyline, you won't be disappointed. Gorgeous. At night, the lights are fabulous.

See the famous skyline in person. Beautiful at night. The sound and light show is okay...music is really soft. If you are planning to catch the show, go to the waterfront area by the Museum of Art. It get really packed, so get there at least an hour before if you want a 'front row seat'. We left after about 15 mins and could see fine from behind the crowds.

Must-see when in HK. If there's one thing you must see, it's the HK skyline. Seriously one of the best in the world, it's especially pretty all lit up at night. Best viewed from the Kowloon side of course. If you don't like crowds, avoid going during the Symphony of Lights.

Interesting but not worth going to there just for seeing it. The Skyline is best viewed from a ferry going between the Island and the new territories. However I would not go there just for this, the best thing to do is to spend a whole day on the island and plan to be at the ferry by evening time to see the Skyline

Best place to view the skyline - at The Peak. The peak is known as the most iconic landmark in Hong Kong, it's a must visit where you see an incredible view of the Hong Kong skyline. Plan to go there around 5:30 ~ 6:00 PM then wait 'till it gets dark - the night scene is even more breathtaking.

Must view from a boat. it was absoluely stunning to view the skyline from a boat. i took the fancy boat called aqua lunar from a local deal site called Klook. despite all the good stuff about the boat, i should just take star ferry right before 8pm to get the best view. Star ferry is only HKD2.3 per person. No one can beat that. it was a must see

Especially at night!!!. The Hong Kong Skyline is truly magnificent, with so many very tall skyscrapers. At 20.00 each night laser lights rake the sky adding to the flood of lights from the tall buildings, just magic. We booked a harbour view room at the Hotel Icon, and had a magnificent view from out 25 floor window and also from the lounge on the 28th floor Above and Beyond, well worth while and a great hotel.

A simple must do in Hong Kong . It's cheap and it's simple. Hongkong has arranged it so it's very easy to take a walk along the waterfront and enjoy the marvelous skyline of Victoria island. If you get tierd there are benches along the way and plenty of snack and refreshment opportunities. Make sure you both see it day time and by night. You can't miss it!

Great Light Show at 8 PM.. We took a MTR train to East Tsim Sha Tsui and walked to The Avenue of Stars. The Avenue of Stars was beautiful, nice, and clean. We were there at 6 PM for day pictures. The views after sunset were amazing. The light show started at 8 PM. We took the Star ferry back to the central MTR station.
Dated. Cityscape is great but the light show is a bit tired. Don't bother, just go to the avenue of stars and enjoy the view at your leisure

Wow!. On a clear evening, the HK skyline is like no other around the world. The harbour, light shows, skyscrapers on both sides of Victoria Harbour are peerless in any harbour town. Come to Hong Kong to enjoy the sights, sounds and food of a truly international city.

Best skyline and skyscrapers. Head to Tsim sha Tsui for some great photos and also dont forget to visit Avenue of the Stars for even more great shots. I highly recommend to all who passes by HK a transition to Victoria Harbour for a light show every night starting from 8pm.
Don't Miss the Light Show. Light show at night is worth the wait! Music and lights on the HK side which you view from the Kowloon side.
Great skyline when you can see it. Suffered from overcast skies and fog when there, seeing the skyline was intermittent but the buildings are amazing
Hong Kong light Show a 8pm every night. Find a place to catch the Hong Kong light Show a 8pm to 8:15 every night...best seen from the Kowloon side. Find a spot near the harbor or on a roof top bar...

Amazing View. Brilliant view, can be enjoyed from Avenue of Stars or all along TST promenade stretching from Star Ferry and Harbour CIty till Hung Hom. Symphony of Lights can be enjoyed on a clear day and even on a cloudy day when the lights fall on the clouds above. The pirate themed junk boats in the Victoria Harbour add to the overall view. All in all the one thing in Hong Kong that should not be missed
Good View of Hong kong skyline. Get to see the city from the peak and good tram ride .It's beautiful even in day and during night as well.But its very crowded
None better. If skyline is what you want great from either side of the river and even better from Victoria Peak. Also great from top floor restaurants

Among the most awesome skyline views in the world. The skyline views of HK from the Victoria Bay are world famous, but the views from many places in the city are breath taking. Take a bus tour (and sit on the open upper deck) to enjoy these views!
super modern. loved using the star ferry and seeing all the buildings in their arcitectial splendor. Very impresive indded.

amazing skyline. best view is from Kowloon walk along the avenue of the starts if you visit around 8pm their is a light show that is worth a watch, what ever time of day there is always something to see
Beautiful sight on the river. Laser show in the evening. Its near the ferry on the river. Lasershow from buildings and at the music hall
Peak visit. The peak on a clear day is breathtaking and my guide Jamie took me to exactly the best spot on Lugarroad
A must see. The Hong Kong sky line is famous. It is a must see when you are there. Probably the best view is from "The Peak".

Avenue of stars is the HK experience. Was pretty cold out in January but nonetheless we went out to the Avenue of stars. The HK skyline is a very good view from here. It's a nice romantic walk if it wasn't so cold out. The light show is uniquely HK. Oh and you must try the fresh shredded squid at the kiosks. Sweet aroma and the squid is pretty darn tasty.

Best skyline in the world ... check it out at night from the Peak, HK Promendade & Kowloon for the best views. The Hong Kong skyline is one of a king, no matter where you see it from ... there are a dozen options or more and attached are a few pictures from all over Hong Kong (The Peak, Wan Chai, Hong Kong Island coastline, TST, Sheung Wan, etc). It is incredible , both day and night so my recommendaiton is to plan around it and try to see it from as many angles at different times of day as possible.
The view. You get a really good feel how impressive this city is, supper clean and friendly staff. What is cool is that you get a device to learn more about the city

Amazing. Hong Kong Skyline is just amazing at night to look at from across the water at Tsim Sha Tsui. There is Symphony of Lights that starts 8pm, if weather permits and also there is Avenue of stars, which is like the hollywood stars of fame, which you have to see day time. You can also catch the star ferry from there.

you have to see. Beatiful view , form the riverside you can see all the opposite island of hong kong. I suggest to visit when wheater is good, otherwise u can get much wind. Also i suggest to go around at 22 o clock you can assist at a fantastic game of laser light from opposite building.

Best Skyline: Where to View. The HKG skyline is famous and acknowledged as a must. Yet the question is where to view this. From the top of the Peak it is not the best, as it is a bird's eye view. You can have another birds-eye-view from Kowloon too. But I am inclined to think that the best is down in the harbour side on Kowloon shore, the Tsimshatsui promenade or on the roop floor of Ocean Terminal, in the evening around 8:30 or 9pm., when there is a spectacular lazer display for many minutes. This is a true spectacle.
One of the World's Premier Vistas. Hong Kong is amazing, a resilient holdout of British culture in a Chinese context. The buildings and their light shows continue to dazzle.
Best skyline in Asia. What else is there to say? Whether you view it from the Peak or from the harbor, it's magical. The lights, the skyscrapers, the water all add up to a beautiful view.

Impressive. The skyline of Hong Kong is probably the most impressive of anywhere I've stayed with numerous high rise buildings all illuminated within yards to the harbour (although I'd hate to work/live in any of the crammed in buildings). The Star Ferry harbour tour is a good way to get a good view of everything without getting shattered.
Fresh view. In the pretty skyline was good and fast. The view from the skyline was beautiful. We had so much fun.
Visit sky 100. Sky 100 is the tallest building with a look out floor at the 100th floor then has the Carlton Ritz Hotel on the next 18 floors and is situated in Kowloon on the Harbour front
amazing skyline for an amazing city. The night skyline of Hong Kong is about as good as it gets. The city lights against the water is just a beautiful scene!

Spectacular. Hong Kong is known to have a very impressive skyline and it doesn't disappoint. Could do with some more hospitality establishments along the waterfront though, but we did find one and enjoyed a beverage as we admired the view.
Something to see. From the Kowloon side, great area to walk around in. Skyline for HK is very interesting, definitely something to see if you are in town.

Superb!. Don't loose the chance to look at Hong Kong skyline.
I don't know if it is the modernity or the mixture of different culture that makes HK so special, but it's sure that you will hardly forget this skyline!

Great but depends on a fog. Fog and hazy view on some days
Liked the vibe and back to civilization after 2 weeks of travelling throughout China
Best from the top. The best place to see the HK skyline is from a rooftop bar - don't stress out about seeing the 'light show' - just try to see the lights up close for yourself!
beautiful. if the weather is right, take some time to enjoy the view! You can sometimes see traditional boats too.
Amazing on a Clear Day. Hong Kong is a huge, modern city. It is especially pretty with all the lights at night. There is a light slow on the buildings at 8 pm--not to miss.

Day or night, it's an amazing view. It might be easy to forget to look out the window while in Hong Kong. Don't pass up any chance to do it. There is always a different perspective that can surprise you.

A great view from the Kowloon side.. This is a must for visitors to Hong Kong especially as there is light show across the harbour at about 8pm every night which is in the Guinness Book of Records. The technology is impressive as some of the buildings which are lit up in time with the music are at least a mile away.
From Kowloon. Walk along the sea front in Kowloon at any time of the day to see the skyline. During the evening join the crowds to watch the laser show and other sights.

Skyline magnificent but symphony overrated. Well the view if the Hong Kong skyline is actually quite beautiful. It's nice seen day or night . The view Shd be from the Kowloon side. BUT pl don't get excited abt the symphony at night! Tad disappointing. The lights are beautiful anyway. The music and the laser doesn't add to it in any way. So don't fret of u can't make it in time. Just stroll around the causeway and enjoy whatever time!

Ever changing wonder!. Spend hours watching the ever changing face of the Hong Kong skyline. From morning til sunset it is a wonder to behold and an amazing mix of ultra modern and traditional architecture!

It is just a skyline . Apart from lights on all of the buildings, it is still just building. You have to see them and the added bonus of a little music and some lasers makes no difference. Seeing them from the peaks was good, light show not so good
Just a line. Smog covered and nothing compared to Shanghai and singapore. The skyline is just a line of uneven buildings some completed some in various stages of completion.

Very good trip to Hong Kong. Some do's and dont's are summarized below for everyone's benefit. The best time to visit HK is Feb-Mar or Oct-Nov. Avoid the summer months since it can get pretty warm. Visit Disneyland and Ocean Park only on week days. Its crowded like hell on weekends and everything from getting into the rides, getting food, getting a taxi back to the hotel etc will be a huge problem. Purchase tickets for these two places in advance if possible and collect them before you enter the park. At least one day each is required to do justice to these places, so plan well. Before you leave the hotel, and assuming you have not taken a package tour, request your hotel to write down the destination name in Chinese. While English is understood by most of the cab drivers, it can be a problem at times. Also, most of the hotels have their details in a small visiting card sized booklet, both in English and Chinese. Carry that at all times to avoid confusion.Be prepared to walk!!! Carry comfortable walking shoes and clothing. People in HK have a fetish for following rules and forming queues! Unlike India, you can't 'jump the queue'. So, don't even try it. Some times people there take offence if you do. We were staying at Ramada at Des Voux Road. There are 2 decent Indian restaurants on Hollywood Street (Bombay Dreams and Jashan) and 1 on Wyndham Street (Ganga's). Book your table in advance, especially on a Friday evening or on weekends. Some people like to have at least one meal which is Indian, and therefore it makes to ensure that you get what you want.Its a safe city and has a vibrant nightlife. Do explore the same. The energy levels that I saw there and the kind of energy that I saw is somewhat lacking here.
Fantastic at night. Iconic of course and a wonderful experience to be there rather than seeing it in a movie! Keep the camera handy.

One of the world's most iconic. Best viewed at night from the Kowloon waterfront park during Chinese New Years. Other times are nice,but not quite so spectacular. A short Star Ferry.ride across Victoria Harbour. This view is seen in any Hong Kong location movie, just to let the movie goers know where they are. On the weekends in the summer there is a light show timed to music,which is broadcast through speakers along the Harbour Walk. The high rise buildings of Hong Kong are lit by thousands of LED lights,and lasers. These lights then flash and make images in time to the music for a fun free show. After the show, go any where to a the many fine restaurants in Tsim Sha Tsui, district of Kowloon. There is even a Hard Rock Cafe,for those who miss American hype.If you are lucky enough to be here during New Years, the light show is coordinated with a spectacular fireworks show. There are three huge barges of fireworks positioned the length of Victoria Harbour. They are computer controlled,so all three barges light off the same firework at the same time. Saying this is spectacular,would be an understatement to say the least. Your vision is filled with exploding color from peripheral to peripheral. Don't forget to breath,is my best advice.
best skyline in the world. best is to go to the waterfront at Tsim Tsa Tsui and enjoy the view.Or go to the peak, just before sunset and admire the change of the colors
Top Skyline. It was amazing. There was no other skyline like this in the world. So, don't hesitate to come here and enjoy the Hongkong Skyline

An amazing skyline. To me, there is nothing more amazing than Hong Kong's skyline. I haven't been lucky enough to have traveled to New York, or some of the other large cities in the world, but I do love the skyline. And definitely, you have to see it from Victoria Peak! The Symphony of Lights is also awesome to watch, but this is better viewed from the Kowloon side. Just another added attraction to the beautiful skyline of Hong Kong!

Splendid!. It's simply beautiful ! I have to admit that I was pretty impressed...
Tip : Go see the skyline at night when they're having the light show...

A magnificent site at night. Fireworks on the water added to the impressive skyline. Vertical living but much of the old charm remains at street level. Two worlds apart in one place. The pace that the skyline has and is changing is remarkable. For best views go to the top of the Peak or stand harbouside in Kowloon
Beautiful. To put it simply; a stunning view! Especially at night, definitely a must see when in Hong Kong !!!!!!!

Superlative cityscape. This skyline is famous for a reason. The handful of famous towers that live on the "world's tallest" list do not disappoint (Bank of China proved especially impressive in the steel, as it were), but at least a dozen lesser known buildings prove to be just as interesting as their famed counterparts.Best viewed from the Avenue of Stars in Kowloon (located along the waterfront to the east of the Tsim Sha Tsui ferry terminal) at night, Hong Kong comes alive in light and color across the water. Truly, one of the great cityscapes of the world.

Beautiful!. Hong Kong has one of the most beautiful skylines in the world. One of the best ways to see it and take photos is by taking the Star Ferry (I go on the lower level) from Tsim Sha Tsui at night. In March, there is fog but I got wonderful photographs. My family and friends like walking on the promenade (or the Avenue of Stars) which is along the harbour on the Kowloon side as well. At night, there is a nice breeze and great photos can be taken there. If you don't have a camera, there are vendors who do a good job of taking your photo and are reasonably priced. Don't miss the Hong Kong Skyline at night!
Spectacular. Just gorgeous, makes New York look like a small village. It's baffling to think of so many people squished into such a small area.
BreathTaking. Wonderful and stunning views of the city..a must list!!! U never get tired of looking at it...amazing!

The peak. Make the effort weather providing to take the cable car to the highest point in Hong Kong, the view is defiantly worth the effort ,choose your day as I cant imagine it being worth it on an overcast or heavily smoggy day.we arrived at 9.15am and avoided any queue, of which by the time we came back down there were a lot of people waiting.
Breathtaking. City skyline in my opinion rivals New York from the water and land.A complete mixryure of old and new

Just Amazing - Magical!. The HK skyline is so amazing to see 24/7 - you can never get tired of looking at it or all the activity that happens in the harbor. The nightly "Symphony of Lights" show with lasers and music is just magical!

I never tired of this view. Morning, noon and especially night, go down to the harbour front to look at the view and watch the river traffic. It's amazing. It's not always completely clear but it's still awesome.

stunning at night. took a ton of photos just looked beautiful, they have a laser light show every evening at 8 pm, so we went there got outdoor seats in a restaurant , what a waste of time, some building's were slightly more colourful, and a green laser light randomly flickered from a few taller buildings, really not worth the trouble, but the skyline at night very nice
foggy but goody. it's all grey and foggy since the weather was not ideal when I came, but it's still great. I highly suggest NOT to come in winter season or close to winter.

Beautiful!. This is one of the most beautiful skylines I've ever seen. It's simply stunning, and never gets old. You can see it from many hotels or walking along the harbor. The evening light show is very worthwhile, and reinforces the beauty! Enjoy!

Beautiful views. -Went on my first night, weather was cold and foggy and light drizzle, better standby a proper sweater to keep yourself warm. -Was crowded but able to linger around freely. -The view of the city lights was awesome despite the weather at night. -The light shows were average accompanied with projections and music. -Went on the last day also the weather was clear and fairly cold, and managed to see the sunset and walked along to the Avenue of Stars. -Overall, it was worth the visit. Not to be miss.
Beautiful. If you have time, go down to the harbour, near the walk of fame, great place to take photos of Hong Kong Island, and the boats in the harbour,

Wonderful view! The highlight of our trip. I would say that this is the best, and MUST do thing when you are in HK. This is a free and fun attraction for sure. My family are hard-to-please kind of people, but all of them agreed that this was the highlight of our trip. The view of Hong Kong Skyline was breathtaking. The fog got thicker by the time the light show started, but we still got to enjoy the beautiful view. Definitely will come again for this.

What a sight. As I am writing this 6:30 in the morning the Hong Kong skyline is wrapped in a dense fog. However, I remember it vividly from last night looking at it from the Kowloon side, how lucky I am to have seen it. Hong Kong is great and it has the skyline to go with it.

Possibly the best in the world--go at night. It's hard to decide which is the better Singapore of Hong Kong but both are excellent. I recommend you stroll around the Avenue of the Stars before dusk, take some pix, have dinner and return, enjoy it when darkness enhances the view. Take the Star Ferry so you can see it from both sides.
A breathtaking view. The view of the city was great and stunning, nothing but pure pleasure and beauty. It was stunning to my eyes, and I have never seen such a thing up close and personal before.

Lovely colourful view. Lots of attractions are free in Hong Kong and this is one of those. There are enough space to sit if you want while waiting. However beware, once the light show at 8:00pm and 9:00 pm start, people stand up and might block the view. If you want to see the light show, choose a clear day. Out of the 4 days we were in Hong Kong, 2 of those days had very low clouds, which made impossible to see the top of some buildings. Not sure if it was because Chinese new year just had passed, but all the building are displaying colourful lights in daytime too
Awesome lights. It was easy to get to and the view was great! Definetly worth a visit, lots of photo opportunities, not to be missed, next time you're in Hong Kong

Never a dull moment... Even with the overcast and being a rainy day, it still felt special. So many thing to see from different vantage points. I could of easily taken 200+ pictures between being at least 15 different locations along the harbor, on a ferry and from the tallest building in Hong Kong.
Absolutely beautiful. the colours are amazing, the heights are just incredible. Really beautiful to see at night. During the day was cloudy so I didn't appreciate it as much

Impressive. This is one of those skylines, you will remember. Looking at Hong Kong Island from Kowloon is a must see view for anyone visiting the area. We were there at 8:00 on Friday evening and happened to see the light show. This is not the most fantastic thing on earth and actually quite disappointing, however that does not detract from the skyline itself, which is incredible. The only question I would ask is whether the lights need to stay on all the time, it seems such a waste of energy, let alone the cost.
One of the best looking skyline in Asia. Bring your camera and then you go to Kowloon or a boat ride on the ocean to get some really great pictures, go in the evening

despite the clouds, it was great. We were in Hong Kong in March and it was surprisingly cold, with afternoon temperatures around 15-19 degrees Celsius. It was cloudy, but despite this, the Hong Kong skyline was magnificent. The low clouds gave it an eery, melancholic look. It may have been even more beautiful than during sunlight!

You will never have enough. Living in Hong Kong for nearly a year I have seen the skyline from all possible angles and at every possible daytime but I am still amazed whenever I see it again. It is a modern age wonder.

Laser light show. At eight pm there is a light show on the waterfront of HK. Go to Kowloon side and watch from the Avenue of stars by the Arts Centre.Best view is from the elevated platform towards the ferry terminal. not where everyone else stands opposite Central Pier. Its ok , there's music and coordinated lasers and illuminated boats cruising around make for great photos but its all over by 8.15 so I recommend the Deli and Wine cafe afterwards, good value and easy to order and pay.

Sit back and enjoy the view. First night we went to catch the light show but it was a misty and cold night, view wasn't good and all we could see was misty lights. The HK pulse light show was good, nice projections and music to compliment it! On our last evening, we took a stroll to the promenade and managed to catch the sunset on a clear day! Such a gorgeous view!

Aqualuna is a must!. this is my second time to Hong Kong - last time i was here - i saw the Aqualuna boat and i thought it's too touristy to get onboard that to see Symphony of Lights. This time i got dragged by my friends - have to say - it was a really nice experience. The boat was very well maintained and had really cool music. The lounge area was amazing - you can just laze and enjoy the Lightshow while sipping on the complimentary wine. I would say it's perfect for group of friends or couple. Better line up earlier for the 7:30pm boat to get the best seats. I would recommend buying your tickets for the 7:30pm online as i saw some who lined up to get tickets couldn't get on. I got mine at a discount from klook travel and it was easy to simply show the evoucher on smartphone

Spectacular view. I guess this is one of the most photographed areas of the world. Even if you are not into photography you can't help yourself to get your camera or cellphone to take photo of the impressive Hong Kong skyline. During a clear day it is really panoramic. It can be best viewed from The Peak, The Avenue of the Stars, The Promenade or if you are riding one of the boats in Victoria Harbour. If you are in one of the boats you can have both the views of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.The view is really spectacular specially at night. The Symphony of lights with music and narration are held every night at 8 pm. Get your spot early coz it can get really crowded.

Rise to the top. I was here for the International jewellery Show. Had the opportunity to see one of the most impressive views in the world when it comes to man made. It's a city packed with so many buildings and the most impressive thing is that it's still developing with so many cranes everywhere. The harbour is one of the best I have seen. The light shows are from 9pm to 10pm. A must see..
Absolutely awesome!. Most impressive skyline in the world. 8.500 skyscraper! More than anywhere else in the world. A fantastic light show at 9pm. It's a must when you stay in Hong Kong.

Go at night. It's very impressive lit up at night. There is supposed to be a sound and light show each night and we went to a good viewing spot at the designated time. All we saw, in addition to the regular lights, were a few searchlights moving back and forth. No sound, except for people talking. That part was a disappointment.
Fantastic views. Still one of the best views in the world.Best on a clear evening and fantastic wit a firework display.

a must see when visiting Hong Kong. if you visit Hong Kong then this is a must see. It's not hard to tell why this ins one of the best night time skylines in the world and the backdrop for so many movies. I recommend going down to the Avenue of Stars in Tsim Sha Tsui, and also viewing it from The Peak to take in this awesome splendor at night.

Clean, Clear and Best Skyline.... I am here in Hong Kong from almost 1 year, I can say Hong Kong has best Skylines to see.Best place to see both side skyline is from Ferry. From ferry you can see both side, The Hong Kong island and kowloon island.

Red Sailed ships to view the light show. On the recommendation of our guide, we took the Aqualuna at the pier at 7:30 for the 8:30 show. Make a reservation or pay on line as the boats are small. Don't book a dinner cruise as we were told the food is not good and over-priced. The boat is quaint and we sat on the forward open deck. The crew kindly provided blankets as it does get cold on the water. The fee includes a free drink, soda or wine and not sure what other drinks offered. The show itself only lasts about 10 minutes but it takes a half hour to pick up passengers on both piers. There is an excellent laser light show with corresponding music. Well done and quite clever. It does show the skylines on both sides very well. There is no wheelchair access.

Clean & Clear Skyline. An unique aspect of Hong Kong skyline is that there are no visible bridges connecting the two sides of the river as can be seen in the skyline of other cities like Shanghai etc. All the interconnecting roads and MTR lines are under-water, which provides a clean and clear view of the entire stretch of buildings at one go.A must see at Hong Kong. Best viewed from the TST Promenade.

Don't miss this no matter what else you do . We went and saw the light show last night on the mainland side and it was the best light show I have seen. The show starts at 8 pm so if you are short get there early as there is a huge crowd but well worth the effort.

The best skyline ever. They say Hong Kong Skyline is the best in the world. As a travel blogger I can attest to that from reviews I read online and saw on ravel sites channel. You can get the best view of the skyline at Avenue of Stars. Better to take a photo of the skyline at Avenue of stars during daytime and at night time. Don't forget to set your camera on a panoramic view !

Hong Kong. I found HK extremely crowded with so many people on the sidewalk that one could not get from from side to the other without great difficulty. The pollution was so bad that it was smoggy all the time. There are no trees and no greenery in the city. All there is are back to back extremely high buildings. This a city I would never go back to.
Nothing like it. It is one of the most impressive skylines during the day But there is nothing like the lightsshow every night.It is just fantastic
Evening light show impressive. What you must do when in HK - see the light show - best from the Kowloon side of the harbour - though impressive not as 'knock your socks off' that I had been expecting

Crowded but a great city.. Liked everything but the crowds. Plenty of shops with just about every and anything you wish to buy. Cheap shops as well as expensive shops depending on what your travel budget permits you to spend.
Like Bladerunner!. Neon and LCDs everywhere. Catch the Star Ferry at night from Wan Chai to Tsim Sha Tsui and return, breathtaking!
Day or Night. A very elegant skyline to be seen day or night. Its hard not to go back a few times and enjoy the views. Wont get bored with this skyline.
Go here after dinner late at night. You get a nice view, and you avoid the crowd. Also the weather is nice in October November time frame. I was here before in May and it was horrible, too humid.
Star Ferry Harbour Tour. Took the hour trip on the Star Ferry around the harbour and watched the skyline. Beautiful! Complimentary drink and snack too, Make sure you take your camera :)
Great at night when lit up. Fab lighting in the city , shame about smog at times, good restaurants everywhere , beware of pickpockets
Fantastic. See it from The Peak. Take evening photos from up there too. And take the (very cheap) Star ferry to Kowloon. One or two hours in Kowloon is enough.

Incredible view of the harbor at night. The only negative is the overhang of haze which is a smog over all the Hong Kong area. Both sides of the harbor are great views. Take a walk along the harbor on the Kowloon side during the day and in the evening

One of the best skylines in the world. Brilliant skyline. Hong Kong is one of th great cities to visit in the world. I've never seen so many sky scrappers. The architecture nad lighting are truly unique. I highly recommend anyone visit Hong Kong.
Great. Very impressive. Hong Kong is the city with the largest skylines in the world. Each evening at. 20:00's light show at all skylines. BE EXPERIENCED

Smoggy by Day and Night. I was in Hong Kong for three days right before the lunar New Year. The highrise buildings were colorfully lit with LED lights to celebrate the Year of the Ram with a nod to Hello Kitty. I viewed the skyline from Victoria Peak on Hong Kong Island one early afternoon and subsequently from the waterfront in Kowloon day and night. Visibility was very poor as a result of heavy smog during the time I was there.
Must see!. It is truly one of a kind. See the skyline at night from one of the ferries crossing the harbour and from The Peak.
10/10. One of the greatest skylines in the world. It's a must see if you go to Hong Kong. If you're in Hong Kong for new year, the fireworks here are world class
spectacular. Very misty and polluted, but nothing else likeitt with views from both sides of the harbour and light show every night at 8pm
AMAZINGGGG!!. A definite MUST SEE while in Hong Kong! One of the most impressive skylines I have ever seen in my life, esp at night!

If you have a chance to see only one thing there - this is the One. As for me - this is obviously a must see in HK. It is a celebration of the contemporary urban life...Worth to see by day (and be ready to get impressed by the very different views day by day or even hour by hour, depending on how much you can see through the clouds/ fog) and by night with the lights - colourful and moving all the time. An advice would be to take a view from the water as well - just get on the Star ferry, any deck is ok for the views :)The widely publicised laser show made no particular impression though - unless you are there during it anyway, do not kill yourself planning your time to see it.

incredible. if you are into skyscrapers this is one of the places that are a must for you. spectacular buildings like im peis bank of china, norman fosters hsbc building or the tall icc building will impress you
Stunning views. It was so much fun to go up the skyline and see so much of the natural environment. You could see most of Hong Kong and the old pathway that people took to get up the mountain.

Great photo opportunity. the Hong Kong skyline can be viewed from the Kowloon waterfront, and is worth a look by day as well as by night. The much-publicised laser lightshow we found to be less than spectacular, but the city lights themselves are worth a second look, particularly if you manage to get a clear night. By day, there's always something new to look at, and plenty of vantage points to see harbour activity, whether from the promenade itself (worth a visit on its own for the people-watching potential) or from the perspective of the Star ferry, which is a must-do, and probably the best 20p-worth of entertainment you could ever spend!

MUST VISIT PLACE. its one of my favorite place and its a must visit place, very scenic, every night 8 Pm, from avenue of stars there is a lazer lighting and music show. worth watching for the hong kong skyline.

Spectacular. The best way to see the Hong Kong skyline is from Kowloon. You can walk along the promenade and the view across is just spectacular, day or night. The tops of the buildings are lost in the clouds, and the view is always changing dependant on the time of day and the weather. Visit on a cloudy day and the tops of the buildings are lost in the clouds, as the tiny boat taxis dart here and there beneath, and the ferries make their way from Kowloon to HK Island. In the evening the view is amazing, and if you are lucky enough to see the red masted junk sail by at close quarters as we did it just adds to the whole amazing experience. The Avenue of the Stars is also along Kowloon promenade and is a good place to admire the view at the same time. There are lots of runners and walkers who frequent the promenade, locals seemingly, particularly on an evening and it just adds to the diversity of the experience.

You should here before you die. If you live in country side, you better come here to feel the power of city.City of live, you can feel it when you come to Victoria Harbor and surround by this skyline.You never feel the it from the postcard or card until you come here.
Super For Pics. The light display was a little disappointing, but the skyline at night is a brilliant back-drop for photographs and well worth a visit!
very beautiful at night.. ongoing light show by active lighting on various high rises. There is also an intermittent laser lighting at 8 pm or so. Best viewed from the Kowloon waterfront at the TST.
Laser light show. The laser light show (seasonal) over Victoria Harbor is something to behold. Do not miss the shows during Chinese New Year period when the shows are nightly at 8:00 p.m.

One of the world's best views. Hong Kong is one of my favourite cities and the skyline of Hong Kong is most recognisable. View it by day and by night. The laser show each night is spectacular and if you are lucky enough to be in the city during Chinese New Year or any other special time, the fireworks displays are stunning. Also take a walk along the promenade, although a little hot during day (lack of shaded areas).

City of lights. Had various views of the hong kong skyline from different locations - intercontinental hotel, victoria peak, IFC, ferry etc.Best view in my opinion - intercontinental hotel. What better way to enjoy the amazing view on a holiday than in the comforts of an air-conditioned environment, sit back and relax with a drink in hand!

Laser light show. Walk down to the harbour and watch the free laser show every evening at 8 p.m. Most of the buildings that are lit up are on Hong Kong Island so the best place to view the show is from Kowloon harbour area. Nice area to stroll along during the daytime too as they have their own Walk of Fame (stars for Bruce Lee & Jackie Chan amongst others).

As good as it gets. This is the famous skyline you see in movies, and best way - the only way, I think! - to see it is to go to Kowloon. Take the ferry from any of the peirs at HK island at dusk (for a day time view), get off at the pier at Kowloon and walk along the Avenue of Starts promenade. It makes for a nice evening. But skip the laser show, completely overhyped.

SPLENDID WHEN IT SHOWS UP. Been here a few, mostly foggy days. The sun finally showed up late yesterday afternoon--the view of Hong Kong Island from Kowloon is such that you never tire of drooling over the view.

Tallest Buildings. In the day time you can see all the major companies of the world and their corporate headquarters, the buildings are in the clouds. In the evening,choose a good viewing point around the harbour and witness the Laser Show from all these same buildings. Well worth the effort.
360 degree to see Hong Kong scene. I like the view from Kowloon to look out 360 degree, few building like it in Kowloon to see Kowloon West & East from this height. Gorgeous view.. don't miss it

The best view in the world (to me). Looking from Kowloon over Victoria harbour to Hong Kong Island day or night the sight of those tall very elegant and exciting buildings gives me great pleasure and never fails to excite me, a view I will always remember.If you haven't been then go, be like all the rest of us and fall in love, have yourself a mistress like I have done,

wow!. I've been lucky enough to see lotsof wonderful sights on my travels but this is right up there. You really have to be there to see it, feel it and share it with your friends, family or whoever you're with. The light show is great and the whole experience sums up this wonderful place that is Hong Kong.

Panoramic View. If you are in Hongkong, to visit this place is a must. What a fabulous view of hongkong. You should visit this place in the evening, so you can see the skyline in the day light and then in the night as well. It is worth seeing the view in night.
Amazing view. Our best experience of Hong kong was this wonderful skyline , simply amazing and nearly as good as Shanghai's
Breathtaking.. Has to be seen to be believed. The skyline at night just takes your breath away. It stretches forever.

Hong Kong Skyline. In my opinion, one of the best views in the world at night with a clear sky. Try sipping cocktails at in the lobby of the Intercontinental Hotel. There is nowhere better! If you are lucky enough to cach the laser light show normally at 8pm, it's worth the wait!

You have not seen HK without seeing the skyline!. Well, you won t miss it if you stay in Hong Kong, because you will see it automatically if you live in Kowloon. For those who do not live on the Kowloon side, the one metro stop across the bay is a must and see the skyline from this side. There are of course several ways to see this beautiful view:1.) From a restaurant/bar in a hotel on the Kowloon side (ex.The Peninsula, New World Millenium hotel, The Ritz Carlton Ozone skybar, Sky 101 etc.)2.) By walking on the "avenue of stars" during night time or daytime3.) Taking a boat ride We did both 1 and 2 and I would say you have to experience both to really see and enjoy the beauty of this Skyline. Out of all the Skylines I have seen, this is on my top 3 list by far!

WOW !!!!!. Wont write alot, but you really DO need to watch the night laser show, trip across to Kowloon take a seat and watch the show............................it FREE and worth the trip on Star Ferries across to Kowloon.You certainly wont miss it if you in the Area, best observation point is Mount Victoria, you just got to see it.........................ITS SPECTACULAR

Excellent ride. We used this while coming back from Big Buddha to airport. This is worth taking a ride. If you want to spend a little more money, you can try taking the ride in the glass floor cabin, i did not feel any difference as everything was visible from the normal cabin itself. Over-all don't miss the chance.
Best Thing in HK besides Disney. Other than Disney this is the best thing to do in HK. Make sure you stay for the light show as it is amazing as well.
WOW. This is hard to put to words ,as I think pictures are the only way you can describe this ,you really need to just go wow

Lives up to its reputation. yes it is supposed to be one of hong kongs main attraction and quite justfiably so. from both sides ( hong kong island and tsim sha tsui) the line up of the skyline is quite impressive and looks very glamorous in the evenings.
Great Attraction. Great view, great to walk around - a must see in HK to have an overall view of the City, the port and the infrastructure...

holiday vacation location in Hong kong. great location and plenty to see and do, more designer shops than you can imagine although nothing cheap anymore. plenty of sites to visit, Victoria Peak, Stanley market, Macau, try the Starr Ferry and tour buses show you all the highlights

Iconic Hong Kong Skyline. I'm a Hong Kong expat having lived here for over 20 years. I thoroughly recomend taking the 'Star Ferry' cruise in the evenings for the best vistas of the iconic Hong Kong skyline. The experience and views obtainable from the open sided ferry are excellent. A Star Ferry ride is iconic in itself,and beckons a bygone era. A must whilst in Hong Kong so why not pair the two experiences? I would recomend the night tour for the best views but the day vistas are nothing to be scoffed at either. I hope you enjoy your stay.
Spectacular. This is a skyline that isnt to be missed. Its worth making the trip up to Victoria Peak to see it in its full glory.

I'm a Native New Yorker but this is even better..... I couldn't believe the Hong Kong Skyline at nite. All the beautiful buildings and was blown away by the fact that every night there is the world's largest laser show across the skyline by all the prominent structures. I wish I were here for New Year's
Picturesque. Recommend taking the ferry to Kowloon to view the Hong Kong skyline at night. Great view of the city lights.

Spectaculor. It's probalby the best waterfront views around, adding in some lasers and flashing lights makes it even better. I'm not sure if they did anything different for new year but it was a great view. You can get a bar on the top of buildings. Next time I come to HK we'll do the view by river boat.
Decent. Pretty good. I found other major cities have better skylines. Also went when it was mostly foggy/hazy. Really cool rooftop views of the poorer parts of the cities though.

city of skyscrapers. The HK skyline is a sight to watch for its elegant, tall buildings. On a clear day, you can walk along the Victoria Harbour and marvel at the skyscrapers. The skyline is also a great view when seen from The Peak. Or you can take a boat ride. All are equally good. Except the Symphony of Light & Sound Show. it is overrated. avoid!

Brilliant Skyline. What attracts me most about Hong Kong is the impressive Skyline it has. I enjoyed the views from both the Avenue of the Stars and the Peak. Day time and Night Time views offer different experience!
smoggy. hong kong is a fantastic place, but at themoment you can't see he skyline due to the weather, disapointing, as you cant see anythng, dont waste your time going to the peak.

I expected more from the light show @ 8:00 PM. The Hong Kong skyline is very interesting thanks to the numerous skyscrapers that have been erected in recent years. I enjoy looking at beautiful buildings and I think that HK has a lot to offer from the architectural point of view.I was a bit disappointed at the light show because I was told that, in the past, has been truly spectacular,but what I saw was only an average display of light works.
when clear its spectacular. when clear it is spectacular. Saw it from the 18th floor restaurant at the Sheraton for the 8pm light show Good view from Walk of Stars if clear day
Hong Kong skyline. Brilliant. Exceeded our expectations. Watch the 'Symphony of Lights from the Kowloon side at 8pm.Look for the two financial buildings on each side of the harbour -ICC and IFC 1.

Hong Kong in a nut shell. do the entire hike up from Hatton road, around thebpeak, stop off for a beer at peak lookout cafe but don't eat there, then go up to high west to get a 360 view...Walk down to central and get yourself a well deserved meal at Mexican Burro or Vietnamese Bep
Hong Kong Skyline. Best at nighttime, beautiful, bright, and vibrant. Take the a ferry across from HK island to Kowloon.
Absolute must when in Kowloon. Well presented and easy access. Food and drinks available. The abilty to walk around and photo opportunities were perfect

impressive.... I suggest to avoid March cos most of the time is very foggy. Normally November and December are cool and dry with clear blue sky.....but these days, wind from the north also bring the smog from the Pearl River delta, so nothing can be guaranteed. Still, it is impressive , especially the sunset.

laser light show. I found the evening laser show to be a little disappointing. A bit of a non-event The boat trip within the harbour to enable the visitor to witness this supposed wonder event was ok, but the show simply didn't warrant the effort..

A very cool view. This is one of the best skylines I have ever seen. Maybe second behind only Shanghai. A jaw dropping accomplishment. Very easy to get to on Kownloon. Right at the bottom of Nathan Road near the star ferry terminal.

Beautiful sight at night!. The Hong Kong Skyline is a beautiful sight with its many architecturely diversified skyscrapers. There are several places to get an excellent view - from the Sky 100 building, from the many ferries crossing the harbour, from the harbour ferry tour, and from Victoria peak. The skyline is especially beautiful at night as most of the skyscrapers around the harbour are well lit with a variety of colours and scenes.The biggest disadvantage is that the city often has poor visibility due to the poor air quality.
Wow. Never fails to impress. If you take the train from the airport the HK island skyline is worth waiting for.

Not to be missed. If you are in Kowloon or high above Hong Kong island, or even in the North Point area, the skyline of the city is a sight impossible to forget. And I always get the impression that the night image is quite different from what you can see during the day.

A beautiful skyline. The HK skyline is stunning! The modern buildings coupled with a mixture of old and new HK gives the city a special feel. At 2000 - 2015 every night (weather permitting) - there is a light and music show. The views from Kowloon are better than those from HK island in my opinion. Its a relatively short show, but the music and lights are perfectly integrated. It does get quite busy when viewing from the Kowloon side - but it was worth it

Beautiful nightlights. The skyline is best seen from Kowloon peninsula as you get a good view over Hong-Kong. It is a nice display with a mixture of billboards and various displays. If in Hong Kong, it is worth having a look, although I would not go to Hong Kong specifically to see it.
Beautiful. The only place you can get the entire view is from the terrace of the Peak. It is beautiful and I still have it in my picture collections

Best skyline ever - unfortunately not so good sight when we were there. As other's write, the night view is the best. And the laser show 8pm is a must see. Unfortunately I have not seen it in myself in clear weather daytime, but according to pictures that is also awesome.
Beautiful skyline. Skyline is iconic part of Hong Kong.Go to Kowloons side and wath tha laser / lightshow at 8pm every night.
AMAZING VIEW. Spare some time during the evening especially for viewing the skyline. If possible do this from a place high up on the hills or from the top of a tall building.

Still the best skyline in the world!. Whether you are an avid photographer, a buzy businessman on a quick stopover in Hong Kong, or a couple on your honeymoon, no visit to Hong Kong is complete without a visit to the Kowloon side of Victoria Harbour, to see this amazing view!Go about half an hour before sunset for the best photo opportunity.

best view if no smogg. In my view Hong Kong has the best skyline I've seen in this world at any time of the day. just the laser show is highly overrated. if you happen to be here during Chinese New Year don't miss the fire works, they are spectacular! when there is smog, which is quite often in winter and spring time the view is gone...

Hard to beat this world class view. Whether by day, watching all the buzzing around... not just tourist, but the commercial aspect of commuting from one side to the other... or by night, when the lights, the laser shows, the music... oh my goodness, it is like sensory overload.
Don't miss this spectacular aspect of Hong Kong.

A Top Five Skyline of the world. You can debate the other four, with Sydney and New York surely making it to most lists. But for sheer, in your face, bravura, Hong Kong takes some beating.View it from street level on the Kowloon Waterfront from on high in the über cool Aqua Bar on Peking Strret. And if you're in time for the eight o'clock laser show, so much the better!
Xmas night on Hong Kong Harbour. Laser lights and a trip on Hong Kong Harbour on a colourful Chinese junk were trip highlights - great fun
Ok skyline. It was just ok , to much pollution . Shanghai is better ,,, must see the 8pm light show on every night ,

Light show and more. The Hong Kong island skyline from Kowloon is magnificent... A wide variety of building styles that border the harbour and are seemingly placed in and on the mountains. At night fall the buildings are lite and at 8:05 there is a laser and light show off many of the buildings.. The best view from the Kowloon island is from the walkway on the harbour anywhere from the Star Ferry clock tower down to the Intercontinental Hotel.... The view from the bar lobby is awesome too!!!!

Hong Kong skyline -a must!. Whilst you're there it's worth a visit especially at night time when you can see all the lights on the buildings. At 8pm -8.15pm every night there is a laser show its better seen from the mainland as all the lasers seem to be on the island. Another reason it's best at night is the smog tends to clear, unlike in the day, it's also a lovely stroll down the avenue of stars too.
On a clear day. Beautiful skyline in January even with the smog. Night view is awesome, the laser light show is way over rated.
Laser show. HK certainly has a fantastic skyline. In the evening they have a laser show which we watched from the restaurant of our hotel. I believe the show started around 8 pm.

Best skyline of the word!. Stunning skyline, day and night, and do not miss the sound of lights which can be viewed from the TST viewing deck towards the HK island skyline. Be there early if you want to have a decent place to take pictures. Also take a Star ferry for the 1 hour harbour cruise, best during the day to get a better impression of the skyline!

Kowloon Tsimshatsui sea front. To enjoy the harbor view and the spectacular city view and night light, do try the Tsimshatsui water front. Go further down to the Ave of Stars where Intercontinental Hotel is located. Buy icecream with the icecream van which usually will park in front of the cock tower outside the Star Ferry before you walk down to Ave of Star. The night view is fantastic when you walk back from Ave of Star to the Star Ferry. There is laser light show t 8pm every night and to watch from Kowloon Tsimshatsui is a better view. During Xmas or New Year, they will also add fire work from the roof of several buildings and it is very very beautiful.
The profile of HK. Awesome high rise but, as most of HK, the air pollution is a serious drawback to appreciating this unique place.
Highlight of our trip. It's pretty much the best part about Hong Kong and it's gorgeous :) If you go to the harbour at 8 PM every night, it lights up and it's a must see!

amazing views. The skyline is particularly impressive by night. Around 7 or 8 pm there is the festival of lights - a laser show viewed by many tourists each night and its definitely worth having a look.

Busy Busy Busy... but worth it. I think this was the most touristy thing I did on my trip to Asia, one of those moments where you feel you and a crowd of other people are being herded from one location to another. That being said, it is worth it, the train up to the skyline and the skyline view is worth it, there is no where else in the world that compares to the amount of skyscrapers Hong Kong has! If you head down the road once you are up there, you'll find almost the same view with around 100 less people
A drink high in the sky. A perfect place for an apéritif with a beautiful view to the Island.Prefer the day light for the view
