Blade Runner movie come to life.. Life at light speed, amazing, slightly mad, inspiring, intimidating, unique, add your own expletive and the sound track from the movie Blade Runner.
Play Misty for me. Sadly low cloud smog? and rain spoiled this experience but imagine that it is a powerful skyline on a clear day

Strolling along the skyline. A world renowned skyline...a must see view. usually crowded so be ready to take your panoramic shots... would've been nice to take night pics but just so many places to visit..an hour is sufficient...can visit the museums afterwards...Avenue of the stars was just that..an avenue..thank god for Bruce...

Love the Skyline!. It was very foggy the entire time we were in Hong Kong, but I still love the skyline. Didn't see the show this time around, but loved sitting on the Kowloon side and just staring at all the beautiful buildings.

3D light show. Show starts at 8:30 for the lunar new year on the waterfront ,but before this is a light show over Victoria harbor looking towards hong kong island which happens every night,after check out the many patios in the area for a cocktail enjoy
endless and higt. more skyscrapers than NYC, with significance. The guides will tell you what thought and consideration, including Fung Shui went into the construction of many.
Unbeatable!. get over to Kowloonside for 8pm for the laser show...perhaps it's gilding the lily, but is worth the trip

One of the best!. Wonderful views from Kowloon port (end of Nathan Road) and from the Peak Tram. I would recommend both. Ascend the tram just before dusk to see day and evening city scapes. Avoid queues by ascending early and having a drink before viewing.

Buildings and Buildings. The skyline is best visible from the Victoria Harbor during the Laser show that starts at 8:00pm; The view is breath-taking although the laser show isn't; some people also suggest to take the ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong during the 8:00PM ride to enjoy the Laser show on both sides of the river; but for the view of the skyline it's good enough from the victoria harbor. Best time to visit is during the evening post sun set.

A tribute to moden constuction. I was absolutely stunned when i saw all the different designs of buildings the owners allowing the individual architects to have freedom of expression is amazing not like many boring cities who demand cheap shoe box designs for higher revenue but are left half empty due to there blandness.Amazing Hong Kong well done.

No show like it!. The Hong Kong harbor has not competition when it comes to lighting,night light shows and overall breathtaking views. Some of the building have clever lighting adding to a spectacular and memorable experience.

Great Heights. The View of HK city by the night with its lit up Sky Scrapers and the reflection of it in the sea was an out of the world experience. Breath taking view of ships passing by and the people all over the place active and running after work. Nothing to match this experience. Simply Unique to HK.

Chase to be top 3 in world!!!. A very expansive vista from each side of the harbor. At night, there is a brilliant light show that emirates from numerous skyscrapers.Watching the boat traffic is mesmerizing.

Stunning Skyline. The architecture of modern HK skyscrapers defnitely make the skyline breathtaking and unique. Viewed from all angles: from the Kowloon side, from Victoria peak, from Victoria harbor on a ferry, the skyline is truly spectacular. Plus, the nightly laser light show is worth viewing.

One Ship wonder. We were on a cruise ship and the sail away or sail into, is a wonderful sight, especially at dusk. But we could not help but notice there is only one restored old junk ship with red sails, but it is pictured in every tourist brochure. And yes we took a picture as well. When sailing out the last set of slum houses is the other side of Hong Kong, a basic reality check as you sail into the night.

best view from the Upper House. The restaurant floor of the Upper House has an amazing view of the Hong Kong skyline. We also loved the vista from taking the tram above Hong Kong park and then walking back down.
Harbour view. Victoria harbour breathtaking at night when the lazer show is on and a place to people watch! Go on star ferry too.

so nice. go to one of the many roof-terrace bars in Hongkong central (try to get there before7-8.p.m., after that you will have to stand), maybe combine it with dinner so you're already seated when the sun is setting and enjoy the view.
SOO nice!

Best skyline of Asia. Hong Kong's skyline is by far the BEST skyline in Asia not only because there are so many tall commercial buildings along the harbour, these buildings are decked by lights and dotted with residential properties. The best place to see this either at the Peak (take the Peak Tram or No. 15 bus or No. 1 green minivan from Central or a taxi from anywhere) or along the boardwalk on Tsimshatsui or by the pier or outside Convention Center on Hong Kong side. I think the Hong Kong side is more spectacular (i.e. you have to be standing across the water on Kowloon Tsimshatsui side). There is light show daily at 8pm free of charge.Enjoy!!!
Hong Kong Skyline. Fantastic view at sunset from Kowloon terrace!Sitting there for half a hour at sunset, you will see Victoria island lighting up little by little!

Even if you don't intend to, you will pass By.. The Skyline is Beautiful. Specially on Clear days. The light show at 08:00 PM daily is not that spectacular, but the crowd and the Oohs! and that aahhs! around you will make you feel you are in a Magic Show. The Avenue of stars is also there, couple of statuses. Mostly tourists around. DON'T BUY FOOD THERE! EXPENSIVE! Get it on your way, or after you go (From Tsim Sha Tsui)

Impressive. The Hong Kong skyline is just tops, best viewed from the Avenue of the Stars on the Kowloon side. You can also view it from the Sky100 tower or go up to The Peak. There is a laser/light show a few times a week which is definitely something you got to see at least once during your visit in HKG.

Worth the walk. Worth viewing at night when it's lit up & worth checking out the bit where the 'stars' have put their hand prints. It'll fill an hour or two of your day with photo's and tourists getting in your way...

The city skyline is beautiful. A tip would be to do Victoria Peak at night so you could see it.It is also beautiful from the Avenue of stars view point. I thought the light show was pretty underwhelming but def worth a visit. We did go on the night the soundtrack was not in English so this didn't help.
A great view from The Peak. Whilst the Hong Kong Skyline is spectacular from almost any direction take a look at it from The Peak.

We liked it. Both sides of the Harbour are excellent, day and night. As our Hotel was in Tsim Sha Tsui and with Harbour view, we had the luck to see daily and nightly the panorama, from the Panorama Hotel.

Take a nice stroll and watch the Skyline. Don't expect to be fascinated but it's still very nice to take a stroll on the 'The Avenue of Stars' (on the Kowloon side) to get the best views.
On a clear day you can also go up to the peak and watch it from there.

Have a look. I have seen many sky lines in the world and the Hong Kong one has like all of them , its been ever evolving .
Every time I come to HK the skyline changes , thats what is interesting about it.

One of best ever. One of the best scenery ever, especially at night. Best seen from the Star Ferry going to or from Hong Kong Island or from floor 28 in the Peninsula hotel In Kowloon (a fancy restaurant and bar called Felix. Very expensive).
The lightshow is disappointing. The skyline of HK is just awesome but the lasershow is not worth the time, even it's for free. It takes place every evening at 7 o'clock.
Best Light Show. Light show every night. Get there around 8 to get a good seat. Take the ferry to Kowloon and I believe it stars at 10PM. Bring a good camera. its worth the wait

Taken by night. If you are a keen photographer, get your camera out at night. Views are spectacular. I would advise to take a room high up in a hotel just for the views. Relax with a drink next to your window looking over Hong Kong at night - a partner at your side helps!!
Spectacular. Honestly, the Hong Kong Skyline can give Manhattan a run for their money. It was magical to view this at night.

Always something different to see. We were lucky to see the skyline at Christmas - and boy was it a great show. The buildings all looked wonderful at night, and the view from our balcony was breathtaking.

Simply beautiful. The skyline both day and night is beautiful, from Kowloon to the peak both day and night. Seeing the light displays on the buildings is really unique to HK and the scale is beyond anything anywhere else.
Victoria Bay cruise at night. It was a fun 90 minute boat ride to watch the evening laser show. admission included unlimited beverages. It was great to see the side of buildings light up!
Amazing. The Hong Kong Skyline is one of my favorites. It is really impressive. All years the skyline change smoothly cause Hong Kong very fast. I love the change they are living in the flow.
breathtaking. its always breath taking. Hang out in a bar in TST and watch HK skyline at night makes the evening special

Besser gehts nicht. Ferry by day and night, you can do a lot by walking, the location of the 4Seasons is fantastic. Ferry pier is 19 min walk from the Hotel and the great ifc Mall is connected with the Hotel Complex. From the large Pools with Terasse and Bar you have a wonderful view over Victoria Harbour over to Kowloon and the new ICC Building
Hong Kong is Great. There is so much to see and do in Hong Kong. We have been about a dozen times now and it just gets better and better.
Best Skyline in the World.. The views from the Kowloon side or the star ferry are amazing. I was shocked at how cool the skyline was.
Beautiful city. The place is very peaceful and perfect over the twilight timing. Never forget to visit this place at Hong Kong.
Fantastic. Fantastic every thing you imagine and moreGo at 8pm for nighty light shows it just great great great great great
Super beautiful skyline the best I ever seen!. We went on a cruise to see the skyline at night. With good music, wine, cheese on a red Chinese sailboat. It was a beautiful experience!

best skyline in the world. I've been to Hong Kong on an annual basis since 2000, but the the skyline continues to overwhelm me - whether I look at it from the Peak , from the TST promenade or East Kowloon. Took my little daughter to the Peak with the Peak Tram on Xmas eve, and even she referred to it as 'incredible' - and she's used to HK too.
Beautiful. Amazing Sight. very beautiful view. so many tall buildings and sights to see. best view point is avenue of stars

Beautiful skyline. We viewed the Hong Kong skyline from many different places, at day and at night. It is simply spectacular. The views from Victoria peak are well worth the trip. We also viewed from the sky100 tower which was also amazing. You can have a lovely stroll down by the harbour to see the view and find your own favourite spot.Even our views from our hotel in Kowloon were fantastic. We particularly loved the views at night with all the billboards lit up. Great views from avenue of stars at night also. A truly amazing skyline.

HK by night- pick your nights. The tourist season in Hong Kong is up and down like a yo yo, and it clashes off and on with business trips l need to make regularly there. The Chinese New Year, Calendar New Year and other dates have fire works which add to the daily 8pm light show.Its good to get a meal with a view at that time, from Kowloon across the bay.Some days, l say, are better than others, and if you want, check out Youtube for some insight on previous dates and shows.To go around the bay by boat ( there are several) and see the sights on a hot evening is also very pleasant.

beautiful at night. It is a beautiful walk along the harbor in Kowloon to look at the Hong Kong skyline. The sampams are beautiful.. We did take a night boat that showed all the buildings with a light show. Lots to see on the waterfront, like statues to honor famous stars. Also gets you to the ferry terminal to macau and the various museums.

Wow, doubleWow! . Came here last April for a day out from Guangzhou, and I made myself the promise to come back. I spent New Year's Eve and fulfilled my promise. This IS the most spectacular skyline I have seen, and I have seen quite a few. I've seen it from both sides of the harbor, from the hills, from the peak, from a ferry, from a high rise, and from Ave. of the Stars. Early morning, noon, evening and night during the show and late when the night ate it almost all up. Go to Hong Kong even if it is only to see this, the most magnificent of the world's skylines.

Fantastic view from tim sha sui. The skyline is beautiful probably like the other skylines of the world but the view that you get from Tim shai sui promenade is fantastic. Both in the morning and evening during the symphony of lights the view and the breeze is just awesome.

Absolutely Magnificent. The Hong Kong skyline at night is magical. The lights across the waterfront are beautiful. It is definitely amongst the best in the world. Having a hotel room with a lovely view of the harbour so you can enjoy the sight each night is a must. It is just a pity this beauty is not reflected during the day when the smog sets in.

..breathtaking views. The view from the Skyline it's simply breathtaking! We also booked Aqua reastaurant at the 29 floor to enjoy the experience on a different level. The view from the Kowloon mainland side will make you spaechless.

Best view in the world. The skyline in Hong Kong is one of the best in the world. The buildings on HK Island are lit up with different colors and its quite a view. At around 8pm there is a light show which is nice.

Amongst the best in the world. People rave about the New York skyline, rightly so; the Tokyo skyline, rightly so; the London skyline, rightly so. And the Skyline of Hong Kong Island waterfront from Kowloon is breathtaking. The buildings reflected in the water make for a magical scene, make sure you book a hotel with a good harbour view.

Fantastic skyline, but the light show in the evening was disappointing. Amazing skyline to see, day or night. We specifically went just before 8pm for the light show with the skyline, and it was a disappointment. Just not much to it. See the skyline but don't force the light show in the schedule it is nothing special to see.

Amazing views by night !. I like it at night, the views amazing and for me it.s better than NY,because some people talk about it. I think even the Skyline in Shanghai beats NY. Anyway, back to HK, yeah its amazing and around 7 45 or 8 pm , the Laser show starts, I always miss it , but ... next time :-)
Wow. Great ambiance and comfort. Exceptional service.Friendly environment. delicious drinks and big variety on menu
Amazing views. It was just as we thought it would be but so much better. Beautiful at night, especially from the Star Ferry.

Wow! No photo can prepare you for this.. I approached by water, as I was staying on Lantau Island near the airport. It is like Sydney on steroids, from the distance, across the water, it looks fantastic but as you get closer the sheer size of it is overwhelming. It is impossible to stop taking photos!
Wonderful Hong Kong. Love everything about this view, the atmosphere anywhere you go is divine. Wish I could return every year.

The Peak Tram. Unless you enjoy standing in line for 45 minutes to get your ticket to the peak tram (notwithstanding your purchase of the octopus card) I would certainly give it a pass and take the bus up the hill. You not only get the ever-nicer view as you ascend, but also get to see where the people who live in those fancy buildings patiently sit while waiting for the local bus.We made the mistake of waiting in line for the tram and were under-whelmed by the actual ride up. The views were limited because of the trees and foliage that has grown in along the way; not to mention that the ride's steepness seems to present the City on its side. Give it a pass and certainly ride the bus down again for an even better perspective.
Pretty Amazing. These towers are packed in tightly, and the architecture is actually quite pleasing, using variety and class without displaying an awkwardness or gaudiness in putting a lid on tops.

Worth a short visit. World class skyline, worth paying a visit to sight the magnificent sky high buildings and towers adorned with pretty little lights. For the first ten minutes the 8pm Light and Sound Show could be called fun but otherwise repetitive and lackluster. Easy walk from central Tsim Sha Tsui.

Magnificent Views of Hong Kong and Harbor. Love the varied high quality cuisine choices the most, shopping was second, and cultural attractions next. What's not to like about Kowloon? Not sure. Maybe that we didn't allocate enough time to enjoy.
Show at night. Around 8 pm, they have this musical/light show on both sides of the harbour. It's for free and pretty nice view!

As seen from Kowloon. Very happy to have stayed on Kowloon side to enjoy the Hong Kong side as our nightly view. There are several harbor cruises available, but due to the choppiness of the harbor, better shots are obtained from land. It was worth the extra for a room with a view. 8pm Light and Sound Show is fun. Enjoyed strolling along the harbor from the Star Ferry up to East Tsim Sai Tsui.
always growing. The cool thing about the skyline is that it is always growing. The nightly laser show is fun to watch.

Stunning!. Of course, it depends on the weather, and how clear the air is. But the view is lovely, and the walk along the water is nice in itself. Be sure to include a trip on the ferry for another perspective on the skyline.
Hong Kong Skyline At Night. For a fantastic view of the Hong Kong Skyline at night, go to the Oyster and Wine Bar at the top of the Sheraton Hotel in Kowloon.

Amazing Skyline. HK has one of he best skylins we have seen. We saw in the daytime, but at night is when it comes to life. We saw the lightshow (which is nothing special) but we were there as the sun went down and it is great to see the transition from daytime to night.Great to take pictures!
Known around the world!. It is one of the best. We viewed it from top of Conrad Hotel and also on return from Macao on Jet boat at night during light show. Very nice.

Er. If you too live in a city with skyscrapers, and have seen other lazer shows, prepare to be disappointed...we were walking the front anyway, so weren't out of our way, but it would have been a major letdown if we were. I mean, its a load of buildings, they light them up in a semi co-ordinated show.We'll be waiting in line to look at the boats on the water next. Oh wait...

Like no other. If you can get it on a clear day, the skyline viewed from Tsim Sha Tsui side is well worth a visit. Take a cheap ferry ride across to Hong Kong Island while you are at it and soak it in for a few extra minutes on the short ferry crossing.

Great to see the development. Great to see the well done skyline from Victoria harbor, peak tram and sky terrace. Walk from Central station to peak tram is great with lot of commercial building on the way.

Fantastic. By day or night, hingkong skyline is fantastic.
Don't miss the light show..The Symphony of Lights from the Tsim Sha Tsui promande at 8:00pm every night.
You can also catch a great view of the skyline from the peak.

Amazing. Making your way down to the harbour was easy from where we were staying. The subway works very well. The skyline is amazing. Be sure to stay for the evening laser show...you wont be disappointed.

Hong Kong is breathtaking so much to do.. The underground trains were so advanced compared to London.
They were easy and quick to get around also very cheap the taxis were cheap compared to London as well.
Great view. One of the best skylines I ever saw. It is worth seeing it by day and also by night. You must also have a camera, because the photos of the skyline are fantastic.

Don't miss this if you visit Hong Kong. The Hong Kong skyline is easy to enjoy, form shore or from the water. they have a laser spectacle that involve several buildings in both side of the harbor, They have installed some bench on the shore for people to enjoy the show. They also has a sound system to explain the scenes, they even have the translations in several languages on a FM radio.

Hong Kong Skyline. By day or night the Hong Kong Skyline is fantastic. If you view the skyline from the Peak or Victoria Harbour you have a first class view of a sensational skyline. At Night the lights are also a delight and a must have photo.

Too bad you can hardly see it because of air pollution!. Hong Kong is such a vibrant exciting place and part of that is its harbor skyline. At night the buildings on both side of the harbor light up in colorful displays and coupled with the cruise ship lights and constant boat traffic it is pretty exciting. Between eight and nine some of these building lights go into overdrive changing and swirling and just being magical. The problem is the air pollution is so bad in Hong Kong now that on a five day visit this January, three of those days were pretty bad, sickening in fact. One day was so bad I didn't want to leave my hotel room. But Hong Kong is still amazing and the night time skyline is something to behold. Can't say if you should wait until China starts cleaning up its air or you should see it now before it gets worse. It would be five stars without the air pollution.
Breathtaking view. Hongkong skyline is wonderful both in the daytime and night with all lit around.All skyscrapers around and beautiful mountains range.

Amazing skyscrapers. Loved the laser show at 8pm each night. We were amazed by all the different styles of buildings, old next to new. Imaginative designs. Loved walking along harbour at Kowloon, always something exciting to see.
Stunning. So glad we went. the day we went it was a big foggy/hazey but still quite pretty. would be lovely in clearer weather

View from Kowloon is spectacular!. The Hong Kong skyline is spectacular day and night. Take the Star Ferry from Central and enjoy the view from Kowloon, overlooking Victoria Harbor. There is a light/music "show" at night, but I don't think it's worth the bother.

Amazing view.. The lights play on the ICC was simple breathtaking. We had the good change to see the skyline from the victoria peak as well as from a cruise in the harbour. We loved every second of it.!

Light show is very disappointing. Light show is disappointing and over rated.
Space and art museum looks dated and in need of overhaul.
Traffic pedastrian crossing is dangerous as only 1st half of the crossing is lighted up at any one point of time.

HK Skyline. This is an attraction in HK. It may not be very impressive for people who come from big cities. But it's worth your while if you come from a small city. They have a light and sound show too (if you're into that kinda thing). They are offered in cantonese and English. So be sure you go for the one on English!

Great view than any other asian countries. I stayed with a apartment where there was an amazing view of harbour along with the Honk Kong Skyline. An awesome view in the evening by the harbour of the Hong Kong Skyline.
Always intersting to see the light show at night. An iconic view and the light show with music is very enjoyable. Don't miss it.Get there early to secure a good position.
Amazing!. All the buildings were decorated in Christmas lights, awesome. It was the hightlight of the 3 day stay!

Awesome. I don't usually use the word awesome, but I was full of awe at the Hong Kong skyline during our recent visit and we enjoyed it from many perspectives , from our hotel In Wan chai on HK Island, from Kowloon at the Port from the deck of our cruise ship and from the high point of Lan tau Island.The sheer quantity and scale of the buildings is something to behold and even though I am a nature lover there is another type of 'concrete beauty' in the shapes of the towering buildings against a clear Hong Kong sunrise and sunset.
beautiful views. Beautiful views especially from Victoria Peak and from any of the ferries. Also from the promenadeCan be windy
One of the most beautiful in the world. The skyline is unique because of the water between HK island and Kowloon you actually have two distinct skylines. Very beautiful.
pleasant view. Suggest that you take the ferry from hong Kong island to Kowloon (Starr /MTR ferry) to get great photos of the skyline.

Take the Peal Tram. We were lucky and caught the Peak Tram up to The Peak. Get there early before queues form. The walk around Luggard Road was spectacular as we had panoramic views of the city, outer islands etc. Well worth the effort.
Stunning. Especially fantastic from the top of the Mountain and/or at 8pm each night when there's a light show on the river. View it from the Kowloon side.

Symphony of lights - not to be missed!. It is definitely worth making your way down to Victoria Harbour to watch the symphony of lights -a light show reaching across the bay all co-ordinated to music, with lasers and lights of the skyscrapers creating a spectacle that one will always remember as unique to Hong Kong. The technicalities of putting on this show boggle the mind. The show I have heard, costs around HK$44 million per year. Stands are available for visitors to watch the show in comfort on Victoria Harbour waterfront but the ideal place to watch is on a harbour cruise. The best thing it happens every night and it is free - if you watch from the shore.

Can be Spectacular but First You Need to See it. Hong Kong's around Hong Kong Island is truly amazing. However, first you need to be able to see it and this can be the challenge. Pollution levels are regularly quite high and increasingly the view of the skyline is blocked by the pollution. A wonderful feature of Hong Kong can suffer from the obscured view. Going to the Peak was once a great experience in the evening to look down on Victoria Harbour and the myriad of skyscrapers. Sadly, increasingly this view is obscured by the heavy mist hanging in the air. Most, if not all of the air pollution, D.rifts down from Mainland China.
Nice but Overrated . Just really lots of lights on buildings, a bit of music and laser works. I was expecting a fantastic show but was really let down.
Amazing. it doesn't matter how many times you come, it's always impressive, I don't think you can see such skyline anywhere in the world

Best in the World. It's just a matter of where you want to see the Skyline from - of the two tourist places - the Peak and Tsim Sha Tsui promenade, the TST promenade has the iconic view and is much cheaper (it's free). Don't wait around for the light and music show.For a different view, search for rooftop restaurants and bars.
amazing light shows. just drive through the city and there is magical lighting at night on all the buildings especially the ones near the river

Best skyline of the world!. Or at least that's what CNN calls it... and I think they are not that far off! Watch from the Star Ferry and TST. The show a night is nothing to write home about, but worth seeing if you are in the neighborhood. Watch it from the Avenue of the Stars
Take the Star ferry. From Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon to Wanchai day or night for an amazing view of this ever changing skyline. Dramatic, awe-inspiring cityscape
Skyline. Very impressive. Better than the pictures I have seen before travelling. The view looking from the Harbour over to Hong Kong Island is amazing at night!

Icon view. There are some skylines which are must see's and the Hong Kong Skyline is one is them. It has everything from history to modern buildings. Besides the busy waters in front of you the view is spectacular. It is a must and it will not disappoint you.

The best!!!. Spent one hour here and it was ao relaxing and comfortable. See the best skyline in the world under the splendid lights were so exiting for us. Just visiting this place and see the romantic sunset and then dancing lights
a bunch of buildings. I'm pretty sure they didn't build all this stuff just to impress tourists. But it is pretty cool, especially at night.

Fab night- skyline of Victoria Harbour! . Great for a photography trip in the Kowloon side of harbour ! There were great spots for us to take photos and also sheltered benches where we could seat and take a break. There were families and couples and all ages there. A friendly atmosphere! There were newsagent nearby where you can buy bottle waters and snack etc. Bring a good camera plus wear a jacket to keep you warm, can get a bit cold at night. Don't forget to check weather forecast because when it gets misty, there is not much worth to see!
Excellent. Loved the view from The Peak and the Harbour, especially at night. We loved the walk around the harbour
The perfect juxtopositions. To see an ancient temple right up against sky rises directly in front of lush mountain ranges is pretty special and unique.
Loved it. Hong Kong sky line is just awesomeA deco must see... and they are still building more...Will deco go back with the kids one day...Its just an amazing place

Best Skyline. Having been to a lot of places around the world, the Hong Kong Skyline is the best modern sky scraper skyline in the World. The split between the Kowloon and HK Island side with the Victoria Harbor is amazing. While both perspectives are nice, our preference would be observing the view of HK Island from the Kowloon side. The Intercontinental and the Ritz-Carlton are both amazing places to experience the sights. Now with all this said, the “Symphony of Lights Show” is the biggest farce that exists. The show is at 8PM all that happens is some green laser lights turn on then off. It is NOT a valid claim at a light show. I will say the entire sky line from sunset to sunrise is an amazing light show. DON’T make any special plans for the 8PM light show.

picture perfect. Beauitful and awesome. Never have seen such a huge city skyline as it seems to go for miles! Nice platform to view the skyline from and you most definately want to go up there on a some what of a clear day. Hard to do with all the city haze and smog though. Heard to best time to go is after a good rain. They say it clears the air.
Brilliant. View from the Harbour Grand Club lounge is excellent. The rooms have a great view as well. Would love to watch fireworks from there.
stunning. I could look at the Hong Kong skyline all day or all night! Really great vantage point from Tsim Sha Tsui promenade

WOW - the best cityscape I have ever seen!. One evening we walked down to the promenade in Kowloon near to the Space Museum. It was about 8:00 pm, had just got dark and the skyline there is amazing. We just sat and gazed for about 45 minutes. This is quite incredible, the signs, lighting and layout of the city on HK Island gives the most indescribable backdrop. It is free, its a walk so its good for you....get out there and do it, you won't be disappointed. Enjoy!
Breathtaking. Amazing views from Kowloon across the water. Stunning seeing the lights and hustle and bustle of life in the city.
Really lovely view. Hong Kong skyline is iconic and has to be seen to be appreciated.There are so many skyscrapers.This is truly a financial hub.

Magical Skyline. The first time I went to Hong Kong it was still under Bristish rule and even then the skyline was evolving but as I kept going in and out of Hong Kong the massive building became amazing night lights that really made Hong Kong skyline just dazzle .

Symphony of Lights. Laser show on waterfront at 8pM quite different than anything we had seen before. Avenue of Stars is right there and also seating to watch the show, but need to be there 30 min early to get a seat
View at the top. Do it, go up the lookout on the Tram. Fantastic views, could have spent an hour or two there but was on a tour so the visit was brief.
One of the best!. Watch it during the day or at night! From shore or from the deck of a boat !! It is awesome!A short sruise coinciding with the light show would be ideal !

Avenue of the Stars. It must be visited at least twice: once during the day and once during the night. There's a daily music and lights show from 8 to 8:20pm. The best view is seen from the Avenue of the Stars at Tsim Sha Tsui metro station, East exit.

Amazing Skyline. I visited Hong Kong in October during a business trip. The best view of Hong Kong Skyline is from Kowloon. A local person recommended me to go to the top floor of the car park (outside car park) of the big mall in Kowloon (I do not remember the name but it is the big shopping mall just as you get off the ferry). From there, you are higher and can enjoy amazing views of Hong Kong. I would also recommend to check Hong Kong Skyline at night where all the buildings come alive with all the lights display. I believe that at 8pm every night, they have a lights show on.Hong Kong Skyline is also very nice from the Peak - from there you can see Hong Kong from the mountains and Kowloon. Definitely worth the trip!

Lights...... People complain about the light show? Why bother, the skyline itself is mesmerising!, nothing can compete with what already is... Amazing views from the top of the ICC BUILDING, AMONGST THE TALLEST IN THE WORLD.
Breathtaking. Everywhere you look could be a postcard!! take a selfie stick well worth it as there are loads of photo opportunities
Good. Good way to step back and actually see Hong Kong away from the hustle. Go at night, its quite nice.We are lucky we have local friends in Hong Kong and they showed us around, good times.

Great Photo location for skyline view of Hong Kong. The Hop-on-Hop-off bus included a ticket to the Hong Kong Skyline. It is a funicular railway that takes you to a top of a mountain with spectacular 360 degree of Hong Kong and surrounding area. The angle that this railway takes up the mountain is amazing,Once at the top of the mountain you arrive in a plaza of shops and restaurants. There is plenty to see and multiple stores to shop at. You go up several escalators to arrive at the viewing deck. It can be windy up there, bring a warm jacket.The views are wonderful, plenty of opportunity to take photos. The only problem I had was finding how to find the way down, either I missed the sign or they need to make it bigger.The staff were friendly and it was well organized. I enjoyed my trip to the Hong Kong Skyline and would recommend you spend a couple hours in the area.

Go up Victoria Peak. Go across to Hong Kong itself and up Victoria Peak at night for a breathtaking view of the harbor and skyscrapers of Hong Kong and Kowloon lit as you will see in few other parts of the world.
Catch the Victoria Harbor light show at 8 pm. Hong Kong Skyline is best viewed at night from the Kowloon side near the water. Also at the Hong Kong Garden towards Central

Unique. Hong Kong skyline is a unique experience that I haven't seen anywhere and if it says something is about how Hong Kong is different from any other part of the world. the music and the lights is a unique light show where all people gather to see at 8 o'clock.

Amazing. The skyline of HK is amazing. We were disappointed with the light show. Every night the buildings light up and depending where you are you will see different things on the harbour and on the buildings to see. We went down to the Avenue of Stars on New Years Eve and the fireworks were fantastic! Don't miss it if you are ever there at this time.

Absolutely stunning. Well worth a visit - and it's free! Just drop by the Avenue of Stars in Tsim Sha Tsui on Kowloon Peninsula, and you'll get to enjoy the lovely view. At 8 pm they show a wonderful Symphony of Lights show which is a must see (I recommend to watch it from the observation deck behind the clock tower). If you want to get a fuller view during the Symphony, get a trip on the traditional Chinese junk boat with red sails - they'll give you a warm blanket and a free drink! The trip is pricey, though, and it can be really crowded on holidays and the weekends. The junk takes off at 19:30 from the Kowloon pier 1 and at 19:45 from a pier at the Hong Kong island.

Spectacular view!. My first time in Hong Kong (stayed in Mong Kok) and my goal was to see the beautiful skyline. I caught the subway to Tsim Sha Tsui and walked to the avenue of the stars. I arrived around 530 and was told that the light Show didn't begin until 8 pm. Lucky for me it was November and as the night was creeping in the city began to light up! I wasn't able to stay until 8pm but the view was still spectacular! Definitely will be returning for another look and this time staying for the "show"!
wonderful view at night. with all the huge buildings lights. The light show itself is quite disappoining. we expected a lot more

One of the man-made wonders of the world. This is great view day or night. I wouldn't waste the time on the supposed light show, I have seen it twice now, and its very underwhelming. Wander down at night to take some pictures of the building lights, and activity on the harbour.
Must see. Hong Kongs sky line is amazing enough during the day, at night it is second to none. A must see when your there!

A view you can see for hours!. Both sides, Hong Kong Island and Tsim Sha Tsui, has an amazing view of the skyline. The light show every day at 8 pm from the avenue of stars and Star Ferry is a treat to watch. You should be lucky to watch it while sitting... there are lot of viewing decks across the city... choose the one you like...
Really nice. Its beautiful but you do not have to take any river cruise for that. You should get hold of a vantage point on the 1st floor near the ticket counter.

Awesome. You have got to experience the light show it is brilliant, I have watched the Laser Show from the Sky Lounge at the Sheraton and on the promenade, both are good. The show of lights is good and you can have a nice stroll along the promenade also get the noodles off the street venders it is very good.

Best Skyline. Whether you are viewing this skyline from Victoria Harbour, walking along the waterfront from from the top of the peak - it is amazing.The high number of skyscrapers and the effort that goes into decorating these skyscrapers - esp during special occasions such as Christmas - makes this skyline the best that I have seen (so far) in my travels.
phenomenal. This is magnificent.Go to the Kowloon waterfront around sunset and look across at the extraordinary skyline of Hong Kong Island.

Must see!. Definitely a must go when your visiting HK. Doesn't cost a cent!There is a light show at around 8:00pm every night. A Perfect place for some good photos and its not too packed as the strip is very long. The breeze and freshness makes it a good place to hang out with a group or partner. We walked here from Tsim Tsa Tsui station.
Breath taking. one of the most fantastic cityscapes in the world. I would recommend a trip on the star ferry by daylight and by night for the best photo's

Great Syline, Expecially at Night. This is one of the worlds nicest cities, especially at night. A walk along the shoreline is suggested. Try the street food too.Best time to visit is in the winter months.December was perfect.

Unfortunately smoggy on our trip. Give the light show a miss, maybe it was because it was not a clear night.. The skyline had it not been so smoggy would have been incredible. It's amazing to catch the star ferries, especially at night. It's a very busy stretch of water and fascinating to just sit and watch it all go by.

The beauty of New Year's Eve from Hong Kong harbor. We were on an Azamara cruise that anchored in the harbor for the New Year's eve lights and fireworks. We slowly sailed out of the harbor as the fireworks blazed above the brilliant colors of the skyline. What an amazing sight!
MUST MUST MUST. try to arrive at evning time, before sun set.from the tram trip to the view... its a big fun atraction

Great skyline. Take the star ferry across for 20p/30c if you are on Hong island from Wan Chai, if not go to east tsim sha tsui and you will be on the avenue of stars which offers the best views of Hong Kong islands skyline. The reason is it not a 5 for me is because i have been to NYC and Waikiki which bettered this Skyline. Beautiful all the same. Hope the directions help you guys :) have a great holiday!
amazing city views not to be missed. get out on the water and onto the rooftop bars - amazing city views not to be missed. Star ferry is a must do

Amazing skyline.. Everywhere!. It's captivating and simply remarkable! The skyline of HK is amazing and I spent a few cold hours driving around on the rickshaw hop on hop off double decker to keep gazing at it!
You won't see anything like it elsewhere. Such an amazing skyline and one that has changed from 5 years ago when we were last here . The view from the Peak is just awesome

Fantastic. Unbelieveable, and on the up and up. Plenty see. Go to So Ho if you like quirky. The new renovated police station which is now an artisan shopping centre is fantastic. There are plenty of little bars shops etc. Just travel on the travelevator and get of at SoHo then wander. Cocktails cheaper than wine and same as water so enjoy.

Great skyline!. The skyline is without doubt the most visited attraction in HK. One can't see the city without actually you know... seeing the city!The best time to go is during sunset, you can see it during the day, the golden glow and then finally the night in one visit. The light-show is pretty cool, but very repetitive and not as exciting or glamorous as one may be led to believe.We went with a HK friend of ours and she said the light show is getting worse, some lights are no longer operational due to cost, etc.Non the less, a definite must-do!
Light at Night on Hong Kong Island. The best view is at a clear night to watch from the peak. unfortunately, many nights are not due to haze and fog.
City Skyline. One of the spot for taking a good photos, with the iconic view of the Hong Kong's tall building as a background.
Fantastic skyline. It is a must in Hong Kong. I think the best view is across from the Star Ferry pier and then the Avenue of the Stars. The light show is also worth the visit

Never fails to take my breath away. Hong Kong is a frenetic place full of stark contrasts: the religious and the pure greed of capitalism, the traditional and the modern, Chinese and English, but most striking is the contrast of very rich and very poor. The night skyline somehow hides the grime and poverty of many cities however (not least the nearby Macau), but I know of few cities that can match the beauty and majesty of the view of Victoria Bay. Do check out Hutong restaurant. A great place to see the 8pm light show (not the most impressive light show on earth, but to have all the major buildings synchronising green lasers is still pretty).Taking a trip across by ferry at night is also a "must do".Even sitting on by the ferry terminal looking north towards Kowloon is pretty impressive. There is a pleasant outside bar just by the terminal. Go and get a drink and sit outside on the steps by terminal 3.

Amazing view!. We took an evening cruise (with free drinks), then a delicious meal and ended up with a short drive towards Victoria peak to get the views across the bay. Brilliant evening tour and we gots some incredible photos. Trip booked with splendid tours

Never tire of the view. We were lucky enough to have a harbour view room at the Shangri La hotel in TsIm Sha Tsui and the Hong Kong skyline view is spectacular and changes from day to night. I have never seen so many high rise buildings in such a condensed space with a busy harbour with a variety of boats passing all day. Fantastic.

Brilliantly luminated. It is a nice experience to get there and view the lighting musical. Plenty of tourist come early to pick a good spot to view the light show at night. It is located next to the Harbour view area. I believe the best time shall be 6.30 - 7.00pm to reserve your spot. The view is breath-taking, complemented by a musical synchronisation with the light works. Only last about 30 minutes, I think. But the lightings on the buildings in HK across the bay stay illuminated for a lengthy hours till late night daily.

Find the right location and enjoy the view. This is a scene that is always impressive. You can get a great night view from the promenade or one of the restaurants perched in various hotels and office towers.The view from the Kowloon side over the harbour and back to Hong Kong Island is great. All the buildings are lit up, and there is usually a light show at some stage in the evening. It can be hazy at some times, but generally you will have an impressive view to enjoy year round.Book a table at Aqua (window table) and savour the view over a drink or great meal.

Brilliant. A feast for your eyes.
Some days were a little smoggy otherwise a great sight.
Great night and day.m

Stunning skyline with overrated light show.. I viewed the central skyline from the "Avenue of stars" in Kowloon. Whilst the luminated buildings were impressive, the light show didn't turn out to be as great as I'd heard. Several buildings were covered in various colours that changed in time with the electronic music that accompanied the lights. Green laser beams shot out from the tops of other buildings.The light show starts at 8pm and runs for approximately 15 minutes. Arrive early to get a good position along the riverbank and rug up - the wind was chilly in January! Recommended for families and those curious enough to see it for themselves.
best view from Tsim Sha Tsui promenade. every day at 8pm,there will be Symphony of Light show that combines the music,lights and the famous hong kong skyline in the background.

Brilliant and Huge. You can't get away from this skyline which gives plenty of photo opportunities from many angle. A trip out on a star ferry/harbour cruise really lets you see it. Then of course there is the evening where it lights up and becomes really spectacular whether viewed from the water, from behind the massive glass at the Intercontinental Hotel, or at the top of the peak.
Rivals New York. Victoria Peak on a clear day is almost as a spectacular view as it is from Rockefeller in NYC. The view of the city from a cruise or Avenue of the stars at night is a must see.
A lifetime Experience.. Just kept on watching and watching......From the Avenue of Stars, from the peak, from the sky100 observation deck, from anywhere, it is just mind blowing.
Hong Kong. The skyline is beautiful especially at night across the water. It was very interesting how some of the building very lit for the holidays
MUST SEE. This is a must see. Amazing view especially if you enjoy taking photos. Such a great view such a great place to take pictures.

Hong Kong - Photographers Dream Location. Stunning Skyline..... a little misty in January but still impressive. Use the Cheap and frequent Star ferry to cross the Victoria Harbour. Many great photo opprtunities.

Picturesque. It's a beautiful sight. You know when you watch asian action movies and there's a beautiful backdrop in it and you'll think to yourself "wow". That feeling would be doubled when you it in the flesh. Although there's so much people here which could be a hassle, it's a given thing. It adds to the modern oriental charm it has. You'd wanna take a picture of it and put it straight on your facebook cover! lol! There are other skyline that could be better than this but HK skyline sure has it's own feel.

the best. stayed here with thousands of other people during new year night the best ever , nice calm and friendly people , nice fireworks, no drinking , no drugs , no partying , just calm nice people having a good time, with people from all walks off life....

Peninsular Hotel Hong Kong. Brilliant, it gets better every year. Had lunch on New Years Eve and the presentation of the foyer, restaurant & whole area was amazing. String quartet playing in the foyer, lots of visitors amazed at the ambiance. The bud lighting was lovely and it really was a Christmas wonderland. Table service as fabulous as ever. Yes, it is a bit pricey but once or twice a year it is worth it just for the service and the presentation on the plates.

high in the sky....jump off the top and other fun. Great view of the city from the top of this needle in the sky..you can pay to jump off of it ...all harnessed up as you may imagine. Great for the whole family
evening light show fun. The skyline is striking but, even better, many restaurants along the shore have great views of the light show at around 8. Tend to be more pricey though.
Beautiful but only at night. Because of the air pollution in HK the view really isn't nice in the daytime. But at night, it's fantastic. Better to go at night.
Brilliant!!!!. Just awesome.A visit to HK is worth just to see the skyline.And Tsim Sha Tsui is the best place for viewing the skyline

Nothing like it!!!. If you thing NY has a nice skyline, you havn´t seen nothing yet. Looking out from the harbourwalk towards Hong Kong island at night will make you feel like you are in a future world, nothing like it on the planet.

Laser light show shouldn't be missed.. Ate dinner at a restaurant on the Kowloon side that overlooked the Harbor and provided a panoramic view of the Laser light show. Very romantic and a nice visual display.
Woohoo!. I came to HongKong 30 years ago and thought the skyline was amazing then. I can tell you it's even more impressive now!
Beautiful. Excellent and beautiful. Its lit up so well. And the buildings had christmas theme lights when we visited. Terrific.

Just about Alright!. It doesn't require much time that's it's only plus. It's just another skyline if you are going to hongkong just walk by it that is all it's require . Majorly overrated bu then these kind of views don't impress me that much. To each his own!

Just impressive with a great light show in the evening. The Skyline of the city is definitely something special with the water in front, then a line of skyscrapers and then the mountains. There is a great laser light and music show which is a must if you visit Hong Kong for the first time.

Skyscraper heaven. Don't bother with light show just go see the skyline at night with the buildings. We were there post Xmas so very spoiled. Make sure you check out Penninsula hotel at the entrance to the show. This is the best location to watch

One of the best nightview spot in the world. One of the 3 best nightview in the world. I like how the lights of building changes, the light of ships, and good foods/people along the riverbank. Definitely one of the best nightview I shot ever.

Fantastic Laser show. During December, you can watch the nightly laser show from different business towers in the Hong Kong side. Just walk along the Star Walks in the Kowloon side and enjoy the fantastic laser show.

Worth a visit. HK skyline is a pretty view from any place you choose to view it from. Specially in the evening, when the reflection of multi-colored lights from the skyscrapers dance in the sea, you get an amazing view while walking on the promenade. If you are in the Kowloon area, you can take a bus or an MTR to Tsim Sha Tsui and walk to the Avenue of stars to take an evening stroll. A walk around the esplanade towards ferries will give you ample time and angles to see the skyline on the other side of the Victoria harbor
manhattan of the east. The hong kong night time skyline from Kowloon is fabulous and the light show at 8 every night is a great bonus, well worth taking in
Amazing. Some people call it the best skyline in the world... they are right. Strongly recommend to visit by end of day, to enjoy the night view.
Beautiful and busy. The skyline is second to none for views, however, the crowds are a bit overwhelming. I would definitely go early to avoid the crowds and get the best pics!

Best from a ferry. Multiple ferries zip around the harbor; use your Octopus Pass to ride any of them for wonderful views of the HK skyline. Travel to Lamma Island for a taste of HK without traffic, peaceful and interesting with good hikes. View Hong Kong skyline there and back.
Dazzling interesting site always different!. Love the Hong Kong skyline from both sides and also from the water!! Just so amazing and always different morning noon and night. Magic!
Christmas in Hong Kong. The view of the Harbor from the Intercontinental Bar is a must do for a cocktail. The xmas decor enlivened and already beautiful skyline.

skyscrapers jam. we went there for dec- jan two weeks holiday. Watched fireworks over Tsiam Sui sha Pomonade also looked at the sky line the Sky 100 and Sky terrace 428 at the peak. It is like mini New York where all the high rise buildings very close to each other creating unique sky line for Hong Kong . In the evening once all lit up it is worth a view. The laser show is not much of a much.
Breathtaking. Wait patiently for the lights come on and you get a whole new perspective on Hong kong. Looks classy and fits the bill of a happening place.

Views of Hong Kong. Views of Hong Kong and Kowloon from the Harbour Grand Hong Kong were excellent from the 40th floor. The views during the day are good but at night, especially at New Year are fantastic.
Fantastic view. Fantastic view, specially at night. There are light shows every now and then. Although the one I saw on December 29, 2014 was disappointing but the view of the skyline is excellent
Incredible!. Day or night the skyline of hong Kong is BEAUTIFUL! We went when Winterfest was on and I have never felt so Christmassy!
Exhilirating. Some of the tallest buildings in the world - the whole city densely packed by people and building and is full of energy
You can't miss this. The Hong Kong Skyline is pretty amazing and is something that should be on your to-do list if you ever find yourself in HK!
Aww some !!. Really breathtaking view . ferry drive was cherry on the cake. more relaxing city in the evening. and busy business city .

A quick view of HK. You can either walk along the promenade or see the skyline from a ferry which we really enjoyed. Must bring coins to by a ticket ($2-$4HKD e/way) which is quick and easy. We just went over to Kowloon which took about 10 minutes. Sit on the right on the way over and left on the way back to get the best view if starting from HK island.

Amazing skyline. We have just celebrated New Year in Hong Kong and celebrated in a restaurant on top of shopping centre overlooking the bay so had a brilliant view of the skyline and fireworks, well worth a visit.

A place to visit at night!. I stumbled upon this beautiful sight when I was walking around on the last night of my trip. The sight of the beautiful lit up skyline is a breathtaking one and taking a long relaxing stroll with the sea breeze blowing against your face with the skyline in view is a fantastic way to wind down at the end of your day. If you're early enough, you might see helicopters taking off for Lantau island. Go there and you'll know why it's considered a world class view.

Below expectation laser show. We were told by many people the laser show is the one to see. Well, we were disappointed because there was not too much laser. There was some music leading to the laser show but it was nothing that we would want to come back. The view of the high rises was actually pretty nice. There were many people there but it was manageable. This is near a large shopping area with high price stores and 1881 Heritage Plaza so one can do all of this in one trip

Awesome skyline. The HK skyline on both sides of the Victoria Harbour ( TST and Central ) is very inspiring . As long as it is not very foggy , you get to see exceptionally beautiful skyline all along with coast . You can't miss the skyline, irrespective of which side of HK you are on.
Amazing view!! . It is an incredible experience and the view was amazing! I'll recommend this experience to everyone visiting Hong Kong!

Breathtaking!. The Hong Kong skyline is just amazing. We didn't bother taking a tour on the ferry as originally planned as we found that using the ferry to cross the harbour, and walking along the avenue of stars provided good enough views. One of the best sights I've seen!
Amazing view. Amazing view of Hong Kong Island. About 15 minute walk to the ferry terminal which U.S. very cheapReally busy at The Walk of Stars
Free to stare!. HK Skyline is always great to see. Experience it best from the Star Ferry! Another option is to go to Kowloon promenade early in the morning and get great pictures!
Go to the Piek and have a great vieuw. Must do when you have the time, be aware that it can be very busy at the tram station (more then one hour waiting is not an exception)
Another city skyline. Have to leave Hong Kong island to get the good picture. Went took picture, left, just another city skyline...

Beautiful view but over crowding. nice view in the morning and night but it was extremely cold when we went there. Difficult to snap a nice photo (selfie) on our own due to over crowding and ended up getting them to tKe photo for us and purchase the photos
sleepless Hong Kong. Hong Kong Skyline in the evening reveals that robust energy of Hong Kong is 24x7. The holiday decoration adds a seasonal flavor to the skyline to make my experience a unique one.

Breathtaking!. We first viewed the skyline from the deck of a cruise ship and it was breathtaking. You didn't know where to look. It was vibrant and we could wait to actually get on land to experience what we could see.
Make sure you build in time to experience e Temple Street Market on a evening. Really worth it!
One of the 10 best in the world for a reason. The skyline from both sides of the bay is fascinating, with a mix of new and old both covered in neon.
Good anytime, especially at night.. Great photos to take home. Good night shots. It can be still impressive during the day on a clear day.

Best city skyline in the world - View from Aqua Bar. Unlike any cityscape. Go for a drink at Aqua bar (of Hutong restaurant) in Kowloon for the best view of the light show or go onto the car park (through the shopping centre) near to the Kowloon star ferry if you are on a budget.
Fantastic Light Show. Even in the rain, the nightly light show does not disappoint. The view from Kowloon is great. Don't miss it!

Nothing like the pictures!. I've seen the HK skyline so many times in photos but I guess all the photoshopping they do to make it look more interesting really is deceiving. It felt a lot smaller in person.

Young city!!!!!!!!!!!!. Hongkong is a young city. I love their lifestyle. Moreover, there are lots of designer's labor and I love that. But to experience some thing that is more casual you can come to street market where has yummy food and it really satisfied me. Hongkong is the city that never sleeps, the nightlife is the most interesting thing here. Me and my friends had a really great memory.

Best of the best. The skyline of HK Victoria Harbour is just amazing. I started coming to HK in 1997, but the view from Kowloon towards HK island still fascinates me. Even at daytime it is already beautiful, at nighttime it is gorgeous! The laser show at 8pm is a joke. Forget it and enjoy the view from any restaurant or hotel bar that offers this amazing view.
ace Xmas display. Always impressive, but the Christmas display is definitely worth muscling your way to a good vantage point by 8pm.

I have fallen in love. This city is truly beautiful.It's a bit overwhelming at first, with the millions of people, super tall buildings, etc., however you will quickly fall in love with the city.The city skyline is beautiful. The view from Tsim Sha Tsui and the Peak are amazing, and should be seen both during the day and at night. I cannot wait to visit HK again.
Best view is from kowloon side. The best viewing point to see the Hong Kong skyline is in front of the Intercontinental Hotel at night

Fantastic. it really is true, the Hong Kong skyline is fantastic. When I first saw it, I felt incredibly small. The buildings are. Interesting, very diverse, and most of them nicely lit up during the evening hours. In fact, there's no need to stay for. The light show especially as it's crowded during that time, the buildings are lit up anyway (sometimes hard to know where the light show action is), and it's way more interesting to see the lasers (only part of the show which I found nice to watch) from your hotel room or a restaurant/bar.
What a skyline!. I live with a NYC skyline view and boy this is just as comparable! A must see. I would go to the Peak during sunset so you could see the transition from day to night. Incredible.

Hong Kong light show. The view from the promenade by the Kowloon public pier was terrific. Looking across Victoria Harbor, you could see the light show reflecting off the clouds above as well as the water below. It is definitely worth seeing at least one of the nights you are in Hong Kong.

Must See in Hong Kong . The skyline from the harbor is fabulous! My husband and I booked a dinner cruise (Harbor Cruise Bauhinia) through our hotel that was during the laser light show. The light show was cool, but nothing amazing. The skyline itself during Christmas/New Years is gorgeous with all of the lights! It is surprising how many skyscrapers are in Hong Kong and the pictures we took came out great! :)

Best one in the world!. Hong Kong skyline is a surprise. It's big, wide and spectacular!! Make sure to go on Kowloon side at night time for a stunning view and lights show. You can enjoy it from the street or from the different restaurants with a view. However, it doesn't matter on what side of the bay you're standing on the skyline will blow your mind.
Stunning at Christmas. Great view from victoria peak and from Hong kong Island and kaloom sides. Also while traveling on the star ferry.

Best Time to Visit is from 6:30 pm to 8:30 pm. And the best location to observe it is from the Kowloon side either from one of the restaurants or bars on higher floors of the several high rise building at the tip of the Kowloon Peninsula (such as the Felix Bar at the Peninsula, Sky Lounge at Sheraton Hotel, or the Lobby Lounge at the Intercontinental Hotel).

Nice Skyline!. We went to the Golden Bauhinia Square at Wai Chai to see the night show as we have already visited the Avenue of Stars and wanted to see the skyline from the other side. The view is always amazing !

One of the best skylines in the world!. Beautiful day or night! Surprisingly how all those tall skyscrapers come together harmoniously to create a symphony of a skyline that one can never get tired of looking at.

Spectacular at night, great photo's after dark.. With the harbour being the focus, the Skyline makes a spectacular back drop after dark. We went to the Symphony of lights at 8pm and saw from Avenue of Stars. While the lights were great, you can see it at anytime after dark as the buildings are lit up prior to show.

Hong Kong Skyline: A Sight to Behold.. Once you have seen it, you will never forget it. The more you see it, the more you will appreciate it. I used to live in Hong Kong until 38 years ago, but every time I return to the city, I will make sure I have taken a ferry ride across the harbor just to see if anything has changed, such as an addition of a new skyscraper or any new mega-size neon sign has been erected. No time for ferry ride? No problem, there are many viewing points along the waterfront on both the island and Kowloon side, such as the Wanchai Golden Bauhinia Square, the Avenue of Stars at Tsim Sha Tsui or simply go up to the Victoria Peak where you can experience magnificent 360-degree harbour and skyline views from day to night. Best time to be up there? I'd say at dusk, between 5 to 7 PM, when there is still glowing light of the sunset while you wait for one of the world's most captivating urban night scene come on. It's also the best time to take a good quality photo of the night time panoramic view of the city espeically if you only own amateurish camera equipments.
Hong Kong Skyline. It rained the day I was there. It was slightly foggy and a bit cold. I think the Hong Kong Skyline is a bit overrated.
Beautiful. Wow llooked at the skyline morning and nite. The Christmaslights were amazing. The laser show was a little lame.

Stunning Skyline. I sat near star ferry and watched the skyline just before dark until complete darkness. Absolutely the nicest skyline in the world. People here in Chicago say we have to nicest skyline, but we have nothing compared to Hong Kong!

Most beautiful skyline. For me this is the nicest skyline in the world! I love it to walk down on the avenue of the stars in tst and watch over to the island with all the amazing skyscrapers. It's getting even more beautiful by night time and at 8 pm for the light show! I will never get bored about the view!

Symphony of Lights. It is the world's largest permanent light and sound show by Guinness world record. To view the Hong Kong skyline, go to the Kowloon waterfront, 365 days a year at 8pm, to see laser lights, colored beams and search lights choreographed to symphony music. To view the Kowloon skyline, go to Golden Bauhinia Square in the Wan Chai District. The show lasts for 17 minutes. It alternates days broadcasting the introduction of the buildings in English or Cantonese. On special holidays it becomes more magnificent with the addition of fireworks shooting off from the buildings. I prefer viewing it from the Kowloon side because the Hong Kong skyline has more lit buildings and after the show there are many shops and restaurants to walk to. On both sides there are many affordable photographers that will take your picture and you can pick which part of the skyline you want in the background.
The views are worth it!. Avoid the tacky trincket shops and head straight for th etop where you'll get the most brilliant 360 degree views of Honk Kong - so, so worth it.
Outstanding attraction!. Beautiful views of the city; very relaxing and enjoyable attraction. Allow plenty of time to truly appreciate the views.

Otherworldly. On your first visit, you realize very quickly you are not in Kansas anymore. Unlike any skyline view I have ever seen. So spectacular it has brought me back....twice. Take the tram up to see the view from there. It is incredible. We walked down from the top. 30-40 minutes you are in Central and we got to see some spectacular homes on the way down. Surprisingly a very quiet walk.
Laser lights. The laser shows wasn't as fascinating compared to the one in Singapore. Thanks to everyone who came, it become crowded

One of the great free expereinces.. Visiting in December we were blessed with beautiful clear winter skies. The view frown Kowloon at Tsim Tsa Shui is lovely, the skyscrapers come to life after sunset and many have Christmas lights. From the viewing balcony, you share the view with travellers from around the globe, all fixed at the skyline and life going by on the busy harbour's water. This is one of Hong Kong's great free attractions that you can enjoy again and again.

Breathtaking. Hong Kong has one of the impressive skylines of any city in the world, if not The most impressive. As such, it need not be rated since it can't be improved in response to ratings, and marking it down for bad weather is kind of silly. Make sure you don't miss the evening light show and take in the view from Mount Victoria. The Star Ferry cruise for the light show is lovely, too.

Amazing skyline - day or night!. Similar to New Yorks skyline - Hong Kong's skyline you will never forget; it is just amazing! your view is from the Star Ferry on the water or standing on the pier.If possible try to be there early evening (around 8 PM) when the light / laser show is on - can also be seen from more restaurants in TST. The view cannot be described by words - you have to experience it by yourself! Enjoy !
nice :). The Skyline is really nice. i was a bit unlucky with the weather though, so I think its even nicer with lots of sunshine, blue sky and warm temperature ;)

magnificent day or night. Hong Kong's skyline is beautiful at night and magnificent during the day making a perfect backdrop for holiday snapshots. Ever growing and changing the cityscape can be viewed and recorded from a number of vantage points.From the Kowloon Peninsula, along the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade you can get some of the most iconic views of the Hong Kong Island Skyline and in the evening this is a popular vantage for the "Symphony of Light". Another excellent vantage point to see and photograph the Hong Kong Skyline is from the top of Victoria Peak. On a clear day the view is almost unmatched, at night the city it lit up to offer a different and some would say more beautiful view of Asia's world city.
HK skyline. one of the best lights show that i ever seen!! wonderfull and amazing lazer lights over the city... just 5 stars!
its a wonderful site. the weather was perfect . Light show was amazing with the Christmas theme to match the decor at the viewing area.

Hong Kong Skyline from the Peak Skyview Terrace. Nice skyline of lights and skyscrapers if the clouds allow for it! It may get a little crowded as people tend to park themselves there from slightly before sunset. Tram service is often overused and getting down via the tram may mean a 1-2 hour wait in the queue. We decided to pay HK$300 for a taxi right down to the nearest MTR.

Addictive picture taking. From the Peak, from some of the top floor restaurants, from the harbor boats, from the waterside,... holy cow I have a hundred photos. It is the best skyline at night that I've seen anywhere in the world.

Great view of HK. We went on a tour with the big bus company (excellent) and this was on both routes. The train ride up and back was as exciting (different to anything I've ever been on) as the sky viewing area. This gives you a fantastic view of Hong Kong both on to the main land and south of the island. Plenty of tourists there so the line could be long but the train comes regularly and fits many people on it. A must visit if your in HK
Brilliant view day and night. Particularly nice view at night looking towards HK Island. Many buildings have been decorated with Christmas lights and it looks amazing.
Skyscraper Forest!. Its like forest of skyscrapers like no other stretching around the harbour as far as the eye can see.
symphony of lights. the symphony of lights is a must see in hong kong. it happens everyday and it is a beautiful event. see it from either side although the kowloon side is better.

Plenty to see and do. Hong Kong was a great place to visit plenty of things to do. We stayed at the Harbour Grand hotel which provided a shuttle bus into Kowloon where you had markets alongside designer shops there was plenty to see and do would definitely recommend a visit
nice view.... nice view when come to good weather... easy to move with octopus card... well connected and nice people
Photo great. Like all of Hong Kong, the streets, markets, culture. The friendly people. The night life and bars. The water ways of old Hong Kong and the fast variety of food available is fantastic.
Amazing. The whole place is so diverse; there is high rise flats worth fortunes, junk boats, expensive shops and markets; different but very nice.

Electrifying!. The HK skyline is beautiful... Most electrifying at night with the daily light show at 8pm. Definitely not to be missed while in HK. It can be viewed from the Avenue of the Stars at Kowloon side, or from The Peak at Hong Kong side. Note: Do check the weather forecast as it can be drizzling during the winter, and it would be a less than ideal experience.

Nice laser show. Skyline view on the Victoria harbor is amazing, especially during the night. But tons of tourists everywhere, since it is one of the best attraction in Hong Kong. But definitely worth visiting!

If you splurge on one hotel view in your life , make it this one. Watching the Hong Kong Island skyscrapers and apartment blocks from the Kowloon side is an absolutely amazing view. Sunrise and sunset at either end of the island are spectacular enough, but then the night lights steal the show. Cannot be good for global warming, but have to forgive them for the experience.
Good view from Star Ferry. Great view of HK Skyline while travelling to Tsing Sha Tsui on Star Ferry. Tickets are cheap even for upper deck. Just takes less than 10 mins.

Hong Kong Skyline. The best view of Hong Kong Skyline is at Victoria's Peak which everyone goes by the tram. Its quite windy up there. You can see the Tower Building, Bank of China Building and Cheung Kong Center. When we went it was not very clear. It was misty but the sight was great. Worth it

Most beautiful skyline. The best view in the world! At twilight the city of Hong Kong erupts in a shimmering display of city lights , best viewed from across the Victoria Harbour. The nightly Symphony of Lights is an additional treat! It's definitely the most beautiful skyline in the world!

Aaaaahhh.....Wonderful. Another wonderful tourist site that boasts some of the most amazing views (panoramic) of Hong Kong. There is a small fee to have a tram take you up some 200 feet and when you arrive there is a mall-like ambiance and escalators that take you to the top of the observatory. What I did not like was there was the tram fee but yet another fee to see what is advertised. You can still get great photo's by not paying to go all the way to the top. And if done on a clear day, you will enjoy. The tram queue gets very lengthy so plan ahead. But enjoy!
always good. The best views you will have from star ferry and between December and Chinese new year. Good view you have also from intercontinental hotel best during nice Dinner

WOW ! This is a must see place. The skyline is absolutely incredible at night right now. Because of the Christmas Season, businesses of all kinds have pulled out all the stops to make this City shine!! Not to be missed is the laser show while riding on the Star Ferry in the harbor. Make sure to do a full 360 look because there is so much color in addition to the impressive skyline. This experience was definitely impressive. Go if you can!!

Breathtaking. Look at the Hong Kong skyline from Kowloon. I recommend one of the bars or restaurants in One Peking Road, as high in the building as possible and try to get a window seat. i live in Hong Kong, I love Hong Kong.
Amazing views from Tram Peak. The title says it all.....amazing views. And not just about catching the tram....also fantastic views if you caught the bus up or down the mountain.

Pearl of Asia!!. Amazing skyline, the best in Asia!!!I am always fascinated by this place, busy with a good order, holding the past but embracing the moment, people from all over the world melting with locals. How can this not reflected in the skyline and light show in the Victoria Harbour?! While you are appreciating the skyline, take a moment and imagine who passed here 100 years ago or even earlier! Fabulous pearl!!!

Up and over the sacred mountain Ngong Ping. On Lantau Island where I used to spend time when growing up, you can now enjoy a peaceful 25 minute ride up and over the mountains to get to Ngong Ping, the largest statue of Buddha, a documentary film on the life of Buddha, shops, restaurants/snack bars... the Po Lin Monastery and great walks. Just take the MTR to Tung Chung and walk over to the Skyline Cable Car.... Enjoy!

The absolute best!. To really soak in the skyline, get a table at the Intercontinental Lobby Lounge or the Sheraton Sky Lounge and enjoy a glass of champagne while watching the 8pm light show. This is my absolute favorite thing to do the very night I arrive in Hong Kong. Sometimes unclear and foggy nights can make it difficult to take in the view, but usually in 3-4 days of time you can get one really wonderful, clear night!

Hong Kong Skyline. One of the best skylines in the world. Across the harbour both on HK island and Kowloon there are some nice buildings. There is a light show with some laser lights every night at 8pm which makes the night skyline come to the fore. The fireworks when they happen make the skyline a real spectacle.
Great light show. This place can get very crowded during the laser light show at 8pm so be early to get a decent spot.
Awesome view. Nothing like the view of the harbour from either side.The lights are amazing.The laser light show each night very overrated!!

Evenings across the harbor from the Peak to TST are exquisite. viewings from either side are great; but after dark is best; and you get a greater panorama from above the fray on the Peak. However, waterfront viewing from the Cultural Centre and Star Ferry Terminal in TST is fine as well

Amazing skyline. We have been to a few big cities and have to say the HK skyline is the best in terms of density and including commercial as well as tall residential blocks. Also a completely different view during the day and night

spent hours watching the harbour ..... Watch harbour and Hong Kong island: never a dull moment, day and night! Hong Kong provides an attractive mix of Chinese and western culture. Continental gives the very best location for an unparallelled view of the city life.

Stunning Nightime View. The harbor skyline is stunning and breath taking from Victoria Peak in the
evening especially when it is clear. The reverse skyline can be viewed from the TST Star Ferry Terminal towards HK island. Truly views which are unique. NY and San Francisco skylines
evoke the same kind of warm feelings when viewed.
Breathtaking sights. Whether you are visiting or living in Hong Kong the lighted skyline at Victoria Harbour is always a breathtaking sight.
Next to The Best. Beautiful Sky Line.Good Laser Show with commmentary and historic info. Excellent view from the Victoria Peak.

Beautiful Skyline for about 20 minutes. It's great to look at from the avenue of stars, from star ferry, from sky 100, or from the victoria peak. You can look at it for about 20 minutes, click your pics and you are done! The skyline is as good as it gets when it comes to urban concrete jam-packed cities!

Hong Kong Lights. I feel so fortunate to be living in a flat on the harbor side of Hong Kong Island. I can sit for hours and just watch the boats go by. I can watch the ICC Light Show every night from my living room, or my bedroom. I can even get the App and listen to the music that goes with the light show and never take a step outside. Hong Kong is the Best. For $HK2.50 you can take a ferry from Central to TST, that's about 35 cents U.S. And you get off at a Mall that has great restaurants, mine is the Sweet Basil Thai. With a water view, and a great meal, who could ask for more. I actually live here, and can see it everyday.

Great view. We were told there is a light show at 8:00 pm. So we went early and waited 30 minutes for a short laser display. I would avoid the crowd and miss the light show. Just go and enjoy the skyline when you have time. Don't go with the crowd at 8:00 pm. Not worth it.

Stunning view. Looking across the harbour at the Light Show from Tsim Tsa Tsui (TST) is definitely worth experiencing.
