Better still, have a meal at the Italian restaurant on the wharf, close to the Star Ferry, and enjoy a very romantic setting. Actually, the Laser Light Show isn't as great as the view. Crossing the harbour on a boat is the fun part!
Great Views at Sunset. THE way to see the Harbour - book around sun set. Goes West and East in the Harbour so you can see where the airport used to be!

Best Skyline. You must come to experience the skyline I would say it's the best among all places I have visited! The best view to see the skylines is to see it from Tsim Sha Tsui on Kowloon side and look over to Hong Kong Island. All the lighting are just stunning and you can see the decoration for X'mas and new year all around and it's just picturesque.If you are lucky with good weather of clear sky and clam sea, that would be the best and also you can take a ferry to cross the harbour which to enjoy the sea breeze. Must try when you visit Hong Kong!The carnival will start soon before xmas until end of Jan and this another highlight as well!

Spectacular Skyline. The Hong Kong Skyline is stunning--especially at night when light displays paint scenes across the facades of the skyscrapers. I especially enjoyed the moon and clouds that scudded across the face of the International Finance Centre across the harbor in Kowloon. Hong Kong at night is just brilliant.

The best Skyline on the world!. Hong Kong has by far the most exciting skyline in the world. It's compact and vibrant.
A walk along the waterfront promenade offers the best view from the Kowloon side and best of all it's free.
Best City Skyline. Forget the Avenue of Stars... And you'll have to dodge the your groups, but the HK City Skyline is like no other....
Unique. Great experience. A must if you visit Hong Kong. Must go at daytime and stay till dark to see the city light up and look at the sunset.
LOVE IT!. Worth seeing as much as possible, I do recommend a trip to the top of Victoria Peak both during the day and at night.

The harbor at night is very impressive. Spent three nights in Hong Kong and was on the harbor walk each night going to different bars and restaurants (an easy way to get around on foot). The laser light show is not that impressive.

Just Had "a wee peak". Victoria Peak is truly one of the great views of the world. High-rise buildings that seem to touch the sky but, with a backdrop of rolling green mountain peaks surrounded by blue sea.A great place to spend some time on a clear day. If you have the energy try the Lugard Road walk, you'll get a 360 degree picture of Hong Kong & the surrounding islands.If you want a reverse angle of Hong Kong's skyline try a night cruise on the harbour, with the added bonus of the Symphony Of Lights as night settles in.

Almost unreal. I have never seen so many tall building in such a small space. It's like Montecarlo but with taller buildings and multiplied by 20! Some buildings are new and shiny but so many are old and very thin. They made me think of European buildings from the 60's and 70's only much taller. Some look like beehives or social projects. But hey, it's Hong Kong, the view is breathtaking!!

Head to Victoria Peak for the best view of Hong Kong. Go about an hour before sunset to see the difference between day and night time, its truly a thing to see. Excellent spot to take photos. A little touristy obviously, but shouldn't be missed. Make ample time to stay at night as the line for the tram back down is HEAVY. If you can afford it, take a one way trip up and take a bus or cab back down.
Good to do once. Tram was good, but very cold and a bit to much of a tourist attraction , was a little let down. plus not enough time once we were up there
The Classic View of Hong Kong. Probably best viewed from Tsim Sha Tsui and if you are in Hong Kong, it has to be done! If you are staying on Hong Kong Island, just get the Star Ferry.

Symphony of Lights Cruise. We did a 45 minute cruise round the harbour. At 8pm the light show begins. You get a drink included. The boat is a junk with red sails. We had a great view of the lights and the cruise was very enjoyable.
WHAT A VIEW. This has got to be among the best views in the world especially at night. Best to veiw from the peak tower or from a boat in the harbour.
hk skyline always there for you. have a walk from the star ferry harbour along the hk museum. worth thousand words specially during dusk to night

Good view of Hong Kong. Before you go up, make sure the sky is clear but you can end up with a tour of the cloud! If you are lucky to have a sunny clear day, you will be amazed by the charm of this city and the harbour.

Gets crowded but worth it. It's a beautiful sight. You see Hong Kong from a completely different perspective and even the layout of the landscape. But people here get crazy. Everyone is crowding around the edges and just sticking their cameras out.
Take some photos but don't forget to enjoy yourself with your own eyes and ears!
Skyline at night wow . Make sure u go at night and watch the laser lights from the skyline on victoria harbour Just amazing , worth coming to see .

Iconic view but very busy. excellent iconic view from Kowloon, but only downside is number of people with professional cameras taking over the place. Worth seeing, but do it near end of the day when Suns gone down.
Hong Kong from above. Best to come and experience - there are not many words to describe 25 min (one way journey) by sky car - breathtaking view!
Great view. Me and my friends had a great time here to see HK skyline at late afternoon. The atmosphere was so relaxing and comfortable. This is a hightlight place that you must see.

A view worth seeing !. The view itself it is wonderful. But waiting for the show it is not worth it. It will not ad anything! If you in Kowloon by the time the show starts it is ok to wait, but don´t make your plan with that constrain.
Nice view. By taking a boat ride, a Chinese junk if u want.. It's beautiful especially at night. It's 190 hkd per pax w a drink.. 45mims cruise

Lovely light show at 8pm. The Hong Kong Skyline is lovely, great views from Kowloon and Hong Kong Side and also on the Star Ferry.
We viewed the light show from Kowloon side at 8pm. I heard it described as comparable to that of the Bellagio fountains in Las Vegas - IMO Its not that good but worth a view.

Don't miss the skyline at night. Be sure to view the skyline at night from both sides -- Kowloon and Hong Kong Island. With our hotel on Kowloon, we took the star ferry to the island and then back to see the light show. We were a little underwhelmed with the laser light show (especially since we sat and waited for an hour before it started) but just walking along the promenade in Kowloon was a nice experience. The moving lights on buildings on both sides were especially good -- not just during the laser show.

just stunning. especially with the lightship that starts at 8pm it is great. more show in the weekend then on weekdays. try it fro a roofterrace like sevva or take a aqua tour in between kowloon and the island. (those are not free off course)
One of the best in China. Buildings aren't covered by adverts, which makes the skyline really beautiful. Have a walk during a clear day and come back at night!

Nice to see ...from far away. I was not impressed by my first visit to Hong Kong. Ok, it was a business trip with very little time to do sightseeing. That said, apart from a nice skyline, I have seen several shopping malls that one can find everywhere around the world, but nothing really special which would attract my attention. By the way, the taste of the local food it's very different from the Chinese restaurants here in Europe: watch it!

Always amazing... The Hong Kong skyline is most amazing. It is always fascinating. The skyline is best viewed from the Harbour. There is also a free laser show in the evening. The building lightings are amazing.
Amazing views. The skyline must be seen at night to be appreciated (that's the only time you'll not notice the huge construction sites dotted around!) It's impressive and especially at Xmas!
Stunning. The skyline was refreshing and calming after a busy day of wondering all over Hong Kong. The sea breeze was nice and cool and the sights are amazing.

Nice by Day, Even Nicer at Night. Hong Kong is famous for it's skyline and as such a great free attraction which is always busy day or night. Lovely to walk along the promenade. If you go at a certain time in the evening there be a free light show which is always busy.

Nice view!. Saw the Hong Kong skyline from 2 locations. The first being from Victoria peak during the day, which was an awesome view. The next being from the promenade at night, which was nice as well. It was cool to see the city all lit up.

Wow, Wow, Wow. Go see this!. Ok. So a few years ago we saw the Red Junk on a visit to Hong Kong and decided we'd take an evening ride to see the Skyline show put on every evening at dusk. We are SO glad we did! This was an amazing and throughly noteworthy ride. What a wonderful show the city puts on. The skyline lights up with a timed show on the skyscrapers along the waterfront and there's no better way to see it than from the red junk. It's awful hard to take pictures on a moving boat, but don't miss it!

Go to Kowloon and look back,. The skyline and the evening light show is worth the trip. Learn to use the Metro. I found it doable. One hint, when you enter the MTR at the bottom of the stairs use your smart phone to take a picture of the sign for that exit/entry.

Light and sound. Atleast fog/smog cant stop being able to see the 8pm light and sound show, which i would say is a must in HK. Perhaps its obvious but the best place to watch it is from Kowloon, I recommend along the promenade by the council building/clock towet; get there 7.15pm latest to get a good spot; find the wall with the rail behind so you can sit in comfort, as there are limited benches/seating.
UNIQUE SKYLINE. Worth the trip! Superb during the day and breath-taking at night. Sight seeing boat/junk trips recommended

Some of the most spectacular city views in the world. Views from Victoria harbor are great, night views along promenade and walkways are wonderful. Wouldn't waste time waiting around for the night "lights/laser/music" show where buildings show off their strobe lasers, etc.
Beautiful. Loved watching the sun set over the city from Victoria Peak. The skyscrapers lit up and the city began to glow. Recommend!
Awesome skyline. A must see.. Part of the reason I went to Hong Kong was the brilliant city views from either the Peak, harbour or the mainland. Great.
The best skyline in the world. Hong kong has 1700 skyskrapes. Manhattan has the second most skyskrapes. They got 50. IT is so beautiful.
nice skyline. Skyline is pretty from many places all around the city but the symphony of lights is of over estimated

Beautiful. Come in the evening to enjoy the lights show, but come early to have a nice viewing spot. All the buildings light up in dazzling colors and the reflections in the sea are especially beautiful.

A Night time Wonderland. The Hong Kong skyline is best viewed at night from Kowloon side. Although the skyline has dramatically changed over the last 30 years with more and more high rise buildings it has become more spectacular particularly with the light show which is most best seen from the Kowloon waterfront. The show is enhanced by the decorated craft in the harbour - worth seeing
8 pm Light Show. Go across to Kowloon (TST) on the Star Ferry and walk round to the water front and be astounded by the daily 8.00 pm light show. Unforgettable.

One of the best City Skylines in the world. The Hong Kong skyline has numerous notable buildings, and they all "compete" in a lightshow in the evenings for viewers. They decorate to the season and create a spectacular view.

NOTHING LIKE IT WHEN IT COMES TO SKYLINE. In my opinion, it is the worlds most beautiful skyline, topped off with a LASOR LIGHT SHOW every night at 8 PM. Absolutely breathtaking. Watch the show from KOWLOON SIDE, the go over to HONG KONG ISLAND side and do the same on another night. Then go up to VICTORIA'S PEAK and watch it again. You will never forget it.

Spectacular Skyline. I was lucky enough to see the skyline from multiple perspectives. Firstly from Victoria Peak, which is a must when visiting Hong Kong. It costs about HKD40 for a return trip on the Peak Tram (excluding access to the viewing deck). Personally I don't think it's worth doubling the price for the viewing deck access. If you look around enough, you'll find some great viewing spots on the peak.Secondly, I saw the skyline from ground level on the Star Ferry. It's well worth taking the ferry from Admiralty to Tsim Sha Tsui so you can take in the sights from the water. A truly immersive experience for less than HKD3 per trip.Finally, I was extremely fortunate to get an almost unique view of the skyline from the roof of the Harbour Grand Hotel in Kowloon. The hotel is situated perfectly and has the most breathtaking rooftop pool that provides views of the entirety of Hong Kong Island. At ovr HKD2,500 per night, it's not a cheap viewpoint to access but the five star hotel experience is taken to that extra level with the rooftop view and pool, a perfect gift perhaps.

Mildly entertaining . Some interesting buildings tightly packed together. At night there is a 'light show' to music but not really worth waiting around for. Not that many buildings appeared to take part or they were too spread out.
Great skyline. great from he esplanade & even greater from The Peak. Comparable to other great cities of the world.
Best in the world. Beats NYC by miles! Stunning and the light show is great. Best viewed from the Avenue of Stars of the Aqua bar on the Kowloom side
Must-see ... and difficult to miss :-). If you are in Hong Kong, you'd have to make quite an effort of not seeing, and with it admiring, the Hong Kong Skyline. It's awe-inspiring, plain and simple.
a beautiful view from many different locations. capture a panorama during the day and the evening from the same spot. It is a cool photo set to have.
Up and up. The buildings in Central are simply mesmerizing. I took dozens of photos of them, many of the same buildings at different times.
beautiful. gets a little crowded and hard to get a photo if you can you will get some beautiful photos at night

Fun to watch at dusk. OK, it costs a bit, but trek over to the Hotel Intercontinental on the Kowloon waterfront, settle into the lobby bar for a good drink, and watch the lights come on as the sun sets. The number of skyscraper animations is amazing and fun, especially now with one or two buildings using the entire facade for holiday LED shows. The Intercontinental juts out a bit toward the water, and the entire waterside is a gigantic glass wall looking directly at Hong Kong Island.

Stunning but light show naff. The city skyline is truly amazing but the 'light show' was truly disappointing! We had a view of the city from our hotel in low loon so we're blessed with great views of it at night and day. The view from the point is definitely tell worth the trip up in the tram- which is an experience all in itself!!

Unforgettable. We took the tram up to Victoria Peak. Very busy, about half an hour wait. We did the circular walk round the top of the Peak. As the light fades the views get more spectacular. ... not to be missed!
Nice walk. That's a nice walk in the evening. You can see all the high rise buildings and the city lit up in the evening.
Fantastic. Fantastic views during the day and night from Avenue of Stars and from some hotels for example the Panoramic Bar and Sky100

Great panorama. I love the skyline on the island side especially at night (viewed from the Kowloon side). I was there three years ago and the light show was better then but still well worth a ferry ride across the harbour.
Beautiful Night View. The night view here is beautiful. It's really nice to relax here with a friend. If you're in hongkong be sure to visit this place at night.
The greatest!. Quite possibly the greatest skyline in the world. And the city itself is one of the most exciting — filled with great restaurants, interesting sites and warm, friendly people.

Acceptable. As I said, acceptable. Nothing special as you get to see this in other countries as well. I suppose the powers that are tried to make this place a little special by introducing avenue of the stars but that too, do not appeal to me (see my review). If this is your first trip, I suppose this is a must go, so as to let you put that tick in your travel log book. I was lucky to see the motorized Chinese junk boat sailed by for some photo opportunity. For here you can see really how close buildings huddle with each other and each building are just fighting for attention, even at night. There was some major construction going in the night I was there, perhaps my visiting experience would have been better without the construction. I was told there is a ticketing counter for Disneyland here, but I did not seem to be able to spot it. Oh well.

Worth a look. Went for a walk along the avenue if the stars, along the promenade past the clock tower. The lights are amazing, so many buildings the mind boggles. There are some cheesy props to have your photo taken along the way. Nice breeze on a warm night coming from the water. Yes there are people everywhere, be patient and you get more than enough photos.

One of the most unique skylines in the world. Experience one of the most wonderfull skylines in the world. For years buildings were added and new lights installed resulting in this wonderfull result. If you walk along the boulevard of stars at the Kowloon side of the river you will get the full sight. One to never forget!
The Peak. We caught the little tram to the Peak. Everyone that goes to Hongkong should go to the Peak. The views are fantastic. We caught the tram down but I would like to walk down next time.

Spectacular Night Views. This night time view of the Hong Kong skyline from the Kowloon side would have to rank as one of the most spectacular in the world.Best place to view is from the park at the harbour end of Nathan Rd. There is a light show commencing at 8PM each night but the show itself is a bit lame but well worth the walk to the park to take in the night time view.
Shines bright. Brillant beautiful at night...go on the Star Ferry for a better view...try the light show at 8pm in English Mon Wed and Sunday
Great night views. Great night lights. ChristmasFest has been great.Don't stay at Hotel -terrible views and in old area of town.

A Good Run Ashore Revisited. I first visited Hong Kong in the earlt 60s it has changed a lot in that time but the skyline is iconic throughtout the world. You would not thisnk that there was rom to construct anything more on the island.Victoria peak has changed a lot with it now being so commercialised a lot of Chiniese from the mainland. The view is still the same that skyline is magnificent and even more so at night dining on the peak, it is still a wonderful place to take your lady. I think that no matteer what happens the sky line seen by plane, boat or from the landward side will also stir different feelings in people.

Most Enchanting Skyline in the World. Nothing compares to the lights on the water, and the swath of large cargo ships, sail boats and cruise ships that drift through out the harbor...its spectacular and interesting as it changes. Never boring

The best Skyline in the world. Exciting vibrant and the best views ever from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island! The 8 pm light and music display is not easily forgotten! The whole skyline lights up in an electrifying masterpiece!
Stunning!. Absolutely loved this skyline; both during the day and at night :) Perfect viewing from the Promenade.
Red sails on the harbor. This is worth doing but the boat is quite loud. The skyline is one of the best in the world. I love this harbor. It compares to Sydney harbor. Great.
special. good overall at night good light show ,.good signage and,tram ride and views very good. very clean ,good metro system.
Worth it. Worth it. Experiencing it and seeing it on TV and photos is different. Even if you have got a short transit in Hongkong, get out of the airport and enjoy this.

Remarkable view from Victoria Peak. On an earlier trip a decade ago my wife and I saw the Hong Kong skyline from Victoria Peak in the evening, which was amazing, and on this trip from the same place during the daytime, which was also spectacular. There is enough construction in the area that the view had changed, but was fabulous both times. Don't miss this when you are in this interesting city. Victoria Peak is a standard stop on most commercial city tours, but you can also take a tram to the top. Plan to spend a little time to explore the view from different angles that can be had by taking the walkway running from the overcommercialized car and tram stop.

The best skyline by far. You can view it from across the harbor - the whole city puts on a show - laser lights, music and all - who does that? Granted Hong Kong epitomizes the commercialism at the its best - it sure beats city like Chicago, New York by a mile - with so much thought put into it celebrating what it has. Wow what a magical moment!!!
Outstanding at night. Spectacular views both from kowloon and the peak. Great during the day and at night...one of the best skylines in world

Excellent show! . You must see this when you are in HK. Night show is breathtaking. Light and music show stays a long time in your memory. It also looks good during the day but for sure at night it is the best.

Breathtaking. No matter how many times you visit Hong Kong, the skyline continues to cause me to gasp. And as quickly as the mega-skyscrapers are built, the skyline can change dramatically from one visit to the next.

LIGHTSHOW A MUST. The Lightshow is a must - Use one of the boats and get out in the Harbour it will amaze you. Don't Miss the tram to The Peak and check the views on the way up - the leaning buildings will astound you.
Very well done. The buildings are looking great at the moment with Christmas themes as well as the laser lights. I expected a bit more, but it is very well done. Worth seeing it doesn't go for long
Amazing. Amazing views especially the Victorian Peak. The bright lights at night was unbelievable - must see.
Great View. This is a must when you´re in Hong Kong. The best way to appreciate the skyline is from Kowloon at 8pm when the light shows starts (It lasts 15min). Its free and apropiate for all ages.

You've seen pictures, but better in person. Unbelievable number of high rises in close proximity. A city that is mostly all business. It is beautiful to see, but you have to seek out the old cultural icons. Shopping is now for the wealthy Chinese, as prices for same goods higher than in the states.

Best seen from the water. Book a harbour boat trip with dinner and music to get the best views and a fun ride. The boat circled the harbour many times and permitted all on board to get the best selfies and direct shots of all the illuminations and buildings many times from different angles. You can better appreciate the towers and mountains with a view from the waterline. The boat trip is good value with a wide choice on the buffet and a fair bar for those that wanted a drink. The staff were friendly and helpful but the stars were the two female singers who not only sang well in many languages but managed to get the dance floor filled from a very mixed and sober audience. Great entertainment in the end.

Fabulous. Get yourselves to the promenade on Kowloon for around 7.45pm ready for the buildings on Hong Kong island to start their light show. It is free and worth it. Use the Star Ferry to get from one island to the other, it is cheap and all part of the Hong Kong experience.

One of the Most Famous Skylines in Asia. This review is quite late. Hong Kong Skyline is one of the most beautiful and popular in Asia. The best vantage point is the Avenue of Stars promenade or the Victoria Peak. There is a colorful light show at 8pm which is spectacular. You can also take a cruise and view it from one of the Old Chinese junk boats.

One of the nicer skyline, but it really depends on the season. You can find one of the nicer skylines around the world from Vic Harbour, or the Star Ferry. Sunset time or after 7pm would be a good time to view the bustling city, but if you like a little more personal space and quiet moment.There is a night time light show but it gets filled with tourists and can get quite messy if you are not a "crowd" kinda person. But if you are a photo enthusiast, and you like city-scapes, don't miss this if you happen to be around in HK.

go down to clock tower near ferry station for light show from 8pm and dont forget , jade market, food markets, flower ma. Smell of warm meat hanging in the sun outside so called butchers shops, and and the haggling over goods in the street markets
Fantastic views. View the Hong Kong skyline from the Victoria Harbour promenade, or from the Star Ferry. A great time to see it is at night, and at 8pm when the light show takes place.
Night time show. Great to be down on the waterfront to watch the night time light show either on Kowloon of Hong Kong Island side

Beautiful. Beautiful is the word I rarely use, but for HK Skyline, its just pure beautiful. I took the cruise with dinner and watched the light show from the cruise. You have gorgeous view on both sides of the harbor and the lit up buildings appears full of life. You can go there for a quite evening. Take a stroll by the promenade, sit and introspect, read or just watch people having fun. This place is for all. A cruise would be an added bonus and can be booked at the venue 40 mins before departure. Food is not that great, i paid 180 HKD for a trip and food. Go and see it for yourself, you'll know why HK skyline is ranked alongside London's and New Yorks's.
Beautiful Skyline. We have seen the skyline from Avenue of star area. The skyline was very beautiful . The light was coming from different building and forming a good rythm.

Great when no pollution. Lovely at night along the harbour with lights dancing at 8:00pm. Many tourists gathe to watch at TST esp., mainlanders. Many pickpockets mixing with the crowds. Touters are everywhere along the harbour front. Apart from the safety side, a good way to look at beautiful skyline, esp., when there is clear sky with no pollution which is getting very rare.

What a spectacle. Hong Kong Skyline is best viewed towards the end of the day when the light starts to fade and the skyscrapers' lighting designs start to be visible. It is a show on its own with skyscrapers having full size images moving...........

OMG IT WAS BREATHTAKING. A MUST-SEE. If you visit Hong Kong and miss this... you have not truly visited Hong Kong. This was the most amazing Skyline I have seen in my lifetime as of yet. There are cabs close by ready to take you anywhere. Just amazing and FREE.
Sky100. Great view,specially after taking all attractions and then knowing locations.360 degree views - 384 metres above sea level.Fourth highest building at this stage.
Spectacular panorama. The view at night from both sides of the Harbour is just amazing. The daytime view is fabulous too with the mountains sitting just behind the skyscrapers.

stunning architecture and a cheesy fun symphony of lights!. I'd say the true skyline of Hong Kong is best viewed from Kowloon or the walk of stars and is well worth catching the sunset from this point not to mention the super cheesy but free and fun Symphony of Lights - a light and sound show that literally covers several buildings on Hong Kong Island! pretty great to watch and a fun little evening out.

The buildings are impressive. By day or night the Hong Kong skyline is fantastic but if you catch the 8pm light show from the Kowloon side the skyline is magical. There are plenty of places to get some great photo's but remember to look behind you as well because there are also some great light effects on the Kowloon skyscrapers as well.
We went almost every day. We were a 5 min walk from the skyline watching over from the Kowloon side. Its so sweet especially on a clear day. The night laser show was tacky but still enjoyable

Very nice when the air is clear.. Many have waxed lyrically about the HK skyline. And, in theory, it's great.But, thanks to the messy sources of pollution upwind, the view is poor much (most?) of the time.Note to those responsible in Shenzen, etc: Clean up your act! Or hand over to those will do the job properly.

Futuristic. The buildings are impressive, with a sharp, cleanness about them which is characteristic of modern cities. The Hong Kong Skyline is therefore one of the best - by day or night. Best viewed from one of the observation towers or from the harbour area which is pleasant in its own right. I'd recommend going at sundown to witness the contrast between night and day.

Best skyline in the world...check it out from both sides (TST & HK island). The Hong Kong skyline is one of the finest in the world. It is great from both sides (TST/Kowloon and HK Island) and even from multiple angles (Ritz Carlton or Aqua Tokyo or Peninsula from TST/Kowloon side and from The Peak, Central, Wan Chai or Causeway Bay on HK Island side). You can also check out both sides from the Star Ferry or other dinner cruise...regardless of how you chose to see it, you will love it either way.

A favourite skyline. Always love sailing into HK Harbour - the skyline never disappoints. But...the night laser show was, well, sort of limp -- so much more could be done. But seeing the HK skyline is always almost like coming home.
Beautiful. Try going to Kowloon side to really appreciate the beautiful skyline. you can catch the 8 pm light show from TST or just enjoy the views from any of the roof-top restaurants
HK skyline is one of the best!. Breathtaking - don't miss it! The Peak is amazing day and night and the harbour is fantastic as well - make sure that you take the Star ferry across the harbour.

Average.. The best time to visit the harbour is obviously at night because of all the lights. We also saw a laser show which was quite impressive. The selection of restaurants is really good and the prices vary from very cheap to very expensive. The standard of food seems to be excellent where ever you go. We got a ferry over to Stanley markets which was fantastic. Shopping was great. We also got on the "train thing" to the peak. That also was well worth the trip. The only down side here was the difficulty finding a western toilet. I didn't fancy going over a hole in the ground, as clean as it may be, NO THANKS!!!!!!Unfortunately that's where the positives ended for us in this city. The smog and pollution is disgraceful, people bothering you and following you all the time on the streets to buy or have something made, clothing wise. Keep away from the people at the ferry terminal trying to get you to buy tickets and win big prizes. We got sucked in and were taken to the "Gold Coast" where it was all about time share. We were extremely angry at them as it wasted nearly a whole day for us. It is very very crowded as well. Wasn't one of our favourite places and we won't be returning.
Amazing look in nightine. I was dining during my boattrip. Very nice food and a breathtaking view to the skyline. Not very expensive, worth any penny.
Amazing view. One the must see Is HGK nightview! You will definitely remember it for good! To capture it take a good camera with you. Or you can just enjoy the view

Not Fun. Nothing worth mention when you have to pay for visiting. I have visited a few of these such as101 Taiwan, Shanghai, Malaysia, USA... This is the least attractive. No need to visit unless someone provide free tickets
amazing sight. what can I say that hasn't already been said Hong Kong at night is almost like Las Vegas with it's bright lights.

wonderful city. beautiful city with high rise buildings but beautiful harbour and lots of greenery and hills, a lot to do , hotels are amazing value for money and the choice and standard of food is incredible, Of course you can shop virtually till you drop, but its expensive but you can have a lot of fun for cheap, my best time was going on the ferry back and forth between the islands with beautiful views at day or night.

Always amaze me. The skyline of HongKong is always amaze me whenever I travel here. The light show is always on every night. The performance on the promenande is always entertaining. As long as it is not raining, it is nice to have a stroll especially at night.
Out of world . Most enjoyable is to see the Inlands skyline from a ferry in sea. I was lucky to witness a grand laser show , in the evening .
View it from Kowloon. Incredible skyline and best viewed from Kowloon side or on top of Victoria Peak. Look for red sailed junks as they crisscross the harbor.

Beautiful architecture. Hong Kong's skyline must be one of the most impressive skylines in the world. There is some stunning architecture and the sky is the limit.Don't miss the 8 pm light and laser show.

Breathtaking!!!. Go to Victoria's Peak and take a breathtaking view of the HK harbor and bring your camera.Also if you can take a dinner cruise a great evening of dancing while sailing on the harbor. Also enjoy the light show.Take a taxi to Victoria's peak there are plenty of taxis available for the return trip.
Amazing spectacle. From the Peak or on a cruise ship at night, don't miss this amazing view of all the skyscrapers! Each evening, the light show will illuminate the sky over Victoria Harbor!
nice views. Worth a go on. Lovely scenery and very high up so you get a good view of all of the city. A little pricey but the duration is long
Not What It Was. It is still a sight worth travelling to see but it is being ruined by overbuilding. Not what is on the postcards any longer.

The Peaks. The view of the skyline as the light show started. Worth the time and effort to get up there. The tram to the top was interesting. Just ignore all the shops from the tram stop to the top on the many escalators

Very relaxing. We had a great time here and see the beautiful skyline of Hong Kong. Must visit this place at sunset. The lights of buildings were very romantic and the atmosphere was very relaxing as well

Hong Kong. Scenic HighlightI was able to visit some of city most popular spots, Victoria peak where visitors from all over the world come to see the spectacular views. I took a Tram ride for a panoramic view of the city's skyline, than enjoyed a cup of coffee at the top of the peak.visited the renowned fishing village of Aberdeen, enjoyed a boat ride and of course enjoyed the shopping at some of the fancy stores.

What a laser light show!. Best seen from the Kowloon side, the 10-15 minute long laser light show emanating from many of the buildings in HK add an extra vibrancy to a city that really does not need it. Good views are to the east of where the main ferry drops you off in Kowloon.
Touring HK. Liked everything including the crowded subways. Mt. Victoria, the Financial district, the waterfront, the shopping. The "old" airport was the PITTS.

Hong Kong's first image. Think Hong Kong and the first image that flashes across your mind is its beautiful neon lit skyline. All the big cities of the world have some beautiful buildings but what sets Hong Kong's skyline apart is the exquisite sea in the front and enigmatic mountains in the back. Night or day it has its own beauty. Sit back, relax and enjoy the beautiful buildings of Hong Kong.
Just nice. Some say it is cheesy but I say it I'd do nice. Can't help loving HK every time I see the skyline ESP when travelling on the Star Ferry

Pick your night and take the 15 bus. The way most people go to the Peak is by the Peak Tram which usually has long queues. Better to take Bus 15 and go over the top of Hong Kong for a spectacular ride that takes in both Aberdeen and Hong Kong views along the way. You can take the Peak Tram back with less queueing to deal with. It goes without saying that clear skies can make a huge difference. One suggestion - after you have done the views everyone does, why not walk a half Km along the track to the left of the Peak Tram building and get some spectacular views of the Western part of HK Island. Buses are easy in HK and always terminate at an MTR station so you can never get lost.

Breathtaking... No other way to describe it. Breathtaking..I was stating at the JW Marriott and my view of Hong Kong caused me to sleep with the room blinds open so that I could savor in the view all night long.

Light show on the Hong Kong Cultural Centre. Right now there is a wonderful light show on the wall of the Cultural Centre at Tsim Sha Tsui. It's free, it's on the harbour front and right now the weather is really pleasant. Not too hot, not too cold. You also get a great view of the Hong Kong skyline. Go around 8:00 pm so you can also see the Symphony of Lights, it's a treat that's on every night in HK.
Tsim Tsa Tsui. Great view from of HK skyline at Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade. Best around 5-7 pm with light show and twilight.
Breathtaking. Always amazed with the view from victoria harbour, one of the best in the world, the view at night definitely soothing
Iconic view!. A picture that I will never forget and never grow tired of looking at. The Hong Kong skyline with the mountains in the background is an amazing thing to look at!

Must see if you are in HK. Just one of those things that you must do when you visit HK. It is a beautiful walk around the harbour foreshore with the bonus of the light show. Best of all it was totally free.

wonderful view. we got lucky and had a clear view on what we were told as one of the rare occasions given how well known Hong Kong is supposed to be polluted. The bus ride up the peak was great with amazing view. Just a note: The bus ride may not be for the faint hearted given how the bus drivers spped through the seemingly narrow lanes but it's safe.

Excellent view. If you're already visiting the peak and Madame Tussauds, this one is definitely worth doing. Its just few escalators away from Madame Tussauds. The view of the skyline is amazing. Make sure you go In the evening, as the view is best post sunset. You could set out at 4-4:30. You would easily be back down to Central by 8:30pm.
Wonderful lights. The skyline is stunning with buildings of all different shapes , colours and sizes and lit uop at night it is an amazing sight .

Impressive. This is a 'must do' for tourists, to see the Hong Kong skyline from the Kowloon side. There is considerable crowds with the same idea. You can get there easily by MTR (metro) but I suggest at least one trip by Star Ferry. Get there about 5 PM, it's still light, and see the scene transform into night-time by 6.30 PM.
Amazing. Feel like home to see it. Hong Kong is really my city. Wish I could spend my retirement there watching the skyline and exploring the outlaying islands,. The place is special.

Views spoilt by haze (or smog?). Disappointed that during the daytime, views of the skyline was spoilt by the haze or smog or a combination of the two, even from The Peak. Night views of the lit up city from high up were much more impressive but nevertheless not entirely clear of the haze.
Only in Hong Kong. You can't beat a view like this; no matter from which angle, direction, or how you're viewing the Hong Kong Skyline, it's amazing.

Beautiful view. The laser light show at 8pm nightly is a must see. Most of the buildings in HK island is lighted up. Dancing lights and lasers go with the music for a few minutes. You can also see passing boats and cruise liners all lighted up
The 8pm Light Show. Nice skyline with all the different shapes and sizes. If you go to the Harbour for 8pm they do a laser light show which is pretty cool.
Superb. On a clear day one can get a good sight of the skyline. In the evening Hong Kong skyline comes to life with Symphony of Lights, a ten minute music and laser lights based program.

Pretty Impressive!. In my opinion, because it is so spread out and so big, I still give the NYC skyline the edge over Hong Kong. That being said, some of those buildings are pretty impressive and there are so many of them clustered together. Everywhere you look there are tall buildings all around you and make you feel so small. Pretty cool to had the chance to be in one of the largest cities in the world!

Probabaly the best skyline in the world. No night-time skyline matches this one. You can view it from the Kowloon side with the peak in the background, from the Island side looking across to Kowloon, or from the peak looking down on all of it. At night it's a glittering array of multi-coloured buildings, with music to boot if you're stood on the Kowloon side promenade.
Skyline that gives you a neck-ache. Beautiful skyline that is further enhanced with the Symphony of Lights show. Standing next to the Star Walk of Fame the skyline with lights looks beautiful.

Iconic. All major world cities have their own look and the island of HK has added to theirs with a laser show each evening that adds to the already bright neon buildings. The view is such that one doesn't want to close the room curtains so that you can look out at the city and harbor at any time of the dY or night

You Just Got to Love the Skyline Here. I have been to Hong Kong many times and have always felt it has one of the most spectacular skylines anywhere. There are many ways to view it. On this trip, we took the Star Ferry to one of the outlying islands, Lantau (Mui Wo). Take the ferry and park yourself in the stern of the boat and watch the skyline from there. Not only is it a pleasant 45 minute ride each way, but you get to see the skyline from a different angle and also some of the ships around the harbor, and you cannot beat the price.
Harbor. the most beautiful view ever seen in a city.In the daytime but at sure night. What a athmosphere :-)

Amazing!!. An evening walk along the promenade is a must if you are in Hong Kong. The view is amazing. We took a long evening walk after dinner, it was a warm evening and the walk was romantic and relaxing.

HK is not a romantic city, but the skyline.... The skyline makes you feel just great, relaxed and entertained by the creative projections on the buildings, a MUST GO, no need of getting on the ferry, perfectly enjoyable from the high sidewalk of the pick (the mall), or from the front shore.

One of the best views in the world. This really is a breath taking skyline. Especially at nightIt is can be viewed from the Avenue of Stars, Star Ferry, one of the many hotels or restaurants.I have been going to Hong Kong for 10 years now and will never ever get tired of seeing this sight.

Fab. Take the Star Ferry from HK island to Tsim Sha Tsui and turn right when you get off ferry to walk the waterfront promanade. Look across to see the towers on HK island light up at dusk. Music and laser light shower at 8pm which we found dissapointing.

Literally Impossible to Miss. Along with Victoria Harbour, this IS Hong Kong. The skyline is absolutely stunning, especially when the buildings are lit at night. With several promenades on both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon, there really isn't a bad view in the house.
breathtaking. boarded a boat at one of the piers late evening after sunset and set sail to see the breathtaking light show of the hong kong sky linethe coordination of the light show is superb

One of the best in the world. What is there to dislike? There's simply nothing else like it. Hong Kong is a special place, up there with the best and the likes of New York, Rio di Janero and Singapore. And this is coming from someone who grew up in Sydney!

Amazing. The Hong Kong skyline is simply amazing. Whether you're taking it in from ground level from the Avenue of Stars, or from the Peak - or one of the many high rise restaurants, it's simply stunning.
Amazing view. Amazing view! Every time we visit Hong Kong we make a pictures of this view. The best is to see from Promenade of Stars.

Beautiful Skyline. Visit during the day from the Harbour. Providing the day is not too smoggy you will have a beautiful view across the water of the Hong Kong Island sky line.At night, the building are brightly lit up in an array of colours illuminating the vast skyline. You can also view the skyline from the point and look down on the impressive buildings. A must see whilst in Hong Kong.Make an effort to see the skyline both during the day and lit up at night. It won't disappoint.

Hong Kong Skyline. I was totally in awe every night I saw the buildings all lit up in the evening. It was so beautiful and even through the day seeing all the sky scrapers everywhere you looked! They donimated the skyline.
WOW. Loved the skyline, went up the peak to see it at day and night, a definate must see whilst in Hong Kong

One of the best in the world. See during day on the walk along the TST harbor and see at night from either the Sheraton HKG Sky Lounge, Intercontinental Lobby Bar or the Peninsula bar, Felix. Go to the The Peak only if you have time; it is covered in tourists and can be extremely busy; depends on the day for the view from The Peak. Some days are very foggy.

Amazing !. The skyline is not only massive but beautiful ! The architecture is varied, with some structures being quite dramatic ! Nighttime from the Kowloon side is inspiring. I enjoyed ending each day in the lobby restaurant of the Intercontinental, which has a perfect harbor skyline view.
fabulous. You have to see it to appreciate it, From the Victoria Peak to the water front of Kowloon, basically from any where you have this unbelievable view.

See it at night!. Stunningly colourful at night. The towers' geometric shapes are stark in the lights that play within and between them. The lightshow from the Kowloon waterfront is worthwhile for any tourist to watch and wonder at. Additionally, looking down from Victoria Peak onto the rising megaliths makes you realise what an amazing place this is.

Hong Kong Skyline. One of the best skyline's in the world as viewed from the Kowloon (mainland china) side of Victoria Harbor. Arrive at 8:00 PM and see the laser light show. Laser light rays go from building to building across Victoria Harbor. Quite a sight to see.
Just need a clear night.... During the day, it was so hazy, not good for photos. The night had great options. Madera Hotel has a lounge on the 29th floor which had an amazing view.
Breathtaking. The view and skline is amazing, whether from the Star Ferry, the Peak or the harbour side the view never fails to amaze.
Asian Giant. A must see, the skyscrappers are amazing.The Brits,did a really good job :-). Hong Kong simply displays high level efficiency

Great Skyline. On a clear day , dont miss the sound and light show, preferable from the Kowloon side.
Another way to see the skyline on both sides is to take the ferry. recommended
Asia's World City. Hong Kong Skyline is one of the best in the world, i've been to a few big metropolitan cities, by far Hong Kong is still one of my favorite

One of the Best in the World. Hong Kong has an iconic skyline with its set of skyscrapers. I would recommend taking the cable car to visit The Peak to get the best views of the city, the skyline, and Victoria Harbor. If possible, try and visit on a clear day because on the day we went to The Peak it was really foggy, but it was still fun and the views were still great. Most areas with the best view get crowded throughout the day, but stay patient and allow for plenty of time for your visit.Be sure to arrange your schedule to be able to see the laser light show that takes place at 8pm. Definitely should not be missed.

Awesome View. The Best time to visit this place is in night, when you can see the HK skyline which is like WOW :) .. Even the drive to this place is really good, you crosses the busiest streets of Hk and then you enter a silent zone which is nice .. While driving you can start enjoying the Skyline view :)
Crowded..Over Crowded.... Was very over crowded... Being weekend was jam packed...Try to go on regular days.. Was only able to see hands and cameras..

Really good at night . Came here during the day and it was a beautiful view. Came here again at night at around 7:30pm in order to get a good spot for the 8:00pm laser light show.It was the best!!One of the coolest things I've seen here by far. Will be coming back every night while I am here DO NOT MISS OUT!Come early so you get a good spot

Spectacular at night!. We were lucky enough to stay at the Ritz Carlton and we had spectacular view of the skyline from our room. Daytime is fine but it is mesmerizing at night and a total, Must See! Skyscrapers fill the skyline of Hong Kong and one cannot imagine how they transform themselves into the spectacular light displays that you can view in the evening. Make sure to view from the Kowloon side!

Lovely. Everything about Hong Kong was great. I loved it and would love to go again. The underground was easy to use and so clean and the whole experience of small shopping malls underground was lovely. Also being able to use your 'octopus' train card in the small shops was a wonderful idea. I could go on forever about this place!!! GO IF U HAVE THE CHANCE!

Spectacular. Extraordinary is an understatement! Make sure you visit this place after sunset, the skyline is breathtaking in deed! I highly recommend to all who passes by HK a transition to Victoria Harbour for a light show every night starting from 8pm.

Breathtaking views from Kowloon. The views from our hotel and the harbor area of the Kowloon city were breathtaking and not to be missed. No wonder this is the top attraction in Hongkong. While you are in the harbor area, take time to get your profiles drawn by local artists, listen to local musicians performing at various points and needless to say, take great pictures.
Always good. Been coming to HK for many years around 6 times a year. The skyline never fails to impress. Also I always stay at the Panorama hotel on the 30th floor, so I get a good permanent view

Great Experience. There is two options to go there. Use tram if you want to feel the exciting of riding an old tram or use your foot if you like hiking. Come early in the morning to avoid long que. Wifi also available at the top.

Hong Kong. Getting around Hong Kong is tricky, The best way is by subway. easy to learn and cheap. We got sold a big Red Bus Pass, which is great, but you spend all day waiting for the bus to turn up! It works if you have time. Otherwise get a taxi cost is more but you get there. Do take the train across the border into China worth the trip

It's just very impressive... You can't miss Hong Kong Skyline when you're in Hong Kong. Incredible skyscrapers all over the city and impressive light shows along the harbour.Avenue of Stars / Victoria Harbour and The Peak is the most famous tourist spots to witness the impressive skyline.
Stunning skyline, best viewed at night. There are several places to view the stunning Hong Kong skyline. I'd recommend the Peak and the TST waterfront near to the Avenue of Stars

only a time pass. i think you can have much better skyline experiences rather than wasting your time here. the same view from the top floor has nothing new to offer. go if you have never been to any skyline before.
Breathtaking. Loved it,even on a cloudy day,breathtaking no matter how many times you see it. Always amazes me and always look forward to going back
A must see. Make sure you get there on time for the light show, a few bars along the skyline to enjoy after! Lots of photo ops.
Old and new. Incredible skyscrapers, but if you walk though Hong Kong Park, a feel of the original colonial settlement is still to be had.
almost perfect. Watched laser light show which is fun but probably once is enough! Extremely pretty for an evening walk along the promenade.

Best skyline. Sky scrappers with fancy lights seeing their own reflections in Victoria Harbor is quite a sight to watch. Skyline is best seen post evening. We were fortunately staying closer to harbor during our trip & so keep going to this place every evening.

Great view, nice place to chill. Really nice views, very relaxing. Grab a drink and just sit and watch. The lights from the buildings, the calmness of the water plus a pretty cool light show adds for a cool experience. Worth jumping on the star ferry as it costs about a pound and adds to the experience!

Take a harbour cruise. Evening on the harbour is the best time - watch the lights come on aboard an evening cruise boat. We took the tour around the harbour and ending at Jumbo restaurant. Great night out
Impressive. Watched laser light show which is fun but probably once is enough! Extremely pretty for an evening walk along the promenade.
Magical. Just couldn't get over the amount of high-rise buildings built in such limited land available, it was an exciting experience

The lights fantasic.... It was an easy walk from the hotel to the area where the light show was going to take place, and as the evening was warm we didn't even take a coat. It was a great show, although pretty short. We enjoyed the lights, the music, and the friendly crowd. This is something you should try.

A spectacle to watch and be there at 8pm for a light and laser show with music.. You will have to take a ferry if you are staying in HK mainland and that in itself is an experience where you get to see the skyline from the waters.

Picture-perfect. I visited this attraction on the Kowloon side of the city and coupled it with the Symphony of Lights that starts at 20.00. It is picture perfect and postcard quality. It was as clear as the pictures you see in travel magazines and there is something magical about the view and atmosphere.Make sure you have this on your list of must-sees in Hong Kong.

The only way is up. Space is at a premium, so tall thin buildings abound giving Hong Kong a unique skyline. Best viewed from either Kowloon looking back across the harbour, or from the Peak to get the view of both the island and Kowloon skylines.

STUNNING WHEN YOU CAN SEE IT. And that about sums it up. It *is* an absolutely stunning skyline, but the smog and pollution from mainland China that blankets the city so often means it is often hard to see. The air was putrid when we were there; at best it was awful. Hong Kongers (and Macanese) need to urgently agitate the mainland to literally clean up its act or people will start avoiding both Hong Kong and Macau. Friends of mine went over to Guangzhou and said it was even worse over there.

Just like I imagined. To have the chance to look at Hong Kong skyline at night was one of my dreams. Fortunately I could do it and it was really amazing to see so many lights and so many buildings. From Kowloon side, near the watch tower you can catch a nice glimpse of HK side.

Awesome!!!!!. *) Amazing skyline, probably the best in the world.*) Best seen from TST Promenade or Avenue of Stars.*) There is a Symphony of Lights show that happens in the evening at 8 PM where the Buildings Light up during the 15 minute.For a detailed trip list feel free to visit http://hongkongandmacauitinerary.blogspot.in/2014/10/hong-kong-macau-itinerary.html
Amazing night skyline. I've been to a lot of cities but none beat the Hong Kong skyline. The skyline is amazing at night. I love this city!
WOW!. it was all lit up like Christmas. On my first trip 20 years ago to Hong Kong, we flew in beside the city. That was the most exciting.
Do not miss the lightshow. Do not miss the lightshow at 8 p.m. The skyline itself is breathtaking, when all the buildings are lit it is even more impressive and the show is the summum!
Do not miss. A great time coming here to enjoyed great atmosphere. The lights and buidlings were splendid at night. People here were friendly, too. Just visit this place at late afternoon is great!
Pretty but not spectacular. The light show on the skyline was pretty and impressive but just viewing from Kowloon was sufficient. There is not much to add.
Magic. Absolutely beautiful harbour and the light show is spectacular. The buildings lit up at night are fantastic.
Nice view. It was beautiful sight to see at night, when the buildings omit light. It would be great if they put a light spectacle here as additional attraction.
Stunning. My business partner took me to Hong Kong Skyline, it was awesome, especially when you go on the ferry and Kowloon become the most wonderful city in the world.

Peak Tram. 2nd time we have visited and loved it.Annoying that it is cash only when you buy your tickets and that it is double the price to go to the very top for the best views (which is not made explicit when you go in) but still a great experience. The tram is a real piece of history and the whole family loved it. The views are 2nd to none. Amazing.

Smog ridden skyline. The whole time we were in Hong Kong the skyline was filled with smog. It is unpleasant to look at a smoggy skyline. Night time is the only time you can get a true picture of what the skyline is like.
Spectacular views of HK. Take a tram to Victoria Peak or the ferry between HK Island and Kowloon to get spectacular views of Hong Kong Harbor.

Light show vantage point. We visited HK for three days and dotted between Kow Loon and HK Island. The most impressive method is The Star Ferry. The ferry also provides the ideal vantage point to see the light show beamed across the buildings on the harbour.I can recommend a window seat as the ferry trundles back to HK Island just before 8pm. Bucket list stuff when rounding off a busy day in a vibrant city. Fantastic.
Stunning. We made it our priority to see the skyline on the first night and it was amazing, in the same way the New York skyline defines the city the HK skyline does the same thing.
Truly magnificent view od Hongkong skyline. Just hop on the ferry and admire the beautiful Hongkong and Kowloon skyline. During my short stay here I could not resist to take it several times.
See it from Tsim Sha Tsui. Always go to TST to talk a picture every trip.I must have dozens now considering the number of times I visit Hong Kong.
AMAZING VIEW!!!!. Just amazing!! You better see it yourself ;) For me ... It's really beautiful. Stay in a higher up hotel or go to the Peak. You'll get amazing view.

Always superb. It is great to have a drink in a hotel bar with the skyline spread out before you as night falls on the city. However, this time the polluted haze was present and the lighted skyline not as nice as before.
As good as it gets. It's a skyline. You know what it should look like. This is what it does look like. On a harbour too and that's always nice. Just ask anyone who lives in Sydney.
Beautiful. It's lovely down at the waterfront during the evening. I'd skip the Symphony of Lights though. Was a bit of a let down.

Amazing how it changes every two years. Hong Kong has added 15 world-class skyscrapers and high-rise buildings on both the HK side and Kowloon side. The Hyatt Hotel in Kowloon looms high above the crowded shopping area with spectacular views. Actually if you go to Disneyland and take the Parachute Drop at night you get a great view of the city lights.

Beautiful view from Kowloon. Walk on the Kowloon side and watch the Hong Kong skyline , enjoy the light show in the evening,
Amazing...
Skyline Is Breathtaking. Loved viewing the skyline. A bit crowded, but beautiful buildings and vistas to the sea and mountains.

AMAZING Skyline!. I have travelled the world: Mexico, Singapore, Australia, Canada, China and America.And by far this is the most amazing skyline I have ever seen it is so large and full of colours at night!If you visit Hong Kong Victoria Harbour is the first place to go! Epically book a boat tour for the Symphony Of Lights which is the worlds largest pernament light show.Would recommend it to all!
Beautiful Night Sky. I believe that with all the skyscrapers in Hong Kong the night skies are a photographer's boon. There appears to be over one thousand high rise buildings, 30-50 stories high.
Great city. Excellent view of city as light fades from Bulldogs and Dog House, etc., although drinks getting pricier.
favourite place. This is my home town and my favourite place. I also like the peak where you can see the whole city. You can see the firework and light show from here.

Worth seeing. This is a view that everyone should experience. Our hotel was located just next to Victoria harbour so it was part of our evening walk to stop and see the stunning lights from across the harbour. Magnificient.
A must click. The Hong Kong skyline is definitely a must click opportunity. And the best place to do this is from the Avenue of Stars.

Cityscape. fabulous skyline - nothing like it in the world!
nightly light show was lovely. decent view from the hotel

Awesome. Awesome view. Good stroll after dinner, to enjoy the cool breeze and night views of Hong Kong Island skyscrapers. Beautiful lightings on buildings. Highly recommended especially for first time visitors.

Beautiful Skyline, Especially at Night. The skyline was amazing, especially at night. The nightly laser show, which starts at 8 PM local is slightly over rated, though well attended by tourists and locals alike.

breathtaking skyline at night. Beautiful at night. The laser light show does not add much to the already spectacular view seen at night.You don't need to go see the skyline during the crowded time when the laser light show is on,because as it is , its already beautiful to gaze at even without the lase lights. A must see when you visit hong kong. Stroll along the avenue of stars.
Hazy. Unfortunately the skies were hazy, like almost always in HK. Still pretty impressive! From Kow Loon side you see most of the sky line, from the ferry it's pretty amazing as well.
Skyline. Amazing we walked around to enjoy the views, listen to music and check out the street stalls. Make sure you view the Avenue of stars as well as the light show.
Breath Taking. This is a must see the view is amazing. You can shop eat a little ice cream. We loved it would go again.
Best Skyline in the world. The view from the Kowloon side to the Island is mind boggling. Great atmosphere at night with the laser show at 8pm. Just sometimes to many people!!

where to catch great views. Two great places to view the HK skylines; In Kowloon viewing HK island:: on the 2nd floor outside balcony of Ocean terminal or the Star Ferry terminus. IN HK viewing Kowloon; bar area on rooftop of the IFC mall.
Magic. We had the best view from our third floor suite at the Intercontinental ! We kept the curtains open 24/7 because we did not want to miss this view! The Hong Kong skyline is truly beautiful!
Amazing experience with the light show. This was the best part of my stay at Hongkong. Watched the light show on the traditional boat drive. Was an awesome experience.
Amazing skyline, best in the world!. Awesome view at night from Kowloon side. Don't bother about the laser show though! The skyline is the real attraction

Best Skyline ever!. Ok, I might be a tad over enthused here, but this is really spectacular and there are so many ways to enjoy it. The trip with the Star Ferry is always a treat just looking at it .. the placement that you can enjoy the sunset in just the right direction ... spectacular from both sides or up from the peak. The hills in the background (something that i.e. my next favourite skyline, New York, does not have)
Shortened laser lights show. A spectacular light display of the HK skyline. A brief laser light show coordinated the lighting on several skyscrapers, but after 5 minutes ended
cool experience. thrilling experience. it was a pleasant experience to enjoy it. a great tourist attraction. wonderfull view from the top.

Loved it!. Let's face it! All of us seen image of Hong Kong's skyline at least once in a lifetime. And yes, it is as spectacular as one would imagine. I've enjoyed it especially after sunset, with the evening show when all the lasers/neons of the skyline are synchronized with the music :)

I don't know how this gets to be no. 1 in the world. It's nice to sit by the water and look at the buildings opposite, but it is not a GREAT view. (I'd give it 3.5 = good, if I could.) Compare it to the view across the Thames or the Seine, or Shanghai's Pudong viewed from the Bund, and it's hard to see why anyone would make this their number one. Plus there's too little shade, and too few places to sit, and now the ridiculous Avenue of Stars.

Get a harbour view room.. If you can get a room with a view, you will remember it forever. Hong Kong, on either side of the harbour is full of big buildings. We stayed on the Kowloon side at Marco Polo which gave us the opportunity to look out of our room at the Island skyline. Never tired of looking at it. What a view.

One of the most recognisable views in the world. Of course the skyline with the peak behind it is world class. The major reason for going up the peak or or taking the Star Ferry across Victoria Bay. The much publicized light show (8pm every night) is very overrated. Actually very hard to notice the difference.

What a fantastic skyline. The skyline is great- when seen from the Kowloon side=simply amazing. Nice to just stand there and look at all the buildings. At night is even better-they are all lit up in wonderful colors. Also nice to observe the skyline from the Peake.
Impressive at night. The skyline rivals dubai. So many buildings are lit up at night. the view from Kowloon is amazing. Also God from a boat.
Allow enough time to see the big Buddha. Great Views of Hong Kong however we never left ourselves enough time to explore the top of the mountain and climb the Big Buddha!!

Hong Skyline best in Asia. Wow the word come naturally when you were going through a train to Madame Tussaud , Hong Kong Peak and you see the beauty of HK Sky line with lot of eye catching ultimate man made lighting structures one of the best in asia i can say
Light show. Light show starts at 8pm every night except if there's a typhoon in town. Occurs from both the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island side, so you can catch different views.

Go anywhere that is on a hillside and enjoy the view. We went at night for the real experience and the view is wonderful when it is clear, You can watch all the lights changing on the buildings and the activity on the harbour is mind boggling.
It is a wonderful view and look like fairy land.

See the haze. Hong Kong is infamous for its air pollution. A view of the skyline is a great way to see it. In an odd way, it's a sight in its own right. Your view of buildings across the harbour will be obscured. See it during the day and also during night, where the lights of the buildings are attractive. The level of pollution tends to vary, and you may want to visit more than once if you want a relatively unobscured view.

Can't miss this if you come to HK. When HK is shown in movies and on tv, this is the image portrayed, so you cannot miss it. Buildings are lit up at night making for a dazzling display of lights and architecture. Best seen from Kowloon side in my opinion (as the bigger buildings are on the Island).
Blue sky almost every day. Nice weather on Oct this year. Blue sky almost every day. Excellent for photo shooting and countryside tour.

Pollution Spoils View of Hong Kong's Spectacular Skyline. Although I have been to Hong Kong many times over the past 30 years or so I have never seen it through such a haze of pollution as during my two day stay in October. It is still very spectacular by night but pretty awful during day time.

Majestic. The only thing I can say about this was it was truly an amazing view
Be it from the tower or the tour boat; you absolutely don't realise time passing (and I'm not a guy who loves this kind of $tuff 😜)
Great View. This gondola ride takes around 25 minutes over the airport and pretty mountains. It can be very windy so take a cardigan ladies.
Night lights amazing with laser show at night. Enjoyed the modern buildings, especially at night with the lights and laser show, also the night bus tour through Kowloon is good.
Amaazing. Thought it was a little expensive until I rode it and realised how long it was. Amazing views and not to be missed on a visit to Hong Kong.

Oh what a sight!. We walked a short distance to the west of the Peak Tram stop on a narrow street for a much better view of the city. Bypass the Wok at the top of the tram and walk west on Lugard Road to the third viewing area. You will be glad you did.
Spectacular Hong Kong. Wonderful environment - great people! The views from our Harbour View room and the lounge and restaurant were amazing!
Super views. Some awesome views from 'the peak' and Skyline - excellent in the evening with views of city all lit up.
A breathtaking view. Hong Kong Skyline is one of the most impressive skulines I have seen. A huge city on the edge of an island!

Amazing!. Beautiful, breath-taking and unforgettable. I will never forget the Hong Kong skyline, all the lights, adverts, glowing and proud buildings. The red boats dotted along the harbour. Very picturesque, romantic and pretty.
I hope to go back again!
The Light Show. I was expecting something special, unfortunately I felt it was very out dated ......it was something like Electric Light Orchestra concert from the 70's

Incredible scene. The Hong Kong Skyline is great in either direction and it doesn't mater if it is day or night.
The mountains make an incredible backdrop to the city.

Light, Lights and more lights.. A very busy and bright skyline at night. You can spend a lot of time trying to read all the advertising or just enjoy the collective effect. The waterway is just as busy with boats of all shapes and sizes.

Great from Kowloon Shore at Night. Definitely be on the Kowloon shoreline/avenue of the stars at 8pm for the light show on the Hong Kong side. Lots of people, but a great view and a must-do if you visit.
They have done a good job photoshopping. The skyline of Victoria harbour is very impressive, however don't believe that the symphony of lights is ever as clear as in all the pictures published.
Great photos. Can't be fault just wish we had seen it from the Peak at night but will certainly go again. We went down to central pier and did an amazing boat tour at night very much worth it.

My asian adventure. I loved Hong Kong. The Harbor was so beautiful at night.I loved riding the Ferry. In Stanley, I didn"t even feel like I was in Hong Kong.I walked alot,and I didn:t like it when I got lost. I always asked someone the right way,and found it pretty fast.I loved the view at the Peak. I loved going thru the Peninsula Hotel.

awesome!. whether you see it from the Hong Kong Island side or the Kowloon, the expansive skyline dotted with the some of the best architectural jewels will mesmerize you. if you want to go a little lavish appreciating the skyline, I would recommend the harbour cruise. Otherwise an evening stroll along the avenue of stars is a lovely experience. there is no particular point on the ground which gives you a better view. you can stand anywhere and just fall in love with one of the world's best cityscape.There are, however, a few aerial views that gives you an even more brilliant view. Like, if you go to sky pier or the sky100 observation desk. One can try these spots only in the evening.

Beautiful Photo spots. The view from the Kowloon side (Avenue of Stars) is stunning at night. Great photo spots. Just walking down the avenue of stars for free is definitely better than doing the cruise. The sound & light show can be missed.
Amazing. We spent a lot of time on the harbour (day and night) looking at at the ever changing skyline. The symphony of lights was great.

On a clear day the skyline is amazing. The Hong Kong skyline would be one on the best in the world but between the smog and humidity sometimes it's hard to see! However, on a clear night it does look fantastic. A good way to see it is on the Aqualuna where you can go out on the Harbour both day and night for a great view. If you choose the night trip then you will see the light show that starts at 8pm.
Evening light show is fun. Each evening harbour light show is staged when skyscrapers come to life. Take star carry to Kowloon to get best view
Great in the evening. It is great to look at the skyline of HK island from Kowloon, especially near the walk of stars in the twilight or when a storm is approaching.

Good on a good day. Hong Kong has a wonderful skyline and in the evening around 8pm much of the harbour is lit up. The skyline can best be seen from the Star Ferry. This is another wonderful Hong Kong experience.

This is a MUST. But you must pick a day when there is no pollution. It is a great walk up going by mid level escalators to the tram. This is a great experience. We spent hours at the skyline. So much to see and great opportunities for photos. There were always crowds waiting to get down in the tram and it was too hot to line up. They need a covered area fir this. Decided to walk down. This is another MUST DO.

Amazing Skyline. The tall buildings of Hong Kong are defintely amazing. Some of the talest office towers are here and some are very stylish. Use the ferry to have a nice view to both sides of the harbour.

"Amazing View". We had an opportunity to see the Skyline at night, during the day and in the rain! Unfortunately, the fireworks show was cancelled due to the rain. This view is amazing at night. We took the little ferry accross it was was so beautiful!

Fabulous Setting. We got to see the skyline at night when we first arrived for the light show and of course later during the day and from Victoria peak.The light show is not really a big deal..they make too much of it in the various travel digests but its a great atmosphere with hundreds of people gathered there to view and supported by background music...when you visit HK its at something to see.Its very nice in the broad daylight.
Breathtaking view . It is breathtaking view and can't get enough to take photos. But the light show is not amazing. We even didn't know the laser show was over as we thought that was just a start.

Wonderful, especially at night. Beautiful Skyline, especially during the symphony of Lights and Sound.
Very impressive during the day.
A must-see.

Beautiful!. We enjoyed the skyline from our Hotel-The Upper House and the Peak. The skyline is wonderful especially at night when the buildings are lit. It was also interesting to watch the typhoon come in across the harbour.

Nice View. I was impressed by the Hong Kong Skyline! I went in the afternoon and then again in the evening for the light show (not good!). It was quite impressive both times but especially at night by the star ferry. I could easily chill out here for half an hour and people watch. Not the most impressive I've seen (Shanghai was amazing) but well worth the visit.

great view. If you love new York city, you will love Hong Kong, it is bustling, exhilarating, tons of store, food is authentic and like nothing you have had at your local Chinese restaurant. Prices are good, the people are welcoming and quite friendly.(they love and cater to Americans)Must go to the top of Victoria Harbor and see the view from above. Stayed at the Regal Kowloon Hotel on 71 Mody Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Kowloon, Hong Kong. It's 5 star hotel, exquisite and you can walk to see the city and the back streets, were there are a lot of tiny shops and that's an experience.

World-class city. This is one of the most beautiful skylines anywhere in the world. I have seen most of the most spectacular skylines: NYC, San Francisco, Capetown, Sydney, etc... Hong Kong leads all of them!
Impressive. Beautiful from harbour day and night. Enjoyed the ferry trips especially at night. Enjoyable walks along the foreshore.
Hong Kong must do. This is a must do when in Hong Kong. Best views of the city, and a great interactive personal media to explain the history and landmarks.
Wow and Wow. The Hong Kong skyline is fab!!!! BIG TIP .... Go to the Eitz Carlton and take the lift to the 118th floor for drinks in the highest bar ever!! Well worth it ..... The view is stunning.

Memorable and breathtaking. The evening light and laser show is awesome - find a nice spot with a bottle of wine and enjoy! One of my best experiences was sitting in the jacuzzi with a cocktail as the ship left the harbour at just the right time to enjoy the lazer show! Wow oh wow oh wow!
Skyscrapers everywhere!. If you're into urban landscape and architecture, then this place is the bomb! Skyscrapers everywhere!

drop everything and go there. so beautiful urban and mystical place tha Hong Kong is, a must go at least once in a life time, that skyline is the best from Tsim Sha Tsui or from the Peak day or night !
Hong Kong Skyline. The skyline of Hong Kong was simply Breath taking, unbelievable and amazing !!!! If you are lucky enough to have a room with a view, then savour it and take lots of photos
hong kong break. loved the statues of buddha and bruce lee. the ferry around the harbour was very good and interesting
So nice. Had a great view of Central Skyline when I was there - when I go back next month with stay in Central and look back the other direction.
Breath taking!. Excellent trip around the harbour. Colours are fantastic, this is a must to get some great photos and videos.
Hong Kong is a memorable city. Exciting and memorable, nothing to dislike, Hong Kong people respectful of travellers and very helpful. Shopping fantastic and Canton cuisine delicious.
Stunning views topped with unparalleled personalized service. We enjoyed clear blue skies each day and the views from our room and the rooftop Ozone bar were amazing
Amazingly Beautiful. Whether day or night the skyline is beautiful with so many tall buildings and in the evening so many colorful lighted buildings

Amazing. One of the most beautiful harbours in the world, Victoria Harbour and the Hong Kong skyline are world famous. Most people go during the day but it's worth seeing at night time when the laser show comes on and the neon lights on the buildings are switched on. There are multiple vantage points through out the city from the foreshore itself to up in the hills of Hong Kong and they're all worth visiting. If you're staying at one of the hotels on the waterfront, definitely go for a harbour view room.
Amazing Skyline. Loved Victorias's Peak and Drinks on the 118th floor of the Ritz Carlton! The day and night perspective should not be missed.

wow. The skyline is incredible, you see something different everytime you look
The symphony of lights wasnt quite as "breathtaking" as I was lead to believe.

See it from the Inercontinental Hotel bar in evening. Best view of the nightly HK skyline light show. Get to the bar early to stake out a good seat. If you stay at the Intercontimental and you have upgraded to the concierge level, the private lounge offers the same great view.If you are on a budget you can see it all from the Walk of Stars behind thE Intercontinental, but get there early to get close to the railing
Lovely to visit ... you see all Hong Kong from it!. Desliked nothing .... loved the view, the gift shop and the building contents (shops, cafes, restaurants, etc)
