Stunning!. We went twice during daytime and twice at night time. It"s as if you will never get tired of the stunning skyline. Riding on star ferry gives a different perspective. Just awesome!

Asian New York. The view really is very beautiful. In good weather in the evening, you can take great pictures. The best time for photos - one hour before sunset, when the sun sets behind the Lantau and skyscrapers lit with lights.

a trip to the top. This an amazing structure at the end of the Peak Tramway. there a shops, restaurants and amazing views. Buy a ticket at the tram desk for journey and entrance to the skyline and this lets you up to the viewing deck. you will be amazed

Probably the best Skyline in the World!. I have been living since 7 years in Hong Kong and I still pass the skyline every occasion I get! Most of the time Hong Kong is pretty hazy but if you are lucky enough you might get a clear view on the skyline. Every evening on 8pm there will be a light show including music on mandarin, cantonese or in english. If you are here for chinese new year you should catch the fireworks which is very impressive, not to be mistaken for the normal new years eve firework which is not impressive at all... There are some food stands across the Avenue of Stars but usually just for snacks like dried squid, check out the handprints of the Hong Kong stars while you are there to find famous people like Jacky Chan, Jet Li and Chow Yun Fat.

Spectacular Light and sound show!. It's absolutely remarkable to see the mixture of people for every culture and nation together to enjoy a few moments of awe! The music was accompanied by dancing light upon the buildings and bay. The floating boats and vessels enhanced the charming evening. Go for it !
Nice night view. The skyline is nice, recommend spend not more than 2 hours. You can enjoy the view and wind at the same time.

Essence of Hong Kong. The Victorial Harbor and the Skyline is quintessential Hong Kong. Every visit has to include a stroll along the waterfront. We saw it from both the Kowloon side and the Island side. At night the skyline is better seen from the Kowloon side. The water front is pretty lively after night fall. People line up to see the Symphony of Lights, which basically is a synchronized laser show projected from various buildings on the Island side. Frankly my wife and I were pretty disappointed by the light show. It's not that interesting. We wish we did not spend several hours to catch it. Going back to the main target of this review, the HK Skyline is a must-go if you plan to see Hong Kong.
Aweson. This has got to be one of the best showcase of skyline to the places Ive visited. Be sure to bring a good camera when visiting HK!

Hong Kong travels 2014. Hong Kong was a very exciting city, from very old and unique to very modern ... the harbour looked stunning at night with all the lights glistening on the water, to the colourful laser lights bouncing from one building to another at night about 8pm
Something else!. I have come across many skylines in my life time but this went for kms and was asthetically pleasing.

8pm is the time to be at the harbour. After a long day sightseeing I was so pleased that I made the decision to stay for the light show and stood at the Star Ferry terminus to watch. it was superb - like New Year's Eve! The next day these breathtaking buildings looked so drab without their vibrant lights.

Forget New York..... The Hong Kong skyline, to me, is the most spectacular in the world. It has funky skyscrapers much like Shinjuku in Tokyo but what sets it apart from everywhere else is that it goes on forever. Take one of the ferry services to really appreciate it.
Symphony of Lights. go to the eye bar in iSquare,,,google it,,its on the Kowloon side,,and the best views for Symphony of Lights @ 8pm every day
Skyline. The Symphony of the lights was not worth the wait. Everyone tells you to watch it but if you run out of time, don't worry , you have not missed much
Sparkles. The night lights up with magnificent lights and is so lively around the streets. Many shops restraints and markets to see. Also time spent down on the harbour

It was over hyped. The skyline of Hong Kong is great at night but the light show is a little over hyped for me as it was just a couple of buildings flashing and shooting lasers. There was way too many people also and felt it was too crowded.
Great way to see the city. Best tip is to take a taxi to the top, and the tram down. Skip the line, and cost is about the same. Hop in any cab and ask for Victoria Peak.

Hong Kong fantastic city with energy. Highly recommend cable car to Buddha. Take crystal car so you can see views from all angles. Also recommend a trip to Stanley market Hong Kong. A trip to the peak and the tram down is also worthwhile. Found nigh market bit disappointing and ladies market good
Glorious reflections. The buildings lit in different changing colors was magnificent. The water of Victoria Harbour with its reflections was fascinating.
Excellent view. Its nice to see the Hong Kong Skyline....They say there are more number of buildings than New York. The sky line looks amazing at night.

great skyline. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful. Really Hong Kong lit up at night is it's best view. Can take a harbour trip or just simply jump on theclow cost star ferry. Night views from the peak are also well worth the trip

Must see for all new travelers. You are treated to a spectacular view a the Hong Kong skyline at night, great hospitality and a pretty good history lesson of the area. What more can you ask for. The trip itself isn't that long but if you are looking for a good sightseeing experience i would recommend it.

A skyline like no other in the world. If you are visiting Hong Kong, you should not miss the world's most famous and spectacular skyline. It's too beautiful that you need to visit it twice. One in the morning and one at night. You can get the best view of the Hong Kong skyline from Tsim Sha Tsui. From here, you can explore Avenue of the Stars, HK Space Museum, HK Museum of Art, HK Cultural Centre and TST Clock Tower.
Facinating !. One of the most fantastic and interesting places I have ever visited and have to experience the tram-ride too .
Great view. Awesome view of HK and a good time waster if your waiting for your flight time but beware of the bar up there - it's super expensive!
HK Skyline -a must see day & night. A great view over the city - you should see it during day time as well as at night! It's amazing and really worth to see twice.

Lightshow at night in Hong Kong. The Lightshow on a night was breathtaking. They light up the buildings in time with music that is piped through speakers. It's best to try and find a restuarant / bar on top of one of the hotels- there are many- to take in the ambience.

Lightshow at night in Hong Kong. The Lightshow on a night was breathtaking. They light up the buildings in time with music that is piped through speakers. It's best to try and find a restuarant / bar on top of one of the hotels- there are many- to take in the ambience.

Stunning sky line especially at night. Really have to see this place with all it's sky scrapers lit up at night.
Spectacular viewing and do not forget the camera or IPad for photos

Other-worldly.. I've never seen a place quite like Hong Kong. The contrast between the glass and steel and the green of the mountains in the background is simply stunning...the whole place is a modern marvel and it only gets better as it gets dark and the lights come on. I can see why this is rated the best skyline in the world. Incredible.
Beautiful view. We stayed at Ritz Carlton Hotel at Floor 117 in the room looking Hong Kong Island and Kawloon. The view was to die for.

Be on the waterfront at 8pm. For the Symphony of Light. The buildings pulse and dance in a riot of colour.The skyline is spectacular, though, from any direction at any time of day. Whether from Kowloon looking across to the Island (which is our hotel room view) of from the Island looking back to Kowloon - both skylines are just beautiful, unrivalled.

Stunning and colourful views from Kowloon. It just changes from year to year and gets more and more complex and colourful and indeed higher and more outrageous. laser lifht show every evening must not be missed. View from The Peak on theIsland is exceptional as well.
Great. Just come and enjoy. We had a great time to see the best skyline in the world. Late evening is great time to visit

Several Ways to do This!!. Perhaps Hong Kong's most spectacular attraction but it can be viewed a number of ways!!#1(Symphony of Lights)Hustle over to the Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade before 20:00 and set up for the Symphony of Lights - a stunning light and laser show with music accompaniment. Great show but it gets a little crowded most nights. Best viewed from the bar in the Sheraton Towers with a few oysters and a glass or two of chardy.#2 (Star Ferry on Victoria Harbour)A cheaper option than the Symphony of Lights view from the Sheraton Towers but no less spectacular. On a clear day a view of Hong Kong from Victoria Harbour with the Peak in the background looks better than the light show.#3 (Get Down and Amongst It)My personal preference! Wear off some shoe leather and take a wander amongst the architectural marvels that make up Central Hong Kong. There is no substitute for seeing these monsters close up, beside the foundations with some subtle afternoon light reflecting off those many widows!!Try to take in all three views - they are all different and have their own qualities!!

Always great. My wife and I walk along the Avenue of Stars in TST 2 or 3 times a week on our way home. I have never become bored with it. Sometimes disappointed when the air is not clear but on the days like today when everything is clear it truly is spectacular.It is one of the sites every visitor must see, especially if you also get the Star ferry to Central and visit the peak to see the view from the other side

Awesome night view of the Hong Kong skyline. The Avenue of Stars is the place to go if you want to get an awesome view of the Hong Kong skyline. We came here during the night and all the lights were a really pretty sight! It's nice to just stroll around that area and enjoy the night view. Do note that since it's a tourist area, it will usually be kinda crowded though.

Mesmerising. Really worth the visit. One of the most beautifully breathtaking sights. I will definitely go to the peak again to view the skyling again on my next visit to Hong Kong!
Definitely a must see!

A Must See. This is a must see. It's great for couples, or families and groups of friends. The light show is cheesy, but its fun, you just soak up the atmosphere and relax. The skyline is amazing to see. Walk down the riverfront and there are tons of photographers set up to take your photos. There really is nothing quite like the HK skyline!
Great View. The Hong Kong skyline is great, the 8 pm laser show is one of a kind. View from the Ritz is bar none.

Must do Peak, and Harbor at night.. You cannot beat this city skyline. From the Peak, from the harbor in TST, from the ferry cruises. The sites are non stop. The show at night is incredible for a sight.
Must do. This is an amazing experience. The cable cars go over water and through the wooded area to get to Big Buddha. Queues or us were small. A must do.

Fantastic view of the concrete jungle. The Hong Kong skyline was a marvelous site. I saw it mid afternoon to sunset and was able to see the unique shapes of the prominent buildings in Central Hong Kong. It's a definit must-see in Hong Kong.
Best City Scape in the World. Never ever get tired of viewing Victoria Harbor and the city lights. Great foodie city and shopping.

amazing skyline!. I think it's one of the manmade wonders in the world! if you get a closer look to HK, you'll find how people struggle to survive in such density and still manage to make the city thrive. simply amazing.
Just Beautfil - go at night. Brilliant. You read about the HK skyline but nother prepares you for its beauty. Don't miss it if it is the only thing you do in HK.
One of the best i've seen. The skyline is amazing, especially from central pier ferry where you can see the light show coming from some of the buildings.

Breathtaking!. Enjoy the stunning views of the megacity best from one of the following areas (all use public transport to get to)1- the peak, taking the bus or a taxi up to look over the city and see the views from above. recommended to v sit at night and the peak mall is open til 11pm and has cafes, restaurants etc but if leaving at the closing time some will have shut and it is harder to get a bus or taxi at this time.2- avenue of stars to see the harbour side of the city, you can walk down the avenue and enjoy the stars and statues on one sidde and views on the opposite3- or reverse it and walk along the harbour side to see the avenue of stars opposite, both are different but beautiful with iconic buildings and landmarks to spot.or do all three and compare- it really is incredible out there!

Hong Kong is love!!!. I can describe experience I had and using just two words: SO GOOD !!!! I recommend everyone to explore this. Even if you like nature more, it would be same as I was - speechless and happy!
Seen better. Pretty but light show disappointing. Only half the buildings compared to two years ago. Watch it on YouTube instead. Don't waste time or effort to see it.

Iconic Skyline with a son et lumiere show each night. The skyline is iconic and magnificent whether seen from a boat (Star Ferry) or the Kowloon coast. The nightly (20:00) sound and light show is OK but nothing to get too excited about except for the occasions that they have fireworks.
Pretty but these days there's Shanghai. Great views from the bar at the Peninsula Hotel, as well as I hear... the bar at the top of the IFC.

Illuminating!. The Hong Kong vista is unique. So many buildings, and lights with a dark backdrop.Hong Kong for so many visits has had that misty smog curtain which dulls the overall impact. Not so this visit, every where we looked we had clear views.This is a panorama like that in Budapest, you have to spend time taking it all in.
Beautiful view!. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful. It looks fantastic late once it gets dark. You may want to catch the sound and light show, which is not great but not too bad either.

A Garden of Beautiful Buildings Reaching to the Sky.. The Hong Kong Skyline is an amazing visual experience for those of us who appreciate man made designs. Mixing modern structures along side ancient buildings in a shocking contrast this city is unique. I felt safe walking the city streets with a friend and was welcomed with smiles when photographing the local people.

Spectacular. It was really amazing!! We got on to the ferry and there were no problems when you see the view, we went at night, it really was the most stunning skyline I had ever seen! Would definitely recommend any one going to Hong Kong to do the very short ferry trip! Will definitely be going back.
Lights Lights Lights. Do not miss the chance to see this. The skyline is so beautiful and the lights are nothing short of spectacular. Its about 10 minuets long.

Probably the best modern city skyline in the world. Hong Komg's skyline is legendary for a reason: the varietry of the architecture equals other modern cities like New York or Chicago. The added twist is the mountainous background, which makes it truly unique. BTW, these mountains are surprisingly wild. Walk 5 minutes into them, and you could feel like you're in absolute wilderness. Unreal!
fantastic view. the best skyline during the night with all the building in the island full of lights. On saturday at 8pm there is a interesting “light show” with the music.

Symphony of lights. 8 pm nightly on Victoria Harbor. Synchronized music and light show from skyscrapers on both sides of the harbor. Lasts 10 minutes. Easily viewed from the Avenue of the Stars on the Kowloon side.
Awesome !!. Its mind boggling to see so many sky-scrappers of breathtaking designs & structure. The best view is from the Peak and when you travel in ferries.

Great view. Spectacular view from the peak! Hong Kong has not been called the best skyline in the world for no reason.
If you are a fan of urban life style and city lighta, this is a great place to be.

Very impressive. The skyline is certainly impressive as all the tourist books say but I wouldn't rate it as mind-blowing. The buildings are impressive, if you like high-rise, and the Hong Kong Island skyline is lovely to look at from the Kowloon side but I didn't find it as impressive as the tourist guidebooks implied.
Awe inspiring. Take time to go and appreciate the Skyline, it really is pretty impressive and the spots either the best views have lots going on.

nice. You definetely have to see the skyline from a boat tour.. It is simply outstanding... Tour of 1 hour which is super nice... Amazing seeing the skylie even during night ... I simply love Hong Kong with all its lights and different shape buidings...
Changes but still amazing. Was last here in 1995, and obviously there a lot taller skyscrapers now. View is still amazing, especially at night, but .. wasn´t that impressed with 8pm light show.

Great views. It's well worth walking along there in the afternoon/ evening, close to the Avenue of the Stars. Often boats pass by and the views of the city are amazing. Definitely worth taking your camera.

The best scenic route in Hong Kong. The best route to enjoy Hon Kong skyline is walking along the Avenue of Stars at night. Nice place to enjoy the view and to stop by and take pictures of the view as well as the sculptures.
Great modern architecture. Even better than New York. See it from Kowloon or the Star Ferry. Don't miss the nightly light show!
Only thing I enjoyed about Hong kong!. The view is great during the day or night & plenty of photo opportunities ! A look from Victoria peak at sunset is a must but expect crowds so get up early!
Really "WOW"!. Quite unique view, not what expected but probably more imposing especially at sunset or dawn. Worth going on top of the mountain.

Travel up the Peak and see the view. The view of the harbour and skyline of Hong Kong from the Peak must be one of the 'world views' everyone should experience. Go up by the Peak Tram (a pleasure on its own) and prepare to be 'blown away' by the view.Pick a good day though, as air pollution and haze can have a dramatic effect on what you can see.
Affective (Especially in the night). If you ever been to Hong Kong, try to catch a boat ride in the night and catch this precious frame of that silent hilarious city.
Great view. Worth seeing the lights and walking the promenade on Kowloon. Get a good spot for lights . Bring a camera
Brilliant. Laser light display good but can be boring if watching every night.However the lights over the Harbour are very good

Go during Christmas season. One of the most spectacular skylines in the world. Best to go at nighttime during the Christmas season. You will see beautiful Christmas lights on the skyscrapers. Watch them from the "Kowloon" side.
Best part of Hong Kong. Great view. Best pictures to take along this stretch at the harbour best of all you don't need directions to get here

One of the best. Undoubtably one of the best vistas in the world.
Whether its from The Peak, the Star Ferry or the Walk of Stars - its magnificent 24 hours a day

Only if there is no smog. Hong Kong skyline is unique. There is nowhere else in the world you can find so many skyscrapers layering from sea front all the way up to the mountain side. However, you really need a clear day to get the most out of it.
Hong Kong on a budget. The nightly light show of the Hong Kong skyline, viewed from the Kowloon waterfront was spectacular and entertaining.

Once or Twice is probably enough. Good attraction - we kept wondering if there was more to the light show though.
best view was from a dinner cruise or avenue of the stars
See at night. It was spectacular during the day but by night with all the lights it is just awesome, try to see the light show, its free and entertaining, if you want to sit get there early.
3 days in beautiful Hong Kong.. Beautiful Skyline and beautiful city and get the ferry across to Stanley Park and the area around it.
Mind-blowing skyline both day and night. We lucked out with clear days and nights and the skyline from our hotel, from a boat on the harbor and from Victoria peak was incredibly beautiful
Lovely Place. Liked the view and it offers the best of east and west. Especially at night. Fabulous to take phots.

WOW. We took the old tram up to this excellent restaurant. The view from the restaurant was exceptional with fantastic views of the Hong Kong skyline during night.
The food was excellent and the service fantastic.
Hong Kong skyline. It was amazing to watch Hong Kong skyline. One of the best view, especially at night. Million of lights are very impressive.
excellent. If other places claimed their nightview worth $10000000, Hk should be 100x better. It have life and full of colors

HK Sky Lines. During the day, you will experience wonderful skyline with excellent urban infrastructure: sky-scrappers, bridges, harbor, islands, sea and mountains all fused and mingled together perfectly. During the night, you see the magical neon-light buildings, city scene, harbor and mountains and you must take out your camera to record down these unique scene that you will never find in any other parts of the world.

Best about 9pm. However, having been to hong kong more than a dozen times, the best season is the Christmas Season, when the buildings are on grand display with all their lights. Always a romantic place.
Hong Kong Skyline. The most enjoyed in Hong Kong -late afternoon and evening view. City view give the best experienced. Easy to communicate - all in English.

The avenue of stars is badly lit and you can hardly see the inscriptions on the walkway at night.. Like the laser display but looks like there are less building lighting up. There are lack of toilets and places for drinks.
Best og East and West. Hong Kong offers the best Western and Eastern culture. Excellent food, lots of attractions. Very safe to visit - you will never feel unsecure.
get a room with a view!. Seeing the harbor view is a must in HK! Bite the bullet and pay the extra for the view, you will not regret it.

must see!. i liked it. Just take your time and enjoy the view. This was one of the first locations I visited in Hong Kong. The atmosphere was romantic and you can get your picture taken here. This place is close by to Avenue of Stars and Museum of Arts

Hong Kong. staying Kowloon side at first I did not like the street presence of guys trying to sell me watches & suits on the street, not best of atmospheres, best part staying Kowloon side is to watch the laser light show looking over the river every evening @ 20.00 hrs. really impressive views over the buildings on HK island, but once over in HK island the feeling was very different, more easy European feel to it, doing the various attractions was great, eg HK heights, victorian railway to the heights, bars in Soho street, really enjoyed trips to repluse bay & Stanley Market etc. HK island was a very enjoyable experience,

Sky 100 tower was fabulous!. What a great way to see a 360 degree view of the city. The ride up in the lift was very fast with visual displays to show you how far you have travelled in how many seconds.The views of the city are excellent and very clear with terrific labelling so you know what you're looking at.Well worth an hour or so!

HONG KONG SKYLINE. A perfect skyline view you can find in a city , you never get tired of lighting effects and music and specially the view .
The diversity of buildings and lightings and color usage will give your soul a nice happiness .
Don't miss .

Every great city has an instantly recognisable skyline. Hong Kong is such a city. Best views form 1,500ft up at OZONE bar at The Ritz Carlton, West Kowloon park and on the lower deck of the Star Ferry.

5 days in Hong Kong with 2 kids. 5 days with 2 kids, wife, pram & back pack. Not a big deal. Good metro service. Tourist friendly locations. Just 1 day on a tour pack. Rest 4 days on our own. Make sure you take enough water & couple of umbrellas for shade & rain.Suggested itinerary. Day 1. Tour pack of Hong Kong city. Day 2. Disney worldDay 3. Lantau islandDay 4. Ocean park. Day 5. Kowloon - museums, harbour city walk & shopping. Octopus card is handy for travel & purchases. Over all a nice pleasant place to tour. We stayed in Kowloon Holiday Inn Golden Mile.
Breathtaking Skyline. Cant say enough about visiting HK for the first time, the views and skyline from the top of Hong Kong Island are spectacular in the extreme and are a must see.

The best photo back drop. had a great time sight seeing in the area, there are lots of places to see and had so many photos taken, though my feet are aching from too much walking, just seeing the skyline is worth it

If in Hong Kong, pick a clear night and enjoy. Hong Kong is a unique place. The skyline is right on par with NYC. It is quite amazing what has been done to continue to enhance the skyline year after year.

Just spectacular at night. Take boat cruise at night and catch the Hong Kong skyline as it is a sight to behold. With the mountain in the back and the wonderfully light buildings in the front, it is a remarkable sight.
a must do. Do this early on in your visit to hong kong and you'll get an instant visual of how this amazing place hangs together. Superb

The laser show is not worthy of time.. The HK skyline is beautiful as ever, especially at night. However, the laser show at 8 PM is definitely not worth the time and effort. Quite pitiful compared to others such as in Singapore. I would avoid the crowd at the time.

Incredibly beautiful, day and night. Skies were mostly blue during our August 2014 trip. Based on other reviews, we thought that they would be overcast and we'd have a lot of rain, neither of which showed up. Under this condition, the beauty of the blue harbor against the surreal-looking skyscrapers, backed by pointed mountains was breathtaking.

Mesmerising!. The view was like nothing I've ever seen and was truly incredible. I visisted just as the sun started to set (the junk ship sailing into the orange glow of the bay was beautiful) and, of course, after sun set where it got pretty packed in time for the Symphony of Lights. The music sounds like it was lifted from a Gameboy and it was absolutely heaving but nothing beats the light reflecting off the water, especially with the moon lingering above the skyscrapers. I'm a sucker for a good view and this one, one of the best 'man-made' views I've seen, didn't cost a penny.
Hongkong skyline. Hongkong skyline is filled with many skyscrapers. I went there spring time and the season is cool and nice

Great manmade skyline. The skyline view very much depends on weather conditions as told by our guide. Thankfully, it wasn't too bad on the day we did a climb to near the peak and view was overall impressive with the bright lights of a cosmopolitan city.

Definitely worth a gander. First time in Hong Kong for 20 years and a lot has changed. This time having 2 days to squeeze in many sites of Hong Kong made this a very hectic journey. Though the skyline is definitely worth a look. They do light shows off the main walkway along the promenade and although slightly underwhelming. The skyline was truly very pretty... Almost as nice as the Manhattan one. So take a night stroll.. Don't mind the thousands of other tourists there... It's pretty nice view and actually quite chilled out.

World class - truly outstanding.. HK's skyline is truly spectacular.Dusk was my favourite looking at HK Island from the Kowloon Public Pier / Cultural Centre / Avenue of Stars. The evening light show was worth seeing once. The music was a bit lame and it wasn't breathtaking but free and worth the effort, especially if you simply time it when you need to do the crossing on the ferry anyway.Even during the day you can just stand and admire all the skyscrapers.

Spectacular View. I'm from Singapore so skyscrapers are nothing new to me, but the view from the top of the peak is something jaw-dropping, not a view that can be easily seen in Singapore where everywhere is quite flat.Suggest to come on the peak tram around evening time (allow time for queuing) when you can see both day and night views. Then you can have dinner at the peak. There are malls up there.

A mesmerising view. The skyline is breathtaking, both at night and in the early morning when the clouds are going down from the mountains. Take a walk along the avenue of stars in the early morning and breathe the exhilarating sea breeze. The view captures imagination. The mountains, the harbor, the skyline and the sea. Nothing wakes you up better than a good walk along a beautiful landscape. At night the place is full of people and you can't really enjoy it. But you should see the lights from the opposite building and their reflection in the water.

Must see If you're in Hong Kong. There are actually three attractions on the same spot. Many happy people is the one that you get once you're there. To experince the sunset, you have to be there before the sunset. And of course the Dance of Lights is spactacular which starts at 20:00 and lasts for less than one hour.You MUST experience this to feel that you have appropriately visited Hong Kong.
Best attraction in HK. In my opinion this is the sight of the city. From TST you get an amazing view of Hong Kong island skyline and the Victoria peak behind it. Honh kong at its best!

Hong Kongs greatest asset. One of the best skylines in the world. Lit up in different colors which makes for a great view from Tsim Sha Tsui where the light hits Victoria Bay. Free.The light show is nice but overrated.
Its Amazing. Best skyline and skyscrapers. Head to Tsim sha Tsui for some great photos and also dont forget to visit Avenue of the Stars for even more great shots.

Spectacular. Extraordinary is an understatement! Make sure you visit this place after sunset, the skyline is breathtaking in deed! I highly recommend to all who passes by HK a transition to Victoria Harbour for a light show every night starting from 8pm.

Wow big buildings everywhere. So the Skyline is pretty amazing. From all angles the unique blend of old and new architecture makes for an awesome view. some of the buildings are so unique it makes the trip to the high viewpoints work the trip.
Best in the world. I love the skyline in Hong Kong especially from the peak! although it is great in Tsim sha Tsui too especially at the light show at 8 pm
Great light show. The best way to see the evening light show is from the Star Ferry Peer opposite the Island.There is the largest upscale shopping center right there (Harbor City)

Best view ever. This is one of the best view ever! especially at night (8 PM) when the Light Show starts
I wish good luck to all of you whom wish to attend to it: better to have no fog at all but in Hong Kong it's a bit difficult situation.
Wonderful views. Terrific views from either side (Island or Kowloon) . By day you feel the pulse of the bustling waterway or by night when there is a real excitement at being in such a lively city.

night cruise. brilliant lights seafood meal great tour guide great just be ready to jump ashore as it does not tie up had to get a ferry back from kowloon get Octopus pas if senior for cheap travel buses and trams and taxies very cheap

Spectacular. The Hong Kong skyline is right up there with the best city views in the world. Even better at night. Best seen from Kowloon side or from high hotel rooms eg shangrila or intercontinental . The lights at night make a fabulous back edrop

Best viewed by night for sheer beauty and ambience.. I first saw the Hong Kong Skyline (at night) back in 2006 and it blew me away with its sheer beauty with all the lights on the skyscrapers and neon signage against the backdrop of the Peak. I then lived in Hong Kong as an Ex-Pat for 18 months in 2007-2008 and the Skyline still blew me away even when I saw it almost everyday.I still visit Hong Kong from time to time now and the night Skyline viewed from the Kowloon, Tsim Sha Tsui (TST), side still amazes me and I always try to get to TST to see it during my trip.Is staying on the Island take the Star Ferry from Central or Wan Chai to TST as the view from the ferry is stunning as well and the ferry is very cheap (just a few HK$). Alternatively use the MTR and get out at TST station and walk from there to the Clock Tower / Star Ferry Terminal as this is the best place from which to see the Skyline of Hong Kong Island... Enjoy.
Wonderful View. Mesmerizing view of Hongkong's skyline. A must see. Commute from Central to Tsim Tsa Tsui in Star ferry gives an excellent view

Beautiful Place. I went to Hong Kong with some friends and I really enjoyed the views from Hong Kong Skyline. It's so beautiful to see the entire city at night from there. We also had some drinks while up there.
A must do in Hong Kong :)

Take the cable car to the top and take in the amazing skyline.. After spending a good hour in the hot and muggy queue we climbed aboard the cable car to the Wok. The view from the top is just outstanding and it is a city I have always wanted to visit. I wasn't disappointed and the skyline is one of the best in the world.

A must.. The view is outstanding from the Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade as promised. An outstanding skyline and worth the time to see. If on HK Island just get the Star Feery over, cheap fare ( use octopus).
Must have left too early as I did not see any light show happening on the scheduled time.

Splendid.. It's what many come to Hong Kong to see and it really is spectacular. It doesn't really require the so-called symphony of lights to add anything to it. The symphony of lights was disappointing and not worth hanging around for.The skyline on its own is sufficient.
Wonderfull view and show. The light show is great to see. Sort of unexpected gift. The harbor and the lights make it very special

Mountains, lights and water. The skyline here is fabulous. Even when it is fogged out. It shows a different side. Spending an hour or so on a ferry or just a Star commuter from Central to Tsim Tsa Tsui is a great trip.The evening light show is in my opinion better than Singapore's but both suffer from a lot of other light and some idea that a straight laser is something special?I have spent time on both sides and would recommend that any visitor does.
One of the most spectacular man-made sights one can see.. Awe-inspiring in scale! More skyscrapers than New York, on a piece of land roughly the same size.One does wonder when the building will stop!

Visually stimulating. Best seen from the Avenue of Stars. The skyline itself is pretty incredible. Then the laser show starts around 8:00 and lasts for 15 or 20 minutes. Can be crowded but worth the visit, especially if you are already staying in Tsim Sha Tsui and can walk over.

The mountain behind.... looks pretty unique to me. I did not expect a mountain the buildings to look this good when natural and man made jungle mix. The laser lights wasn't have clear at times for some reason, but the light works in sync with the music. View is wide big enough for people to view. Laser show was long enough but it may or may not be exciting to all.

A remarkable view. It is awesome to see what humans have created.
The number of high rises is huge and you have not seen so many tall buildings all along the coast at any other place.

One of the most stunning sights I've seen. This skyline is absolutely incredible, my favorite in the world personally. The harbor at Tsim Tsa Tsui is very nicely positioned to see the amazing power of Central and just leaves you to wonder how many people are over there and what they are all doing. There's a reason this i my desktop background!
Wonderful. It is such a spectacular sight no matter how many times you see it. there is nothing to dislike. At night when it is lit up it is unforgettable sight especially from the sea.

Victoria's Peak Worth the Trip. One of the best places to see the Hong Kong skyline from is Victoria's Peak at night. Go right to the top of the Peak (and pay the $45 Hong Kong to do so) and then take the free audio tour. The whole family had their own headset and we were up top for over an hour learning about the city as we looked at the amazing skyline. It was hot, there were lots of people, it took a long time to get up and down and it was still well worth the time. When you get to the top take the time to enjoy it.
Absolutely to see in Hong Kong. It's almo at the only thing you can do in HK.The skyline in huge and dramatic. Ok, it's not New York, forget something so exciting but it's very fotogenic!!
Harbour views. The views from our hotel were spectacular and the added lightning show made it priceless. We also went on the funicular tram and the views were even better.

An impressive skyline i suggest. It' a really impressive skyline in the night you can watch the buildings and skyscraper with so diferrent shape from other city.In the evening fireworks at 9pm it's a big gift to your travel.

be seen to believe. it is a thriving busy clean city, with plenty to see. going ahead high tea at 101 floors up gives Hong Kong a different outlook .so many shopping centres, not necessary for shopping but just exploring, so clean and something different in each one
Great photo op. A great view at night with the laser light show. It gets crowded as show time starts along the Avenue of the stars. Quick tip you get a great view from the Intercontinental
Amazing view. It's been a dream of mine to see Hong Kong skyline and it lived upto my expectations. Defiantly to be seen at least once in your lifetime. A view I shall never forget.
Nice wiev. But often af little foggy due to pollution. Sometimes a little difficult to get near the water. Good wives from the convention center
Wonderful. will never forget the views and the lasers. I loved it. Sailing out off Hong Kong on the start of a Far East cruise. Wonderful Adventure

Stunning. Visited last May. We saw the skyline from so many places but by far the best is from a boat in the harbour. We luckily saw it on a nice sunny day but there was a little of the pollution haze around. I loved the entire skyline - so many shapes and sizes - so many buildings - it is certainly compact! At night it is the best skyline I have ever seen. The atmosphere created by the fabulous light shows is mesmerising - I loved it and could have spent hours looking at it. If you can't do both then the nighttime boat trip around the harbour is fantastic. Very highly recommended.

Great view and good food. Went to see this great view on a day that the fog had cleared. Got lots of great pictures and bought some cool gadgets in the shopping mall before eating out at Bubba Gumps Resturant! Lots of fun!

What is there more to say - one of the finest skyline views in Asia Pacific. The view is best from the Kowloon side and you can use the Star ferry to enjoy more of it on your return to the Island. There is a nightly light show which is quite fun but it can get crowded on the waterfront viewing areas. My own preference is for a late night walk after dinner, when there are far fewer tourists and you can see some of the locals casting their nets and lines into the sea.
Nice. Very cool. One of the world's nicest skylines. Go to the Avenue of Stars and Vicoria Peak for the best views.
Skyline. Great Skyline. Something your eyes can enjoy and take your breath away. It was great at night to watch from a boat the dancing lights on the buildings.

The pollution isn't visible at night. We expected alot more from the Hong Kong skyline.The first thing we noticed upon our arrival, was the intensity of the fog all over the city, and it just didn't get any better.At night, when the lights came on, the character of Hong Kong changed to a much more spectacular sight, hiding the smog. Although we had a reasonable time during our visit, Hong Kong has nothing more to offer unfortunately.
Beautiful skyline. Best skyline in the world in my opinion,large area to stroll around with lots of interesting characters to observe.The light show however was a bit of a let down.

SIMPLY the best skyline in the world. Always changing light and atmosphere, dramatic, colourful, mystical - brilliant in every way. Everyone should visit HK at least once in their lives. Just not all together at the same time!

Smog spoils view. We took the railway to The Peak but were disappointed because of smog. We could see the harbor far below but it was covered in haze. Try to pick a clear day and get there early before the crowds get overwhelming. The view from Kowloon harbor area is much better. Don't miss the evening light show. Watch it from the Kowloon dock area and use the pedestrian elevated walkway close to the ferry terminal.

Wow. Take a trip on one of the Ferries at night and the views are spectacular. If the skies are clear a visit to the peak is a must with the tram ride to the top. Star Ferry is extremely cheap and if you take it across to Kowloon the views are breathtaking.
Great view. Had a great time here. We could see the most beautiful skyline in the world. The lights of buildings were so splendid and we sugguest coming here at 7pm

Beautiful skyline - light show is a disappointment. The skyline is very beautiful - especially at night with the lights on. The light show however, is quite a disappointment. When I saw it a few buildings turned their lights on and off and changed colours, but I was not impressed.
Not so impressing. The skyline is truly beautiful, but the Symphony of lights at 8pm is not that special. Just a cuple of buildings lighting up to music and 6 lasers. It's still really beautifull.
Beautiful View. A must see when visiting Hong Kong. Skycrapers everywhere!! Amazing harbor view. I was mostly on Kowloon side, but also took a harbor tour ride right about sunset.
City view. Nice to see but try it from as many angles as you can manage. New territories, peak etc otherwise not much different to many other cities

One of the world's most beautiful sights. We saw the skyline from the top of Victoria Peak and from the other side of the harbour on Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade and the Avenue of the Stars. A fantastic sight during the day, it really comes to life at night. Come in time for the Symphony of Light show at 8pm, when the skyscrapers on Hong Kong Island put on an amazing light show to music.

Awesome, especially at night. Many kind of different design and architecture, also the height of those building make all those skyline is awesome. At night, those skyline become prettier with its light. Even there is a light show everyday from those skyline every night.
Amazing. Never ever fails to amaze me, fantastic ! one of the best views, night or day, of a coastline that I have ever seen.
At night, it's amazing!. Our first time there and it was our first time watching something like the symphony of lights. It was beautiful...
Highly Overrated. Unless you love huge bill boards of Sony, Panasonic etc, there is nothing special. Maybe it was unique 20 years ago.

Hot but picturesque. Being a native New yorker I know a gorgeous skyline when I see one. The Hong Kong skyline is breathtaking. Go as early as possible because the promenade gets crowded however, there is also a light show at night so that is also a option. The sun is scorching in August, so if was extremely hot.
Spectacular view. Very impressive view of skyline with all it's colors and magnificent light show at 8 pm every evening.

Panoramic View that you will not forget. I went there with my sister and her couple of friends on 29 July 2014. We reached there via MTR and alight at Tsim Sha Tsui. We view the skyline from the Avenue of the Stars. The view is overwhelming with full lit lights of the Hong Kong business district. We waited and watched for the 8 p.m. Symphony of Lights show. However, the show was disappointing as we not to sure what was happening and what to focus on with the lights all over the place, and blurry. We gave up watching the show halfway and we on to take the Star Ferry and went over opposite where the skyline is.Suggestion: Do go there during evening as weather will be much cooler as you wait for the skyline to light up. But do bring umbrella when it rains as there are not much sheltered areas there.

Stunning city lights at night. Bearing in mind this was our first stopover on our trip, we loved the night lights of Hong Kong, the reflection in the harbour, the atmosphere of other people equally as impressed as we were made it an unforgettable experience

Love the popular scene and lights!!. I loved the lights blinking and to watch one of the most popular landmarks in the world was absolutely amazing!! I also loved the Bruce Lee statue and the palm match in the ground. It kinda tells me of Hollywood haha. But overall excellent. The ships crossing the sea was also very nice. Must visit that Hong Kong once again!! Actually visited it on the March of 2011 but the review list didn't have that so...

Peak tram. Lined up for what seemed like hours to get on tram a lot of pushing & shoving for night view. Don't go school holidays as we went and there needs to be more organization and control when getting on the tram as everyone wanted to get on at once & there is no one controlling this, small children were getting squashed when entering tram. They need to have a head count to how many should be on the tram at one time. Once you reach the top it is a great view but by the time you get back down which is an hour wait again to get back down you would be better off finding a high rise building to view the city it would be so much more enjoyable.
Bucket list stuff. The lazerlight show is brilliant (no pun intended), but even just being on the harbor on a cheap ferry is memorable.

a must to do in 24 hours. If you have only a day in Hong Kong - you must see the skyline by night. Truly breathtaking view of the colorful flashing lights of the city and the panorama of the soaring skyscrapers.

The endless activity makes it wonderful to watch. The best place to watch the sunset or dawn on the harbour is from one of the harbour front hotels. Sitting in a room or bar on one of the upper floors sipping a beer and watching the ferries plying too and from Macau with the skyline stretching around the coast is a great way to while away some time.
Skyline. Make sure you view the skyline before sunset. Very Impressive. Prepare for a wait to board the cable car.

TAKE YOUR BREATH AWAY. You can enjoy the skyline by taking the famous Star Ferry, Aqua Luna or other ferry ship across the lovely Victoria Harbour. This is the most memorable skyline from a ferry ride, it was also my last ride before departing Hong Kong. The rainbow reflection from the water makes the nighttime even more glamorous. Each way is only $2 USD. Hong Kong is such an happening place enriched with traditional cultures and histories of its people. What we are witnessing today, is the aftermath of the hundred years of battles, millions of handwork, and sacrifices. I personally think that the best views of the Hong Kong Island side come from the world famous Victoria Peak with its glamorous views of Hong Kong Island skyscrapers. My friend and I both trying to catch the sunset and took the MTR to the tram. But the tram takes at least 3 hours in line! She instantly changed of game plan and took us onto the double decker bus to catch another express bus from the star ferry pier to the Peak. I am really glad that we choose to ride the double decker bus, as you get to see the downtown sitting from the top view. When we got to the top of the peak, it was just perfect timing at sunset. We waited 30min for the city to get dark and needless to say, it was the highlight of my trip.

8pm from Kowloon ... By the Bruce Lee statue!. The HK skyline is spectacular and possibly one of the top recognisable views anywhere. At night, it is even more so. At 8pm there is a light/laser show, worth a view although I don't think it is as good as it used to be, but then again, as a free attraction, worth a go!

Amazing harbour. Lived in Hong Kong for 5 years the harbour is a must. Night time light show starts at 8pm stroll to the Deck Bar for a nice cool drink and people watch. For an evening meal woolloomooloo and entertainment plus various eating places and bars on that side of the road.

visual overload. Superb from the ferry across to the hongkong skyline....so much so was unable to capture it adequately with my camera,so didn't..... if only the images in my head could be transcribed!

Experience HK Skyline. It was a nice experience to see the view of Hong Kong at night. The buildings in the Central were beautifully lighted. Tsim Sha Tsui (located on the other island) which is opposing Central where HK Skyline can be viewed its entirety.

Remains impressive. The skyline of Hongkong stays impresive. Doesn't matter how many times I saw it, it will always be one of my favourite attractions in Hongkong. The lights,the displays onthe buildings are always changing. I always look,forward to see what has changed. An don' t forget the lasershow in the evenings.

Even better than expected.. I have never taken so many photos in my life! Mainly from Victoria Peak. If you go up the peak, it's best to go late afternoon, take your photos, go for dinner and then go to the top Sky rooftop to get night time photos too.
Peak Tram. Loved the experience of travelling up to the peak on the Tram. Last did it in 1983! New trams are lovely, and a bit cooler too

A Must See. This was a wonderful treat! We truly enjoyed the view and the meal at Bubba Gumps was fantastic. It rained, but that just added to the view. We went in the late afternoon, but I would recommend going evening and night so you can see the lights at night. The wait was a bit long, but it's well worth the wait!
Great view day or night. The Hong Kong harbor has a great view day or night. A walk along the seaboard walkway is very relaxing. The walk of fame is also educational.

Beautiful Panorama. Hazy, and washed out by day...it transforms into a thing of beauty after dark. Beautiful colours and neon signs against a backdrop of Indian ink coloured sky, the reflection of which, shimmers on the harbour. Beautiful for your never to forget photo of Hong Kong.
One of the coolest skylines in the world. Hong Kong has one of the coolest skylines in the world. Make sure you catch the light show from the Avenue of Stars and bring a camera

Amazing skyline. This is a vertical city.. Every where you go, HK is an 'upwardly mobile' city. Skyscrapers all around the place. Some of them look spectacular day and night, and some are just tall and boring. But the skyline is breathtaking.

Surprising. As a former resident of Hong Kong we were somewhat curious what this comparatively new lookout area on top of the Peak Tram was like. To our surprise not only did we find it provided a very good viewing platform over both the harbour and Aberdeen and Lamma Island,, but we were also given a small video screen and earphones which allowed us to get a commentary on various parts of Hong Kong including some history. The entry fee was modest for such a scenic attraction.

One of the best harbours in the world. Excellent during the day as it is busy with all the boats of varying sizes and even better at night. The harbour comes alive with the buildings all lighting up and showing off their colours. The Star Ferry is a wonderful way to see this harbour on the cheap. There are many tours available but even just standing on the " Avenue of Stars " is a very cool place to be,
Great place and city. long lines to go on the tram, not if you by tickets from a tour group like big bus, the agents are very helpful. view was great and bubba gump food was excellent.

An iconic view of Hong Kong. Hong Kong changes frequently, every time I go there seems to be some new major building project. However, the Hong Kong skyline is a constant icon of a great city. View it from the peak or from Kowloon or from the Star Ferry it looks impressive from all directions. Especially impressive when lit up at night.

Amazing skyline. My friends and I visited an old friend in her office at the Penthouse of a building . From there we viewed part of the HongKong Skyline and found it truly amazing.....reminds me of the New York skyline.
One of the best things in HK. I love the skyline. It makes my day every time. For the best view, take the star ferry from TST going to central or wan chai!

get up high and see the views. anywhere around hong kong is good, there are plenty of waterways , and advantage points. so get up high see the views. do this at night too! the city lights up it is a great spectacle.

Great City. We used the hop on hop off bus to go to the zoo and bird park, the tram to the peak overlooking the city as well as seeing the city. We also took a harbor cruise for a different perspective. It was a hot muggy day with clouded visibility.

OWW! DIO!. The 'coordinated' bunch of buildings randomly flashing lights for a good 10 minutes, culminating in a poor flicker of mono green streaks of lazer across the sky made for more of an anti-climax than anything else.

Typical Skyline, Underwhelming Lightshow. So I took the ferry from Wan Chai over to Tsim Tsha Tsui to take some pictures of the HK skyline. It looks great in the day and even better at night. But as someone who's lived in cities all his life, HK's skyline is pretty average. I found out in the evening that there's this lightshow called 'Symphony of Lights', a massive coordinated light show every day at 8pm if the weather permits. Watching it from Harbour City, the show started off subtly, without the sign from one of the buildings, I would not have known that it started. The 'coordinated' bunch of buildings randomly flashing lights for a good 10 minutes, culminating in a poor flicker of mono green streaks of lazer across the sky made for more of an anti-climax than anything else. If it wasn't free to watch, I would probably have given this a miss. Worth hanging around for I guess, but don't expect too much.
Great. Great view, better to go during the Winter months as it is less humid. The lights at nigh were amazing! Big city feel

One of the Worlds Great Skylines!. The skyline is my favorite of many large cities. The skyline is accessible both from behind at Victoria Peak and from Kowloon or on the bay between the mainland and Hong Kong Island. Take the Star Ferry for a night time view with the light show.
Great skyline. Impressive skyline. Great to look at while jogging the TST promenade during the day, and great light show view from the Kowloon side at night.
Skyline from the Hong Kong Island side. You get a nice view of the mainland skyline. It is within walking distance from the hotel--although it is a few blocks. So be prepared for that.

Fire and Water. At night this is the most spectacular view with the flashing lights on the high rise buildings being reflected across the water in the harbour. It was such a beautiful backdrop for our romantic dinner on the 49th floor of the Upper House. How lucky are we.

Great View From The Avenue of Stars. Really great view of the city skyline on Hong Kong Island from The Avenue of Stars in Kowloon. Great light early morning for photo's as well as great to watch the Symphony of Lights each night.

Hong Kong's answer to the Eiffel Tower,Golden Gate Bridge,Petronas towers and other landmarks. Must visit, brilliant show at 8 pm every night. Gives a beautiful view of the entire HK skyline from the TST harbour area. Take a train to Tshim Sha Tshui and be there before 8 pm. Do not forget your cameras at home.
wonderful views at day, and night!. The night times in H.K. are phenomonel. It is a show for the eyes, and the experience is fun, and be prepared for many different experiences on the senses.

One of the best. Whether it is looking across the harbor, taking a Star Ferry sightseeing trip, or the view from the Peak, Hong Kong has the most beautiful skyline in the world. The light show put on by the skyscrapers every evening is free and impressive.

The best in the world and the attraction never dims. Hotel Well worth booking a room with a view
I have visited Hong Kong many many times and Hong Kong Skyline remains a constant source of joy

Packed in like sardines. Lots of very modern high rise buildings scattered through hundreds of tall apartment buildings, all clutching at the shoreline of a busy busy harbour, filled with barges, pile drivers, tugs, ferries, cargo ships and cruise vessels! It's all a real buzz!
First highrise visit. I have to say the view of this skyline from the ground and above is truly amazing. I've never seen so many buildings along with the peaks all in one place. Worth all the photos

I've heard it is the best skyline in the world.... Hong Kong Harbor is truly an amazing sight, especially at night. The view from the island side to Kowloon is incredible as you cannot believe the number and amount of high rise buildings. The view from Kowloon toward the island side is spectacular in a different way; the lights of the buildings at night are beyond numerous - bright and larger than life. Super fun to see from Ozone a bar on top of the Ritz Carlton or from the lobby bar at the Intercontinental.

Its OK. We were very underwhelmed by Hong Kong. The skyline is illuminated and I guess some people get excited by that but we felt like the place was America meets Asia and the skyline exemplified that. If your life revolves around shopping, you will find plenty here - nearly all of it exactly the same brands as you would find any any decent sized city.....why travel at all?
Amazing . The Hong Kong skyline is spectacular make sure you take in the light show from Kowloon viewing area at 8pm.. But viewed by day or night it simply is a must see

Best thing. Easily the most striking thing about all Hong Kong. Best view of it was Horizonte Bar in hotel Madura just off Nathan Very good place to soak up the nighttime atmosphere of the city skyline.
Great at night. The light show at 8.00 each night is well worth a look ( best position is front on Intercontinental Hotel - I didn't have any dislikes

A Must See. Day or night, it is a stunning view. During the day, the skyscrapers of Hong Kong, the most vertical city in the world, can be seen clearly and during the night, the luminous skyline is amazing. Additionally, this is a great place to watch the bustling harbor. Anyone who visits Hong Kong must witness this breathtaking sight.
Amazing view. This should definitely be on anyone's Hong Kong itinerary. The view is amazing and one can truly embrace the beauty of the city.

Breathtaking view. As a New Yorker who has aways loved Manhattan with its lights and views, I can honestly say that the Hong Kong skyline took my breath away. Go there right at sunset and watch all the biuldings slowly being lit up. Simply take a seat and enjoy the show...literally. Once the sun sets and all the skyline is lit up, there is a light show for about 15-20min. All buildings flash and light in different colors. The lights are coordinated and completed with lasers. It is definitely worth the wait to experience it. Highly recommended

Hard to beat and its free. From either Hong Kong or Kowloon this is one of the best photo sites going. It is spectacular and you can find vantage points to shoot photos right around the city. And it doesn't cost a cent!

Astounding view of HK. This view is beyond words. You'll stand in awe of the shimmering, tall, and unique architecture of hundreds of buildings. View the skyline at 8pm then you'll go gaga on which view and direction to look at. The musical light show is over the top. The splendid way to end your day tour.

fascinating. The people were very helpful, if we were looking at a map they would ask, can we help. Take plenty of water when walking around because it gets very humid. couldn't help but notice all the scaffolding on buildings under repair was bamboo.
Amazing. Amazing skyline, worth a visit to Victoria Peak to view. Night or day it is worth visiting the peak. Symphony of lights are fantastic and well worth visiting at 8pm

Fantastic View. We had a fantastic view from our hotel room, this was just higher.Our hotel recommend a bus to get to the top, as the que for the tram were 3 hours long and it was quite late in the day.
WOW. I like Hong Kong very much and the skyline is something very special you can't get anywhere else in the world!!
Fantastic views. I have been to New York and Hong Kong's skyline is just better. Staying next Victoria harbour is your best way to enjoy the views.

no need a boat ride for this!. Many people decide to get on a boat to admire the skyline at night (with the lights show) but believe me, you do not really need to waste your money on that since the views from kowloon are good enough.In day time, get a regular ferry to cross from one side to the other and you will have the same ones for a 10% of the price. Spend wisely your money!
Breath taking. I maybe exaggerating it but for me, it is like an Asian New York. An entry way to Asia. Wait for the light show at around 8 pm or 9 pm. It is worth it.

Try to catch the light show. The Hong Kong skyline is by far one of the most iconic in the world with respectable number of skyscrapers. Aside from going to the top of one of the skyscrapers to get a panoramic view there is not much other than catching the light show. Make sure to check the time, but from the Kowloon side accompanied with music there is a beautiful laser light show which incorporates the lights of some of the main building across the bay.

Great view in the right conditions. The famous Hong Kong skyline is fantastic with the skyscrappers and the many Neon signs. You can see it from Tsim Sha Tsui area around the ferry, Science museum or Ocean terminal. The one big issue in recent years is the pollution/weather. If its cloudy/foggy then you really cannot see much. You can also get a good view if you cross the harbour at night on the ferry.

The Peak. We went to the Peak to see the skyline, we went there in the daytime. We paid around 40 HKD each.The view was amazing but I felt it could have been free or cheaper. They did give some automated tour guide thing with headphones to justify charging people to stand on the roof. So what else can I say...
What a Beautiful City. Talk about breathtaking city. Would recommend seeing the city from the ferry, Victoria Peak and the pier at night to capture the size and magnitude of the city.
One of the best skylines in the world. In my opinion one of the most beautiful skylines I've ever seen. Can get some fantastic photos along the avenue of stars.
Peak experience from the Peak. This is an amazing skyline, has to be seen by day and by night. According to the tours, HK has x2 skyscrapers than NY (but don't tell that to the Americans)

A Sight for Sore 'Legs'. We wandered about the Harbour City area in Kowloon and after trekking for some hours, settled down at a Restaurant in Harbour City Centre to eat and watch the marvellous Light Show. The meal and relaxing time sitting gave our legs a much needed rest.
Unreal Skyline. I have been in Hong Kong for more than a mont now and each time I see this Skyline I am still impressed and amazed.

From any location its stunning. Hing Kong harbour although shrunk with the land reclamation still is one of the most gorgeous skylines in the world... the light show at 8 PM every night although nice doesn't add to the beauty at all, enjoy it from the Star ferry, Kowloon or from the peak its all good...

Hong Kong day and night view. If you are looking for nice hong kong views whether day or night, peak is definitely the best place.
I also went to Avenue of Stars and stayed on to see the Symphony of Light, slighter poorer.

Avenue of Stars. There's was a brilliant fireworks show on a cloudy evening. You can catch it at 8pm and then at 10pm from the avenue of stars. I just loved how well this synchronised especially when the fireworks went off from the terrace of different buildings in the skyline. Mesmerising and definitely not on the "can ignore" list.
Beautiful. Make your way up to The Peak via the Peak Tram for the best views of the harbour. And bring your camera.

Ok but have seen better and worst. Hong Kong is a busy city with many things to see. At night they have a laser show. My wife thought it great and I said it is ok. Some happen behind us and some in front. Only last 10 minutes and you are with a lot of people. Maybe being on a boat in the port would have been better. City seems safe but they have 0 ability to allow for crime or garbage. Right to jail and heavy fines. Maybe US need to take a look at this. Subway very clean and never felt in fear like in New York.
Brilliant by night. View from hotel terrace was magnificent! The nightlife was very vibrant and fun. Easy to get around and lots to see and do!

Amazing view. From both shores the skyline is worth dedicating several minutes. If you travel in summer as we did, take the Star ferry, roughly 5 minutes, so you can appreciate the view and enjoy sea breeze all along. Take your picture with the Bruece Lee statue at Avenue of the stars in Kowloon, just a little walk at your right when you arrive at the ferry station. At sun down the light is spectacular for the pictures!

Tallest Visitor's Attraction. Magnificent 360° view of the island. Don't forget to collect souvenir, you won't find it elsewhere. click a lot of photographs with family. elevator is express, spare at least 60-75 minutes for this place, on your way back a branded outlets mall will greet you.
Great Views!. Great views from many different vantage points all over Hong Kong. Best spots are from The Peak and from over at Kowloon.

Awesome. View is quite spectacular. Advice: take the taxi up a bit before sunset, so you can see the skyline at both day and night time. Tram on the way up is a shocker, it's so packed. Better to take it on the way down - much less wait

Travelling in Hong Kong in general. Just a short review for those who has never been to an Asian city. It could be cultural shock.Hong Kong is extremely congested. I've been back twice, 2007 and 2012 both times in November and very hot like Vancouver, cdn's summer. I think i'd die in dead summer. Subway system is by distance, so they calculate based on the number of stops. if you're using it lots maybe it's good to get and load up a travel card called the Octopus card than trying to find change all the time. Then there are independent white buses on separate system more on local smaller street routes (i think individual owns their own like a taxi but instead a mini bus and then large double decker buses that run on main routes that also uses the Octopus card. Pros: cheaper food, LOT of variety, lots of night life, lots of stores and malls, lots of restaurants, as small as Hong Kong is there is a Disneyland, street food everywhere. interesting and unique trinkets that you won't see in North America. Sub way system is great and connect many places together, they have a night laser show at the harbour (think it might be daily or weekend only, sorry can't remember), neat country side type locations accessible but small boats/ferries, Cons: lack of variety in types of food, the streets actually has a constant smell of sewer, small restaurants and food carts seems dirty, public bathrooms are quite stinky, REMEMBER TO BRING TISSUE WITH YOU AT ALL TIMES. Lots of bathrooms don't provide unless you're in bigger restaurants, mostly cash if you want other than nice restaurants. Very congested and busy all the time. I got in trouble for trying to take photos of food street carts during night. they thought I was a reporter. They are running an illegal business so i understand....so DO NOT TAKE PHOTOS.
Pretty at night. Great for the photographer . One of the worlds most photographed skylines. Sadly getting a very clear day can be a game of chance.

Great Skyline, Great View. Whoa, the view was great, tall buildings, colourful lights, unique ships sailing, all of them combined gave a very good experience in Hong Kong, plus there was a government free wi-fi here a good effort from the government. Recommended to visit if you are in HK
Completely amazing!. Go to the panorama site on the other side of the bay, or take a boat! It's so very different from Europe!
Stunning harbour. The skyline at night is absolutely stunning and forget don't forget to catch the symphony of lights at 7pm from Kowloon pier.

Amazing at day, Beautiful at night. We were very fortunate to have a harbour view room at the Four Seasons and there was constant activity and entertainment on the harbour in the daytime then the light show and a beautiful skyline at night. This is one of the things that makes Hong Kong so special. We also visited the M Bar in the Mandarin Oriental which has excellent views and ate at St Betty's at IFC for dinner with harbour views.

Great skyline with laser shows. The skyline can be watched from the bridge or one of the ferries. Since it was rainy and foggy this day, I have chosen for the bridge. The laser show starts every day at 20 pm. It was nice but nothing spectacular, more like you will also see in other cities of the world. Maybe when there would have been less fog, the show might have been better.

nice view. Great view of the skyline where there is a free light show every night at 8pm. Don't need to bother by going on the boat cruise as it is not that cheap to see the light show for 15 minutes. I would recommend that you splash out and have dinner at aqua restaurant at 1 peking road on the 29th floor with great views of the hong kong skyline. Exxy restaurant as it is 5 star but worth it if you can book early and request for a window seat.

Just like all the movies. I saw this view every day from my hotel and it dominates the city just stunning in all lights. Night time is spellbinding with the light show. unfortunately there are no longer the laser lights as in the YouTube clips. early in the morning is another view as the sun rising reflects off the buildings.
Worth a Visit. It is worth a visit but do check weather condition before going. Tram ride is awesome but worth. Good options for foodies at top.
Disappointing Laser Light Show. This highly promoted laser show was found to be disappointing and highly overrated, and not worth the effort of fighting through crowd to reach foreshore to watch.
Our Hotel overlookedVictoria Harbour. A stunning spectacle for 24 hours everyday. I never got sick of looking at this fantastic view!!!! The light show every night just has to be seen.
Impressive. HK is of course unlike any other city.The views from our 19th floor hotel window were good. You can of course go to Victoria Peak for the ultimate view of HK when the skies are clear.

On a clear night a harbour trip is a must. We had prearranged a tour and had a boat almost to ourselves. I liked that drinks were provided. The cheapest harbour trip is a star ferry...costs about $3.40hkd

The most beautiful in the world. We were told to go to the Intercontinental hotel for a drink and to see the lights at night. It was magical, drink was expensive $25 but worth every penny, I would go back in a minute. It was cool, you could take pictures, listen to a combo and see the skyline all at the same time.

Great Sight Just for Look!. Much can be said about Hong Kong. It is a place for instant gratification either with business or culture. Hong Kong as an island had transformed itself from the simple fisherman village with a huge influx of refugees from China in 50th to an important financial center now-a-day. Whatever happened the island is still thriving ahead with much of the energy as in the previous past. Looking at the Hong Kong Skyline either in the day time or in the evening with the light and sound, Hong Kong is still the ever struggling society that seek monetary reward on top of other. The Hong Kong Skyline is a very good proof of this principle of life basing in money and wealth.With the above understanding, we look at the Hong Kong Skyline in corporation with the human life behind the skyscraper dominated the whole horizon. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
Amazing skyline. Definitely one of the most beautiful skylines I have ever seen! On our last night there was a full moon and the reflections on the Kowloon waterfront were stunning.

The most lively and must-see skyline. The HK skyline is most lively and one of the most spectacular in the world, with one caveat: on some days when the pollution/smog from southern China does not spill over to HK. I am always fascinated by the variety and intensity of harbor traffic. The skyline are on both sides: Hong Kong island and Kowloon. The highest and most spectacular one now is from the top of ICC (International Commerce Center) in Kowloon -- at the observation deck (fee to get in) and from the Ritz-Carlton HK's restaurants (my favorite is from The Lounge window tables -- no fee as long as you're eating or drinking here). The sister tower of ICC is the IFC (International Finance Center) located in Central, HK. It too has expansive views of Kowloon and parts of Central. The IFC has the Four Seasons Hotel which also offers nice views of Kowloon skyline. As a New Yorker, I consider the HK skyline to be the most interesting and active skyline.

Beautiful building lights at night!. A must to be at Victoria Harbor to enjoy looking at the skyline! Hongkong is just hot and humid in July. One would need to wear cotton clothes, and very comfy shoes to walk around amidst mega crowd.
Skyscrapers Everywhere. Skyscrapers Everywhere. Lots of buildings look identical. Feels like playing Sim City. The whole city has an underground area that connects all the buildings too.

Areal MUST WATCH when in HK!. All superlatives we read before arriving are correct!
Real one of a kind unique view, and I'm an experienced traveler!
We saw it from our room at 16 floor of YMCA, we saw it from Victoria peak, we saw it from walking the TST cost line,its marvelous.

one of the best. Even after living in Hong Kong for over a decade, it is one of the 'must see' places in the world where you don't get tired of. The best view is from Tsim Sha Tsui, from there take the historic Star Ferry to Central. If you manage to be there at 8pm, you will even witness a symphony of lights during the daily light show, featuring over 40 buildings on both sides of the HK harbour.
Excellent skyline go to Sky100 tower and for free in China Bank Tower.. Skyline impressive go to Kowloon side to see it at night.Best seen from Sky100 tower on Kowllon side and at noghtime.
unbelievable. Pictures do not due justice to the unbelievable tall buildings with varying architecture against the harbour - breathtaking!
See it once. Great to see although this light and sound show is a little over rated. Still, worth seeing the once.

Stunning. From whatever angle you see the skyline, it is stunning! You will never get bored of the skyline, it is very impressive. Even tough litte tacky, with the music and all, make sure you see the laser show from Kowloon side at least once.

Don't be fooled...it is too impressive!!??. Having visited New york, Tokyo, and other major cities with an abundance of Skyscrapers when I first arrived in Hong Kong I felt a little underwhelmed.The densest population per area on the planet they say...We'll I didn't get it till I boarded the ferry to leave, and peering from the window realized the specks I was focusing on (buildings) where entire block size, and the Hotel I stayed in (a mere 55 stories) was dwarfed by the 100's of adjacent skyscrapers. Then there's Kowloon across the bay. I must say even the light show at 8.00pm each night did not impact me till I was able to appreciate the Hong Kong Landscape from Sea level.Aweinspiring, breathtaking, and every other superlative that comes to mind.

This is the soul of city. If you'll come in HK go to the Victoria peak and see magnificient views from the hill. It is an amasing and unforgettable expeetience. In the night is better. Don't be afraic by colosal queus at tram, avoid them taking a cab or a bus to the peak.

Hypnotic!. The skyline is out of this world!It is so stunning that I was just caught to stare in awe and still hard to realize that all this is man made - it looks like scifi movie during the symphony of the lights (every day 8pm). Or, even better than movies. Avenue of stars was a good place to see symphony of lights, but it seems to be quite crowded at a time. Skyline was definitely one of absolute high lights on my vacation and one of the reasons making me want to return to HK.

home for a while .... ignore the date I visited ... no option to put that I lived there for 3 years !! such an incredible, panoramic sight .. one that I miss and will never forget !! vibrant and memorable, fireworks over the bay used to be a sight to behold. If you ever get a chance to visit this incredible country do it - you won't regret it !!

Second Only to NYC. While unlike CNN, I don't think the Hong Kong skyline is as good as NYC's, it's definitely one of the top 5 in the world. Quite a few of the buildings are iconic and luckily there are many spots to see it from.To see Hong Kong's iconic skyline: go to the Avenue of the Stars on the Kowloon side. Alternatively you can pay for the Sky100 observation deck and have a slightly more encompassing view from above.To see the other side of Hong Kong's skyline: go to the Victoria Peak and you will see the famous picture that comes first in any search of Hong Kong (in no small part due to Wikipedia).To see Kowloon's skyline: go to one of the free observation decks on the Hong Kong side, like the Bank of China Tower (open one day a week), or the Exhibition Center.

Unique and well worth the look from below and above. Unique beautiful buildings. Take a good look across the water, skip the lame light show at night, and go to the peak by cable car and look down. Majestic views and great picture taking!

Memorable beyond belief. Beautiful coloured lights on 8pm for the laser show, sometimes during special occasions they have the fireworks too, but no matter day or night the view is so wonderful. Take the Star Ferry and you can take in the breathless views from both side of Victoria Harbour! The images you have will forever be with you

Great views. Our lovely hotel room in Metropark Hotel, Causeway Bay was the perfect place to view the night time panorama of the Hong Kong skyline. The building are so tall and the twinkling lights of all the harbour skyscrapers are mesmerising.

Get there early to get a spot. It only lasts for about 15 minutes so you don't want to miss the beginning.Take the MTR to East Tsim Sha Tsui or Tsim Sha Tsui stations, and follow the signs to "Avenue of Stars".

Gud view. Gud to see that Hong kong has developed so much. we were on 104 Floor. Elevator takes no time to reach there. Really you get a very gud view from the top level & also enjoy Hot tea in the coffe shop.

Probably the best skyline in the world. It's just incredible and definitely the best part of visiting HK.
