View it from avenue of stars on Kowloon and take the star ferry back over to Hong Kong island (sit at the front left side for best view). During day is very different from night so both times are probably worth it. 8pm for the light show every day is very impressive.
goregeous.. Beautiful display of coloured lights around 8 pm..reflecting into the water...well worth a view from a high spot....
Beautiful!. We were there for the opening of the Southeastern Asia Olympic Games and the sights and sounds were spectacular! Fireworks were unbelievable too!

Impressive. As our hotel was in Kowloon we had a fantastic view of the HK skyline especially at night with the christmas lights and lazer show. It was really amazing especially with all the boats continually travelling back and forth across the harbour.

Probably the best in the world. Amazing from either the Victoria Peak view, or from the Kowloon waterfront. Fills up early, so get there before sunset. Took a taxi to the top of the peak to save time because of the tram wait.

Excellent night view we have ever seen.. There are 5 minutes walk form the place we stayed to harbor and we do enjoy the night show on 8PM where the place will be flash lighting with powerful music,definitely very view.Walking pass through the culture center,there are star ferry and we have take a ferry to reach central,and visit Financial center where are so many retail shops.

Great views - exciting. We were here in March and while 3 days were really unclear due to the fog, the other days and when we were there last years, the views were brilliant. All the lights from many locations of Hong Kong make it special. Love love this city
You gotta see it !!!. One word of advice - don't forget your camera to record those stunning views, particularly at night !
Amazing at night. Words can't express how impressive it looks at night. Must do a cruise at night along the Victoria River

nowhere in the world. The skyline is so amazing that you can watch it for hours and still be wondering how people built such city in such short time! The hills give special glare to the city which although completely industrialized, in not flat as a pancake but mixes the multi-storey buildings with nature, making them even more interesting.
Hong Kong skyline is amazing. Regardless of the food, Hong Kong skyline is not to be missed. Where on earth could you find such attractive scenery?

Beautiful Skyline. I live in New York so i am "used" to skyline, but Hong Kong skyline is special. Harbor + beautiful buildings + mountain in the back = splendid!
We were lucky there were some fireworks on the roof top of the buildings the night we arrived in Hong Kong!
Most recognized but forever changing. It is amazing how beautiful the Skyline is. Taller and taller buildings are added every few months. It is changing and becoming more beautiful. Never forget.
Love the view. Love the view. Hongkong has skyscrapers, which makes the view beautiful! The ferry trip is worth in the night around 7:30-8:00 pm. The night view is very happening.

The best skyline I have seen so far. We went for the Symphony of Lights and we were surprised at how overwhelming everything was: the size of the skyscrapers, the boat traffic, the crowds, everything. This was a true Hong Kong experience and I definitely recommend that you take the Star Ferry to Central in order to complete this experience.Tip: If you don't have a professional camera (a good flash in particular), it is worth paying 40 Hong Kong dollars (roughly 5 US dollars) for a photo with the skyline in the background, as there are a lot of photographers lined on Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade. They print it on the spot for you and it becomes the perfect souvenir from Hong Kong.

Stunning. One of the best skylines anywhere in the world especially when combined with the harbor. You will never tire of the views. Walk the promenade or dine in one of the high rise restaurants to enjoy the view.

Amazing. Wow! I read reviews before visiting but never could I have imagined the magnificent sight we would see! We were all amazed. Both the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island skylines are seriously amazing.

Excellent the best I have ever seen. I find the Hong Kong skyline excellent. It all looks new with different architectural style for many buildings. Much better than new york and other places.Do take the ferry/bus to go to the other side (Tsim Sha TSui promenade) and have a look at the skyline from there during the night. The regular 8 o clock lighting shows are also good to watch!

Beautiful Scenery. The beautiful scenery of Hong Kong Skyscrapers is amazing. I stand on place called The Avenue of Star, near the Salisbury Rd. The best time to reach here is around 19.30. It was very amazing view...

An unforgettable view. Hong Kong has one of the most dramatic skyline in the world, and one of the longest (from Sheug Wan to North Point). It is best enjoyed from Tsim Tsa Tsui, walking along the shore by the Hong Kong Space Museum. Another good view point is the Star Ferry.

Broadway lights along the Harbor. Watch the great evening show for free from the Pier with your kids. Or with your sweetie sailing on the water in an authentic sailboat (chinese junk). Ticket includes two complimentary drinks for the 45 minute harbor cruise. Comfortable lounging seats and great breeze.Worth it.
not as expected. Heard of it more but reality let me down. lighting was not as expected. There was heavy downpour and sitting with an umbrella was really painful.
Light show honk kong hsrbour. Well worth taking the time in the evening to see this show best viewed from the mainland side somewhere around the star ferry terminal

Hazy view. Loved seeing some of the amazing skyline and different views of Hong Kong. The buildings are quite original. Took lots of pictures. However the view was lessened by the haze over the city. Some of the water views were a little better, and beautiful, overall.
This was on a free tour included with our Hotel Benito reservation. Excellent tour.

Gorgeous attraction. Hong Kong is a very special city. Its Skyline is unique in this world. You can get different views of its unique skyline from both sides of the harbour. The best way to catch and enjoy it is by taking the cross harbour ferry "Star Ferry". However, weather condition and season is a factor to consider. Best season to visit Hong Kong is fall which is around Sep to Nov.
Awesome. Awesome skyline, one of the best in the World. We found the best time to enjoy was in the late afternoon, just on sunset. Get in early to avoid the crowd particularly on the Kowloon side.

Just amaizing. We stayed in the Rhombus Hotel overlooking the River and being on the 40th floor gave us the panorama view of the Skyline and Lights , every night it was up to the top floor ( Garden ) to view this wonderfull City , Don't get to romantic , one night we forgot to go out for Dinner as we were taken aback with the Sights Sounds and Views .

Quintessential Hong Kong.. It's the classic view of HK that one sees in every film featuring this spectacular city. You can't visit Hong Kong without seeing Victoria Harbor. Once you've made it to Hong Kong you can't beat the price. It's free.
night time cruise. good country first time traveleers will like this small destination after singapore and bangkoke little humidity and lot of traffic

Simply Stunning.. As beautiful as the New York City skyline is, I thought the Hong Kong skyline was even more so. No trip to Hong Kong would be complete without seeing the skyline at night, with all the lights reflected off the waterfront at the harbor. It is absolutely magical. The best place to see it is from Kowloon. Water ferries are readily available at the harbor in Hong Kong. Don't miss this spectacular sight or you'll never forgive yourself.
Nagy Arafat. it is the best Skyline in the world , never seen anything like it and I resided in Chicago , Houston, Miami, and New York.
awesome. it's my first time to visit HK and i loved it. I love the colors the lights and most of all SHOPPING!!

I love looking at this city!. It's a great treat for the eyes at night to see this city from the harbour or the peak. It's also great to ride in the double decker buses and go around the city to Times Square and Stanley Market.

A must see!. We went in the evening and yes it was busy, but to see this awesome skyline in person was just jaw-dropping! My husband was able to get a great shot of the Chinese red-sailed boat with the skyline in the back ground and it is one of our favorite shots!
Bustling with life!. A good way of spending an evening in Hong Kong. Walk along the Harbor and enjoy the view of the city on the move.
Skyscrapers galore. We could not get over the number of buildings! !! The awesomeness of the skyline and the architecture

Worth seeing at night but light show was disappointing.. The lights on the tower blocks were very impressive at night (viewed from Kowloon) but we were disappointed with the 'light show' - it was quite cloudy so maybe that is why the lasers were not so impressive. Still worth a visit though.

Best skyline. Evenings show everyone that the Hongkong skyline is fabulous.Multicolored lights shine from buildings of different shapes and heights.Every evening at 8PM ,they offer a light and sound show which is one of a kind.Truly a sight to behold!
Hong Kong is breathtaking @ night. Hong Kong is for the top end shoppers with endless global stores available. Markets offer an alternative for cheaper shopping.
Def among the best skylines to photograph. Definitely among the best skylines to photograph but be early to get a good front row spot. The Hong Kong skyline laser show starts at 0800.

The Peak. I went to the Peak and it was an exciting venture. I was able to take pictures of the entire city of Hong Kong. The lights and scenery was absolutely wonderful. Everyone should visit there when you go to Hong Kong.
Beautiful Skyline!. When we went there the clouds didn't let us appreciate at all, but for what we were able to see, i would say it is Very Beautiful!

Memorable. The skyline overlooking HKG island is fantastic - especially at night. With the combination of high rise buildings with lights on and the peak back drop makes this a must see sight after the sun has gone down. I've seen the laser show a few times and I must admit I'm a little disappointed but I still love seeing this spectacular sight.

recommended and free. I advised to view the skyline from the harbour during the day and night but it you can't do both do it at night the buildings are more impressive. It is not far from a MRT station. You can sit there enjoy the view with drinking and eating. Public drinking is allowed there for those wondering but there is a McDo nearby and a 7-eleven. Make sure you bring your cameras to take plenty of photos. From there you can take a ferry (3-4mins) to hong kong island.
Very beautiful. The Skyline is a must see when in Hong Kong. There are several unique and spectacular buildings, which are very beautiful when its dark.

Beautiful and free. The infamous Hong Kong Skyline is so beautiful at night. I have visited this place many times and still love it. It is so romantic to take a stroll along the boardwalk The best thing is that there is no chance for this beautiful view.
Skyline. WOW. What a wonderful view. No dislikes. Loved the light show at night. Did a harbor cruise and enjoyed every minute of it. Just an all to all great place to see.

Beautiful. Come in the evening to enjoy the lights show, but come early to have a nice viewing spot. All the buildings light up in dazzling colors and the reflections in the sea are especially beautiful.

A must do in HK. Hong Kong Skyline is one of the best in the world! Great to see during the day and also at night. The Symphony of Lights is fantastic and well worth seeing. Make sure you get there early as it gets quite crowded.
Beautiful in the evening twilight. As the buildings light up one by one as darkness falls, the scene is beautiful ! At 8pm, there is the Symphony of Lights Showtime.
Nice place. You need to get there early as it get extremely packed and if you want to get some nice shots we need to get a place at the front. There is a also a show with lights

Wonderful view. The Hong Kong skyline is one of the most famous skylines in the world and it does not disappoint. Whether you are appreciating the view of the skyline from Victoria Peak (recommended) during the daytime, or watching be light show from Kowloon at night, the skyline does not disappoint. I definitely recommend staying in Kowloon so you can really appreciate the skyline.
Bright and intense. Love it, love it. We landed at the evening. We enjoyed the Hong Kong island view during our taxi ride to town, it was mesmerizing.

Over rated by others. Probably the.weather didn't add points to the skyline... It was kind of cloudy are the beginning.Other than some laser beams and some buildings lights. It's totally not worth the wait. Unless you are nearby, then it's not a big loss for missing it.I heard a group was comparing Singapore Mbps laser lights vs this hk skyline, they said the effect is better than hk's. I haven't seen mbs but I seen sentosa's and disney's. Honestly, I was truly disappointed when I saw this skyline on last sat.But near the ferry terminal side toward the stars avenue , some young groups or individuals will set up a small area to sing their songs or some singers' songs. Pretty nice but super crowded.

Great Harbour View. I am from New York and I am a helicopter pilot. As such I am accustomed to great views of skylines. I used to always fly at night on night trips to see the skyline all lit up. For years I thought the best thing in the world was the New York skyline. But in truth it doesn't hold a candle to the Hong Kong skyline. So whatever vantage point you can get to whether it be the peak for one of the many observation decks or rooftop restaurants I advise to go up and have a look. And no time could be better then around Christmas time where this Chinese City outdoes any western city I have ever been to in terms of decorating their buildings with Christmas lights it's amazing. Also I don't know if they are still doing it but for a while in the evenings at 8 o'clock pm they used to do laser shows around the buildings it was really nice

Victoria Peak skyline. Loved the view from Victoria Peak. It gives you a birdseye view of Victoria Harbor and skyline. Unfortunately I went during rain, but was still able to see the view. If I liked it during this time, I can only imagine how spectacular it is on a nicer day.
incredible view. take the tram to the Peak and enjoy the fantastic view to Kowloon.You can also eat at the peak cheap or expensive it is up to you. Are you in HK it is a must to go there.

Must see. Hong Kong skyline at night is one of the most amazing attractions in HK. You need to get there early as it get extremely packed and if you want to get some nice shots we need to get a place at the front. There is a also a show with lights
Pretty. Took the Big Red Bus and got to see the HK skyline from Victoria's Peak and from Kowloon. Do not spend the money for the night tour, not worth it.
Fantastic. Its really breathtaking. Make sure you are on the Kowloon side on the walk of stars to see the symphony of light at 8.00pm.
Great view. I like to hike from the bottom of the hill to top, about 10km. Too hot to hike from June to Sept. Should done this either in Nov/March.

Looks like you're facing a Picture! Amazing!. looks like a fantasy world in first shot, you can spend hours wandering at Avenue of stars, criss-crossing harbour via ferry or just sitting at an empty spot... Loved the lighting, loved the atmosphere.

Steves Trip. Go down to the peninsula just as it gets dark near the clock tower, get there early as it gets packed out with fellow tourists and wait for Hong Kong Island to light up. You will remember it for ever so take a tripod if you have a DSLR camera and capture the beams!

Gorgeous modern city. Some like old stone and historical settings. Others may like modern architecture, clean lines, and bright lights. I love Hong Kong and its modern skyline. What a fantastic city. I think old Uncle Chin is managing his new property nicely. Do not hesitate to visit Hong Kong! Check out that skyline!
Skyline is great at the right location. Looking from both Kowloon and Hong Kong side to each other at night is really great, also very signature Hong Kong experience.

Amazing view especially at night. The Hongkong skyline is one of its own, especially as there is not one skyline but actually two. Depending on whether you stay at Hongkong Island or in Kowloon, you can experience a different view on the metropolis of Hongkong. Recommended visiting hour is at night when the city is illuminated and at a certain time every evening there is a light show with music in which a number of Hongkong skyscrapers participate. There will always be tourists or locals taking photos, but space aplenty, so don't worry.
Great View. Great view. This is a must see when traveling to Hong Kong. Love the light show and the beautiful scenery.

3rd tallest building view cci tower. Great at night, visit the ozone bar, have a fabulous cocktail and soak up this impressive view. There is a light show during the evening for 15 minutes, this is quite cute, don't expect serious lazer lights you will be disappointed, lovely all the same.

Stay somewhere with Harbour views!. What an awesome view! I would highly recommend you stay somewhere with Habour and Ocean views. You wouldn't think it would make a difference in somewhere such as Hong Kong where you're out of your room a lot, but believe me, its well worth the extra money spent. The views and light shows are second to none.
Nice skyline show. The show will started on 8pm. But this is to advice that must go there around 7.30pm to book a nice seat.
Forever Memory. The skyline is absolutely breath taking. There are a lot of restaurants and shopping within that area to enjoy as well.

Could have sat here all night. One of the most iconic skylines in the world. Totally amazing to see. I could have quite happily sat watching the world go by all day/night.Great atmosphere and a feast for the eyes. You must see this.

Just the world's best city skyline. See them either from the Victoria Peak or from the Avenue of Stars. I was trying to capture it thru my lens in both locations and both times foggy. So if you've never been to other places, just the thinking that the ones you're seeing now is the best makes your trip very pleasurable.
Unbelievable views. Go up to the peak at night the views are out if this world. Eat at one of the restaurants to enjoy the view for longer
World class. One of the skylines you have to see in your lifetime. The amount of effort the city makes to impress you is commendable.
Pity about the Smog. Great view of the city from the Peak. We bought a red bus ticket which allowed us to skip the queue to the tram by over an hour. Plenty to do and see at the top
8,000 skyscrapers - how can you go wrong?. #1 city in the world for amount of skyscrapers, followed by #2 - New York, with 4,000. Stunning at night.
Beautiful views. When it's a clear night the views are amazing. It's definitely something worth doing. Don't forget to take your camera!
Not surprised me as espect. the light is beautyful but not surprised me as expect. and a sound is very slow not thrilled as it be.

Nice for first few visits. Try to be there for the 8 pm light and sound show if you are going for the first time. Even better if there's a fireworks show on special occasions like chinese new year or new years eve. If going on a normal day, try to reach there to witness the sunset.

empressive view. well, that is a must, even if your not a big fan of crowded urban ares and sky scrapers.
but it still empressed me....

Impressive. Waited until the laser show started, get there early to ensure a view at the front. Unfortunately for us, the weather was cloudy, so we didn't get a clear view. Would try and go again sometime.

Stunning. I have travelled to many large cities and this is by far the most beautiful and breathtaking skyline I have ever seen. It is just gorgeous...the buildings are all works of art in their own right and the mountains with their greenery and the beautiful bay in the front...just picture perfect. Try to do a cruise or one of the cable cars. You won't be sorry.

No words - breathtaking. Best thing in HK. best views are from avenue of stars. and near clock tower. Symphony of lights starts from 8pm everyday. Smog kills the magnificent view to be honest. But cant help. if interferes both day and night time appearing HK skyline has a filter in front.
best skyline. the view from avenue of stars was magnificent especially the colors in the water at night. although the symphony of lights show did not live up to our expectations.

How can you not be impressed by the Hong Kong city skyline?. Seriously, how can you not like the HK city skyline? It is awesome. The buildings and bright lights surrounded by the lush green mountains. The buildings really are monolithic and all mixed in with the HK 'grungy-ness' I love. It's a great city and you got to see it.
Feast to the eyes. Watching Hong Kong skyline is a memorable experience. Either from the Victoria Peak or from the Avenue of Stars, the skyline is worth watching under the lights.

A feast for the eyes from "The Peak". During holiday time be prepared to jostle with the crowds. The tram run to the peak was an accelerating experience, but before that, we have to wait for over an hour just to get into the tram! Once out of the tram the views are breathtaking, and as the sun sets - simply marvelous.The Hongkong skyline, laser works on buildings was a feast for the eyes. On our return it was back to the long queue...Overall the trip was an unforgettable one! Will go thru the queue all over again if we have to! The view at the peak made every inconvenience worth it!
Amazing view from "The Peak". Amazing view. If you take a tram, on the way up is really crowded, I recommend taking a taxi going there and the tram on the way back.

Simply Breathtaking. The day was so foggy that it's recommendable for you to visit here at night when the lights are all illuminated. It was indeed thrilling to see all the lights and laser there at night, definitely a beautiful background for shooting some photos.

Unmatched, simply amazing. There's something to be said about seeing a cluster of skyscrapers crammed up between the ocean and the mountains, particularly at night.The light show can be missed, though. It's just a bunch of lasers with no discernable synchronization.

Great photo opportunity. We go to see the skyline every time we are in HK, and I think nighttime is much prettier than daytime, with all the lights. Compared to a few years ago there are fewer lights on, due to environmental concerns and energy-saving, but there are enough lights on to make a most dramatic scene and a wonderful backdrop for your photos!I take my kids to see the skyline to look at all the tall buildings. Living in a small town in England our buildings are very short, being only a few stories in height. The kids loved looking at the tall skyscrapers with the lights running up and down the outside.Note: many of the buildings put special lights up for Christmas and Chinese new year to make huge pictures that flash/move. Well worth a visit.

Pfffy - a row of buildings. Big deal!. I can never understand the fascination people have with a row of buildings across water. HK skyline, is like Sydney skyline, New York skyline [insert city name here] skyline. It's a row of buildings that are colourfully lit up at night. Not an attraction in my opinion. You won't het a romantic shiver down your spine looking at the buildings, or walking through the masses during the evening light show.

Looks Great. See it from both sides of the harbour! Take the Star Ferry across to the other side. Looks great in both the day and nighttime. Remember the sound and light show on the buildings at 8pm as well. Best veiwed from the avenue of Stars

Highrise buildings can look charming too. View HK skyline from the Peak and Tsim Sa Tsui waterfront. If you go to Tsim Sa Tsui waterfront at 8pm, there is a light show. But, don't put your expectations too high if you have seen light and sound shows in other cities. This is kindy level. But it is free.
HK Skyline. During my staying weather was lovely and sky really clean. Had once more the chance to enjoy one of the best skyline in the world. I love it
Other than Shanghai Skyline, Hong Kong Skyline is outstanding!. Best option is to take a bout tour that ends close to the nigh or go to the high tower building for wonderful pictures and footage!

Superb, easily among the best. Superb views. It can be easily said it's among the top 10 beautiful skylines among the world cities. Night views are more stunning, no matter you are at Kowloon side or at HongKong, views from both sides are equally stunning.Suggest to make sure you see both day and night views.
Brilliant. Beautiful skyline. except when its polluted. thick haze! should watch the light show. recommended to go at night.

Excellent. A great view but not always very clear!The best view is along the Avenue of Stars at any time. Seeing the view by day and night is recommended though! Skip the light show. It's rubbish and very crowded! Also the Sky 100 observation deck of the ICC building is a great place to see Hong Kong properly. In my opinion it's the best view of Hong Kong. The Peak observation deck is OK but very busy!For free views of the city go up the IFC2 tower to the 55th floor. It's free to go up! Only snag is it looks over the city and not the harbour. Another decent free building is the Bank of China tower (the one with lots of rectangle shapes). This one does look over the harbour.
Amazing view!. Relaxing and memorable. My kid loved it! Tiring but worth it. Comfortable clothing and shoes recommended esp. for kids.

Check It Out from different Locations.. Everyone looks at the skyline from the Star Ferry or the Peak and that is all great particularly as the night falls. To improve the experiences there are other opportunities say from the Convention Centre, Causeway Bay and from any number of tall buildings. One can take the Star Ferry and co ordinate with the Symphony of Lights Show. There are no shortages of Skylines in Hong Kong and I suggest that people go to Tseun Wan and Tseun Wan West and see the remarkable views across the water towards Lantau Island.

One of the best city skylines in the world. This is by far one of the best city skylines I have ever seen . Night time is amazing . We were catching the ferry back across to Kowloon ( star ferry is only $2.5 hing kong dollar ) so 30 cents in Aussie dollars well with the journey . We got some of the most incredible photos . Post card worthy
a wondefull piece of view. just a superb feeling when walking around the victoria harbour with this view. nice light display. I am lucky as i am getting good weather to view it

Looks great anytime. The skyline is striking in the evening, but also looks impressive in the daytime. The light show is good, but for me it was only a minor increment on the already impressive sight and I would not personally go out of my way much to be there are the precise time for the show. It's also worth getting my on one of the tall buildings for a view of the city from above, for example from one of the (expensive) establishments in Peking One.

Super. I am a city person and city lights excite me... The hongkong skyline is fabulous and better than seeing during the laser show is to see if from the sky deck on the peak on a clear day.. Don't miss it ... It will take ur breath away

Lovely. True that HK skyline is one of the best so far I've seen. Well coordinated, colorful and majestic. You should just ensure you watch it from the right place to enjoy the view. Tsim Shai Shui promenade connected by ferry from IFC mall is where I'd seen it from.

Eight Wonder of the World!. Just an amazing spectacular view and it's free! Can get busy by the clock tower and Avenue of Stars. Even better view from the Intercontinental bar, but that's expensive.Didn't think the 8pm light show made it any better.That's one crossed of my to do before I die list!

Spectacular. Spectacular scene. Having watched similar sites else where in the world, i can vouch for this site.Try to carry your tripods, if you wish to capture the transformation of the scene during late evening to night. The avenue of stars is not very impressive, given that most stars are local ones. We cannot identify any star other than Jackie Chan and Bruce Lee. The view from Victoria Peak is spectacular, as well. Try and get the glimpse during day and night from the Peak, if time permits. Spectacular is the word to describe the experience.
Out of this world. The tram ride was awesome,the view all the way up was great. The sky line of Hong Kong was mind blowing
All that you've heard.... Well it is very commercial, but there is something about seeing all those brand names and the fun lights sparkling at you across the harbor that just makes you feel good!

Excellent. We were here by Mac 2010 so please ignore the visited date. We lived at nearby Tsian Sha Zui just walked can arrived this 星光大道. The light show started every nite 8pm. It's perform together with music. They are cooperated very well each other. Very beautiful and amazing...
It is spectacular. But then what?. It is an incredible skyline, great lights, fun but a little lack luster laser light show. Go to dinner somewhere with a view and enjoy with a glass of wine.

The Light Show at Night is Definitely Worth Seeing. There is a laser light show at 8pm each night on the waterfront facing the Hong Kong island skyline. The skyline is lit up with laser lights and a number of the buildings have lights that also participate in the show. There is music that accompanies the light show. Very impressive and enjoyable. A very beautiful sight and it's free!

Massive and awsome. Likes: Make sure you see it from the victoria peak, and see the night light show.
Dislikes: Nothing worth mentioning.
The Best Skyline in the World. Dubai, Shanghai cannot match the beauty of Hong Kong's skyline. The most impressive skyline in the world is in this dynamic city.

Beautiful Views. My family and I sailed in a Junk boat along the harbour one night. The views of the skyline are like nothing I have seen before, and you really have to see all the lights of the buildings and neon signs in person to truly appreciate them (sounds weird, i know). Well worth having a stroll along the harbour at night!
For the best views. Take the Star Ferry in the evening to the other side and watch the Symphony of Lights skyline light show, 8pm every evening.

Beautiful. It was one of the best views. Must make it a point to visit. Just sit and relax watching the harbour and the beautiful skyline in the night of the most bustling city. Nice place for the kids too.

The best. Nothing actually prepares one for the view that the skyline offers.One of the best skylines anywhere in the world.Best viewed by a ferry at night around 8pm because of the symphony of light show.
Beautiful view. Much more beautiful at night time. Nice walk along the harbour too. You can find seats and photo stalls along the walk way. As well as lighting show at 8pm everyday
Awesome. There is nothing like the view of Hong Kong from the Peak. Fantastic photos, but queue for Peak Tram can be long and crowded.
Very pretty at night. Like most large cities in China the lights at night are very pretty. I think it would be nice to enjoy the lights from the harbour on a dinner cruise or Chinese Junk.
The best way to go. Liked an accuracy and clealiness. very modern way to go from point A to point B. Every announcement was made in Chinese and also in English.

Anywhere, anytime. What's not to love about watching Hong Kong Skyline and the harbour. Hong Kong is a really busy place and it is easy to get caught up in the hustle and bustle. To take time out just find a place to sit and watch the harbour: day or night, it doesn't matter. Always something to look at but moving at a more leisurely pace, it is a way to de stress. Kowloon left of the Star ferry terminal, Harbour side from the rooftop of the IFC mall, the peak. there are lots of places - just find one and chill.
wow. just fabulous - all day, all night, activity, lights, lasers, the most exciting view ever, and the most fascinating to watch

Views of the skyscrapers looking down on high. The best views of Hong Kong island are available from the area just eastwards of the Kowloon water bus terminal. From here one can view the buildings on Hong Kong island and watch the water traffic which is quite fascinating.
Essence of HK. Gotta go during evening to enjoy the sunset while taking a stroll. The lights show is a sight to catch!

The lights across the water from the skyscrapers was really cool. This was an adder benefit of walking on the promenade. The buildings are all lit up at night and send these rainbow colors across the water. Great picture taking opportunity.I will say again though that even at night Hong Kong was too hot for me!
Night Skyline - must see. Enjoyed light show and skyline - one evening from Aqua Bar and then from Star Ferry. Both great experiences.

Excellent - especially at night. The views are simply astounding. I saw the skyline at night from the Sky 100 observation deck (located on the 100th floor of the ICC building in Kowloon) and and also from the Ozone Bar (even higher on the 118th floor) at night on the ICC in Kowloon - simply breathtaking. But perhaps even more memorable an superb are the closer and almost unreal views by day and night on the ferry from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon and back, and from Aqua restaurant in TST, Kowloon. The Hong Kong skyline stands out amongst other city skylines, given the amazing views from both Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, whether on a clear or cloudy day and especially at night. In a word, stellar.

Amazing views too windy but great. Worth to visit after sun goes down, see the star walk and put your hands in the stats like in Hollywood, great to see locals and tourists and also to take pics of the bay during the day or night, some smell like burned oil or gas around but not a big deal still pretty place to be at.

Brilliant at Night. Always something to see. Best value at night especially when the light show was on. During the day the harbour is really busy with shipping and small vessels. Get on the ferry for a sensational (and very cheap) cruise.
Laser light show is amazing. Shopping in Temple St Night market is fab. Star Ferry & trams a real slice of authentic Hong Kong. Just say no to the street hawkers and they will leave you alone.

The skyline is beatiful, the light show is boring. Took a ferry from HK side to Kowloon side view the light show which starts at 8pm every night. The view is excellent but the light show is boring. Gets crowded by the harbour. Not really worth sitting around and watching.
Awesome. Great place to have a blast and look at all the Asian people with their cameras and great infrastructure in this place.

Best in the world. Good views. With the lights from the skyscrappers things can be really good.
But clouds can play spoilsport.
very nice skyline. let say it is one the best in the world. but there is a lot of pollution. it is very beautiful in night. walk around the bay is fantastic.

Pretty light show. It starts at 8pm. Watch it from the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade. There will be less people there compared to watching it from the ferry tour which will cost you unnecessary expenditures. It's just a colorful light show from a line of all the tall buildings located across the waters at the Hong Kong Island. It lasts for abt 10-15 mins. Worth a watch though.
always the best. I like to visit the skyline and watch symphony most of the time . it is best viewed from the harbour
Fantastic. I have never seen more Skyscraper anywhere in the world.The light show at 20:00 is worth watching from the Kowloon side.
Best ever!!. Well.. Best skyline ever .. What more can I say. Take a ferry during the evening to witness this magnificent skyline during daylight and night..
What a view!. This is particularly spectacular at night when the lights come on and viewed from Kowloon is even better.
worth seeing. take a look especially at night when there is a light show all the tall buildings put on a good display.

One of the most beautiful skyline. Hong Kong has one of the most beautiful skylines in the world. No matter if watching it from one of the many skyscrapers or from the place. It is just amazing. The many different lights from buildings advertisements and the reflection from the just make it perfect.

Symphony of Lights. Depending on your previous experience, you may be shocked or maybe not impressed that much by the show (considering all hype) - ether way you owe it to yourself to see it at least once. Arguably it's a biggest laser show in the world, so why not, right?They key is picking the good view point - your overall experience depends on it a lot. And as far as I'm concerned, you've got to make one main choice: ether you watch it from the boat or from the shore. Naturally, with first option being highly superior, it's also more expensive (no surprise here, since second one is virtually free). No matter what you choose, I'm sure you will enjoy it, so don't stress out too much if you can't spare money for the boat :)
The PEAK. incredible 360° site seeing of HK! A must do! And the way up there with the tram is very typical and joyful!

Spectacular on a clear night. One of the world great attractions and it is (almost) free. The lights are spectacular but a lot of the time, the air pollution shroud it in a pea soup grip. On a night after a rain storm or a typhoon, before the air pollution sets in, get a ferry from Wanchai to TST and enjoy the view. On bad nights, just imagine what it could have been.
Awesome. Harbour and the skyline, look majestic, specially at night. View from avenue of stars is awesome. Its amazing to see it from Victoria peak as well.

Impressive. Take the STAR FERRY to Kowloon and walk along the promenade (Avenue of s Stars) to enjoy an unparalleled view of the skyscrapers nestled in the topical hills. Day and Night are both worth a visit.

Romantic Skyline. The Hong Kong skyline has evolved epically over the past 20 years, and it is the only place in HK, where you want to (and can) stand still to watch the world go by. The vibrance of the city comes to high at 7pm, once all the lights are on. It is so beautiful that you feel like its christmas everyday. Don't miss the view from Tsim Sha Tsui harbour front. It will make you fall in love with this city!

Spectacular harbour view!!!. The harbour view at night or day is really spectacular on a clear day!!! If you come during the fireworks display occasion, you will leave the harbour totally mesmerise!!! There's also a nice walk along the harbour front where you can see your favourite film stars' hand prints on the pavements!!!!
Unique. There is no other skyline that packs this visual wow! punch. An architectural feast for your eyes and cameras.
A great place for sunset. It is nice if you can get there for sunset and then watch the sun go down and the lights come on. The daily light show is also worth seeing, I think at 11:00pm but check.

One of those things you have to see. Pictures rarely capture the vibrancy and pulsing life of this town. Go and see it. Stand on the seafront, or do it from Victoria Peak, or both. If you're arriving there at night you'll feel it the moment you step of the plane. This is not like any other city at night.

Impressive concrete jungle. Hong Kong skylines are impressive. Its like Monaco of Asia, just better. Some of the best way to view the skyline are from along the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade or Victoria peak. But I believe there must be even awesome ways to appreciate this man made wonder. And at night, of course the impressive light show, but i kinda wish there would be more on the light show.

Breathtaking - Every time. On numerous visits, it's always breathtaking, by day and by night, culminating in the Symphony of Lights spectacular at 8pm each evening. To walk along the Kowloon waterfront, from the TST to Star Ferry Terminal and gaze across the harbour soaking in the view. Then to get 'up close & personal' with the buildings on the island does stretch your neck muscles when you stare at the skyscrapers stretching themselves skyward. There is some modern architecture so behold if you have the inclination.

Impressive manmade and natural beauty. Two recommended viewing points. First see it from the star ferry pier and take the ferry across, then take the tram up to Victoria Peak and sea it from above. An unforgetable experience.
Beautifull view!!. We went to the lightshow around 8, this was really beautifull but 15 minutes was a little to long. However a must see place!
beautiful. unique.The light show, the building the harbour it self, . Very nice city where I would see myself live

Veeerrryyy impressive. I'm a native New Yorker so know about skylines already.And this one is number two after you know what.And they know how to light things up after dark . Take the ferry at night and see things from both sides.

Great light show. We were on a cruise ship at the Ocean Terminal in the Hong Kong harbor watching the show with cocktails freely available. There was ongoing commentary for the show. It was more entertaining than I had expected. Lots of color and flashing lights. The weather was warm but not oppressive. Very romantic.
A must see. This you have to experience if you are visiting Hong Kong. Get info at where to stand and at what time (I think the show is at 8pm). You will be truly amazed at the performance.
must be good. when we reached it was too cloudy and no skyline could be seen. The view must be spectacular from such a height but one needs to be fortunate enough.

View from Victoria Harbour & Victoria Peak. The night skyline from the Victoria Peak is magnificent and magical! You can even keep a memoir of your visit to The Peak by taking photographs with the city skyline at the back which they provided.
You can also enjoy the breathtaking afternoon view of the skyline and harbour from the Victoria Harbour while chewing on grilled squid too!

The IFC building. takes my breath away every time I look at it. and the rest of the skyline is pretty cool too. Note that its the HK Island skyline that is fab, not really the Kowloon side. Don't bother paying exorbitant prices for the restaurants to see the light show, just go down to avenue of the stars and watch the show for free!

Nice views. When you go to Hong Kong you will see one of the most spectacular views from the plane coming in over the islands and mountains. HongKong is a nice place for both business and Pleasure, but be aware of the prices here. It's expensiveEnjoy

Worlds best skyline. Seeing the Hong Kong Skyline for the first time is a truly breathtaking experience, at any time of the day. It is without doubt the most impressive skyline in the world. The hundreds of tightly packed glittering skyscrapers set in front of the mountains and reflecting in Victoria Harbor is a sight that you will never forget. Take a stroll along the 'Avenue of Stars', watch the Symphony of Lights (a musically synchronized light and laser using the skyscrapers) in the evening, relax at one of the fancy restaurants and cafes that line the harbor front area and take it all in. For alternative (and equally breathtaking) views of the skyline take the historic 'Star Ferry' across the harbor to see the skyline up close or look down onto the city with a birds eye view (something you can only do in Hong Kong) from 'Victoria Peak'.

The Peak. I've heard you get a great view at the top of the peak, sadly for my partner and I we had bad weather (sea of white clouds and some rain) the two nights we tried.As a result, I'd strongly recommend getting the peak tram up to the peak mall and then if the view is looking good, I'd pay the extra for the observation deck, if not you've not lost anything apart from equivalent of a few English pounds on the tram fare and you can still enjoy the shops, restaurants and bars at the top here!

Nice but raining and misty. The views from both sides using the ferry are awesome as you pull away, despite the rainy day we experienced. The views from the Peak are even better, but again would be better if it had not been misty and raining.We also saw the Kowloon side from our hotel room on a higher floor. We didn't experience the light show though and if we had the time would have chosen to hop over to Kowloon to the Sheraton's bar at the top. A good experience from wherever you view this skyline.
Glitz & Glamour impress!. Even more so, at night, as you take a boat cruise to Repulse Bay & back to Pier 9! The seas may be choppy but wait for the Laser Show at 2000 hours!
Excellent. Worth checking our from both sides of the harbour for different views during the day and night.The light show at 8pm each night is okay. It's a must for visiting Hong Kong.

Beautiful sight - don't forget the light show with music. The Symphony of Lights is a lovely accompaniment to a cocktail in a suitably located hotel bar. Sometimes they play the music as well. Audiences can also listen to the radio along the harbor: FM103.4 MHz (English). The skyline is also quite spectacular even from the Star ferry which is well worth the ride rather than just taking the underground train.

Must See!. Hong Kong Skyline is beyond gorgeous at any time of day. At 8 pm every night, there is a light show on the buildings. We stopped to see the show several evenings during our one week in Hong Kong

A bit haphazardly done. It gives a clear view of the waterways, especially on a clear sunny day. I went up to the Peak to have a better view of the skyline and took lots of photos on the skyline. You can see from there the Happy Horse Racing ground, the beaches and the islands.

The old ferry makes the best choice. It's the cheapest means of transport and while you may not have a drink you get the best views when the weather is fine that is. When going from Wanchai seat on the side by the station as it will provide the best views once it departs, and the other way round upon return. It leaves every 15 minutes and may even see the lights's show from there.
A magnificent site by day or night. At eight o'clock each evening there is a light show; all the main buildings participate its a great site.

Most spectacular skyline in the world. The Hong Kong skyline is in my estimation the most spectacular in the world. And I lived in New York City for over 17 years and saw some great building, but it still does not come close to Hong Kong. There are many ways to appreciate the views, and if you do any number of tourist things, you will get to see the skyline both at day and night. A ride up to Victoria Peak during the day will give you fantastic views. If you go up Sky100, again you will get some great sights, but for night time viewing head to the promenade in Tsim Sha Tsui right behind the Intercontinental Hotel at about 7:00 and you will see the spectacular skyline along with a light show. The light show is not that great, but the skyline with the lights and crowds of people is a definite for a visit to Hong Kong. Tsim Sha Sui is a stop on the MTR red line.
Impressive . You can simply sit by the bay and watch all the skyscrapers, the boats passing by and if you are at night the symphony of lights.

Obviously a must see!. I saw the skyline by walking along Causeway Bay at night. I ran into a photography exhibition and got a professional photo taken for a few dollars. It is beautiful and if you walk right the way along Causeway Bay you will see it from different perspectives. I walked alone and felt quite safe. It's quite a good way to spend a relaxing evening - a pleasant stroll along the bay.
Breathtaking Views!. The view of Hong Kong Island on different angles from the sky100 is spectacular! This is definitely a must see when you are in Hong Kong.
great Skyline!. Lots of different buildings, lightshow in the evening, some nice art on the boulevard! Nice restaurants close by, you could walk for a long time..

The Skyline that Just won't End!. You may have seen pictures of the Hong Kong skyline, but you don't get it until you see ALL of the skyline! It goes on and on! There's no where to go but up...and up they go. Building after building, tower after tower. It's spectacular both day and night. Many building have free access to their rooftop via. restaurants, so choose one on a clear evening to see the lights at night.The other best way to see the skyline, is to do a harbour trip. This could be a tour, or just a taxi to some of the floating restaurants. You'll also get to see some awfully big yachts this way! Enjoy...there is nothing like it!

All Good At The Peak. The Peak is pretty pricey - HKD 40 for a round trip to the peak, and HKD 40 just to go to the rooftop. Very pricey, and barely worth it. Well, hard to say -- there was a lot of fog, but the view was amazing. All in all, would probably do it again. It's a must-see.
Worth a visit. The Hong Kong Shyline from various avenues - from the Peak from Tshim Sha Sui Promenade etc. are a must see.

don t expect a magic moment. It is nice and worth to see but definitely not a must. the city by night is beautiful, but the light show does not bring much. the music is probably produced by a kid of 5 years old, it sounds so ridiculous that we could not stop laughing...
Great View. Since Hong Kong is a business city but have very limited land, so the house/apartment goes higher and higher. It is marvelous to see all the modern design building

excellent place. Such a great place to visit in ferry in eve. It is awesome and truly magnificent view. Your eyes will not able to catch the whole show there, no matter how hard you try. Its memories that cannot be forgotten.

A history of architecture. The sklyline represents modern architecture of the last 40 years. It is very interesting seeing the progresses dones during that period and the way building has developed. For skyscraper interests this is a great place to study their past and present. Hong Kong might be the most sophisticated place for architecture worldwide. It is an unique opportunity to study it in real scenario and to get ideas for city developments. The effectiveness of space use and the tackling of environmental issues is various at this place and still it was succeeded. A good example of how cautious development should be done.

A wonderful to be in evening. Hongkong skyline is a must see place if you are in Hongkong. I will also recommend a ferry ride. A walk near Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade is always very relaxing. Enjoyed and highly recommeded

Best Skyline in the world.. Best Skyline in the world. Even beats New York in my eyes!! I have lived here for over three years now and I never seem to tire from it, takes my breath away every time I see it! Stunning!
Star ferry for me. I know it is the iconic scene from Hong Kong and what better than the star ferry at dusk for the equivalent of less than 25p It cannot be beat

Light show disapointing!. After hearing really good things about the light show I was very very disappointed in it. I actually left half way through the show.
I think the best way to see the skyline is catching the ferry at night
Impressive. It is a very impressive Skyline in front of the green hills, which are surrounding the city. the lightshow in the evening is also nice!

Fabulous views. The harbour and its surrounding buildings are spectacular, up with London, Paris and New York. Try a visit to the Aqua Spirit or Felix to see the vista from on high, or take a sundowner on the splendid Aqua Luna junk cruise.

Admiring the Best Skyline in Asia. Hong Kong is known for many things but one of the main attractions in the city is the Victoria Harbour with its amazing skyline of skyscrapers with junk boats sailing past in the foreground.I have only been to Hong Kong once, and I made sure that Victoria Harbour was my first port of call. I consider the Hong Kong skyline along the harbour to be the finest in the world, even ahead of the numerous skyscrapers of New York, Dubai, Tokyo, the Marina Bay area of Singapore, or even Sydney Harbour! There is just something so special about Hong Kong’s waterfront.There is a boardwalk alongside the harbour called The Avenue of Stars, which showcases the famous names in the Hong Kong and Cantonese entertainment industries, which began with the Shaw Brothers’ movie studio and has since spawned numerous Kung-Fu and martial arts heroes such as Bruce Lee.It is often blisteringly hot and humid in Hong Kong, and along the Avenue of Stars there is not much respite from the glaring sun, so make sure you bring along an umbrella or top up with sun lotion! It is nevertheless a popular area for tourists and locals alike to enjoy a pleasant walk in the daytime while enjoying the view and taking photos! It is in the evening, however, when the Harbour comes to life. A breath-taking laser and light show called The Symphony of Lights is held every night where the skyscrapers on the Central side of Hong Kong are illuminated to a musical soundtrack. It provides an amazing photo and video opportunity!There are plenty of things to do and go and see in Hong Kong, including the famous Victoria Peak, but you cannot go wrong by spending an hour or two at Victoria Harbour in the daytime, and then return in the evening for the entertainment. It is really one of the ‘happening areas’ of the city. The show is, of course, free, but make sure to get there quite early in the evening, as you don’t want too many people standing in front of you obscuring your views!

Laser light show. Viewing the laser light show was very awesome riding on the party boat. There was unlimited drinks and a snack provided while cruising the bay watching the laser show and music presentation.

Excellent. The skyline at night time was awesome. The amount of lights and the skyscrapers gave an awesome backdrop. Make sure you go on a clear night and also go on the star ferry for the on water view

One of the greatest skylines in the world. Get yourself to the Symphony of Lights one evening, standing somewhere around the Avenue of Stars. It is very cheesy and not quite as impressive as the adverts on the plane make out (ie no fireworks - I think they reserve this for special occasions such as New Year) but it is very cleverly done using lasers and building lights. It is a shame the music is synthesised though.While this gives you a great view across the river, you have to go up to Victoria peak, the views of the city are second to none, no trip to Hong Kong would be complete without taking the time to see Hong Kong from above!

Amazing! A must when in HK! . My husband and I spent a week in Hong Kong in May and this was the highlight of our trip! We caught a ferry from Central on Hong Kong Island to Tsim Sha Tsui and watched the light show at 8pm. The view was just spectacular! We were both blown away by the skyline! This a must see when in Hong Kong!
Best at Night. Don't Miss the Symphony of Lights Laser Show where the Buildings Light up during the 15 minute show every evening at 8 pm. Best Viewed from the Avenue of the Stars on TST Promenade
Hong Kong skyline. Have enjoyed looking at the ever changing skyline - although it has been rain and cloud shrouded the whole time we have been here, it has still been treat
You must to see it!!!. The best panorama ever!!! Probably the best view is from the Tsim Sha Tsui side, especially at the night. I hope to be there on New Year's Eve.
Great views. Leave Kowloon on Star Ferry @ 20.00 and get great view aor walk along the promenade and great views of the Island

As iconic and as amazing as it looks in films... Best seen from Tsim Sha Tsui - with particularly good vantage points being Cucina (in the HK Marco Polo) or Felix (in the Peninsula) and as iconic as it looks in films. And our top tip is to stay in one of the hotels in Kowloon with a harbour-view room - it's the most amazing view to wake up to each morning and the hotels are generally a little cheaper than over on HK island.

Busy, noisy, exciting, everything a city should be. A view that you shouldn't miss. See it and the light show from the Sheraton hotel, near Nathan road or other bars and restaurants. Definitely recommended.

Overrated, I feel. At 8pm, they have the I light display. This 15mins show is slightly overrated. Against an oriental music, the laser beams was following its beat and but after a while, it was nothing more than just laser moving with the beats. You need not squeeze with crowds despite being there on a Friday night. The place was windy and was spacious.
Amazing Skyline. If there is something we loved about Hong Kong than it is the amazing skyline. The buildings will just blow your mind. I rate this the best skyline in the world together with Dubai.

Stunning Skyline. Lots of people lined up across the waterfront with cameras in tow, and the atmosphere grew tense with anticipation and people trying to get good position to see the symphony of lights. Then at 8pm or thereabouts the music started playing and a series of spotlights shooting off the roofs of skyscrapers in tune also shooting of the odd laser into the sky and flashing a few lights. It is definitely worth spending a few minutes on the Avenue of the Stars to see the city lit up and looking gorgeous, with lights reflecting of the harbour.
Delight for the eyes. The legendary HK sky line continues to evolve and to delight the eyes of visitors. One never tires of gazing upon it.
a must see. The night we watched it was pouring with rain, which did dampen our experience but still worth doing. Hong Kong it quite a sight when all lit up.

Wonderful views by day - and by night with added music and lights. Just walking anywhere along Kowloon harbour side gives great views of the Hong Kong Island skyline, but do it in the evening when everything is lit up is an added extra. And there is the nightly light and sound show to make it even better.You have to stop and wonder at this view whenever in Kowloon. And you also get a good view from the Hong Kong side looking over to Kowloon.
HK Skyline. The skyline is really nice, beats most of the skylines I have seen. The light show on the otherhand was a bit disappointing.

The best in the World. Seriously amazing... come from many directions in HK to get great views... be there around 9pm for the light show... jog along the harbour to see the junk boat at around 8pm... one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen... bright red sails against the skyline... so cute.
Great view. Took the Peak tram to the skyline and went to the Mall rooftop to view the HK skyline - which was for free!

Best taken from the sea. The sky scrapers of Hong Kong glimmer in the evening light with a life of their own. Best viewed from the sea, as evening darkens to night. Take a ferry trip (1 hour) from the Kowloon side at 6:55pm or so, and you get both dusk and dark, and are back at the terminal in time to catch the light show at 8:15pm. It's free, don't expect too much, but entertaining. The harbour itself teems with boats of all shapes and sizes, and with the skyline behind and the soft light, it is really very beautiful. Kowloon has it's own skyscrapers of course, so from the boat trip you see it all. Well worth it.

One of the best skylines i've ever seen. Fantastic skyline of lots of modern buildings. View from avenue of the stars in Kowloon is great as is the view from the river on a boat. This is a great place to start a trip in Hong Kong.

HK is so nice. Great skyline. I love it A lot of people come every day to HK for shopping. Not me - I always come for working. When I go to the fair in the Exebition Center, I take always the very cheap Starferry, because I can have look to both sides Kowloon and Hong Kong side from the middle. In the evening at 8:00 the skyline says Hello to all the visitors during the lightshow. A must for every visitor.
I love Hong Kong. Very beautiful, Very nice sky line. We took a ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui, it is relax and fantastic. I love Hong Kong.
Only from The Peak!. Stunning is the word, but only make the trip up to The Peak to view the skyline on a clear day or night.
WOW!!. Its the best skyline in the world and the 8 pm symphony of light show makes it even better.We took a cruise and it was a amazing view.Also the view from avenue of stars is just mesmerising.

Nice view but mainly of tall buildings. The skyline view is pleasant but not breath taking and most of very tall building although many with unique architecture. Worth a picture or two but the view of the Shanghai harbour is worth the trip.
One of the most beauiful and stunning views. If you are a fan of big city skylines the Hong Kong Island Skyline is one of the most awesome and approachable.

Worth Seeing. This was a lovely thing to experience. We took the ferry from Hong Kong Island and walked to the viewing area and it made for a nice evening. Read up on the back story of the show. It gives you a better idea of the light choreography. Great photo op of the skyline too.

Beautiful day or night. Visited at night and was amazed at the scene. The normal lights and signs were enhanced by additional lights and lasers. The area near the ferry terminal did get busy but there was plenty of space along the harbour and it was easy to get a good view. During the day it is also a spectacular view and is a lovely area to wander along. Close to lots of restuarants and bars for refreshments.
Must see. Take the star ferry and go to Kowloon,hopefully the weather will be clear,sit back and watch the light show,well worth seeing.

DO NOT MISS at night time... A breathtaking photogenic skyline that at night becomes even more interesting and interactive with the laser show at 8:00pm.Bring your camera and tripod and get fantastic images from here!
Night view was fantastic. Visited at night and able to have a good overview of the skyline of Hong Kong. The light show at 8pm was alright and should spend some time walking along the bay,
Best viewed from the peak and harbour. Spectacular skyline... we witnessed from the Victoria peak and harbor (while travelling on the Star Ferry)
Must see. It makes Hong Kong quite spectacular, viewing the city lights is a must, it does get fairly busy thought. Its also worth taking the ferry from one side to the other

very impressive. nice lightshow at night. looks impressive both in the day and at night. was a bit misty the morning i arrived, so it didnt look that great. cleared up by night and all the famous colours and lights came out to play
fantastic. The skyline is fabulous, skyscrapers, old and new architecture and a n amazing light show of an evening across the harbor.
Spectacular. Wow!! The city skyline has to be seen to be believed and at night it was magical. Just beautiful and seeing it from our docked ship was incredible.
View this from Intercontinental hotel. Spectacular but best viewed from the interconinental hotel , have a cocktail at 8pm and watch the light show

Fantastic. The skyline of Hong Kong, seen from Tsim Sha Tsui on Kowloon Peninsula, with all the old ferries is a must see when you are in Hong Kong, possibly at night when all the buildings are lit. Never fails to amaze me.
Amazing view! Not to be missed.... The line for the Peak Tram was quite long but it was worth the wait. A trip to Hong Kong will not be complete without seeing the majestic view from the top.

From anywhere you look during any time of the day you still can't get sick of it.. From Wan Chai Pier to IFC and from TST Pier to to Intercontinental Hotel are probably the best place to check out the skyline.
Taking photos of the Skyline or have some beers from 7s and relaxing is also a good way to enjoy the night.

Best Skyline Around. Take a walk along the Harbor area and enjoy the breathtaking views of Victoria Harbor. The light show in the evening is especially cool and best of all it costs nothing but your time.
A lot happening in this area and if nothing else you can do as much people watching as you like.

Memorable experience of HK. If it's your first visit to Hong Kong, then this is a must as it's what all the travel photos of HK is about. An impressive skyline, busy trade activity, impressive museum etc. We watched ships and cruise liners go past and took the ferry home. Great experience.

A truly compact, skyscraper filled city!. It's truly amazing how so many people can live in such a relatively small area. By day, you are impressed by the sheer sea of humanity that lives and works in this vibrant city. By night, your attention is drawn to the amazing modern architecture in the form of giant edifices that dominate the cityscape, complete with their own light show.

The skyline that was. What a shame! The Hong among skyline WAS beautiful at one time. That was before the hoards of traffic created a thick smog covering Hong Kong island. From our large picture window in our lovely room at the Peninsula Hotel, we had a perfect view of the harbor and Hong Kong Island. But that view was shrouded in smog and fog day and night. At night, at least, there were twinkling lights in a multitude of colors on the high rise buildings on the Hong Kong side. The change in Hong Kong is amazing. More and more high rise buildings are built daily. Gone is the city's charm of yesteryear. It has been replaced by horrendous traffic jams, terrible air quality and obstructive views.
Mesmerizing. The view coupled with the sea breeze is designed to keep all traveller glued to the promenade. Every corner is worth a Facebook posting.

Recommended by day and night. Recommended daily walk or breakfast with a view.
Do not forget the show at night 20:00 exactly!
The buildings look like a perfect painting
Must Do. Iconic Skyline - go to the Peak for best viewing. Don't queue for a tram -(1 hour). Take a taxi or bus!

So fabulous. HongKong is simply magnificent. It is hard to believe that so many people live in such a small space. The tall buildings seem to have been there forever, they blend in with the mountains and the bay. At night they light up and glitter like stars. When you yourself become part of the sklyline way up on the mountain, looking down on the skyscrapers, you realize how fabulous man ingenuity is. Everyone must see HongKong! And I'm looking forward to my next visit.
Best city skyline in the world.. This city has the most impressive skyline. Check out the light show from Kowloon side every evening.

Wow. Unfortunately we couldn't see Hong Kong from the skyline as it was misty that night, but the whole experience and traveling over there with the ferry was out of this world. Hong Kong's hi rise buildings decorate the sky with beautiful lights and colors at night! Something to be seen!
nice!. very nice sky line. nice for photos and just relaxing. nice to go there when there are less people to really enjoy the view
Encredible. Beautiful during the night. Can be hard to see during the day with the smog. A good way to pin point where you are in this large city.

HK Skyline. If you are lucky enough to be see this on a clear day, or night, you probably will agree that it is pretty damn stunning. Take the ferry across the harbour for a closer view; ferry piers are from Wanchai and Central on HK Island, and TST in Kowloon. The trip Central-TST/TST-Central is only 7 minutes.. Don't know the TST/Wanchai crossing - maybe 15 minutes... Cheap as chips, anyone can afford it. I used my Octopus Card so don't recall the cost.... 20 pence or something ridiculous like that. Bargain!Otherwise, stroll along the TST promenade, from TST East up to Ocean Terminal. The better view is from Kowloon looking across to HK Island. But if you've got the time, do both.And don't forget your camera :)

Busy and Interesting when not foggy. Loved the light show at 8pm each night.Could watch the harbour and skyline from my hotel and from the ferry for long periods without getting bored.But the view was often obscured by the fog/mist which persisted the whole week we stayed there.Some interesting sights - and loved the Lego models of the various landmarks at Toys R Us in Harbour City shopping centre near Star Ferry terminal (basement level).

Blade runner. If you don't like high-rise architecture you'll hate Hong Kong. It's a bit like visiting London and never leaving Canary Wharf. Hong Kong lacks anything in the way of grand historic landmark buildings. But, if you're a neophyte with a Le Corbusier fetish, you'll love it. By day it's a mixture of sterile glass and chrome offices and shabby high rise tenements, often shrouded in the thick grey haze of pollution drifting over from mainland China. But, it really comes alive at night when the lights come on. Then it transforms from a caterpillar to a shimmering butterfly. If you can find a suitably elevated viewpoint (try the 28th floor roof terrace bar at the Park Lane Hotel on Gloucester Road) you'll get a spectacular view of the illuminated buildings including the Bank of China tower, and the Kowloon waterfront reflected in the waters of the harbour. If you're lucky you'll see one the many cruise ships float by, lit up like a Christmas tree. It put me in mind of Ridley Scott's Blade Runner. If you walk the streets at night you can often hear public service announcements in Cantonese, and I'm sure they were advertising opportunities in the off world colonies. We even saw a drone one evening flying above the crowds. Unique. You'll either love it or hate it.

Hong Kong Skyline. Highly recommend viewing the Symphony of Lights Show at 8pm from the Avenue of Stars at Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon. For a quieter experience with less crowds also try viewing from Central.

Best Night City Skyline In The World. Amazing evening view from Kowloon side looking toward HK Island . Great views from avenue of stars or from intercontinental hotel lobby lounge or Spoon restaurant .

See it to believe it.. Hong Kong skyline comes in number 1, don't waste time searching up for it, seeing pictures and feeling it for yourself is different, I personally think that the most beautiful thing cannot be captured by a camera, and has to be seen with your very own eyes. You can either take the peak tram up to the peak to see the skyine from above which is spectacular, or take the famous star ferry over to tsim sha tsui, and walk along the promenade.

Unique experience. You should visit the Tsim sha tsui promenade around 6pm. Have a look at the avenue of stars and other landmarks and then settle down for the 8pm symphony of light show. Its unique and unlike anything I've seen before (and I say this after visiting the NY, London, Tokyo skylines). Its a 20 min show and if we were on time we would have watched it from the boats. Something I plan to do the next time I am there :)

Take a walk.....one of the Wonders of the World.. One evening take the PeakTram to the top, get a taxi to the top of Magazine Gap Rd and walk the winding road into Central District. Fantastic views over the towering buildings and across the harbour. Walk takes about half an hour.

Amazing views day and night. The views of the many skyscrapers with rolling green hills and the harbour was quite breathtaking both during the day and especially at night when all the buildings were lit up.

The best. Definitely one of the most dense, exciting, and attracting part of the city. If you visit HK without getting a great view of the skyline (either from Kowloon side or Central) you haven't really visited HK at all.

Beautiful. One of the most beautiful views in the world. Ships come and go. Smoggy most of the time, but just gorgeous. Well worth traveling to. The laser show on the high rises at night is not to be missed. Very cool. Symphony of lights. Do the cruise if you can for the symphony of lights as the promenade gets very crowded. Get there very early. Its 8pm every night.
Wow - those views are amazing. The views you get from the amazing tower are incredible - its a bit of a funny place to get to but definitely worth the effort
most amazing view from tst side. Great views especially from the harbour facing rooms at intercontinental, or from the Duk Ling boat in the harbour

Light show was alright - nothing spectacular. Light show was good, we got a good spot. Pays to wait 20minutes after the show to leave, as there are heaps of people around, its dark and not well organised.

Engineering Marvel. Having last visited Hong Kong 15 years ago, I was amazed at how much the city had grown (skyward)! The Skyline and cityscape are marvels of engineering, and is best viewed from the Kowloon side looking across the busy harbour, although I would recommend steering away from the crowds during the Symphony of Lights show. I had the opportunity to view from day and evening, with both times of the day offering a different experience.
Fantastic.. Got to be one of the best in the world, I never got tired of looking at it, especially at night time when it's all lit up.

the sky line from TST end is fantastic. walk the avenue of Stars and take in the fantastic skyline in the night. Its a wonderful place. There is a nice coffee bar and if you are there at 8pm you get to see the laser show on the high rise buildings accross
Great lightshow 8pm every night. Find a good vantage point and enjoy the laser show, it's great. Very different Kowloon side to HK side, too.

The best skyline view.. You should be on the Kowloon island to get the best view of the HK skyline. Choose a spot like the Avenue of Stars, Tsim Tsa Tsui or buy an upper deck ticket on the Star Ferry. Both day and night views are magnificent. Try the light and sound show at 8PM. Another good place to view the Victoria harbour is from The Peak. There are telescopes to get a closer view.

The 'New York' of Asia - especially at night. The HK skyline is always an impressive sight - even after several years living in the city. The most preferred spot is across the harbor, on the viewing platform close to the Avenue of the stars, just outside the 'Harbour City' shopping mall. From the HK side (Victoria Harbour) easy to reach by ferry (going to Tsim Sha Tsui). It's often a crowded place, especially when the 'Symphony of Lights' is shown (daily at 20:00). The show is spectacular, but the view around sunset, when the lights mix-in with the red sky, are even more breathtaking. The bar of the Felix Restaurant (in the Peninsula Hotel) is also often cited as an excellent viewing point. Unfortunately the bar is very small and often the shades are down so that you just get a limited view of the skyline (the famous view of the Felix bathroom is more interesting, but a real replacement).The very best view is from the 'Wooloomooloo' rooftop bar (in the 'Hennessey' building, 256 Hennessy Rd, Wanchai. Yes, it's the 'wrong' side, but the skyscrapers are almost in arms reach. It's almost 360 degree view, less crowded and you can enjoy a drink without getting ripped-off. If this makes you hungry, go downstairs to the Wooloomooloo restaurant for an outstanding steak or western/fusion dinner. You will not regret any dollar spent there! Note: the bar occasionally has private functions, calling in advance is recommendable.

Must see. Its the most beautiful sky line in the world and not only from the piek mountain you have an amazing view, als from Kowloon side its even nicer; go in one of the hotels like Peninsula hotel and see the skyline of Hong Kong as well. It stands the competition with NY.

Combine it With the Laser Show. Get the best views of the Hong Kong Skyline from Kowloon after dark.At about 7:45 and 9:00 p.m. every night there's a laser light show. Together with some of the Hong Kong Island's tallest skyscrapers lit up in gorgeous light displays, it's like being in a kid's fairy tale.We've traveled to more than 20 countries, and Hong Kong has the best nighttime skyline I've ever seen.
Don't miss. Just if in town watch the towers light show ,if posable find a restauarnt with a view sit back and enjoy and wonder "who left the lights on in there office block

Beautiful scene. Go around 5-6pm, you can see the skyline before & after sunset. It is beautiful. You'll be able to enjoy symphony of lights at 8-8:15pm, with narration in cantonese (except Mon, Wed & Fri in English). Worth visiting.

Spectacular Picture Perfect Hong Kong Skyline. Hong Kong Skyline ranked as the no. 1 Skyline in the world in CNN's 2010 publication containing the names of top 20 Skylines worldwide. It fully justifies it's top rating with spectacular views offered from either side of the Victoria harbour. The tall skyscraper buildings, mostly in Hong Kong island are best viewed from The Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade of Kowloon. The daily night 8 pm light & sound laser show in which the light falls on the skyscraper buildings located on the Hong Kong island, draws huge crowd of tourists. The best views from Hong Kong side are from Victoria Peak, IFC Mall & China Bank building. However, foggy weather sometimes play spoil sport for the panoramic views of the skyline.

Lovely at night. Lighting makes everything magical, the HK skyline is really wonderful to look at, at night, however, in the morning, and because of pollution, you'll be really luck to have a clear day and take an unpolluted picture in the morning.

Bored with show!!!!. I have been to Hk many times and love it to bits but for some reason the Festival of Lights is now boring, years ago the show was amazing and synced with the music incredibly but now the show last 15 minutes and for the first 13 it's boring and not really in sync with the odd building flashing, the last two minutes is when it livens up like it used to years ago, disappointed.....

Impresssive View. Strolling the promenade along the river on the Kowloon side, you have a great view of Hong Kong and its many skyscrapers. The river and harbor are busy -- always boats going by, an ever-changing picture. Tip: The night time laser show, featuring lasers beamed from a number of the skyscrapers is really no big deal. Not that many lasers, not much variation in what they do. If you've ever been to a concert with some laser lights, you've already seen better. If it's matter of choosing between the light show and something else, choose the something else,

LOVE IT!. What a great way to spend an evening, cruising beautiful Victoria Harbour...what an amazing skyline! After the cruise, on to delicious dinner at the famous Jumbo Restaurant. We loved this experience!

One of the world's greatest cityscape. The density of material and human energy in this city can make New York seem laid back, but one sight worth the entire trip to the far side of the world is the view of Hong Kong from the Kowloon side of the harbor. In addition to extraordinary modern urban architecture, almost every high rise presents a dazzling, computer driven light show at night. So far as I know, there is nothing else like it on Earth.
Amazing. The skyline at night is amazing, there was so much to see and take in, such an incredible city. This was a highlight of our trip.
