Not my thing really. I suppose that if you are into big city/bright lights/night life, then looking at this skyline would be great. And of course assuming that the weather plays it's part!But I was not overly impressed with the ostentatious show of excess. I prefered the mountains at night in the north eg on the Sai Kung peninsula.
The light show at 8pm so well worth it.. We booked the restaurant aqua and had an amazing view. You can also get a great view at night from the public star ferry
A fascinating trip. The skyline looked amazing at night, so much of interest to see everywhere. So much crammed in, interesting to see the high rise apartments.

Hong Kong Surprise!. Even after three decades, I will never get used or bored on the Hong Kong Skyline. Constantly changing and bringing new attractions either in height of skyscrapers, architecture or light display the Skyline will always be a Main Attraction.But what is most fascinating - this Skyline is never far away from the Nature. Hong Kong is surrounded by sea and small hills allowing a wonderful display between City and Country side. 43 % of the Land area is reserved as COUNTRY PARK and Hong Kong has well over 1000 km of well maintained hiking trails.Go and enjoy the excitement of Hong Kong's Skyline, Nature, Eating and Shopping.

Hong Kong's trademark. For me, this is like must visit place when we travel to Hong Kong. The lights that are made from the building was very beautiful. No need to spend long time here, unless you will hop on the boat or having dinner in the expensive restaurant. :D
Simply amazing!!!. Absolutely amazing!! Must see while visiting Hong Kong!! Just make sure It is not foggy (otherwise you won't see much but... It is still worth it:-)
Breathtakingly surreal. its like being in a movie I cant believe they do this every single night its amazing I loved it so romantic aswell

If you haven't seen this, you haven't been to Hong Kong. I admit this is touristy, but as a native Hong Konger, this is my personal top 3 recommendation if you are coming to visit Hong Kong and tight on time. When I am in Tsim Sha Tsui I would especially take the star ferry at night to appreciate this view.This is admittedly the best night view I have seen, compared to Hakodate (函館), New York, Chicago, Shanghai, Singapore, Paris...reason being for its large cluster, colourful neon lights and variety of skyscrapers - all with a hefty price to HK's environment - something I always bear in mind and leaving me food for thought about HK's future and town planning in current social environment..Don't miss the 8pm fireworks too. Best place to view would be in Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront, either Ave of the Stars or the small pier on the left of Harbour City's main entrance where restaurants were lined up. Alternatively a good place for a private, reasonable dinner setting (~HK$250 px) would be on One Peking Road, in the Japanese restaurant 火間土 where there are private tatami rooms and good food. View is superb and better than the over-priced restaurants in Harbour City. But be sure to book in advance.Happy to recommend more places if you are tight on time or have too much time in Hong Kong.
A night view second to none. I have no hesitation to recommend this fantastic view,especially at night, from the Peak Tower or whereabouts.Have a nice time
Stunning display. At night from TST. Well worth a look as it highlights the scope of the buildings as well as the harbour.
One of a kind. Definitely a top destination during your stay in HK and please don't forget to take the star ferry across the Victoria Harbour.

Take a stroll under the stars. Take a stroll along the promenade in Tsim Sha Tsui in the evening and see the spectacular lights under the stars. Go there at 8pm to enjoy the light show and you will not regret it.
The City Of Light. one of the best in the world, if not... HK has a double skyline and nightly light show ... the water and mountains the city is all on the edge... 24hour power
Worlds best skyline at night. Hong Kong skyline is a spectacular view at night. Go there at a little bit before 8pm every night to catch the Symphony of Lights lightshow.

Beautiful sky line from the top of the building. Thel Hong kong skyline is a beautiful specatcal from the pier. The building are all well lit and the skyline is reflected in the water. The Hong Kong light show however, is totally disappointing. However the surronding areas with the Pensula hotel is great.
Nice but smoggy. The skyline is pretty, if you can see it through the dirty smog. Maybe we were unlucky, but the city didn't impress us at all. Pure for business. Shopping can be fun.
Hong Kong skyline. This was beautiful, I have always loved the New York skyline but felt this was even better. The light show was good too.
The place was amazing. The place was so amazing and splendid when the night comes. Spent here for an hour and it was an unforgettable experience.

Absolutely beautiful. If you've never seen the night show, you must do it when in Hong Kong, at least once. It is simply amazing, and the way they are all lit up, it is just beautiful!So many light and so many tall highrises make this truly a one of a kind experience. Whenever we visit Hong Kong, we must see this show at least once. It is amazing watching it from Tsim Tsa Tsui.This is definitely a recommended experience for anyone visiting Hong Kong!

Nice place to be @. Interesting and always packed with people.... Provides a fantastic view of Hong Kong at night and there are also street performances that helps to heighten the atmosphere. Recommend spot for night @ Hong Kong.

Hong Kong By Night -. Brilliant as always. Harbour can be a mish mash during the day but once the lights come on it is wonderful. First time visitors should try the Star Ferry about 8pm as there is also a light show.
Nice view. It is one of the best in the world, with the surrounding mountains and Victoria Harbour complementing the skyscrapers. I will come back here soon !

Even with fog, gorgeous!. My husband and went to the back of the Hong Kong Cultural Center (Kowloon side) at around 6pm because we thought the Symphony of Lights was at 7pm. Well, it was at 8pm, so we stayed here for more than 2 hours in the cold with occasional rain and fog. It didn't matter, though, because we still had a great time watching the lights of Hong Kong Island. This is a nice place to just hang out and experience the energy of Hong Kong. A nice place to relax and just "be".
Worth seeing, particularly at night.. One of the best city skylines I've seen and we've been to a few major cities in the world (New York, Rome, Paris)
See it day or night. At night the buildings in HK island are lighted and at 8pm daily there is a light show best viewed from Kowloon, across the bay.
Fantastic Skyline. The view was just intruding , it was simply relaxing and admiring the beautiful city from far, very nice plans to hang out and many foods stops are available around

Snap Happy!!. Its amazing, get the camera ready and get snapping, too many good pics from here!! Also the local coffee shops are just Devine and they really do know how to make a fabulous cake there!!

Lovely at night. This was a magnificent skyline but definitely better at night, the weather wasn't brilliant on my 1st night I went to see it but I made the effort to go back and the reflection of the lights in the harbour was lovely!

Fabulous Skyline . Enjoy it from the ferry at 8PM every night.. Ocean Park is Brilliant. Disney HK is also great. Double Decker Trams and buses are good fun to ride on. Stanley Bay is a very nice place to hang around in the afternoon and have a drink . Night markets are a HIT with the street sea food .
Skyline. The most amazing skyline in the world. Worth a look during day time as well as night time from the Kowloon side. You can get great views from the Avenue of the Stars area.

Amazing views. I loved Hong Kong's urban landscape combined with natural landscape of mountains and the sea. I think HK has most beautiful city-scape in the World. I also loved the changes of views depending on weather conditions and the time of the day.

Very pretty at night. The hong kong skyline is very pretty at night, lit up in neon and flashing up and down the bay.Try to catch the lightshow, it's one of those quintessential hong kong experiences. Tip: skip the pricey dinner tours, and just go up and down the harbor with star ferries, for a cheaper and altogether nicer experience.
Great moment. Enjoy our time to see the skyline of city, spark lights and the draught from ocean. The atmosphere was so great and more romantic when dark comes.

such a great Skyline. By day or night the Hong Kong skyline is fantastic but if you catch the 8pm light show from the Kowloon side the skyline is magical. There are plenty of places to get some great photo's but remember to look behind you as well because there are also some great light effects on the kowloon skyscrapers as well.

Love it!. I have been to some cities with some great skylines (New York, Singapore, Tokyo) but this has got to be my favourite. Be sure to catch the evening light show and try to cross the harbour on the Star Ferry at least a couple of times and see the skyline from different angles.

Gorgeous sight. In all of our travels, I do have to say this has been one of our favorite sky lines at night. It's lit up in so many colors and is dazzling. We went back and forth on the Star Ferry many times while there since we stayed on Hong Kong but you will see the beauty of the skyline by going across to Kowloon and looking back.

Enjoy reading a book and live music sitting at the quiet corner. Such an advantage for a Kowloon resident like me to enjoy this vibrant skyline glistening with gems of lights from the majestic skyscrapers. It's not merely a place to visit but its magnetic atmosphere of magic somehow generates inspiration and energy for me to absorb. Once in a while I find myself a quiet corner, bring a book there to read, or my laptop when writing blogs. Occasionally there are enthusiastic young artists producing great music, singing songs of English, Mandarin or Cantonese. Addicted to the skyline that has been rated as the best in the world by CNN, and artists that outperform a lot of musicians who I need to pay for the concerts. What more I can ask for?

Great, free and relaxing. I loved walking along the avenue of stars and looking at the skyline during dusk. I recommend this you all. Watch the industrial and passenger boats go by. Having hung round MK for a fair chunk, didn't realise there was SO much on HK Island.
Definitely a MUST. There really is nothing quite like it. Other cities have great skylines of course, but Hong Kong from the Kowloon side is really something special.

Spectacular. Up there with New York as one of the world's most stunning skylines. A trip on the star ferry at dusk is highly recommended or you can just enjoy the view from the Kowloon-side waterfront.

never disappoints. We never tire of this and it is both spectacular AND free. Even the local photographers are not unreasonable and the end product is a relatively cheap and enduring souvenir. The light show starts at 7:45 and repeats at 9:00 - very pretty.

Amazing views of the city. Has a NYC vibe when looking from the kowloon side (TST) Skyscrapers are bigger than ones found in Manhattan, spectacular views with the lights in the evening. Has a good vibe and lots of restraints/shops nearby.
The best in the world. Love the ambience and especially the laser show each evening at 8 p.m. Probably the best if not one of the best sights in the morning or late evening in the world!

What a view!. We stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel, right on the harbor with a beautiful view. The lights were awesome, right from our room. You could see from the Avenue of the Stars, just below us, as well.

If you liked New York you will love this!. Amazing, the view from the ocean when you see the city skyline is outstanding. Bucketlist must! Friendly people. Amazing to see what we have been seeing only in movie theatres all these years!
Pretty View at Night. The city of Hong Kong has a metropolis vibe and at night the lights and buildings are a stunning sight. It's a beautiful city.

Stunning. As many have reviewed here. The HK skyline is stunning.
We have been here many times and this cities waterfront is simply amazing.
Take the Star Ferry from or to Tsim Sa Sui. You won't be disappointed.

it is a must. Hong Kong Skyline is one of the best of all the town i know. Best point to look is from Kowloon Star Ferry Harbor area (also near Nathan Road Shopping area). And a must a trip to Island with the old Star Ferry, a perfect view to the skyline is almost guaranteed, if weather is clear.
stunning. The night view from Kowloon looking back to HK is stunning. We took it in from Aqualuna bar. And the laser show while short is pretty neat.

Unrivaled. The twin skylines of Kowloon and Central Hong Kong facing each other across the harbor are stunning. Take the Star Ferry across the harbor at night to catch the spectacular light shows projected on some of the skyscrapers.

Even more amazing than you expected. In the daytime it is spectacular, by night it is incredible. Hong Kong is incredibly densely populated - where you can build you have to build up - but the new Skyscrapers and interesting in the main and enhanced by the harbour area. A view from the Peak is especially thrilling.
Great moment. This was a great place when the dark comes. The lights were splendid and the wind from ocean made us felt very relaxing.
Best in the world. Who reviews a skyline? Go to the Star Ferry terminal, watch the light show from the walkway around the edge of Kowloon. Best skyline view in the world.

Bus 15 to Peak then walk for free!. Avoid all the tourist trap expense and queues. Get #15 bus from Central terminal. Then just use your own legs take a wonderful 2,800 meter walk all around the Peak.free.amazing.5*.
Lights. Rooftop bars that were in the middle of all the lights on a beautiful evening was a great memory. Try a rooftop restaurant or bar during the symphony of lights .

Eh.... I was expecting alot more given the reviews. Very underwhelming. There was about 4 buildings with a green beam which was triggered by the beat in music. Another 3 buildings light up whenever they feel like it. All in all the view is nice but the lazer light show is a bore - hard to tell if itd even started or not initially. Better off going after its finiahed to avoid the crowds.
bright lights big city. The skyline from Kowloon is not to be missed. Very nice. A bit on the hazy side so photos were not crisp. Perhaps it was the time of year.

Stunning. The best free light show in the world. The view from the Star Ferry after darkness falls is superb. By day, Hong Kong and Kowloon are botjh rather drab, especially in Early march with almost constant drizzle, but after dark, it's everything you expect it to be.

Relaxing and nice view. Pride of HK. We've been at the Avenue of the stars during noontime and we can see the skyline from TST accross the Central, but it is a little bit foggy thrn but still the view is nice. We took the ferry to cross to central so we can view TST are. Equally nice view.we'd just hope we had a chance to see the skyline at night which I know is better.

:) Light show. One time see its okay, but really thats its nothing... Few lasers and lights in buildings, and music ofcourse... Thousands of peoples looking this same place,,, Starting at 8.00 PM every day...
Ah...what is there to say. I took the ferry to Kowloon and enjoyed the sunset at the Sheraton Lounge and the lights were magical.
beautiful skyline. beautiful both at day or night.. there is some show at night, you can see the skyline with colourful light and a music... you can see a trademark hongkong ship too...

Fantastic to have seen it for real. Always loved the Hong Kong skyline and it is particularly good from the Star Ferry piers at night on the Kowloon side. Get there before 11pm when the lights go out however. We had a drink in the ground floor bar of the Intercontinental though there's a minimum spend of 116 HK$ - though that's not hard to exceed.
Impressive. Especially during the night, the view is spectacular. There is a "lights show" every day at 8PM and it is good...but not that impressive as the first sight of the skyline.

A picture of this skyline is my cover photo on Facebook !. This is a gorgeous, modern Asian skyline. The laser shows in the evening are an added bonus. The views from the towering Ritz Carlton are particularly entrancing.
Stunning skyline. How can you resist the bright lights of one of the world's great cities? Didn't disappoint by day or night.

An amazing skyline that just gets better each time I visit. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful, each time I see it I am impressed by its spectacle and magnificants. Even though it doesn't have the worlds tallest building, it is home to the highest number of skyscrapers in the world being number at over 8000 and growing. I have hundreds of photos of the skyline taken from both the Hong Kong Island side and the Kowloon side and each tie I return to Hong Kong I take more. I have seen the skyline bathed in sun light and encased in both fog and haze, I find the beauty of the magnificent buildings to be unmatched by any other city I have visited or seen.

new york eat your heart out. After many attempts and 3 klms walking we came to the famous hongkong skyline which to me surpasses that of new york.Although it was a misty day we stood on the waters edge and gazed across the river spotted with the occassional chinese junk adding a touch of legends to the modern scene.We took our time and walked along the avenue of stars chinas version of broadways handprinted boardwalk with bruce lee plam prints with his statue leaping as if to fend you off from his beloved homeland.If in hong kong just get a taxi down and admire this view both by day and by night when lights festoon the sky in beams radiating in and around the buildings like the pulse of the vibrant city.

Very impressive. I suggest to try and see the light show between 8/8:30 which happens I believe every night. The buildings light up and their are green lasers shooting across the harbor. I don't know where else their is something comparable.
Possibly the Most Beautiful Skyline in the World. I love Hong Kong so the skyline really works for me. Other people may prefer New York but for Asia - Hong Kong has the best skyline!

One of the best and most exciting skylines in the world. I love Hong Kong! The skyline is totally exhilarating. It looks amazing by day and night. It looks great from the water, from the peak, from the harbour, from anywhere! You can see the crazy dancing evening light show from all over the city (although you can only here the music from that spot Kowloon.
Fantastic skyline. A view you will never forget... Worth seeing at both day and night to see the different effects. The light show was not worth it though fir such a short thing.

The BEST. The Hong Kong skyline is not one of the best skyline of the world, it is THE BEST. It has the most number of skyscrapers. And every evening there is Symphony of Lights - a pyrotechnics and light show which last around 8 minutes i think, with a commentary of the famous landmarks in the skyline highlighting them with the laser lights. And the best part is its free. The best vantage point is of course Avenue of Stars and the Clock Tower in Tsim Tsha Tsui but its always crowded. For a more serene experience hop down to the top of one of the piers in front of the IFC in Central. All the tourists flock to TST or the Convention Centre in Wanchai to view the laser show and the locals…well for them its part of their daily lives, so they don't pay much attention. Its a proud recipient of Guiness record as its a longest running laser show on the planet.

Spellbinding.... Hong Kong skyline is easily one amongst the top five in the world… The skyline particularly on the south side of the Victoria Harbour transforms in to a mesmerising canvas of lights and colours as the sun sets. The best way to witness it is from the opposite side of the harbour from the Avenue of Stars in Tsim Sha Tsui. The icing on the cake is the 15 min light and sound show named “Symphony of Lights” which takes place every evening at 8:00PM. This is a show of dancing LED and lasers lights from over 45 buildings across both side of the harbour reacting rhythmically to a soothing music. The best way to capture the skyline in your camera is from the promenade from Tsim Sha Tsui side of the harbour. You will need a camera with shutter speed control and a tripod in order to capture the colourful lights in their full glory. “The Peak” located on the north side of the harbour also offers a bird’s eye view of the skyline. Another way to enjoy the skyline is to take ferry ride across the harbour…

Victoria Harbour at night is still the best!. Get down there for the laser and symphony show, we did and had a great time.Make sure you get there in time to snag one of the places on the Kowloon seawall, the view is astounding.Also make sure your camera can operate in low light and use a monopod if you have one as there is no room amongst all the legs for a tripod.Look in your guide to work out which langauge is on the speakers but you can tune into a local FM station for the language commentary you need.Definitely worth it.
Great View. Defintely worth a walk by the habour in Kowloon at night and the view of Hong Kong island. The view im sure improves when the weather improves.
Great nighttime view. Be sure to watch the harbor for the nightly 8PM laster show. Also take a Star Ferry for a close up look.
Spectacular. There is nowhere else in the world that you can see such spectacular lighting of the buildings at night.

Nice but crowded. You dont have to use the terrace - it takes ages to get up there and its always crowded. Besides You have to pass million overpriced shops to get there. Get outside of the train and follow the road to have the same view without millions of people. The tram tends to be overcrowded, and after 19 You have to wait around 1h to get back down. Get a jacket as it gets pretty windy up there!

best at night. been to hk before. it was my forst time to see and stroll at night. totally diff. ypu can see the lights of the building on hl side. stunning view. and the light show is musically scored.was with my kids and they enjoyed the stroll even with the cold wind gushing.

Very misty. We got the ferry over to Hong Kong island then a bus just outside the jetty which takes you straight to Victoria peak tram station the tram takes you straight up when you get to the top you go into a very modern mull with loads of shops and eating places. There are loads of escalators that take you to the highest point you then have to pay $4 to go outside but we didn't do this as it was very foggy and you just couldn't see anything which they did warn us but it was an experience just to go up on the tram
Awesome. This view was awesome. Even on a cloudy day it makes you feel special. I enjoyed watching the lights during dinner at one of the high rises on the Kowloon side.

A very attractive addition to a nice stroll on the waterfront.. While in Hong Kong, I was able to spend the evenings exploring. Hong Kong is very walkable and it was a nice relaxing evening walking around and viewing the sights.
Beautiful colorful skyline. If you can, get a hotel which overlooks the water and enjoy the lights of the buildings which make up the skyline of this very large city.

A Symphony of Lights. The music and narration of the Show is broadcast every night along the Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront between the Avenue of Stars and the Hong Kong Cultural Centre, and the promenade at Golden Bauhinia Square in Wan Chai. Broadcast of the soundtrack is in different languages: English on Monday, Wednesday and Friday; Putonghua on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday; and Cantonese on Sunday.
A skyline that you will not forget!. Come at dusk to enjoy both the sunset and night view.The promenade behind HK Art Museum is an excellent location.

Great Light Show. For any of those who want to watch the Victoria Harbour light show - I went not that long ago and it is genuinely amazing. Its a free show, so bring your camera, walk up/down and pick your spot to capture the light show!
Cannot Miss. Watching this awesome skyline at night is the best !Seeing the view from both sides of the harbour is very worthy as well.

Rise high, high-rise. As a New Yorker, I'm quite used to the skyline of Manhattan. In spite of my seeing it almost every day, I never tire of it. There's something about the various heights of the building, giving an almost crooked teeth look. One can't help but to stare at those magnificent buildings. The Hong Kong skyline is also one of those places that one can't help but stare at. For the best views, take the Star Ferry over to Kowloon, then walk over to the Avenue of the Stars to really take in the colossal view of the HK skyline. Words can't do justice on how spectacular the skyline really is. Alternatively, ride the Jetfoil over to Macau for additional views of the skyline. If you're on the HK side, there is a path that runs along the edge of the water affording views of Kowloon's skyline. Particular buildings of interest are: ICC (Kowloon), 2IFC (HK), Central Plaza (HK), BOC (HK) and HSBC (HK). Hong Kong is a truly great city and proof is in the pudding.

3 mobile sales incentive tour. Really loved this trip, although it was raining a bit the sites you get to see are amazing! Value for money was excellent and the boat itself was great. Staff were extremely attentive and looked after you all the way round this is a must see.

Unforgettable. From the HSBC building to the I.M. Pei designed Bank of China to the new IFC in Central, then cross the harbor in the Star Ferry to the Clock Tower, to the majestic Peninsula Hotel, to the Hong Kong Cultural Center, these are just some of the unforgettable skyline and architecture.
Spectacular if Not Overcast. Light Show is at 8pm and there are many who go to watch. Pick any place on Kowloon side to see the light show and take your pictures.
Scintillating view. The sky line is simply awesome and breath taking.I loved it.....every thing here in H K is on grand scale...as I said simply awesome...
A great skyline. Take the Star Ferry at the princely cost of HK$5 (40p) for a round trip to see the Hong Kong skyline after dark. Its well worth an encore.

Amazing views. The queues do get long but we did our tour with the big red bus company so managed to avoid them. It was cloudy when we were there so although the views were amazing it would have been better on a clear day.

Almost beyond words so great..... It might sound cheesy but somehow the sight of Hong kong's skyline always gives me a thrill - it is so clustered and a mix of old and modern. Day or night there is always something to look at and from one of the harbour ferries at night it is magical.

ICONIC. Be there for the 10 minute daily light and laser show at 8.00pm, best viewed from the Kowloon side – or from a boat. Buildings continue to have their own displays after that and help make it one of the great and iconic skylines of the world.

Only in Hong Kong. What a beautiful view you can see from this bay!
I have never experienced such a beautiful "urban view" with such buildings! In fact, before going there I was thinking "Gosh I am going to see buildings... It's only buildings, so it can't be that awesonme". But actually it was awesome, with the buildings illuminations especially. I definitely recommend it.

MOST ATTRACTIVE VIEW. My first visit was in 1980 and a lot has transformed the Hong Kong Skyline throughout the years. I witnessed the transformation of the 80's, 90's and 2000's as the most magnificent construction projects of South China. One of the fabulous sights used to be the junks that were later banned from filling in the harbor but my favorite remains the HK Convention Center, like a Space Ship rising out of the sea.

Simply fantastic. I've came across a lot of stunning skylines till today, but no matter how many times I reconsider the ranking, the skyline in HK is always the best. Wether you are viewing it from victoria harbour or Central, the peak or stars of avenue, it is just way too beautiful to be true. A 120% must visit if you're in HK

Comfortable and safety. I like round trip around most Hong Kong area, such as Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and New Territories. It is air conditioned in bus compartment, it can be said cleanness and tiddly.I do not like that the bus service interval not high and the last bus is closed early.
Something else. Loved the view and atmosphere, although the light show was a dissapointment as was the peak due to fog.
magic. Ive always loved the skyline of Hong Kong and it just keeps getting better and better. On a clear night its magical with all the lights lit up like stars x

Hong Kong skyline. Hong Kong skyline is one to see, yes most big city's have one but no one does it like Hong Kong, laser light show in the evenings that light up the city, I would recommend to jump onto Star Ferry and just cross over to Kowloon and admire the skyline, and as the ferry is so cheap I would say do it a few times and see it from both ends.

Am I missing something?. I thought at first that my rating was a little harsh, maybe a "good" at best, but then the skyline is that of most modern cities, except some are lit up.We were going to take a boat trip around the harbour during the 8pm light/laser show for the best position, but it started raing slighly and the wind was getting up, the water started getting choppy. So plan B was implemented to view from the Avenue of Stars, Kowloon side. Plenty of people had the same idea, but we managed to get a good view of all the area. The lights and laser show, very disappointing and not really worth the effort to put it on. I know I was not expecting some sort of Disney's Epcot type show, but this was quite underwelming to say the least. You may aswell just look at the skyline when it is lit normally, take some photos and leave before all the crowds for the 8pm show.
One of the World's Great Skylines. Take the Star Ferry to get the best view of the Hong Kong Skyline and enjoy the views in both directions..

I enjoyed the Laser Show. HK Skyline is great place to have your self captured. Skyline looks strong & majestic during sunlights and is elegant and romantic after dusk. The laser show is the highlight and is a must watch. Make yourself atleast 15 to 30 minutes before the show starts to get a nice seat.Its a great piece of coordination in LIGHTS...
Stunning!. The Hong Kong skyline is the most amazing I have ever seen. Especially at night. You won't be able to believe your eyes. Great for anyone interested in photography.

Longest Skyline. Although when I visited HK, most of the days were foggy, the skyline still amazed me.From both the islands.. Kowloon & HK Island, the tall building look awesome. Worth walking down the promenade.. taking photos or rather Panaromic photos - cos the skyline is too long to fit in a frame :)

Amazing Skyline. Great to see the island skyline anytime of the day, but magical at dusk and at night. Nice light show at 8:00pm, best viewed from the mainland side, as most of the impressive buildings are on the island. It's lovely to take the Star Ferry across the harbour at night. If you want a good view of the ICC then go on the roof (parking lot) of Harbour City.
Wow. The only problem with the skyline is you cannot fit it all in one picture. You have to go across to Kowloon to get the best view.

Great views either way. The skyline is worth looking at from either side of the harbour.Lots of buildings lite up at night and everything you would expect from a modern city on a bay.Do not make a special trip to see the night light show - was disappointing. The general lights on all the time was sufficient.

Excellent is the word. The Hong Kong Skyline is amazing and definitely lives up to its expectations. It's really a great sigh even though we are from Singapore and are used to skyscrapers. The massive lights and all will definitely make anyone stop and stare.However, please feel free to give the Light Show at 8pm a miss as it is a VERY HUGE disappointment. Just a couple of lights which are hardly impressive. There were loads of tourists beside us who were also awaiting the show and well, about 2 minutes into the show, everyone started leaving.

Amazing. The skyline here is really unique and best between 8 pm when the there is a sound and light show for around 15 minutes. You can view it either from Hongkong island or Kowloon but the best vies are from a boat where you get to see both sides of the sky line.
Impressive. Its a must to visit on your every trip to Hongkong! Simply Stunning! A total different view from the day and night!

Expected More. We watched the 8.00 pm light show from the harbour side in Kowloon and were a little disappointed. The spectacle of the buildings outlined in neon is impressive but when the symphony of lights takes place you get lasers from the tops of the tallest towers and not much more.

One of the most memorable places. It's magnificent! Ane time of the day, Hong Kong Skyline is worth having a look at. The Avenue of Stars is really close too so it could be 2-in-1 or even more if you wish to visit the Space Museum and The Museum of Art. I often go to the Bund in Shanghai, which offers a noce view on skyscrappers in Pudong, but in Hong Kong it's thousands of times more beautiful and the water is amazingly blue (in Shanghai it's yellow, even brownish).
More impressive than Sydney. But a shame the experience is so magical there are thousands of others on the quayside filming the event with their smartphones!

On a clear day. Truly an amazing sight. From the Kowloon side, looking across to the island is the perfect HK view. If you can get to the peak on a clear day, it's worth the queuing and crowds to catch a glimpse of this iconic skyline.

Fun light show. Be sure to see the Symphony of Lights from the Kowloon side. We bought the Night Tour from the Big Bus company. Outside of seeing the neon lights and seeing the location of the markets, you can skip the bus tour. The show starts at 8 and lasts 15 min. Stand by the Ave of the Stars for a great view.

Memorable skyline. A very impressive skyline in the day and even more so at night.Unfortunately the weather was not very good during our visit and was cold and misty but even so the view was very good and we can imaging on a clear day it would be spectacular.An enjoyable experience and highly recommended.

must see. Spent a day in hong kong whilst in transit to australia. Caught the airport express which is clean and efficient. Walked around hong kong and experienced the diverse nature of its shopping and people . Absolute 5 star shopping malls to bac street laneways selling everything from prada tomlocal produce. Congested but orderly. Great place.

must see. Spent a day in hong kong whilst in transit to australia. Caught the airport express which is clean and efficient. Walked around hong kong and experienced the diverse nature of its shopping and people . Absolute 5 star shopping malls to bac street laneways selling everything from prada tomlocal produce. Congested but orderly. Great place.

Just amazing to see at night. Just wish I had a high quality camera to take pictures at night, to show what my eyes are seeing.
Just fabulous to see.

Average. To be honest, the hong kong skyline was merely being enhanced by the the view areas on either side of the islands (e.g. avenue of stars etc). Other than that, it was just another city skyline without much pretty skyscrapers. However, the 8pm symphony of light show was definitely a let down. You really don't have to plan your trip around it for all you get to see are random flashes of spotlight off the buildings scattered all around the perimeter.
Most impressive skyline.. The Hong Kong Skyline is one of the most impressive in the world at day and at night. Just sit down and enjoy the great view of buildings and mountains.

A lovely skyline.. Hong Kong has a lovely skyline, especially when most buildings are lit up after dark.The lights display of the buildings is truly beautiful and the light show that can be seen in the evenings (weather permitting) is not to be missed.Recommended.

A little foggy. We're sitting on the 117th floor of the Ritz Carlton as I write this. We've been here two days and can't see out the window due to the fog. When it does lift, this is a gorgeous city!! BTW, in our opinion, the light show at night is overrated.

Spectacular Lightshow. We were there during the Christmas season and the light show displayed at night on buildings on both sides of the harbor were spectacular. Colorful and entertaining. Would highly recommend anyone visiting Hong Kong take in the skyline view at night.
Great experience. Worth visiting. Cable car takes you to up to the mountains and 25 minutes ride from ground. Value money.

Spectacular. There really is nothing quite like it. Other cities have great skylines of course, but Hong Kong from the Kowloon side is really something special. Here's the thing: we crossed over to Kowloon on the Star Ferry in the middle of the afternoon having been up the peak. "Look!" I said to my kids, who were a bit more underwhelmed than I thought they should be, but maybe they were skyscrapered-out. Then having spend some time in the space museum and having dinner we came out in the dark. Suddenly the view was "awesome"!The light show is good, but I think I preferred the subtler joys of just watching the illuminations changing as the big screens and lights change across the harbour. We took the Star Ferry back to Wan Chai, staring all the way.
Awesome. Be sure to catch the light show at 8 pm every night was really something to see. Laser show on Victoria Harbor.
best view in the world. Has to be seen to believed, and no matter how many times you visit it never becomes boring. Both night and day are special but best of all viewed onboard the star ferry
Fantastic View. Always a good view of both HK and Kowloon side, I've experienced it during the daytime and also the festival of lights at night. And also seen this from Victoria's Peak as well.
BEST IN THE WORLD. HK has the best skyline in the world, epic and majestic. Best viewed from Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront promenade.
nice sky line. appears to go on forever rising up in the mist and fog. both historical buildings, decaying housing and new modern behemoths.

A dream at night. Already during the day its mighty impressive. Take the star ferry and have a good all around look. We were lucky with the weather. Most of the time HK lays under a layer of smog and visibility can be less than 1km. Otherwise, breathtaking views at night from Tsim Sha Tsui, with our withou Symphony of Light. Wonderful from Victoria Peak. (Avoid Peak tram - unless you want to stand in line for a good 45 mins or longer, take bus of taxi)
ooooooooooooooo. Words cant describe it: go see it for yourself! The view from the Peak especially is amazing! And try the same from the Star Ferry promenade!
Better at night. We came here twice but it was better at night when all the lights were so splendid. Had some drinks and enjoy the best skyline of the world was so great.

Lasers lights and luxury. You've seen it all on CNN as a backdrop to their newsroom there, but in the flesh with the sea smell in the air and sound of passing vessels to and fro it's worth taking the time and trouble to be there for the light show.
OK, but not great. Unfortunately it was foggy only cleared for one night, so we visited to see the lazer show, but we found it a bit dssapointing

Matchless view of Hong Kong!. We saw the Hong Kong skyline during the day and night. The night time glow is far superior. the best vantage point for us was the SkyTop restaurant on the 17th floor of the Sheraton Hong Kong & Towers Hotel. we were able to caught the spectacular nightly Symphony of Light Show covering all of the high-rise corporate office buildings surrounding Victoria Harbor. It is a great vantage point to top-off your exhausting day of city sightseeing!
Best city-scape in the world?. Probably. You can see this view from many places but the star ferry across the harbor is probably the best.
Amazing at Night. As cool as this skyline is during the day the night time magic is like no other city we have been to. Amazing light show every night a 8pm. Do not miss this.

Very Pleasing to My Eyes. It's my third time to be in Hong Kong and I never fail to come and visit this place (Kowloon Side) as it always pleases my eyes. Everything is amazing in the Hong Kong skyline- the Victoria Harbour, the array of buildings, the shipping vessels, the sky, the people walking by, the calmness and serenity of the atmosphere and the cleanliness of the place. Also, it's all for free. There are also a lot of benches to sit on, to relax and observe the magestic beauty of this skyline, the people passing by and just enjoy the atmosphere. I recently came with my 4 year old son and 9 year old daughter and they both enjoyed the place. They also liked the grilled squid for sale around the area as much as I did. I would recommend this to everyone

Iconic skyline. The Hong Kong skyline will be familiar to many people. Travelling by car/ taxi from the airport affords you great views. Many of the hotels have accommodation on high levels both on Hong Kong Island and in Kowloon which afford great views of the opposing skyline. We did a pre-dinner harbour tour which extended the views beyond the immediate area of Hong Kong Island and Kowloon and the commentary was adequate. The trip to Victoria Peak is a must for appreciating the skyline, the extent of the natural harbour and the more distant views out to the South China Sea.
The One. One of the most impressive displays of lights, sounds, and colors. I have seen a lot of Skylines, this has to be in top five, a must see.

Awesome from Kowloon. We were staying at the Shangri La Kowloon. I spent hours watching across Victoria Harbor to Hong Kong. Just amazing the buildings and lights day or night. Best view to watch and enjoy is the Promenade in Kowloon with Starbucks, the Art Museum and a life size bronze of Bruce Lee to enjoy the lights. Time square on a bigger scale. The evening light show was a little underwhelming.

Great skyline. I always see the Hong Kong Skyline only on TV, like for example on CNN Asia. I finally got to see it last January. It was impressive, thousands of buildings with different sizes and design complemented by the Victoria Harbour. Now I know why CNN recognized it as the best skyline in the world. It’s sad that we didn’t able to see it at night, which I think is more spectacular.
breathtaking view !!. certainly worth the time.. though the weatherwas too cold.. wrong timing i guess.. but still just amazing.. and so peaceful.. must see in hong kong id say

Amazing, unfortunately the weather was not cooperative with rain and overcast the whole time.. I liked traveling around the city, very easy to get around using the metro system there. I disliked the weather when I was there..very cold and rain.

Best Skyline in the world. Hong Kong has the best skyline, you'll want to take the star ferry a couple times to do it justice. The light show is great, you have to go early to get a good spot to view.

Didnt want to leave. I visited in 2009 with a group of college friends and we didnt want to leave. The skyline is so breath taking and peaceful that we didnt want to leave. The long strip felt so safe that we were all comfortable walking around at 1am in the morning. I would surely like to bring my husband and daughter here to experience this magical place.
skyline. the sky line is amazing wanted to look at it all the time, the fireworks on new years eve were amazing also the laser show which is on every night

Magnificent skyline!. The views at Victoria Harbor are breathtaking! As you stand (or ride) to take in this view, be prepared to have your breath taken away, literally. The laser light show at 8pm each evening is an unforgettable experience.

Stunning. You must see this if you are ever in Hong Kong. We made it a point to come back here practically every night. It is the best free show in Hong Kong. Plan to be in Kowloon at dusk as you can see the skyscrapers turn on their multicolored lights and captivate you as those lights are reflected into the shimmering Victoria Harbor. Stick around for the narrated show which started at 8pm in January, I imagine that it will be later during the summer months. On weekends look for the Junk Boat sailing the harbor.
IMPRESSIVE. been to a number of nice cities...never been so impressed by skylines...make sure you check the light shows they have at 8pm every night..CNY fireworks great!!
Wow!. I personally think the Hong Kong Skyline is one of the most amazing in the world; especially at night! A great way to see the skyline is from The Stay Ferry which is a classic and cheap!
Be it at night from the Peak ... ... or from HKs latest addition, the SKY 100 - Building with its visitor platform at 363 m above sea level, just breath-taking.

its a must.. The view was great. But to all travelers please purchase the tickets for the peak tram online or through big bus company. This would help jump the long que. I went on weekdays thinking there wouldn't be many people and boy was I wrong. Also go at night or in the evening and stay till its dark the the hongkong skyline is fully lit. Its worth it. There are some nice places to eat but they are quite overpriced for the food they serve. But I guess they charge for the location and view.

Nice and free attraction. After a day visiting Hong Kong on walking, in the evening we went to see the Skyline light show.We arrived just 10-15 minutes before and a lot of people were already there. Anyway, there are a lot of space available and so we managed to see the show quite well.After the show we had a nice walking so to see the Skyline more quietly.There are a lot of stands selling food and drinks.

Must see. It's something you must visit when you are in Hong Kong. Especially during a night when all the lights shine in the dark. It could have been even better during Chinese New Year but we did not have that chance to stay in HK any longer. The light show disappointed me, it's really nothing special, plus during that time it gets crowded.

make a beeline for the skyline. By day, or by night, sunny or cloudy...each time, it has a charm of its own. We caught it at its best... the fireworks display on the 2nd day of the Chinese Lunar New Year!! Psychedelic and super spectacular! The 8 pm lighting is also nice to catch. On any other day, at any time, just hitting the waterfront and soaking in some fresh sea-salt in the air is great...along with the beautiful skyline.
the food its best. i would like to eat there again and i miss the taste of the food, i like the most is oriental food and some of chinese
Hongkong half day tour. good tour if you dont have too much time in Hongkong.The optional sam pan ride was lovely. The tour guide took us to places you would never be able to find yourself.
Amazing!. This is truly one of the greatest skylines in the world. You must get to the harbor to see it! Also be sure to see during the day as well as during the night. A must!

Stunning but the laser show is nothing special. Hong Kong is striking. From the moment you leave the airport to drive into the city (assuming you do), you'll likely have your nose pressed up against the glass wondering at the movie-esque architectural scenery towering above you. The skyline is definitely best seen from down on the Kowloon side of the harbour, just be ready for the crowds. If you want to sit through the light show (every night, 8pm) then make sure to get there early. If you want to get the ferry tour that takes in the light show (19.55 from Tsim Sha Tsui) you'll have to go and get tickets earlier in the day - it sells out hours early. To be honest, though, while the skyline is definitely something you should pop down to the water to catch during any stay in HKG, the light show is a bit of a let down. Really nothing spectacular and a lot of people leave early. As for the 'commentary... tonight in English!', I didn't hear more than a few words spoken. Maybe that came after the 20 minutes or so it took me to get bored an give up.Light show let-down aside, the skyline itself is fab.
Not as I expected to see. Atmosphere is very good at the avenue of stars , light shows are fantastic and sync with played music .

Great Skyline, with the water and building. The contrast with the water and the tall buildings is great, everything so compact and reaching for the sky. It would seem the only place to go is up. Try seeing the view from different perspectives, The Peak, Bank of China, etc... Always something new to see.While we enjoyed looking at the skyline (especial from our hotel room window on the harbour) we didn't enjoy so much the night lights show. But that is another review.

Breath-taking. It has all been said by others, but an amazing concentration of people in a totally vertical city either side of the harbour. You get a sense of it coming in from the airport on the express shuttle, but the views across the harbour from the Ibis hotel, high up on Victoria Peak or best of all on one the ferries are spectacular. We were particularly struck by high-level walk-ways snaking between the rows of buildings and taking the crowds above the roads

One of the most Spectacular Skylines in the World in an Incredible Setting!. Our first night in Hong Kong, the weather was perfect as we strolled along the harbour on the Kowloon side. The view was amazing with the glittering skyscrapers lining the water.  Our second night we viewed the special 8 pm Light Show which is okay for nothing but the lasers certainly don't add a lot to the superb vista. It's a great spot to see tourist portrait photographers at work and watch all the tourists gather. It's one of the top sights in the world without a doubt.

Iconic Panarama doesn't disappoint. We took a trip on the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong on the way to see the racing at Happy Valley. The views were spectacular and I managed to get some good pictures on the smart phone.Not to be missed.We had to buy 2 tokens (HK$5) as the octopus card did not work.

What a view!. The views match the price of the real estate! With million dollar views all round I would definitely suggest getting to the peak. If the tram is too busy get a cab up from the bottom of hong kong island for around 15 dollars AUD

absolutely must see!!!. we got so lucky to see the skyline and the laser show on a clear cold night. the skyline is so worth the trip, it is stunning! the laser, well that was a bit underwhelming. i can only tell you that to see the sky line from the harbor side is so wonderful, it makes top of the list of things to see in hk.
Beautiful!. Over-looking the city in HK is amazing! The night view is the best in the world. Definitely worth visiting.

Great view. Beautiful skyline, with it's own unique feel to it, and great light show every night at 8pm. Although I have split feelings from an environmental point of view as to the huge carbon footprint all the lit up buildings have, they are making changes and on this visit I noticed a lot more solar panels have appeared since my last visit 8 years ago, which is encouraging as it does look fab. As others have said the best view is from Kowloon looking back at HK island, although it does look good the other way too. One of the things I like it the boats that cruise up and down the harbour, especially during the light show with their own lights highlighting the shape of the boats, much more atmospheric than during the daytime.

Amazing! It's one of the best skyline in the world. It is purely spectacular! Countless stunning buildings behind the beautiful Victoria Harbour and in front of the surrounding mountains! This breathless view is just amazing! My wife and I sat there for a couple of hours to watch the sunset and it was probably one of the best scenery we have ever seen in our lives. I would never get tired of looking at this view and more importantly, it is free!I think it is one of the place you have to visit before you die.Tips: Don't waste your time with the laser light show, it's horrible!
great view over smoggy Hong Kong island. great views over the island,Victoria harbour,Kowloon,but very cold and foggy,quite expensive for food and drinks so be prepared,but the views are stunning
Excellent. So many tall buildings..Make sure you can catch the light show, its not fantastic but nice to see once.
Simply amazing. It's something you could just watch for ever. The lights keep changing depending on your vantage point. Taxi rides are a great way to see the sights amongst the skyscrapers.

Been a lot of places,this is best!. I've seen a lot of big skylines around the world. This one is certainly the best.HK is so spectacular because of the surrounding hills, and this makes its skyline even more dramatic!Such a beautiful city and well maintained given it's massive size. Well done city government!
Beautiful. Very beautiful and iconic skyline. Does not matter if you saw it at day time or night you'll definitely love it.

nothing spectacular!. I expected something more spectacular. It is OK. Music could be better! I went to the sheraton to have a better view and it was just ok. I just heard so many good reviews I expected more.

One of the top 10 skylines in the world. How impressive!! The stunning buildings, especially at night all lit up with festive lights. There is such a variety in the architecture, size, design of all the buildings. I wish there was an architectural tour if Hong Kong, similar to what some other cities have because it would be pretty amazing to understand the influences behind this amazing city.

Stunning, especially at night from the Star Ferry. The reviews are true - you simply must see this from Kowloon or from the water on the Star Ferry at night. We took the 'Symphony of Lights' harbour cruise, which gives you the best view of the amazing city scape on HK Island, and across in Kowloon.At 8 p.m. the laser show starts, and lasts around 10 minutes. If you are trying to view this from HK Island you'll have no idea what you're missing; get yourself onto the boat or across to the Avenue of Stars in Kowloon.The clearer the weather the better, obviously; but even though we had a murky evening it was still spectacular. If you do take the boat, get to the front (bow?) open air section as soon as you can for the very best views.

Breathe taking. You will never see anything like it in the world. Best view is walking along the harbour front from Hung Hom station to where the ferries are in TST at night. You can see the skyline unfold in front of you.

Light show is spectacular. Head out to the promenade near to the Central Pier and take in an impressive selection of lit up skyscrapers! Some of the older Neon effects mix very well with the newer, all singing and dancing light paints.
good family fun. Really enjoyed the lasers in the evening. We had a great family event, would recommend to future travellers!
not that bad. just cost me around 150, I forgot the accurate price. Don't have much expectation for it. Just OK, not that bad

One of the great iconic sights of the world. Whether day or night the view across Hong Kong harbour is one of the most photographed scenes in the world, it is one of the great memories you will take away from a visit to one of the worlds great cities
Lazer Show. You must watch the lazer lights show put on every night at 8pm from accross the bay in either direction very nice

Lights not so many. Having been to HK a few times, I have loved the skyline with all the lights. I found that this time the lights were not so many and took away that magical look they also seemed to get less after 11pm.

It is a joke. . I do not know who is writting these reviews, but to see the skyline or light show with star ferry is a complete misinderstanding. Star ferry: if you get into ferry from Island then they will take you to the other side to get some people, then they will show you the light show(i will tell you later about that), the. They will sail hells now where for a half an hour. Makes "a bus stop" and goes back for half an hour to the pick up points. Lets people out on mainland side and only then back to mainland. So for 10 minutes of lightshow you have to sit in the terrible boat and waste your time for hour and a half. Worthless. Do not try, trust me. Light show, is another joke. What you see at night from any place in honk kong that is the lighshow, apart from that they turn on three lasers on the buildings and put on bearly hearable music on the ship. The woman over speaker has suck strong accent and so silent that you do not understand what she is saying. Nothing. Wortless. The skyline itself is worth seeing at day and at night. But choose different locations. There is a hotel in the tallest building across from island. You can sitt there and enjoy the views day and night. And it is so much better. Or go to the peak it is good too.
Go now before the place is engulfed in smog!. My parents live in HK. Its a great busy city but very crowded and lots of issues with pollution now which is a real shame...
Amazing. Catch the Star ferry from Star pier and cross over to Tsim Sha Tsui and be amazed by the skyline. Worth also going at night for the nightly light show.
Awesome modern architecture!. The HK skyline before and after dark is simply amazing - just imagine the wattage being consumed to power up all those lights in this big commerce focussed city!
Most Attractive Skyline!. It will be hard to find another place that has the same or close to skyline scene.... two thumbs UP!
Great view. We'd like to walk outdoors, this place was so amazing and splendid at night. Enjoy the night lights dancing and skyline, that was so great !
Breathtaking!. A trip to the top of Victoria Peak is a must-do while in Hong Kong. Consider going later at night to see the city lights and avoid the daytime crowds.
Great Skyline!. Watching the skyline from the Peak or from a Ferry is magical - something you have seen on the TV many times but seeing it in person has a different effect!

Spectacular views. Well worth a trip up to the Peak to see the skyline. And if you don;t want to queue up for hours for the Peak tram, get the No. 15 bus from Central Pier, which gives you wonderful views as you climb up to the Peak. For the best views when you reach the top, go past the tram station and walk along Lugard Road. There are gaps in the trees that give you an unhindered view of the entire harbour - magnificent!
Absolutely spectacular.. View the light show from across the harbor on the Kowloon side. Every night at 8:00 pm. No need for a seat on the benches, everyone stands and blocks your view.
Amazing jungle of concrete. Hong Kong have a big concentration of tall skyscrapers. Best places to see them are at avenue of stars, from bus number 15 bound to Victoria Peak and Victoria Peak.

Something to be seen,and then some..... Whether from the Star Ferry,the Avenue of Stars and watching the Symphony of Lights or the many other available variations ,the skyline is one of the truly iconic tourist or sightseeing spots in the world. I am truly glad to have seen it.Does it beat Brooklyn?,I hear you say. The lights themselves likely do but NYC's contribution to contemporary culture and its skyline's connotations of that,still keep it ahead for me.And now I hear you say,what's that got to do with the price of fish? :)

Impressive!. From Kowloon this is an impressive sight, especially at evening/night.During the day pollution makes visibility low and don't waste your time with the laser light show at night, shockingly bad!!

Glorious view. Having seen the skylines of Istanbul, San Francisco, New York and Singapore, I wasn't expecting the Hong Kong skyline to be much of an attraction. However, when I viewed it, I fell in love with it. It's a magnificent view from one end to the other end. Best time to go visit the skyline is during sunset time. Walk along the "Avenue of stars" during sunset time and then be at the skyline at about 8PM when the "symphony of lights" show starts. Also, look out for the Hong Kong style boats moving around in the water during this time.

As impressive as NYC skyline, arguably better.. Make sure you get the view from the Kowloon side. Also, taking a boat/ferry ride on the harbour provides a lot of good views. I didn't try it, but a helicopter ride would be insane!

Lots of pretty buildings. The Hong Kong Skyline was nothing more than pretty buildings, bright lights. I honestly didn'tthink it was anything special, compared to the other skylines of big cities. If there was one thing that made this one interesting, it was the Hong Kong style boats floating around- that is definitely what makes it unique and gives it it's signature look.
Lifetime experience. It's amazing to watch from a sea , laser shows & lighting on tall buildings and synchronicity was superb , only thing which hampers the view was ?smog ...

High rise and water. To fully enjoy the spectacle of the Hong Kong Skyline it is best seen from both sides of HK Harbour. A short and cheap trip on the iconic Star Ferry takes you from HK Island to Kowloon and back or vice versa. There are plent y of available walks along both promenades where you get to witness the hustle and bustle of not only the land but just as important, the life on the water that has provided HK with such enormous trade over many centuries.

Nothing Earth-Shattering yet an Enjoyable Trip. I enjoyed the nightview @ Hong Kong Skyline. Even though the photographer says "free try" for the photo-shoots, they just want to make you see the photos and then pay for it. The photos were quite expensive. The things that they give you (electronic device and headphones) were useless and annoying. Service is ok. Just come for the skyline!
WOW. It was Christmas and the skyscrapers were lit up with Christmas lights. There was also a great laser show every evening.

Amazing from all angles. Do yourself a favour when in HK, take in the skyline from :
- The Star ferry
- The walk of stars
- The peak
Be sure to get up to the peak before sun set and watch as the sky changes and the lights come on....spectacular.

Brilliant View. Just an amazing view which tells you are somewhere very different.
Best viewed close by the Star Ferry terminal or perhaps in the Sky Bar at the Sheraton.

You can't miss it, literately. While you're in Hong Kong, you can't possibly miss it. The skyscrapers are everywhere. If you go to Kowloon at night and stand on the Avenue of Stars, music will play and there will be lasers shooting off the tallest of buildings synchronously to the tunes. It begins at 8pm. Along this avenue, there is also a Starbucks and a cool beer place to sit outside. Really the view was best at night when we were there, because the haze was impenetrable when we were there during the day.
Memorable.. Only New York can rival this skyline and it is instantly recognisable in films or pictures. At Christmas the lights are wonderful.

What a journey in the harbor. Taking the star ferry is of course a must when in Hong Kong. Take the trip at night to enjoy the 2000 light show and sit on the upper deck. If you choose to satnd for the crossing, hold on as the chop can be disorienting.

Hong Kong - World's most boring city?. It was unspectacular and even the trip up to the Peak was an anticlimax as all you could see was a couple of hills, buildings obscured by smog and a bit of the bay.
One of the best in the world. Pretty hard to beat this skyline. World-class and it gets higher and bigger every decade. Unbelievable.

You have to see this yourself. See it from the Peak or at night from the harbour or a ferry. Its actually everywhere you go. From the bus from the taxi. Dont miss the container piers coming from the airport either
as good as it gets. been quite often now and never fail to be impressed by the skyline - enjoy! sometimes can be misty but with a blue sky, wonderful from the peak of the water
Unforgettable!!. One of the best, in the Asia!!! Especially at the night.
Good view from the top. The surrounding building lights are arranged in a way to attract tourists. Good view from the top and one enjoys it most at night. Day-view is not that exciting
wonderful. Please Dont leave HK without taking some drinks or having a dinner looking at the Skyline in Hong Kong
Beautiful skyline. Great variety of skyscrapers and buildings all beautifully lit at night. Impressive from both the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island sides.
One of the seven wonders of the modern world. Well what can you say about the Hong Kong skyline ? It surpasses any in the world - only Shanghai's comes close.

Beautiful and never disappoints.. If on the Kowloon side take a walk from or to the Star Ferry, along the Avenue of Stars. The view day and night is great but at night there are all the beautiful lights and the laser show. It's a lovely walk after dinner or before bed.

Very good night skyline but light show a none event. The skyline is quite breathtaking but the 8pm laser show is not worth hanging around for. There are certainly crowds on the Kowloon side but we thought the laser show quite poor
Great views. On a clear day ( we didn`t really get one) must be really great but with so much fog or mist most of the time it is a little disappointing.

Nice. V beautiful skyline with all lights up! Definitely worth a walk down the promenade even in winter! But dun bother staying for the light show. A total waste of time. SG Gardens by the Bay show is better - and I don't even like it that much!

You can't miss it!. Always gorgeous, different and overwhelming during the daytime and at when it's dark.
Symphony of lights in the evening, don't miss it!!!
Must have in Hong Kong. Slow walk along the water line with regard on the high building during the day or looking from hotel window at night - view is fantastic.
Magnificent skyline. If you enjoy architecture, HK has several buildings worth seeing. There are nice views both during day time as well as night time when the buildings are lit.

Skyline is best viewed from The Peak. In Singapore, one can get beautiful skyline of skyscrapers from places like Marina Bay Sands and One Altitude, therefore, I cannot really understand why this is highly rated on CNN. But I gave it a 4 stars because the cold winter weather made it more special. We went up to the residential area at The Peak to view it. Quiet, peaceful, chilly, the fog made it a little mysterious and picture perfect.
Alive!. Interesting experience, definitely must see. If you are by the beginning go the avenue of stars, you will also have the 'music'. Beware of the crowd. 8pm

One of the greatest skylines in the world. You MUST put this view on your bucket list! From my viewpoint, it is one of the greatest skylines in the world. Try it by air, by sea, and by rail, they all have very different looks. Many times they "blackout" the buildings, so hopefully this does not happen when it is your turn to view the skyline. I cant recall how many times I have viewed this skyline, and I never get tired of the view.

Beautiful. I had such a great time meandering through Hong Kong. I took the Star Ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon to watch the laser light show and view the skyline. Fantastic. Yes, it was a bit hazy, but so is most of China. :)
Sit Back and Enjoy. Come join the crowds and just sit and wonder at the amazing sky line. Lots of nice seeting near the star ferry terminal

It all comes down to weather. We took the ferry over and strolled the Avenue of Stars promenade to experience the skyline and while it was nice, the hazy weather/pollution distorted it. Further, it was a Sunday night so a lot of the office buildings were blackened, limiting the vibrancy it probably has on a weeknight at 7 or 8pm.
Nice. Great spot and very laid back. Drinks are quiet dear but the atmosphere is great! Once again the service wasn't great but the view was awesome!

Fantastic Skyline. Wherever you view the skyline from it will be fantastic & you will never tire of this sight as it changes all the time. Only negative is the thick pollution which makes photos appear misty.
Come at night !. The view from Kowloon to the Hong Kong Island side is an impressive sight from every angle. Come at night where you can see a a short laser show at 8pm every night.

AMAZING. BREATHTAKING.. even after 3 years of living here I still just LOVE this city. I don't think you would find a more impressive and fascinating skyline to admire, no matter what time of day or night, really.

What's not to love?. This is a gorgeous, modern Asian skyline. The laser shows in the evening are an added bonus. The views from the towering Ritz Carlton are particularly entrancing. A picture of this skyline is my cover photo on Facebook.

The Best Way to Appreciate the "Size" of Hong Kong. While the Skyline is only one small piece of Hong Kong, it does illustrate the size and modernization of the core business and commercial districts of Hong Kong. I am not sure it is the most impressive skyline in the world but it is definitely worth seeing from both sides. Take the Star ferry to enjoy the view from either side and from the water itself. As others have mentioned, there is also a great view from the peak.
Amazing. Must see. The light show isnt really that impressive but just seeing the skyline is. Defiantly go at night.

It was beautiful but.... Now the air pollution is very serious and if you go there during October to February, you seldom have a clear view of the harbour as the winter monsoon from mainland is affecting the air quality. You will have better chance to take a nice photo during summer, typhoon days or after heavy rain.

Impossible to miss. Hong Kong and Kowloon skylines are clearly some of the most interesting of the world. You can enjoy them almost from any point: ground level, Avenue of the Stars, Victoria's Peak, ferries, ports, etc. If you want to take night pictures of the skyline do not forget that Hong Kong has a lot of light during night and the smog will diffuse it even more.

Concrete Jungle. Beautiful skyline from either side. We stayed in Kowloon and the evening HK Skyline across the harbour was just gorgeous especially with all the beautiful Christmas lights and messages. The same with the skyline of Kowloon at night. We also went to see HK from above at the Peak and that was just gorgeous! Definitely worth the trip up

Best Seen from the Ferry to Central/Wanchai. One can see the HOngkong Skyline best from the Ferry to Central/Wanchai, especially on a clear day. It can also be viewed from the balcony of Ocean Terminal. A few minutes is all it takes to soak it all in and take lovely pics!
Too much smog.. Although the skyline could be beautiful the fact it is surrounded by smog and pollution wrecks the beauty of it. On clear day when you get one it would be beautiful
Wow. It's important for everyone when they travell to Hong Kong they should take a ferry rise to see this beautiful hongkong skyline..i think it's a must do thing.
4 Days in Hong Kong. Brilliant. Loved everything. The Hotel, the sights , the shops, the food. Disliked the lack of good directions to the Harbour Tour booking kiosk.

Breathtaking. Beautiful beautiful skyline at night. Sit on a restaurant/ bar, take a cocktail and just pause for a moment to admire this view. It can take your breathe away especially after a long hot day walking around the city.
Wait for the light show as well, it's worth your 10-15mins.

Hong Kong visit.. Hong Kong is one of my most favourite cities. In the evening the view is beautiful looking across the harbour from Kowloon to Hong Kong Island. There are many places to visit and see apart from the main attractions. Travellers who are there for a short stop-over or just a few days probably miss a lot of the culture and sights. It is a very busy city and can be overwhelming. If you need a guide I would recommend the 'Hong Kong Local Guide'. You can find the information on facebook.

Hong Kong. Fantastic place lots to see and do, this is the place if you like Chinese food, The skyline is great, the lights are better than Las Vegas, cruise the Harbour, and shops are good for a bargan

Eye Candy. There are so many ways to see the beautiful and colorful sights of the Hong Kong Skyline. The Star Ferry is a must for any first timer to HK. The 10 min ride each way gives one a perspective from the water. On the Kowloon side, stroll along the boardwalk and view Central from there, or even more serene, go to the Ritz Carlton, have a drink in the bar with a full on scope of the Harbor, Central, and beyond to Lantau Island. Night time is especially enchanting because the buildings are lit up and you might even get a glimpse of the old junk with the red sail, that cruises by throughout the evening. Going to the top of the Peak is another must for skyline views, but for those who want some exercise, try walking the loop trail which starts at the top of the tram.Don't bother if it's foggy but on a clear day, it's a little diamond in the ruff. Nice, lush, tropical walk in the middle of the city.
wonderful. such a wonderful place for sightseeing... very nice view and atmosphere... it's a must place to visit.

Vibrant yet peaceful. The Hong Kong skyline was a joy. My hubby and I took the kids and grabbed some ice cream, and went for a walk along the harbor. Taking the ferry from Tsim Sa Tsoi was fascinating itself. Lots of good pictures and just a good family spot to hang out at.
Music show. Just find a good location to watch the music night show coordinate with the light show made from the skyscrapers! dont miss it, it's free and unique!
Fantastic at night. You need to take the Star Ferry at night across to Kowloon. The view is the best. Then you can ride the subway back across to Hong Kong.
new years eve spectacular. Hong Kong is very clean and the transit system is excellent, the air pollution is getting worse and even on windy days, seems like its foggy.
Its a visual treat. plan the visit for an evening, experience will be doubled. we went during christmas and new years, so the crowd was large, so plan accordingly

Pretty, and romantic!. My wife and I left the kids at the hotel for an hour to get some personal time. We went to the Harbor side and enjoyed the beautiful skyline. It was around 7pm, and we enjoyed some canto snacks -fishballs on a stick at a canteen nearby also facing the harbor. We also had an artist at the spot hand-draw a picture of us. Go there and you'll find something fun to do while enjoying the view!
Unforgettable. For me the only reason to go to Kowloon and take the Ferry. The light show is just OK, but it can get very crowded.

Wow... what a view!. It is by far the star of the HK show.. the skyline! Every night there is a light show that you need to watch from Kowloon. Best place to go for a drink and view the skyline has to be the Inter- continental! Expensive drinks (30usd for a G&T) but the view is worth just one!

HongKong Harbor / Skyline. While this is plane by day it comes to life at night, now with 'video' advertising on some of the building.I got some photo's but needed to set my camera to manual & use a tripod other wise the smog/haze can fog some shots

A must see when in Hong Kong. No matter how many times I have visited Hong Kong I always make the effort to see the skyline. Overlooking the harbour, the lights, the breeze in the evening being able to unwind.

Beautiful but not very Impressive!. It is a beautiful skyline with a lot of colourful Neon lights on the buildings, but it is not as impressive on the first sight. But it was a warm and quite night when on the night cruise enjoying the view. Still it is a MUST to visit if you drop by Hong Kong! I Love Hong Kong!

A Must Visit. You have to check out the famous Hong Kong Harbor if your there. A trademark of the city with the Hong Kong style boats floating around and the great skyline. A wonderful spot to take pictures. The have a light show during the evenings.
Beautiful. The view of Hong Kong night life was fantastic. Could not have asked for more. The weather in December was cool and nice. It didn't rain at all and visibility was superb.

Best to view at Night. A beautiful harbour skyline.I found it best at night with the tall lit-up buildings reflecting off the water and also with the lighted red sails of the local junk boat sailing about the place. The "star wars" laser light show at night (when it is on) is an added bonus.Best night vantage point is near the clock tower on the harbour bank.Day time the view is usually spoiled by the fog & mist in the air all the way right to the horizon - at least it was so in December, during our visit.The Star Ferry is also a great way to view the harbour lights at night - it gives an additional perspective.
stylish. good and safe city in Hong Kong. Good shopping paradise and nice people. Fantastic places like Lantau Island, Repulse Bay & Stanley Market, relaxing trip and refreshing
Amazing!. My first skyline experience! I was so awed by the gorgeousness. Be at the place like 30mins early because it gets so crowded by the time of the show.
Sweet view. Nice to take a ferry trip from the other side and check out the view at around sunset. Theres a variety of things to do in the area and North of it aswell.

Not Shanghai's but... If you have not seen Shanghai it is impressive. As a New Yorker I know skylines. This one is great. Must see at night. At night it really puts NY and many other US cities to shame. Also see during the day. If you have not seen Shanghai - this is just amazing. Having just come from Shanghai - this skyline is "nice" but one must really see Shanghai.

Nothing special about the dialogue in the dark. The illuminated buildings are amazing but in my opinion the son et lumiere was not worth the wait. If you are in the area then maybe give it a go at 8pm but otherwise view the skyline from Kowloon over to HK Island at any time of the evening.
Amazing. Hands down the best thing about HK.. I had an amazing view from my hotel.. Was just breathtaking.. First time seeing entire buildings decorated for Christmas.. Loved it!

Great view. Just like the movies. You can easily recognise the layout from movies and know instantly you're in Hong Kong. the lights show is pretty boring and free from the harbour so dont waste your money paying for boat trips. Not worth it.

Magical. Whether you are downtown, on the Star Ferry, riding the train, or sitting in a gondola on the way to the Big Buddha, Hong Kong has a unmatched skyline. Combine the mountains, the ocean, the skyscrapers, and the lights and you have Magic in a truly twenty-first century city. But it does not end there, as Hong Kong combines the new and shiny with the grit of a teeming city with ancient roots. The markets, the temples and the parks add a depth to the shimmer. This is one of the most beautiful cities in the world!!

like in he movies, even better.... When you have this view in front of your eyes, you realize you made it to Hong Kong.
