I remember staring at the skyline which is impressive, night and day, and daydream on the adventures that I saw in many movies, the local history and of course the great dim sum that can be found around the corner... not to be missed...

Always ask for a room with a view. Experience it now while you can! The Hong Kong Skyline makes you want to be part of the world. Whether it be from the Ritz in Kowloon Bay or the W in the bay, you won't get a better view of the Island Hong Kong!

Christmas Harbor Light show is definitely worth a December visit!. Many of the buildings all along Victoria Harbor have spectacular led-light decorations & every evening they have a Light show that is just beautiful. Have never seen the like anywhere else.

Magnificent. Whether you are on the Peak, Central, Wanchai or on the Kowloon side, the views of Hong Kong are just magnificent, whether by day or evening. At the Kowloon Star Ferry a nightly Skyline show is conducted around 8pm and it is free.

Be sure to visit Victoria Peak -- great view!. We took a taxi up and the bus back down since the line for the tram was extremely long in both directions. Otherwise it was a beautiful night and the skyline was gorgeous.

A unique skyline worth seeing. Hong Kong obviously has a skyline unlike any other city so it was good to see it (from Avenue of the stars and from the ferry). It's a must see at least once kind of thing!

Where is the skyline. Just came back from Hong KongOther than 3 rainy days and a couple cold days, the rest of the trip is "sunny".I took the star ferry so many times at different time of the day and night, and I kept asking myself where is the skyline (I exaggerate) . The smoke and the smog is so thick that the sky line is covered with haze. The night is better, because of all the X'mas lighting, but you still cannot see far.The day after all those rain, I finally get a better view of the harbor. But it was again covered over at night. I went up to the peak and it is the same. May be it is just the time of the year, I do hope so. Or is it because of the pollution. If so, the Pearl of the East is going to lost it glitter.
Get In EARLY!. Amazing views - beautiful! But, you MUST get in early!!! The line was so rediculously long and given the weather was very warm, it makes you think twice... Unfortunate
What a view. fantastic view of Hong Kong from promenade outside our hotel. The Christmas lights and night time light show were awesome

Its great to go up there to take in the sights.. i do warm you that the tram has 1.5 hours wait on average and if you get a Oyster card you can use it to board.Be careful when you wait for the tram as there is a gap in the railings where you can fall on to the tracks.

Beautiful and a Must See...Best in the World. This is one of the most amazing skylines in the world. The have a great laser show every night. Can get crowded on the weekend other wise a good and relaxing walk.

The Air Pollution killed it for me. air pollution was said to be not that high in december, but I disagree it was way too polluted for me and even though the skyline is otherwise impressive, it really put a huge damper on my experience.

The night river trip was not to be missed. The lights round the harbour are super, the fresh fish market a must to visit, a trip on the gondola to visit the Buddha, so much to see and do also the shopping if you get time. But very expensive so save to go

Amazing!. The hong kong skyline is beautiful & the light show in the evening is stunning. Music is played & the lights are illuminating the buildings across victoria harbour. Very enjoyable experience.
Skyline. Properly one of the best skylines in the world...if not the best. Love the laser shows. Very distinguished buildings.

Very lovely. I thought that this was a very beautiful and enjoyable part of my trip to Hong Kong. Not only does it embody the big city feel of HK, it is also a very stunning place to visit. It was my first time going to the HK skyline, so it was quite a shock for me to see all those skyscrapers light up. The lightings are beautiful, and the atmosphere is very romantic as well. Plus there's the cool Avenue of Stars (similar to the Walk of Fame in LA). Also, please do try to see this place both during the day and at night, cuz it looks and feels very different. :) I would highly recommend those touring HK to check this place out!

No words will do it justice. Absolutely amazing and the light show is awesome. I've went to the light show every night I was in Hong Kong. It does get crowded so it can be difficult to get a good shot without having lots of people in the pic.
W O W !!. Symphony of lights shouldn't be missed here. It is awesome and very unique. The beautiful sky scrapers are one of the best across the world.

Great to walk around. It has been voted the worlds best skyline for a reason! We walked around the avenue of the stars, after going to the ballet, and it was truly amazing. There is so much do do around the area, not just look at the skyline. Unfortunately we didn't make it to the light show but from what we heard it is incredible. This city is so easy to manage, especially with children. One of our easiest, and best cities to visit.

Vast & Original. HKG skyline is quite eye catching and vast,spread across the Victoria harbor,At night it's very colorful with a daily light show at 8 pm for 12 minutes,with thousands of tourists flocking to have a glimpse.The skyline is spread across almost in very direction you see from Promenade on the other side.Many other cities have tried to copy or even make taller buildings (Shanghai,Dubai etc),but HKG Skyline is far better,bolder, brighter and dense.The IFC tower is most beautiful of the skyscrapers around the world ( white ivory lined look daytime) and the ICC in Kowloon is stunning at night with light artwork on it.Best views of the dense and vast skyline can be enjoyed from the peak sky terrace.Must enjoy the star ferry and look around too.This is probably the most beautiful Skyline in the world except Singapore skyline (not tallest but most perfect and symmetrical ever seen).HKG also has highest number of Skyscrapers in the world,some are on sloping hills too.

symphony of lights. symphony of lights - most disappointing . the lights of hong kong and kowloon skyscrapersare good to see. the symphony - ive seen better in brisbanes river fire. had a good positionto watch . left before it finished . - rowdy -brisbane
Wonderful trip. I watched the skyline from a junk ride and it was a truly great experience. I simply loved the skyline. The lights came on at 8 pm and they were fascinating. Great experience.

Out of this world.. What more can I say with so much having been said about the HK skyline, it falls nothing short of taking your breath away. I've seen it daytime last year when I was in HK, and this time I finally got to enjoy the spectacular Symphony of Lights on a cruise at night, and whoa was it ten times better! Too bad it was raining but nonetheless I was still stunned by the LED lights, lasers and neon signs on display, great symbol of Hong Kong's economical and historical development. All I can say is : You have to see it for yourself to be thoroughly awed, no number of photos can present its beauty in full.

truly stunning. Definitely try to see the skyline from many different locations across the city. This is really easy to do given how vertical the city is! And so many buildings have great views. Agree with other reviewers that you need to see this in both day and night views-- and my favorite is night time, when some of the buildings light up rather creatively! Also nice to see the boats in the harbor day and night.

Hong Kong skyline. Get there early to get a decent place to take pictures as it tends to get very full around the time the laser show starts , 20.00. Keep a look out for the junk that passes by as this make a great addition to the skyline . Best views from near the Intercontinental Hotel .
One of a kind. Saw both daytime and nighttime views, and you MUST stay for the nighttime views. Quite possibly the best skyline you will ever see.

Great Skyline. One of the best skylines ever. It s really spectacular how the old city mix with the new technology. It is better to see both skylines at night from a boat in the river. Do not miss the night show every day at 8pm !
Must see!!. Amazinggg! i have been to hing kong many times but this was first time here , its so beautiful and will come back again next visit :)

never fails. seen this five times never fails to amaze me top 1 must see free things in hong kong. the symphony of lights is also a much watch one of the classic scenes in HK - the chinese junk passing by the hong kong skyline

Words don't do justice. Life is not worth living without a visit to this place. The skyline is is just plain beautiful. It can't even be described, simply has to be experienced. We went during Christmas and the spirit was definitely in the air. The buildings displayed Christmas ads and greetings on their glass facades. They even played music which ind of set the tone. The only problem was I just couldn't leave, because I have never seen anything like this. There is nothing like in the world. Hong Kong should be proud to have such a tourist attraction.

More beautiful than seen on pictures!. We were there on 13 December 2013 and spent approx 1 to 2 hours of walk to enjoy the view. You can walk along the Avenue of Stars. Go in the evening (about 6pm) to see the buildings light up one by one. This is one of the main places to visit in Hong Kong and it's free! At the end of the walk, you can continue to enjoy the view with coffee at Starbucks.

Sooooooo boring, don't go. Heard by many people about this attraction.The music is cheesy and the lights very boring. Even people around me were very happy when it finished. I don't see any reason to see it.

Well! There is nothing else like it!. Simply has to be experienced! November and December are the best times. But, if you ever get the chance, see it at Christmas, as the buildings dressed up in their Christmas lights are unforgettable! You'll be all the more poorer if you never see this un-natrual wonder!

Great Skyline - Underwhelming Light Show. Hong Kong has one of the best skylines in the world, especially at night. Views can be had all the way from the Star Ferry Pier, along the TST Promenade to the Ave of the Stars. This a a wonderful walk day or night.The skyline lights come on at about 6PM (in October, it was dark by then). We made our way to the TST promenade by 7:15PM and were able to get a good spot along the rail, before the huge crowds amassed.The laser light show started promptly at 8PM. It consisted of loud music and green laser light beams from the tops of a couple of the buildings across the bay on HK island.The night time skyline is a must see, the lights show -not so much. I would not recommend altering your itinerary around being there at 8PM.

Buildings light up in concert. While we were there, we saw the buildings light up, showing animals, Christmas decorations, words, shapes and colors. We are more "nature" kind of people, but it gave a great sense of the size and scale of the city while we were walking toward the ferry.

Excellent skyline, disappointing symphony of lights. On 15 december 2013, Went to the tst area at around 5+pm (hk time), went near the harbour city, there are a lot of shops around, like gucci, lv, h&m and etc. the skyline was fantastic even in the day... was super cold, temperature was 16-17 degrees. Went over to watch the symphony of lights that started at 8pm, was there at 630pm-7pm... was drizzling, there is a performance near the museum, some breakdance performance by a group of girls. by 745pm ,there was already a crowd standing near the railing, to catch the symphony of lights.... there are announcements made stating that it starts at 8pm, i will say , it is a good gesture...When the performance starts, by then it was already raining heavily. but it did not dampen any of the tourists mood to watch. however i was a little disappointed by it. was expecting more though. but nonetheless, enjoyed myself. took some pictures. dropped by isquare(mall nearby tst mtr) before heading back to the hotel.
Just awesome !. Amazing views, both from the Kowloon side and also from the peak. Looks very nice in the night .. must visit attraction in my view.

Amazing especially at night. The Skyline is very impressive with on city high rise offices looking like solid silver in the sun. At night, the atmospghere at the promenade by the Star Ferry Terminal was fantastic as thousands of people (it was Saturday) watched the laser light show (which to be honest I found a little disappointing). That takes place every evening. The night sky line is full of colour and mirrors in the harbour waters

One of the best views.. The skyline is really pretty in the day but it sparkles at night, bringing it to life, making it one of my favourite views in Hong Kong. The symphony of lights is really pretty to watch from the Kowloon harbour.

Its rated the worlds best for a reason. Its rated the worlds best for a reason, yes its spectacular.You can view it from the promenade from Tsim Sha Tsui, from a boat in the harbour or from Hong Kong Island.Its starts at about 8pm and its great.
Maybe the best in the world.. Amazing and a must see when visiting HK. Catch the 8PM light show from the Kowloon harbor... outstanding.
good view. Try not to miss 8p.m. light show.I missed that and unfortunatelly after 8p.m. gets darker and darker as the buildings are shutting down the lights.Any way that was a good one.
Nowhere like it. The most amazing view of a skyline I have ever seen. Daytime wonderful, but night time is fabulous. Take a good camera though. The light show at 8pm is spectacular too.

Nice view from Kowloon. go to the Marina and look for the PENNINSULA HOTEL. Take the lift up to the Felix Bar at the top and check out the view!Even if the cocktails are really expensive.. It'S worth getting one!

Simply gorgeous & amazing. Must see at night from Kowloon side near Star Ferry terminal. We were lucky to have a clear sky & almost half moon. The laser show is not as extravagant as expected. Expect big crowd and people with i-phones blocking your view every now & then. But it is interesting & enjoyable.

simply spectacular!!!!!!!!. my first visit to Victoria Peak is in 2010, summer.and then last february.the first time i went up there with bus and the second time using the tram and let me tell you the queue for the tram was insanely longggggg. maybe it was in the evening and people wanted to see the sunset so it all made sense but just be sure to go early so you dont have to miss the stunning view when the sun went down. simply stunning, and then the night view with all the lights. wow.

Good harbour - great by day and great by night. Walking along side the harbour during the day the buildings and skyline look great from the Kowloon side.The skyline transforms at night around 8.00pm with the symphony of lights. A light and laser and music show that lights up the harbour and a large number of buildings for 15 mins or so.The harbour is great to cruise on.I would suggest a visit during the day and then again at night around 8pm to enjoy the light and laser show.

Great Skyline. Don't miss the 8:00 p.m. laser show on the Hong Kong Skyline. We found that the Kowloon Public Pier to the right when you exit the Star Ferry in Kowloon was the best place to see this light show over the harbor and on the Hong Kong Skyline. Be sure to get there 10 mins. early to get a seat.
Cool city. Laser light show at sunset great to watch with a cocktail. Ferries, cruise ships, people watching all great fun in this international city

Great view with laser light shows at 8pm. I was lucky enough to stop by for 2 nights during my 5 days trip to Hong kong. For me, I think it's best to be there by the evening before the sun sets. The sunset view is as good as the night view (on days of good weather). The first time I was there, it started raining heavily just when the laser show was about to start. Had to run for cover whilst lugging my tripod and backpack as I didn't expect the rain.While for the laser show, it wasn't as spectacular as I have expected but would still recommend first timers to Hong Kong to go watch. It's just my personal opinion so I am sure there are others' who would love it. Also, it would be wise to be there earlier if you want to have a good spot to watch the laser show. There is a Starbucks Cafe along the Avenue of Stars so you can grab some light food and maybe have a hearty dinner after the laser show as the show lasts about 15 minutes.
One of the most identifiable skylines. Not sure what to say more than the views of the skyline from Kowloon and from Victoria Peak. Great place for shopping, eating, drinking, and people watching.

Amazing at Christmas Time. We viewed the skyline from the roof top of our hotel, the top of Victoria Peak, the Big Red Tourist Bus night tour, and finally from our cruise ship during a late departure. It's is truly breathtakingly beautiful
Spectacular light show @ 8 pm. Don't miss is!. Get the metropolitan feeling of HK! The light shows put HK in a different view. Make sure you enjoy the show from the harbor or a nice venue.

Best City View in the World?. Viewing city skyline from Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui) could be the bst city skyline view in the world; at least about few thousands of tourist thought so that night. With the Symphony of Lights starting at 8pm which lasts about 15 minutes, viewers can lay back and enjoy the breeze and light display at about any spot along the Arena of Stars.

Stunning. It's great to see both sides of the harbour. Best way to see the Hong Kong Island skyline is at the Avenue of Lights/Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade. Around 8pm every night, there is a nice light show. Best way to see the Kowloon skyline is having dinner on a high floor in a Hong Kong side skyscraper! Or from the Peak.

World Class Skyline. Our hotel was in the Kowloon district of Tsim Sha Tsui so we walked along the Promenade including the Avenue of Stars. He went during the day and at night for the Symphony of Lights. We probably walked for 2 miles but you could get a good view of the skyline without walking much.The Symphony of Lights is a light show of the building lights set to music. It was OK but it did not match the hype we heard before we went.The Avenue of the Stars is statues and hand prints of famous people from Hong Kong. It is fun watching the tourist who know the stars get their pictures taken with the statues.We also took the Star Ferry across the Victoria Harbour to Hong Kong Island. This ride was very cheap and well worth the time.I had trouble breathing in Hong Kong, I constantly had a runny nose and a cough. It was much worse near Victoria Harbour. It seemed to be allergies because when I was in the hotel I was fine
Best place to view. It's definitely worth a drink at the Sheraton sky bar for a spectacular view of the skyline and light show.

Stunning skyline. Whether from the Peak, from Wanchai Hong Kong or from Kowloon Side at the Avenue of Stars at Tsim Sha Tsui, the Hong Kong skyline is simply breathtaking. Particularly at night at 20.00 o'clock, when laser-show is activated one should enjoy the fabulous skyline.

What a fantastic sight. Go up on the peak tram and look out over the whole of Hong Kong. What a sight. If you travel over to Kowloon on the Star Ferry and walk down the avenue of stars at night on the water front , Hong Kong looks fabulous, lit up and like a shining star.

Spectacular Skyline. Its very difficult to say whether HK skyline or NYC skyline is the best! The beauty of HK skyline is the varied colors and neon light banners along buildings. The reflection of these colors also makes the entire view spectacular!Most of the skyline is visible from pretty much everywhere, but the best views are at night & dusk, preferably from TST promenade. Just make sure its a clear day, else you may be disappointed. Try to also watch the sound & light show (from TST), which is a daily free show (8pm).

Awesome!. I was looking forward to walking down the riverbank and taking it all in. It's breathtaking. The lights, the breeze, the noise from the boats. Definitely better in person. A must for all HK visitors!

Great Views. Hong Kong is well known for its beautiful skyline and it doesn't disappoint. The city is stunning with great views from different points. Wish we could have seen the 8pm light show, but hopefully on our next visit.
Take a jacket. You are on the highest observation point in town, so take a jacket. It gets windy and a little cramped.

High light of our trip. Well worth doing boat tour at night. Hard to take photos because of smoke most of the time. Hong Kong is a great stop over few a few days, motels by the water best ,ie: Canton Rd.

8000 highrises and mostly neon. I live in Chicago and have visited big cities before, but this was a big city on steroids. Pictures of the neon of Times Square are nothing like the neon in Hong Kong and Kowloon. It's everywhere and being that it was nearly Christmas time, it was holiday themed--so that was fun. I'm not used to scrolling words from the bottom to the top of sky scrapers, nor multiple lights doing all sorts of things. Don't miss the 8:00 laser show every night--even if the introduction is in another language, the music and lights are fun to watch.

The best in the world! Dazzling!. The Hong Kong Skyline is the best in the world. It is absolutely dazzling. We stayed at the Intercontinental, Salisbury road just so that we could spend all day looking at it.

Awesome. One of the Worlds most spectacular skylines. No photos do it justice and nigh time from Kowloon looking across the harbour is quite breathtaking. Watching, from Kowloon, the sun go down over the urban landscape is a special experience.

Simply amazing.... Being in Hong Kong is an amazing experience all together.... The Skyline is no exception... The architecture, each building has a personality... I enjoyed watching this amazing site during the day and at night. You definitely have to see this in different times of the day.You will love it!

Not up to the mark. I have seen symphony of lights many times in Singapore and that’s much better than HK one. The only better thing is THE LENGTH, lights use to come from so many building and could from all building upto 1 KM. Light show use to start with blinks and so many pauses, which creates more anxiety but from entire duration (15 mins) only 5 mins show is more than average and other 10 mins are below average. Hence I would suggest that please do not go with high expectations, its just an average for those you have seen these types of show in other place.
Great at night. Most of the tower blocks are lit up at night and are stunning. Try and see from the Peak at night or from the water.

Unique!. Many can try to assimilate the image of Hong Kong, but will forever be known as "copies". Hong Kong's skyline is its own and no one can take that away. It's controlled chaos at its best. Dive in, and you'll have a night to remember!

Very nice. We were there December 1st the weather was perfect the waterfront was nice, and many buildings were decorated for Christmas. The only negatives were some smog and quite a lot of construction obscuring the view.
HK visit. downtown is very crowded, some smog, but the people are very friendly. fascinating buildings, escalators (people movers), you gotta visit the Peak.
Perfect Skyline. The view of the Hong Kong skyline is perfect except a bit of disappointment on the symphony of light which was not that attractive.

One of the best night view of city skyline!. I love Hong Kong city skyline very much especially on the island since I was a small kid! The night view of the skyline was so vibrant with the lighting and neon. Truly amazing.

Spectacular views. The spectacle of Hong Kong Island's skyline by day or night has to be seen to be believed. Despite having been to Hong Kong many times it still brings a sense of excitement. This is one of the most sophisticated and cosmopolitan places in the world and there is no doubt that the skyline is a showpiece. Try heading for Victoria Peak in the day or night for fabulous views sweeping down over the Island and across Victoria Harbour to Kowloon & Tsim Sha Tsui. And don't miss the Symphony of Lights at 8pm nightly where the skyline comes alight across the Harbour in a dazzling display of laser light and music. Best vantage points for this are facing Hong Kong Island along the Harbour near the Star Ferry terminal. There are also some beautiful bar & hotel vantage points where you can relax and gaze at the view. Try the Hennessy Rooftop Bar perched up one flight of stairs from the Wooloomooloo Steakhouse on Hennessy Road. The views of the skyline are hypnotic.
Takes you by surprise. Worth hunting this out at sunset as you don't appreciate it when you're walking among the towers all day.

Do not miss this. It would be a crime to travel to Hong Kong and miss this. Get the ferry from Hong Kong island over to Kowloon and enjoy the view. Don't worry about the 8pm light show, just enjoy the view during the day and after dark. Amazing. For a different angle, travel to the peak on Hong Kong Island and look down. Just fab.

Lovely at night. What makes the HK skyline so special is the fact that it's fronted by water. At night, the light from the buildings is reflected on the water, creating a wonderful little kaleidoscopic display on the water -excellent photo op. It does get crowded though, because of its proximity with the promenade of stars and general shopping district.
At night. HongKong is great by night. Most people are still out and about enjoying lights, ferry rides, bars and restaurants.
Make sure it's a clear. Really good to experience, just make sure it's a clear day, sometimes hard in Hong Kong. Well worth the trip. Good for family's as well.
Best Skyline in the World. Spectacular skyline. The best two places to view/photograph it are from the "Avenue on the Stars" in Kowloon and from "The Peak" on Hong Kong Island.

Charming. Beautiful at night. the pollution in the day spoils it, but the night is perfect with all the lights from the buildings. check out the light show at 8pm, though it gets repetitive at points, but better than nothing!

Urban Beauty. The Hong Kong skyline is a must-visit while you are here. Best viewed from the kowloon side (Promenade of stars, Tsim Sha Tsui),there's a nightly light show at 8pm (lasts about 20 minutes) where many of the buildings light up/flash/have lasers along with music - best of all, its free! Note that you have to go about 20-30 minutes early to score a spot at the front (it gets pretty busy). Pick a clear night and bring a good camera as its often hazy.
Night time is the right time. Head over to Kowloon on the Star Ferry around 8pm to watch the light show along Hong Kong's city skyline. Its very touristy but make sure its on your list.

Most impressive and colourful skyline. Hong Kong skyline is stunning especially at night when all the sky scrapers are lit up. The best view is from Kowloon side where one can see beautiful tall buildings of Hong Kong Island, Central, Wan Chai and Causeway Bay. At about 8.15 p.m. every night, there is a laser show but no fireworks. But I did not find it all that great.Star ferry, Avenue of Stars, space museum and lots of other sights can b be enjoyed on Kowloon side and many more on the Hong Kong Island side.Long walks can be enjoyed along the waterfront all along the harbour
Amazing views. Wow... if you plan to travel or visit Hong Kong, I would HIGHLY recommend seeing the Skyline.Amazing and most of all it's free.
Amazing sight. I had forgotten how amazing this skyline is. They also have a laser show every night which is a must

Probably the most spectacular man-made view in the world. It's absolutely stunning when viewed either from the Star Ferry or from the Kowloon side. There is a spectacular laser light show in the evening, but the sight is amazing at any time of the day or night.
Mixture of concrete jungle and glorious earthly peaks. Fantastic skyline, mixing skyscrapers and lush, green peeks along the water. Skyline from Kowloon and Hong Kong are both breathtaking.

City never sleeps. It gives an impression of energy...city never sleeps... though it is crowded.Besides traditional harborside walk at Tsim Sha Tsui, tourists can enjoy fabulous view at newly completed harborsidewalk on Hong Kong Island (from Central Ferry Pier to Wan Chai Exhibition centre)...
Postcard view!. It was a beautiful panoramic view of hong kong skyline with the cooling weather at night. We really liked it and enjoyed sitting there and staring at the 'postcard'.
Excellent View. You can view the skyline from various points, from Victoria peak, from Avenue of Starts etc.. it looks different and beutiful from all the place.

A must see. If your stopping by HK, you have to visit this spot. Touristy area, and its lovely during the night. They have a light show at night, and the sky is lit up anyway with all the sky scrapper lights. Must bring a camera. A bar and a starbucks are located right on the harbor, fun place for both a romantic walk or a family walk..

Star Ferry Ride Across the Harbor to Hong Kong Island is a Must. Required for best view of my favorite city skyline in the world. I never get tired of the sight of Hong Kong's skyline getting closer and closer. At Tsim Tsa Tsui MTR station, walk to the Star Ferry pier. Cheap and economical, and well worth the price and time for the views that it provides.

A skyline to behold. The stunning HK skyline is best appreciated from the Kowloon side - walk along the kowloon peninsula walkway at night and you won't be disappointed! Alternatively, arrange a junk trip up and down victoria harbour for a different and more personal vantage point! The sheer size, density and vertical nature of HK has a different side to it when light up at night

no wonder it's always in the movies!. Hong Kong skyline is amazing!! The blend of colorful neon lights together with the waterfront is a sight not to be missed. No wonder all major movies love to include the skyline in their show!
The peak. Definitely something that has to be done if visiting Hong Kong, we went at sunset and got some amazing photos,

It is one of the wonder of the world in a clear sky. The architecture of Hong Kong is not repeatable. All the different high-rises, different shapes, lighting, looks like a modern mad artists nightmare that you can slowly immerse yourself into and with a good drink in your hand even enjoy.
Magic. The view on Hong Kong is always magic by night. It's the only city I knnow with such a beautiful skyline during the night.

Truly spectacular. We were busy shopping in Mong kok and we left by 7.30pm so that we could arrive at the harbour front before 8pm well in time for the Light show. The moment we came face to face with the skyline .... it was a jaw dropping sight !! Even before we left India we had heard lots about the Hongkong skyline but seeing is believing. Absolutely mind blowing. At the same time I must confess that the light show fell far below expectations. It would be well worth taking a ride on the ferry from where you can enjoy the sights on either side of the water.
Skyline at Night. On the ferry coming back from Macau and then on the bus to Kowloon we were able to witness the beautiful skyline of Hong Kong at night.

You can't see this anywhere else in the world. The sheer number of skyscrapers is amazing, but the interesting architecture, not to mention the decorations of lights, makes this a unique and special sight.

The view is spectacular at night when they have thew laser light show and the Xmas Decorations. There are many restaurants that have windows overlooking the Harbor view. Plan to be there at the table before 8.15pm when the light show starts. If you want to stand at the Harbor edge on the Kowloon side there are many vantage points all along.The Xmas decorations make an even more spectacular view. It is a really gorgeous view that rivals any in the world.

Stunning. One of the most stunning cityscape ever. You can view it either at the Avenue of the stars wherein there is a bonus fireworks display or at the Sky Terrace of The Peak wherein you have the birds eye view.
The best in the world. The lights, music and views of this skyline from the Kowloon side looking over to HK island is the best we have scene in the world.

See the Symphony of Lights. at 8 pm, situate yourself on the Kowloon side, right at the Star Ferry Terminal, for a great show.. the end to a perfect day in Hong Kong! There is a lovely promenade where locals and tourists alike gather at sunset...and then wait for the show. This is just blocks from the Peninsula hotel, and several other nice restaurants, so you can shop, eat, drink in virtually any style you like plus enjoy one of the most brilliant skylines on the planet.

Beautiful!. I visited the harbour after sunset and the view was breathtaking. I watched the Symphony of Lights show (which is held every evening in Kowloon at 8pm). It was very entertaining and beautiful to watch. I couldn't get enough of the beautiful skyline, either from Victoria's Peak, the harbour or the hotel. Well worth a visit!

Must see from Tsim Sha Tsui. Get yourself across to the Avenue of the Stars area at TST and just wonder at the Skyline. Marvellous. As mentioned by others you can also enjoy the Symphony of Lights at 8 in the evening. You need to be in the Avenue of the Stars area to get the commentary and the associated music as, frankly, without these it really isn't overly impressive. Indeed even with these, it's largely just OK. Still a great view though.

Excellent views. Saw the skyline from the top of Victoria Peak during the day and from the harbour area at day and night. I definitely recommend a trip up the Peak, as even though the weather was not great on the day I visited, it provides the best views of the skyline. I visited on a Sunday when the queues for the tram were longest, but the purchase of an open top bus ticket allows you to enter near the front. The laser show at 8 every evening lasts for about 15 minutes and worth seeing if you are in the area.

Fantastic show. Watch the Symphony of Lights show - which is held every evening - from the quay by the Star Ferry pier in Kowloon. It starts at 8:00 pm and lasts for 10 minutes. Get there at the beginnign to watch the buildings be introduced. Very entertaining!
Amazing place. I went there with my family. An amazing place. Spectacular views. I havent seen such views before in my life.

One of great sights in the world. Cannot get enough of the sight from either Victoria peak or from the waterfront or our hotel room.
Laser show at night was worth watching but not as special as enjoying during the day and night from many different vantage points
The place where you can see the HK skyline. Every cities should have it's skyline and in HK this is where u shud go. I went there during daytime n nightime and I experience different views

8 O'clock light show. We always book at table at the Pizza Express in the Ocean Mall looking back on HK Island for the 8:00 pm light show. At Christmas time and Chinese New Year the lights are quite something.
Amazing place. We found this place was so great. Walking around and see the incredible skyline of Hongkong. Enjoy the sunset here was one of the best part in our trip.

The laser show. We were disappointed with our November 2 Saturday evening laser show - admittedly there was a little drizzle around - and some low cloud. The best part though was seeing thousands of others - locals and tourists - pretending to enjoy it.

a glimpse of hong kong. the best place to see the hong kong city at night. watch the symphony of light that will amaze you. from many angle you stand it won't ruin your time because it just perfect. last but sure, you may walk a bit to avenue of stars where you can see all the Chinese actor and actress name on the path. (and only bruce lee and jackie chan all i know) get tired? stop in one of the coffee shop with a scenic view over the hong kong island you'll loving it.
Beautiful!. it is just another big city, but Hongkong knows how to display it's skyline well. with the symphony of light, watch the HK skyline from the ferry or from the west waterfront promenade

A good evening cruise followed by Dinner. We purchased a evening cruise and went around admiring the Hong Kong sky line. There was music on board and some food. But we were supposed to have Dinner at another destination in cluded in the price. The Food at the Dinner was really good.

Best place to view the skyline from. The most beautiful skyline in the world! The best place to view this amazing skyline is from the top of Harbor City Ocean Terminal, just 2 minutes walking from the star ferry. Directions: Enter Harbor City and take the escalator to Level 4. Follow the signs to the parking garage. When inside the parking garage take the stairs one more level, to the highest level. You will now be on top of the Harbor City Ocean Terminal with an amazing view over Hong Kong! If you are a photographer looking for some amazing shots of Hong Kong, this is the place you want to go to.

best seen at night. amazing skyscrapers, beautifully lit with neons, and the amazing sound and light show Symphony Of the Lights, everyday at 8pm. Hongkong island skyline isa best seen from Kowloon, with the best vantage point for the Symphony being at the Avenue of stars in Kowloon, since more buildingd in HK island participate than Kowloon islands, but to get the best glimpse of boht, take a ferry!

"Amazing Skyline". My daughter and I booked a hotel room with a harbour view especially to be able to enjoy a view of the harbour on this our first ever trip to Hong Kong and were not disappointed. The view at night was absolutely amazing and by day almost as stunning! I would recommend to anyone travelling to Hong Kong to book a harbour view room, take a ferry ride on the harbour and watch the Symphony of Lights. Amazing!

Awsome views. Star Ferry then to the 15c bus which takes you to Victoria Peak.Great trail to walk and then the cable car back to the the shopping area and bus back to the Star Ferry. All done with a swipe of the Octopus card
One Of the Best in the World. Don't leave without seeing this amazing skyline at night. Either from Kowloon side or Hong Kong side, you can't go wrong!

Nice Symphony of Lights show. Hong Kong being a harbour city, they have developed the skyline very well. During the day, you can view this skyline from Victoria Peak and if its dark, then may be lights as well. When you take a cruize ride, you get to see the real lights show and the real skyline, which is really very good and pleasant for the eyes.

Stunning skyline -too much to take in on one trip!. It really is an amazing skyline. You find yourself drawn to it all the time-photographing it from every conceivable angle! For our trip it was most beautiful at night due to the mist that ruined it during the day - rather frustrating. It was great walking around the buildings on Hong Kong island and then crossing over to Kowloon on the star ferry followed by a walk on TST promenade.

Stinks!. The skyline was nice, but not very relaxing or enjoyable. The floor was dirty and cockroaches can be seen around. The ocean breeze stinks, we can not stay there to chill and chat. Like others have said, too many high end shops and too many signs.

Best cityscape I have ever seen. i was there from 22 Oct to 2 Nov and did not notice excess pollution. It is an amazing view and I think it is best seen from the star ferry (which is itself a bi of an institution. I try to do that crossing on all my HK visits!

Quite amazing . The Hong Kong skyline is probably one of the finest caricatures of human engineering. Viewing it from the tsim tsa tsui promenade is truly a wonder. Although personally I felt that the Shanghai skyline is much more impressive, thanks to the oriental pearl TV tower. Definitely worth a visit.
World's Best. Nothing compares. Pudong in Shanghai is outstanding, but Hong Kong just has so many more high rises. Also they flow up the mountain. which makes for a stunning view.
Wow. This is one of the most amazing skylines in the world. It gets pretty hazy in the fall and winter, but more clear in the summer.

Lazing in HK. Efficient and cheap public transport system was great.
Too many high end shops, Gucci, LV, etc. with very few customers was a little disappointing.

Second to None. By far one of the most beautiful and recognizable skylines anywhere in the world. My favorite views are from the ferry and the Kowloon side. Daytime and night time views are equally impressive. If you can catch the laser light show, it's a treat as well.

Hong Kong Island Skyline. The view of the Hong Kong Island skyline is absolutely stunning. I was born in Chicago and I get to see the skyscrapers here on a daily basis, but the HK one completely cured my Chicago skyline blues. Both during the day and night the view is a must see. On certain days of the week there is also a laser light show, I didn't get a chance to see it but on my next visit (in 14 days!) I will definitely catch it. Taking the Star Ferry across the Victoria Harbour and absorbing the views all around (while having a beer) is an experience I will forever cherish.

Impressive. On a clear night, the Hong Kong skyline is like nothing I've ever seen before. I've described the city as a real-life 'Jetsons' city (the cartoon from the 70s and 80s), and you get an awesome view of skyline from the promenade. We also crossed the harbour on the Star Ferry at night, and that was impressive as well.

I was amazed at the sight of such a wonderful place. Going to he central by a ferry and that also with family is a reason to be joyed .victoria harbour gives you a beautiful peace of memories of Hk skyline.closeby is the harbour city mall that offers the world of food,fun,brands of different categories like clothline,electronics,games etc. come out to just see the sea waving through ,the ferries,boats and the surrounding images of tall and gorgeous buildings to praise Hk is all about!!

It's an Hong Kong must do. One good time to go, would be just after the simphony of light is over, around 8:30PM. The crowd disperses and all the buildind are still lit. If you got the time, try to get a look at both sky lines...from Hong kong and from Kowloon. And of course, the appeal is to see it after dark.
Amazing view. Amazing view, especially at night. Beautiful, romantic, magnificent. But the symphony of lights was dissapointing. We were expecting more than just lights come from some buildings...

Good day out. We went her for a few hours on our way to the airport and really enjoyed the cable car ride up to the Bhuddist monument. The cable cars give you great views over Hong Kong and the area at the top has plenty of areas to sit and eat or drink. It is a bit busy particularly trying to get back down again but it does get easier if you just watch the queues.

A Hong Kong Must See. Its one of the city's icons. On a beautiful clear sky night its simply irresistible. The place is crowded by mostly tourists, and you have a few artists on the side drawing pictures for people. The buildings light up the sky, and you have a light show once in a while that literally does that and its worth checking out.
Awesome view!. Hong Kong skyline is amazing at night time, beautiful! Recommend going for a drink in the bar on Avenue of the stars and taking it it.
Iconic. I don't know why else u would come to Hong Kong than to see the beautiful skyline. It's magnificent.

Irresistible. Our 21st floor to ceiling window gave us the most amazing view of the entire skyline. In fact it was a real struggle to turn our back and go out for the evening! Unlike other reviewers, we were really disappointed by the 'symphony of lights' show, expecting more than a few strobe lights and some random music which didn't seem to have any connection with what we were looking at. We felt it did nothing to enhance what is already breathtaking. For this view alone we would opt to stay in Kowloon every time.

unique skyline. Nowhere in the world has a skyline like Hong Kong with the silhouette of the Peak in the background, massive skyscrapers jostling for position on the shoreline & the choppy waters of Victoria Harbour in the foreground. The Symphony of Lights at 8pm, when they have a laser show on the building, is well worth seeing from the Promenade.

city with amazing energy. The Hong Kong skyline is really like no other city in the world... the energy from Hong Kong is similar to New York and yes it is one of the most polulated cities in the world but every time I am there and see the skyline day or night time I get a lift. Take the boat trip at night time and see the light show fantastic!!!

One of the most amazing cities in the world. The views of the Hong Kong skyline is like no other city in the world. It may be one of the most populated places in the world but my heart lifts when I see the cityscape. Hong Kong is like my second home.
view from the sky. If you are lucky and have your hotel room on the 107th floor overlooking the harbor, and Hong Kong Island all in front of you, you might not even want to go out for dinner.
seen it, know it!. I have seen many pictures of the Hong Kong Skyline but nothing prepares you for the reality. It was like being in a dream, much of Hong Kong had the same effect on me.
Hong Kong Skyline. Amazing cannot put into words the light show and the skyline so clear and we had a view from our hotel room

Stunning at Night. Hong Kong skyline is absolutely stunning and beautiful but I prefer it at night. The best view is from the Kowloon side - near the star Ferry Terminal [Tsim Sha Tsui - metro stop]You can also walk along the avenue of stars - although for most westerners you will not know most of them. If you see a very big crowd - you know you at the Bruce Lee star!
Spectacular. You have to see it to believe it. Although there's plenty talk of light pollution, the skyline is spectacular at day or night.
Hong Kong at night.. A must see. Also beautiful during during the day on less hazy days. It's a shame how to pollution is impacting a top tourist attraction.

One of the word's great skylines. Hong Kong Island's skyline is absolutely stunning and beautiful ... whether it is during the daytime or at night, when the lights bring it to life. The best place to see the HK Island skyline is from the Kowloon side along the harbour promenade which starts from the Star Ferry Terminal in Tsim Sha Tsui. It is reported that Hong Kong has more buildings over 500 feet (or 150 metres) than any other city in the world. One of the best ways to see both skylines (ie. the Island & Kowloon) and which is inexpensive, is simply to take a ride on the Star Ferry from Central to TST and then TST across to Wan Chai. The Peak also provides great views of both skylines but from a different perspective as you are looking down onto the harbour from a high advantage point.
The night view is my favourite. This is such a great place to take great photos and what not. It is a great picturesque site and has incredible views.
Rad place, dude!. The skyline is sick and alight with positive energy, ya' know? And it is so peaceful watching the skyline is so beautiful.

Truly beautiful. HK' s skyline is truly beautiful. You cannot go to HK and not make an effort to enjoy what it offers. Go and have a drink or dinner at one of the restaurants or hotels that offer a view at night or as others suggest take the tram to the peak or simply travel to and fro on the Star Ferry. The night view is my favourite .

Great skyline. Very nice skyline of both HK and Kowloon. Both the skylines can be viewed from the Peak. The music and light show every evening after sundown may not be great, but pretty enjoyable, specially from the Kowloon side.
Never tire of this city. The harbour at day and night I could sit for hours watching itthe local shopping and food is great also

Best skyline in the world. I think this is an amazing skyline. Shanghai's is pretty good but HK is still the best. Take the ferry across to the island for less than 50 cents USD. At night especially nice
Just like on CNN. Nice walk on the Kowloon side with view of Hong Kong side skyline. Great spots to take photos. Boats and a Chinese junk add spice.
AMAZING. See it in daylight and at night time from land, sea and from any high point you can. It's amazing. However I wouldn't bother with the light show.

Beautiful. I rented an apartment in Causeway Bay with a group of friends.The view we had from this apartment was amazing. We could sit and watch the light show over the harbour every night if we wanted to. The harbour was changing all the time and this made being in the apartment a great choice for us. The Hong Kong skyline was just beautiful, it is a shame about so much smog hanging around.

One of the best skylines in the world!. The Hong Kong skyline is spectacular. You can view it from the Peak, subject to the haze. or best seen from the Kowloon side. Some hotels provide plenty of rooms with great views of the Skyline and harbour.
Great place to relax. Its a great place to sit down, chill out and relax. The building lights were such a pretty sight.Expected much more from the skyline 'performance' though.
You have to do this!. Brilliant! There are queues for tickets if you catch the tram but the view at night is amazing. SO beautiful and well worth the effort. A truly unique HK experience. Do it!

Gorgeous. It doesn't matter if you see the sky show or not, amazing to take in at anytime of the night. We panicked and ended up paying for a very expensive meal to be viewing the skyline for the show and it was defnitely not necessary.

Great views from above and below. The mix of water, high rises and hills is not unique but in Hong Kong it looks different and amazing whether you see it from the Peak, from the water on a Ferry, or strolling along the Harbourfront.
must see. We really enjoy it. Worth a visit for sure. it is so nice with a reasonable price for family. The kids were so excited as we getting up.

Unique. So romantic. Dusk is my favourite time. All this is free - bar your flight, accommodation and food costs! There is an energy in HK which is positive and comfortable without being OTT....but what a carbon footprint.

Hong Kong skyline. The best views of Hong Kong island are available from the area just eastwards of the Kowloon water bus terminal. From here one can view the buildings on Hong Kong island and watch the water traffic which is quite fascinating. Having crossed to Hong Kong island one can gain access to the Peak via No15 bus. From the Peak one has views of the skyscrapers looking down on high.

Never fails to be cool. Just a really cool, interesting view. Dramatic buildings from a great vantage point, really never gets old. As some other reviewers have said, on days when the pollution rolls in or in fog it is a disappointment; on the other hand, on a clear day or especially a clear night, it is spectacular.

Awesome. Even though I lived in Hong Kong for three years, the skyline never lost the awe it inspired every time I took the ferry around the harbour. Everything is so tightly packed in, and even in the three years I was there, the skyline changed immensely. Make sure you take a trip on the ferry at night, when all the buildings are lit up - its a site to behold and if you are there for any of the festivals, new year, etc and get to experience the fireworks, be prepared for how loud it gets with the noise reverberating off fhe buildings. Nothing compares to the Hong Kong skyline.

Day or night. Day or night this is a spectacular sight. From Kowloon (or the Star Ferry) of from victoria peak the array of new and distinctive buildings is really impressive. They really know how to impress.

breathtaking views of skyline. The views are absolutely magical,either daytime or even more so at night, you can walk to your hearts content along the harbour or just sit and take everything in.We have been to Hong Kong a couple of times now and the views from Kowloon side and Hong Kong Island always take your breath away.The skyline is definately not overrated, sometimes you may not be able to see it as clearly as you would like, but it depends on what time of the year your visit is, (weather plays a big part in whether you see or not)

Still great, but pollution means it's better at night. I last came to Hong Kong almost 20 years ago. The skyline is still great, but it's true that pollution now takes its toll. All three days have been hazy - but the effect is less visible at night, so night-time provides the better views in my view.

Best view in the world. Sadly, much more impressive than Manhattan... but great for Hong Kong. Walk along the promenade, enter near the Star Ferry area on the Kowloon side. 8pm nightly laser light show is quite fun, and free.

Fantastic skyline. The skyline of Hong Kong Island is awe-inspiring. Impossibly crowded with towers of concrete and steel, it's hard to believe development could be so dense. And yet its backdrop is lush, green, nearly undeveloped hillside.
great view. lovely view and the tram was good fun but not the most comfortable seats in the world. cafes at the top are plentiful.

Spectacular skyline at night. The Victoria harbor is easily walkable by taking the MTR to Tsim Sha Tsui station. The picturesque skyline is breathtaking, with the skyscrapers’ lighting and boats sailing in the background. There are lots of shops along the streets which offer to take professional photographs at affordable rate with the skyline background.
Air Pollution kills it all. The Hong Kong skyline is overrated. Visibility is poor due to the air pollution. You can see better, clearer and more beautiful skyline in Singapore.
Lovely Skyline. Hong Kong skyline at night is really lovely. A must-see while you're in the city. If not for the crowded promenade, I would have loved to stay there longer and appreciate the view.
light show. Light show on every night at 8pm. Very good to see, Very popular choice with visitors. easy walking distance from Nathan Road
Spectacular. Spectacular in every way, especially when returning from Macau on the ferry. It is difficult to imagine the power that must be generated to light up so many lights.
The main place to be when the sun goes down. A nnight view of the Hong kong skyline cannot be matched. It's the main place you should be when the sun goes down
Skyscapper builder to take note of the green terrace. The Green Terrace on all the skyscrapers is a very good thought. All skyscrapers to take note of this
Lovely. Lovely at night , worth taking a trip down to the promenade in the evening and seeeing it light up ,
Skyline. Make sure you take a good camera. We took an old digi camera and mobile phones are good but not the same.

Hong Kong's must see. It's true that Hong Kong's Skyline is breathtaking, you can compare it to New York. It is a must see in this city, pictures of all skyscrapers seen from the harbour would the best souvenir.

Spectacular view at night. The skyscrapers and hotels of Hong Kong and Kowloon certainly put on a good show at night. The lights look especially good reflected on the water as your cross on the Star Ferry. Very memorable.

don't miss the laser light show in the evening from the kowloon side!. don't miss the laser light show in the evening from the kowloon side! We went between the peninsula hotel and intercontinental to get a great view of the show-it was at about 8:30pm-ask around-all of the buildings are involved and music is synched.

See the Spectacular Skyline!. Our family took the tram to the peak and saw the amazing skyline. Luckily we had great weather and the views were magnificent but I do know that on some days you're lucky to see meters in front of you, let alone the Skyline!
Highly recommended to catch the tram but just make sure you visit on a clear evening
Night Cruise. A highlight of Hong Kong is taking a night cruise around the harbor. The buildings are alive with color and laser shows

View form the peak. A trip to the Peak at night to enjoy the lights of the city below is well worth the trip but try to pick a clear night, the trip up on the cable tram it great too, during the day the view is brilliant
Can't be missed, literally!. Check out the light show, on every evening I believe. The top of the Peninsular for a drink was a pretty cool way to do it!

The Peak at night. A must do. A ferry across to the island and then a bus and you arrive at the peak for wonderful views and a great dinner. A bit expensive but save this night as your special occasion. Don't plan a day just go when the skies are clear and then enjoy. Spectacular.
excellent view. a must view panoramic when you visit Hong Kong! Very beautiful scenery, especially at night. The lights and neon lights from the buildings are spectacular!

Dazzling skyline. I love Hong Kong's skyline. I admire it from Victoria Harbour, when I was taking the ferry from The Central to Tsim Sha Tsui and when I was at the Peak. The bright lights on each and every of the high rise building is a sight to behold.

Hong Kong skyline and more. Hong Kong skyline is amazing. There are other attractions that make it memorable; taking a ride on a cable car to the Big Buddha is also amazing, as is the statue and grounds too. Hong Kong has an energy like New York, vibrant and alive. It's also fun to walk and look at the shops. I didn't do a lot of shopping there, so I can't really say anything about the prices or quality of goods. I was on a strict budget, but it would have been fun to shop!

Only one of its kind. I live on Lantau island in Hong Kong, so whenever I get the time, I take a trip to a site where I can enjoy the skyline, whether it's a Star Ferry crossing, drive to Stanley, going up the Peak or dining at at a restaurant with a view.

Beautiful Skyline from our hotel. If you are looking for a great view every night of Victoria's Harbor stay at the Icon. There is a nightly laser light show which you can download an app on your phone and listen to it while the show is going on.I learned that the last night we were there, it was great!

The Night Sail in Red Flag Boat just awesome to see the Hong Kong Skyline.. The Hong Kong Skyline is definitely among the top that I have ever seen. Especially stunning is the view at nights from the red flag ship. We had a great view of the light show also.

Gorgeous! Incredible views. We thought the light show was a bit average to be honest but seeing the skyline was fab. All the huge buildings - it just went on and on. Great views from the ferry port on Kowloon side.

wow!. View from the peak was wonderful. Also walked for miles all around HK. Took ferry to Discovery Bay, went over to Kowloon and walked around harbour front. Met friends who live there and they love it. All in all a wonderful experience

First HKG trip.. Most memorable thing was riding on top of open deck BigBus tour with tropical warm air in hair watching colourful lights come to life as day turned to night....it was like an endless summer...unfortunately the bus ride stopped at 630pm...at ferry terminal.

night time in Hong kong. The light show is the best you'll ever see anywhere in the world, the clubs are vibrant and lively, the star ferry is a must to go on, all so a trip to the monsoon harbour is an eye opener just brilliantthe prices all over Hong Kong are starting to climb as quick as the tower's, but all in all a well worth place to go and see.
Incredible. Hong Kong has one of the worlds great skylines. Climbing the peaks and looking down it was like looking over a futuristic city. Reminded me of Blade Runner.
Good show. Nice views, light show is good, in different languages on different nights but the language does not really matter. Lots of room so no rush, grab a coffee and enjoy.

A nightly light-show. There is an unmissable free show to be enjoyed on the waterfront of Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong each night; when we were there in March last year it started at 8 p.m. And lasted about 20 minutes.The show included the illumination of the buildings along the Hong Kong Island shore along with music and laser light shows all synchronised and very entertaining.Probably best seen from the Avenue of Stars - highly recommended.

Cant miss activity in HK. I traveled around the world and the skyline for HK is one of the best...not even being biased since I was born there. I actually stay in the victoria harbor vicinity quite often on my business trips and the Sheraton there always put me in a nice skyline view room. The harbor is great for a good run in the morning but it is even more impressive at night when all the building are lid up. For money savers like me, you can take the ferry across the harbor for a very cheap price, but just make sure to do it at night only. An amazing attraction in hong kong and this is the first place i take visitors to when they come visit with me.

How could i have forgotten. So much to see in Hong kong How could I have forgotten the fantastic Skyline Its certainly a must of an evening when they have a light show this is just amazing . The best view is from Kowloon so when In Hong Kong ensure you get over to kowloon for this spectacular show Even during the day the Sky line is just an amazing site with all the sky scrapers cramed into such a small area its just one of the best Skylies you may ever see.
Fab views. What a brilliant night time view from kowloon, although I did not think the laser show was worth the wait
Awesome lights. The skyline is something to see with all the lights of buildings and apartments. Especially the laser show on the Harbour?
Amazing!. Beautiful by day or by night, a definite must-see! Avenue of the stars is a great place to view the skyline, esp at night.

Very nice - especially the light show. Well worth seeing both at day and at night. Sometimes the clouds and fog make it difficult to see.
At night the light show is worth seeing.
Excellent. Hong Kong skyline is something else, it is breathtaking There is a light show every night which is a must to see.We only had a short stay in Hong Kong butI think we made the most of it

Best in the world. Our favorite vantage point is along the avenue of the stars area on the Kowloon side since you can see the whole panorama of Hong Kong's skyline from there. We lived in a highrise right on the water above the Pacific Club for about 6 months, but I can tell you it never gets old. It still takes our breath away when we come into town or bring visitors. The light show every night at 8pm is a must-see. Stake out a spot on the observation deck close to the clock tower (right by the Star Ferry terminal) to hear the music that is synchronized with the light / laser show. It is always a bit crowded (even in the rain!), so for a front row spot, get there at least 15 minutes ahead of time.
Getting boring. A delight at 8pm but needs something new to wow the crowds. The light show is a little boring on return visits. Nearby Macau offers more as a skyline.
A beautiful skyline. The skyline at night was beautiful and breathtaking. Although we did not travel to the summit by tram, seeing the skyline was an impressive sight.

went by the tram. the tram ride was an excellent experience at a 45 degree angle, dont miss the right hand seat while going up...... but reaching to the tram was very confusing....... we missed the easy way to the tram. so, be sure to get a local bus(i dont remember the number) from one of the MRT........

light show to see. Take a boat out in Hong Kong harbour at the time of the light show,(every evening as the sun fades). All the buildings facing the harbour have to treat their facades with light effects. It is spectacular and magical to witness the decline of natural light on the water and in the sky and the simultaneous increase of high tech lighting designs on the buildings of the city. One of the great treats of this city.

A skyline with multiple angles. It is amazing how much I love tall buildings with lots of lights. Watching the skyline of Hong Kong was every night a moment to look forward to. The best thing about the skyline was the fact that you could see it from so many different places, from the Star Ferry, The Peak, a skybar on Hong Kong Island or on the TST side. Take your time and enjoy the view!

One of the best in the world. Nip on the star ferry from Hong Kong to Kowloon for literally less than 20 pence per person. The harbour gives an uninterrupted view back to Hong Kong island and the simply spectacular sky line. A perfect picture opportunity.
Intercontinental Hotel Views Amazing. Views from this hotel is simply Panoramic of the Hong Kong Skyline even from your harbour view room.

Love the lights. The night view from the Kowloon side is just amazing. The boats cruising at night adds to the building æights on Hong Kong side. Was fortunate to have first row seats as we jad a patio room at Hotel Intercontinental (Salisbury)
Best seen from Kowloom. has to be seen to be believed from walkway of the stars. Best seen after dark. No problems with hawkers and area feels very safe

Fantastic at night. Maybe some smog about - but after dark it all seems a bit clearer -.whether watching from avenue of stars or star ferry or from a harbour side hotel bar - you have to watch this at least once!!!!

Very energetic Walk along the harbor n boardwalk. One evening we walked the boardwalk along the harbour across from our hotel. We had not done this in Kowloon before. We were astounded as to the variety of tourist who were there enjoying the view n the stars on the walk like the stars in Hollywood with the hand prints of famous Asian movie stars n more. There were many art exhibits along the way too. You could just sit and enjoy the weather n view if u wished .

Great way to see the Plc, soo much to do in Hongkong. the trip to Kowloon in the Night Ferry was awesome.. Airport Express is a great way to get to & from Airport. Very Cheap & Comfortable & Convenient. Ferry to and from Kowloon is great way to see the night life of nathan street. Love Wanchai District too.

Crowning jewel of HK!. The Good =)~Even more impressive than Singapore's Marina Bay City Skyline!The Bad =(~The nightly AVENUE OF STARS show lasts only 5 minutes :(My Tip for future visits:~Make sure your camera is able to take nice night shots!

Best view of HK on a clear day.. Best view of HK on a clear day. Fantastic level 360 degree walk around the Peak after you have gone by the peak Tram .. I'd go early morning or sunset .. the earlier the better to miss the huge cue to get on tram. best thing to do in HK. Then pop into the cathedral at the bottom near the Peak Tram station for a quiet part of HK while walking back to Central.

Kowloon side is better to enjoy Hong Kong skyline. You can enjoy Hk skyline pretty much anywhere, Hong Kong is an island so if you are in the Kowloon (the mainland side) at Hollywood walk, which is right by the water, I would say this is the best place to snap some shots, at around 8pm, all the buildings in HK have a light symphony and they light up in a rhythm, it's cool to see.
Beautiful Skyline. The night view of the skyline is truly beautiful and calms you down especially with the colourful neon lightings and the ferries. Hong Kong is a beautiful place to go to indeed.
Stunning Skyline. the views of Hong Kong skyline is just breath taking. The buildings are amazing and the lights at night just so wow!!

Loads of bright city lights..... A good skyline is you like man-made structures. There are loads of buildings glittering with lights - but that is about it!
A good place to view the sky line is from Tsim Sha Tsui, Avenue of Stars and Victoria Peak.

Beautiful skyline. The Hong Kong skyline look beautiful, especially looking from the Kowloon side. The light and sound show that began at 8 pm was average, we kind of got bored after awhile. Hong Kong is a very interesting place to visit.

You grasp a "bigger than life" sensation with this marvelous skyline. Certainly an "awing" sensation when you are on the Star Ferry crossing the river from Hong Kong to Tsim Sha Tsui. Beautiful skyscrapers and architecture.

Magnificant. Looking beyond Victoria harbour at Hong Kong Island from Kowloon in the evening has got to be the world’s premier light display. For those photographically minded it is a gold mine, particularly with the mist in the evenings. Plenty of good vantage points by the harbour to take it all in. Just magnificent.

Incredible vista by day or by night. One of the best places to appreciate the fantastic Hong Kong skyline is from neighbouring Kowloon on the other side of Victoria Harbour. A short hop on the Star Ferry from Honk Kong itself will give you a great view. The evening light and sound show, which begins at 8pm, is ok.Good hotels to stay in for the view include the Intercontinental, Peninsular, Sheraton and Hyatt Regency all on Kowloon.From another perspective, Hong Kong itself, you should take a journey to The Peak, and look down on the skyscrapers below and across the harbour to Kowloon itself, which is beginning to boast more than a few skyscrapers of its own these days.I have been to Hong Kong many times and I still am impressed and moved by its skyline every time I return.

Amazing view. The skyline of Hong Kong from Kowloon is amazing. There are very few places in the world where there is an equalled view of a city skyline which dominates the area; the only other is really NYC. Yes like all cities it's busy and the area by the bay to look across at the skyline can be full of tourists but it is a tourist destination. Recommended and worth a walk down to look across. Equally if your staying on Hong Kong islands its worth the ferry across to Kowloon just for the view.

Loved the skyline!. We loved the Hong Kong skyline. We were fortunate enough to have a great view from our hotel room, and we enjoyed a few quiet moments looking at this amazing skyline - both the buildings and the lights.

Laser/light show- what a let down. If you are pressed for time in Hong Kong, do not go out of your way to see this. Yes the buildings light up in synchronisation but its not spectacular, the buildings without the special light show is magnificent, you don't need to wait or sit through the light show. Try and catch it while you are visiting the harbour, don't go to the seating area and watch it - seating is just concrete steps. at the start of the show, people push in front of you, so keep your place. after the show finding public transport close by was a mission- no train stations close by. we ended up cabbing it back to the hotel. Avenue of stars is at the harbour, no point going if you don't know Asian actors/actresses
HK skyline is exciting!. You will be thrilled! But go in a clear weather month, if you can. It has moved up my list for a return/2nd trip very soon, before my China visa expires.

fantastic. A fantastic experience! The longest cable car I've ever driven (and the only). The view breathtaking. It's a pity that far from the city centre, but as you are in Hong Kong you need to see it.

Love the view, esp at night. On a clear night with no fog/haze, the view is spectacular. Relaxes my mind and soul each time im there during non peak season :)
Grab a tripod, a camera, capture the moment and you wont regret

A brilliant free light show each night. We were lucky to have clear weather though you couldn't ever tire of the view regardless of the conditions.
Worth getting onto the upper deck of the prom around 7:45 for a good spot.
overrated. though the skyline was beautiful it was not nearly as extravagant as expected!! Its better after dark.
fantastic. breathtaking. every clear night is like new years eve. don't miss this. one of the highlights of our trip

Animated and colorful. The view is simply magnificient! Animated and colorful, there is even a countdown animation for the light show which usually start at 8pm.If you are happened to beon the ferry, the ferry will stop to give you time to enjoy the view from the middle of the sea.Lpve it, will definitely come back again just for the view.

Don't get tired of looking. This is just amazing. We saw from all angles and sides. From Kowloon side toward Hong Kong Island, then from Hong Kong across to Kowloon and back toward Hong Kong Central. Then from Lantau where you can just glimpse the lights through a gap in the Bay of Silvermine. Never got sick of it.You have to see they symphony of lights.
Hong Kong skyline. Simply amazing! Might be better tan San Francisco . Very colorful and animated. What else is there to say seeing is believing. And I LOVE San Francisco!!!!!

Boy this has changed dramatically in 12 years. When we visited Hong Kong some 12 years ago the skyline wasn't full of so many buildings. I not sure if I like it as it will become even congested in the next 12 years or so. The only thing good about the skyline is at night the colours are fantastic.
WOW. Talk the tram up to the view point which offers spectacular view of Hong Kong. You need to ensure that it is a clear day, if not the clouds will block out all visibility.

light show. great show of light and sound
its amazing modern technology and a landmark destination for all visitors to hong kong
too short though

Excellent View, A must watch. Its really a must watch. excellent view. Fresh strong breeze across the walk with excellent lighting. Looks very amazing. One can spend easily hours there with lighted/decorated boats passing and some times even cruise liners.

Great views, but go on a clear day. We had great weather so had superb views. We decided not to book in advance (so waiting to see what the weather was like) so were apprehensive about potential queues. We went late morning and didn't have to queue at all. Well worth a visit when in HK.

beautiful. I've been to many cities around the world and I still think this is the most beautiful skyline you'll see anywhere. A visit to the harbor at Tsim Sha Tsui is a must for any travelers to Hong Kong.
Great Site. You have to take a ferry around victoria Lake to see both sets of skyline that of Hong Kong Island and Kowoloon. Beautiful

Taste of Hong Kong.... First day went to have breakfast at a shopping Mall cafe ..a English Breakfast ....very tastey..in the IFC Mall. Then I went to see Kowloon because I used to live on Kowloon Peak in 1954...wow how it had changed in my day there was only one tall building Peninsula Hotel. Taxi driver who ripped me off my Hotel had told him to take me to Hong Kong Station but instead he was speeding to the Airport. I told him stop turn round but he charged me for his mistake and demanded 250 dollars and I was furious and said heres 160 dollars. And jumped out of taxi very tempted to report him to the police. My fair usually cost 20 dollars so please make sure before taking a taxi that you tell them where you are going..

skyline 100. 4th tallest building and the panoramic view is amazing. When in Hong Kong must go see. You see the old airport, There are load of buiding works going on around the tower so you do think when walking ther that you are going the wrong way but keep going the cost of going in was about $100 HKD but well worth it

Best view at night from Harbour cruise. One of the many great attractions in Hong Kong. I felt the light show was rather ordinary. Maybe because of the misty warm conditions. For my first trip to Honk Kong, I did the Red Bus tour on all 3 circiuts as an orientation/exploration of all attractions. I recommend this and then, depending on your length of stay, you can go see specific attractions.I also thoroughly recommend the cable tram to the peak.Stanley Markets was an interesting attraction.
take the skyline by night on the star ferry. Its like being pushed back in the 60ies where the ferry were built under the konlonial times - really great
A must do...see it by day and by night.... Dramatic and Stunning, particularly at night...give the light show a miss though, somehow took away from the amazing view in itself.
Inspiring skyline at all times of day. A vibrant city skyline which never sleeps. Always something interesting to see, the locals are most welcoming.

Didn't Feel Like Leaving. Known one of the top skyline view of the world, certainly live up to it.
Sitting over the railings, enjoying the sight & capturing every frame with my eyes. Just beautiful..

Stunning!. We were lucky traveling HK while the weather is super fine and the famous HK skyline at night is simply as gorgeous as what we saw in a postcard! Highly recommend to find a nice seat at the Harbour Arcade to enjoy such unique city scene with a lovely drink.
World's best skyline!. Simply impressive. Try to be there at 20:00 to enjoy the simphony of lights' show! Try to avoid weekends if you would like to avoid crowds.
The most beautiful place in the world!. It's so beautiful. It's massive, and so hard to capture in pictures! Great contrast of countryside and skycrapers. so perfect out there.
Nice Lights. Went to watch the light show. Nice to see all the buildings lit up, would have been better on a very clear night but still enjoyed.

Nothing beats nature. Everyone talks about the HK skyline but for me the most attractive part of HK were the hikes in the country. Having said that you would not wish to miss sunset and then the light show at 8 o'clock. My son made sure we didn't and took us to a couple of expensive rooftop bars to take in both. What we didn't do and should have was take the ferry across and get the full view from the other side.

Hong Kong Skyline. Just a quick tip for you.If you are staying in Hong Kong and you want a great view of the harbour. Stay on Kowloon side or take a ferry across.You can go to hotel Nikko which has an amazing sky bar and enjoy a nice drink overlooking the bay.The star ferry is only ten minutes walk from the hotel if you are staying on Hong Kong island and wish to get back.Also you can walk from the hotel and on the front keep going right to see the walk of fame with famous Bruce Lee bronze and other famous people's star in the walk way.Enjoy
Simply great. It can be seen from different part of the city, from Avenue of Stars or Victoria Peak... It is wonderful at any time of the day! Worth seeing.

Wouldn't call it breathtaking..... Have sometime in between of connecting flights? yea, you can come and watch the ''famed'' hong kong skyline.
Nothing otherworldly, but have time to spend can definitely stop by here.

Aussie tripper. It has earned every accolade. At 8pm every night the buildings light up even more and put on a spectacular light show. The only downside was the pollution haze that was present from time to time usually late in the day

brilliant. we came all the way to see the skyline.. what a skyline.. it hits right out side airport.. lovely order.. and lovely bridges.. and the competitive designs.. it;s an amazing experience to walk along the buildings.. admire the heights.. will go back again..
breathtaking. you should not miss an opportunity to get a view of the skyline from Victoria Peak - who would think that Hongkong is full of green.
