Amazing View - Thats Hong Kong.... Impressive & fantastic view by both day & night. We view it from star ferry, enjoy the skyline for both Kowloon & Hong Kong Island. Lot of photo opportunity, the red colour Aqua Luna junk with HK skyline as the background, colour star ferry crossing harbour....AMAZING!!!

On a clear day you could see forever. Visited Victoria Peak (on the steep peak tram) and the views were fantastic also went to Sky100 in the ICC building and the viewing floor was on L100 and i'm told that on a smog free day you could see the chinese mainland
Laser Show. This show every night at 8 pm is worth watching. Just to sit by the waters edge and watch the lights is an experience not to be missed
A 180° view doesn't offer enough.. Whether seeing it from the avenue of stars or from the peak, this city is truly breathtaking. Makes you know that it is a city to compete against all others.

Amazing Scenery. Attended Hong Kong in August with 4 others, and took the opportunity to view Hong Kong Island's skyline at both day and night. The night was particularly spectacular viewing with the majority of the island's skyline illuminated the evening skies. It was marvellous viewing and an opportunity that should not be missed.

Make sure you see the light show. In the evenings there is a light show on one side of the harbor, if they still do it. This was back in 2006. Regardless, the skyline is amazing. It's one of the busiest waterways in the world.
Go to ICC Tower. To see light show and skyline - can take it in from the highest bar in the world at the 4 seasons. great photo op

Stunning at night!. This may have been a highlight of my trip to Hong Kong. Riding back and forth on the Star Ferry and taking in the skyline on both sides was impressive. At night this skyline really comes alive with colour! Don't miss it!! There are lots of places to stand and watch along the promenade. It really is stunning.
must see. Awesome place to visit at once. Moreover, the scenic view is just amazing, went with my family. Its a must watch especially at late evenings to admire the beauty of the place.
typical global city. Awesome by nightfall ! wish we had more time and less crowd on the cruise to actually enjoy the skyline !!

among top 3 in the world. magic city, if you can appreciate the cultural crossing which interminably from 150 years is going on here. The skyline, changing every year, is now among top in the world, after Florence and Sydney. Whether you're on Kowloon side or on the island, it's breathtaking especially at night. make sure you find yourselves on a Ferry boat aroun 8pm every night, and you'll appreciate the Light' show among the skyscrapers !

Nice place to see the Hong Kong Island Skyline. Went here to see the views, it wa a nice place, the area was very large and the views were spectacular. I went there to view the light show, but its not as fun as watching the light show as on hollywood avenue. It lacked the atmosphere and the funny music that you get on the avenue. But if you want a place to view Hong Kongs Skyline, then there is no better place.

One of the best views in the world - and always will be. Just stunning. This view - particularly from Kowloon side looking out to HK Island never fails to impress, day or night, sun or rain. The changing landscape in HK makes the view even better every time you go back. Having been lucky enough to grow up in HK back in the 70's, 80's and 90's, I've seen the view once or twice and yes the view is a little different now, with a "few" more very very very tall buildings.A trip to HK has to be on the top of most people's travel lists and when you go, do not miss on the views!

my favourite ever. It was love at first sight and my love affair with the HK skyline continues. When I leave I say 'see you soon' as I know I will be longing to return again soon. Its warm, vibrant and familiar. Go see the Light show by all means, but check as it stops nearer christmas.

A must see if in Hong Kong.. With one of the midt etunning skylines in the world it goes without saying that you must see this man made spectacle whilst in Hong Kong. Go up the peak in the peak tram or watch the light show from the Kowloon side of the harbour.

WOW I have to see this again in my lifetime!. I love to travel to different places but this is one place i must come to again. this Skyline is truly incredible. you must view it from all angles and at different times of the day and night to really appreciate it. it is like nothing else. view it from the shore and from one of the ferry boats crossing the harbour. view it early in the morning when all is relatively quiet, in the middle of the day when it is crowded around you as you look across the water and especially view this stunning skyline during the evening when all the buildings are lit up and all the lights are reflected in the water. the laser show is also worth seeing, although i did find it rather disappointing so don't expect too much from that. if you are not even planning to go to Hong Kong it is worth going just to experience this!
Not to be missed. Grab a camera and a take out coffee and head for the shoreline where the evening lights will dazzle. You know you are in Hong Kong when you see the skyline.
Beautiful Skyline. Great show, cheesy music, although I did expect it to be better, however it was free so can't complain.

Symphony of Light. No one should miss the Symphony Of Light in the evening,
it gives a spectacular view of the Hong Kong skyline

Tony's Hong Kong.. I crammed 3 days of Fun the Best I could. Went on 2 of the Day trips the Hotel offered. Worth every cent!! Picked up at Hotel and Basically was chauffered around the city and showed the wonders of Hong Kong.

A Wonder of Modern Times!. Even if you are a traveler who have seen the World and not impressed by much. Hong Kong Skyline is a wonder of the modern times. Out of necessity, Hong Kong has to rely on Sky-scrappers because of its shortage in inhabitable lands, and having thousands of them stacked in relatively small area, coupled with a beautiful harbor that separates Hong Kong Island from Kowloon Peninsula, resulted in an amazing view from either side. If you take the cable-car up to Victoria Peak on Hong Kong Island, the beauty is ever magnified. It's something everyone should experience even for once in one's lifetime.
Enjoy some coffee while at it!. there is a starbucks conveniently located at the harbor, a good spot to start off the day in the city before site seeing and shopping!

Skyscraper city. This is a view not to be seen. So many skyscrapers competing for the little space on the island. It's almost hard to believe. Go 1 hr before sunset to get a decent viewing point. The light is best just after the sun goes down. The light show is all of 10mins and does nothing to enhance the incredible scene.

Go at night. The Hong Kong Skyline is impressive enough during the day but it really comes alive at night. At 8 pm there is a laser light and sound show which has a wow factor. Get there around 7.30 to ensure a good viewing spot. 40 odd buildings take part in this extravaganza and it will only take 15 minutes of your time. Worth it!

Bring a camera... its amazing!!. I have lived in Japan for nearly 6 years and this is the most amazing modern industrial skyline I have ever had the pleasure of seeing. It seems that every building it a minimum or 60 stories. If you had to guess what a real life skyline scene from the film "Metropolis" looks like.. Hong Kong delivers. All you will want to do is take pictures and try to stop saying "wow".

best skyline I've seen so far. When you get out of the subway station in Kowloon (Tim sha tsui) you don't see the skyline of Hong Kong island because of the other buildings. That's actually very nice because when you turn around the corner you suddenly see the entire skyline which is absolutely amazing. Go at night (the first time), you'll be more impressed! All skyscrapers have colorful bright lights. Don't expect too much from the Symphony of lights (around 8 pm) though. It's nice but by far not as impressive as the view of the skyline itself.

Eye catching. The night show of lights on the Barbour very good we stood on Kowloon side and got good view , but have to get there early. Out of 5 days we only got 3 clear days of viewing but was still good
Like nothing you've ever seen. Hong Kong is unlike any city I've ever been too. The skyline is amazing. Go down to the harbour, have dinner & wait for the light to kick in. Simply spectacular!!
Amazing views!. Hong Kong is a spectacularly scenic city which is sure to provide you with stunning views from most viewpoints.

Beautiful!!. The Hong Kong skyline is spectacular. The harbour cruise ride is a must in hong hong. The light and sound show too must not be missed. It's fascinating seeing such a well coordinated show (coordination of the different buildings during the show)

City of Skyscrapers. I was blown away by the beauty of the Hong Kong skyline and I don't impress easily. Because it is a city of skyscrapers, this is definite eye candy. I also happened to arrive on the first day of the Chinese New Year so the skyline served as a backdrop for magnificent fireworks. However, even during the daytime without the festivities, the skyline is amazing and memorable.

It was spectacular!. We went there this June and as a matter of fact, the weather wasn't appropriate because it rained mostly. This however did not stop us from witnessing the music and light show they refer to as Symphony of Lights. It was very lively and enjoyable as streaks of light went hight up in the sky and some reached and beamed right on the clouds. Its one of the best places for night photography of skyline and cityscape.
city of beautiful lights. amazing! this city is truly beautiful beyond my expectations. Not to be missed if traveling in Asia.

Hong Kong Skyline. mind blowimg skyline on both sides,particularly at night time,its really an eye feast.sailing in a cruise and watching the illuminant buildings on either side is a memorable experience..

Nice little walk. It was a hike up the back hills to the top of the mountain. I ended up at the park near a mall on the top of the mountain, and there was a walkway where you could see much of Kowloon, and much of the city side of Hong Kong Island. very pretty.
V Nice. Must see once in life time. I have been to many places but still consideredthis the best in the world.
Beautiful!. Loved the laser light show at night . We watched it from a restaurant where you could even hear the music. Very cool!

Beautiful and colorful Hong Kong skyline. Upon arrival in Hong Kong in the evening of our first night, we were able to watch the light show from our hotel room overlooking Kowloon. The next night we traveled via Star Ferry to the Kowloon side to see and hear the beautiful light and sound show that entertains and enthralls visitors each night. And what a beautiful and colorful show it is. The pictures we took were amazing and are an amazing reminder of our visit to this exciting city.

Amazing Skylines with wonderful views from both Kowloon and Hong Kong. Amazing skyline views from either side i.e. Kowloon Tshim Tsa Sui promenade or from Hong Kong Island (best views from Golden Bahunia)
Must visit at night time. Spend nearly an hour visited in daylight and also at night time. Good location for photography.There is a light show which happens every night at 8pm.
Worth a nice hotel. There's nothing like waking up in Hong Kong on an upper floor of a hotel with a view of the harbor. Try to get a room with a view if you can.

Amazing skyline of the city but don't bother with the light show. I went to the pier by harbour city to see the skyline. The view was absolutely breathtaking. Most people were there waiting for the light show that comes on every night at 8pm, so it was busy. However, after 5min of the show, we didn't really knew if that was a show or its not started yet. So my tip will be to go after the show perhaps when the crowd has dispersed so you can take a better picture. But definitely worth a visit,

One of the best views in the world. Looking down from the peak is one of those views that will take your breath away. The best time to go is just before dusk and stay until dark because at night it is even more stunning. The best way up is via the tram but the queues can be long, a taxi alternative is not too expensive though especially if there is 3 or 4 of you, but do the tram if you can it's a real experience. The second best skyline view is towards HK Island from the harbour side near the Intercontinental hotel. If money is not an issue have a drink or burger in the Intercontinental bar and watch the light show at 8pm every night.

Symphony of lights. Let's be honest. The light show does not amount to much. But who needs it? The Hong Kong skyline is spectacular without the lazers or clunky music. Awesome. If this is your first time in Hong Kong it's one of those things to add to the top of the hit-list.

Victory Peak and Victoria Harbour. By day the best view is the stroll around Victoria Peak so you get to see the entire city/island view. It's free. Don't bother to wait in line to take the tram, catch a cab and your at the top for the price of the tram. Spend your time walking the paved path rather than waiting in line for hours. Once on the Peak walk around, don't forget to look up at the vegetation, you might catch sight of one of the giant leggy spiders. Check out the vegetation: giant India Rubber Trees and more! The free walk gives the best view of Hong Kong. I don't recommend going up on the roof top of the man made building to see the city; you have to pay once you get to the fourth esculator and you get the same view as the free walk. At night, go to the Kowloon side of Hong Kong and go to the walk of Stars: find Bruce Lee and Charlie Chan and then at 8 and 9 pm, watch the symphony of lights for which the Chinese spend so much on creating a great light show. I don't think it's as great as the harbour lights - the Bund in Shainghai but it is beautiful... don't miss it. After the light show, walk to the harbour and take the ferry back to HK island. It's all just for the cost of your metro or ferry ride. It's a great deal and one of the sites for which HK is most famous.
Amazing from so many places!. - the ferry, the peak view point, the revolving restaurant - view 62, the rooms in the Exelsior hotel The architecture and the lights are amazing

Must see is the Symphony of Lights. Truly of the best skyline in the world. To better appreciate it, go to the Avenue of Stars at Tsim Sha Tsui to watch the Synphony of Lights every Mon., Wed. & Fri. at 8pm.
Stuff of Dreams. Go there for the evening laser light show. Something not to be missed. Take the star ferry there and back and if you are lucky you will catch it in transit

Victoria Peak. Views across bay from Victoria Peak towards Kowloon are fantastic, but go on a warm day as it can be very cold and windy at the top. If the weather is not good the view from the seating area near the Star Ferry terminal Kowloon side towards Hong Kong island worth a look.
Gorgeous. The Hong Kong skyline is simply amazing with buildings electric in lights, conveying the energy of this marvelous part of the world.

travel on the Star Ferry for the full panorama. After 40 years of travelling the world, from the days of needing to watch every penny to now being able five star accommodation, to travel the few minutes across the harbour on the Star Ferry from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon) and/or return remains one of the wonders and delights of travel.

Breath taking. Being able to see the skyline of Hong Kong is one of the best experiences of my life. Having lived there for 13 years, I only managed to see it a few times as I lived far away from the city. Many people say it is ideal to catch it at night when all the lights are on and the laser show starts. The best time is during Chinese New Year or Christmas when the buildings have additional lights in celebration for festivities. Take a Star Ferry during the day (when its not smoggy) and take photos. Hong Kong is wonderful place to stay, the skyline is by far one of the worlds best attractions.
light show. nice skyline in day and night, not too impressed with the lightshow, long wait for not much really. seen better.

Not too clear after the typhoon!. We just so happened to be in Hong Kong for the week over Utor passing, and if anything it added to the experience! Anyway, the skyline wasn't quite as visible as we'd have liked but it was still impressive, I'd recommend getting the small public light bus up from the pier to the top for something different to the town - really get an idea of just how hilly and amazing the area is with buildings on every bit of semi useable land.

Symphony of Lights. The Symphony of Lights is the “World’s Largest Permanent Light and Sound Show” by Guinness World Records, has been further expanded to include more than 40 buildings on both sides of Victoria Harbour.A stunning, unforgettable spectacle synchronised to music and narration that celebrates the energy, spirit and diversity of Hong Kong.Every night starting 8pm

Incredible. Will have to agree with the majority of reviews on here. The skyline in amazing and just writing the review take me back to memories of the Chinese boats, the lightshow and the sights and sounds on our journey from Wan Chi down to the harbour. Well worth a visit.
Light Show at 8 not worth it.. Skyline is beautiful. Specially at night time. Go to Victoria peak and sea it too. I was not a big fan of the 8 o clock show from the harbor.

A view to never forget. The Hong Kong Skyline is amazing and definitely the first thing you want to see in Hong Kong.
This is an great view if you see it night or day.

Fantastic! The chineese boats, and the gigantic screens on the buildings are a great contrat and a unique view.. You must be very careful while admiring the skyline, I recommend that you do it from a hotel or restaurant, or simply take the Star ferry for a splendid view of the harbor. It really is fantastic!

You'll never forget. A special view - the place where you can really see & feel how fascinating and powerful when two cultures, East & West meets... the vibrant, but still majestic city, where millions of people and billions of dollars are in constant interaction.

Too long queue. The queue was very long. However, it was not too crowded to take a photos when reached the top.
Have to spare time at least 2 hours for it. I am not the person who fascinate the skyline view much so I would say that you may consider going only if you have time.

Brilliant. Go over to Kowloon, but avoid the crowds at eight in the evening. It is the famous light show which attracts so many people. The light show is really nothing - there is enough lights anyway... - it s stunning in the evening.

No question: This IS the draw of HK. There is a night show of lights that best watched from a hotel room if you have a view. The morning and afternoon views cast interesting lights on the plethora of buildings on Hong Kong Island. View from the Intercontinental Hotel is uncompromising, but rear views from Victoria's Peak may be more complete. Worth the visit.

jackie chan. I loved this place as I got see the hand print of Jackie chan and also clicked a lot of pictures .this is the place you should go if toyou are planning to click some great pictures with your family.
GREAT TIME. we had really enjoy it great skyline amazing lighting but if you really wanna enjoy it you must be there before 7:00 PM to stay in the front and you can watch all the towers lighting show
Engineers/Architect heaven. Beautiful skylines, need to get find a good spot though. Normally places like the peak or at the avenue of stars is a good location to see the skyline.

Great Skyline. We have been in the evening at the TST Promenade and it was great. If the weather allows it, you have a great view ! I would try to come at 7pm or at 8.30pm - 9pm. At 8pm there is the Light show which is not great at all and the whole promenade is swarmed by tourists.So for Fotos try to avoid the 8pm show.
Sparkles at night. Bright lights from tall buildings best seen from the Star Ferry from Kowloon to Hong Kong. It's quite spectacular and not to be missed.

Hong Kong Skyline - It never grows old!. Walking along the TST Promenade recently, like we've done hundreds of times before, we had to just stop and admire the Hong Kong Skyline. It is magnificent, set behind the lovely Victoria Harbour and and in front the sloping peaks of Hong Kong Island. When sky conditions are favourable, this is truly one of the finest skylines in the world. The Hong Kong Skyline represents the impressive collection of giant skyscrapers on Hong Kong Island, which are best seen across the harbour in Kowloon. There are spectacular views from quite a few restaurants and bars in the area but there is no place we enjoy admiring the skyline more than ground level directly on the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade and there are three times of the day to enjoy being on the TST Promenade to catch views of the Hong Kong Skyline. First thing in the morning, before the crowds arrive, you can have the entire waterfront to yourself. This is a peaceful time and the best chance you will have for uninterrupted photographs of the Hong Kong Skyline as well as the famous Bruce Lee Statue and other interesting things to see on the Avenue of Stars section of the TST Promenade. As the sun begins to rise, the sky bleaches out and the nicer views are lost until mid-afternoon. Unfortunately, about this time, the crowds begin to descend upon the promenade area and they pretty much stay for the remainder of the day. Depending on the time of year and the weather conditions, at some point in the mid-afternoon, the sun will begin to recline towards the west which can have the affect of making fine shooting conditions of the skyline from the Avenue of Stars area. At this time of the day, the sun is at your back, adding nice light to the island peaks, Skyline and harbour. If the sky conditions are favorable, you can also benefit from deep blue skies as well. This is when you can get those optimal daytime photographs of the skyline. Unfortunately, crowds remain heavy during this time period and if the air quality or weather is poor, the skyline views can be disappointing at this time of day so we usually take a pass and wait until after dark to visit instead. Finally, night visits to the promenade are always recommendable. Regardless of the air quality, being on the promenade after dark provides you the opportunity to see all of the entire Hong Kong Skyline fully lit, illuminating Victoria Harbour. While the crowds are quite heavy, particularly around 8pm when the Symphony of lights show begins, you can usually find a nice spot to set-up a tripod and take pictures of the Skyline. And, when we have good air quality, night views of the skyline can be breathtaking, making a memorable experience for visitors to Hong Kong. As such, we almost always tell our guests to watch the air quality in the morning and if it looks very good, to rearrange some of their activities so that they can visit the TST Promenade and Avenue of Stars during the afternoon and night to catch the Hong Kong Skyline at its very best. In the end, only Manhattan Island in New York City compares in beauty, scale and magnificence to the Hong Kong Skyline, a place that is a real source of pride for our city.

Beautiful skyline with a good music and light show every night. Hong Kong has a beautiful skyline during the day. It gets even better at night when they have a music and light show with many prominent buildings along the shore co-ordinating the lighting to put out a superlative music and light show - the only one of its kind I have seen. Definitely worth seeing.

Surreal. I stayed at the TST promenade from 6 pm to 9. Watched the sun go down and lights come on. The Hong Kong skyline is surreal. It is almost unlikely. The mountains are right behind the skyline. If you imagined such a skyline, you wouldn't expect the skyline to be right behind. Then, if you imagined the mountains, you wouldn't expect the skyline right in front of it. That's what makes it surreal and worth watching. Go on a clear day and watch the "Symphony of lights" at 8 pm. The Starbucks rooftop on TST promenade also provides an excellent quiet view of the skyline

Incredible city view. looking at the Hong Kong Skyline is always amazing. Even that you are taking a Star Ferry, or looking from the Victoria peak, or strolling along the Avenue of the Stars. Even if it is day or night, Hong Kong skyline is always giving you its best!

Breathtaking everytime. One of the must see things ever on planet Earth. I lived in NYC and HK skyline beats NYC's in terms of beauty. It takes my breath away every time, world's #1 skyline.tip: #1 there has been pollution in recent years due to HK being a over populated city, going in the winter to view the skyline ensure a bit less smoggy view = white clouds + blue sky.#2 there is a light show from 8:00 PM to 8:15 PM every night. during holidays it's even better.#3 Victoria Harbor offers the best views.

see it all the time in movies, but you have to be there to see it. best place for a free photo op: Kowloon Tsi m Sha Tsui (TST) Promenade, with the whole Victoria habour and the famous skyline behind you. Best place to see it from the top: Sky 100 in the ICC building on Kowloon side. You see the Hong Kong harbour, 360 degree of the whole Kowloon. I rank it as better than the victoria PeakMost entertaining with Tram Ride: Victoria Peak. The pro is that you can take a tram ride which is fun by itself. The con is that you are looking at the skyline from the back side of the harbour.

The changing colour of the city. The real time to visit the Skyline is in the night., Trust me in the morning it does not provide anything great to the eyes. However as the day approaches to dusk and the city gets ready to display its real beauty. The best place to catch the skyline is from the Victoria Peak as you would get a complete view of the skyline. Also you can check the complete Symphony of light. You can also check it out from the Ferry where the Skyline looks much better but you can only view the Symphony of light from 1 side of the boat

Night cruise is a good way. Food good, photography aspect good, floor show mediocre. pick up time was a little askew but get there early. No taxis when you return you have to walk up to the main road to flag one down

One of the most beautiful and best cities and skylines. The skyline is beautiful day or night and rain or shine. It is great if you are up at the peak and also from a hotel or one of the many restaurants with great views. It's hard not to see the skyline with such a diverse and amazing city.
skyline at the harbour. a lot of activities at sea, combined with great buildings at the skyline. Take a seat, a coffee and your camera and you'll be busy for hours!
hk. Great go at 5 wen turns to dark the rain , lol hk was good saw lots o good things it is expensive so b ready
Seen better. Light shows not much and both shanghai and Singapore have similar skyline (plus NY). Saw Kowloon from Hong Kong island and went across on star ferries to look the other way.

spectacular view and very refreshing. This is one place you must see when you are in hong kong. For the avenue of starts, the skyscrapers looks amazing. the cold winds and calm waters relaxes you.a walk or just few minutes around the place with leave you refreshed after a tiring day.
Increadible. I am not sure if it was nicest during day or night time. The best view is from Victoria Peak which we visited twice. The tram is a great alternative to get there.

One of the worlds most beautiful skylines and waterway. Hong Kong has beautiful buildings and a great location
The skyline is an attraction in itself
Recommended
Love it, love it. Must be seen! Soak up the experience of a magnificent cityscape/ skyline not seen anywhere else in the world!

Famous and beautiful night view. The Hong Kong Skyline is famous for its beautiful night view. Choose a clear night to go up The Peak or have a drink at a bar or restaurant on one of the sky scrapers on both sides of the Victoria Harbour, to savor the fascinating night view of Hong Kong.

Skyline is great, light show a bit overrated. Find yourself a nice bar Kowloon side and go for drinks before dinner and watch the light show. It's not worth making it a main event of the evening, but it's a nice back drop to drinks

great place to see. Hong kong is a great place to visit you should stay at least 1 week to see most of the attractions
Don't miss the light show starting at 20:00

very beautiful but didnt leave me speechless. It was a beautiful skyline. The crowds are crazy during peak times, so try to go in the morning or a bit after the light show is over and people have had a chance to clear out.

Hong Kong festival of light. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful at best and even more so in the evening. The festival of light was a bit of an anti-climax. We were expected to be blown away by the music, but it was a little boring and only some of the scrapers added additional lights to the already lit up building. One can take a cruise on the Star Ferry for HK$150, but then you have to book well in advance. And i'm not sure it's worth that as the display only lasts for around 10 minutes. Rather arrive at the ferry terminal in good time, secure yourself a good spot (it's a big area) and watch it from on shore. The ultimate would be to watch it from Victoria Peak
awesome night view.. the night view of HK skyline is simply awesome. Strolling around the TST area is also a great. Finding food is also not too hard.

Beautiful!. We went up to the peak to see the light show. We did not pay to go to the observation tower, instead took the free elevator at the Peak. Granted there were more people but no need to pay. From where we were did not hear the music, but were able to see the lights. It was the most amazing skyline I have ever seen! No need for music. A must see for sure. If you are taking the cable car make sure to give yourself plenty of time, it gets really crowded. After the show there are long lines for taxis and buses but they move smoothly.

use the bus guys ..... we went there on our arrival hoping to take the tram but were welcomed by a 3 hour waiting sign and quietly decided to come back later .... on further investigation it seems that the best time is to go early morning by 7 when the service starts to miss the crowd... but we decided to take advice from other travelers and took a bus in the evening, which was a equally good ride to the top.... so do go there but dont waste your time and energy if there are long waiting hours....

Nice (likely the best thing to see). Nice, very nice, from both sides.You can appreciate at the best as background for a romantic dinner (Hutong, Cafe Gray or choose the place according to your feeling and pocket)Lights in the night chaotic as the rest of the place.I would not recommend the lights show in the evening that a mix of boring musing and some lights shot here and there, lost in the overall skyline

So great!. I've seen a lot of skylines. Hong Kong is up there with the best. I stayed for the lazer / light show (symphony of lights) and it was OK, not really worth the wait. The skyline in the day and at night was wonderful.

bright nights. the sky is lit up every single night with a show which is the biggest light show in the world, it brings crowds together to see one of the most extraordinary built skylines in the world
Blew my mind away!. Although its one of those things where you look at it and then your like "ok" it was still amazing. The view was terrific and it is a great photo opportunity.

Stunning view ~ no need to wait for the light show. From Kowloon's side (the Tsim Sha Tsuim Promenade) the Hong Kong skyline is a beautiful sight. It is perfect for romantic walks or just walking along the harbour while sipping on coffee.
(The light show, however, is worth a skip.)

Inspiring. Very impressive, with a number of ways to enjoy it. From the first time I saw it from by the Star Ferry, couldn't get enough views. The viewing platform, next to the Ferry Terminus is a great vantage point. In the evening, the light show starts around 8pm, but it gets very crowded. During the daytime, I managed to get some iconic images of the Star Ferry in the foreground, and the Red Sailed Junk with the Skyline behind. Another interesting view is from the Ferry returning to Hong Kong from a trip to Macau. Another good view is from the Peak, both day and night time.
Romance at the Skyline!. I loved it and had the best time with my loved ones! Highly recommend this and other attractions in Hong Kong!
Fabulous view, unexciting displays. The view is superb and well worth the visit. Tithe efforts to make more of an attraction of it were less impressive.

world class city..100 story buildings & lots more. It's amazing and changing daily as construction continues nonstop. What was big 5 years ago is dwarfed by NEW buildings springing up at a dizzying pace. world class city is home to 7+ million and HUGE #'s of visitors continue to pile in. enjoy from a night time perspective to get the FULL effect.

Best skyline in the world. It does not really matter where you view Victoria Harbour from this has got to be the best skyline in the world. For most people that will be from Victoria Peak, but there are many alternatives. From on high, the Ozone Bar in the Ritz Carlton and any of the bars/restaurants in The One building (100 Nathan Road) give a perspective of the island itself. From low the Star Ferry must rank as the best value for money (HKD2.5/3.4 at weekends) in the world. Also a walk along the Avenue of Stars in Tsim Sha Tsui is a very pleasant stroll on a nice day. Still finding different ways and places giving an alternative perspective of the skyline which is ever changing and has two of the top ten highest buildings in the world. Love it !!

Dancing lights. Take my brother, his gf and friends to come here, take photos and watch the symphoni of light.. Rain fall down at the time when the show about to start. Still lot of people stay to enjoy the show. My groups enjoy the show very much, something that we can enjoy in our country.
Great!. Hong Kong people are very friendly and nice. Hong Kong is beautiful,Gourmet everywhere. we love Hong Kong,
Night view. Fantastic view at night, especially all lit up! I would have rated it five stars except it is so hazy in Hong Kong the daytime view was ruined!

A view to amaze. No matter how many times I see it I am always inspired. By day or night it is a photographers dream. View it from a Star Ferry, or the walk of Stars or as you travel by bus. 8.00pm is when the light show starts, but if you want the sound then down by the waterfront is where you need to be.

Must Do Activity. Go early to avoid big queue... The skyline is a must to do activity in Hong Kong. Make an early visit say by around 8 am or book online tickets to avoid the rush. Do try the Crystal Cable car which gives you another experience of the skyline, transparent from all sides.

Best at night. I didn't think it was going to live up to they hype but it really did. It's very impressive, especially at night time when it is all lit up. I actually think it's more impressive than the New York skyline.
Brilliant view. Great at night and during the day. Missed out on the night light show as it was cancel,ed due to rain earlier in the day!
Spectacular. It is absolutely breathtaking, especially at night. The harbour cruise shows it off to its full potential.

Beautiful!. The view of Hong Kong skyline has to be the best cityscape in the world! Take the Star Ferry from Wan Chai or Central pier and you can walk along the avenue of stars while enjoying the view, you can see the famous Bruce Lee statue by the walk of stars too.

Amazing Views!. You get amazing views of the Hong Kong skyline day or night! Breathtaking views from the Peak but you cal also view the vibrant skyline from Star Ferry Tsim sha tsui. There is also symphony of lights every night from the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade. This is one of the best attractions Hong Kong offers and tourists enjoy a magnificent view along with great photo opportunities!

the millenium there and always go back to soak this up. the count donw at the millenium was perfect, and when even I am back in Hk, just to sit in the park in kowloon I still think is the best to soak in the sky line. the city is buzzing, there is life, you can feel it, wonderful. this is a city to visit more
Great views. We love Hong Kong and have been here before. It always amazes me the new sights, buildings, heights, whats next. We visited the Sky city tower wow what a sight.

Unmistakable day or night. A trip up to the Peak to see the skyline is a must either day or night although the weather can mess up your plans. Go to Kowloon side in the evening to catch the skyline by night. The "Symphony of Lights" sounds wonderful but was a disappointment (although it only lasts for 15 minutes - don't go out of your way to see this). The night skyline is enough to impress.

One of the Best Views in the World. Hong Kong has a number of world class attractions, but for me the greatest feature is the majestic view across the harbour and its skyline. It's a world beating view and something you will remember long after you return home. Great photo opportunities for visitors and a different experience during the day and at night. Highly recommended.
Best City View in the World. Hong Kong Habour would be spectacular anyway but add the towering peaks of the Island and the effect is breathtaking

Hong Kong Light Show. Go to Kowloon side for the 8:00 p.m. "Symphony of Lights". Even our friends from New York were deeply impressed.
Try to get to the Avenue of Stars before 7:30 p.m., cause the crowds are huge every night.
Manhattan of Asia. LOVE looking at the skyline, especially on noghts when they have the laser show bouncing off the buildings.

Hope for a clear(er) night. Travellers to HK need to check out the skyline from two vantage points. The first is from Victoria Peak. Go early as the lines for the tram can be LONG or take a cab to the top and bypass the lines but the tram ride is part of the adventure. The other is from the Kowloon side which also gets pretty busy so find a nice spot and settle in for the light show and hope for a clear night.

Romantic view. This is definitely something not to be missed when in Hong Kong.To enjoy it in comfort and in an airconditioned environment, go to the Lounge at the Intercontinental Hotel (ex- Regent Hotel). You will additionally be entertained with a good band.Prices are not cheap but worth the exceptional view.

Great Night View of the enormous Sky Scrapers. It is good to line up for the Peak Tram around 8 o'clock during night. You will wait around an hour, and once you take the tram up, you will have a short moment where the tram stops for a minute for people to take pictures. When arriving on the top, you can take pictures, do some shopping, have a coffee while watching the skyline, yadayada..... and it is also worth it to walk for around 15 minutes along the Peak Trail, starting from Lugard Road. After walking for quarter of an hour along a curving, dark, but easy track, you will be able to see the Skyline from a different point of view. It is actually a great idea to include trekking in your Hong Kong traveling other than shopping, eating and seeing historical stuffs. The Peak Tram goes until 12 p.m. so it is not a bad idea to go around 9 or 10 pm if you are not tired.... When coming back down, it's not bad to take bus number 1. You will wait around 2~10 minutes depending on the length of the line and soon enough you will enjoy a curvy drive down the mountain through expensive apartments. Overall, this is a great place to go other than having to line up a bit,

Its great to go up there to take in the sights. i do warm you that the tram has 1.5 hours wait on average and if you get a Oyster card you can use it to board. Be careful when you wait for the tram as there is a gap in the railings where you can fall on to the tracks.

Spectacular view !. Hong Kong's skyline especially at night time is amazing, only thing is that the crowds at tsim sha tsui tourist hotspot for skyline is always annoyingly packed .......If you want to stay away from the crowd, go on Aqua Luna boat and enjoy the skyline with a glass of house wine!

One of the best in the world. A simple and cheap way to enjoy this magnificent view is simply to take the Star Ferry between Kowloon and Island. Might be a bit bumpy for good photos but if the weather is good, just take in the view.

Best From the Other Side!. Spectacular views of Hong Kong are best seen in Kowloon! Yes, both are in Hong Kong SAR, but the skyline that is famous is the one on Hong Kong Island, so you need to visit “the other side” namely the peninsula of Kowloon to get that angle! So make sure you include a stop on the “Avenue of the Stars”, the promenade in front of the Hong Kong Museum of Art and Hong Kong Cultural Centre, and you have great motives for your camera. While there you can also pay a visit to the museum and Cultural Centre, and enhance your Hong Kong Experience with food for your soul. Continue along the promenade as it extends to the East and when you pass the Intercontinental Hotel, there is a nice deck (with seating) where you can enjoy a cold beer or a Starbucks treat to accompany the Hong Kong view.

Most stunning skyline. take the star ferry from Central Pier to Tsim Sha Tsui and then walk along the Avenue of Stars. stunning Skyline, particularly at night, with laser light show every night 8pm. a must see when in HK.

Got to see this at least once in your life. Use the harbor ferries and see this from both sides. We enjoy dining outdoors at the Red at IFC looking back toward Kowloon and then going to Harbor City Mall and looking back at the island with a cup of coffee. it never gets old and we still take pictures.
Memories living there.. The nicest view at eve from the Kowloon waterfront side. Can be very crowded at times with the 8pm lightshow. The promenade shows also some statues of movie stars .

Best experience - if you know where you can enjoy the view. Taking a picture of the Hong Kong skyline is probably something you wouldn't want to miss when visiting Hong Kong. I was showing my friends around Hong Kong, and aside from the Peak, we also enjoy the skyline at couple of other locations. First evening, we went to a bar on the top floor of Beijing Road no 1, where there's only glass and illuminated table but nothing else. The night view of the HK island side was so pretty and you get a panorama view there.The second day we went to a restaurant on a hundredth floor at ICC on west Kowloon, pity the day was a bit misty so couldn't see much. If you're fancy to see the Kowloon view instead, I'd also recommend you try walking into one of the high floor restaurants on the HK Island side (e.g. the Chinese restaurant at Mandarin oriental or IFC). It's an experience worth trying.

Classic, but always changing.. One of the most iconic and memorable sights in the world. Go to the Kowloon side to watch the sound and light show at 8.00pm every night. Or if you have the money, see it with a cocktail in one of the top floor bars, such as the Felix at the Peninsula. Can't give it 5 stars because it is so crowded and the show becomes rather monotonous after 5 minutes. A must see though.
We took the Gondolas up to Big Buddah. the price is ok,,, maybe 20 dollars each,, the ride good,, and then the Big Buddah,,, is good on a clear day,,, for us,,ahahhaha rain rain rain,,! oops

Hong Kong at night. We had heard about the night time light and laser show along the harbour front so we booked a evening tour, light show, and evening meal coach tour. Although not cheap, it was a good night out. Had a trip on the star ferry and then a ring side view of the light show, where al the buildings on the opposite side of the harbour lit up to music and laser lights from the top of the buildings. It lasted about an hour and is well worth seeing. The light show is free, you do not have to do a paid trip. It is on every night so make your way down to the harbour.

Clear panorama after the rain.... We went to the Peak to hike the loop and by the time we finished, it was almost 6pm. We wanted to catch the sunset but rain suddenly poured heavily. When it cleared, we were treated to the most picturesque of views as there was hardly any smog/fog in sight. Choose from among the many viewing decks either at the galleria, the wok shaped building or to the right (with the pagoda). Even the locals I was with were amazed!

Hong Kong Skyline is brilliand. I just love Hong Kong, the shopping, the skyline, the markets, and the many country walks that you can do. I also love the ferry trips from Cowloon to Hong Kong Island.

Acrophobics Beware. The skyline includes a number of mountain homes and shopping areas. I don't know of any huge shopping malls in the US built on the top of a mountain. The acrophobic may be encouraged by tour guides to go up in the mountains at night to view the skyline, but I suggest that unless they are with an extremely experiences guide, native to the landscape, to avoid it. There is very little lighting in the route up into the mountains at night. Traveling by bus during the day with a tour guide is no problem. Enjoy the view from the mountain at night with a post card.
Great skyline. Especially from Avenue of the Stars great skyline at nighttime and full of activities. There are seats and Starbucks at end of the walk.

Stunning Skyline, Overrated Light Show. The Skyline one gets to see from TST Promenade/Avenue of Stars is Breathtaking. It a must see one's it's Dark. The light show was decent, one can even give it a miss.
Best way to enjoy is get a takeaway coffee and sit on the edge of ledge ones the crowd disperses after the Symphony Of Light.

Best Lightshow Around. This is a skyline to beat! Every night the skyline does a coordinated light show. It's an unrivaled experience. While the view is great from either side, for the best impact, hop aboard a ferry to watch from the middle of the water.
Simply amazing. Great place to be if possible go after dark to see the skyline. Its open till 11 PM in the night. Good eating out joint and shopping place.
Victoria Peak - Excellent. One of the top highlights of Hong Kong. A must see even if cloudy. You can take private tour or trolley up to the top. Gives you an amazing view.

Stunning. A skylines go, this has to rank up there with NY but much easier to view! I would suggest viewing from the top of victory park where you can get a wonderful birds eye view and then for sunset view from Kowloon to get a different perspective with the lighting up

Must see!. A must see for any trip to Hong Kong. The light show starts at 8:00 PM every night. There are great views from the "Avenue of Stars" adjacent to the Kowloon-side Star Ferry pier. Area starts getting busy around 7:00 PM - arrive a little early and/or bring a snack to enjoy while you wait to ensure the best views. Another great place to watch from is the "Harborside" restaurant in the InterContinental Hotel.

One of HK's main attractions. One of HK's main attractions is its skyline. And the price is free!Get down to the TST Star ferry terminal or anywhere along the south bank of TST for an amazing view. Best seen at night. At 20:00 each evening there is a "light show" where somehow they've set up the buildings of the HK skyline to have a light show in time with music. There are lasers too. And it's free. Definitely get down there.

BreathTaking!!!. It is simply the best skyline in the world. Stunning. Sitting across in Kowloon and sipping a Coffee at Starbucks, one could stare at the Skyline for hours on end and the icing on the cake is the Light and Sound Show at 8PM every night, best viewed from the Avenue of the Stars. The Star Ferry to Hong Kong from Kowloon is a must have experience (HKD $1.5 one-way ride).

Urban eye candy. The skyline of Hong Kong is a feast for the eyes, be it day or night, sun or rain. The architecture of some of the buildings (Bank of China, HSBC, Four Season's, to name just a few) stand out along Victoria Harbour. Views at night and particularly at 8 pm when the laser show takes place is spectacular. It can be best seen from the Kowloon side at One Peking Place. Other great views of the skyline are from Victoria Peak (worth waiting in line and taking the tram) and also from Sky100 (Kowloon side).

Hong Kong wow!. landing in Hong Kong was such an amazing sight! All the thousands of buildings rising out of the ocean is a sight to see, wow...wow...wow!The shopping is so wonderful that I can not wait to visit this amazing place again! going up Stanley hill and looking down during the day and also a must see at night when millions of lights lit the skyline, once again wow..wow...wow! I have been to more than 40 countries, and Hong Kong really amazed me! Nathan road had so many hotels shops restaurants, etc that you are spoiled for choice! Everybody must visit it at least once in their lifetime!!!the floating Jumbo restaurant is also a must do, There are plenty of sightseeing tours to keep you very busy, and all worth it!!!

Best Hotel in Hong Kong - The Upper House. We love Hong Kong for Shopping & food.We love The Upper House for it excellent service, the hotel was awesome. It is a wonderful hotel especially for family holiday. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Exceptional view. Dont know what else to say really, it is fantastic and it is free...no reason not to go see it. I would just recommend taking an umbrella. We were here in July and it was raining every hour so a walk without an umbrella is not very pleasant.
Watch it at sunset. and then stay for the sound and light show. Great fun and a great way to meet people. Also looks wonderful from The Peak

Best in the World. One of the best, if not the best, skylines in the world. There are two places for best views. First, along the Victoria Harbor in Tsim Sha Tsui. The second is from the Peak. Don't pay to go onto the top of the Tower. The best views from the Peak can be found walking about 15 min along the trail. It would be best to arrive before sunset and be able to watch the day time skyline and the night time skyline as well as watch sunset on the other side of the Peak. There is a Symphony of Lights show every night at 8 pm. You would need to be on the Tsim Sha Tsui side to watch.
Amazing skyline. Got to be one of, if not THE best skyline in the world EVER! VIews from the Peak, Lugard Road are stunning.
Excellent is the word. Avenue of star ...star ferry ride....Peak are the some of the places to watch it. It is amazing and should not be missed at any cost.

best skyline, laser show used to be better. i go back to HK every couple of years. I travel to other places in the world and i can honestly say it is still the best skyline in the world, easy to see so much of it without much effort. The laser light show nightly used to be a bit better though. They have shortened and changed it a bit. I love to see all the new buildings and reclaimed land extensions that are done
Victoria Peak is must do in HK. You'll be amazed by the dazzling skyline of this beautiful cosmopolitan city. The day and night experience gives you different perspectives.

Laser Light Show. Get anywhere near the water (the Avenue of Stars is a good bet) in the evening and watch the free light show. The cities skyline is pretty amazing any time of day, but at night it is tops.
Must see skyline. Worth a trip across to Kowloon to see this magnificient view.The boardwalk is magical with plenty of photo stops and places to observethe harbour
One of the great city skylines of the world. Take the Star Ferry after dark for some of the best views of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon skylines. A night approach by air is breathtaking.

Light show. It was a bit of a disappointment but it is definitely worth seeing. The buildings light up with different colors. I would not take a night cruise to see it. Watching for the pier near Star Ferry Kowloon is good enough.

Best skyline in the world. When the weather is clear, nothing beats the views from The Peak or TST. This is by far the best skyline in the world. I prefer to hike up to the Peak at dusk to catch the view. Or else hop on the Star Ferry from Wan Chai to TST for another great view.

just gets better. a smog free visit this time after recent rain storms meant luck was in for a sparkling clear view across to the island from the mainland. it made the evening light and laser show even more spectaculartwinned with a walk along the "walk of stars" this is an ever changing panorama in one of the most vibrant of places anywhere

Amazing skyline that you must see!. An amazing skyline full of all the colours of the rainbow.Unfortunately we didnt see the laser show, however we did experience the skyline via boat on the river, and it is something I will never forget!I would definitely recommend spending some time watching the world pass you by.

Fantastic from any Location. Had the best weather day for pictures out of four visits to HK so went up the tram to Victoria Peak and took a few pictures. However, from any location it looks spectacular.
Great show!. The everyday lightshow is a must. Go there around 19.30 and wait for it to start. Bring a videocamera..

Do not miss the nightly light show and views. Folks....do not miss a close up look at the Hong Kong skyline and light show.Sit down near the harbour and/or in your Hotel room (like we did on two occasions) and relax with a drink in hand.Can be tricky with young kids (our 7 yo lasted approx. half an hour before becoming restless although it was after another 8 hour day pounding the footpaths and shops/markets etc)Recommended.
Amazing Skyline. Awesome skyline that comes to life in the evenings. We took the Star Ferry and really enjoyed the atmosphere and view.
Amazing.. I went there at night. Summer night, pretty hot and crowded. However, the view is amazing and breathtaking. I'd come back to the peak again.

Amazing architecture. Clearly you can't miss the skyline if you go to Hong Kong, but take some time to actually sit and marvel at it. I would recommend you go to the waterfront and watch the nightly light show.
A show to behold. HK buildings are never boring! Whether they emit beautiful lights or display the homeowners washing they are worth a look.
great view from TST of the HK Island lights. Watch the light shows in the evening and head to the Deck and Beer and well grab a beer and sit on the deck.

lasers not so good. The actual lights of the buildings and view are spectacular but the laser show a little disappointing I also found the subway signage pretty awful and we continually got lost although I would definately recommend the octopus card.

More than just an Ordinary Skyline!. Located along the Avenue of Stars, the Hong Kong Skyline not only offers you a fantastic view of the buildings across the river, if you were to take a short stroll down the Avenue of Stars, you would be able to view the hand prints of famous Hong Kong actors & actresses down the lane.The Hong Kong Skyline is a must-visit & you should take a look at it at night when the buildings would light up! It is indeed a spectacular sight! (P.S. There's also a light show, "A Symphony of Lights" which involves the buildings of the skyline at 8pm every Monday, Wednesday, & Friday!)

Best harbor skyline in the world. As far as skylines go, this one is very hard to beat (with Shanghi and New York only slightly behind). The best view is from the classic water taxi, or a junk if you can rent one. Enjoy!

Best views of the spectacular Hong Kong skyline.. For fantastic views and panoramic photo opportunities go to the Avenue of the Stars, near the Kowloon Star Ferry Terminal. Best time is around sunset as the lights reflect off the buildings. The view across the water is truly spectacular. Maybe go for a drink and watch the Laser Show light up some of the buildings, every night at eight.

Half day tour to top of Peak,trip on a sampan round the Harbour ,visit to a jewellery factory. It was very good except that the tour guide talked more about himself rather than telling us where we were and what we were seeing.

What a view. The cheapest and most important sight of Hong Kong is the skyline. Grab a wine, sit down and enjoy the fantastic views of the skyline. It is absolutely stunning. A must see for every traveller.

Spell-binding!. Asia's world city is a fascinating study of contrasts - lush green mountains next to deep sea harbors and an incredibly dense concrete jungle in the middle!The Hong Kong skyline really brings out this contrast in a spell-binding manner. The best way to enjoy the skyline, in my personal opinion, is from a boat that takes you around the Victoria harbor! Please see some of the photos that I have attached herewith to get a sense of what I am trying to convey.The peak is the next best option; however, it doesn't bring you real close to the action and the quality of view is heavily dependent on the pollution and the weather.I have also seen the light show from the Avenue of Stars at the TST promenade but found the experience too noisy and marred by everybody trying to take photos or record videos.

Impressive. Hong Kong is one of the most densely populated cities in the world. Thus, it's very much a vertical city. Many of the buildings in Central (a neighborhood at the center of HK) are very unique architecturally. There are also a few beautiful buildings in Kowloon (across the harbor). I recommend riding the Star Ferry to see the skyline from sea level. Walk around the waterfront in Kowloon to see HK Island's skyline and take a few pictures. I also recommend seeing the skyline from Victoria Peak. I took the Peak tram and did the walk recommened by Loney Planet (take Harlech rd and then Lugard rd). You get some pretty awesome views of Lamma island and Victoria Harbor. Go on a clear day if posssible. Try to see the skyline during the day and night!

Awesome. We had the most spectacular view of Hong Kong's Skyline, we cruised into the harbour aboard Mariner of the Seas. First glimpse of the skyline was so pretty, just on dusk and the lights on the buildings coming on and reflecting off the water.After completing our cruise in Shanghai we returned to Hong Kong and stayed at the Sheraton in a Towers room, the view was spectacular, something I would never tire of.We visited New York last year and have to say I think Hong Kong's skyline pips it at the post.If choosing a hotel try to get one with a view of the skyline, it truly is beautiful.

A dreamy view. I love the view, the combination of the buildings and the sea is amazing. There are 3 ways to enjoy the view:1. Sit at the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade (where you can also find Avenue of Stars) and just stare across the ocean. If I had the time I would sit there all day. 2. Go to Victoria Peak (best by the peak tram, but you can go by car) and see Hong Kong skyline from above. Pretty amazing. 3. My favorite: Star Ferry Pier (which is very cheap by the way) Cross the ocean from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui or vice versa while enjoying the view. I can say if you haven't seen HK's skyline, you haven't seen Hong Kong yet.
viewtiful hong kong. The only thing i hate from it is the linethey are fairly ridiculous but hey its worth the waitmagnificent scene from the top
The Best. Going to sleep looking at that stunning skyline across Victoria Harbor is one of my favorite things. Viewing nightly light and laser show from the Promenade is a free delight.
Absolutely amazing.. There Is no hesitation to stand along the pier and stare at the skyline for as long as you can. Especially at night time, its beautiful.

Mountains of glass and steel!. The towering skyscrapers of Hong Kong are a magical sight at night. With more than 8,000 (twice the number in New York) and many more under construction, the skyscape in Hong Kong is both mind-boggling and brilliant. The nightly laser and light show across the Victoria Harbour from the high buildings is worth a look.Only negative is trying to find an address amongst the forest of tall buildings. Something to behold though for sure!
The Greatest Skyline in the World. Hong Kong gives New York a run for its money when it comes to the city's spectacula skyline. Prepare to be dazzled!
Amazing view. Opening our hotel curtains and looking out over the Hong Kon Skyline was breathtaking. Hong Kong is a fabulous city with interesting arcitecture.

Crossing Fantasy World. Getting lost in fantasy world is what it feels like to cross from Victoria to Kowloon by Ferry, surrounded by most magnificent skyscraper towers of fantastic light shows, festive shouts and romantic dillies during the cross over from the Island to mainland, a trip that can be done daily to benefit from the cheap accommodation and night markets in Kowloon!
Disappointing. We went a few nights but this was rather boring and dull. Even when we went on the other side to view, still boring. the ferry ride accross the bay was nice.
Outstanding!. Amazing and awesome city. Density and topography meet along one of the world's preeminent natural deep water ports.
a dream come true!!. since my times in the Cruise lines!! Victoria bay!! was in my mind!! take the ferry early night!! dont buy the expensive ticket with the show"...... what show???

Victoria Harbour View. Only one way to get the full effect of the importance, vastness and sheer intensity of Hong kong and its deep Harbour - that's from the view point at the top of the Victoria Peak tram ride. AT NIGHT.If you time your arrival for the dusk performance of the world's largest light and sound show, you'll be in for a treat.The whole city and harbour is an array of light performances for 20 minutes. From the viewpoint at this time of day, the impression of this sometimes clostrophobic metropolis is one of intensity, pride, nostalgia and a quite unique locale. It ahs to be done.

Light show. The light show is performed at 8pm each evening. On the evening that we went there was music to accompany the light show. The music was excellent, the light show was very ordinary leaving a lot of people going away disappointed.
360 degree view. You must experience this - it's incredible - one of the best skylines in the World. The laser show every night at 8.00 is brillliant.

Better by night or day?. This was our second trip to Hong Kong and one of the reasons we came back as on our first trip it was so misty we could not see much at allof the skyline. So much better this time though. We found it skyline interesting both by day and night as the buildings take on a different prospective by night. It is great to see that the buildings are not just tall towers as many of them have interesting aspects built into them to ensure they are lucky buildings. When we did our tour we got good background information on who owned and built some of the more intersting buildings, there is clearly some wealthy people trying to ensure their building is noticed!
Not up to the hype. Given all the hype, you would think this is amazing. While it is impressive to see, it is not up to all the hype. And, the laser show is a big let down.

See it from the Kowloon side.. Take the Star Ferry to Kowloon for an earthier version of Hong Kong but mostly to ogle the Hong Kong Island skyline. The skyscrapers become neon bill boards at night. Victoria Harbour is beautiful from both sides but truly at its best when seen from a ferry. Don't miss the Star Ferry if you find your self in Hong Kong.

A tour from the air. I loved the sky line, all the way to the big Buddha is a whole experience, you can se the fishermans from the glass bottom, the airport and the different attractions around.
If you can is better if you get the glass bottom.

Extremely over rated. The lights on a single building is beautiful. It has patterns of waves and trees and all. But the remaining building has mediocre designs and lights display. I paid HK150 plus for each person and slightly less for kids. I think this is the most overrated. I had the view from the star ferry. My son liked it. The display started at 8:05-8:20 pm. After exiting from the ferry at central I saw a sitting spot where I can view the entire skyline for free. It's just beside the ferry entrance. Overall if u have time it's better to take the tram to the Peak. That view is much better than the night skyline display.

What's not to like. If you are on Hong Kong Island, take the Star ferry over 1 evening and just sit by the water admiring the Hong Kong skyline. Be sure to bring your camera. The only other place I've seen that can compete is NYC.
Interesting and vast. Tons of huge buildings to look at. At night they all light up and it's really beautiful. The harbor tours are nice, but you can see the main stuff from the shoreline.

Iconic skyline. This skyline along with New York and maybe London, Singapore, Shanghi and Sidney are probably the most recognised on earth. Looking from Kowloon you can spend hours just watching the activities on Victoria Harbour - a world heritage place!!
Excellent views.. Definitely worth a look both in the day and at night as views are stunning. Highly recommend. Lunch in the café would be worth it too. We didn't go but it looked nice.
Beautiful Lights in the Evening. I would call it a beautiful city with skyscrapers with beautiful lights in the evening. It a very romantic site so see the sky filled with beautiful lights.

The Peak or Victoria Peak, you choose - same place. The Peak is amazing, after taking the tram to the top, you enter a large shopping center, this is where you can access the viewing area at the top, there is a charge but again very reasonable for the amazing views that you are going to take in of Hong Kong and the surrounding areas. You are so high up its hard to fathom and the mountain behind you is still taller. The Skyline doesnt open until 10.30am so we hung around a while and took a walk which turned into a hike....anyhow the peak is well worth a visit, we visited in June and although humid at the base there was a nice breeze when you got to the top

The Peak. We visited the peak to view the skyline. The kids enjoyed the tram ride. Was crowded at the line to catch the tram, people were cutting the lines which was awful, people were rushing for no reason when everybody is guaranteed to get a seat. Peak tram can manage the lines better.

Amazing. The skyscrapers make up for an amazing view. We felt awed the whole time. The only downside was the intense heat. We were sweating all over, the sun was really harsh which made it very difficult to be on direct sunlight. HK can be pretty hot in June.

Just like you see on TV and worth a look at especially at Night. Always a Great Laser Light Show everynight about 8pm, usually like to dine somewhere that we can enjoy it. It's everything you see in the Movies and fun to go home and say WOW I Was There, or I saw that etc the next time your watching a good flick that has the skyline in it, ie: James Bond, Jason Borne etc. Well Worth Seeing. Be sure to walk the boardwalk of the stars in Kowloon.

Wonder of man. What a terrific place. The laser show is something amazing. There is music, and the buildings put up a light show that is sincronized with the light from the buildings. On top of that there are lasers coming from the buildings into the sky.And even you get the view of the traditional chinese ships...truly specialIt might sound cheesy, but it is really breathtaking.There is also the strip of chinese stars. So So.You can get your sketch done by some of the artist in the pier.And there is food.
Light Show. if in Hong Kong, you have to see this at least once to believe it. its spectacular, every night at 8pm 365 days a year.WOW

Amazing!!. This is probably one of the most impressive and varied skylines I have ever seen!! Beautiful!! I especially recommend the light show, which is every night from 8- 8:13 p.m. and is spectacular!!!
Stunning by night. We took a river cruise to the Jumbo floating restaurant at night and the views of the skyline are stunning, it's a light show in itself! A must see.

AWESOME!!!. Love the scenic view. Lights chasing each other. Great urban-city-scape. Great architecture. Show @ 8pm every night. Go there in the day, pre-night and night to capture different feel at the same spot.
Amazing. You can walk along the harbor or take a boat ride, or have a drink in the skyscrapers to enjoy the beautiful skyline.

awsome views but hot!!!. amazing,to see hong kong by day or night a visit to Victoria peak is a must,after dark there is a lazer show between skyscrapers.we did a boat trip by night which was both breathtaking and gave us the best view of hong kong by night

Impressive. By day and night the view is impressive. Once on top of Victory Peak go to the terrace of the shopping mall that has the bus stop on its basement. It's free and equally good as the one on top of the mall with the trolley cart (which is like 40HKD).
night skyline is spectacular. its a huge CBD & at night the light show & skyline were amazing, especially from the Aqua Roma Restaurant

Asian Metropolis. Breathtaking view from Victoria harbour to Hong Kong skyline.
Must see during visit to HK, even if just passing by. This is an amazing site, especially during the night when the towers are fully lit up with lights.

Wow...!!!. The top 10 skyline in the world. Hong Kong. If you visit Hong Kong but not going see the skyline then you must be going Hong Kong one more time! Is amazing whether you view from The Peak or Victoria Harbour and don't miss the Symphony of Lights!
Head to Victoria Peak. Head to Victoria Peak or go on a ferry to truly appreciate the skyline. And take the bus up the peak if you like amusement park rides!

Stunning. We were able to enjoy the Harbor both at night and during the day in good, clear weather. It is an amazing site. I preferred looking at the Hong Kong side from Kowloon, but you can easily take the metro across to Hong Kong island to see some of those buildings up close. We were also treated by the duck's visit to the harbor while we were there, a lucky coincidence. This is one of the best urban photo spots in the world, I'm sure.

Excellent view of the city. The skyline of HK, from either the HK or Kowloon side is excellent. I have enjoyed views during the day or at night and it is surely an amazing view of the towers and condos, all lit up with lights and commercial signs. However, I did discover some foul smell in certain parts, not sure if that is the water or just some sweage near by.
Tourists: Must See. Best seen at night on the Kowloon side facing the Island. You can stay for the 8PM Symphony of Lights then take a boat over to the other side :)
Spectacular. Really great views from a junk boat, but equally as good from kowloon or Hong Kong Central. Be sure to have your camera ready.
Great for visit. Visiting this place at night and it was fabulous. The hundred of lights from buildings lighted up, they was fantastic.
Adreline rush. Brilliant, lucky we caught it on a good day as most of the week was raining, beautiful views across the city. Worth the wait and the queuing up.

Must see at night!. Go to the Kowloon side for the 8 PM daily "Symphony of Lights" show. It's free and pretty cool! This was our second visit to Hong Kong and it was as spectacular a show as the first time!
You need a really clear day to enjoy the skyline. The HK Skyline is incredible, but you have to have a clear, smog-free day to truly enjoy it. The 8pm light show was neat, but not that impressive.

World Class. Hard to top this beautiful city. So many different angles, from the peak to the harbor, offer splendid views of this incredible skyline. No matter if you are on a ferry, on the peak, looking from Kowloon, Hong Kong will amaze you.
Amazing. The Hong Kong skyline is one of the best in the world, and the show at 8pm everyday is a must watch for every tourist.
terrific view. atmosphere and drinks and anyone should visit the toilet.....unique experience......full of young guys smoking place

simply, DAZZLING!!!. Never seen a better skyline. A treat to watch at night, after 2000 hrs to be precise. Some buildings looked like illuminated beacons while they melted into the clouds, leaving a bright ring of white aura at the intersection!

I miss it. I spent about 6 weeks in Hong kong last year and I miss it. If you are traveling from an English speaking country to China...this is a great place to start. Signs are mostly in English and nearly everyone speaks it. Visit Kowloon shopping district and take a Chinese Junk tour of the harbour. Beware...If you are not Chinese, You will be approached by people trying to sell you designer watches, Suits, hand bags,etc. out of the back of a truck - If you want a Suit - Try Sam's Tailor...they are the best.

One of the iconic views. What's not to love about the skyline you've seen in a million pictures. Simply fantastic ! Enjoy the light show each night at 8pm or (my favourite) find a bar before sundown with a great view and watch how the view changes between day and night time.

Lots going on other than the view. Stunning views to be had from the TST shoreline both in the day and night .The light show at 8pm is worth a look although we were distracted by thousands of mostly Chinese tourists heading off to view a huge rubber duck moored next to the ferry terminal a King Kong sized version of the type you have in your bath.Not sure what that was all about . Views from the Peak are also equally good .Second best cityscape in the world knocking on New York's door perhaps .

Asia trip 2013. My trip to The island of Hong Kong was fantastic. I tried to see everything there was to see. I loved touring the island via the Big Bus. Loved the cable ride to the Peak, the boat ride on a sampan, the day trip to Macau.

Amazing. The skyline is simply gorgeous, you can't believe there are so many buildings! Also you can see some ships or boats passing by, which makes it even nicer. The music and lights show was quite disappointing for us, just some lasers coming from three buildings and the music was horrible. Higher expectations than what it really was.
Impressive skyline. One of the most impressive views I've ever seen from both sides of Victoria Harbor and especially imperial in the evening
nice !!. HK does have a nice skyline--both from the Kowloon as well as the HK Island side. The light show does a lot to further accentuate the skyline.

Stunning. No matter where you view this from, it is just absolutely stunning both day and night. I viewed it from the 25th floor of the Prince's building, from the Peak and from the Aon office. At night it is just so spectacular, especially during the 8:15 pm light show. The contrast of the skyscapers against the tropical peaks is just spectacular. The electric bill must be larger than the GDP of small countries!! It is truly, truly spectacular.
Amazing and must see. What a fantastic experience. You have to see this to appreciate . The view to Hong Kong Island is truely breathtaking. Well done Hong Kong

Hong Kong Sky line by night. Best view is at 8pm from the Avenue of Stars to watch the light show?There are lots of people so getting there 15 minutes before is advised.After the show walk down the Avenue and have your photo taken by ne of the many photographers. But don't be misled by the advertised 20 dollar price, that's for a thumb print picture! Ad haggle, half is a good deal!

Breezy, wonderful, must-see. This is one of Hong Kong's trademarks. It's a good visit either in the morning or evening. You can jog/walk around and enjoy the cool breeze in the morning; or spend a relaxing time looking at the view of building lights in the evening. The Hong Kong skyline is just a few minutes walk from the center of Tsim Tsa Tsui shopping district. It's a nice break after a day of shopping/walking around the city. Perfect for taking photos, of course! Preferably bring bottled water, though there are vendors in the area.

Nothing Like I have ever seen!. Go to the Avenue of the Stars / Victoria Harbour to really appreciate the view.The light show is hyped up but its really not that great. what is great is the fact that you have a lot of people there who are also interested and this creates quite a buzz.
View it from Kowloon. Great view from Kowloon but a little disappointed with the laser show at night.......ok, but not wow.

Stunning can sit for hours looking at this from Kowloon. Fab at night and good in the day even in bad weather. Best from Kowloon side. A great place to chill out and take long exposure shots at night.
Up there with the best. Great sky line night show at 8.00 pm ok best views from the Kowloon side, take the star ferry for a better outlook from the water.
Beautiful skyline. The light show is pretty good to look at. It starts around 8pm. Take a ferry (which are very cheap) and you get to see both skylines of Hong Kong.

The Skyline to beat all Skylines. Be amazed at the high-rises that show-case Hong Kong's architectural phenomenon including Bank of China, Exchange Square, Hong Kong Bank, Lippo Tower, Central Plaza, Kowloon Wharf and expressway, as well as nearby Stonecutters Island. There is a popular cruise for those who love the vibrancy and the ambitious town planning of Hong Kong. High-rises showcasing Hong Kong's architectural phenomenon, include Bank of China, Exchange Square, Hong Kong Bank, IFC (International Finance Centre) and Central Plaza along the waterfront. There are other new and remarkable infrastructure landmarks, like Kowloon Wharf and its developments, Kowloon Expressway and the nearby Stonecutters Island which for many decades served as a British Naval Base until June 1997. Having been rebuilt it is now a Chinese People's Liberation Army Navy Base. Other interesting scenery along the Western shoreline of Hong Kong include the skyscrapers built on the hillside, traditional Chinese shipyards, and the World's largest container terminal.

One of the Earths most amazing. . .. Great skyline consisting of contrasting mountains and skyscrapers, there are no shortages of places to see it from, pretty much anywhere you go you will want to get your camera out!
Best in the world. I come to HK almost every other month and every time, I get awe-struck by the island skyline. The density between water and mountain truly makes this a spectacular sight.
Amazing. Hong Kong is a beautiful city, especially at night. The light show is free and can be observed while making a path ferry between islands. Worth.

Spectacular. Pictures don't really do it justice. HK has the highest density of high rise buildings in the world including quite a number in the top 100 tallest. Some of these are on the slopes of the Peak of HK island. The overall effect is like nothing I had seen before.
Amazing views. Take the glass bottom sky view gondolier - shorter line to wait in and awesome views. Trip to big Buddha was great - well worth it.
Great. One of the world's memorable views, especially during the nightly light and music show. The Kowloon deck provides a good place to view the show.

the view is great.
