We went to the peak with the tram and that was nice experiment.We only had to wait about 10 mins before we got to the tram, but when we came back, I'm sure you would have needed to wait 1 hour.The view from the peak was really awesome.You got 360 degrees view of Hong Kong.We were there by day, so the view would be even cooler during night.

Asian City that Never Sleep. We enjoyed the ... light show at 8pm. I believe HK has one of the best skyline in Asia, judging from where I came from nearly 13000 miles away. It reminds me of seeing Manhattan from New Jersey or Brooklyn Heights at night.

Skylines. I'm writing this for a topic project hope you like it. Also please vote for helpful. I was walking in the busy streets of hong kong. Suddenly, I saw lights shine around me everywhere I go.The beautiful boats were sailing down the crystal clear water. The high rises suprised me because the glass had such a strong reflection!
Must watch. Be there at around 6:30 and take the double decker bus to reach there. It is extremely windy so please take a sweater or a jacket with you. The view is spectacular at night.
There is nothing like it. I was in New York a couple of months ago and the skyline in Hong Kong is so much better, especially at night. Should not be missed.

You can't go to HK and not see this.. Because then what's the point. Everyone will be like "What? Where are your pictures of HK?" ... seriously catch the Star Ferry and see the view from Kowloon. Star Avenue is a good place to view it from. Skip the light show.
Iconic. What is a visit to HK without checking out the skyline? Has to be one of the best, if not the best skylines in the world. Love it!
Urban Fantasy Land. Pictures and words do not do justice to the spectacular skyline. It has to be seen to be believed. The best views are from Tsim Sha Tsui, the Star Ferry and from Victoria Peak.

From Kowloon or Hong Kong. Skyline from whichever island you look, is massive, monstrous sky scrapers, illuminating marvels, the rubber duck adding to its glory. Rubber duck was grounded for a few days like a fried egg, but rose to its majestic height by the last week of May. Catching sight of Kowloon from Hong kong would certainly have this adorable yellow patch in your picture
Wow !. There is nothing quite like the Hong Kong skyline - catch the Star Ferry to Kowloon in the evening & prepare to be amazed by the light show
Skyscraper Hong Kong. Hong Kong always busy and buzzing. Shopping and bargaining can be fun or nightmare. Lively at most times of the day and night. Stayed in Kowloon.
Pretty. Pretty, particularly with good weather. Take in the views from 'The Peak', behind the skyscrapers on Hong Kong island.
HK Skyline is hard to beat....but. just take the Star Ferry any time but don't hang about for the nightly light show viewed from Kowloon side. It doesn't quite work...

Unique and compact..... It’s not New York but what makes it unique is how compact the buildings are along Victoria Harbour with superlative views from Kowloon side. We had good weather and so visibility was perfect to see the contours of each soaring structure during the day and even more dramatic and colourful at night.Basically most of them (apart from the tallest - International Commerce Centre on Kowloon side) begin at Wan Chai across to Central on Hong Kong Island.The most iconic is Two International Finance Centre, plus The Centre, Bank Of China Tower, the circular Hopewell Tower, Central Tower and my favourite – the elegantly curved roof atop the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre sitting close to the water.The skyline never ceases to impress us and although best seen from land, we also take the Star Ferry to give us a whole new perspective while on this short journey across Victoria Harbour.Enjoy your experience!
amazing. impressive skyline, even if you've been to other major cities. sky high buildings and lots of neon lights in close proximity make hong kong's skyline a top attraction.
Amazing. So much building going on everywhere.Great views but quite foggy while I was there.I didn't do so well with transport but was a bit scared of getting lost.

Breathtaking buildings. The architecture and beauty is hard to take in. Go to the IFC mall on Hong Kong Island with picture identification. They then allow you to go to the 55th Floor of the office block and take pictures of Hong Kong for free. The views at this height are magnificent.
Always Breathtaking. I've come to Hong Kong for so many times already, and I've always been mesmerized by it's skyline. I love the evening scene!

Be sure to catch the Red Star Ferry and see the Night show. The skyline is great, especially at night with the night show. The show begins at 8pm so be sure to catch the Ferry over to the other side to watch. The ferry ride costs about $0.50 and is fun. Even though the viewing area is very crowded, it is not hard to see, so you really don't have to arrive very early.
Better than NYC. You must be in Kowloon to see it but is better than NYC - if you are lucky enough to have sunshine...

Quite Awesome. The skyline, looking over from Kowloon, is frankly quite awesome at night. Most of the buildings are lit. Don't miss the light show which happens at 8pm every night - where a lot of the skyscrapers participate in the light show.
Stunning view!. The Hong Kong Skyline is one of the most fascinating views I have ever seen, both at day and night. Not to miss the laser show every night at Hong Kong Harbour.
Best place to visit. I liked every thing except the photos taken when entering the lift by the management. It is very costly at 160 hongkong dollars for a photo and a key chain with your photo

What's not to like?. It's one of the most wonderful skyline sights in the world, probably better at night than during the day due to often-bad air quality or fog. This comment is true either from Kowloon to HK Island, or vice versa. Because there is so little to say that others haven't, I can just point out two things: (1) HK has several of the world's 50 tallest buildings. They add great value to the view. (2) When you look over at higher-end residential areas at night, you may see large buildings with few lights. Many flats have been bought by real estate speculators who do not wish to rent them out to facilitate an easy sale. So they are empty, and therefore dark. Go up to Victoria Peak to see the lights at night but be prepared for massive crowds. And as for the 8 PM laser light show, well, ummm, as often as not, people say "is that all there is?"
Harbour Lights. Great view on the Harbour at night with all the lights the promenade at Tsim Sha Tsui best view point

Breathtaking. I have never experienced anything quite like the view of the skyline from the viewpoint at Victoria Peak. We went up at night time and could see the light show which takes place at around 8 p.m. I also recommend Sky 100 at the ICC building in the day time for the most stunning views.

World Class Skyline. I'll get the minor negatives out first: Sort of a tourist trap and it's hard to truly enjoy the skyline in fullest due to the crowd. I visited Avenue of the Stars to view the skyline during the light show period (scheduled every night on 8.00-8.10 pm), which is honestly not that spectacular and might explain the inflated crowd size, so perhaps best to avoid that timing. Heard that sometimes the weather can be a bit foggy to see the buildings clearly too, so make sure you research the best timing before visiting.The skyline itself is quite magnificent. It boasts only one truly iconic architecture (Bank of China), but where it lacks in gravity-defying buildings, it makes up in vastness and volume. With 2,354 skyscrapers above 100 m (making Hong Kong #1 in the planet), you can see grand buildings towering to the sky from left to right.

Superb Light Show & Skyline. Preferable if you on Hong Kong Island to get a better view of the Skyline, there a Laser Light show at 8pm every night. If possible try a harbour boat crossing at 745pm to get the best view of the skyline.. Fantasitc is all i can sy
What a beautiful night visit!. Took a boat ride on the harbor followed by dinner at Aqua Luna. Walked around the next day and played tourist

Magnificent. Always a view to fall in love with. The skyscrapers are like Asia's version of NY..it doesn't matter whether you're in island side or Kowloon. The view of the skyline with the Star Ferry in the horizon is a classic!

This is as iconic as the skyline of NYC pre-9/11. See it from the promenade of the Hong Kong Art Centre (across from The Peninsula in Kowloon), Felix at the Peninsula itself or even better and cheaper from the HK -Kowloon ferries where you can see both sides. Night time, day time two different views. Try it

Universally agreed to be the best skyline in the world. You have not really lived until you have got the star ferry from Kowloon over to Hong Kong Island in late afternoon before the buildings light up, get the bus up to the peak and the watched the buildings on both sides light up. The view (at all points of this journey) is enough to take your breath away. Trust me, this is no normal bus journey- it will be one of the rides of your life!

Stunning. What can you say about the Hong Kong skyline one word stunning. 8 0'clock every evening they have a light show which is well worth seeing. Have a wander along on Kowloon side to the Avenue of Stars and see the statue of Bruce Lee and just soak up this fantastic city
Fantastic especially by night. It's free! From Kowloon Hong Kong island Skyline by night is the best light show on earth. But Kowloon is catching up with all its new buildings going up.
wonderful tower, is as been on paradise. excellent for hong kong best top view pictures, have a snack or drink in a special moment with friends or family

Breath taking...best by boat. I can agree with CNN voting the skyline of HK the best in the world. I had the privilege to experience the night skyline at a 3 hour boat trip. It was really amazing. I recommend this to everybody visiting HK for the first time. This gives you a better understanding about HK.

Awesome sight!!. We loved taking pictures of the skyline from the harbor. For someone who just starting playing around with an SLR, this was good practice to do some night shots. The lights show was also a treat and not to be missed.
Amazing. What a view! Certainly something I'll never forget, especially if you experience it from Ozone Skybar at the top of the Ritz Carlton hotel.
Stunning views everywhere. Plenty to see and do. There are fantastic sights around (almost) every corner. People are cheerful and helpful.

One of the best views. Walk by the avenue of stars and you can find the hand marks of the most famous actors and actresses in Hong Kong. You cannot afford to loose at 19:30 the light show, its spectacular
Harbour view. Go on the LTR , the busses and Pling -Pling , ikea has three shops in Hong Kong , great food and of course a lot do stuff you will need for you home
Very Beauitful. Must go to the lazer light show at 8 pm every night. its very well presented with lights on the buildings on H K Island side going on and off the music.

Must see in Hong Kong day & night. The Hong Kong skyline is one of the best Skyline vistas in the world. You simply can not visit Hong Kong without taking a look no matter how long or short your stay in Hong Kong is.There are many ways to see the Skyline vista, the easiest and cheapest way is by walking along the Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) promenade, at 8pm every night there is a light show which is also free.To make the most of the views jump on the Star Ferry and take in the views from the water, or take the Peak Tram and view the spectacular sights from the Victoria Peak.
Second to none. Watch either from the promenande or bag a table at Aqua for a classier evening! Well worth the trek, get the star ferry from the island

Easily one of the best in the world. Its not just the number of big buildings, but the easy viewability from the harbor and the dramatic back drop of the lush green mountain that makes HK arguably the best in the world.
Skyline at night. Day or night the HK skyline is a " must see" , especially from up high. If you can get to see a light show it is an added bonus.
Loved it. Get the to the avenue of the stars for 19:30 for the light show that doesn't disappoint, It's free it's busy & we loved it!.
World iconic harbour view. View from Metropark Hotel Executive room is one of the best. Both the Kowloon and HK island skylines are on view and the nighttime light show is worth seeing.

Hong Kong walking along the city at the ferry terminals. Walking around Victoria Harbour on TST side above the ferry terminals the city is gorgeous. Very smoggy but delightful all the same, with food outlets and a light show at night. You can watch the water traffic or shop nearby. I think there is shopping in almost every street in Hong Kong!
victoria peak, IFC 2 or the brand new ICC. messy buildings creating a fantastic city viewalso some excellent buildings form well known architects
skyline... is skyline :-). hongkong... is worth to go... back :-) and too much to say in 300 'caractères' .... but .... as we know.... TRAVELING IS LEARNING SO.... BON VOAYAGE :-)
Best at night!. I'm a huge fan of city skylines and this is one of the best I've seen! Victoria Harbour and Victoria Peak offers a great view of the Hong Kong Skyline.

Amazing!!. One of the best skylines i have ever seen, best views are from Kowloon and Victoria Peak which you can get to by the tram but there are massive ques so be prepared. It can also get quite foggy and this can obsure views. Kowloon was my favourite, dont forget the light show at 8, this is impressive and there are a few bars that give great views.

Great skyline. Loved the view from Kowloon side (and back and forth on the ferries).I thought the symphony of lights show was a bit over-rated, but still glad I saw it (the kids weren't too fussed though!)

Wonderful. We went to the evening light show.. Beautiful lights flashing off and on throughout the skyline. We sat outside with many others enjoying the sights. Completely free!In the daytime the skyline is also very impressive. Go up to The Peak to get the best view.
Breathtaking. Hong Kong has it's unique skyline with nice modern buildings, all mixed with old ones. Don't forget the show close by Intercontinental, in Kowloon, facing HK island! Fantastic!

Lights. Got the MTR to avenue of stars which was fun in itself, live music playing, cafes and bars to sit at for a drink and lots of photo opportunities. It's free to walk up and down and the light show happens every single night with the lights flashing in time to the music, you can also watch the junk boats below. I went on a cloudy day so visability wasn't the best but still had lots of fun.

best seen from avenue of stars. worth sending a evening there, get there before sun set to get the day light view & plenty of picturesque boats on the sea, as sun sets the skyline gets lit up, by 8 pm the free music & light show, not very great but worth the 20 minutes while you are there anyway
amazing photos. Night photos are great the skyline goes on forever. Good views from star ferries. The night light show starts at 8 pm and is best from the Kowloon side

One of the top 5 of the world. Every night is exciting as the lights backdrop the buildings and accentuate the harbor. During the day you have dramatic view of the harbor, mountains and skyscrapers. It is truly a sight to see and enjoy.

Marvellous. Since the Hong Kong city is full of tall buildings spread all around, the sky line view is spellbound. Grand views can be had from near the Avenue of stars. Try the night views across the waters, and you shall be surprised. During our four days stay at Hong Kong we went there on all the nights, and felt like coming back again and again.
amazing. amazing experience, cheap and cozy. probably the most simple way to see the big city, it is a must if you are in hong kong

Cant be missed. Skyline is comparable to that of New York and Boston. The IFC tower is truly the highlight, with only partially visible due to cloud cover around the top floors. A very beautiful sight

Wonderful. I saw many skycrapers in Singapore or Jakarta. But when arrive in HK, its something different, esp when you saw from both promenade either in HK island or Kwoloon. I can definetely spend hours to just sitting by harbor, or the promenade and enjoy the lights from the buildings and took some pics. Its just wonderful experiences, esp as now I residin in an island where there is no high rise building. so If you have plenty of time to spend, u might considering to enjoy the wonderful HK skyline.

Experience of Hong Kong Skyline. This is my second trip to Hong Kong in 1-1/2 years. The first trip was just to get visa to enter mainland china. It was quite impromptu from Guam and did not have any hotel booked. As I found out the Canton Trade Fair was happening same week and no available reasonably priced hotels. Only the high price $350 US/night were available. Moral of story, if you plan to visit Hong Kong, plan way way ahead especially when it comes to lodging. For the 5 days in Hong Kong while waiting for monday to apply for visa, spent several times in the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade area walking and taking photos. I must have traversed the Star Ferry between Tsim Sha Tsui and HK Island at least 6 or 7 times. Cheap fares allows for running back and forth without too much hassle. The skyline of Hong Kong is breath taking during the day as well as at night. I saw the only Red Sail Chinese Junk tour boat, but was not able to catch a tour. Took another evening night cruise and the night harbor views were great. The service on the cruise was not that good. The crew spoke very little english and did not announce what the views were, so we were left to ourselves asking other tourist what is this or that. The tour boats need to train their staff better to accomodate tourists who do not know the area. This would have made a much better value than just a cruise with a couple of soda/piece of cookie thrown in.I just returned from my second trip to HK. This time I took more time to stroll the promenade and looked for the movie star hand print plaques and took photos. Enjoyed the music from the christian group along the way. And again, the spectacular views of the HK skyline was there. This time the weather was quite cloudy and rain intermittenly with fog shrouds. I was able to do the harbor cruise on the chinese junk, the AquaLuna this trip. Although a nice cruise, I was disappointed that only 7 tourists were on this more expensive evening cruise. It did not feel like a party and was disappointing in this sense. The crew was accomodating and the experience was OK, first time to cruise on a genuine HK Red Sail junk. Again, no english announcements of what the landmarks are along the cruise. This trip I tried the subway and was impressed by the efficiency and cleanliness of the system, once one finds out which way to go and the landmark stops before the next stops, etc. Needless to say, I got lost a few times. I speak a few words of Cantonese, but I could not understand the fast pace speech of the locals when asking for directions. Another landmark to visit is surely Victoria Peak and taking the cable trams. Great view of the city harbor and skylines.As an architect, I must say that the modern architecture of HK and mainland China is so impressive to say the least and is so far ahead of the US architecture now. Actually, I am more interested in the traditional architecture of China and how they are able to preserve and rehab these ancient architecture to its present state. I hope they will continue to improve in this area of preservation rather than tear down and build more nameless soulless shopping malls and high rises. The ancient architectural treasure of China is what set this historically and culturally rich country apart from the USA or most countries for that matter. While adapting and borrowing the high technologies from the west to modernize, I truly hope the Chinese and HK'nese do not forget their rich proud and formidable past cultural history. I am hoping to traveling back to HK and China again soon and will visit the Tsim Sha Tsui harbor area again and again marvel at the modern skyline advancement of HK and China.Allen from Hawaii

One of the best skylines in the world!. By far one of the most outstanding, modern and colorful skylines with the 'junks' sailing by on Victoria Harbor. A bit much of commercial advertising but hey, this is Asia!

Christmas Season is the best. Must has been written about the beauty of HK skyline.My favourite season is during Christmas period.Watching from Kowloon is just a relax pass time, very beautiful and romantic.Year End is the best time to enjoy the Skyline.
HK. Take the old trolley to the East of Central area. Jog through the Ladies Market. Stroll through Kowloon.

Must visit. Enjoy the skyline from the ferry. Board the ferry from the harbour in the evening. Enjoy a late evening in the cruise with drinks, and see the symphony of lights dot the skyline at night.Wow, what a sight! Don't miss this.

My wife is begging us to move to HK. My wife and I were told to go to the Kowloon side of the harbor to view the nightly light show. We weren't expecting much, but when the music started we were drawn in like two kids looking at a huge wall of candy. It was awesome! Even without the show, the evening skyline of HK is a must see. Expect to return with some great pictures!

World Class Skyline. Hong Kong's Harbour and skyline is truly world class and is up there with Sydney Harbour as one of the best ever. It is best seen by catching the star ferry at any time of the day or night. Excellent views are available from both sides but the very best view is being based on the Kowloon side (especially on the TST promenade) and marvelling at the Hong Kong Island skyscrapers. The skyline is also well viewed from the top of the Victoria Peak. When I return to HK I know that I will also make time to take in the Skyline views.

Beautiful, from either side of Victoria Harbor. Of course, some vantage points are better than others, but whether day or night, the sights never fail to impress. It's no surprise most buildings in HK often have huge clear glass windows on the side facing the harbor.You'll notice a bit of smog on bad days though.

A must-see!. One of the most beautiful skylines I've seen! Wonderful to walk along the harbor, taking in the breathtaking view of the city lights. You can enjoy the "Symphony of Lights" in the evenings as well! Definitely a must-see!
What a skyline. When the weather is clear (not always the case), Hong Kong by night is quite a view and is worth a look. We spent 4 nights and never got tired of it.

One of the world's great skylines. If you come to Hong Kong and are staying on the mainland at Wan Chai as I was, it is a must do to get Star Ferry and cross to Kowloon to see the view both by day and by night.
This is well worth seeing and in my eyes comes second to Sydney Harbour from the Bridge Pylon

Serious Sight!. Went in July, rainy season - we waited around for the rain to clear up to ensure we made the most of our trip. While we didn't get to see any junks, it was such a sight - the buildings, the water, the activity. At night, there was a light show too that was a sure sight. Postcardesque, seriously. Food along the boardwalk. I believe I recall a Starbucks on the avenue.
hong kong. Busy place but easy and cheap to get around. People are most helpful. Little bits of gardens in unused areas. Walking is interesting and sometimes what you find is just lovely.

Simply Beautiful. One of the most amazing skyline in the world, that becomes magic at the sunset when the lights illuminate Victoria Harbor and the traditional junks. A stroll on Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade is by itself worth a visit to HK.

One of the great views. We visited the Museum of Art in Kowloon and discovered almost be accident that it has the best view of the skyline on Hong Kong island. There is a promenade at the museum that gives an uninterrupted view of the Hong Kong skyline from Central through Wan Chai, Causeway Bay to North Point. You need an ultra wide lens to capture the spectacular vista.Follow it up with a trip back to the Island on the Star Ferry for a slightly different perspective (costs less than HK$3 for the crossing)
wow. this is one of the most picturesque things we have seen in hong kong. the view of the skyline is speechless.congratulation to all the people who worked for it.

Stunning. The skyline of Hong Kong is up there with New York or Sidney. It doesn't matter what time of day you decide to look at it day or night you just get that wow factor but best seen from the Kowloon side looking back at Hong Kong Island. The architecture is impressive with skyscrapers getting taller and creative in design. At night the laser light show on them is in itself a work of art. A must see on your list of things to do and see in Hong Kong.

HK light show and Kowloon Harbor walk. I was surprised that this show still exists as it uses a lot of light energy and coordination. From the Hong Kong side, we watched the various buildings changing their colors and designs for about 30 minutes before the music began. The music coordinated the laser lights on the tops of many HK buildings, flashing toward Kowloon for 5-10 seconds at a time. To get photos required a really fast camera.Since the light show started at 8PM , many people walk the length of the fantastic walk along the harbor on the Kowloon side. In addition to various shows/exhibitions/minstrels performing, there was a tribute to numerous Chinese movie stars and places to get on a harbor taxi or dinner ship. This walk was not finished on our last visit but has become a must-see in HK. Hope the light show stays on.

Best I have ever seen!. Make sure that you see the skyline during day as well as in the evening. Seeing the skyline from a boat is the way to go. It is quite relaxing and you get to see different areas of Hong Kong skyline.

The best skyline in the world perhaps. HK is known for tall extravagant buildings & if you are one of those types who marvel at such concrete skylines then HK is the place to visit. The laser light show with music certainly enhances the experience.
Amazing colour and movement. Standing on promenade near the clocktower at 8 pm for the light show was great! Make sure your camera battery is full!

Big City - Bright Lights. My last visit to Hong Kong was about 18 months ago, until last night I had forgotten how brilliant the night lights are from both sides of the Harbour. Travelling on the Bus last night watching the light show around 8pm was spectacular - the view of the Kowloon and Hong Kong Island skyscrapers from my hotel around 10pm last night kept me watching without taking my eyes from the display.
A picture is worth 10,000 words. Visit, soak up and enjoy the skyline from anywhere in the city especially on a clear day or night, it is something magical.

Covered in smog. I can see why this might be stunning, but during our 6 night stay Hong Kong, everywhere was covered in thick smog the whole time so you cant actually see the skyline until you are close.
Mandatory!!!!. One thing is see it on TV and one live!! It has the WOOOOW factor. YOU can see the famous views of HongKong

the tall view. hong kong skyline is a wonder. worth seeing at least once and to catch good, amazing views for free, just hop on to the 41 floor of the bank of china tower and enjoy! esp interesting is the view from across the harbour, kowloon side.
Awesome. The skyline is vast and so beautifully lit up at night. The laser light show is an added attraction. This can best be seen from the ferry crossing the harbor.

Beautiful Hong kong. Hong kong have a stuning view you will not regret to see it at night from the Hong kong island or the kowloon side as this is not my first trip to hong kong I do not do the tourist attraction but the view is just beautiful
wow!. Wow! Hong Kong at night is beautiful, the skyline is something to see, worth the trip! You need to experience it from Kowloon and from Hong Kong Island!
tough weather. It was cloudy and rainy our whole visit. We saw the Peak on time for approximately 15 minutes. Our guide didnt let the weather deter us.

Breathtaking view, hilarious light show. You can't visit Hong Kong without viewing the lit up skline from across the harbour in TST, the view is absolutley stunning. Also make sure to catch the hilarious light show that happens nightly around 7 where all of the buildings flash in time to cheesy chinese music, its a spectacle of pure genious.

Amazing - My favourite skyline in the world. The Hong Kong skyline is actually breath taking. Makes you really feel like you are in a futuristic city. Go to Kowloon for the best experience. Or if you can get on a junk at night then you will truly be impressed.
The must in HK. We walked along the promenade and enjoyed views in different time. Definitely, night view is just outstanding.
wow a lovely skyline. lovely HK skyline. Must see!! and remember to take lots of snaps. Go in the evening preferably and watch the lights show daily at 8pm.

A must do in Hongkong !. The Hongkong skyline from the Kowloon side is a must must see ! The walk along the Promenade is beautiful and the weather makes all the difference I feel.It was overcast and windy and we enjoyed the nip in the air.
The view of the city is breathtaking and something which is unforgettable,one of the best experiences in HK

sky line. Better than NYC and Singapore in our opinion especially on a clear day. Good idea to watch the nightly light show from the Avenue of Stars as you can also hear the music. We watched in from the hotel and didn't realize there was music on. it was awesome.
Breathtaking. World-class in every way. A real visual thrill. For the best view, make your way to the waterfront promenade on Kowloon just adjacent to the Star Ferry terminal

Stunning!. See it before the smog swallows it up. One of the best skylines of the World but sadly is becoming more difficult to see clearly. Take a trip up the peak on the tram to see it at dusk, one of the best aspects of our trip.

Better than NYC and Singapore. Better than NYC and Singapore in our opinion especially on a clear day. Good idea to watch the nightly light show from the Avenue of Stars as you can also hear the music. We watched in from the hotel and didn't realise there was music

dont miss the light show.. u need to be in the Kowloon side to enjoy this fully. the buildings light up and a light show starts every day from around 7 for about 20 mts its in tune to music played at the stand, which is the best place to be to view it. its free of charge and refreshing to see hk by night.

Enjoyable.. We really enjoyed the tram ride to the Peak.
Had lunch in the Bubba Gump Restaurant.
Would recommened to go early as lines get long.

Breathtaking. You feel almost as if you are in a Sci Fi Movie. I've seen it on tv of course but you suddenly get the realisation of how many people there actually are in the world. That was the feeling I got as I lived in the moment and took it all in.
the best. Ever changing and never boring and time of day. Also hosts a laser show at 8pm every night, with a number of highrise buildings beaming lasers in time to rather awful music.
View from Kowloon. Be sure to be on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong to catch the night show on the Skyscrapers, then go to Clarke Quay and have dinner on the riverside, not to be missed!
take a ferry ride at sunset. The harbour is beautiful any time of day, in fog, sun and especially at night, but gorgeous from the ferry at sunset.
Great show!. We bought a boat ride but I would rather enjoy the view from the Kawloon side. Boat ride was way too long for 15 min. show. This show goes every day from 20:00 till 20:15.
Awesome. Great, even in a cloudy day. Just head to TST via Ferry and be there for 8pm. I had cloudy day but it was still great.

Fantastic. What can anyone say about the spectacular Hong Kong skyline that hasn’t already been said?
Even when it is misty it is still spectacular.
One thing amazing about the skyline is to think that about half the world’s sky scrappers are here and they have been constructed using traditional bamboo scaffolding rather than the more usual steel scaffolding.

Hong King Skyline. must see at Hk
was very windy and chilly (April'03)
8:00 pm, music and lazer show, donot miss it
get a good vantage point, else you will not be able to enjoy

Just beautiful. If you want to have the best views of Hong Kong skyline you have two good options, one is to take the star ferry at night from kowloon to hong kong and back and the second one is to go to the Grand Hyatt Hotel and dine at the Grissini restaurant asking for a table next to the window. Those are the best views in my opinion

Pity about the Smog. We hung around for the nightly lazerlight show - which while, cool, wasn't nearly as good as the shows we had seen in Singapore etc. No dobut the dense fog/smog at the time had a lot to answer for. Otherwise, just like any great skyline HK rates highly!

Light Symphony show. No need to take a boat ride to see the HK skyline, you can perfectly enjoy it from Kawloon side. Find a Star boulevard-walk and take wonderful pics from that point.If you have chance, go to either side of harbour around 7-8 pm to see the Light Symphony show.
best in the world. go to tsim sha tsui for the sunset and enjoy the view of all the different skyscrapers on hong kong island, with good weather enjoy the light show at 20:00
HK skyline. Hong Kong skyline can be easily enjoyed from Victoria Harbour...go in evening n enjoy the breeze... it's a good place to relax...

Great view. The skyline is impressive. However, it was so foggy when I visited. I recommend that you visit on a day with clear skies. Check the weather if you can. I also like the view of the harbor with the mountaineous tarrain.
FABULOUS and SPECTACULAR. This skyline was amazing we went down just about every night of our stay to have a look. At 8pm they have a lazer light show. Ferries stop in the harbour to view the show.
Breathtaking. Every time you see the skyline you just say "Wow". Although the light show is overrated the actual skyline itself is unparalleled anywhere.

Amazing Skyline. Spent many hours just sitting on the harbour looking at the skyline - day and night. Cannot recommend enough. The best skyline in the world. No picture does it justice compared to being there and experiencing it.

World's best Skyline. Sorry Manhattan, but Hong Kong has the world's best skyline. With more skyscrappers than any city in the world, the Hong Kong skyline is worth the trip itself. On a great day Victoria Peak gives the best views of the skyline, however if the weather isn't great then head over to Kowloon to get some superb views.

Unforgettable!. The famous Hong Kong Skyline is one of the most beautiful things in the world, a line of skyscrapers long miles, one next to the other, from the Harbour close to the tower bell or the Museum of Arts is the best vantage point to admire this architectural beauty.The first few seconds you'll spend watching this beauty is easy to remain speechless.Very impressive by day but nothing compared to the show at night with all the lights on the buildings that are reflected on the channel that runs through the city. You must absolutely go to testify in front of this beauty.

Spectacular skyline. The high buildings are quite impressive during the day but really come alive once night falls and they are lit up. Worth viewing the Symphony of Lights from the Kowloon side especially if you get the added spectacle of an electrical storm going on in the background as happened the night we visited.
Cloudy and raining part of the time.. Nice temperature around +23 C. Lots of people, minding their own business. People average friendly. We enjoyed the stay.

Asia's most impressive skyline!. To enjoy the best view of the Hong Kong skyline, here are the two best options:1) Morning/day time - board the Star Ferry from Tsim Sha Tsui to Victoria Harbour - the view is simply breaktaking2) Evenings/night time - take a casual stroll along the windy Avenue of Stars to watch the Symphony of Lights show daily at 8pm and also the skyline lighted up at night.
Brilliant. Hands down the most incredible skyline I have ever seen. The symphony of lights is incredible, and although the weather was overcast it was still incredible. Worth the trip in itself!

One of a kind view.. The view of Hong Kong from Victoria Peak the Harbour or just about anywhere in Hong Kong needs to be seen to feel the atmosphere. No photo does it justice. The view in daytime is amazing however the view at night with all the lights is awesome.A walk along the harbour in the evening is an experience you will remember.

Just Brilliant. Having family in HK I have been lucky enough to visit this place numerous times.The syline is amazing and you can see why its used in so many movies these days.The Peak - AMAZING views above the city, especially on a clear day so you can look right out over the bay etc. You can jump a taxi up the peak, walk up if your bonkers or like most get on the tram ride.The Star ferry - really nice ferry boat ride thats nice by day, fantastic by night..Pictures to followThanks
absolutely one of my favorite of hong kong. love hong kong's skyline from both Hong Kong Island side and Kowloon sidechilling by the harbour watching the ships rolling back and forth
very nice. overall it is a very nice skyline with mountains in the back. It was very foggy when i was there but it still looked nice

Hope for a clear night. The first night in the city my view was obscured by rain and fog. But the next 2 nights I enjoyed the laser colored lights and the ships plying the harbor from the comfort of my hotel room with a glass of wine in hand. I've been to half the countries of the world and I can tell you that this view is magnificent!
Worth a look. Great view from the Hotel Icon, which is across the water in Kowloon Especially pretty at night, but the laser light show is overrated. Also, go to the top of Victoria Peak at dusk.

One of the must see views of the world. Best view is either from the Victoria Peak or from the Kowloon shore promenade. Go to the peak before it gets dark, have dinner (Buppa Gump is a favourite), then you get to see both the day and nighttime view. Take the tram to the peak, but go a weekday if you can to avoid the queues.At eight pm each night there is a light and laser show that displays across all the major high rise buildings. This is best viewed from the Kowloon side from the shore promade. It is a nice walk, start from the star ferry terminal and walk westward in front of the museums.

Stunning Skyline. Viewed from Avenue of Stars on the Kowloon side by night. It certainly rates in the top 3 world skylines. The brightly lit boats enhance the atmosphere too.We stood in front of it for about an hour, waiting for the Symphony of Stars - the famous laser light show every evening at 8pm. Please dont waste your time waiting, the pictures on the web are better.

Light Show over rated. the Hong Kong Skyline is very impressive but the light show at 8am each night is very overated.Each building has some wonderful lighting and laser effects but the whole show didn't seem to fit together really well.Needs a spercial choreographer like those that do the olympic lightshows to pull all the lighting effects together and make it something really special.Light and music show only last about 15 minues and we viewed from underneath a covered area adjacent the convention centre. This was away from all the crowds on Avenue of the Stars and still gacve a great view.With some ploish it could be a great show.
Excellent views...great if a couple. Really beautiful views at night. Seriously romantic if traveling as a couple. Sadly I was on travel with my mate Dave. Oh well...I still enjoyed the views. ^^

Looking forward to nightime. Even though this is still impressive in daylight hours, you really have to see this in the hours of darkness. Viewing from the very affordable ferries or from a vantage close to the Avenue of Stars, you really get a feel for this place. The lightshow adds to the enjoyment and leaves you with a great sense of awe. Well worth a visit!

Mesmerized, Day and Night!. Hong Kong skyline is where you will find both excitement and peace at the same time. The cement forest that has buildings tightly fitted together, surrounded by residential high rise buildings. During the day, you will how meticulous all these buildings, each with its own character, to stand out among others. At night, the lights from all these buildings will light up, twinkle with the busy night life as people leave their work and have family and friends time. Each window tells a story.As you take in the busy lifestyle, it’s separated by the breathtaking Victoria Harbour. Either you are at TST Promenade, Avenue of the Stars, or in Central or Wan Chai or even Victoria Park, or even at top of the Peak by the tram, you will be able to enjoy every inch of Hong Kong, from every corner and perspective that will simply have you mesmerized with its serenity in this fast pace city.

Awesome. Hongkong skyline is awesome. Whether you view it at day or night but imho night is always the best with all the colors and reflections on the water. During my recent visit in early april it was a bit foggy during the day, but spectacular at night. We took star ferry from kowloon to wanchai, hongkong for only hkd2 per person and enjoyed very much the trip and the night view.

Beautiful night time skyline lights. When in Hong Kong, you must have a night time trip on the ferry to view the island skyline! The ferry equates to about 30cents AU$ so it is a cheap trip. The view is best looking towards the island (heading toward Central) but it can be viewed whilst travelling in either direction as you can simply turn around. The bright lights and tall building are breathtaking, this is suitable for absolutely everybody.

Up there with New York City. A beautiful skyline whether viewing from the Hong Kong Island side, Kowloon side or from Victoria Peak. Very modern. There's something good to be said about the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. I always enjoy it.

No visit to HK complete without it!. On a clear night take the Star Ferry across to Kowloon from HK Island and check out the views from the water - they are amazing. It's worth taking the ferry purely for the views.
lights. was a little foggy so never saw the full effect enjoyed the river ride and the lights danced along with the music which was worth seeing.

Better at night. I think that this is the place to take some nice pictures to show once you are at home. Probably better at nigt when all the lights are on and you can take a nice view off the singular skyline of Hong Kong.

A bit of everything. Hong Kong from the Peak (particularly at night) is not to be missed. On the other hand try walking up to Lion Rock (Kowloon), go out to Stanley and the beaches on the way; wander down Nathan Road; or navigate the markets in Mong Kok or Sham Shui Po. Everywhere there seems something of interest in this very diverse place.

Tall buildings, lots of lights. strolling along the water, take in the avenue of the Stars( statue of Bruce Lee and Chinese. Tamrms handprints --Jackie Chan etc) while waiting fior the 8 pm light show. There are also many cafes with outdoor seating if you dont want to fight the crowds.
Rivals NYC. This is a great skyline no matter where you are looking at it from. Hong Kong is a beautiful city. Lots of interesting architecture on both sides.

Cracking View. This is one of the best views of a city skyline I have seen!
Superb across Victor Harbour. Seeing this at night time as well as the day is a must.
The 8pm light show was not incredible but it is worth experiencing.
It is what makes Hong Kong famous. You have to see this for yourself as no pictures will ever do it justice. The 8pm light show is a must.

Best Skyline in the World. If you like cities and skyscrapers then Hong Kong is definitely the place for you. The skyline is awesome, and at 8pm every night they have a light display which you can watch from the Avenue of the Stars.

Awesome. Every night at 8pm you will be amazed by the vibrant spectacular light and sound show. Everyone gathers and camers flash and videos are taken for this magical moment. After walk into Kowloon and visit ladies market where you will find great shopping

Impressive Skyline. The skyline of Hong Kong is simply impressive and the nightly light show (8pm) just adds to it. Don't miss this free attraction and remember to take a tripod along if you want any night shots during the light show. Best spot to view is probably the observation deck near the star ferry terminal but it can be a bit crowded, especially at weekends. Still, there's enough space all around to watch and take pictures. If you're outside the range of the loudspeakers, tune your mobile phone's FM radio to 103.4FM along the harbour front to listen to the music during the show. If you want a different view of the skyline, then try the view from Sam Ka Tsuen. Either take a ferry from near Sai Wan Ho MTR station, or MTR to Yau Tong and walk towards the water. The view from there is different to what you see on postcards but no less impressive.

The Symphony of Lights, spectacular, a must at dusk.... Get to the Promenade, any spot, by 8 PM. The show lasts a half an hour, spend the rest of the time people watching...and thereis lot of that. When satisfied with that uplifting activity , walk to Temple Street Night market for browsing and food of any description...continue with (browsing) people watching until late at night, don't miss the last METRO at midnight.
Very impressive. I enjoyed taking the ferry to Kowloon to see Hong Kong Island lit up at night it's a must see. Also the cable car to the top of the hill gives you a birds eye view.
Super Skyline. There are so many skyscrapers and lights that a ride on a double decker bus or tram or ferry becomes an unforgettable experience.

Arguably The Best. I’m not big on skyline and don’t take a lot of time to even notice. But, the Hong Kong skyline is so striking it commands attention. I have actually spent hours looking at this skyline and there’s still so much to see. I might be a bit bias because I already like large, crowded cities and this one is very clean to boot (I know some areas are lacking, but It’s primarily very nice).The various buildings, though not a complete match, fit perfectly with one another somehow. The Hong Kong harbour is the perfect accent which brings a uniqueness not found many other places. I love it.

Pretty Spectacular !. We saw this show in Mid March 2013 from the Kowloon side. It gets quite crowded so get there early as it is advantageous to have a first line seat at the harbor rail. We were by the Clock Tower so we could also hear the accompanying music which enhanced the show. The show is about 15 minutes and definately worth seeing. You get more enjoyment if you know what buildings names are. The Elements building has a light show every nite - showing clouds, sky and airplanes taking off. We had a view of this from our hotel room. A great magical experience overall!

Great view if there is no fog that is!. It's only worth going if there is no fog (ask at the reception desk as they will not tell you unless you ask which in my opinion is not very fair) the day we went, we didnt think there was fog until we got to the top of the skyscraper!!! We couldnt see anything which was a real shame as I saw pictures of what we should have seen and it looked amazing. We enjoyed leaving love/friendship notes on the heart shaped papers! I will definitely go again next time!!
Fantastic. One hour was here to see the HOng Kong skyline was absolutely fantastic. The atmosphere was open and really relaxing, especially the night coming

Excellent if not for the haze. somehow, the haze seems to be a constant blanket of gloom over HK and that has cost us some precious scenery/view of the hong kong skyline on top of the peak... Nonetheless, we could still make out the bright lights in the NYC of the east!

Spectacular, view at night. One of the world's best skylines. Best viewed from Arena of Stars or from the Star Ferry. Come just before the sun sets and watch it transform as the lights start coming on. If viewing it during the Symphony of Lights, better come early or move along the area as there is quite a long stretch where you can view the show.

Take the boat at 8 PM to enjoy the show. Go there on a cloudy night and you will get incredible pictures ! Every night from 8 PM there is a show, the best would be to take the boat so you can see both sides of the bay.
Hong Kong skyline is magical. Best to see at nightime. Fantastic buildings and love the daily laser show. Try to see from Pacific Club or on Star Ferry
The Avenue of the Stars. 'The Avenue of the Stars' , a few minutes walk from The Langham, is the best spot to view Hong Kong Skyline.
Can't beat it. Once again this is something to experience around sunset. With the sun still up, then with the sky going orangey, and then with all the lights of Hong Kong. Amazing.
One of the bear skylines. Great view from Avenue of the stars. Best to avoid during symphony of lights at 8pm each evening, which wasn't that impressive.

Fantastic light show. Not much more to be said than is in the title for this piece. Every night about 8pm the various buildings in Hong Kong put on a light show which is wonderful to see. Although is does make you wonder why you bother with energy saving bulbs at home.

Great especially at night and with fireworks. From Victoria Harbour: take the boat to go from Hong Kong Island to Kowloon, it's a nice experience with a great view to the Skyline.The Skyline is an unique experience especially when you are at Hong Kong at New Year's eve or at chinese new year: the fireworks are breathtaking!

quite a...cold feeling. Went to visit the new Skyline , and have to say was quite a cold experience ! First because of the air conditioning , they still don't get that most of the people are not directly related with penguins .....]Then the ambient is also not so stylish in my opinion , quite synthetic...... and of course is just about the souvenirs selling stands or crappy pictures ....All in all is much better to go to Ozone Bar , the view is much better , the ambient is much cooler and you can enjoy the panorama having your mohito.....what's more from life ?

World famous for a reason!. Gorgeous, especially at night. Great views from Avenue of Stars. I have to say that the 'Symphony of Lights' was pretty disappointing, but the lily didn't need gilding! A truly world class view.
Wondrous. May be the best skyline in the world, especially at night with the laser show. And daytime is always fascinating with all the harbor traffic. A world-class experience.
Spectacular skyline. Love the ferry ride across the harbour. Don't much care for the milling masses in Central. More space to move around in TST.

Unbelievable from Star Ferry and the Peak. We went as soon as we'd stowed our things at the hotel, taking the Star Ferry across, and then waited for the No. 15 double-decker public bus (which was a 30 minute wait). We arrived at the Peak around 9.15 pm, and most of the mall was closed, and the place was empty-- but that was fine with us! Wonderful experience, we only left because we were afraid we'd miss the last bus down.

It really touches the sky .... it is the trademark of Hong Kong, its the best. We took a bus ride from the Avenue of Stars and I believe that it is a better view of the skyline from Kowloon side. We thoroughly enjoy the symphony of lights show which was excellent show of laser lights and animation through them, I have lots of photos of Hong Kong sky line and i love them

It's really breath-taking.. If you're into cities, Hong Kong is amazing and the skyline is stunning. See it from the top of Mount Victoria on a clear day, but I echo other reviews that say see it from the Star Ferry. The trip across the harbor gives you a good view of the skyline day or night and the trip costs HK$2.00. OR, take the Star Ferry cruise at 7:55 pm to see the light show. You're out for an hour cruising around. The boat they use isn't one they use for ferry service but for their harbor cruises. The day I went was rainy, misty, foggy, very low ceiling, etc. Until it was time for the harbour lights cruise and it turned crystal clear. There were still storms around so in the background was spectacular lightning to go with the lights of the skyline. I hope you get that lucky. (One thing, the harbour cruise costs a lot more than 2.00. I think the harbour lights cruise is HK$170, or about US$20.)
shocking. trademark Hong Kong it is definitely the best views we have seen for a long long time. Night view is even more breathtaking

Who said sky is the limit!!!. Hong Kong Skyline is right up there amongst the best. We took a stroll along the Avenue of Stars and I guess that is a better view of the skyline.We did not enjoy the symphony of lights show which was quite ordinary, but that does not take the charm off the tall skyscrapers that make Hong Kong a vertical city.
memorable view from Kowloon, at night. make the effort to see it - on a clear night, its very impressive.It has to be one of the world must see things
Best in the world. Honestly, I've been to many cities in the world, but HK by far has the best skyline. Take the harbour Ferry from Central to TST, you wont regret it

Take the Star Ferry. Use the Star Ferry as a great way to see the Hong Kong Skyline as it is amazingly cheap and a fun ride. It is also fun to walk the waterfront from the Star Ferry Terminal to the Intercontinental Hotel for great vistas and especially at 8pm nightly for the lazer light show. Although, you may not think it, the Hong Kong skyline is also facinating to see from Victoria Peak too.

Avenue of Stars. I just love it there, esp. on a clear night. It seems they are putting up more seating areas, which are still not enough in my opinion. On the Kowloon side you will find the Avenue of Stars, which has hand prints from lot's of famous people along the way. A good place to spend a little more time is in front of Bruce Lee's statue where people imitate his posture and take pictures. It is always fun to watch those happenings.The laser show starts at 8 pm and is a must see when in HK. I have seen it lot's of time but enjoy it every time again.

One of the best skylines in the world. I sat on a bench for over an hour at sunset watching the buildings come alive. I've lived in NY and NJ for years and love the NYC skyline. This was right up there. The light show was also pretty neat to see and worth it.
makes vegas look like a 2 stop light town. Wish we could have seen it when it wasnt too foggy. We could not see the light show, but the Ferry ride was awesome at night.

Great on either side of the harbour.. Not really a tourist attraction as you cannot avoid seeing the Hong Kong skyline whether viewing it from Star ferry (my favourite) or looking from Kowloon side across to Central or from Causeway Bay to Kowloon side or from the bars on the 4th floor of the IFC building across to the ICC and TST.

Hong Kong Skyline and other places. A real wow factor. Visit to Seeva Bar in Hong Kong financial district the views of the Harbour were amazing. Buy a visit at the Border if you are visiting Shenzhen for a great shopping trip to China. Have to pay in Chinese currency not Hong Kong Dollars and cost us £34 for visa over there rather than getting in in London which would cost circa £85. Barter down in China and pay around a third of what they were asking but in Hong Kong Ladies Market you pay about 50% or what they ask. Have a foot massage in China right near the border...so cheap and amazing. Visit to Stanley...lovely trip by the coast with a shopping market.

Fantastic views. The HK skyline is truly magnificent and there are various places in the city where you can enjoy it from (for free :-)) My favorites are... - From the Victoria Peak (there are several vantage points around the peak to enjoy great views without having to fork out $$ to go up to the viewing deck at the Peak Galleria) where (on a clear day) you can appreciate the greenery of the mountains, the iconic buildings on HK island, the sea and the Kowloon skyline as well. Best enjoyed during day time, though evening views are nice as well.- From the TST promenade on the Kowloon side overlooking the Victoria Harbour and the Impressive HK island skyline... especially in the evening/ night as the buildings light up and there are wonderful multicolored reflections in the water. The sound and light show is much talked about but totally over-rated in my opinion. Don't rush to make it if you can't.- From the terrace of the IFC shopping mall... Overlooking the harbour and the Kowloon skyline. It's a public area and you can get your own food/ drinks and enjoy a leisurely evening.

Quite the light show. We were impressed by the daily lightshow at 8 PM. It must have been an enormous chellenge to get the collaboration from all the involved businessed. We watched from our hotel room but were unable to get the accompnying music on the radio so missed out on the full experience. The skyline in impressive!!

Unexpected!. One evening during our 2 night stay in Hong Kong we wandered down to the waterfront on Kowloon side. The view of all the buildings lit up is wonderful. It was quite a misty evening with low cloud. We did not know about the light show so it was a wonderful surprise and free!

Breathtaking. Take photos from star ferry or night cruise leave flash off! The symphony of lights show is worth seeing every night from eight. Night cruise gives a different perspective of the towering Hong Kong skyline.

A must for even return visitors. 8pm light show on Kowloon side (in TST) for about 15 minutes is a must. This must not be missed. It plays music and introduces the builds while lasers and lighting go off. Even after living in HK for more than 3 years back before the hand over this is still a must on every trip I take to HK and I would advise everyone to take the camera and see the skyline from the Kowlook and the Peak on every trip you make.
A short 2 min evening walk from the hotel. Great views over the Harbour for spectacular photos of the Homg Kong syline in the evening, as the neon fest fires up. This is an awesome view

A different view of Hong Kong. Great- you can see Hong Kong from above, which gives it a different perspective. The lift is an experience as well, as it climbs very rapidly. In the shopping mall below it, there is a Starbucks for those who are bored or appalled by the East's versions of Tea, Coffee, Hot chocolate etc.
Fabulous, just fabulous. We were lucky enough to stay at the fantastic Hotel Icon - harbour view room with floor to ceiling wall overlooking the harbour and skyline - fabulous just fabulous

On a clear night it is spectacular. I loved looking at the HK skyline from both Hong Kong Island and the Kowloon side....it was truly lovely to see all the skyscrapers lit up.I must say I was a bit unimpressed with the light show.....we had purposely booked a dinner cruise to coincide with being on the harbour for the show and it was a real let down.....not too sure if it has changed in recent time but I had always heard it was sensational but can't say I agree!

Post Card Picture Perfect. If you want to take home a beautiful picture of Hong Kong to your friends, the first choice is Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade, second is bird's eye view from the Peak, take MTR to Tsim Sha Tsui, follow sign to Star Ferry, Promenade is right next door, you will see the turtle shape building, which is Hong Kong convention exhibition centre, in 1997 this is where the Handover was held, this is Wan Chai, moving to the right, China Bank, Hong Kong Shangshai Bank and International Financial Centre is Central, Hong Kong airport express and airlines check-in located here, if time allow, take the Star ferry to Central, have lunch or dinner at IFC or take #15 bus to the Peak, the bus trip is about 40 minutes, depend on the traffic, once you reach the Peak, go up the roof with a fee, it's a sight you will not easily forget, it's more beautiful in the evening, don't go if the weather is foggy, you will not be able to see a thing, plenty of restaurants and shops here easily spand a half day. don't forget to bring your camera or I-Phone etc.

Catch the Sound/light show every sundown from the Kowloon Side. Hong Kong has a lot of really cool buildings. The best way to see the nightly sound and light show is from a boat tour in the harbour, next best is from the ferry, and next is from the Kowloon side. The Hong Kong island side is where everything is lit up, so you need to be across the water to see it.
Spectator city views. I liked the light show of the city at night.I disliked the mob scene at the ladies market and the approach made by individuals for the purchase of fake designer bags.
Beautiful skyline when weather is good. We had been recently to HK and was surprised to see the HK skyline. If the weather is good then you are able to enjoy by going on the Avenue of stars.

The HK skyline is great, don't bother with the laser show though. The HK skyline is amazing, but I wasn't particularly impressed with the music & laser show. Seems a bit over-hyped. Seeing the skyline at night though is a must!

great at night. One of the best night-time shorelines we have come across,their festival of light was a big comedown though,have experienced better shows eilsewhere,very crowded music a bit duff but hey its free.
Amazing city. Hong Kong island skyline is simply breathtaking. Could be spectaclar if not for the wet weather and mist.

Lazer show and a clear night - perfect combination!. We stood near to the TST star ferry pier and walked along the promenade to find an empty space and got our cameras ready! It was an amazing sight to see all the beautiful colours and lights on the buildings across HK island from Kowloon side. We then walked along and got a photo from one of the vendors for approx (HK$60) of the whole family with the skyline in the background which was a highlight of the holiday.
Not to be missed. Either from the Peak, Kowloon or any of the buildings, one of Hong Kong´s highlights day or night, sun or rain...

Fabulous. This has to be one of the best water side skylines in the world. By day, at dusk, by night, sunny or otherwise, its fabulous. We loved the view from Kowloon side looking back on the Island. Stop for a drink or afternoon tea at the Intercontinental Hotel (Kowloon side) just close to the ferry point and you won't be disappointed. The lounge overlooks the harbour (ground level) enjoy a beautiful view, watch the boats sail past the huge glass windows and enjoy the change as day turns to evening, the buildings light up and reflect their colours across the water. Magical.
Colorful of lights. Basically think it's over rated, nothing special. Maybe it's very crowded, can't really stand a good view.
Hong Kong is truly spectacular. Amazing city, cosmopolitan, vibrant, pretty, lush hills and water surround. Truly an amazing place and I have been to many. I will be back.
Night Show. At 8pm each night there is laser show on both sides of the harbour, well worth seeing from either Hong Kong island.
Hong Kong Skyline. Always fantastic and a pleasure to behold - from either side of the harbour - day or night. Simply one of the best in the world.

Took The Peak Tram. Great local experience, took the Peak tram with about 1 million locals. It was middle of Chinese New year. incredibly well organised. Everybody pushe and shoved it was just part of the scene. Once we got to the Peak the view was incredible. February and was very cold so rug up. Restaurants were good.
View from Victoria Peak. Wait for a clear day. No need to pay for viewing gallery. If able try walking, it gives a really good persepectve of the size of teh skyscrappers

Marvellous Skylines in the world. If you are visiting Hong Kong then you have to proud to visited the city with Highest Density of Skyscrappers in the world. Hong Kong is the city having the highest number of Skyscrappers in the world, it has exceeded New York, Shangai, Dubai and Taiwan in the number of Sky Scrappers that has been constructed. There are couple of wantage points in Hong Kong which offers the spectacular view of Sky Scrappers but the most amazing view are from the Star Ferry Terminal, Avenue of Stars and the Peak. These places offers very good view of skyline and if you are visiting on a clear day with no haze then it would be one of the best photographs that you can capture in your cameras.
HonkKong Skyline. beautiful skyline, busy and dazzling, as long as the smog doesnt roll in. could stay and watch this for hours
Nice touch. The light so is nice and gives you something to do before or after dinner.However it could be better. But you get what you pay for. So with that it is entertaining.

Magificent Skyline. I have always been awed by the Hong Kong skyline, whether by day or night. The Symphony of Light show in the evening is something that needs to be seen to be fully appreciated. The towers of Hong Kong are aglow with colour. If you find yourself in Hong Kong watch the light show; you won't be disappointed.

Best way to see it. Star Ferry.Star Ferry.Star Ferry.So nice it bears repeating thrice.Don't miss it.at 2.5 $HK its the best deal in the world.If you're already on the Kowloon side, just go to to the water front opposite the Peninsula Hotel and stroll along the cheesy Walk of Stars ( behind the Sogo department store). Even then Star Ferry is worth the trip to HK Island as there its hard to beat the view from the water.

Incredible. The skyline is incredible day and night. We missed the nightly light show as we were doing a night time bus tour but other people we spoke to raved about it. We got a fantastic view of the skyline when leaving Hong Kong on a cruise ship, despite the fact that there was torrential rain at the time.

Shame about the weather. The view of the island skyline from the ferry and Kowloon is majestic. However it was marred by the persistent mist that pervades the area. Photos of the skyline are ghostly. However the same view at night when the hotels and buildings are lit up is amazing and needs to be seen.
Only Shanghai Competes!. Great architecture!!! The skyline on both sides of Victoria Harbor is magnificent!! Something to see!!!
Amazing Buildings. You don't have to be an architect to be amazed by these enormous glass buildings. On a clear da they shine in the sunlight and at night they take on a new life.
amazing. every time you see the night skyline you want to take another photo the difference from day to night is amazing especially the light show
Like None Other. You have to see it to believe it. Although there's plenty talk of light pollution, the skyline is spectacular at day or night.

Hong Kong at night is a spectacular photo op!. Hong Kong is typically busy but watch the skyline at night from Kowloon side and you get a feast for the eyes. If you're a photography enthusiast, be prepared to bring a tripod and sit back to soak in the beauty of the shapes and lights.

Absolute must see. Must see in HK, in my opinion best seen from Kowloon. View is wonderful and so iconic day or night. Agree with previous review that lazer show is over-rated. Tip:watch it from the bar in one of the Kowloon hotels like Panorama by Rhombus or Intercontinental, it only lasts about 12mins anyway.

Stunning Skyline. Whether viewed from Kowloon side, Victoria Peak, or the executive lounge at the Conrad, we enjoyed the Hong Kong skyline every night of our stay. The harbor offers a light show every evening to cap off a nice meal or start a night of entertainment.

Good things to see in Hong Kong. It would be sad to go to Hong Kong and not go up in the tram to the Peak. When the view is clear the view is amazing; just don't get disheartened by the attempts to turn it into a grand shopping experience. Then,by contrast to this, make another special trip- take the Star Ferry over to the opposite side of the Harbour and walk along the promenade there awaiting the laser light show at 8pm. This is entirely free and well worth seeing. Somehow doing both at the same time merges views of old and new Hong Kong.
Beautiful to watch. HK skyline was amazing to watch especially when the weather is clean. Stay at the Kowloon side for a dinner and enjoy the view of this stunning city afterward

Super View. Amazing skylineHong Kong has an amazing skyline. The good thing is that you can see it from multiple directions and locations. Take a Ferry to Kowloon, look down at it from The Peak, enjoy the light show at night, the best thing about it is it Free.
You must see that. If you are in Hong Kong you must see the Skyline...day time and night time... Great experience and cost only 20cents each way...
An always changing skyline. We were there on sunny days and took the bus to the Peak for a better view. It was one of the clearer days en we enjoyed the view.
Beautiful pictures. This is such a great place to take great photos and what not. It is a great picturesque site and has incredible views.

Hong Kong at night. The Hong Kong skyline seen from Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon, which is impressive during the day, comes alive at night when the skyscrapers get lit up. There is also a laser show at 20.00, but it did not really add much to the spectacular light show already there.

I expected more from the laser show. The Hong Kong skyline is very impressive and very colourfull at night. We waited for the nightly laser show which we viewed from Kowloon but were disappointed - perhaps because I have been to Disney in America where they really put on an impressive light and firework show - perhaps I expected too much?

One of the most infamous sights in HK. A trip to HK would never be complete without seeing the most popular skyscraper horizons via either on the Kowloon side or from Hong Kong island. Seeing it at both night or day is exemplary and while I didn't see the skyline from atop 'The Peak' during the day, the night time spectacle from atop the mountain and below from across the harbor on the Kowloon side was awesome and somewhat reminded me of what the tip of Manhattan looks like as you're approaching from the ferry. Whether choosing to view from atop 'The peak' or from across the harbor, there are always shops nearby to give those something to do and small eateries to get some food for those who have worked up an appetite.

Ocean Park. The park is located in a rather large area on the side of Hong Kong Island. The aquarium is marvelous. It is designed for visitors to see the living organisms that live in varying depths of the ocean. For instance, we saw sand sharks circling the bottom of the aquarium floor looking for prey while large rays glided above them... It was a wonderful exhibit. Also, taking the tram ride was quite invigorating because it goes along the cliff side. The scenery was breathtaking!
Victoria Peak -The best view in Town!. The tram is great.Fabulous views from high up but best seen on a sunny day as cloudy days can spoil the impact.
Fabulous at night!. Hong Kong skyline is amazing with the skyscrapers reaching upwards while the star ferries and junks cross over the water from one island to another.
views above and below. Foggy during the day this visit but illuminating at night. Quite eerie but beautiful on the harbour at night and a little cold.

Picture Perfect. Great harbor view with the laser light show that starts daily at 8pm. Intercontinental Hongkong at Tsim Sha Tsui has the best view. What makes it more interesting is when the Sampan sails across the harbor with I.M.PEI's [Bank of China Tower] and Norman Fosters' [HSBC Building] modern marvels lights it's path.

It's OK - Unique Perhaps - But Short. We heard about the night light show on Hong Kong island that you can see from the Kowloon shoreline, across the harbor, and we decided to see it. Laser lights turn on and off in coordination with music. The buildings across the harbor were decked out in nice lighting and, even without the light show, were an enjoyable sight. The additional laser greenish lights used with the light show added a dimension to the view, but I was somewhat disappointed. The performance didn't last ong. Many people were at the shoreline. It's not hard to reach, but did involve a bit of a walk.
Makes NY look small. The view from Kowloon to the Hong Kong Island side is an impressive sight from every angle. Come at night where you can see a a short laser show at 8pm every night.
light show. We were a bit non-plused by the light show....even viewed from the middle of the harbor. I wold rather go to the Ritz and see the view

Chill. Good view for a cultural city, its always best when it isn't as foggy!
Check the scenery on clear skies
Best in the world!. Manhattan and Tokyo's skylines are pretty flat while Hong Kong's is topographically interesting! No other places in the world can be found such unique and beautiful one.
HK at Night. Great views at night with a laser light show every evening especially looking back from the mainland to HK island

So beautiful!! Go to the star ferry pier to see it.... I went to the star ferry pier, between the 4 and the 5th to see it. It starts at 20:00 every night.
It is a show of lights reflected in the buildings of Hong Kong Island that follow the rythm of the music.
Of course it is free, and it finishes at 20:20 more or less.

Icon of HK, experience of a lifetime!. If there is only one skyline in Asia that you can visit, it goes to HK! Breathing taking no matter view by walking along the harbor, taking the cruise or standing on the top of hill.

Fantastic view. We would spend two hours in the late afternoon here. That was all great and fantastic. we could see the highest buildings in the world and get fresh airof the Bay. Otherwise, could have some great and seasinal drinks were amazing.

Breathtaking. A must in Hong Kong. Probably best viewed at night time. Get to the "Alley Of the Stars" on the Kowloon Island. Be there at 19:45 so you grab a place with a decent view just in time for the "Symphony of Lights" laser show, starting each evening at 20:00. (Don't expect much of the laser show). Be prepared to take lots of photos:)Then take a walk along the "Alley of the Stars". Search for Bruce Lee and Jackie Chan:)

Cant see the stars but this'll do. Victoria harbor lights up ever night at 8. First time you see what the skyscrapers do it is really impressive. Not sure hk needs to be wasting all this power on a daily show though. Something to see.
Just like the movies. Seeing the skyline in person after being the backdrop of so many famous movies and events, is excellent. Obviously a must see in Hong Kong, just to take it all in

Stunning - even through the haze. Although the weather was pretty hazy when we were there, we never got bored of looking at the HK skyline and the amount of activity through the harbour is incredible - lovely to see a waterway still being used so much,

Amazing views. Although we went in winter we were lucky that most days were fairly clear. Best views were from Nobu, Intercontinental or Aqua (both on kowloon side). The peak was also abviously fantastic for views of the city. Again we seemed to get it on a good day.

Worth the trip but a bit out of the way. Liked - there was stuff for the kids to do there and the views.
Disliked - The shopping mall downstairs - full of high end European style shops. We weren't interested in that since we can get that back in the UK
Terrific!. The funicular takes you to Victoria Peak, one of the world's most impressive views over a city... It all seems so quiet up there.
Beautifull spot to enjoy. Enyoj the skyline show in the evening including the skytower laser show, its a spectacular thing to see the buildings glowing in the dark.
Amazing. Amazed by so many tall buildings everywhere. At times founfd the traffic noise and masses of people a little overwhelming.

Great Views. The skyline keeps on changing with ever higher skyscrapers going up. The largest is now the IC1 tower where the Ritz Carlton Hotel is on top. Their cocktail bar, The Ozone, is on the 118th floor and worth a visit.
lookit all the lights!. Spectacular buildings.The island looks better at night from TST. An alternative view is TST and part of the Island from the Peak Tram at night.
Great way to see the city!. Really great way to see the city, and exciting too, if you have an Octopus card, you can skip the queue!

It's crowded because it's awesome. After sunset, take the Star Ferry to TST and walk along the Kowloon public pier pedestrian promenade towards the Avenue of the Stars in East Tsim Sha Tsui. This has to be one of the greatest city views in the world, and something I have to do whenever I'm in HK. Yes, it's crowded, but it's also beautiful.

A must-see when in Hong Kong. In the day, you can walk along the Avenue of Stars while looking at the famous skyline. At night, the same stretch provides a different charm when the buildings get lit up. I was there on New Year's Day so there were a mixture of Christmas and New Year lightings on the buildings. However, the sights would probably be enjoyed on a clear day better than when everything is blurred due to the poor air quality so it pretty much depends on your luck to get a nice view.
Poor air quality ruined the view. It is a great view but the whole five days we were in Hong Kong the pollution levels were too high to be bothered taking photos

Beautiful Day & Night. The views of this city Skyline is just wonderful. We were staying at the Conrad Hotel on Hon Kong Island with a Harbour View room and if the day was clear the views were fabulous. Also you should travel to Victoria Peak to see the views of most of Hong Kong. Another is from the roof top bar, OZONE, in the Ritz Carlton on Kowloon.

Magnificent. It was fantastic at night. The lights neons and billboards were just amazing. There are some photographers all geared up to take photos for you. Did a but of bargaining with them and ended up paying HKD100 for 2 beautiful 6R prints. For a hundred bucks - worth it.
Fantastic on a clear night. Unfortunately, Hong Kong has few clear nights. If your lucky to be there on one such evening, take advantage of it. You won't regret it.
Very pretty -- day and night. Two great places to get a view: Go up to Victoria Peak at night. Alternately, TST harbor area provides excellent views both night and day.
A spectacular experience. Harbour cities seem to have such an added beauty and mystic over the landlocked others.Whether on the main land of the island, HK is truly a magnificent city.

Great, but only thing to do in HK. In my opinion, HK is more of a place for business, partying, and living. This is one of the few "tourist" places I went to, but it is worth it. The bus was a little confusing to get to.
Hongkong by night. At 8 p.m.started daily light show at Hongkong Harbour, amazing light show from the skyline of Hongkong Island during about 15 min.
