Fabulous. It’s a marvelous.Especially at night when you have the liht and sound show. Tshim Sha Sui peomonade would be the best place to view the skyline. It’s a free walk. Doesn’t cost anything.

I just love the colours, the life and the overall energy. I have been visiting Hong Kong for many years and I just love the energy of the place. Bright lights,busy,exciting and for me just intoxicating.
spectacular view. Impressive by day, but brilliant at night. Take the ferry across to Kowloon as the night light show begins at 8pm
Beautiful. Hong Kong skyline is best viewed from the Kowloon side. Take the ferry from Hong Kong island in the evening for the best experience.

Hard Beds and small rooms. Liked: Getting around and using the half day tour ordered from Viator was fantastic as you get an idea of where things are and many of your small questions are answerd by the tour guide.Dislikes: small room and hard beds. If you have a bad back or have problems moving ensure that you get a room with a stand up shower. Tiny bathrooms with bathtubs and water are a recipe for disaster.

It's best to join the open decked Big Bus tour in order to appreciate the city's skyline fully .. It's a fast paced city and everything seemed to move so fast , Just look after your valuables at all times . The food is good but it depends on individual taste too . The wet market is worth visiting around Mong Kok area . H.K. people likes everything fresh and live especially sea food . So it's interesting to see live creatures at the market .
I love Hong Kong. Don't leave HK without visiting Admiralty subway station. The view is breathtaking. My favorite building is Lippo Center.
Great view. The most beautiful skyline that i've never seen before. One hour here was great, lots of people coming at late afternoon once all amazing lights from building light up

Best viewed from The Peak. Utterly stunning, including the trip up in the mountain railway. Because you are at an angle the skyscrapers look like they are about to fall over! For the best effect, go up in daylight but still be there when dusk falls (plenty to do up there as well as enjoy the view), the buildings in Kowloon appear to rise from the blackness of the ocean. One of the best viewing experiences of my life.
Magic. Magic needs no explanation HK Harbour surpasses though it may be smaller than a few years back. I like it.

Finally, Hong Kong..... Made it at last. Definitely worth it. The whole Hong Kong experience. If you haven't been there already add it to your bucket list. It's definitely worth about 5 days of any bodies time.
What can you say?. WOW. Not much more you can say about it. So spectacular. I couldn't figure out where to look first. Night time over Victoria Harbor unparalleled!
Like no other skyline!. Impressive! Couldn't get enough of the views of the harbor. Enjoyed the view from the Star Ferry as well as from Victoria Peak.

By day or by night you wont be bored. You will never tire of seeing this skyline at night it is ever changing with the towers changing there lights, by day the shadows cast their spell. Thh Star Ferry is a great vantage point.
Spectacular. Huge laser and light show - the highlight of our visit to Hong Kong. There's a good viewing platform near the Star Ferry terminal in Tsim Sha Tsui.

Beautiful at night!. The lights & music display on the sides of the sky scrapers are quite amazing. Especially on the buildings where they have moving pictures, like a fish swimming up the side of the building.

more hype and smog than lights. We saw the lights form our hotel and went down to the water one night to see the light show as well. It was very smoggy that week we were there and we did not find the lights as spectacular as we wanted them to be. The view form the water was a bit cheesy with the music and the 5 buildings that participated in light show. The skyline I am sure is much prettier when it isn't under the shadow of smog, kinda out of anyone's control of course.
Fantastic. One hour here, that was fantastic, the noisy of vehicle mixing with amazing waves then lights turning up, made a great atmosphere.

great place to cool off and see the whole island.. Its great to go up there to take in the sights.i do warm you that the tram has 1.5 hours wait on average and if you get a Oyster card you can use it to board.Be careful when you wait for the tram as there is a gap in the railings where you can fall on to the tracks.
Dramatic Skyline. Amazing skyline that can be seen form quite a number of vantage points about the city. Particularly spectacular at night time
Eye Candy. The HK skyline is always a sight, but especially at night when many of the buildings are illuminated and sparkle with LED designs.

Breathtaking!. You think the skyline of Shanghai or Manhattan is exciting and imposing? It's nothing on Hong Kong! Especially from the vantage point of The Peak, where you can look down over the island, Kowloon, and Victoria Harbour. I've never seen a better view in my life.

Wonderful. Wonderful skyline at night, better from Kowloon... But also nice from HK Island. During the morning it's usually a bit foggy but clears up after 12... Definetly worth it!
Don't forget the laser show from 8.00 to 8.20 pm! Everynight! Again from Kowloon is better...

Stunning!!. We went just before Chinese New Year and the lights and skyline were spectacular. Walk along the Avenue of Stars in the evening and drink in the atmosphere! Lots of places to stop for a drink or bite to eat.
Meh. Just a walk thru. No need to wait for the light show. It is not worth the wait in the crowed street.
Spectacular. I loved the skyline and the light show. Hong Kong is one of the most entertaining city. Never boring.
The most wonderful in the world. It's simply beautiful, day or night. Don't miss the laser show at 8 pm! Best place to look at it is from the seafront by the museum of art.

What more does one want in life?. When you are in HK make sure you take the Star Ferry (for a dime, virtually) from TST to HK Island. I prefer this route because the buildings on HK side (the Peak side) are more spectacular at night. Get to the front of the ferry with a window seat, camera ready and steady (please, because the sea can be rough at times) and voila. Do bring a pashmina with you because sometimes the air-con is on full blast in the front section. With a night-light of the HK skyline like that, for free, what more does one want in life?
À must see. What can i add? Its beautiful and à real must see before you leave. You can go to THE Skybar and have à drink on THE top floor and see THE lightshow from there
Definitely worth visiting. Fantastic views except if cloudy. Light show worth seeing. Beautiful harbour especially viewed from the Peak.
sound & light show. At 8p.m every night there is a sound & light show highlighting the buildings on the waterfront, definitely worth seeing from the Kowloon side.

A must-see!. The view from here is - together with that from Victoria Peak - iconic for Hong Kong. Both during daytime, but especially after sunset, when all the high-rise buildings on Hong Kong Island light up - some with animations. Do not miss this!

A bit unfair rating this! its the most beatiful skyline in the world!. Honestly, i go to hong kong every 3 years, and i crane my neck to see the skyline out of the airplane window! Its just beautful. Its great now that the ICC is there, as that has a stunning light show! I mean, the laser and things are cool on the other buildings. and the bank of china building still looks modern with its geometric shapes. but seeing the ICC with its full length LED show is great! Very tasteful, scrolling chinese new year and valentines messages this time round! Its Best from Tsim Sha Tsui by the avenue of the stars. you dont see the ICC so well from there, but you see the gorgeous central area across the water. Best at night! And take a star ferry for a cheap boat trip across the water! the picture opportunities are great from the left hand side of the boat!

November Sky. Been to Hongkong in April, been there in September but of different years. November 2012, this time was kinda cold but surprisingly amazing coz I get to wear my animal-printed jacket and my pair of brown boots...fall collection! Hongkong's November sky is foggy from the Victoria Peak with rain showers but it never stop people from doing their hearty activities and shopping. I will definitely be back next November with another pair of boots and a new styled jacket.
stunning view. Hong kong skyline was very stunning. Viewed on day or at night was fantastic. The view from Avenue of the Stars, or from ferry or from the peak was beautiful.

This is one of the best in the world, day or night.. Get a hotel (like the 'Salisbury YMCA) and request this view from your room. Or just stand and look at it from The Peak. At night there is a sound and light show with lasers etc too. They know how to show their city off.
Great!. I have never been to New York but I think Hong Kong can just keep the pace with it. The night skyline is breathtaking. You can't take your eyes off of it. that's sure.
wow. we were lucky enough to be in HK on the evening of the Chinese New Year and the firework celebrations in the bay, what a display and all the buildings lit up as well smashing

Hong Kong Skyline. When visiting Hong Kong it is all about the skyline. It is amazing when viewed from above at Victoria Peak or below from the promanade. You must see Kowloon from Hong Kong and Hong Kong from Kowloon. You must see it during the day and at night when the buildings are all lit up.

My number one city in the World, Hong Kong!!. We stayed on Hong Kong Island in Wan Chai district at a nice hotel. The rooms are small but just enough, because you only sleep there. There is so much to do in Hong Kong and you must try to go for at least a week, if not more. Lot's of shopping if you like to shop, but we did not do much shopping. There are many restaurants and smaller places to eat and they cater for most budgets. The one thing we found most spectacular are the buildings, they are awe-inspiring, unbelievable, incredible!!Take a trip around the harbor at night and just see how spectacular they are!! They are lit up and make an incredible sight!Getting around the Island is easy, you can take a tram, which goes halfway round the island and then take bus which goes around the other half. Both of these cost very little money and you get to see Repulse Bay, which has very expensive houses overlooking the sea and a lovely beach and you get to Stanley market, where you can buy all-sorts. Also Ocean Park, where you can really enjoy yourself.The Peak Tram is not to be missed, try and go up late afternoon, so that you can be up there in the evening to see the spectacular lights! Awesome!A ferry ride across to Tsim Sha Tsui is a must do, also very little money to ride across the harbor. You can also take the underground or MTR, in fact do one way and then go back the other way. We enjoyed staying on the Island instead of the mainland and traveled to the mainland every second day or so. You must also visit the other islands for a look at how the people live. So much to see and do in Hong Kong, go for a longer time and really enjoy it. Look at websites and other write ups from travel advisers. Take your time and plan before you go. It's my number one city in the World, fabulous Hong Kong!!

Dinner at Hutong. Had dinner at Hutong to enjoy the view and Light Show.Dinner was expensive and not at memorable as expected.Better to dine at 3 star Michelin restaurants and take a walk alongharbour front for night view and Light show.

One of the best. Cities with great skylines are few and far between. Most are just jumbled collections of lights that leave only a muddled impression on the viewer. Hong Kong, on the other hand, not only breaks out of this mold, it leaves a clear and lasting impression on all who visit.The skyline is best viewed from the top of Victoria Peak, the Avenue of the Stars, or from one of the rooftop hotel bars in Tsim Sha Tsui. To double the fun, consider renting a boat or taking an evening dinner cruise in the bay. The view is certainly not one to be missed.
Spectacular. It's like nothing I've ever seen. I saw it from the peak & I just didn't get enough! It's a must see!!

Festival of Lights. Definitely go to the island at 8 pm to watch the lightshow! HK sets the building lights to music, and you can watch the lights dance in time witht hat music. It's completely free, and, if you have a metro pass and get there early, you can take a ferry out to watch from the water. it's absolutely stunning!

High views of the city from the very impressive Skyview building.. The trip to the Skyview is via the Peak Tram, the historical tram ride which you have to queue for around 30mins to an hour to get on. The trip lasts approx 10 mins and the views gradually take your breath as you get closer to the top. Sky view has many shops and coffee shops including Bubba Shrimp restaurant. The views are brilliant on a clear day and probably the best ones you will take of the 1,000's of skyscraper rooftops. We went up at night as well to get the awesome views of the neon city. If you buy the Big bus city trip the skyview and tram are included in the price.
Amazing Skyline. when you go to Hong KOng, this is one of the places that you have to see. and I prefer visiting this place at night.
Great view!. One of the best views in Hong Kong! Stay for the Symphony of Lights show. If there is only one thing you can do in Hong Kong this is it.

Best skyline of my life. Great views day and night, best to enjoy from the avenue of the stars in Kowloon....Don't miss the 8 pm "symphony of lights", can not think of a better combination of light and sound on a daily show for free to every one...
Two great places to experience the magic. We had a short stay in Hong Kong but managed to enjoy the magic of the Hong Kong Skyline at night from the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade and from the Peak.
Iconic. Never ceases to amaze just as bright at night. The laser and music show was spectacular. A great way to start the evening before tackling the night markets.
Best at night. Sit on Avenue of Stars and watch laser show at 8pm. Can be busy,but that's Hong Kong for you! Truly wonderful at night.
Wow. Better than Dubai the skyline is, all across the city are big buildings with lightings om all the buildings almost.

View from the Harbour. An evening stroll along the waterfront of Hong Kong harbour will find you awe struck by the city lights. Hong Kong loves lights. Streets in places are so well lit that you don't know whether it is night or day. However, the best lights are those radiating from the skyline. The waterfront is gained in virtually any direction, just head to the water. Some reviewers have given good directions, but there's many places where you can gain access, chose the best one for you. When considering an evening on the water think about taking a ferry across to Hong Kong and going up the tram to the Peak. It is a fascinating evening and one sure to please.
Something different. Most people say that all skyline views are the same, how wrong they are. The view of HK Skyline is second to none. If neon lights catch your eye then you'll love it.
Better than NY. Light show - amazing! The best I've seen!Would def go there again and I would suggest you do the same!
What a Skyline!. Many buildings were colorfully decorated for the Chinese New year, so the harbor was in top shape for our visit. Just lovely.

Buildings shining brightly. We had a view of the Hong Kong Skyline from the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre. It's a 15minute walk from the MTR Wan Chai station. Follow the signs leading to HKCEC. Just walk through the footbridge connecting to the lobby of Central Plaza, and through the overhead walkway. Descend to the ground and walk towards the HKCEC. There you can also find the Golden Bauhinia Square and statue, a good spot to take pictures. Go towards the waterfront where you can sit down to see and hear FOR FREE the Symphony of Lights show that runs 8pm nightly.

We were hoping for a clear sunny day..but. the clouds had overtaken Hong Kong when we were there but it was impossible to ruin the beautiful Skyline in Hong Kong. It was everything I had always heard it would be. I can't wait to go back.

Great photo op, nice walk.. It's a great spot during the day or at night - either way the view across the harbour is stunning, although not one of the best I've seen. The skyline makes a nice backdrop for a walk along the promenade, but whenever I've been there has been an abundance of people which makes it a bit too crowded for comfort. The stalls every few metres with staff that shout at you to take a photo is a bit off-putting, too, but it's definitely worth a ten minute walk if you're in the area. Free wi-fi, too!Also there are a few nice cafe's just by the Avenue of Stars (inc. Starbucks) where you can sit outside and enjoy the view with a few less people bustling past.

One of the most impressive skylines I have ever seen. The view from my room at the Intercontinental of the Hong Kogn Skyline is absolutely fab! At night it just lights up. During the day you can see all the Junk Boats and Ferries along the water.
Free entertainment. Last about 10 minutes. Watch from hotel room or down Avenue of the Stars. There are also cruise boats during this time and they light up also to add to the atmosphere.

Not to be missed. Best seen from the Star Ferry terminal in Kowloon, when you look across the water it is a magnificent and, in the hours of darkness, colourful sight, At 8pm there is a laser show too. has deservedly beena top sight but Shanghai is now a real competitor.
Beautiful skyline. Loved the night view from across victoria Harbor. Worth taking the boat across the harbor just before dawn.
Amazing!. We just loved looking at all the business the city has to offer! Coming from a small town, the hussle & bussle was quite a change.

A breathtaking moment. I had no idea what I had in store for me as I walked with some friends to the Avenue of the Stars. As soon as we reached the area, I stopped, speechless as I saw the whole of the skyline in front of me with the harbor as the setting. It was one of those moments where a smile creeps unconsciously across your face as you witness an amazing sight. I was in HK a month and returned as often as possible, especially in the evening when they have the light show. The fact that the light show is every night amazed me.
A sight to remember. A must see to all visitors in Hong kong! Go see symphony of lights from kowoloon island. Its free and worth your time.

Nice view from tst promenade. Nice terrace just out side the star ferry pier in tst few step away from ocean terminal probably the best place to see the hk skyline When there u can also enjoy the light show that start at 8pm every day

amazing views. it is surely one of the best skylines that i have seen out of the many that i have seen across the globe. the best part of the skyline is that it is almost a unending 360 degree line . in the night with all the lights on it is surely a must see while in HK

Beautiful, just beautiful!. Been to the Avenue of Stars several times but the view never fails to take my breath away. Somehow, amidst the concrete jungle that is Hong Kong island, they have managed to create a fantastic waterfront skyline that's truly amazing. Watch out for the fog though, there were times when the fog was so thick all my pictures came out terrible. It's also a nice place to just hang out and people watch.
unique view. Must see in the evening. It comes into its own. Such a beautiful view and a unique experience seeing Hong Kong by night from the peak. I love this place. I love the view.

Stunning!!. Very beautiful, interesting and fascinating. Interesting by day and beautiful by night,especially from the top of high buildings,of which there are many, in the form of bars and restaurants.

Hazy but still the best skyline in the world!. It's one of the most famous images in the world. By day the skyline of Hong Kong is breathtaking especially seen from the Star Ferry but by night it comes alive with electric lights on the buildings. While the air was hazy during my visit, the view was still amazing.
Great skyline. The skyline is much better viewed from Kowloon side. Watch for laser show every evening at 8pm from near the Star Ferry on Kowloon side.

Vertical living!. Go down to the harbour (Kowloon side) just after dark and catch the light show. It has flashing lights on the buildings and lasers being fired off the tops of the skyscrapers. Worth a look.

whatta view :). I love this place. I love the view. You can just sit around all day and just look at people and admire the place. When I went here, it was cloudy and there was a rain shower but it didn't stopped me from not going to this place. You'll see the clock tower on the way here. If you
Misty not to be missed. Even though it was foggy and misty, Hong Kong skyline continues to impress. I may be wrong on this, but I think the laser show is even more impressive through the fog.

Fantastic. Fantastic - especially when enjoyed sitting in the bar of the Intercontinental, with a cool drink in your hand. As a European, you quickly come to the conclusion that Asia will rule the world, and most likely, you will not regret that thought.
What a fantastic place!
Free Show. Must be done at least once. Best place to view is the raised walkway to the left of Star Ferry Pier.

Fabulous !. Must see in the evening. It comes into its own. Viewing the skyline from the Tsim Sha Sui is recommended, as really see the city light up. If you like Starbucks, it's located right after the Walk of the Stars providing good views of the city while having coffee.

Best Skyline!. Definitely Hong Kong skyline is the best skyline in the world! On our first day in Hong Kong Island we asked a local guy about what is the best way to see the Hong Kong skyline. He gave this idea of watching the view of Hong Kong skyline from the peak which has to be done after the sunset.On the same day me and my wife went to Victoria peak to see Hong Kong by night. The view from the peak was really amazing!!..Specially when start to get darker and all the lights start to iluminate the city. Such a beautiful view and a unique experience seeing Hong Kong by night from the peak. The next evening we decided to watched the laser show from the other side of the island. It was holiday season and some of the buildings has a christmas decorations and christmas lights. The show of the laser display together with the christmas lights was stunning and wonderful landmark. Hong Kong skyline was a really the best of the best. We also took the star ferry sightseeing tour by night and the skyline was much better seing from the boat...Never miss Hong Kong skyline!!!..
view fantastic. YOU got to do the Peak the ride up in the tram and the views are fantastic there is a restaurant and shops but souveniers are expensive
Must visit. Go at night and around 8 when there is a laser display. Although the laser display isn't so great it doesn't make it bad.
Light Show. worth seeing the entire skyline, gives a different perspective of what you see during the day in the markets. light show is pretty.
Very nice even covered in fog. Hong Kong skyline is legenday especially if seen from Star Ferry. We were unlucky beacuse the weather was bit foggy
great pictures. this place is simply amazing.. grab a drink in one of the many rooftop bars.. great views... loved it... would always come back...
One of the best I've seen. Brilliant! Probably the best in the world. Lots of colored lights and so many high rise buildings especially against the harbor.

Best skyline in the world!!. didn't like the queues at the Peak Tram Station but has to be done for the experience and fantastic views from the top! Must visit during daytime and at night but unfortunately sometimes the dreaded smog tends to linger and restrict viewing pleasure.
Must see of Hongkong. Great view from the peak, easy to reach by cable car. There also is a nice walk along the rim with great places to take photographs.

Best skyline in the world. we spent a week in HK and ever evening would wander to Kowloon to watch the sun set and the buildings light up. the view is 270 degrees and is stunning. it was a bit cold and wait until 8pm for the laser display.

Harbour View is spectacular. We dined at Aqua on the 29th floor overlooking the Harbour in a private room to celebrate a 21st birthday - WOW!! Spectacular Harbour view at night - 8pm laser light show each night. Also great from top of Victoria Peak at dusk as day turns to night. It's the prettiest skyline with the Harbour

Amazing skyline. Hong Kong is breathtaking during the day, but goes up another level at night. The view from Kowloon promenade at night is wonderfully. Don't think the green energy bug has got hear yet!
Breathtaking. View the skyline at night from the Kowloon side! Beautiful! Though bring a jacket, it gets really cold with the wind blowing.
Worth watching. Worth watching its one of the best. I lived it. was in HK with friends and family in Jan end. Enjoyed my trip a lot.
Night and Day. The skyline is totally different at night and we found the laser light show nice but over rated but it is worth doing a harbour cruise

The Kaleidoscope of Colors. One must not miss to witness the beautiful Hong Kong skyline! The kaleidoscope of colors left me in awe as darkness filled the city. It is best to see the HK skyline starting at 4PM. You will be amazed how the tall buildings are transformed into big fireflies flickering in the darkness. Such a beautiful view to behold.
Breathtaking and varied. An amazing contrast of high and low architecture that goes on and on and on. The most sophisticated urban towers juxtaposed against unsightly cement blocks.

up high down low. There are some great places to see the sky line and the light show up high in some of the hotels or down low on the front outside or sitting in front of a nice table with music and watch from there all good.

City of lights. A residence fro 25 years, I am still in awe with the skyline in Hong Kong. One of the many reasons why I love hong Kong. The colors, the energy the city presents, the noise, the chaos, the crowds, the hills, the country parks...Hong kong has a lot to offer.

Absolutely beautiful !. The Hong Kong skyline is stunning. We went to the Peak for daytime viewing which was super.... but the best in my opinion was taking the night time Star Ferry 1 hour tour of Victoria Harbour from 7:15pm to 8:15pm. You can catch the Star ferry either on the Kowloon or HK island sides. The lights are wonderful and the extra light show was from 8:00-8:15pm. Cost was about $22 USD each.

Best harbour in the world. I love it, from day to night it gives full ambitions and energy!! You can walk along the harbour or take a boat ride, or have a drink in the skycappers to enjoy the beautiful skyline.

Unique eye candy. One of the best places to see the skyline of HK is from the Intercontinental Hotel's Cocktail Bar at around 7pm when the lights of the HK island comes on at once with your favourite cocktail in hand! Try it and catch the Laser light show as well when you're next in town on weekends!

"Pearl of the East". Definitely one of the best and most beautiful skylines in the world, and here is a list of places good for photographing the Pearl of the East:1. Tsim Sha Tsui "Walk of the Stars" / Ferry Terminus2. The Peak (Victoria Peak)3. Sky100 Tower (observation deck) at Kowloon Station4. Waterfront Promenade (West Kowloon, 10 minutes walk from Sky 100 Tower)5. Fei Ngo Shan (Eastern Kowloon, great place to view HK Island from Kowloon, but this location is not served by any modes of public transport. You have to cab / rent a car or hike up there)These 5 spots are my personal favourites, and I've attached some photos with this review in case they are helpful! =)

With octopus card to the peak at Hong Kong.. If your day is sunny, Theo you should go to Hong Kong for the peak. Go to Hongkong Central by MTR and toen walk to the Peak tram. Everywhere you see signs how to walk. With an octopus card you can go by tram, bus and metro. You can also buy coffee or even an sky pass at Sky Terrace 428. If you put 65 HK dollars, that should be okay. Thema's you don't need to be in a long queue. Just go to the tram and Go to the highest peak. The view is so amazing. It is wonderfull.

Simply beautiful. We were lucky enough to be invited on a renovated junk (the Michael Angelo) to cruise the river. It was sensational, the skyline and the skyshow were superb. I would recommend it to anyone!
Stunning. The backdrop of mountains and jungle right down to the highrise towers of the city against the harbour makes for a spectacular view, no matter where you see it from.

queue early. If you want to get a day shot and night shot of the Hong Kong Skyline, queue at the Peak Tram early because it takes an hour or more to get to the tram. It is really crowded in there. The view is amazing! You should get the Sky Terrace 428 pass (Sky pass) to get a good vantage point of the skyline view.

View from The Peak amazing. The Peak tramcar will have you queuing for quite a while to get in. I would suggest pre-arranging tickets so you can jump the queue. I'm not sure if it lets you also jump the queue on the way back down, but suspect not. Perhaps plan to take a taxi or so back down, as the queue for returning was massive.Amazing views though, and some good restaurants.

Don't miss this. You have to get a view of the HKG Skyline from two places - the Peak and the TST Promenade. Try to get a view of city from both these places in the day and night. The View from the Peak is pretty good ... I 'd recommend people to take the Tram both ways and include the sky terrace entrance while purchasing your tickets
Glittering views. Brilliant glittering skylines and - test your knowledge of brands by guessing which building belongs to who! Can spend a lot of time just gazing and admiring.....

Best skyline I have ever seen. Hong Kong skyline is the very best I have seen and there are many places to get a great view and all show a different side to it. Excellent views from The Peak in the evening for the light show but also great views from the mainland side of Hong Kong. Also recommended to view from a Star Ferry crossing or a Taxi ride through Hong Kong Island.
What can you say but amazing!. There are some wonderful sights to see in our own home country of Canada but this has to be amongst my top 3 of best views! So different yet so wonderful.
An eye on the world!. the view over the city at night was brilliant. We had a guide who took us to a 'secret' location for the best views and we were not disappointed!

World class. I stayed in Kowloon because the skyline across the bay is a free light show every night. Everyone comes to stare in wonder even the locals never get tired of it. Lasers fly around and buildings cue the lights to provide a magical view from Kowloon ( take the Star ferry only HK$2.50 ) .

A must see for every traveler. If you love architecture, you will love Hong Kong. You can take a formal tour and I also encourage you to get a view of the buildings from Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. One of the best and cheapest alternatives is to do this via the Star Ferry. Also, check it out from the Peak!I've been to Hong Kong many times over the last 20 years and I never get tired of this.

Beautiful, iconic!. HK skyline is truly iconic and world-famous. I think it is particularly stunning at night, when it is lit-up. HK is a very cosmopolitan and energetic city, so going out at night is safe, as everyone else is out. Whether you choose the island or Kowloon side, get out there and do the tourist thing, it's well worth it.
Just a Beauty!. From the hotel room seeing the sunrise and sunset was just Beautiful. Or just strolling down near the port is also another beautiful way of looking at it!

Lovely especially at Christmas. We saw the buildings lit up every night from our hotel (Hotel Panorama, Kowloon - excellent). It was Christmas and the lighting was superb. Also from the Victoria peak on a clear day the skyline is pretty.

A walk along the Kowloon side water front is worth it.. There are so many options to see the sky line and it is one of the best things to do and it is free. I especially enjoyed running along the water front early in the morning enjoying the spectacular views. I did go back for the light show and it was worth seeing. Do not go expecting an amazing light show, but just go and enjoy it for what it is worth. It is very crowded but a fun experience.

Eye candy. One of the best skylines in the world whichever side you view - from Victoria Harbour or from Hong King Island. The best view (I think) is from Victoria Peak, plus you get the slightly scary tram ride up there.
Best View. Best View of the HK Island skyline is in the evening from Sky 100 ! Totally worth the fee going up !
impressive. you got to see it. dont miss the light symphony show, i took the star ferry to watch it from the water and be able to see both sides of the bay, amazing.

Could not wait to see this. We stayed in Kowloon and just loved every evening seeing the light shows in HKC. Also the junks and dinner cruises in the harbour with all their lighting added to the magic.

A must see. The HongKong skyline across the Victoria Harbour is a timeless beauty. While the nature has taken the backstage and the building and neon the frontstage Hongkong Skyline is a must see for any visitor. In the evening timing it to 2000 to see the light show is a treat but for the photographers any time at night is good for some interesting photo opportunities.
o.k.. The skyline is very pretty at night over the water-we saw it from a cruise ship and it was truly lovely-during the day it is just o.k. - nothing special

A good sight night and day. A very typical sight, seen many times over in photographs, but looking at the real thing is something else, specially at night. During the day, pay a visit to the Peak and look at the Hong kong skyline from the very top. After sundown, enjoy the light show from either Central ( Victoria Harbour ) or from Kowloon side..... its breathtaking !!
Beautiful. The night time laser show is a treat. We had a perfect view from our hotel room and from the outside lounge. I have heard seeing it from the ferry is even better

Stunning sight. Hong Kong skyline is world famous. Most probably one of the most fantastic skyline on the planet day or night. I have a personal preference for night time. The best way to enjoy it at leisure is to go to Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade near the Hong Kong Cultural Center. It is also great to use one of the many ferries that shuttle between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon. There are not many cities in the World where you can watch the sea traffic at the same time. I can only think of Istanbul, Sydney and Stockholm. So this is the place to go and watch this unique scene.
fab. worth seeing particularly in the evening, the lights have won awards and on a clear evening they are magical

Awesome view of Hong Kong. The view from top og Skyline is awesome. Buy tickets of roof top to have a look of Hong Kong. Its worth watching atleast once. The wax museum inside is very cool. The whole experience is very good.
Loved it!. It's amazing when you finally see it. Very romantic for a nice walk after dinner (Kowloon side), and lots of restaurantes and bars to explore.

amazing view in asia's. Hongkong is really unique because have many view when we walk along this city. In the night the view is really amazing. I'm standing in front of victoria harbour with many people from many country then waiting for symphony of light. Many tourist spare their time to see the show. Started from opening speech from narator to introduce all of building in Hongkong. After that one by one the light come from the buildings.So, I just want to say you must visit and see this show ! amazing !

Harbour Lights. Magnificent views from our hotel in Kowloon across the harbour took in the nightly harbour light show at 8 pm each evening. By day the skyline was also impressive, though some days are very hazy.

Amazing, especially at night.. Arguably one of the best skylines in the world. The light show at night is a trip. Take a nice stroll on the boardwalk on the Kowloon side, or stop by a rooftop bar for a drink.
best we have seen. this really was the highlight of our Hong trip. Day time and night time are lovely. symphony of lights is great from Avenue of stars

I'm a New Yorker and HK blew me away. I'm a New Yorker and the Hong Kong skyline blew me away. It is by far the most incredible skyline in the world. Its just beautiful and especially at night. I wasn't that impressed with the laser show, but if visiting HK for the first time it is a must see. Such great buildings!

sound and light show. This is an extraordinary collaboration of many of the skyscrapers on Hong Kong Island. The lights on the building are synced with a music track that is played outdoors and on a radio station every night at 8 pm. There are lots of people watching from the promenade.
My favorite skyline in the world!. Even though the skyline changes each time I visit Hong Kong, it is still the most beautiful skyline on this planet!

Iconic skyline. I loved it all lit up at Christmas, our hotel offered an amazing view of the harbour and the skyline. It was great watching at twilight, as the neon started to switch on. I was constantly drawn to the big picture-window of our hotel.
Amazing! Must see!. Everyday at 8pm. Amazing view. Go there at 7 pm to choose yourself front row, there is a LOT of people! We happened to be on the boat when it started, amazing!
Amaizing View of Hongkong city. prepare your self for long walking... choose right underground transportation to get close to tourist attraction
Excellent. The skyline has to be seen to be believed masses of tall tower blocks, ranging from public housing to Ultra expensive apartments has to be seen from the Peak to appreciate it
Lovely view day or night. Try getting to the Star Ferry pier from Kowloon and look over to Hong Kong side. There's free laser and light show at 8pm every night. Lovely!!

Skyline of City of lights looks best in the night. Best view of Hong Kong skyline is from Tsim Sha Tsui (any place from Avenue of Starts to Harbor front is good). Different buildings of interesting shapes stand homogeneously around the sea to form a great harmony. Places is amazing to visit even in daytime but the whole skyline comes alive when shine with the lights in the night; especially at the time of symphony of lights show.Hong Kong’s skyline is indeed one of the best I have ever seen. A must visit!

WOW!!!. We went to TST and Avenue of Stars and I must agree with other tripadvisors, the skyline at night was 3-letters, WOW! Lot's of people, mostly tourist.. and might have to spend some time to get a good place for photo. Can be quite chilly during the winter months. We had a great night, the buildings were well illuminated. We missed the Symphony of Lights at 8pm as we were still having dinner. Best view is at Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade and we walked down the Avenue of Stars. Hard to capture photos of the celebrity handprints during night. Visit again during the day if you want them on print. Toilets are available but queue might be long, if not head into Sogo to use their facilities, at the same time, to do some shopping

A must see in Hong Kong. You shall never miss this view when you are visiting Hong Kong. The view is marvelous especially at night. You can enjoy the magnificent view when you are going to Star Avenue..

Simply the best. Its like the Grand Canyon, you have to see it to believe it. Its a sea of skyscrapers and neon in Victoria Harbour. I wont forget the first time I came around the corner where the Star Ferry loading area is and saw the skyline. Maybe not worth $2,000 and 20 hour flight..but close.
Best skyline ever. Best skyline we have ever seen before. The lights were beautiful and splendid. Worth for a visit around two hours

Impressive at night. Best views are at night from the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade on Kowloon looking over Victoria Harbour to the Hong Kong Island skyline. There are also good views from Victoria Peak and the Star Ferry. Daytime views of the skyline were limited and ordinary due to the smog.
Manhattan with Mountains. I loved Hong Kong. The city looks a bit like Manhattan/London with mountains. The skyline from the 42nd floor, the Peek or Causeway Bay is stunning on a clear day.
Amazing at night. Perfect City Skyline at night - and also during the day - mist adds intrigue and excitement - try and find a bar view a view and enjoy!
Memorable. Viewed from the ground or from the peak the skyline especially with the towering ICC building...can take your breath away.

The Skyline. Amazing; worth the trip.
I just couldn't get enough this skyline, a building metropolis.
So much to see and do and of course great photo opportunities.

Maybe all the Christmas decorations made it look tacky. Maybe all the Christmas decorations made it look tacky, but I thought it was overdone. Too many moving santas, bells, and blinking lights. I imagine it looks classier outside of Christmas time.
Memorable and Unique. At night the lights are fabulous and during the day it is so beautiful to see the the buildings against the skyline and ocean.

This is why you come. The skyline is arguably the best in the world. Plan our visit around it. You definitely want to be able to gaze at it, all hours, from your room. Also see it from the top of Victoria's peak.
Between the buildings, the lights, the mountain backdrop, and all the variety of water traffic, this does not disappoint.

The peak or Sky100 for better view. If you want the picture of the city, you may found that the peak and Sky100 are both best location for the better view.
But if you have no time for that the next best location is the avenue of the star in the night.
Fabulous. Wonderful skyline and fantastic modern buildings. Loved walking through the business district. Seeing the evening light show from Kowloon is a must

Hong Kong at Christmas. We were there just before Christmas and the waterfront put on a great sound and laser show. The buildings were lit up with Christmas wishes etc. and choreographed to to music. Very crowded but were talking Hong Kong so go with it. It's always crowded with a never ending sea of people.

The Most Exciting Skyline on Earth. Lower Manhattan and San Francisco are the only other skylines that come close. However, built on undulating hills with mountains as backdrops, and with skyscrapers stretching in every direction plus a busy harbor, Hong Kong's skyline is better by far.To truly appreciate it, stay in (or have a drink at) one of the hotels in Tsim Sha Tsui (the Kowloon side shopping district) that directly face the harbor and Hong Kong Island.Equally stunning, in a different way, is the view down from The Peak, which is the highest point on Hong Kong Island. (Take the Peak Tram, a funicular, to get up.)Perhaps surprisingly, the luxury hotels on Hong Kong Island itself do not enjoy as good a view, because they mostly overlook Kowloon (where the buildings are drab and uniform in height), and because the office towers on the island block the view anyway.

Amazing views!. So privileged to have been to Hong Kong and see the spectacular views of this beautiful city. Victoria Harbour is so beautiful and the boats that go up and down the water all day long! Hong Kong at night is one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen in my life and would recommend Hong Kong to everyone! :D
The HK skyline from Tsim sha Tsui. The skyline set against the cruise boat with red sails is definitely the imagfe that defines Hong Kong

Amazing view on the Skyline. There are many ways to view the Skyline but the one we have chosen is for sure one of the cheapest and best ways. Take the public bus no.15 from central ferry terminal to the peak, it takes about 40 minutes. When you reach the viewing platform (Peak Tram) at the end of the bus trip, go left and following the "lugard road"-walk for around 10 minutes and you will get a perfect view to the skyline of HK. We had a little foggy weather nevertheless the view was amazing. There were not too much others who might have made it too crowdy. It was a really good option to enjoy the sunset. And for all of this, you just have to invest some dollars (around 20 HKD for a return ticket). If you are in HK and have about 3 to 4 hours, you definitely have to do this.
Hong Kong Skyline. Such a beautiful skyline, especially when lit by Symphony of Lights. Seen from Kowloon, it is magical, even if there's rain.

Great to see on a clear evening. I spent a good few evenings looking at the Hong Kong skyline. It is very relaxing to just look at the many buildings that contribute to the skyline. It is something you don't see in other cities and you never get bored of looking at many different things
Amazing sight. Seeing HK lit up at night is simply a sight to see and makes for a great picture backdrop. Take a ferry at night if you can to see it all

Magical. Hong Kong is a beautiful city, and at night especially the skyline is amazing. I just love walking around the city and looking up or looking across the harbour from either Hong Kong Island or Kowloon, great

One of the World's Spectacular Skylines. The view of the Hong Kong Island skyline from Tsim Sha Tsui on the Kowloon side must rank as one of the world's most spectacular skylines. It is a glass and concrete jungle of tall buildings striving to outdo each other in reaching for the skies, all framed against the waters of Victoria Harbour in front and the Peak at the back.Unfortunately, in the last decades, the view has been somewhat obscured by bad smog. On a clear day you get good views. Otherwise, you will have to use your imagination having to peer through thick smog. On smoggy days, the views are generally better at night when the lights on the buildings light up.
A great Skyline. A unique skyline for all tourists. Especially impressive though around Christmas when the decorations add to the colourful lights and atmosphere.

best skyline I've ever seen. okay, I've never been to New York or Chicago or anywhere in the US like that; biggest American skyline I've seen is probably Houston. But I've been to Shanghai, Beijing, and Seoul. The Hong Kong skyline blows them all out of the water. Literally, because it's all about the beautiful Victoria Harbor and the mountains as a backdrop to the buildings with their amazing lights. To truly enjoy, go to Victoria Peak during the day to get the overhead view, and then at night get down on the waterfront on the southern end of the Kowloon peninsula near the Cultural Plaza/Avenue of Stars area to enjoy the "Symphony of Lights," a supposedly nightly event where they play music over a PA system and the building lights are synchronized to the tunes.

Take in the laser light show. Laser light show at 8:00 PM every night. Best spot to view from the Kowloon side is the upper deck above the harbourside promenade. Watch the Hong Kong buildings come alive with lights and laser lights with musical accompaniment. Amazing choreography

Breathtaking. The Hong Kong skyline is absolutely breathtaking. We only had a short overnight layover so we took the subway and went for a drink at the Sheraton sky lounge to take in the view. It was absolutely worth it. It is the number one thing you must see even if just passing through to another destination.

Tall. The skyline is beautiful and very different to London. Buildings in HK are all very tall and in the evening they light up. It is beautiful and can make some stunning photos. Some buildings are old and the plaster is cracked and alongside you have new buildings. The financial district has many modern tall buildings which are obviously not as old as some say in Kowloon or Wan Chai.

Spectacular day or night. The buildings along Victoria Harbour look fantastic during the day, but at night they light up. It's called "The Symphony of Lights." 8pm every night many of the buildings put on a light show.

Crazy and amazing. Great view from harbor, especially at night. This place was the best to see the Hong Kong skyline with an open air and straight view to the business district with hundreds of buldings.
One of the most dramatic skylines in the world. Take the ferry, take the tram up to Victoria peak, or simply walk around the harbor...the sky line is stunning from all angles.

Best in World for light show. Hong Kong for NYE was the best choice -light show on the harbour followed by Fireworks. Complemented by our wonderful stay at the W Hotel. Shopping was better than the value from Christmas sales in Sydney

Stunning!. An absolute must for any traveller. The Peak is the best place to go. Take the tram up and pay the extra to go to the upstairs and outside sky deck. It's best to go on a clear day and best to go an hour or so before sunset because there are also spectacular views of the bay the other side from the city view. It can get chilly and windy up there (Dec/Jan) and once you go down stairs you are not allowed back up. Following the sunset you can just watch all the lights come on in the city as it gets darker. Then get another perspective of the skyline from the Avenue of Stars and Star Ferry trip. Again, aim for a clear day (it was bright blue skies when I was there) and I would imagine this makes it all the more amazing!
Stunning view of skyline. You have to see it to believe it! The view is amazing! Recommend taking a taxi on return as the lines are so long.
Amazing is the word. Awesome place, where you can see so many huge buildings. Take a ferry across the river to see the both side of the river and see those high & tall buildings.

Christmas lights. I thought the best view was from Kowloon side, looking back at HK island. A lot of the buildings had elaborate Christmas decorations and animations on their buildings as well. Free, as well. And you can do the Avenue of Stars walk while you're there. Victoria Peak is worth a visit too for an entirely different view of the city. It gets cold up there though!

World's best skyline - day or night. tall buildings and water - the best combination for a beautiful view. you must see HK from Kowloon, take the Star Ferry across and then look back at Kowloon from HK.

Wow!!. The skyline is amazing.. seeing it from Tv or pictures are just not the same as being there at night especially and seeing the amazing view and the million of lights streaming through... just beautiful
just beautiful. no words to describe..you just cant help but be amazed. ride the star ferry to appreciate, be sure to sit by the window. would help if you know where the port is :)

Words are pointless. It has to be seen to be believed -- just go to Hong Kong and soak it up. From the Star Ferry, from a hotel, from Victoria Peak, anywhere. There is not a disappointing view in the whole city.
AMAZING. Amazing at night, the light show is really pretty and the kids thoroughly enjoyed it. It is clear why it rivals the NYC skyline!
super skyline. in the evening, on the kowloon side you can watch a night light show of the hong kong skyline, every night at 9 I was told.
Pretty and Huge. We enjoyed looking at the skyline. It is really huge and beautiful. We saw it from the Avenue of the stars. This is a great place to see it.

Pricey view of the city. Loved the view from Sky100 but felt it was very overpriced for what it was. The coffee shop was very small with few tables and it would have been nice to sit up top with a cup of coffee to savour the views.

At Par with any skyline in the world. Amazing buildings and many places to view Hong Kong's lovely skyline. Our hotel also gave us an amazing view of the skyline. What amazed me was that it looked so fabulous from Kowloon also.
One of the best skyline in Asia. Breezy air, magnificent buildings, lights and Symphony of Lights make this place so attractive. Must go in HK.

Great place in Hongkong. We spent 2 hours at this place. It was great and amazing at night. Easy to find out the most amazing place in HK like this. Easy to view the High buildings, the harbor and the splendid lights.
Enthralling.... Tourists, take note and swing by 7-11 for some hk$10 beers, then kick back and soak up the view... Over Christmas and new years there are additional festive storyboards to behold.

Unbelievable. So many buildings. Went just before Christmas so all the buildings are lite up in the Christmas theme. Light show was not the best and lots of people could of just been the clear night so the laser show was not seen clearly. More impressed with the lights on the buildings. Hong Kong best to see at night. We came in on a cruise in the morning and looked like a lot of smog but we were told it was mist. It burns off and then at night it is unbelievable.
Super cool skyline. Tons of cool buildings to look at during the night, but I find some of the neon lights a bit tacky. It's also hard to see some times due to the pollution.
Love it!. Better than all the movies, travel shows, guided books and pictures in the world. Real life Hong Kong skyline rules!Must do experience once in a life time.
NYC on steroids. Don't miss the light nightly light show. It's great from the Ferry and from the 28th floor of hotel Icon
The most mind blowing city view on earth. It's a scene you'll never forget. The queue to get down on the tram is annoying so be prepared for a 10-15 minute wait.

No wonder it's #1. I like to think of myself as a well-traveled (and therefore lucky) person. It's rare to encounter places (in busy cities) where you are amazed by the beauty for almost nothing, namely 2.5 HKD for boarding the star ferry.Be it by night or by day, you won't regret what you see, the landscape is magnificent and definitely enjoyable.
Very nice. Very nice with all the light on the buildings. But the show they do every night at 20.00hrs isn't that good.
Amazing. From many places you could get a nice view. Victoria Peak, the promenade near Star Ferry. A good tip is to go to the mall The One, go to the last floor, order a beer and enjoy the view!

Hong Kong Skyline. We started our round the world trip in Hong Kong for 3 days, such an impressive place, the city was bustling, the buildings were jaw dropping, loads of shops. Mong Kong shopping is amazing, the streets lit up like it was daytime. The Skyline trip is brilliant, a tram takes you straight to the top of Hong Kong so you can look down on the City, a must for the camera people of the world.

Beautiful. I like the skyline, especially when I travel on Star Ferry. I can never get bored looking at the skyline, from either Hong Kong island or from Kowloon. Staying in Marco Polo allows my family and I to view the skyline almost every night. You can try taking the Star Ferry during the Symphony show.
Very Beautiful. Very beautiful at night. The buildings are lit very well and its a feat for photographers and our eyes. Go and have a look at the famous Hong Kong Skyline at the Victoria Harbor.

spectacular view at the peak. ls exciting going up to the peak by the tram but i think the authority got to improve on the queue system. No queue line at all , everyone just squeeze into the line after buying tickets. that is the chaos part! There should also be a capacity in the tram otherwise we won't know if it is overloaded with passenger. But the view is spectacular!
Beautiful View. Great view and very close to our hotel. The Harbor light show is just across the street from our hotel. Great picture opportunity.

Stunning Skyline, disappointing light show. The Skyline is breathtaking at night but the light-show is a little over-rated. We were expecting to be completely wowed based on what everyone had said but it was nice.

Hong Kong Skyline and light show. The Hong Kong Skyline and famed light show was quite enjoyable but a little over-rated. We saw it from outside the convention centre and felt that whilst it was impressive, the hype given to it was a little over-rated.
Unbelieveable at night. Best seen at night from Kowloon side, unbelievable when all lit up. Even better at Christmas when the building have huge Christmas lights down the side of the buildings.

The very best in the world!. I have seen more than enough skylines around the world and nothing comes close to the one in Hong Kong. I love to take the ferry to go across the habor. It is just a 5-min ride and costs close to nothing. A must-do in Hong Kong.
Spectacular. One of the world most spectacular skylines. There're plenty of places to look at this magnificent skyline. From Kowloon or from any ferry on the bay.

Breathtaking even after living here over 10 years!. As a tourist back in 1997, I went down to the waterfront at the cultural centre in TST, Kowloon every night of my stay and just watched this most amazing view. Irrespective of why or how long you are in HK for (as a resident or tourist). Take a few minutes and enjoy it, whenever you can. Irrespective of season, time of the day or weather. It's is a man made marvel.

Symphony of light.. Best viewed from the Kowloon side. It runs every night. The aural description alternates between Mandarin and English depending on the night.
Basically, the biggest permanent light show in the world, as the Hong kong skyscrapers light up in dramatic fashion.
I kid you not, put this on your bucket list of things to see.
Good. Not as impressive as I thought it would be but its definitly a must see especially from the top of victorias peek.
Beautiful at night. Pretty at night but smoggy in the day. I would advise to go to the peak or to view it from the harbour only in the night.

Beauty of Architecture. Many cities in the world has high rise sky crappers and buildings but nothing lined up between the sea and formed a beauty of architecture like Hong Kong does. The views are just too magnificent day and night. Make sure you catch the spectacular lighting show as well.

Scenic harbour, from either side. The new ICC is the highlight of the view from the island side. The view from the TST side is still as good as it has always been. Lately the air has been of poorer quality, as it blows in from Shenzhen, but that may improve soon.

Great. Wow nice view. It was nice staying on the beach from Kowloon side and watching Hong Kong Island.
Xcept as Usual apart from Hong Kong being expensive there is no complain.

Amazing sight!. Beautiful from the Hong Kong Island side or from the Kowloon side. It is truly amazing just how many skyscrapers are in Hong Kong! They say 8000, about twice as many as their nearest competition, New York City. We stayed and watched the Symphony of Lights one night from the Kowloon side which was something that should be done once while in Hong Kong. Its a light show from both sides of the Harbor set to music every night at 8pm.

Fabulous views and breeze. It is highly recommended that you make a trip to the Avenue of Stars in the early evening about 5.30pm and take a nice sunset stroll along the avenue and watch as the lights come on one by one. The gusts from the cold wind as we went there during winter made the experience so much better too. Also, be sure to try the grilled shredded squid, it's really delicious. However I would recommend going on a weekday as the day that I went was thronged with tourists from tour groups and they were all scrambling to take pictures with Bruce Lee and cutting lines. End the night with a relaxing ferry ride to HK island via the Star Ferry to visit the IFC opposite and take the escalator up to the roof garden. It provides a nice view of the Kowloon Harbor from the HK island side. And It's free!! Overall a million dollar view and it is a must see when in HK. A big pity about some of the rude scrambling tourists. PS : for those wears ng caps, be cautious as the wind blew off my cap a couple of times, but luckily not into the sea :)
Light show. every evening at 8pm there is a laser and light show. Best watched from the Avenue of the Stars, Kowloon side.

Iconic views - don't miss the Symphony of Lights every night at 8pm!. Spectacular display of the vibrant and bustling economy. Catch the Symphony of Lights 10 min display every night at 8pm - from Tsim Sha Tsui promenade (first choice, best view), Hong Kong Victoria Harbour, The Peak, Art Museum veranda, whilst on the cross harbour Star Ferry - it gets better each time, and I've done them all!

Very nice view, great to join the Big Buddha!. Start with the bad... The price is high...
Buy your ticket in an travel agency or others, the queue to buy it there can be more than 1 hour! And then you will need to wait another hour to get a cabine... Arrive at 09.30 am!
Great views. Very comfortable and pleasant way to join the Big Buddha.
Go to the light show at 8 pm.. The skyline is as beautiful as expected. I was not expecting such lavish Christmas decorations, incredible. The light show was entertaining, felt like disney.

Dazzling display of sight and sound. Wow! The Multimedia light show on either of the harbour involving approximately 40 buildings is an unforgettable experience. Whether you're admiring the skyline from the harbour in Tsim Sha Tsui, your hotel room or from The Peak during the day or at night, you will leave Hong Kong with glorious dramatic memories that will linger on for a long time.

Must see. Agree with other reviewers that your will never get enough of Hong Kong skyline. You can see at eye level from Avenue of Stars platform or bird eye view from The Peak. Further, should check out the skyline at day time as well as night time as it gives different 'color' to the view. Extra bonus if you can enjoy the view from day time changing to night as the view is spectacular, especially the view from The Peak. Also, one should enjoy the view from the ferry travelling from the mainland to HK Island. You will get two different views across the water. Two things cross my mind when I was there to enjoy the view from different angle – one being how congested certain part of Hong Kong with all the tall buildings standing very close to each order and narrow street. Second – the amount of electricity utilized/supplied to all the commercial and residential buildings that normally light-up till midnight.Nonetheless, the view of Hong Kong skyline should not be missed by any visitors

Amazing skyline. Everybody knows Hong Kong has an amazing skyline. The good thing is that you can see it from multiple directions and locations. Take a very to Kowloon, look down at it from The Peak, enjoy the light show at night and so on.

The best. Tsim Sha Tsui , roof of the Hong Kong hotel car park (next to the Star Ferry , above the Harbour City mall) - find your way up there and savour one of the best views in the world of Hong Kong Island - especially at sunset , to experience the real esscence of HK - the night view is just amazing and the scale of the buildings on the other side is lost in what is a stunning experience.
It will leave you in awe. The view at night is fantastic and the daily light show will surely impress even the harshest critics.
Breathtaking. Breathtaking. Like no other city in the World. You will see the world go by on the South China Sea. So interesting you will just stare
breathtaking. absolutely breathtaking on a clear day, we stayed in kawloon so we could see the best view of the island, rather than hong kong its self, great at night!

View from the Grand Hyatt. You don't need to take the tram to catch a view of Kowloon. Go to One Harbour Road....Grand Hyatt, Star Ferry and HK Convention Center and you'll look directly at the Peninsula hotel.
Living up to its reputation. The skyline view is excellent. Especially the view at The Peak and Victoria Harbour. Choose a hotel near Victoria Harbour.

Evening laser show. Head over to Kowloon on the Star Ferry to see the best of the laser show but be prepared for crowds. Lasts from 8 pm for about 20 minutes. We did also watch from the Red Bar in the IFC Mall on the Hong Kong side, the lasers are weak from this side but there's still lots to see.

Must See. The best skyline I have ever seen. And the light show they put on is just the icing on the cake. During winter it tends to be a bit foggy obstructing the view- so make sure you go and see it on a clear day.
Fantastic light show. experience the skyline at night from the Avenue of Stars (Kowloon ) - nightly light show at 8.00 is worth a visit

Spectacular at night. The skyline is spectacular at night ,you get a taste when coming in from the airport at night, its huge.
Unfortunately it was really foggy/smoggy during the day when I was there ,so couldnt really see too much of it other than 100m in front of you .I would love to see it on a clear day.
Nice. We saw it from the peak on a clear day - AMAZING. We also saw it when we were travelling to peak from lantau. Reminded me of san francisco

Meh. My first visit to HK, and I expected a mecca from all the reviews. Crazy bright and uber-sized Samsung et al corporate ads marred the view and the night time view. Beijing has more interesting architecture.
Sceney. My family went there after dinner, taking a stroll along the pathway. While we were looking at the skyline on this beautiful scene, the wind was chilling us.
Spectacular!. Absolutely brilliant, the atmosphere is great, must go! Romantic for couples or just great gathering for families.

Three great places to see it from. The best view I had was from the lookout tower on Victoria Peak (take the tram or hike it). There is also a nice place to see the skyline from the roof of the IFC mall (note I had a hard time finding this - it's just the fourth floor above the oval atrium). And, there's an incredibly cheap ferry ride (Star Ferry) from right next to the IFC mall over to the Island (like $0.50 USD) which gives you a nice view of both sides and great photo opps.

Iconic. This spectacular skyline is so well known all over the world and its such a pleasure to be part of it. The view (from Kowloon side) is just amazing. Try to see the firework and laser display as well - not to be missed.
The laser show is a must on top of the rest of the awe inspiring view. Go to the laser show on an English speaking night (if your Cantonese is a little rusty) you cannot visit Hong Kong and miss it
Amazing at night. Go to Kowloon's Avenue of the Stars and view the 8pm light show. Well worth watching and take your camera!

Beautiful, especially during Christmas time. dislike the big crowds everywhere, like the food and the efficiency of transport system. The skyline is beautiful, especially during Christmas periods as all the skyscrapers are decorated with Christmas lights, the pace is a bit frantic but that is because it is a big city, there are a lot of tourists, especially people from mainland China who go there for shopping.
Spectacular. Take the Ferry across to Kowloon at night and enjoy the light show around 8pm. Top off the evening with a walk through the Night Market and enjoy some amazing seafood.
Very different.. Well worth crossing to Kowloon for the views, the ferry trip (very cheap) is also well worth it. Spectacular light show every night at about 8pm.

Great skyline in the dark in clear weather, surely, but.... it was pretty good when we were there, overcast and grey, and the Christmas light show from 8:00 pm to about 8:20 pm was worth the wait, though as my traveling companion said, if you have been to the Epcot Centre in Florida you wouldn't think it anything special.Free, though, and if you are dressed for it, something you should see in Hong Kong.
Looks great if you are lucky. This is impressive view, but due to foggy weather you can visit Hong Kong and see it only once or twice.

Especially when it is dark and not foggy it looks great!. I like the skyline, it is impressive what they build and how many people are living there. I like it because we don't have this kind of skyscrapers in Holland.
100 floors in 56 seconds...... nice view from 100 floor of hong kong.lifts are fablous taking to 1000 ft in less than a minute.could opt for this in our sigh seeing option in hk.

Skyline. The view is alright, but less impressive compared to Shanghai. Looks impressive at night. It's worth going up to Victoria Peak for the view, provided you don't mind paying the silly fee for a ticket and waiting in the queue for 45 minutes.

Overcrowded. The good: sure, this is actually one of the musts of Hong Kong, a walk along the Kowloon side to enjoy Hong Kong's skyscrapers... either you do it daytime, night or at sunrise. In the History and Science Museum buildings there are some restaurants and bathrooms. Not easy to spot the entrance, but it's somewhere there. You could also use the facilities of the SOGO shopping mall (just opposite the entrance of Nathan Road)The bad: it's often, especially in the evening, overcrowded. All the city's tourists gather here like some cult-sect followers to watch the free 10minute light-show (the show is really nothing special, but you will have the feeling to have missed something great -and free- if you don't watch it). tip:1. if you really want to watch the light show, try to go to the second floor of one of the adjacent buildings (Museum of Science), it's usually less crowded. 2. if you are a morning person, you could enjoy sunrise here, because most people are not, you will be able to enjoy it all by yourself, in a surreal empty Hong Kong.
Move over New York this is a serious view. Night or day who would not delight in a view across water to a rich variety of skyscrapers silhouetted against vibrant green mountains

Needs to be seen to be believed. The array of beautifully built skyscrapers on the harbour is amazing, very relazing to sit on the Kowloon side right on the harbour watching the star ferry going back and forth, sailboats and the famous red Junk sailing by. Mid 2011 and Late 2006 visits.

Amazing and Surprising!. I had read about Hong Kong's Skyline but was still unprepared for the depth of it. My husband felt that many of the buildings, particularly the apartements, are taller than NY apartement buildings. It is a beautiful sight especially from the ferry.

Do not miss the light show at 8PM from TST. The laser light show music is a must do! Take the ferry to TST or if you are in Kowloon go the TST walk way in front of the Pennisula hotel. Best viewing by the Avenue of the Stars.
Outstanding skyline. Be sure to look at Hong Kong Island from TSM side at 8PM for Christmas lights show. There are many viewing points - where the Star Ferry lands would be a good choice

Symphony of Lights and the Hong Kong Skyline. This is probably among the highlights of our stay. The Symphony of Lights are memorable and worth the wait. A weekend show may be better though. We watched on a Thursday so not many buildings participated so the variety of light 'tricks' are quite limited.Nevertheless, it was still worth the wait. The setting sun amid the tall buildings across the harbor was also quite a spectacle so try to go to the Avenue of Stars as early as 5 or 5:30 pm so you can watch the beautiful changing of the afternoon skies. The long wait for the Symphony of Lights might bore you though (show starts at 8:00 pm) so you have the option to walk around the area again and just come back by by 7:30 pm so you can still get a good seat on the promenade.
5/5. The skyline is like no other city in the world. Although the Symphony of light show a bit, the skyline in beautiful irrespective..

Amazing Views!. Head up to The Peak, and take in the views!! Easiest way to do this and a cheap way, is to just get a taxi up!!! By the way, try eat at the restaurant with the outdoor veranda area - very very nice, quite upmarket and has great views out over the bay. Cant remember, sorry.
Interesting and beautiful. The 360 degree views from the sky 100 were impressive, enjoyed it more than the peak. Make sure to watch the light show at 8pm from the avenue of stars walkway.

Always beautiful. My favourite to-do when I am in Hong Kong. Taking the Star Ferry to and fro Kowloon and Hong Kong island is pretty cool. My favourite cheap thrill! I took my family there for the obligatory tourist shot.

Would have been better without fog. It was really beautiful, but I actually thought it was better after the light show, since it wasnt as busy. Additionally the light show was pretty quick, and the fog didn't help at all.

Nothing Amazing. I visited Shanghai before flying to HK and to be honest, I found the Shanghai skyline much more impressive. The architecture in HK is pretty bland by comparison and during the day visibility from Kowloon isn't great. It's not worth waiting for the light show - it's just a few flashing lights on buildings with the occasional laser beam i.e. pretty dull.
A must see in Hong Kong. Beautiful skyline especially at the evening. Take a stroll at the Avenue of Stars or ride Star Ferry to see Hong Kong's number 1 attraction.
One of the best man made views in the world.. Go to the Inter-Continental in. Kowloon and have drink in the lobby after dark. There you will see a spectacular view of Hong Kong Island.
Not to be missed. Travel by the old funicular tram to the viewing point. Go late afternoon and take your time til it gets dark. Amazing view
A "must-do" in Hongkong. Combine with a transfer with the STARFERRY trip.Go there by app 18.00 to see how the sundown changes the colours of the skyscrapers.

New attraction and well worth it. Great views of the harbour and easy to get to via Kowloon MRT.Well worth adding to your list of places to visit in HK.Not so great if it's raining or smoggy though so pick your day to visit!

Click Sip Enjoy. I love Hong Kong, it's an amazing high energy city wrapped around Victoria Harbor. As such there are hundreds of restaurants & bars with great views of the harbor & the skyline. Part of the charm & adventure of HK is discovering that next great restaurant or bar with an even better view of the city & water. Victoria Harbor is alive with commercial traffic, pleasure craft & of course the ferries. Whether on one side of the harbor or the other or on the water itself the views of the city are great. Be sure to catch the daily evening light show where the skyline comes alive with lights and sounds.

spectacular views. Hong Kong has an amazing skyline! Our hotel room was on the 57th floor with all around windows. How spectacular the views of this city are. The hustle and bustle of this city is unreal and the outdoor markets are not for the faint of heart....

Star ferry/Big Bus. Sadly the weather was cloudy and very overcast so we did not get the full benefit of the skyline however the sheer volume of people, the connections with all the movies and and the traffic in the harbour itself made the trip well worthwhile.For value for money, information and history the Big Bus City Tour is a must. You will see far more in a couple of hours than even the most dedicated traveller could ever hope to discover in the time. Stanley market was, to be fair, a bit disappointing with a lot of cheap and tat!Take the two day ticket for the Big Bus, it will get you to The Peak, (thick fog!), Sampan (interesting!) and includes your Star Ferry to and from Kowloon and Hong Kong island.We thoroughly enjoyed our few days.
The best feature of Hon-Kong trip. It is unique experience and can't be missed. View it from Star Ferry or go on the other side of the water. The best place is from other side of the water.
inspiring buildings. One of the highest bank buildings, the silver one was designed by the famous architect, I. M. Pei who designed the pyramid at the Louvre Museum in Paris...very inspiring stuff.
Breathtaking from every angle. The lightshow is good but don't miss something else just to be there at 8pm. Fireworks dispalys are unmissable though.
grown since last visit. hadn't been to Hong Kong for 25 years, so the sky line has really grown, really lovely on a clear night. Nice to just sit and have a coffee on the Kowloon side in the evening

Beautiful, but not on cloudy day. I am sure it is more beautiful on a clear day because I went there on a cloudy and mist day. You can view it from different coner, but I suggest you view from harbour view. You can enjoy it at the lobby cafeteria of Continental Hotel. So amazing. You can enjoy lovely music, comfortable sofa and the famous HK skyline in this cafeteria

Impressive. As other reviewers have mentioned the Hong Kong Skyline is very impressive. It is amazingly bright and multi-colored. We rushed to the waterfront to watch the laser show and were very disappointed. If the music was not playing in the background it would be hard to tell if anything was going on. The bright lights coming from the hundreds of buildings kill the effect of the laser show. But it's free, so I shouldn't complain too much.If you miss the laser show don't worry about it. The skyline is impressive enough on its own.

Laser Light Show. The Hong Kong skyline is fabulous at night. I recommend looking onto The Island from Kowloon. The top level of the carpark at Harbour City (Marco polo Hotel) is a great viewing location.But, the laser light show at 8pm is the lamest thing I have ever seen.In this era, with the lighting technology that exists, the Hong Kong laser show really is below average and needs a complete overhaul. Hong Kong can do better!
Excellent views. Book online and go early in the morning. Get the MTR to Kowloon station. It's amazing views across Hong Kong very cheap and a great find.
Beatiful Skyline. Get on the star ferry it is the best way to experience the skyline and is dire cheap. Only costs appro 75cents US.

Amazing Day Or Night. Hong Kong is an amazing city so vibrant and exciting. The skyline is always on show day or night from where ever you are but it is definately worth going up to The Peak to look back down over Hong Kongs skyline a truly amazing view.

Go see the lightshow when you're in HK!. It was very cool, I heard a lot about it so I knew what to expect. I went to Mong Kok to check out all the markets then headed South on foot to the waterfront and watched the show. We checked out some shopping centres nearby afterwards but I'd recommend a ferry ride!

Amazing! Check out the light show from Kowloon side at 8 p.m.. I recommend seeing the skyline from the Kowloon side. The skyline is fantastic during the day but even more impressive at night. The light show starts at 8pm and is not to be missed.

Picturesque!. What can I say that hasn't already been said? Breathtaking, mind blowing, mesmerising!! This last trip was our 5th time in Hong Kong and this view is always captivating... I literally have hundreds of photos of it as every moment of every day offers another stunning vista as huge clouds move or the light changes. My top tip? If you can possibly afford it, book a harbour view room and make the most of this million dollar view while your in Hong Kong :)

Top of the city. On my travels I usually tend to stay in cheaper rooms but in Hongkong I spent money I could have bought a nice laptop with on my room, a suite on top of Bishop Hotel and for me it was worth it. Enjoying the skyline of Hongkong from your bed is a very special experience you won't forget.
