Only topped by sitting alone on West High Peak with a 360° view after I almost had to be saved by the Hongkong mountain rescue service because I had tried to get a very special but a little dangerous view.At least take the ride up to Victoria Peak and take the fantastic 30 minutes hike around. Its called Pok Fu Lam Tree Walk.

Just spectacular. Best City in the World and that's coming from a New Yorker. Night or day. Cheapest views: In Kowloon..California Pizza, Peking Duck House, Star Ferry, Drinks at Felix, Discovery Bay FerryHK side: rooftop bar in LKF Hotel, Victoria Peak leave terminal and band a right onto the paved walking trail, the best place to take photo's at night. Junk Boat harbor cruise. Dragon Back hiking trail towards Big Wave Bay or Stanley.... Great hike even with kids. You will hit a peak where you can see HK on one side and the most beautiful views of Stanley on the other.

Sure - it's pretty awesome. I guess it's just the fact that you get the skyline from a distance, from two different directions, and it overwhelms your vision. There are a some super cool-looking, really tall buildings in HK that make it stand out. I missed seeing it from the peak because of the weather, but even from the harbor it was pretty nice.

Wanna die for.......... The most amazing skyline ever in my life, it was quite splendid and manigfic. We talked together while seeing the beautiful boats crossing and twinkling lights.That was so beautiful!!

THE vibrant city of lights. So much to see & do within walking distance OR, using the excellent MTR system.Friendly, helpful locals.The food.The harbour.The mass of humanity.The shops.The food.Only 9hrs flight time for Aussies.
first visit. great view over the city wished we had more time to go up in the evening to see the lights of Hong Kong fair price to travel the train which takes you to the top

Spectacular. The view from Kowloon accross the bay to Hong Kong is one the great city-scapes of the world. It is wonderful to sit at on the harbour edge at dusk and watch the lights come on as the sky darkens. The 'Lightshow' with music is a bit tacky but somehow fits with the hectic glamour of the city.
Better at night. Has a lightshow every night at eight for about fifteen minutes. Best place is down on the riverside.Daytime is okay but the smog gets in the way a bit.

Awesomeness². The view is absolute amazing!
Many, many skycrapers! The 8pm lasershow is beautiful and THIS VIEW is the reason why you should go to HK!

Beautiful, Dazzling night sky line that captivates you. In order to take in the beautiful Hong Kong skyline at night, board the Star Ferry either at Wan Chai or Central. Enjoy the slow, chugging service to Tsim Sha Tsui. It is even better from November to February when the buildings on Hong Kong Island side dress up with Christmas, Chinese New Year decorations. A sight to behold and be captivatedGet your cameras out!

A glittering wonderland best viewed from TST. There is no where in the world that can compare with the Hong Kong skyline,particularly as at 8pm every night the skyscrapers in Central are lit like Xmas trees and for about 15 mins there is a laser light show.The distance across the water allows for the perfect illuminated vista at night for the amateur or professional photographer,moody if overcast in the day or spectacular if sunny without the usual misty patches.Best place to view from is the Star Ferry Terminal or the boardwalk at the rear of the museum and the Intercontinental Hotel.
One of the best. THe HongKong skyline is one of the best in the World! At night time the building lights are amazing.
Peak. Great way to see the city and Kowloon, excellent value for money. It has a selection of restaurants to meet all tastes.

What an excellent hotel to stay and enjoy!. My family and I have travelled all over the world and have stayed in numerous hotels. None can compare with Madera Hong Kong. The hotel is very clean, well-located, quiet and artistically designed and decorated. More importantly, their staffs are probably the most helpful, pleasant, and effective one I have ever met.We checked in after midnight and check out before 6 AM [Nov. 8-Nov 12, 2012], the same Asst. Guest Service Manager, Florence Ng, a young lady, was on duty on both occasions. When we checked in, she went out of her way to help us push our luggage cart from the street corner to the hotel, together with the porter Edmond. When we checked out, she carried our luggage for us and saw us off at the door. Florence was so helpful and pleasant that we felt completely at home during our stay. The porter, Edmond, is also very helpful young man. Another staff, Kevin even let us use his cell phone to call long distance…. Everyone was so wonderful. The room, linens, and sheets are very clean and all the necessary amenities are provided. The air-conditioning is very efficient and the air circulation is excellent. The location is very good. It is in an alley but only a few steps from the main streets. Our room is very quiet.In all, even the Insight Vacation Tour hotels and their staff we have experienced, are no comparison to those at Madera Hong Kong and its super staff. We had a wonderful stay and experience at Madera. Professor Leo Liu, Ph.D., and Shirley LiuRichmond, British Columbia, Canada

Unbelievable skyline. Viewed from the waterside of Kowloon, there are very few skylines in the world that can rival Hong Kong. More impressive than New York with the background of Victoria Peak, make sure you see it at night wiht all the lighting effects.
Water Views. When you are in Kowloon and exploring TST, just turn around to admire the HK central & Causeway Bay skyline - even without the light show at 2000 it is breath takingly gorgeous!!
Excellent views. Make sure the day is as clear as poss., or views can be limited. Lots of shops etc. can get busy - we waited 40 mins mid afternoon on a weekday .

Great Wine Festival under the Skylines of Hong Kong. We visited on Nov 2nd 2012 the American Express Hong Kong Wine & Dine Festival for the first time which is an epicurean feast of wine-themed events organised yearly by the Hong Kong Tourism Board.We enjoyed strolling along the wine booths (my guess about more than 200 wine booths) with the view of Hong Kong Skyline and harbour for wine tasting from around the world (At the entrance, you can buy a Classic Wine Pass /tokens package for 2 person : HKD300 with 15 tokens/ 2 wine glases and holder, a very nice souvenier to take home)and the gourmet food stalls offering Dutch, Italian and French cheeses, Italian Ham and many others foods.We bought a very nice Dutch old cheese to bring home to KL...The festival is free to all those visiting, you just only need to pay for food and for wine wit your tokens at the stands which are priced fairly reasonably. A free bus shuttle service is available (run every 5 minutes) from MTR Kowloon Station or East Tsim Sha Tsui stations to the West Kowloon Promenade.Overall, it was a very nice and well organized festival to visit specially when the night starts to fall and the Hong Kong skylines takes a very a different view under a pleasant November weather and a nice glass of wine. Next year event will be held from 31st October to 3rd November 2013 so it is definitely to plan again to visit this event next year.

Be there each night @ 8:00pm for Symphony of Lights!. Wow! All i can say. Great waterfront, very walkable, Symphony of Lights each night at 8:00 pm should not be missed. Great Hotels (Peninsulla, Ritz, etc). Just a big WOW!

A fun and free night. We got the Star Ferry across to Kowloon to watch the light show at 8 PM. There is a viewing platform by the ferry where you get a good view of everything although the crowds make it difficult unless you get there early or are tall. There is music and commentary (in Cantonese) and the show lasts 15 minutes. Great fun and value.

Light show - 8PM each night. If ever a far-fetched video game backdrop came to life, it still wouldn't compare to the reality of Hong Kong's skyscapers on a hill and nightly (8PM) light show. While Hong Kong itself isn't the best tourist destination in the world, the skyline is something well-worth beholding.

great , but dont be like us a nd book , just go as we got a over cast day and saw nothing. don't book this , just get the subway and turn up , its cheaper and if its a over cast day then you've not wasted your money

Great view. I advise to visit peak for seeing HK skyline twice. Once while it is still day and of course in the evening.u will get absolutly different impressions of the skyline. Another way is to come there around 5-6 p.m. and hang around until it gets dark.that way u'll safe some money.There are a lot of gift shops and places to eat.The best place to see the light show is the bund.

Love it up and down.. The escalators are 800 metres (2,600 ft) long with a vertical climb of 135 metres (443 ft). The total travel time is twenty minute...from a wiki. Hong Kong knows how to move people. This is the longest escalator in the world. Be aware it's down in the morning and up from 1030am to midnight. If you take it up you can get off at various levels but remember you will have to walk down...or cheat in a cab.

Breathtaking!!!. HK has the best skyline in the world!!!! There is absolutely no comparison...... Love the 8pm light show every night (free!). :) I've seen it countless times in my 9 years of living here!!!!!!!

Amzing. We loved the skyline at night. The laser show was great but just seeing the lights from Kowloon was awesome. Probably like New York! It does get busy for the light show, particularly if you want to get to the front. During the day the weather can be quite foggy, so night is best. Travelling on the ferry offers a different and great view.
A beautiful man-made thing!. Try to book a hotel room that has windows facing the Victoria harbour and is high up. It is a great experience and you can also see the symphony of lights.

One of the best skylines in the world. If you go to HK and do not see the skyline from both sides of the harbor you will be missing out on seeing one of the best skylines in the world.In addition it is good to see the skyline during the day and at night.You must go to see it! Enough said.
Always changing. Everytime you go to HK the skyline has changed a little and the best way to notice this is at night while floating around the harbour on a ferry watching the Symphony of Lights.
Definately Worth Seeing. The HK Skyline is one of those iconic views you need to experience if you viisit HK. Shame it wasn't clearer but that's HK for you.

Impresive view from Kowloon. Few skylines compare to this. It is made all the more impressive when looking at it accross the harbour and at night. I thought the nightly light show was dissapointing, however I know other thought it was good, it depends on your experience of such displays and I guess I have been spoilt in the past.

Few skylines can compete. which skyline would you put up against Hong Kong's? Chicago is great and so is New York, but you will be hard pressed to find a skyline with so many interesting views from so many different vantage points.A Symphony Of Lights is a light show that is free to the public and shows a good bit of the skyscrapers with different lights. I don't know of a city that has anything sililar to it on such a scale. It's a must see.

Iconic. The views of Hong Kong and its Victoria Harbor are hard to beat. Two good spots to view: The Peak (of course) and the Waterfront on Kowloon. Don't miss it. The Peak is best, I think. Make sure you see day and night. Go up to the observation deck in the afternoon, have dinner, and view the skyline at night.
SIMPLY THE BEST. You have not experienced a beautiful skyline until you view Hong Kong island's! I always reserve a harbor view room to experience the beauty.

hong kong skyline. Amongst HK's numerous attractions both on the island and mainland up to the New Territories is the famous and much talked about skyline. It is a monument to artificially created spectacle, go down to the Avenue of Stars at night or up to the Peak at dusk to watch the vista changing by the minute. Neon becons abound heralding the World's multi-national successes. Concrete edifices decorated in shades of lurid red and green, breathtaking laser and firework displays split the humid sky. Make this one of the must do's of your life!

"A View To Marvel". The Hong Kong skyline is a must see attraction in my opinion.You have to ride up to Victoria peak, using the peak tramway for a small fee & to be able to get the best views pay the top fee so you can go to the top of the viewing platform. It's best to go on a clear day for the best views!For a free view just have a walk to the conference centre overlooking the harbour.

View the evening Sol Et Lumiere. Each night at 8pm a light show hits the skyline from the Kowloon side. So the best place to see the famous skyline is not on the island but on the viewing platforms at Tsim Sa Choi

you recognize Hong Kong Skyline in a flash. Having been to Hong Kong you recognize Featured traveller photos of its Skyline in a flash. It certainly has character. We were told that the best viewport of it is the Stars Avenue, but we haven't got there. We watched the Skyline at night from Kowloon - incredible views! Yyou can't escape skyscrapers in Hong Kong, they are everywhere.

Spectacular, at night. A light show at 8 pm brings this city together, and you can see it from the ground or way up on the top floor of a restaurant or your room at the Ritz Carlton on the 113th floor. All the buildings compete with one another in a dazzling light show. It's free!
Amazing skyline. The skyline seems to go on forever with a nightly laser light show. It is twice the size of New York. There is a nightly laser light show that is worth a look.

View from both sides of the harbour & on the harbour. We stayed on HK Island, and watched the skyline light up. Fantastic view from the foreshore.Also timed it one night so we were on the ferry going from Kowloon to Wan Chai. This was the best view and you could see both sides of the harbour.We also stayed on the Kowloon side. Fantastic view, slightly better than from the HK Island side.Dont only go for the nightly laser & light show. The views of the HK Skyline during the day are gorgeous.
A view that has to be on everyone's bucket list. If you have not seen the HK skyline at night from the Kowloon Star ferry terminal, you have not lived.
Stunning view!. Check our Aqua Bar which is on the 29th floor of a skyscraper! The view is outstanding :-) They also have a restaurant if you can afford it!
lasar show was very clever. i watched the show from the street of stars in Kowloon. Its was very cleverly done and entertaining. Not too many people blocking the view.
Hong Kong. What an outstanding place this is. The views from the harbour across to Hong Kong Island are incredible. At night all the lights are really something to see.

Skyline. Take the train up to The Peak for a spectacular view of Hong Kong. Even the trip up is amazing and there's plenty to do when you get there, like shop, eat, drink, relax... And it's worth to stay and stare to the laser show on the night sky. During the day I would recommend that you go to The Peak to admire the view from the top. It is the best.

Better thank New York !. Better thank New York !The best views are :1. from the Ritz Carlton Hong Kong2. from the peak3. from the avenue of starsTry to be there when dark is falling, the sky is then blue, becoming dark blue, and the buildings are already enlighted. This is at this time that you will have the best pictures.

One of the world iconic views. See the skyline at sunset and watch the laser light display. Each building vies with its neighbour to be more spectacular. HSBC headquarters which was such an astonishing building 20+ years ago now is dwarfed by its neighbours.

Dance for lights. A city on the edge of the future. These are the opening words to Jean Luc Goddards Alphaville. Hong Kong is the city of the la' eve de future. A city Peter Allen sung about "never closing down", a city where neo-tech cyber dreams from William Gibson stories come to life. All the stars are here, the lights of money too in such a beautiful pageant that few can afford to miss not experiencing just once in our lives.
wow. Get out and see the skyline from a good vantage point. One of the most spectacular cityscapes in Asia

Best skyline. I absolutely admired the Hongkong skyline. It was so beautiful at night coming. Come here early to get a good seat to see the beautiful and splendid lights and boats suring on the face of water.
If you can see it.. Amazing skyline if you can see across the harbor. Pity about the pollution since Hong Kong is quiet spectacular from the 50th floor and up!
World renowned. Absolutely gorgeous on a clear day!. Take the tram up the peak and take in the activity. Gorgeous city. Gorgeuous locale. Wonderful locals.
Heavily polluted. I came back with a lung infection and is it any wonder with the heavy air pollution called 'China mist'

Good light show. Have visited HK 5 times. The skyline still never fails to impress and I always cross over via ferry to the Kowloon side to take it in. This last time, I stayed for the light show at 8pm. It was in Putonghua which I don't understand but the light show itself was pretty good. I think the crowd does contribute to the atmosphere and this time, it was pretty sedate and the light drizzle didn't help things.
Harbour Lights. Light show at the harbour in the evening is worth seeing, lets you take in the skyline and views, get there early to get a good spot.

woow!!. Great View
wonderful fotos
if you are in Hongkong you must see it
especially in the morning, a wonderful foto motive

It is really one of the best in the world. I can see the full skyline from my living room every single day and still I am never tired of it. Never. Amazing at night especially if a pink cloud appears somewhere in the sky, stunning during the day with the mountain tops at the back. Wherever you are on Kowloon side, take a few seconds to enjoy it, from every angle.

breathtaking. Victoria harbour is a great place to see the skyline so many sky scrapers as far as the eye can see. A great place both during the day and at night. We also visited The Peak and the 360 observatory.

Extremely amazing!!!. Could not beat it!!! how it was amazing, with thousands of light ans shining all round and around. Lots of people coming here at late night for cheering and seeing. We loved Hong konSkyline!!
The Peak. Take the train up to The Peak for a spectacular view of Hong Kong. Even the trip up is amazing and there's plenty to do when you get there, like shop, eat, drink, relax...
Outstanding. HK skyline is probably one of the best in the world! Night view is the best! I still remember the view I've got from my plane seat when I left HK!

Everybody should see at least once. The best way is to eat or have a drink at one of the higher end locations in Tsim Sha Tsui and look across the harbour toCentral and Wan Chai, the laser show is fabulous, so atmospheric and provides a great atmosphere. It's a free show, no need to book or worry about seating, just go.

Hang out in Kowloon for the 8:00 light show. At 8:00 there's a light show that takes place on about 20 Hong Kong buildings. That means that the best view (and the music that's choreographed to the lights) are both best appreciated from Kowloon, especially on the Avenue of the Stars.
Impactant. One of the most beautiful skylines in the world. A boat tour is highly advisable. Stunning show of led lights making all sorts of designs like a great open air show.

Great view!. Every time I go to Hong-Kong I visit this place. And it's worth to stay and stare to the laser show on the night sky. Of course don't forget to see the Avenue of Stars.
And one more thing - don't forget to bring tripod with you! :-)
Breathtaking. Light show at 8:00 pm each night. The buildings light up and some have lasers mounted int roof and all this is choreographed to music.
amazing views. Large selection of snacks and drinks to suit all tastes and budgets. Opened till late and is an excellent way to wind down after a crazy day in Hong Kong.

Skyline. The night is really lit up, by the buildings at night. They have a light show, each evening, and they use strobe lights to shine on the buildings on the opposite side of the bay. It makes a nice end to a busy sightseeing day
Get The View From Avenue Of The Stars Or InterCon. Sure, it's a skyline, but it had CHARACTER. The light and sound show was spectacular and the weather during autumn is just pleasant.

Victoria Peak. One can choose to travel up to the Victoria peak by cab, bus (no.1) or Tram. The downhill journey by bus was a thrilling roller coaster ride experience. The view from the peak's observation area was beautiful complete with the full moon at night. The queue for the Tram is long and crowded, therefore taking the bus down if you have a Octopus (bus/train) card is a great option.

Love it!. Hong Kong is a beautiful city and its skyline is very nice during the day or at night.During the day I would recommend that you go to The Peak to admire the view from the top. It is better if it is a nice day.At night it is better from Tsim Sha Tsui. It is also very nice to observe it from the Star Ferry when crossing the river from Central to Tsim Sha Tsui.I love the neon lights of the high buildings and the special decorations during X’mas and Chinese New Year.In Tsim Sha Tsui you can walk along the river to better admire the view. It is a nice stroll.There is a daily light show, I think it is at 8 p.m. but we didn’t watch.
amazing. iconic, brilliant to see this live!!!!lots of people there, be early to get a good spot for the night time light display
Hong Kong tallest buildings. Worthwhile - great overall views of the city - went to one in Kowloon and one in Hong Kong - highly recommend the Peak Tram - awesome
victoria peak. The view at night from victoria peak is fantastic.Caught a ferry to lantua island but not much to see on your own. Should have booked a tour & would have seen more.
Wow. Blade Runner eat your heart out. Great skyline from all angles and views. Highly recommend a visit to Victoria Peak to view.
Intercontinental? Or on the promenade?. Loved the view and drinks from the Intercontinental, but the fun, and music on the Promenade was much more exciting...

Concrete jungle, breathtaking at night!. The Tsim Tsa Chui or the HK island waterfront is wonderful to gaze at the opposite side of Victoria harbour skyline at night! The lights, displays and the reflections in the water are truly awesome with an ethereal junk cruising past it! Couldnt believe a concrete jungle could look so good at night!!
WOW. the Skyline is just breathtaking. No matter where you look from, it will just amuze you. By day, and by night.

Great view, be there to watch the light show. Some may say it is a sky line like any other, nut due to it's typical setting along the waterfront it is a great way to discover the impressiveness of a world city. Be sure to be at the Kowloon side of the waterfront before 8PM, to enjoy the light show on the high rise buildings. Majestic buildings taking part in a great choreography. We enjoyed the view from the terrace on the 21st floor (WoolooMooloo restaurant) on 100 Nathan Road.(Shopping Mall The One) Be sure to be there on time because terrace seats are first come first serve. Or consider having an early diner as they serve great food and also nice snacks, albeit somewhat expensive.

SKYLINE is worth visiting and the cofee shop is nice. You get a 360 degree view of Hongkong from the SKYLINE and worth visiting...cofee shop on the skyline is nice and the ambience is good....you can just relax andhave a view of Hongkong...........nice expereince

May change my opinion on cities in general. I hate cities. I hate skylines. I'd much rather be in the wilderness preferably a long way from the nearest road. But Hong Kong's skyline was something entirely different. It was stunning. For me, it was most similar to sitting on the edge of a 160 foot cliff at 10,200 feet in the High Uintah's wilderness overlooking miles of forests and mountains without a road our building as far as the eye can see."Like that" in the sense of being awe-inspiring and amazing. But, you know, different in every other way.

Awesome. Grab a spot down on the wharf at TST (Tsim Sha Tsui waterfront between the Avenue of Stars and the Hong Kong Cultural Centre)up high maybe in the highest bar in the world. Ozone in the Ritz Carlton, the Hong Kong Skyline and Symphony of Lights at NIghht is another MUST DO when in Hong Kong.

Enjoyed the light show. The night show of the Hong Kong skyline was lovely to watch. Beautifully done to music. Waiting for the lights to come on. Ride in the ferry and watching the skyline as it approaches was romantic.
Like no other place in the world. Skyline can be a bit cloudy/smoggy from Victoria Peak, but views from top floors of many hotels are fabulous.
best skyline. skyline better than new york wether at night or day time the veiw is good from stanford hill or try the ozone bar at night amazing
nice to see all that big city lights. To travel around is easy, public transportation works, but at the MTR stations, you need to walk quite long way to go to connections.
Worth a sight. Great skyline, goes to show how well the tiny little island is developed. For a first timer, do not miss the light and sound show at 8 pm from TST promenade.

Full of lights and colours. It is a pleasure to have a long walk from Star Ferry to the end of Avenue of Stars enjoying the skyline and the great views of harbour. Symphony of Lights, the lights and laser show at 8.00 PM is a must watch.

Unbeatable Sight. I've always loved the Hong Kong skyline since my first visit many years ago! You have to view it from Tsim Sha Tsui by day and night, and view the skyscrapers and harbour from Victoria Peak too!Don't forget to catch the nightly laser light show over the harbour - only lasts 15 mins with music, and adds another dimension to the sight!I can't wait to see it again - make sure you have your camera on hand!!!
Beautiful. We stayed at the Peninsula Hotel and were lucky enough to have access to a view of the Hong Kong Skyline from the Hotel's Pool Terrace. It was truly beautiful at night.
must see. this skyline would have to be close to the New York skyline. We walk the esplanade nearly every night and have done so for the last 10 trip and we never get sick of that wonderful view.

The skyline at night is fantastic. Definitely worth an evening visit at 8PM to experience the laser light show from all the buildings. It is best viewed from the clock tower platform area on the Kowloon side of Victoria harbor near the Star Ferry terminal.

World Class. What else can you say about the Hong Kong skyline that hasn't already been said? Perhaps the most unique and recognizable skyline anywhere in the world. Daytime and nighttime views from Victoria Peak or Kowloon are simply astounding. Highly recommend night time views from the Kowloon side to catch the light show.
Its excellent from the Peak!. The light show is not visible from the Peak. The Sky Terrace is worth a visit. Take the combo ticket with Madame Tussaud. You would save around 30 HKD!

20 minute light show and an hour and half on the boat. Pretty boring show. Over in 20 minutes. Not even free drinks made this bearable. Music in the boat was 'tinny' and would have preferred to go back to the pier after the show but instead circled the Harbour over and over. See it from the pier free and see the harbour for less $$ on the star ferry.
You can never tire of this view.. Hong Kong is a fantastic, vibrant city and the skyline spectacular. It doesn't matter where you are located, there is always something amazing to see.

Magnificent Central!. Wow! The skyline of Central is so impressive and so classic! Just as it appears in all those glossy brochures of Hong Kong. Not the area to go for a rest , however. The pace is fast and furious and the area is thronged with people! Take the escalator up to mid levels- the views of streets and restaurants are really worthwhile. Make sure you watch the Symphony of Lights 8pm each evening. Lights sparkle on all the tall buildings either side of the harbour as music plays in time to the light show.
a bit smoggy, but unique. Too much smog the day we visited, but a unique skyline none the less. Enjoyed the ferry ride across the harbor and lunch as well.
Stunning. My favorite skyline in Asia - great to see from the Kowloon side or a junk..try both day and night views.
It is simply a MUST. Nothing much more to say. Make a night out of going to Kowloon and watching the daily HK light show at 8:30pm
Amazing skyline. What can you say, no were in the world do you get a view like that. The night views and laser show just blows you away.

Pearl of the Orient. Its when you see the city from the peak or from top of some high rise buildings, you will see how bright and alive the city is. The name pearl of the orient defines this city just right as it shines like one.
A great and vibrant city. The sights are wonderful but the touts can be annoying in kowloon. there is so much to see in Hong Kong and nearby such as Macau.

Worth a stroll. We found ourselves strolling the area on the harbor a lot at night, towards the end of the night.No matter the business, there's sobering soothing and awe inspiring about the magnitude of the view.There are plenty of restaurants nearby too.
had bigger expectations. The light and sounds show at night is a bit disappointing, you expect more technology and effects.... it is like a poor disco in the 70's....
Amazing. The nighttime view of the Hong Kong skyline is amazing. Make sure you get to watch the nightly 8pm light show by the public piers in Kowloon (right next to the Star Ferry).

Amazing light show. Arguably the best skyline view is besides the Tsim Sha Tsui ferry pier. Go there before 8pm and get a good spot. At 8 the festival of lights starts and you can see this amazing laser lights show free of charge :)
Excellent and splendid. Easy to get the whole city view from here, many people coming, taking pics, you could spend about one hour or more here. Taking by hands and wish some dreams was brilliant.
Running commentary every night. Good spot to watch is on the Marco Polo car park on the 6th floor. Then straight down avenue of stars or onto the Star Ferry and across to HK
Amazing. Could see everything. The Peak shows the best views. Do need good weather to be able to see far. Good italian restaurant at peak that also enables you to see lots whilst you are eating.
Hong Kong Harbour and Skyline. Looking out my window at night and watching the hotels around light up. Watching the movement of ships, small boats, junks around the harbour
Breath taking!. Heard about it, seen photos of it but its not till you see it in real life- jaw dropping! The huge scale of Hong Kong is made apparent by the light show and is not to be missed.
One of Life's Great Experiences. Just awesome - it just seems such a surreal type of light, neon skyscrapers on a balmy sub-tropical evening. Truly memorable.

See the water front at night.. Go and see the fireworks at night at the water front ,and take a trip round the harbour it was most enjoyable ,we stayed in Kowloon and went across to Hong Kong island it is very impressive super shops over on the island
Fun !. Sit down and chill with a Haagen Daz. Watch nationalities from around the world amble along ..... Jackie Chan's cult status in HK is on view here :-)
fantastic. The views of Hong Kong at night are just spectacularThe lights and skyline wonderful plenty nof activity on the harbour.
Hong Kong buildings laser show. Get the Star Ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui for the Symphony of Lights every night at 8pm. Buildings are lit up to the music and the green lasers shine and flash too.

Rooftop Picnic. On the top of the IFC mall is a little known area that you can take your own food and drink, sit on the picnic tables and chairs and watch the Hong Kong skyline come to life. Buy all the goodies on the first floor in the wonderful deli. Yum!
8000 skyscrapers. 8000 skyscapers and all lit up at night Very spectacular from the Star Ferry to Kowloon which was very cheap Travel by taxi efficient and very cost effective

Night Stroll at Victoria Harbour. It's very comfortable walk along Victoria Harbour and looking at the Skyline of Hong Kong. It was windy and breezy at night. Remember to bring along a jacket in autumn.
Wow - another city that doesn't really sleep.. The skyline is just as you see it on the television and doesn't fail to impress. Simply amazing and beautiful lit up at night.
lovely place.. I went there on the first evening of our stay in hong kong..this place is so beautiful..u feel so peaceful, its breazy n pleasant. the skyline is awesome..got sum grt clicks here.
Amazing views but Singapore has a better skyline. There was a lot of smog most days however I can believe that when there is no smog it is quite beautiful

Very nice at night. I was unimpressed with the "show" that the buildings do at 8a, but overall Hong Kong has an amazing skyline. It was fun to sit back and look at all the different buildings from both sides of Victoria bay. I can believe there are 8,000 sky scrapers on the island!

Fantastic Skyline. Being a life long fan of Hong Kong Cinema I dreamed about it's skyline long before I ever came to Asia, and when I saw it I fell in love with it as well as this city. Hong Kong remains one of my favorite places in the world and it's skyline it's most definitive landmark.
breathtaking. just enjoy the excitement of worldclass architecture and diverse heights. The 8pm fireworks don't add a lot to the magic that's there as night falls
Spectacular views especially at night with the light show. Spectacular views especially at night with the light show. Visit to the Ritz-Carlton Ozone Bar is a must.
One of my favourite skylines in the world!. There's a light show at 8pm. To be honest, if you missed it, don't worry too much about it! They skyline itself is enough in my view.
Hong Kong Harbor. So beautiful, the laser light show in the evenings is fantastic, the veiw is breathtaking, The star ferry is cheap and Stanley Market is the place to grab a bargain

Amazing spectacle. One of the best in the world. Best at night time and with clear skies. There is light show at 8pm everynite and with music. Stand of Kowloon side by Star Ferry for a good spot. Beware of pickpockets as usual. Bring a good camera.
8pm every night. anywhere on harbour front either HK or Kowloon. At 8 pm watch laser light show on several buildings. It lasts for about 15 minutes. Another no cost bit of sight seeing.

Beautiful Hong Kong. When you arrive in Hong Kong at night you are impressed by its beauty. When you awake in the morning the most common statement I hear from different people I take to Hong Kong is that it looks like somewhere else. It is a city that is much more attractive at night!

Whatever you want, its there.. Hong Kong (Kowloon), is a vibrant, exciting destination, and after 3 visits, still beckons. For the shopper it is heaven. Prices have come down, and sales are widely in evidence. The Island and The Peak are star attractions.

Outstanding. How can you fit so many buildings in one space? Our tour guide told us that it is believed that a dragon lives in every hill. One of the sky rises has a hole in it so that the dragon can get out. The nightly light show was a bit disappointing. Loved the harbor views though.

You've got to love the HK Skyline. And the cute light show they put on every evening for free that you watch from the Kowloon side is a must. Who knew you could fall in love with the littlest skyscraper, or that they had personalities of their own? The ONLY drawback is the overcast-hazy-usually not clear skies that will drive the photographer in your family insane and the rest of you to tears watching him-her get frustrated because the sky isn't perfect for viewing. Don't worry about it or make yourself sick thinking you came at the wrong time. It's like that a lot. And the light show is still wonderful, and I still root for the small skyscrapers holding their own against the big ones, and I just ignore the cranky photographer and say, "maybe next time..."

Hong Kong Skyline from Star Ferry. My husband and I choose to visit Kowloon using Star Ferry and we took photographs of both Kowloon and Hong Kong skyline but for me the Hong Kong Skyline was the best!
night lights. Night light Show of Hong Kong city from Kowloon side not to be missed on the Promenade. 8.00pm to 8.15pm.

Best in the world. Sorry world.. It is just breathtaking. Even with the very slightly cheesy lightshow. There are not many major cities in the world i havent been to or lived in, and this skyline takes the prize. Why? Because you can see the whole thing, and it just lies there, hkg-side, for you to stand in awe, day or night.
Best skyline in the world. There's no better skyline in the world, not for sightseeing at least. Best seen from the Kowloon side during 20 and 21, to catch the light show.
Airport Express. Fast, Easy, Reasonable Price. A convenience way to get to downtown from the airport. Free wifi available inside the train.
Just great. It is my favoured skyline.... much better than Singapore... nice an interesting buildings as well as the Peak in the back ground
Good Ambience. Love to when there..good view if there are no haze.. reckon at the evening, the light show is thumbs up..

Interesting light show. I am not a huge skyline fan, but did enjoy the light show. Would recommend watching from the Ferry Pier or somewhere you can hear the music that accompanies the lights. It is too bad more buildings don't participate.

GO TO THE LIGHT SHOW. The light & sound show at 8pm is very nice on the Kowloon side. The tallest buildings emit light beams into the sky, which look incredible. The show lasts 10-15 minutes on the pier and its free lol. Needless to say dont bother looking at the skyline during the day; it is best at night when all the lights are on.

Foggy visibility. We climbed to Victoria Peak with the Peak Tram. The skyline is supposed to be one of the "must see" items.Well' it's kind of disappointing. It was about noon time and though you can see the skyline - the visibility is not very clear. I believe it is hard to find a day with a clear visibility due to Hong Kong's pollution or whatever. We did not climb again for a night view - maybe it is more spectacular.

Great!. See it from Hong Kong island side then take the Star Ferry and see it from Kowloon side! Don't miss the nightly laserlight show. Stand on the harbourfront in Kowloon and listen to the music while the show plays out opposite you - similar to a graphic equaliser effect!Then take a walk along the Chinese Walk of Fame to the Bruce Lee statue.
Like any other tall building.... but with poor facilities at the top. It is also quite difficult to get to as they are doing a lot of building/roadworks nearby.
Not to be missed. View from Kowloon side , go just before sunset and stay until the whole island is lit up and twinkling. Stunning
breath-taking. nature has its beauty, man made buildings lined side by side with its bright neon lights has its own beauty too...and this is the hong kong skyline..breath taking!

Picture Perfect. We stayed in the Intercontinental Hotel at the harbour and were luck enough to have this picture perfect view from our room. We never tired of it.You can have a cocktail in the longue or dine in the buffet and see see the great view.
It is quite stunning. Get on the ferry and see it from the water as well as seeing things from dry land. Probably the best city view I have seen
Light up!!!!. Everything go nothing but nothing go everything. try a drink to see the splendid lights up and down, right and left from your place. so crazy & amazing. Just see and feel it
Beautiful View. The view of the skyline is a sight to make sure that you take in. We saw it both during the day and night. Both were beautiful.

HK Skyline. Go to the Sky 100 to see the skyline, but anywhere high enough is good, it's free at the Bank of China on the 43rd floor on HK island but remember to take your passport, front of the Sheraton having afternoon tea a good place as well, also along the esplanade

Hope for clear skies. I had 3 nights in HK mainly as stop overs enroute to other places in Asia, my penultimate was a torrential down pour that wrote off much night exploration. I thank my lucky stars that my final night was clear and dry, it allowed me to fully appreciate the sound and light show from the TST promenade. WOW if you only have one night in HK really make an effort to see the skyline by night! Take the Star Ferry across Vic harbour and try and get there early, it gets busy very busy, so claim your space and watch the show unfold right in front of your eyes. Spectacular skyline.
Amazing city view. I loved the night-time view and nightly light show. It is usually very humid and, as a result, visibility is often poor, so when it clears up it is really spectacular.

Lights and Buildings Amazing!. New York is a spectacular place from the ground. Hong Kong is Spectacular from high places and arriving by plane. Not to be missed - go over to the Kowloon side on the Star Ferry to get a different view.

Grasp the energy of HK!. The lights show at 6PM has always been fun to watch. Drinks and snacks were expensive so this time, we brought some drinks and stayed for a little longer. It was great and I felt very recharged after :)
The best in the world. Ill keep it short and sweet, If you dont like the Hong Kong skyline you need to seek professional help.
Amazing. there is a light show in the evenings about six pm. You can get a great view from the stars avenue in Koowlong.

Beautiful night. The Hong Kong skyline is beautiful. We were fortunate enough to be there for a fireworks display, but also went again on a "regular" night and were not disappointed. The city lights are special and even after the show, walking along the promenade at Kowloon and looking out to the harbout made for a lovely evening.

Daytime tour Hong Kong. We have done 15 Hop On Hop Off tours since we started our "Round the World Trip" on April 15, 2011. This one was no exception and was absolutely great, we ended up seeing Hong Kong skyline by day and night and it inclued the ferry trip back and forth and agreat by windy winding ride out to Stanley Market. Just a great thing to do in any city if you have never beent there.
Just amazing!. Can't beat the Hong Kong skyline -- especially when highlighted with the Symphony of Lights, It just never gets old...

Better than Times Square!. The night view of Hong Kong from Kowloon is fantastic, particularly from the Avenue of the Stars on the edge of Victoria Harbour. Take the Star Ferry night tour that starts at 7:55pm from Kowloon and you will have an excellent view of the light and music show. (Make sure you book earlier in the day because capacity is limited)
Smoggy!. On the days we were there it was thick smog The night time lights how was very disappointing we much preferred to Shanghai city skyline

Night time best for viewing Hong Kong Island. Taking the Star Ferry across to Kowloon (cheap/best way). Head to Avenue of the Stars for the best viewing spot - anywhere is ok (preferably near a speaker). There will be music accompanying the lightshow! It only last under 20 mins but I felt it was worth it. Got there about 30 mins before showtime (8pm).

Impressive, as expected.... good place to play with all your camera gear :)
Incredibly crowded, though, but enjoyable, especially taking the Tram
wow!. How can this be described? Overwhelming, grand, what a lot of electricity it must use up. I would love to this from a boat.

Holy S***!!!. I visited China in Nov. of 2009. A buddy and i hit the 3 main cities on our 2 week vacation. Hong Kong, Shanghai and Beijing. On our 2nd day in Hong Kong we took ferry to Kowloon and strolled through the streets and checked out the street markets. When we made our way back to get the ferry back while still daylight, we couldn't help notice the in credible skyline in front of us. While we waited for ferry, which we were in no hurry to catch, we sat and took in the awesome site. Sun went down and all the lights came on and absolutely lit up the whole harbor. We both just sat there saying to ourselves...holy s***. And we meant it. The baddest skyline I've ever seen. A must see.

Impressive. We first thought we could find a rooftop cocktail bar to see Hong Kong at night from across the water in Kowloon. But then we came across the Avenue of the Stars, which is basically the seafront at the S end of Kowloon. There's a raised pedestrian walkway along much of it. From there you get a pretty spectacular view of Hong Kong and its lights. Well worth it but if anything I preferred the more intimate sights of night markets, eg the Temple St one in Kowloon. From the West end of Avenue of the Stars you soon come to the Ocean Terminal mall, with quite a choice of restaurants (some of them ever so pricey - we went for the mid-range Nha Trang - Vietnamese).
great. Watched it from the avenue of stars and thought it was great - loved the music. shame it is not longer.
What more could you want. Without saying anything more - it was fantastic. The Symphony of Lights were amazing. The weather was perfect. A fabulous evening.

could watch it day and night. Wherever you go in HK it's imposing and it's free to gawp at - all day and night! Best views - Kowloon Avenue of Stars at night - Daytime - get up the peak and see it from up high!

Magnificent!. Impressive whether you are viewing it from the TST Promenade or Avenue of Stars in Kowloon side or from Hong Kong Island or while on board the Star Ferry as it plies the Victoria Harbour.
stunning skyline. The skyline absolutely took my breath away. Also, the harbour with all the varied watercraft was spectacular.

The best. Positives: impressive in the day, super impressive in the night, impressive in all directions, great mix of natural scenery and man-made beauty
Negatives: none

Must see once at least.. HK has a wonderful skyline with plenty of tall buildings close together, best viewed from the Avenue of Stars promenade or even the Star Ferry cruise across the water body. Lights show in the night is highly disappointing because its not very fancy and expected bit more.
City of Lights. Quite overwhelming to look at. Cleanliness was very apparent from our drive from airport to hotel. Motorways very effecient and drivers courteous.
Pretty amazing. not quite a spectacular as I expected, but in this hotel room at Renaissance you can see so far in each direction with all the lights, the ferries, boats, etc. and it's a special view

There is no other place like the Hong Kong Skyline. There is no place like Hong Kong because the city is hilly (especially Hong Kong island) so you at night you will see the lights from sea level all the way up to 2000 feet above. Residential skyscrapers are easily 50 stories high. I prefer looking towards Hong Kong side from Tsimshatsui area. Magnificent!

Definitely worth taking the time to see it. Even if you have young children, who don't usually stay up late, it's definitely worth taking the time to see the skyline. You see so many pictures of it, or see it in movies, and it's nice to see it for yourself. Even the kids were impressed with the view.
really nice. great place. look forward to coming here again. had a good meal and enjoyed the evening very much. came with colleagues
Did not meet expectation. I think it did not match up to its counterparts in mainland China and Singapore in terms of sound effect and colors.
Unbeatable city skyline!. Nowhere else would you find the same dazzling skyline than Victoria Harbour! One can enjoy different views from the Hong Kong side or the Kowloon side.

Spectacular. The skyline was amazing at night time with all the major buildings lit up. There is a lazer show each night at 8pm.
Best views are to be had either at the shorefront or from the Peak.

Beautiful!. Hong Kong is gorgeous day or night, but of course at night the lights make it even more spectacular. I had heard about the daily light show at 8pm. So on my first night in town, while dining at Cafe Deco on Victoria Peak, I moved to the window at 8pm. I noticed some light beams, but couldn't really figure out what the 'show' was. I was very disappointed. The next day we had a private tour and I told the guide of our experience. He told us it is better to view from the Kowloon side (you see more of the lights), and stand in front of the cultural center (right by Star Ferry), as the cultural center plays music that goes along with the show. So we watched the next night - much better!! Bottom line, best place to watch is from the cultural center so you can hear the music AND see all the lights. It was good. But still, I wouldn't go out of your way to see it. If you are in the area, stop in for the 15 minute show. But don't plan you day around it.
Skyline view from Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade. Skyline view from Tsim Tsa Tsui promenade is really worth the view during day or during night. even lightshow is worth a view
Great to look at. If you are looking for the daily 'lightshow', we have to say,a bit dissapoiting. Just don't expect too much from it. But nevertheless, the skyline stays an amazing thing to view !

Great views but you can get it cheaper.... Skyline 360 does provide fantastic views. However there is a viewing deck that is free :) Come out of the Tower Building itself once off the tram. Turn left and follow the walk way there is a look out for free just slightly lower. There isn't the professional photographers there if that's what you're after. But if you're on a shoe string great way of saving a few pennies.Check out my blog for more Hong Kong details and photoswww.globejetter.co.uk

Sunset Views to Die for. I went to this indoor/outdoor terrace cocktail lounge for pre-dinner drinks. My host suggested that we meet-up before sundown so to enjoy the sunset as well as the city lights that followed.Located on the 18th floor of the HSBC building at the Nathan / Cameron Road intersection, the terrace lifted you well above most buildings in the neighborhood and the view was spectacular. The sillouette of the island mountains at sunset offered a pallet of pastels not normally seen. Reservations for an outdoor table are necessary so call ahead. Well worth the visit.
Wow. We saw this a few times while we were in Hong Kong, and we didnt tire of it. We saw it from the Peak and also from the Avenue of Stars and from Hong Kong Island, well worth a look, a few times!
Breath taking. One of the best city skylines I have seen - it always takes my breath away even though I have seen it many times.
Great view. Give yourself plenty of time to get up and down. Very crowded and need to line up. Also buy the full ticket for sky tower at the bottom if you want to go to the top.

Laser show of Hong Kong skylines. We are so glad to get up to 29 floor of the Madera hotel promenade deck to see the 8pm skyline laser show. Our little kids love the lights of different colors from the high rise buildings. The show lasted about 15 minutes. No matter how busy you are, schedule a time to see this if you are visiting HK. Worth the time. Besides cost you nothing but just your precious time. Why not?

Unreal. Looking at the skyline at night was like looking at a printed picture - you just cannot compute that this is real - great way to spend an evening - also a trip on the Star Ferry is a great experience

One of the most spectacular skylines of this world. Best to be seen from a 2.20 HK$ trip on Starferry from central to Tsim Sha Tsui. Even better photos you can take from Kowloon sight between 8 and 8:30 pm during Symphony of light

Amazing sight. It was breathtaking to see from the hotel. The weather was terrible unfortunately. We were there in June 2008 (that wasn't one of the options for this review which is why the date is wrong)
WHOOOOOO. when the sun goes down and the light on het buildings, its great to experience the beauty of the skyline
A sight not to be missed. It was breathtaking, especially at night. I have seen that view before on plenty of pictures but there is nothing like the real thing

Beautiful View. I've been to Hong Kong a couple of times, and have been to the harbour numerous occasions to look at the night lights of Hong Kong island and i never get bored of it.Despite it being in the middle of busy Hong Kong, i find it surprisingly relaxing. The nightly symphony of lights at 8pm is a must see. It's best viewed from Kowloon looking over the harbour onto Hong Kong island. You can do it the other way round, but you'll find it's best being on Kowloon side. Theres commentary at the start and then music, and the commentary broadcasts in English on Mon, Wed & Fri.If you're lucky enough to have a Hotel room that looks over the harbour, and you're in your room during the light show, you can listen to the narration and music on 103.4FMThe view of Hong Kong at night is also great, viewed from 'The Peak'Now, the view of Hong Kong from a plane is altogether a different experience. The view from the ground looks wonderful, but whilst flying home the other night, the plane flew along and round the harbour before heading away from Hong Kong and the view at night was just magical.

This is not why you should visit Hong Kong. The laser show is not very visible and it is like a tourist trap - you shouldn't visit Hong Kong to see this show....There are plenty of other things to do....
OMG!!!!!!. very close to home yet so far from reality....the skyline is like NYC or MIami with a Blade runner factor thrown in ......absolutely fabulous!!!!!!!
Awesome views. Really great skyline and light show!Try to see the light show from the terrace of the W Hotel... amazing!
Nothing like it. No mater where you are, the Hong Kong skyline is simply stunning. Beats everywhere else I have ever been hands down, and that includes New York.
First experience. Loved the business district but Kowloon was a bit dissapointing. MTR and Ferry services very good, make sure you but an Octopus ticket
a city on steroids. the Hong Kong Skyline is just one of the amazing things you'll note about any visit to Hong Kong. And the 8:00 pm light show from the boardwalk is a must-see for any tourist.

the best in the world. green space, sea and skyscrapers. take the elevator to Victoria's Peak. Another great place to enjoy the skyline is at the Ritz Carlton. One can have drinks at the cocktail bar, eat at the Italian restaurant or visit Ozone.

the greatest view in hong kong!. the view was really really great, where you can see hong kong city from above the hills. you can ride a peak tram to get to the skyline, and you can see a greatest view along the way

Good view of HK. A must see in HK. You see all the buildings!! :D
I think this is the main attraction of the HK. All their buildings are jampacked in a small area.
Lots of tourist in this area.

We are the real show. Great skyline, of course. But what I like best is the show given by ourselves: the world is passing by the promenade in Kowloon at sunset. Groups of farmers in uniform from the mailand mixed with sophisticated trendy teenagers from the city dressed as Korean cartoons: people from Japan to Europe, (passing from America), residents or in their once-in-a-life adventure... you are part of the show ( and attract interest) as much as spectator: you are as "strange" exotic and interesting as any other subject. Who is "normal"? I like it because here HK shows its global nature in its more natural - instinctive - form.

Skyline best viewed from Kowloon. Go later in the day to see the sun set behind the skyline. The promenade by the Avenue of the Stars and the Hong Kong Museum of Art is the best place to view the impressive skyline.
Every thing is big in Hong Kong. Must do's in HK, Lantau Island cable car to Giant Buddha. Peak tram and peak with Madame Tusades. Ocean Park, Stanley or Ladies markets and Harbour cruise.

No need for the symphony of lights. Really great, lots of tourists. No need to see the symphony of lights which is a great dissapointment. Check out the skyline from some of the sky bars or down around the star ferry station in Koowlon.
Touristy but a must. Very touristy and crownded but the light show is unique. The skyline is spectacular bring a decent tripod.

amazing night sky. Hong Kong Night sky lights up with all the building light show. This can be seen any many places around, we were in a cruise ship in the harbour so had a birdseye view.It was absolutely briiliant, complete with music and lasted for at least 15 mins, although the lights were still amazing after this time.

where is better else?. well,what i have to say now..so so beautiful & amazing skyline view, when go up top floor to see the splendid night with so many people, we drink lots of drink & see stars on the sky together,dont forget this place if you go to Hongkong, one more thing, do not forget to bring camera,!

go at sunset. yeah it is damn impressive, and kowloon is a cool area to wander around too. You will be competing with a lot of other photographers but there are plenty of spots, although the best spot for the sunset at this time of year is kowloon end and there is not that much space there.

fantastics night view in the highest the peak and sky 100. There is a fantastic night view scene in the highest points in hong kong like the peak and sky 100, also everywher in hk can view the fantastic scene of hong kong beautiful skyscrapers.

Beautiful.. Been to Hong Kong for so many times in my life, I still wait to see the skyline every time I go there. It was one of the greatest skyline in the world indeed. The cheapest way to enjoy the view was riding on the ferry. It only costs you 3 HK Dollars (around 0.25USD). You can also enjoy the view from the avenue of stars in Kowloon, but that would not give you the feeling of "dynamic" of Hong Kong.Give it a try and you will love it.

Just as all the pictures that I have seen show it as. The half day trip that was on offer is something I would recommend taking you up to Victoria Peak where the views are fantastiv even when it is over cast
The best in the world. Not to be missed if you come to Hong Kong for pleasure or business. The best view is from Tsim Sha Tsui, just in front of the Cultural Centre.

WOW! Go to the top of Victoria Peak.. Take a cab for $5 rather than wait for cable car. Spend more time on top of the mountain. Good shopping and eating on top, Try the noodle shop. You can take subway to Hong Kong Isalnd or take the Star Ferry ride if you like. Suggest Ferry ride in evening to catch the lights on the harbour.

Beautiful picturesque view by day and night!!. Take the tram ride up to see the view over the city by day and find a great hotel to see the beautiful view by night and do some building spotting! - Go and see the light show by music at night it's definitely worth a look!
Hong kong sightseeings. I like the Cantonese dimsum, 'Australian diary' food and the workers efficiency . I dislike the crowd and can tolerate the jam.
Impressive. A really green city- skyscrapers surrounded by rainforest. I've never seen Manhatten, or Rio, but this has to be one of the most emblematic skylines in the world.
Spectacular view. I highly suggest coming during the day AND during the evening. The excellent skyline is very different on both times of the day!
Spectacular. The eight o'clock laser show every night was nice. The view from the Ozone Bar at the Ritz was worth the cost of drinks. Plus a great breeze in the almost outdoor lounge area!

Amazing!. Highrises/Office towers everywhere you look. Even more beautiful at night when they light up the buildings on the Hong Kong side for the Symphony of Lights. Take the Star Ferry at night to see both sides.
Best in world. Hong Kong's skyline is truly magnificent with all the tall buildings and twinkling lights at night. Hard to beat it.

Even the blasé should be impressed. Take the Star Ferry and marvel as this skyline while now China's face to the world was largely laid out and built before they took it over as a Special Administration zone.
Unless nothing impresses this is one special skyline

One of the best cities for skyscrapers. Drink or dine in some of the skyline bars and restaurants for a beautiful view of the Kong Kong. Hotel LKF on Wyndham street has a nice roof top bar which gets real busy after about midnight. The Peninsula hotel has a great restaurant at the top with exquisite dining experience.
Spectacular. Guys, take your girl to visit Victoria Peak or get a high and above hotel room facing the central side of Victoria Harbor. You'll thank me that you took the advice :)
Night time from the clock tower deck is the best place. Must do. Pick a clear night. Liked the spectacle and the ferry ride over and back was easy. Went to 7-11 and bought some beers. Cheap date.

You know you're in HK when.... You're standing by the rivers edge looking at the soaring towers of Hong Kong with the boats in front of you on the water, it's a scene you've seen in many a brochure, the quintessential Hong Kong picture and you're right there! THAT is a good feeling! It's a pretty awesome skyline, and yes it's smoggy, but when the laser light show starts you can't really notice all that, and I suspect you won't care either.If you go to Hong Kong, make your way to the waters edge and have your own 'I'm in Hong Kong' moment!
light show. there is a light show in the evenings about six pm. You can get a great view from the stars avenue in Koowlong.
Smog limits the view. It's a city skyline... not something I'd get too excited about. What you can see is limited by the large amount of smog.

Breathtaking. The Symphony of Lights show is a must see in Hong Kong...absolutely amazing to watch. try to get in early though to get a good spot; it can get really crowded. You can also buy tickets to watch the show on one of the tourist boats
Gorgeous!. The Hong Kong skyline is definitely something that everyone should get to see at least once in their lifetime. It really is that spectacular.
Classic postcard views.. Best from the Star Ferry or from Kowloon side - both at night! Sky scrapers and neon lights at night - get your camera out.

If in HK, why would you not go?. The view is amazing. View it in the day, go for the laser show, see it from HK side, see it from Kowloon side, see it from Star Ferry, pop in the 7-11 and stock up on snacks and go for a long wander.
Just go ;-)

Wow. What a view not to be missed you are mesmerised especially at night
look out for the evening light show

Amazing skyline. Go to Kowloon to the avenue of the stars and enjoy the light show at 8pm. The light show is not amazing but from there you can see all the skyline during the night with all the buildings illuminated by all their amazing lights.
The Sky Srapers. The best part is the view from victoria harbor in twilight. The light and sound show is a must see for every visitor.
Colourful skyline. The skyline looks beautiful infront of the mountains. Hong Kong harbour is so unique; it doesn't look like any other harbour in the world.
Unique. Great harbour view with lots of new buildings reaching the sky - every night at 20h some of them are the stars of a laser show!

Good way to spend 20 minutes!. It's nothing groundbreaking, but it's fairly good. The view from Tsim Sha Tsui promenade (Kowloon side) is one of the best views. If you have 20 minutes to spare, go ahead and do this.Get there 15 minutes before so you can actually stand by the railing for an unobstructed view. The Hong Kong skyline at night rivals that of New York in my opinion as it has the harbor as a bonus. The light show was not spectacular (albeit good), but it's really the night skyline that will mesmerize you. The neon lights bounce off the water while one or two festive boats float by. The breeze is cool, and in that moment you get a glimpse of magical Hong Kong. Find time to pause and take it all in. Then go if you must (laser show notwithstanding).

Some tips. Get the star ferry which is incredible cheap and see the skyline all around. Another tip go to the peak at night and day time . If there is a queue for the tram which is actually a funicular bin it and get a taxi to the top. As you come out near the station take the Tarmac very narrow roar which looks like a wide path to the left not the steep road up the hill, this road will lead you after a few mins easy walking to the easiest and best view of hong kong from the top of the hill the overlooks hong kong. Get the tram down, be aware the tram seats face up hill and everyone misses the great view unless you swivel around and look where you are going there are some spectacular views that everyone else misses because they are facing up hill!

Amazing views !. It is good to look at the city skyline from two different points (at night it is better) located from the both sides of the sea. You can get to one of them via tram claiming to the hill (cable railway). We took taxi to get there and not to wait in the huge line to get the tram.
8pm light show. If your on the harbour, there is accompanying music to the city skyline light show, but even without the music it's very pretty.

Nice view form Harbour. You have to go there at least once if you visit Hong Kong. Good for taking pictures and a stroll. Have a cold drink under the hot sun, nice. If you're free, you can come back at 8pm for the lazer show. But if you can find better things to do, don't bother. The lazer show is disappointing with lousy music and speakers.
Beautiful view from the Kowloon harbour. Beautiful view of the Hong Kong skyline from the Kowloon harbour. Don't miss it. And don't miss the Doraemons as well! :)

it's average. Buildings, skyscrapers, lights.... not very attracting.... but since it's a landmark of hk, i guess it's ok. The Peak would be better. If you really want to go there, then i suggest you to take a ferry across the harbour. Then, that would be pretty nice.
Amazing. The skyline in Hong Kong is amazing, simply amazing. At about 8pm at night they have a light show where all the buildings coordinate and music is played, great atmosphere.

Light Show. We arrived an hour before the show and held our positions until the commencement of the light show. The winners were those who arrived just before the start and pushed their way in, left, right and centre. And after it was over we thought "Was that all??" We certainly didn't see the number of lasers shining from buildings, as portrayed in advertisements. Pleasant, but we wouldn't be bothered again.

Light Show. I've read rave reviews about the light show but honestly - I wouldn't bother. Yes, it was pretty but nothing spectacular. I think if you have nothing better to do then go along the harbour front and stake your claim but if you miss it, I wouldn't be fussed

Smoggy. I suppose its what we call THE WEATHER THEN?Hong Kongers say its the pollution from across the border. August being a hot and still-air month also probably contributed to the Smog.Better than having a typhoon blowing through though!

Beautiful view. Take the ferry across the bay :) -- you'll love it!
the weather was perfect -- breezy and it was close to sunset , so the view was amazing!!

Hong Kong Skyline.. Who can miss it during a visit to Hong Kong, the views from Victoria Harbour are particularly spectacular and photogenic. You need to visit at least twice, once at night to view the laser light show at 8pm which is well worth seeing.
Probably the nicest skyline in the world. 8pm - light show. Watch it! It's an impressive skyline. Make sure you do go up the Peak as well, although the queue will be long.
Victoria Harbour. Loved the lights at night how they reflected on the water. I was a little disappointed in the laser show at 8:00.....thought there would be more activity than there was.
Breathtaking. The drive from the airport was beautiful. The photo opps and views from the waterfront are amazing. We also watched the laser show from Ozone bar which was a worthwhile experience.
Wow. Join the crowds on the Kowloon side of the harbour and enjoy the views towards Hong Kong. Head there in the evening to enjoy the light-show. Just get there early to find a spot to see it all.

Nice view. Our hotel in Kowloon (the Shangri-La) adjoined a pedestrian walkway which went to the promenade along the harbour. At night there was a laser show, visible from both islands. Very crowded. Interesting to see, but it's really just different buildings lit up. Glad we did it, but I was disappointed. I'm not sure what I was expecting ... Definitely different than being in the west - the railing in some places was a metal chain! Some sort of water ferry (but not the Star ferry) picked people up right outside our hotel. It wasn't crowded to walk along in the late afternoon.

Better than Manhattan. Go to the Ritz Carlton in Kowloon and have an appy in the lounge or go up to Ozone bar (both are above the 100th floor). Bring your camera - the view of HK's skyline is terrific.

Best thing about HK. Hong Kong is a great city with some breath taking views of man made wonders.The city is all about the tall buildings - each a landmark. How to view HK. Go to the peak with the peak tram in the morning on a clear sky day and enjoy a 360 degree view of the city. At night go to Avenue of starts and watch the symphony of lights where the greatest skyline put up the greatest show. Take a ferry back from Kowloon and check out the view from a ferry.

amazing View of HK from the peak. Best place for the HK skyline was at the peak or on the star ferry,I would recommend going to the peak about one hour before dark and stay until fully dark to get some amazing pics of the skyline.good luck with your timing I went to the peak three times to get a clear picture, but every time the pollution from China prevented me getting the picture I wanted.
Nice City, Shopping City. Hong Kong is a Shopping City it is possible buy whatever just a block away. Also you can find western restaurants or Japanese. Summer fun on the Peak is a good trial.
Hong Kong Skyline at Night. Beautiful Sight. Best Seen from Victoria Peak at night. Must see if you are in Hong Kong. Also view of the sea from different parts of hong kong is beautiful.
Captivating. Beautiful from The Peak by day or by night. Even better from a boat in Victoria Harbour as the sun is going down.

sky line best place to see in h.k. h.k sky line is most butyfull place of asia skyskeper building u like watch in day and in night at 8pm. their is light show everyday it is unforgatabal exprience on 22july2012 their was typhoon in h.k n i was their i go to koolon sea all trafic on road was close their was no boat in sea the city which dosenot sleep was become slince the vayolent waves of ocen encoraging me to dance in raini with my family
Great views from TST promenade. Wonderful views at dusk and at night time from the TST promenade. Great for walking and strolling about. Can get very crowded on weekends and some evenings
The Peak - getting there. To get to The Peak using the Tram found signage quite poor. Once you got to the top was excellend. Would suggest go early in the morning as the queues get quite long.
Amazing. Beautiful and impressive skyline, especially at night. Lazer show and lighting of buildings beautiful.
amazing lights. Hong Kong skyline, have never seen a light show like it, great from all round the harbour and from the Peak. Due to inclement weather couldnt see the laser show at its best.

Night time lights to remember. Around 9pm each night the sky scrapers in HK light up in a coordinated way that lights up the horizon and makes it seem like New Years Eve every night.
Best viewed from a water side location. Take your night camera.

Spectacular. I loved it all and want to go back.. Easy to communicate with people , which you can't say about a lot of other Asian countries.
All in all a great experience..
Any view is breathtaking. Ride on a double decker bus into or out of town to get a full view of the spectacular skyline. We took the bus to stanley market, but the drive there was half the fun!

Simply the Best. It is gorgeous! The peak, the harbor, the star ferry: it looks exquisite from every angle. I recommend trying to see it from all the angles too: each one is worth the different glimpse of the perfect skyline. In April there were some clouds, but we were still able to see the skyline clearly: especially at night.

Postcard view, everywhere you look.. I've done a lot of travelling, but there aren't many places that can compete with these views. The backdrop of the mountains makes it a very unusual skyline. The harbor reflects the lights at night and many of the buildings have neon or changing lights. Impressive.

Fantastic skyline. We paid extra for a harbourview room and was not disappointed when staying in hong kong i would not want it any other way. The skyline is amazing. I remember seeing it in many of my husbands Jackie Chan and other hong kong legends films before going and thinking I wonder if it really looks like that. The answer is it does but it is ever changing so will not be the same the next time you go. It is so varied the new and old squashed together surrounded by green mountainous terrain. Whoever thought hong kong was just the island was very much mistaken. We loved the mix of the old and the new and the promenade that was just outside our hotel on the Kowloon side. We would highly recommend staying in a nice hotel on Kowloon like ours as is is this way you get to see the skyline day and night outside your window then stay on the island itself to be in the thick of it.

Four Taller Buildings in Hong Kong. Hong Kong skyline is the most beautiful in the world.Any visitor who has been here would agree..In Hong Kong, you’ll see the most beautifully designed skyscrapers by world-famous architects. These state-of-the-art buildings do worth a visit. The Four Taller Buildings in Hong Kong. there are Central Plaza, Bank of China Tower, IFC II, and The Center. The tallest is International Finance Centre II (IFC II).

THE skyline worldwide. For me this skyline is the pinnacle of all skylines worldwide. Even compared with cities like NY or LA, HK has the most amazing density of skyscrapers. Really one of those things to MUST see
Breathtaking. Best skyline in the world. The Hong Kong skyline is one of a kind. The lights of the buildings on the water are beautiful. Everyone can take a world class photo here!
Great skyline. The skyline is great at day and night. Every night at 8PM there is a light show. Truth be told, you really don't have to see it. It's nothing special.
amazing. stunning. by day and by night, it doesn't matter. the Ritz Carlton tower views were worth the money. so were Victoria Peak.
HK city lights. The lights of Hong Kong city skyline to the Peak from the hotel rooms and top floor restaurant are mesmorising.

Best seen from Star Ferry. Cheapest romantic sail in the world. Cheat - stay on board and save the return fare!
Get ferry either from Central or Wan Chai pier
Best seen from Kowloon side at night.

Three days in Kowloon. Easy to travel around Kowloon and Hong Kong, plenty to see, lots of fine cafes and restaurants.
Disliked being constantly hassled by hawkers on leaving ferry.
Tsim Sha Tsui. Missed the 8.00pm light display but the night view is simply awesome. Started from Promenade all the way to Arena of Stars.

Beautiful Skyline, Really Lame Night Show. The view of the Hong Kong Skyline is very impressive, both day and night. I could sit on the river walk and stare at the harbor and skyline all day. Every night at 8:00pm, there is a show called "Symphony of Lights" in which lights decorate the skyline set to music. People begin lining the "Avenue of Stars" about 1 hour prior to the shows start. I was one of these people. When the show began, I started laughing hysterically. There were really bad laser effects, cheesy chasing lights on buildings, and occasional flashes of colored lights in the sky. I imagine the show was really cool circa 1990, but it appears really dated and, well, lame. What was even funnier was all of the tourists that were taking millions of pictures of it. My Christmas tree is more entertaining. If you are hoping for a good laugh, this will provide!

The Sky at Night. The light show at dusk is a must not miss in Hong Kong. If you stay at The Royal Pacific HJotel & Towers with a view of the harbour, turn the room lights off then sit back, relax and enjoy views to the Peak.
wow and wow again. The view rivals any around the world and to take in the view of the harbour from 26 floors up at night is a thing of true beauty.
One of the World's Best. I've been to many cities and Hong Kong has one of the best Skylines. Even with the constant fog/smog it was still a site to be seen, especially at night.

amazing. Such an impressive show to watch. I watched it from just next to the Star Ferry terminal, great atmosphere and not too crowded. You definitely have to see this when you're in Hong Kong. Follow on with a few drinks at Aqua Spirit bar, or head up to Temple St night markets for something more cultural
Great views. Great views, better by evening than by day, ideally from a restaurant with the right location or from one of the Ferries
Beautiful/breathtaking. I'm from Chicago and I love my city's skyline, but the HK skyline...just absolutely gorgeous. A must-see!
Excellent. At night from the peak, the Hongkong skyline is very impressive, worth while experience. It is breathtaking and one of the most beautiful i have seen
Worth seeing. Absolutely worth seeing, especially if you are unfamiliar with skyscrapers. The Symphony of Light at 8'o clock every evening is very nice.
Good to watch. Good to watch from the harbour. Do not get on a ferry and watch it from there it's a waste of time. Pretty cool to see all the buildings light up

Best Skyline in the world.... Nothing beats the skyline of HK. With the symphony of lights that might look cheap but it is for free anyway!!! The architecture and just the walk on the avenue of the stars and capture ur favorite pick of the Skyline with the Star Ferry. That is ur HK postcard..!!!!
A must in Hong Kong. The view during day time is very impressive, particularly on a clear day, but at night it's absolutely stunning. Well worth braving the crowds and paying for the top level.

The best in the world in my opinion. The view is wonderful from Kowloon over the harbour to Hong Kong Island the high rise office blocks and hotels and then the green peak behind it, just spectacular! Then at night there is the "festival of lights", this really should not be missed. One of the best places to watch it from is the small promanarde by the cultural centre restaurant. You are about 30 feet (10M) up and all on your own with no one blocking your view as you can get down by the harbour rail! Operates everynight at 20.00 and has music which co-ordinates with the light shows from the 30 or 40 building that take part. One specail days, like chiense New Year there are fire works too, but I have never seen that. You can also be on the Hong Kong side for another veiw but this is not so spectacular.
