About the Best!. There's not too many skylines that can match Hong Kong. There's something very magic about it all. It's like a wonderful painting. Has to be seen to be believed really.

Words can't describe this!. The skyline in the day is spectacular enough, however come nightfall the whole place lights up and take on a whole new level. Pretty much every building on the island is lit up and iluminated providing a spectacular sight unrivaled by any other urban skyline. I personally didn't find the 8pm light show all that "spectacular" however the colloseum did look really good, along with some other indivudual buildings. Personally I would say the view from Avenue of the stars is better than the one experienced from the peak (a lot cheaper as well). All in all, the chances are if you're in Hong Kong you'll see the skyline anyway, however if your stay is extremely brief ensure you do take a walk along the front of Kowloon at night for that jaw dropping view of the most spectacular urban sight in the world.

A beautiful skyline that can't be missed!. There are several different ways to view the HK skyline and we were lucky enough to experience a few. Victoria's Peak tram taken up towards dusk allows you to see it in the daylight and to watch the twinkling lights come on at night but during high tourist season, consider alternative transportation and skip the chaotic tram. The Star Ferry to the outer islands gives a great view of the skyline as does one of the Macau ferry lines. Although we didn't make it, I also heard the Avenue of the Stars affords a terrific view.

Unlike anything I've ever seen before. We were lucky to have a view of the skyline from our hotel. Picutres and postcards doo not do it any justice. The view is a wonder in itself and willl leave you staring in amazement.
The most attractive scene of HK. If you have chance to visit, do not miss the chance to have a look of Hong Kong Skyline from the harbour. Very impressive.
Great even if it's raining.. As a Jersey girl (and not a Snookie type, but a REAL Jersey girl) who works in NYC, all I can say is "Sorry New York, Hong Kong kicks your skyline A--!
beautiful. exhilirating to see during the day and just as fascinating at night. Unfort did not get to watch the laser chow...next trip

Breathtaking. The view from the peak is just breathtaking. Don't go on a foggy day, as you really won't see anything, but if it is a clear day, go just before sunset and watch a beautiful sunset and watch the city light up. A MUST-DO when in HKG.

Impressive. The Peak (Victoria Peak) provides a great photo opportunity of the Kowloon/New Territories skyline. It is best to check the weather before you check out the skyline as it can be very disappointing on a foggy/misty day. Also go on the tram up to the Peak in the morning if possible- the crowds are just so hectic in the afternoon. The skyline is worth seeing from this vantage point.To get a great view of the HK Island Skyline then visit Sky 100 in Kowloon and you will get a great view of the island skyline. Avenue of Stars also gives a great vantage for viewing Hong Kong but again pick a good day and avoid mist etc.
A must see. Get to victoria peak on a clear day...... its breathtaking.... if cloudy you are wasting your time. he star ferry is another cheap alternative.. or the skyline at nght.... breathtaking

Best sky line in the world. Well ive seen it from Kowloon and from HK island. The best view is from the ritz carlton on the 118th floor bar or the 102 restaurant. But aqua has a great view also. HK has the best skyline in the world if you ask me. The light show rocks!

Hotel Marriott Skyline. a beautiful place to stay and relax while at Hongkong.The ambience is worth experiencing.Location is so ideal because of the close proximity of the hotel to the international airport.Further they run regular shuttle bus service between the hotel and airport which makes a visitor relaxed.Excellent enjoyable view of the South China sea is worth experiencing. Starting from reception till you check out the entire hotel staff take good care.The restaurants serve good food served in style.Room service is commendable. The swimming pool and the spa are excellent places to relax.The main city is slightly away from this location.
Hong Kong Skyline. Go up the Peak and take the little lane off to the right of the main hill. Keep going to get a great view.
Beautiful. Worth going before sundown to watch the transformation until dark and then stay for the light show. Magical. Brilliant for photographs.

Spectacular. I have benn going to Hong Kong for years and this view never gets old. I like it from a hotel or restaurant on the Kowloon side looking across the harbor. It is best at night from the star ferry, IMO.
Outstanding!. View the harbor from Ozone Bar on the 118th floor of the ICC/Ritz Carlton in the late afternoon and from the Star Ferry Pier at night for the laser light show. Absolutely beautiful!
Incredible. New York City is without a doubt the most famous skyline in the world, but as a sheer spectacle Hong Kong beats New York City hands down.

Fabulous. I love the HK skyline, especially when the light show is on. I love to watch it from a bar or a restaurant, but it is also great fun walking through the streets at Central while the buildings are lighting up.

One of the world's outstanding vistas. The Hong Kong skyline, with its shimmering facades, whether viewed from Victoria Peak or from the harbour front is one of the most breathtaking views in the world. Wait till the sun goes down and the lights transform that same vista in to something magical.
Does it get any better than this!. Such energy - such excitment! Everyone should experience HK in there life if they can and be sure to ride the Star Ferry!
great but grey skies. Great but grey skies, worth visiting the north side of the island too including Repulse Bay.

unmissable at night. The lights on all the tall buildings are varied and colourful. It's good at any time, but they run a 'symphony of lights' each night at 8 00 for 15 minutes. We were too late to get seats in the upstairs viwing area of tsim Sha Tsui, so we missed the commentary. But we saw all the laser beams and spotlights. Pretty good free show. Take a tripod if you are aerious azbout photos

Spectacular. The Hong Kong skyline at night is a fantastic sight. I am sure that everyone that goes there will have exactly the same photo's. Great views from the Kowloon Shangri-la hotel as our room was on the 16th floor.
Night Show is great. The daily night show is very good (children love it). Best place to see it is from the viewing platform next to the ferry station

Spectacular at night. The buzz does not do it justice, even without the light show the colours of the building were impressive. We saw the light show when it was not in english and we were not disappointed, the skyline is great in the day but spectacular at night, do both you will prob be back during your stay in hong kong.
Simply the Best. At night simply amazing and best of all free!, enjoy a walk on Kowloon side, see the hand prints of many famous people.
A little foggy the first day.. Spectacular view the second day. during the day was nice - at night it was unbelievable. Better than Shanghai.

Could be the best you'll ever seen. HK skyline could possibly be the best you will ever seen because it is very populated in this very limited land. As a result, there are skyscrappers everywhere. When we arrived at the Avenue of Stars, we were overwhelmed by how much city light the skyscrappers across the harbor had shocked our rods and cones. At 8 o'clock everynight, the laser show would start and music would accompany. I totally understood how much work it takes to make the laser show possible. But if this is the best skyline in the world, I'd be expecting a better and more massive laser show. Everything else is great. Make sure to be there a bit earlier to get the front row seats.

One of the best skylines in the world. It's continuous and contains an awesome and diverse grouping of buildings. In true asian style, there's tons of neon lights too. I'd recommend that you go at night to get the best view though.
Amongst the best in the world at night. Still a stunner at night and probably just getting better with age.

Beautiful and breath taking !!!. The view at night is spectacular and breath taking. I thought i am in one of those Hong Kong Movies. Nice Promenade and beautiful laser show every night.Just amazing !!

Beautiful skyline. Great views for all to see, the view is even more beautiful than you see in the travel brouchures. The skyline looks great at night looking across the harbour when you see all the colours of the lights on the building reflecting on the water. It makes a great photogragh to show the family and friends.
surely one of the best anywhere (man made). make sure you see it from the Peak & also the Avenue of Stars to get the full effect, go just before sunset
Nothing else like it in the world. No matter your hotel, but sure to book a room with a view of the skyline. It is worth every cent!
One of the world's greats. There are so many different places you can go to view the Hong Kong skyline. My favourite is the Kowloon Public Pier. It has to been seen at night when it comes alive.

Spectacular night-view form the harbour and Victoria peak. An awesome laser show in the evenings playing with skyscrapers and harbor lights.
Must see!
skyline. we booked evening tour to see laser light show, we went in cruise, it was excellent

Absolutely Stunning!. Well, what can I say. I think Hong Kong's skyline is the most beautiful in the world, and if you ever get the chance to see the Symphony of Lights at 8pm, then do it. It's free, and it's absolutely stunning and beautiful. (I heard Hong Kongers complain about how the show used to be better in the past, but for me as a first-time visitor to Hong Kong of course I couldn't judge, and I still enjoyed it a lot.) There isn't really any negative aspect - it's a must when you're in Hong Kong. Bring a good camera if you can for the Symphony of Lights though, my tiny compact camera had troubles capturing the beauty without blurring it all.Oh, just one last thing: Be prepared to defend your spot against ruthless latecomers!
Has it all and for al. Once you get to The Pick you would never believe what you see
Hard to beat. take ferry over to kowloon for 8pm light show, not that spectacular but still worth the trip.

"Amazing". Hong kong Skyline is amazing and light & lazer show in the evening is marvelous. There are three best ways to watch the skyline and all three are highly recommended. Watch from the star ferry, watch from the harbor and watch from the victoria peak. We loved it.
Bring a decent SLR!. The lightshow at night-time was fantastic. My compact camera had a rubbish sensor so all my night-time phots came out blurry. I so wish I brought my slr with me.
Great nightlights. Outstanding skyline from the star ferry! The views of both Hong Kong Island and Kowloon were great,
Bset view on earth. See it at night when all the lights (especially at Christmas) and lasers light up the waterfront.

The BEST skyline in the world!. Just take a trip on the Aqua Luna (they do some new Discovery Tour, a sort of hop-on / hop-off service that's very affordable). It's just THE most amazing way to see the best Skyline ever. (Alternatively, you can book a table at their restaurant and view the Skyline from there while enjoying nice food and drink. Either way, you'll be amazed!)
Must take your time. Better with firework-best firework ever, take time to soak in all
Excellent. Its worth watch huge buildngs in such well planned .
Light Show. It wasn't as advertised - not much of a 'laser' show, but the lighting of the buildings made the whole thing look like the buildings were dancing. Loved that.

Brilliant. I saw it at night and during the day and it is so beautiful. The best place to see it is via a ferry trip or from the Tsim Sha Tsui promenade. On the promenade, is the Avenue of the stars where the Bruce Lee statue is located. Who doesn't love Bruce Lee?!
Breathtaking at Night. A sight to be experianced, one of the cities that you must experiance before you die, add it to your bucket list...

Beautiful. Wow.fantastic Stunning beautiful and so exciting Exciting busy harbour with new skyscapers meet the old buildings. So packed with life and interesting. One could look at the skyline for hours
1000 Pictures Not Enough. We literally took hundreds of pictures: at daybreak, at sunset, in the rain, and at night. There is a light show that is amazing.

Beautiful. No matter where you view it from, it's amazing. Pretty from the middle of Victoria Harbour on a junk boat, from the 102nd floor of the ICC (Ritz Carlton restaurant) on the Kowloon side and from our 11th floor room at the Mandarin Oriental on Hong Kong island side.
beautiful. so many colours and buildings. There is a definite wow factor when you watch the lightshow, whether you watch it from the peak or tsim sha tsui

Great idea, i enjoyed it. It's a great idea and you will enjoy it during your cruise. But don't dedicate time just for it.
I believe it's a great idea but it could have been better executed (my own opinion).
What a view. One of the world's most spectacular views, day or night, but especially at night. The lights from across the harbor in Kowloon are a knockout you will never forget!

Massive. It is dynamic- Looks like Manhattan multiplied by ten, with incredible techno lighting. I highly recommend a hotel room with a view of the skyline, where you can fall asleep looking at it, at the end of each day.
One of the world's iconic places!. Watched fire works over Hong Kong from Kowloon side, it was absolutely incredible! Some of the greatest pictures of Hong Kong ever.
A Must to See. The new synchronised laser show starts at 20.00 hours each night and is a wonderful sight.

Beautiful skyline. Amazing view in the night. Tall standing structures by the sea and mountain side. Good architectural buildings. Easily viewable from various parts of HongKong. Some buildings participate in the daily night light show that happens around 8:00pm local time
What's not to love?. I never tire of it. We walk the Promenade across the harbor from the ferry to Fisherman's wharf and get to see this awesome skyline.
Pretty as a picture. We have been to New York but we feel HK has a "prettier skyline" There is nothing to dislike.
Free Light & Sound show at 8pm every night. this was well worth it but get into position early as it gets packed.
World famous for a good reason . . .. Beautiful modern skyline, with ever taller buildings. I never get tired of looking at the beauty of it.

8pm. The skyline cannot be desrbed in just a few words. I have a large poster in my office to remind me how colurful and spectacualr it all is. Try and watch the daily evening light show from the Kowloon shoreline walkway (avenue of the stars)

Great View of Central Skyline from Ah Yat Restaurant. We had dinner at Ah Yat Seafood Restaurant in Kowloon and with the subdued lighting inside the restaurant, we had a great view of the Central Skyline celebrating Mother's Day.

Nothing short of spectacular. This is a must see from several perspectives. From TST, from the Star Ferry, from Victoria Peak, from Jardine's Lookout. On the expressway in from the airport, if it's a clear day (rarely!), the city creeps up on you. First-time visitors if you're staying on Hong Kong Island take a taxi from the airport to get a real idea of the scale of Hong Kong. The road winds up the coast of Lantau, through tunnels and huge bridges until you begin to make out that spectacular city scape. Through the Western Harbour Tunnel and you're out among skyscrapers. It really is one of the best city arrivals in the world, rivalled in my view only by New York. Unlike New York however most of Hong Kong's buildings don't bear close inspection, though there are some gems such as the HSBC building and The Bank of China.The light show - well, see it once. You probably won't want to see it twice, as it's a bit small for the scale of the city in my opinion, and a precious waste of electricity.
Great View. Love this place - strange bar on the top - love it
just wow. a view you just cant tire of. The light show wasnt as wow as I had in my head but definately a must see. man made madness
Iconic. There is no other view in the world like it. You simply can't beleive your eyes.

Pretty by Night. The Hong Kong skyline is very pretty by night. The buildings put on a light show at 8.00pm each night for around 15mins which is beautiful to watch from either the middle of the Harbour or, if you are lucky, from a vantage point within a restaurant or hotel room. By day, it is not as impressive due to the low cloud/humidity which makes it greyish (in June).

Everyone Does It. If you go to Hong Kong, you have to go to the harbor. The view of Hong Kong from Kowloon is the famous side, but the view of Kowloon from Hong Kong is pretty good, too. The Star Ferry or MTR easily goes from one to the other.Serious photographers should go just before sunset to see the difference between daylight, sunset and night. Once the light comes up it will get very crowded now that they do that fireworks show. If you try to set up your tripod on that viewing platform, people will run into you.

Amazing - NOTHING like it in the world!. What can I say? An incredible view of an amazing city! Lots of fun stuff to do down by the Kowloon waterfront where you get beautiful views of the city (Hong Kong Island). At night there is a really cool lazer light show that is really worth seeing, especially if its a bit hazy out.

Day or Night. It is electric (sorry for the pun) but day or night it is just amazing,
take the oppertunity to see it from the river and the peaks you will not be dissapointed.
Wow. Bustling, vibrant harbour city. Don't bother with the nightly light/laser show - it does not add anything and is actually really naff!!

Smog and more smog. I had heard of Hong Kong's famous Skyline but I must admit, it was a little bit of a letdown. I took the ferry to Tsim Sha Tsiu at sunset with my camera. Sad to say all I witnessed was the smog of the city. This was not what I expected and definitely not what some of my colleagues had told me about so excitedly. Perhaps I will go again one day, hopefully on a better day. I can recommend that you travel to Hong Kong to see it but, make sure it is on a good day. Perhaps a better view on the peak is necessary to capture the full wonder of it. I will definitely come back to see it.

Best skyline in the world. What can you say: the skyline from Victoria Peak during the day and night. The nightly lightshow from either Tsim sha tsui or wan chai. My favorite skylines in the world are the city I live in and HK.

Amazing scenery. At night the place become a picture perfect place! All those lights and colors dancing on the waterfront. unfortunately, there didn't seem to be lots of places to hang out to enjoy a relaxing evening...cafes of restaurants...

Skyline. A trip to Hong Kong is not complete unless you view the Hong Kong Skyline. This can be done and enjoyed on both the Island side, ideally from the Peak, looking over to Kowloon or from Kowloon looking over the Harbour to the Island. To be fully appreciated you should see both the Day views and the Night views. I preferred the Night views, but thats just my opinion. Either way it would have to rival, if not better, New York for its Splendour. It does boast some wonderful lights for the night viewing, but they are a tad overstated though many people on the evening were "oooing and ahing" as each light made its presence known. A big plus is that its FREE!! from Kowloon side but to enjoy from the Peak there are very minor costs.
Night lights. The lights of Hong Kong are amazing the high rises at night with their lights make a post card picture

Fabulous. It was exciting to see the Hong Kong Skyline since you see it on the news so often. The light show at night was disappointing. It was extremely cloudy (typhoon was nearby) so I am not sure if that is why it was disappointing. I would try it again on a clear day to see if my opinion would change.
Totally cool!. Whether you view it from afar (The Peak or on Kowloon) you come to HK for this.

Amazing and a must see.. Hong Kong has the most skyscrapers in the world apparently, (twice as many as it's nearest rival, New York) Unlike New York, which is totally flat, Hong Kong is built on reclaimed land and also steep hills, which makes for a multi tiered landscape and lots of contrasts. The modern skycrapers are interposed with many high rise residences with washing hanging out of the windows and I loved that! It's a beautiful view in the day time and magnificent at night. Best seen from the Peak I think, It's awe inspiring, but also fantastic at harbour level.

Simply stunning. The Hong Kong skyline is absolutely gorgeous, especially at sunset. I'd highly recommend that you try and check out the sunset view from the ferry that crosses over from Central to Kowloon or from up on the Peak where you get a bird's eye view of the city.
Mesmerizing skyline. Blows your mind away, especially on a clear day and especially at night

Nice scenary at clear days and evening. Great place to watch the skyline is by the clock tower at the tsim sha tsui piers...good idea is to go back and forth at the ferries from central, chai wan and tsim sha tsui...cheapr than doing the star ferry harbour tour... Make sure u get at the viewing deck by 19/19:30 to get a nice place to sit and watch the lights show...
Beautiful city. One of the most iconic skylines in the world. A must do when visiting Hong Kong
Take the tram up and a bus down.. There is no need to go to the viewing platform. Just walk around the top of the hill, the views are very nice.
the best in the world. Love it. we have the best skyline in the world,Sea, green and high risers! great combination.
Hard to beat.... Amazing view. One of the best city skylines in the world. Be sure to pop over to Kowloon or to the Peak for the best of it.
Fab!. It's marvelous! There are so many skyscrapers, unbelievable. Love the contrast with the sea and the hills.
Super Views!. A MUST SEE, particularly the Light Show at 8 PM every evening--EnJoY!

Iconic and amazing!. To get the best view, I headed to the Avenue of the Stars (Tsim Sha Tsui MTR), where you can see the bay and the skyline. The Star Line Pier is also a good place to see the night show (8pm) from with the lasers etc.
Nice when the fog lifts. The skyline from the Kowloon side was far nicer than the HK side.
Go to the top of the mountain. Go to the top of the mountain. Great views and restaurant at the top
Awesome day or night. For the best view, visit the Kowloon side. Great views while wile watching the light show.
Nothing like it anywhere in the world. Love HK skyline especially at night from Tsim Tsa Tsui
what a skyline. you cant fault the sky line here - it is so recognisable

Amazing. Amazing, perfect, breath taking. Go to the cultural center everyday from 8 there is the symphony of lights. All HK skyline is dancing along 5 symphonies. CANT BE MISSED. Get ur starbucks from inside the center and head to the skyline. 15 minutes of utter amazment. All of this is for free
Just beautiful.. We visited the week before Christmas and all the buildings were kitted out with Christmas decorations which was extra special. Make sure you catch the Symphony of Lights!
stunning- though often shrouded. on a clear day this would be and amazing sight, unfortunately in late april during our stay there were non of these

Spectacular stars of Avenue. Avenue of stars in Tshim Tsha Tsui shd never be missed@ 8pm..every day.The Victoria harbor will floor you with spectacular Light show,never can be seen anywhere else in the world!
Awesome!. The best in the whole world, especially in the night! go for the light show!

Breathtaking. The view from the top of the Star Ferry Terminal is absolutely breathtaking. The harbour and buildings seem to go on forever in either direction. At night is just as special with the light shows.
Just Amazing. Do not leave Hong Kong without seeing the Lasor light show of the Harbour, it's just amaxing and , best viewed from Kowloon side,the architecture is spectacular lit up at night.
Wow!!. When you first stand on the Kowloon side of the harbour and look across it.. well you just think Wow!!

Fantastic views. The Hong Kong skyline has been determined to be one of the best in the world. The view from the promenade in TST is fabulous. The nightly laser light show showcases the many different buildings and the architecture of those buildings. Get an even better view from the Sky Lounge in the Sheraton Hotel.
what's not to say?. the view from Kowloon is mind blowing. the architecture is just incredible and to see it lit up at night is spectacular. i am in love with this view!
great. The Hk skyline is brillant especially on a night trip around the harbour

Your trip is incomplete without seeing this. It was the first on our to do list. we got off east TST mtr towards the exit closest to Avenue of stars. in between we walked past small garden in front of HK museum of arts and stop to pose for pictures with the lovely flowers in bloom.we got there early and as we waited for the symphony of light show at 8; we literally watch as the skyline darken and the lights of the buildings lit up the coast of hk island. if you are on hk island you would be facing the coast and skyline of Kowloon instead. it was our day1 in hk and a brilliant way to start our vacation. it was relaxing as you listen to the music, feel the wind and enjoy the sights. there's plenty of chairs to sit and relax. the laser and light show did not disappoint
Amazing cityscape. The buildings in Hong Kong are amazing, and many of the world's tallest ones are among them. The Star Ferry tour is a great way to see them and learn about the harbor and the city.
Brilliant. Starts at 8pm, get there early to get a good spot. The skyline 'show of lights' is fantastic.

wow!. Get there at 8pm to see buildings with all their lights on before they turn them off at around 10pm.Easy to acces by metro 'east Tsim Sha Tsui' station and then follow the signs to Avenue of the Stars.There are some food stands along the promenade if you like a snack and plenty of restaurants for a good dinner!

Breathtaking. Walking off Nathan road in the evening toward the harbour and then you see it. This is totally breath taking amazing and before you know it you have been standing there for ages gorping at it!! Day or night amazing !!! Just amazing.
Avenue of Stars. You should visit the skyline at night, they have a musical light show that's free to watch and absolutely captures Hong Kong's look and feel.
Best light show in the world. 8 pm on the foreshore of Vic Harbour is the place to be. Makes a rock concert look anemic by comparison.

One of the world's best skylines. Hong Kong equals skyline. It has been seen a million times but the real experience is still better :) Especially on Hong Kong Island, there's a ton of skyscrapers. My personal favourite is the Band of China Tower (the crystal shaped one) where you can go on the 43th floor for free and enjoy an amazing view on Victoria Harbour and the other multistory buldings. Most of the skyscrapers are illuminated at night which can be seen best from Kowloon, especially from the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade. At 8 pm there is the "Symphony of Lights" a 20 minute-lightshow which is nice to see. If you want to experience the vastness of Hong Kong concrete jungle you should take the tram to "The Peak". It leaves close to Central station, is a bargain and allows you the have a brilliant view on the skyline, particularly during and after sunset.

vertically challenged. vertigo-inducing skyline with no equal. Life is lived vertically in Hong Kong. "Standing room only" ought to be the city's motto. Once upon a time the "Honkers and Shankers" stole the lime-light but it has been eclipsed by a raft of new buildings eager to put it in its place and the Bank of China is easily the most memorable even if the IFC and ICC are taller.

Amongst the best.. On clear nights this Skyline takes some beating with all the multi coloured Skyscrapers and every evening at 8pm there is a laser light show on the HK Island. For best vantage be on Kowloon side or 6th floor of Marco Polo car park.
amazing. So architecturally appealing especially during the Light show. Plus has the building where they shot the batman movie!!!

The Best in the World. Watching the numerous building transition from day to night is amazing and they look even more spectacular light up. Over on the Victoria Harbour you can watch the dazzling Symphony of Lights daily. After visiting the peak in the day was a fantastic finale to a truely memorable day.
AVOID SYMPHONY OF LIGHT AT ALL COST. it is perhaps one of the most boring and overhyped light show of the HK skyline. Avoid it at all cost whenever you are at the Avenue of Stars
Awesome!. Best view is from the Avenue of the Stars. It can get quite busy here over the weekend so perhaps try to visit in the week. Love the buildings and the architecture!

A must see in HK... Day and night. The HK skyline is iconic; this is something that can be appreciated during the day and at night, as it completely changes at different times of the day, and it is free. A good viewing spot is from IFC (on the balconies in-between the restaurants) especially if there is a firework display over Victoria Harbour e.g. New Year's Eve.

Iconic from the top or accross the bay. Take the Tram to Victoria Peak to look straight down at the worlds most densely populated city. Night or day your eyes will thank you. A camera is a must. Don't have one? You can buy one at the gife shop at the top. From this perch you really feel as if you are on top of the buildings.

Unique. I've been coming to Hong Kong on business for almost 20 years and never tire of this view. It is instantly recognisable - from the IFC, Bank of China, HSBC, Lippo Centre and the Peak. Get a seat on Kowloon side around 8pm to watch the laser show - amazing.

I just love this ferry ride, every time I do it it makes me feel amazing.. I just love this ferry ride, every time I do it it makes me feel amazing. The best is the ride from TST to Central. You can get one cone of hot chocolate gelati from I scream then head up to enjoy the ferry ride. When you bite the last cone, the ferry is just hitting the Central Pier.

Great view of Honkers. The tram delivers you to an area where you can eat, drink and shop. From there you walk up to the viewing area. We spent quite a while taking in the breath-taking views. Well worth a visit.
No better view!. Check out the light show by night and the Star ferry by day or night!
second to none. Hong Kong is known for its skyline, and I wasn't let down. A must at day and again at night.
Spectacular at night.. Free light show at 8pm every evening with English commentary some evenings.

Spectacular at night with a laser show every night at 20h00!. Hong Kong is a skyline like no other. It has a busy waterfront, great architecture, the tallest peak in background (if you're on Kowloon island) an awesome display of lights and even a bulding that is supposed to be the most advanced clock in the world!!Every evening at 20h00 there is a laser show from some of the more prominent rooftops that is simply stunning! It's like Chinese New Year - every night! (Minus the fire-works of course!)Take a ferry ride, a boat trip or just find a seat on the Avenue of Stars and enjoy!
lights like fairyland. I love the whole Hong Kong thing , this was my second visit
Hong Kong, Pearl of the Orient. From the pool deck of my hotel, to the ocean terminal pier to Victoria Peak, Hong Kong has the best skyline. Don't miss the light show that starts each night at 8 PM.

JoH883. The skyline itself is magnificent, but I was a little disappointed with the 8 pm light show. I guess I expected too much. We watched it from a restaurant in Kowloon, where we had a great view. But I wasn't wowed.
watch the special lightshow 8pm each evening. try watching the view from a junk on victoria harbour!

Great view. A must do in HK as it offers breathtaking views. The ride to get to the top of the Skyline itself is worth it itself! It is best to go in the evening whilst the Symphony of lights is taking place.

awesome sight. from victoria peak at night time you'll seee hong kong skyline and it is indeed an awesome sight. can be very romantic too. try to go to Peak galleria where you can go to their observatory for free.
The Bright Lights Across the Way. The view especially at night was great as was the spectacular light show over the buildings on the opposite Hong Kong Island.
amazing. stunning how the city has been set up around the harbor. And the city keeps growing so it will only get better.

Hong Kong City by Night. It is a must for all travelers to ride the Star Ferry by night... One can take beautiful shots of Hong Kong's magnificent city skyline. I have been to HK several times and the view at night of HK island always amazes me and leaves me in awe. HK has so many amazing buildings. At night, different lights add color to these structures which cast a beautiful reflection on the waters... Simply magical!

More fun people watching!. Beautiful view, beautiful babies! The view was very pretty, but being from the states I found people watching far more interesting. We had a beautiful clear day and the view was amazing. The little kids running around posing for pictures was fun to watch. It's hectic getting on and off the tram but I thought it was worth it.

The ultimate!. The view of Victoria Harbour looking over to Hong Kong Island is magnificent, it is simply tower after tower and gets even better at night. You could stare at it for hours, don't miss the Symphony of Lights show at 8pm daily. Words really can't describe it.
Up, up, up.. Amazed to see the height and density of the high rises on Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.

Great. Great from certain areas, and if lucky to be here on a clear day. It is a very polluted city, so with luck, maybe a few days in a year, after heavy rain.
Don't let them tell you it's fog, or mist. That's only in April . Brown colour gives it away

Best skyline in the world !. What else should I say. With over 8000 skyscrapers Hong Kong has an amazing skyline to look up (or down) to. The composition of the buildings is almost perfect and with the smooth green hills in the background and the bay in the foreground it has everything !

Simply spectacular. Hong Kong has got to be one of the most spectacular and significant cityscapes in the world. The foundation of this great city is the dynamic community which resides and maintains the living environment in such great shape.
Impressive. The light show is a must see, best seen by ferry. If not I would recommned just past the convention centre.
Great experience. Enjoyed everything about it. It was a wonderful experience.

Beautiful Skyline, but Symphony of Lights highly overrated.. The skyline is known across the world and is fantastic to see. Go to the IFC mall, take some food and drinks and go to the top floor to see an amazing, free view.The symphony of lights is every night at 8pm. You need to be on the Kowloon side for the best view. It's slightly overrated though so dont be too down if you miss it.
Skyline of Hong Kong. The skyline is a fantasic sight. We saw it from the peak but it was a little cloudy but great sight. The light show at night was good but could be spectacular.

impressive - New York on the far East. I arrived Hong Kong by ferry, origin Zhongshan - China - on the Western side of the river and at night fall. I was advised to be watching for this and I must agree it stands impressive: "Skyscrapping" at its best tale, directly extracted from Hollywood movies, with myriads of lights, brands, and that look of the "american dream".Right out of the ferry station into Cantonese road, the show continues with all "griffed" brands available in flagship stores: Gucci, Dior, Armani, ... CONS - DISLIKED (a lot)I do not know if it was a coincidence or if it is just like that since this was my 1st and only time in this town, this particular place, but to catch a taxi is simply impossible. Long waiting lines and the drivers just refuse to take some people, using a criteria which is unknown or was simply unexplainable. After the 3rd trial I did quit and move into the metro station...
nice but not interesting. If it's free, it's worth going but if you have to pay for it, it's kind of expensive
Symphony of Lights. The view from the Esplanade at TST, Kowloon (near the Star Ferry Pier) at 8pm for the Symphony of Lights show a must.
Lovely at night. The Symphony of Lights is something every one needs to see at least once...8pm every night
Breathtaking. Amazing Hong Kong. The skyline is wonderful no matter what the weather.
Amazing. The most beautiful skyline i ever sow......the light show is great....and i was lucky with a very clear night.
A grey nighttime view. Wandet down to the Hong Kong cultural centre to see a nice evening view
Nice skyline. I think people make too much of it!! I found it quite average and not up to the hype built.

The skyline at night. The sound and light show is well worth viewing. It lasts for about an hour beginning at 7 pm. It is best viewed from the star ferry terminal boardwalk although we were able to see the lights from our hotel. Images light up on multiple buildings and the colours are spectacular.

Stunning - if a little 'whiffy'. It's a sight for sore eyes, skyscrapers all around you, and if you're there at the right time, a light show from the tops of the tallest ones.The only drawback is the slight (and sometimes strong) bad smell that whafts around when the wind is in the right (or is that wrong) direction.Definitely worth taking the Star Ferring from one side of the harbour to the other to get the full impact - twice as many skyscrapers as New York apparently
HK Skyline.... Beautiful skyline during the day but especially at night. Worth a visit even just to capture some stunning pictures of the colourful skyline at night.

Top 5 skyscrapers. Look carefully from Hong Kong Island side; you will notice that many of the buildings from East to West Kowloon are exactly the same height; 17 storeys. This was from the days of Kai Tak airport being located in Kowloon East, and the landing path had to be kept low over the city. Everything higher than that has been built since the airport moved in 1997; there must be hundreds of skyscrapers built in just 15 years.
Interesting. You really can't beat the New York City skyline but its pretty close.
Amazing!. Because we were there close to Christmas many of the buildings were decorated with lights.

Beautiful mix of nature and high-rise!. I love the way the mountains surround the city, providing a backdrop of nature behind the amazing high-rises and their lights. Then, you have other views that include the water...or the water AND the mountains - just beautiful, everywhere you look! The nightly light show is also an enjoyable sight - I watched it at least 2x, from both sides (Kowloon and HKI); it's fun the way so many of the buildings "participate" with their own lights and designs.
nothing special. dirty,poor crowded city, I can buy my electronics at Brandsmart.
Best skyline in the world!. Beautiful sky scrapers, sea and the green surroundings as background. Best seen from Kowloon.

Simply the best skyline in the world. Not only because it looks good, but because the people of HK actually understand that the modern marvel of building engineering is an attraction and has facilitated this by making the skyline easy to view from the Kowloon side of HK. A must see!

Night Watch. We enjoyed sitting in the bar at the Intercontinental watching the Junks of yesteryear design go by and the contrast with the super modern Hong Kong Skyline. The laser show that highlights designs on the skyline buildings nightly at about 8pm also features and is fascinating to watch.
Awesome and Amazing. Amazing and some very good architecture. Every building was spotlessly clean.

Combine Hong Kong Skyline with a Walk up to the Peak. One of my favourite ways to show off Hong Kong's skyline is to take the person visiting Hong Kong and walk them up to The Peak. Sure, you can take the bus or the tram, but walking up allows the skyline to slowly reveal itself to you - and it's a great way to get a bit of exercise in the HKG outdoors...They say Hong Kong is a concrete jungle, but there are actually some great trails hidden in between the tall buildings, and lots of trees. Bring enough water as it's very humid in the tropics, and of course, bug spray!From Central, you can start this walk in Lan Kwai Fong. Walk up Glenealy, you'll walk through an underpass to cross Caine Road, keep on Glenealy until you hit Robinson Road. The walkways and bridges can get confusing here, but turn left on Robinson until you get to Old Peak Road. Walk steep uphill, you will go past Canossa Hospital and the Ladies Recreational Club. Follow Old Peak Road as it veers to the right, until the car road becomes a pedestrian path. If you want to cheat this first bit which can be confusing, take a cab and ask them to drop you off outside Dynasty Court Tower 2, or where Tregunter Path hits Old Peak Road.At this point, you are in the pedestrian path of Old Peak Road, which is too narrow for cars. This is the original path leading up to the Peak. Imagine over a hundred years ago when rickshaws were the only option, now walk uphill.All you need to do at this points is keep walking uphill. No shops or drinks stands along the way... but what you will notice is the Hong Kong sky unfolding and revealing itself in front of you. This walk is especially beautiful at night. It will take 30 - 45 minutes to walk uphill so try to leave around 7pm so that you can get up to The Peak by the 8pm lights show.The only fork in the road is when you get to Epworth Lodge, junction of Old Peak Road and Barker Road. Turn sharp right - this will lead you to the steps leading up to The Peak Tower.Once you make it to the top... dinner at Peak Lookout - you've earned it after that hike! Have the curry - or else something from the Asian Selection. An outside table is nice if there is a cool breeze...
.. Brilliant and the 4th highest building in the world.
Evening Light Show. Worth the watch from either Kowloon or aboard the Star Ferry Harbour Cruise

Night Light Show. There is a famed laser-light and sound show here every night. We saw the laser-lights from the ship and called it quits after about 10 minutes. No sound and a descending fog took the edge off the show. The sky-line is most impressive and the water-craft keep up their crazy choreography.
Nice!. Design is just stamped in HK.... the skyline is a perfect way to appreciate it
Mesmerising. View it from the Kowloon waterfront and prepare to jostle for good photo spots.

Impressive. The skyline is impressive. The light show was a bit disappointing. The music was a bit soft and dull and the effects were not really amazing. They could do so much better. It is a nice experience, but not jaw dropping (but it could have been!).
Not enough memory card capacity. Make sure you have enough memory capacity in your camera because the view is breath taking..
Better than New York!. I was amazed at the skyline. We saw it at night from the harbor!
Light show at 8:00. Light show at 8:00 pm every night - suggest taking a harbor cruise to see it. Also good to watch from Victoria Peak.
Impressive. It was certainly an impressive skyline for such a tiny area. The city looked much larger than it actually was.

"A sky full of Lighters!". This is the MUST see when visiting HK! The skyline is amazing at day and at night. Lights at 8pm for 10 min is like a sky full of lighters, gets really busy but it makes a better atmosphere! Couples will love this place very romantic and a little kiss in the dark ;). Its right by the designer shopping area, mtr, buses etc.
Love it.. I went during Chinese New Year and the fireworks display was wonderful. I love the Hong Kong skyline. Take it in in the evening during a short boat ride.

Busy but worth it. The viewing platform was very busy but this is to be expected given it is such an iconic part of HK.The light show wasn't as spectacular as I thought it would be but the skyline at night looks amazing.
Wow!!. The skyline is breathtaking night or day, from Kowloon or the peak. But a must do is the light show, every night at 8pm. A little different to blackpool illuminations!!

Fantastic skyline across to Hong Kong Island. This is one of the great views in the world. It is a must in Hong Kong. I think the best view is across from the Star Ferry pier and then the Avenue of the Stars. WOW. It really is fantastic. If you get the chance arrange to go over on the Star Ferry or a harbour cruise. Take in all in. The light show is also worth the visit. 8pm each night.
One of the best. It really is one of the best views in the worldThe skyline
interesting. If you're into cities and architecture you'll love it. A very busy skyline.

Check out the Symphony of lights nightly from Kowloon side.. World renown and worth the time spent to see it. It is a Hong Kong Victoria Harbor tradition! Always great to have dinner on the harbor and watch the laser show!
Simply magnificent. Hong Kong has one of the world's best collections of magnificent architecture in an even more magnificent natural setting. Check it out!
Nightly light show!. Find a place with a view to watch over cocktails and you will be happy! Many of the higher hotels have restaurants or bars at the top.
The 8pm show. We saw the skyline from a boat, dinner then the show commences. What a sight, some you can see over and over.
Spectacullar. The best part of my journey there, I just love looking at that city from the harbour on a star ferry
goos scenary. can see clearly hong kong from here. Victoria Harbour is different with others in the world. it is dynamic.
MUST SEE AT NIGHT!. See it from The Peak. See it from the waterfront on Kowloon side. Ride back and forth on the Star Ferry and get a seat on the side. BRING YOUR CAMERA.
hong kong skyline. amazing how tall these buildings are all competing against each other and also lighting all along the harbour

One of the most beautiful skylines in the world.. Few skylines are as distinctive and iconic as Hong Kong's skyline. Go to Tsim Sha Tsui and don't forget to bring your camera along. Victoria Harbor is one of the most beautiful harbors in the world. To me, only compared to Sydney and San Francisco. See it by yourself.

Hong Kong's amazing skyline. If you want to see the best view of the amazing Hong Kong skyline is from Avenue of Stars Promenade near Salisbury Gardens in Tsim Sha Tsui. Easy access from TST MTR and close to the famous SOGO shopping mall. Remember to watch the beautifully lit skycrapers at night!
Outstanding views at night, as long as there is no fog. Best views along the water front on the Kowloon side, as the Peak can get foggy depending on the time of year.

Spectacular. The best way to appreciate Hong Kong's Skyline is by taking the Star Ferry from Kowloon side at night. You should also try to time it for the laser show experience (see tourist brochures for times). In any case, sit towards the front of the Star Ferry and appreciate the beauty of the Hong Kong Central District Sky Scrapers.

One of the two best skylines in the world along with NYC. In terms of skylines, Hong Kong Island is in elite company along with its only true rival, New York City. Luckily the Hong Kong Skyline is not something easily missed as it dominated much of what you can see from the popular Kowloon and HK Island areas where you will likely spent most of your time when visiting Hong Kong. Thus, you won’t help but have many opportunities to admire the views. There are many places to view Hong Kong's lovely skyline. Our favourite place is the TST Promenade and Avenue of Stars, looking over Victoria Harbour directly at the Hong Kong Island skyline. This image is beautiful in the morning and when the sun is at your back, allowing you to see the skyline with a blue sky behind Victoria Peak. However, the very best time to see the fantastic Hong Kong skyline is at night when the buildings are lit up and reflecting off of the harbour. From Kowloon, you can also enjoy excellent views of the Hong Kong Skyline from several bars on high floors; such as the popular Aqua Bar (30/f of Peking One Road) or the new and incredibly high Sky100 and Sky bar (118th/f) at the International Commerce Center (ICC). Other popular Kowloon based viewing areas include Felix Bar at the famous Peninsula Hotel as well as the lobby and restaurants at the Intercontinental Hotel. You can also enjoy the skyline by taking the famous Star Ferry, Aqua Luna or other ferry ship across the lovely Victoria Harbour. This is one of our favourite ways to view the skyline as we can have a look at both sides of the harbour. From Hong Kong Island views of the Kowloon skyline are quite nice from the Star Ferry piers, the IFC building and shopping mall in Central and from various points in Admiralty, Wan Chai and Causeway Bay where you can grab a view of the harbour. However the best views from the HK Island side come from visiting the world famous Victoria Peak with its glamorous views of HK Island skyscrapers, Victoria Harbor and the Kowloon Skyline. Like views from the TST Promenade, this classic postcard image is good in the morning, evening and when the sun is at your back. But the best view is in the evening when you can see the endless skyscrapers lit up against the darkness of night. The major limitation to the Hong Kong Skyline is the poor air quality we often have in Hong Kong, compared to the many beautiful days you might have in NYC, HK routinely has long stretches of poor visibility so it is possible to visit for entire week and not get a single day with very good visibility. Knowing this, visitors can plan better for their HK trip, being flexible with their schedules and ready to spend time on and near the harbour when they have days with clear skies. This is the best way to ensure that time is allowed for admiring one of the two best skylines in the world.
